P6VXECtFCDy7lY3Bd63RNg.text: Absolutely love this place!!! Tacos are delicious! So far the chicken has been my favorite! If you ever go, make sure to get the street corn! You won't be sorry!

oKvVmOuxbbGvvbfuxPgZ2A.text: I have been to the Taco Guild twice now.  I can't say I won't ever go back, but it is not a place that will be in my rotation.  I have now done lunch and dinner.  If you want to have a conversation, the noise level in the evening is going to make that difficult.  between the music and the high ceilings you will need your loud voice--  I give the place credit for a wonderful reuse of space.  visually that restaurant is spectacular and it is worth going once just for that.    The service is hot and cold. I got there early for dinner and was seated immediately.  I finally had to get someone's attention after 10 minutes or so --to get a glass of wine and some water.  to the waiter's credit--there was an apology for the wait--but i really hate being ignored--some sort of acknowledgement is all that is needed to lower that frustration even if they can't get to you immediately.  I also have to say for the rest of the evening the service was fine.  Now the food--it is okay--Unless they really do something to improve it--it will never be the reason why people come here.  Someone in our party ordered one taco--even on a salad size plate--it was very very small--for $4 a taco you just expect them to be extraordinary of which they are definitely not.  I had a chicken burrito--it was okay--chick was dry and not much flavor.    If you want really good food--go to your favorite neighborhood place or someplace like gallo blanco or richardson's.    Taco Guild will be fine to meet for happy hour and a drink--but there are much better places to spend your dining $$$ for good food.

C6D6zCaIAMic3Rh3t6eyQQ.text: The reviews online and from people I trust have been all over the board with this place.  So here's my run at it: The ambiance is awesome. It always looks closed when I go by but it was really full when we went inside. The door was opened by a guy with huge sideburns and he was happy and helpful. We were taken to a booth really quick and it was seamless. Perfect. Our server was a nice kid. Quick and full of smiles. Brought me a Rita and beans for the kiddo on the fly.  Have I mentioned he ambience is awesome? It's a really cool churchy old town Mexico feel.  The salsa and chips were good. The kiddo loved them. The guac and queso came mixed together which was alright I guess, flavor was odd but enjoyable.  Had a pork taco on corn and a duck taco. Both were pretty good. I'd eat them again for sure.  All in all a good experience. As with most taco places it can be hit or miss with each build. The lady will want to check it out too, so I know I'll be back.

x0yrKtVJCSQvhxL6uVWdNg.text: Super cool spot! You feel like you are somewhere else and not Phoenix! Tacos were very delicious, the BBQ pork was our favorite followed by the fish taco. The veggie taco was our least favorite. We also got the corn in the cob and it was also great. The salsa that comes with the chips is very very good! Will be back real soon for sure!

2ZCe--WrvLpQyt24gdQLIw.text: Ok the food is tastey, and the atmosphere is welcoming and very comfortable.  However here's the rub (for myself anyway) very little food for. I went to taco guild on a recent week nite along with two friends. We all agreed the food was tastey and the atmosphere very nice. Its 3.75 or 3.95 for each taco at first I thought it seemed a bit on the high side price wise but I thought well this is a gastro pub and the tacos are going to be special, so I went with it. I ordered 3 vegetarian tacos and one side I choose corn off the cob. My companions choose 3 chicken tacos withe the side of corn.  Now when the food arrived we were all surprised at how small the tacos were and they were small. The side of corn was tiny also. The chips and salsa were a nice addition however the small amount of salsa they give you means you need to continously request a refill. Now we ate our food and. Enjoyed the atmosphere. We all had the same feeling we were all still hungry.   There are so many fancy restaurants in the phx sctsdale area. And as always it seeems like the main foucus is on making sure the plates and the decour are posh and that there's expensive art. And the food may be delicious. How ever you pay for the atmosphere and the fancy art. And most of the time the portions are small and the prices are high or very high. So you pay a large bill and you leave hungry.  Taco Guild is one of thoses places. For ladies who lunch it may be perfect for a small business lunch fine. But if your  working class lot and are looking for a lunch or dinner. I don't think taco guild will satisfiy your hunger and your wallet will be empty at the same time

dAXInAnobZTN98u3z3kYbA.text: Absolutely some of the best food I've had. Highly recommend coming here for lunch or dinner. Parking can be a pain but it's worth it.

Wca5iw7aGZyI5kvoQ8Fw6Q.text: By far the best food and atmosphere.  Great prices. Traveling from Kansas stopped in close to where we are staying downtown. Highly recommended

oLbV9Q-xip_Bsh0rhDUSNw.text: Best grilled romaine salad I've ever had, and seriously great tacos, guac and margaritas.  Parking is terrible, but worth it to park down the street and walk. The restaurant is a renovated old church which is very cool!

C1ihhWQGvPUd-SJaPPEi3w.text: I always experience fast friendly service. Delicious frozen margaritas. Try rimmed with sugar instead of salt. Chips & salsas are always served and are very tasty. Most appetizers are delish...I prefer my guacamole without onion & its very good.  The only reason I can't give more stars is cuz, as a lover of more traditional mexican food...never been a fan of the tacos. There is something to be said for simplicity when it comes to food. The fix is so easy - no one could even imagine. And the parking at times is difficult. So if I can ever get a really good Taco here...that is orderable consistently - not just for happy hour - that would be nice. I know not much can do about the parking. It is what it is. I hate to valet my vehicle & refuse to do it. I prefer Sundays ...the DJ & special events just don't go with vibe so I don't do friday or Saturday here.

wnqg2DFljbyJXnjCandfGQ.text: Giving 2 stars is actually being very kind... and both are for our waiter Myles. Walked in at 12:45 this afternoon, most places are PACKED at this time TG was NOT. We were met, not greeted by the rudest person ever! The African American YOUNG man who works at the host stand for this place NEEDS to find a new J O B!! Clearly he is NOT happy with himself OR his job at Taco Guild! It was a stare down between he I and my lunch buddy! Instead of smiling and saying hello he glared at us looked us UP AND DOWN and then after I STARED BACK and told him we were 2 people he HUFFED in my face and rudely seated us!! The food...save your money and go across the street to Gazooks or even America's Taco Shop. The food was cold, over priced and tasted VERY bland! NEVER AGAIN!!! That is all!

raZBsBi_TYRy0dyJTe5npA.text: Ok..we've become regulars here, so to be fair, there's a bit of a bias! Still, we've always been treated so well, and the food we've had is great!! We always get the charred romaine salad..every Sunday, you'll find us eating it!! We always sit up at the bar, with Mike. :)

wokiX7bky1wq5fY_3337vw.text: Taco Guild is as good as it gets; funky cool re-claimed church vib, innovative tacos, yummy margaritas and guacamole.  The corn on the cob is a must try.

0U8ekYmGXyLjJfpEwH3ORg.text: The Guild has a very cool vibe. I started lunch with a big bowl of chips and an assortment of four different salsas. Awesome! My duck and snapper tacos were also delicious. You have got to try their Guacamole!

HTEs7xLvt2lKY9qn9IxbfQ.text: One word...... AMAZING!! Try the street corn, it's awesome!! Not to mention the building is unbelievable!!

TsfjFW-rnWWMQZX7j7ZDCg.text: What a cool idea! They renovated an old church and repurposed many materials inside to make the decor, menus, etc. Such unique ambiance here! The food was fabulous with so much flavor. I highly recommend the shrimp taco and the street corn.

XkVaOBA7TcOlvXnVTIJ8Ug.text: First time here. Lunch is great. Avodabo and shrimp tacos were delicious. Guy who delivered the appetizer wasn't really paying attention because he left guacamole and no chips...duh. Will be back

qlX1s7347-WUAccynf9Krg.text: Fantastic remodel of the church! It's absolutely gorgeous inside and out. Great service! I had the grilled romaine lettuce salad with chicken and that is one of the top 5 salads I have ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WftgxsWGrDxEsTu83r3EhA.text: Amazing. No other word needed. And Jason is superb! Gave me and my husband a personal tour for no reason whatsoever - such a great attitude is reflected in the quality of service and product found at the Taco Guild.

JXX3HOuRFXDGL-kF6OQBIw.text: A unique building; its actually a church with stained glasses and steeple.  The service sucked!  We had a group of 10 with one server that didn't complete orders.  I was charged $20 for 2 tacos and one beverage.   Will not be my first choice when dining out again.

5p0ox1ErVLOsGXsDisvs0Q.text: Old World (traditional) tacos and New World (think duck, lamb, cherry steak) tacos assure there is something for everyone. Our party all tried one from each column and no one was disappointed. Margaritas were delicious, service was friendly and helpful. Plus, the space is super fun. Really enjoyed the evening.

v4o0s22ZhQzs3pc-Q6xJfg.text: Drove in from Los Angeles and this was the first spot we went to. Parking isn't great, food definitely isn't great. I had the shrimp, chicken, and mahi mahi tacos and street corner. I don't know if this is always the case, but the food seemed to  come out really quick. They weren't empty, but there weren't people waiting to be seated. The shrimp didn't taste or smell fresh, the mahi mahi was okay I guess, the chicken was just okay. The corn was cooked too much and not good at all. Service was good, but it felt like they were forced to help (facial expressions and body language from hostess and server). Having had Sharkey's Mexican Grille last night, Sharkey's was MUCH better...and it's fast food. Can't recommend this place.

A63O4MNvKghG73GiTPVu3g.text: The coffee braised beef tacos are my all-time favorite. The ambiance is definitely on the hipster side and sometimes the music is way too loud, but the remodeled church is very cool, service is friendly and prompt and the dine-in food is consistently good. However, one start off for ripping off customers with tiny to-go portions when we've paid for full-portion meal! Avoid getting take-out from them unless you don't mind paying full-price for less than 1/4 of the amount of food you get dining in. Dining in is the way to go.

oSKLw28cM4m0RLJoBYTJ-Q.text: The building is cool. I was really looking forward to having tacos in a church. That is where the fun ended. The portions are small and the prices are high. What I did was tasty but I left on for filled and hungry. My wife does not like spicy food and was recommended a taco and she couldn't even eat it because it was to hot.

2TYnPDQ2_G24Qdm-mXfKXg.text: Love this place..great ambiance great service...very enjoyable...only downside dont like any of their salsas...

DjT0IDwotvO6H4lbEk6i7Q.text: It's probably the best kind of late night discovery when you're lured in by a former church turned taco heaven. The Guild did not fail to deliver golden goodness. My girlfriend found the Guild on yelp (yes, I love her more for it) and we were determined to see what the old chapel had to offer. The salsas were each perfect in their color, freshness, picante and pairing with fresh chips. The trio of tacos was delectable: Duck; pork and coffee braised beef - each one more delicious than the previous. We washed it down with two of their custom cocktails and who'd have thought a champagne float on top of grapefruit and vodka could be so tasty. We'll definitely be back and the Guild is not to be missed.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IOB-tMIlFWperDBx_nt07Q.text: First, the good....food was ah-mazing!!!!!   Great spice to most items and good presentation.  Food was absolutely delicious.   Would return for the food alone.  Service left much to be desired.  Waiter was not attentive. Had no clue about menu items.    Other than the amazing food, I've nothing positive to say.   Perhaps a second visit will reveal whether this establishment is worth continuous patronage.  Parking on a Saturday afternoon was also difficult.  Hope they have better parking arrangements eventually

aO3sjR_AtDNpBujM_1HYdg.text: Went here alone one night and the hostess didn't want to seat me at a table since I was alone. The bartender and the food runner were pretty friendly though. In terms of food, I ordered 3 tacos: coffee beef, pork avadaro, and cherry steak. I liked the coffee beef, it was very interesting in flavor and had a little sweetness to it. The cherry steak was also good, but I hated the pork. Not sure I would come back to this place

poFVBgFLQ481qRzRJiQIeA.text: Great tacos! Wait here for a friends birthday party and loved the steak tacos! The tacos are a bit pricey but they do fill them pretty well to wear 2 to 3 tacos can fill you

aJH9BR8T9rRGUD3WeincDQ.text: I don't ever do reviews , bored in the airport haha , a friend told me about this place , atmosphere is awesome , a lot of character very cool building , unfortunately lacking flavor .. I ordered guacamole and it had like no salt what so ever , the shrimp taco had like for little shrimp , under seasoned, the best one was the cherry steak taco.. wasn't impressed with the corn tortillas and I feel they were small tacos for almost 5 bucks a piece . Staff was friendly but unfortunate the flavor wasn't there . Great concepts and ideas for flavor profiles .. just fire the chef and take some damn flavor risks .. even the salsa was lack luster :(

8DcgtyM6mrqABVOjLfewSg.text: This is a unique restaurant, set in an old church. They have some interesting tacos on the menu, including duck and lamb tacos with various toppings. My favorite was the chipotle cherry steak. You get your food quickly. As a group we ordered about 10 tacos, and everyone's food came out within a few minutes!   The pricing is what brings down the rating here. Their tacos are good, but not worth $5 each. Even their beers like PBR are overpriced. With so many options in the area, that is enough to keep me from returning unless it is for a special occasion. In fact, the last time I came here was for a graduation dinner three years ago.

6OiCo9SZyYvYnrZ-snLcVQ.text: This place has the best taco I have ever had in my live. The cherry steak taco is phenomenal!!! Also the street corn is some of the best I have ever had! Also great friendly and helpful host! This is my new favorite place for tacos. Yes the prices are pretty high but it is definitely worth it. AMAZING!!!!

VkEHzXbgYt5T8IW17tK0vA.text: Delicious tacos, fast and friendly service and a very unique atmosphere! I am glad I went for lunch.  Pros: I ordered the Duck taco, which was very tasty.  They did not skimp on the sauce.  The corn tortilla was exactly right and did not fall apart. I had the seasonal veggies as a side, and I loved them.  Grilled veggies are my favorite.    Cons: We also had the Guild Duo appetizer - guacamole and quesso.  That was a little disappointing for the price. But the chips tasted fresh! Also - parking was tough, ended up in the neighborhood behind the restaurant.  I'm looking forward to coming back and trying more things on their menu!  Next time, it will be a happy hour. :-)

aZ7Fb4fMlDvjpMUirQI0eQ.text: Service was good. Atmosphere is unique.  Food was hit or miss.  I ordered 2 items containing shrimp and the shrimp was slightly fishy. Not fresh at all and they were over cooked. The corn is amazing as was the Peking Duck taco.

pxFzSvoS-7bukzVebYxgPA.text: Be aware this place is VERY loud! But if you can get past that or enjoy this loud bar atmosphere you are in for a treat. The food is pricey but tasty with some unusual twist on favorites like the cherry steak taco. Love their street corn on the cob and generous quesadilla. Wine selection and cocktails are not great but food is super. Plus what an unusual venue!

pJxLVa7p4Nza27ycckqUMw.text: Wow! We finally made a visit while we were near by, the food was great, the service was great, cant wait to go back I'm having taco withdrawals.

CHZt5d0IJLFea0CXmsy1Mw.text: Amazing atmosphere! Always got people asking where this is whenever I post a photo on Instagram or Snapchat. The food is is pretty good and the drinks are decently priced. The margaritas are where it's at if you like margaritas. Pretty decent happy hour. The atmosphere is what makes this place worth coming to.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9z596n453h7-Voa0qwMNeA.text: Tequila galore, service on fleek, grilled romaine makes my tummy oh so happy. Love to sit at the bar and chat with the mixologists...just talk to them about your tequila of choice (mezcal) and let them build you some yumminess. Tacos are fab too...love all the salsa choices! Great Happy Hour as well...

BK30O_Rhc0lb42CorThkmg.text: I love the taco guild the meats are amazing. The restaurant is very nice great decor.

_HGgytIlGfpEiY0oLwds0w.text: We have eaten here several times and love it! The tacos are like none other. The street corn is to die for. Always a welcome treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

godPxBj5PnW8pSjaI2X9Ag.text: Love this place. today got some fresh, bright and flavorful ceviche, along with a five star guacamole served with warm, homemade chips.. Have tried a lot of the street tacos, and none disappoint, from the succulent duck to the tasty pastor to several other varieties. Friendly bartenders mix it up right.  Would have given five stars but the parking absolutely sucks.

xzD_gMyifq7Gcw9tc_LJ9g.text: Love the live music!!!! It is rare for me to give a restaurant at a 5 star rating.  We are here on a Saturday evening so it's busy. Despite, we were quickly sat at the bar and were taken to our table within the 20 minute wait. The food was excellent. The live music was definitely a cherry on the top!  I highly recommend it.

Xq_LdGiVmeUEKrQXsRxRng.text: I love this place! I mainly love the setting and their famous salad! Grilled romaine salad! Yumm! I had very very bad experience with a server when I took my mom and aunt for lunch. He was so rude, dry, rolled his eyes and fake smiled. We asked for another server he said no. So I finally called the manager and said he's having a bad day and I told him I work with customer service and that's unacceptable. Long story short we got another server and  was great felt the warmth. Other than that horrible experience I always go back for the frozen margaritas and the salad! Cool place to catch up with friends or date!

RQWWafYGrVQTWTTMG-G0lQ.text: By far some of the absolute best tacos in Phoenix. Great food, great atmosphere and all of the staff was incredibly helpful. Will definitely make this one of my new spots.

8U7B6fwNrOZIh8cXM7wLkA.text: Tommy the server is amazing! I have some annoying food allergies and he went out of his way to discuss them with the chef, they collaborated to make me a superb dinner! I loved the Lowlands tequila flight as well. Everything was excellent, including the restaurant's building itself. It is highly unique and worth a trip if you haven't been before. Great experience for me and my friends. Can't wait to go back! Big big thanks to the staff at Taco Guild for being so accommodating and awesome.

2MDrCFmybf-f4sD8LImjUA.text: This place is the epitome of gourmet mexican. Fantastic food, drinks and service, The restaurant is beautiful. You will not be dissapointed!

h6Nt81jbUYsword-Xg_8Fw.text: Like many have said, the tacos are average and WAY over priced. The ambiance is the selling point! Go for the cool decor. It's an experience. The cherry steak taco is worth trying ($5) but is not worth the price. I had a $11 margarita that barely had any alcohol in it. Pretty dissapointing!   Service was great though. Ashley was really helpful and friendly.   All in all, over priced for what it is. I'll only go back if someone else is paying for it!

LVCqKBujkkt2wM96DCjGIg.text: The church of tacos! Delicious gastro-pub style street tacos and Mexican street corn - also served OFF the cob so you don't have to make a mess while enjoying! With a healthy tequila menu and some edgy flavors this is definitely a place we will come back to again and again.

EJk6R7UCGZe0f3bffWAENg.text: The interior is the first thing you'll notice, a historic church. Wasn't sure if I wanted to eat at a place that use to be a church & had a bar in it. I'm glad I did though because it felt comfortable inside.  The food overall was okay. They have a wide variety of tacos that are a little pricey but they do make them look pretty. Taste-was okay.  Overall was a 3 star experience, willing to try again to get an 5 star experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cherry steak, pork, and chicken tacos with street corn (an extra $2.50)

hVWEGrpXAE8iXeI_JMXLmw.text: Such a cool place with awesome margaritas and unique tacos!!

S-HSIbISElINmdlGhKSX5A.text: The service was excellent; we had a great server and the manager was super polite, held the door for us and was walking around checking on tables. The taco special of the day was a pork one that was excellent-even better that it was only $1.99 during Happy Hour. We had tacos and guacamole for dinner and it was great. What a cool place!  Kind of loud, but we had a good time and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsas

w38gtKgCipgdHP0SX9RAUw.text: Went here last week with a Meetup group.  Everyone ordered something different which was pretty cool--we got to see all of the delicious food.  I ordered a side salad and two tacos--the shrimp with coleslaw and the beef--both on corn tortillas.  I thought the food was good--not exceptional, but good.  One lady ordered a lamb taco and said it was delicious.  Might try that if I go back.  The restaurant is a former Methodist church, so it's pretty neat inside.  The stained glass windows remain.  The bar is where the alter was.  The service was good.  The real negative is parking sucks!  They share an already small parking lot with Starbucks, another restaurant and a very popular thrift store.  Street parking is limited too.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House Salad
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Taco (left) and Beef Taco (right)

VVapcT9PgAfq081XkoxxYA.text: Average tacos and slow service in a unique venue. Parking can be tricky.

4NnEoV0JO_iJPhCdKlJCWw.text: How the hell are you out of corn  and chips and Salsa and say u guys don't have a fryer when ur a Mexican restaurant  and rice !!!!!!!  And then just have a attitude about it and since I ordered ceviche before u told me there's no chips why isn't u come back and tell me before bringing me ceviche with warm ass tortilla with it ?!?!! Like seriously  and then you sit a group of loud skanks obviously already trashed and u keep serving them margaritas dont u know there's a limit !!! I will never come back to this place and my friends and family will definitely know  sad because the decor was nice

Y-57Mc-CSmM_kRyQSjG2Lw.text: Every single bite was perfect. 4 different kinds of salsa, guacamole, chips, tacos, drinks. I. Am.  In. Heaven. The server was friendly and efficient, the building is amazing- stained glass windows and murals left from when it was a church- really unusual ambiance. Built in 1893. Outdoor seating with a giant mister to keep things cool. Very reasonable prices. I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The outdoor seating area
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

O-TEY29_iRTFIZE8ljodiQ.text: I have been there once and will not return, ever. Had some friends visiting from New York, they were running a little bit late, it was approximately 9PM and the waiter told me that if they were not there in 10 minutes, he was not going to be able to serve any food because their kitchen was closing soon. I rushed to order the fastest, easiest items on the menu to have my friends eat before taking off to New York; needless to say, we all eat tacos! While we were eating, many other people arrived and they were served what they ordered without rushing them; their last costumer arrived approximately about 10:30 and were served. Did not understand the waiter's behavior, we were treated poorly, will not recommend this place to anybody.

LeGIK5awixlTGT-q3T7d7g.text: We heard about this place on Food Paradise as the top place to go for great tacos. It did not disappoint and the atmosphere is fun. Set in an old church, this restaurant has a fun and funky vibe with unique tacos and flights of tequila. We tried two trios of tacos so we could sample them. All of them were very good but the cherry chipotle steak was our favorite. We got a sampler of salsas with chips as we sat down and our waiter was attentive and made good recommendations. We are going back soon and it was worth fighting the traffic into Phoenix. The beautiful stained glass windows, the paintings, and the huge chandelier are worth the visit. They've kept some of the Church memorabilia on the walls. Definitely a must see when in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco Guild decor
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ixWWQZzL3qaXhnyB1Idr4Q.text: I came here for a work dinner, 10 of us in total. We made a reservation and they were very accommodating. The waitress was attentive given the size of our group. I like the chips and salsa your get, they have one mild and 3 spicy salsas. Most places just have one or two and they're never spicy. I got three tacos and the rice, al pastor, adobada, and duck. The duck was amazing, the other two were good but nothing unheard of. Get the corn, it's really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. {al pastor, adobada, duck in plum sauce, green chile achiote rice}

DfPzFwHKdjaHcDYXiNLwRA.text: Just incredible food.  The ambiance in the old church adds a nice rustic element to the meal.

MeHvThqYjA4Toam4kXF-ig.text: Honestly, the only things worth noting here are the building itself and the starter - chips and salsa! We devoured two bowls. I didn't care for the other three, but the main "medium spicy" salsa was borderline addicting.   I wish I had heeded the warnings of other yelpers, as I did find nearly everything we ordered to be bland (and dry!). We ordered the al pastor, Yucatan shrimp, and braised beef tacos. None were memorable or even warranted a second bite, but we finished them because we hate to waste food. The chicken enchiladas look absolutely heavenly in photos, but tasted like something you could buy in the freezer aisle. The rice was so colorful, but could've passed for plain white rice in flavor. The street corn was probably the only thing we ordered that I actually enjoyed.   I came to this restaurant knowing it wasn't going to be authentic Mexican food, but Mexican INSPIRED food. Still left disappointed. They have a great concept, but completely missed the mark.

CbymE96W_-DzYedkN_tzGw.text: Enjoyed a meal at Taco Guild. The building was beautiful. The staff was great. The music was good with a DJ doing his thing. And the food was good. I loved the large basket of chips with a nice selection of four salsas. I enjoyed their signature corn and three tacos (al pastor, braised beef, and their fish taco). All were good but their fish taco was the stand out. My friend had a burrito, beef I believe and was satisfied. I don't think he loved it but liked it. Good overall visit and will come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful interior
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eV2wth0JXJfUCMnzw9fhYw.text: Love the atmosphere! The street corn is incredible! It's the best street corn I've had. The free chips and salsa that come with any order are delicious. The prices are very reasonable as well.

CZ2xIQ9uZ2ScaMTFUknowg.text: The food here is very bland, with very strange, unauthentic recipes.  I would not recommend it for anyone looking for good Mexican street tacos or authentic flavors.  I had the beef enchiladas and the chicken taco.  The sauce on the enchiladas had a bland chipotle flavor; the rice was dry without flavor; and the beans were not even pinto beans, but red beans.  Not much to say about the chicken taco either.  The service here was very pleasant and the venue was in an interesting converted church; hence, the second star.  Go here for the atmosphere, definitely not the food!

ZN_5DRcNZ3VSimwIllPRlg.text: Where do I start?  What a crappy experience.  Service was the worst!  We were seated, passed by multiple waiters, not one acknowledged our presence.  Another table of two walked in after us and had waters, sweaty beer and chips before we were acknowledged by our server.  Finally Becky with the shitty hair walks up and drops off chips, acknowledging it took her a while to make it over.  No apologies.  Girl I feel you.  No apologies after we sat and waited another year for you to bring us some waters after I went up to the bar and asked for them because the orange salsa was hot as shit.  We ordered a crapetizer and never saw it because we had passed the point of hangry.  Manager in orange striped golf polo from '98 was amazing at doing NOTHING.  If you want awesome service and staff, excellent food and an amazing interior go to Joyride.

f1ASyMn32AQqYKiEycn2VA.text: The venue is really great. Housed in an old church, they have retained the stained glass windows, but pretty much renovated everything else into a spacious restaurant with some cool painted murals on the walls. We were there on Cinco De Mayo for happy hour. Really not a very good one. One dollar off overpriced craft beers, although they have a decent selection of local taps. Normally $6.95 for a pint, so still $5.95 during happy hour? Only happy hour food option was the taco of the day for $2.50. Not bad, but you have to settle for whatever it is. That day it was carne asada. Meat was tasty, but kind of dry. Overall, the tacos were just so so. The complimentary chips were good and came with a variety of different sauces and they readily brought more chips if needed. We also tried the special margaritas they had come up with for Cinco De Mayo. At $5.95 for happy hour a pretty good deal, but maybe not $12 regularly. We did not try any entres, which seemed reasonably priced, but not sure of portion size. Certainly worth a visit, but if you like a few drinks with your meal, be prepared for a hefty tab.

0IAFvl3MzyAbn_kylDdo4A.text: Save your money and time! The food is bland, dry, and ultimately flavorless. Service was terrible. Nick was smug, and not helpful at all. I ordered 3 tacos, and only managed to eat one. He grabbed my plate after my boyfriend was done, never asking how it was, if I wanted a box, or anything and then brought the check. So many cool places in central Phoenix to go for dinner, this place is definitely not one of them.

OLDkGD5uRPBOWYDRtLzXvw.text: The reason I would come back to this place, and I think the major draw for most of the patrons is not the food. What is exceptional here is the atmosphere, the interior design and the concept.  Let's start with the good. The huge stained glass windows and the giant spherical wrought iron chandelier give this place killer ambiance. The huge open space doesn't lend itself to intimacy, but it's a great place to bring a group for drinks and a conversation.  There is one fatal flaw, and that is a common flaw with places like this: the food doesn't live up to the decor. Gourmet tacos are a great concept, but if you're going to put gourmet prices on your gourmet concept tacos, they better blow me away. I tried every gourmet taco on the menu, and none of them were memorable, or worth $5.  Good thing for Taco Guild that there isn't an actual Taco Guild. Because their tacos probably wouldn't make the cut.

7BlCs_5CGUMtKiCm8ZsyLA.text: Probably the best reuse of an existing space since the Parlor or even St. Francis. I applaud their attempt to introduce the taco to bold new flavors but none of them really resonated.  The craftsmen back in the kitchen should probably focus less on trying to come up with trendy and creative new combinations and focus on simpler arrangements that don't muddy up the palate.

_-XEOvWqmhMycjsNpHYbpg.text: Great ambience and good food. There is a really loud stereo from a juke box, so you can't hear anyone you're talking to. I would've given this place 4 stars if it didn't give me a headache with screaming conversations.

yxIqSF3vHs_aqA2uqUVQZA.text: Ambiance is awesome, food very tasty !! Service consistently slow however friendly !! Love love love the grilled romain salad with steak!! Life changing!  Parking like every local restaurant in Phoenix ..... Sucks

YV-U56_cW2ESuVsfWpevpw.text: Cool atmosphere, came here for happy hour since it is close to my house. Tacos of the day for $1 which were really tasty. Margs weren't the best but they were like $5 so not too worried about that. Would like to come back for dinner sometime

DDCnpYWWJVyRaH8zEf7qKg.text: The margaritas and other mixed drinks are poured by accountants.  The HH margarita had, like, no alcohol.  Neither I nor my friend felt any buzz.  The bartenders pour  into a measured shot and I watched as every pour came up short.  Generosity is a virtue and a return visit...not here. The tacos and fundito were good, but offset by the cheap drinks.  Drink beer or wine, no mixed drinks. Also, they didn't have some of the beers on the menu.

IlMLM4Lg6Rm0I8ICWtV5zg.text: First impression - Amazing building and decor!!!! However, the food is just okay, good but not excellent in my opinion. The service is alright but again nothing to impressive.  I ordered the shrimp taco and due to an allergy to avocado I asked the server if the slaw could come without it. I was told that the avocado was already mixed in and that the slaw could be omitted. When the taco came it was literally a tortilla with 4 shrimp in it. It looked very sad. I had to track down another server and ask for some plain cabbage to add to my sad looking taco. After 10 Minutes that was finally delivered and I ate my okay tasting cold taco. Overall a little disappointed in the lack of care for a customers request.

5XGAlJ5ESpf7z8ctdOu8EQ.text: Happy hour kills. Outside of that it was a little too pricy for my tastes.   The huge chandelier in the middle is amazing. They must have assembled it inside during construction because it is boss.   Another cool tou choose here is they seem to use vintage plates for the food. Ironically my food came on the same style and design plate my grandmother had when I was growing up. Very cool.   They door have a large bar with two TVs set high above. You could watch a game here in a pinch.

novx64J2g7cazo6bdBGBfQ.text: Atmosphere is amazing! The food is really good, too, but the service is soooo sloooooow. Definitely not a good choice for timed workday lunches, but one of our top choices for the weekends.

7D6R9AEqTPG9KDPKmPps1g.text: Unfortunately I was really disappointed with my experience at Taco Guild. After hearing great things about it my fiance and I decided to go for lunch on Sunday. The space is really cool and unique, I'll give them that. The food, however, was subpar. The guacamole was OK and the queso dip was fine. We each ordered 3 different flavored tacos and agreed that across the board the meat in all of them was dry and they all were missing something -- acidity or more sauce or something.  The service, too, was lacking. There were only a handful of us in the restaurant and yet it seemed to to ages to get our food. Also we kept having to ask for refills on our water.  I hope they improve this place. It has potential. Until they do I won't be recommending it to anyone.

Aw6EeBG_AS1jSNm-7H2pZg.text: Went here a few weeks ago and was not impressed by the food. I got the chicken burrito and my mom got the chicken enchiladas. We both thought our food didn't have much flavor and was pretty bland. The inside is really unique. I wouldn't recommend the food, but would recommend having a drink at the bar just to experience this place.

gAU4VAuFzwnIBeMbT6knvw.text: I LOVE this place. Delicious tacos and great drinks. My former coworkers and I would come here frequently for happy hour.

mxHqRnAA-z0GhY6S4vuP0g.text: I try to stay away from 5 star ratings. So I waited a few days to write this review. First of all re-tasking this old church is by far the greatest idea and lends it's self to thoughts of monks making ales in the basement. Headed here to taste a tapping of Cartel's Tequila ale. That is a hole other review, Let me just say it is one of the most original brews I have had the pleasure to enjoy. They have pork taco's on the happy hour menu at $2.00 each. I ordered one with the brew and I could not tell you what made it so good. So I finished the brew and ordered another taco to go with brew. This will be my go to for tacos so I suggest you try it when you can still get in.

0M3E08wAGgBzWLaFRjcYrQ.text: Loved the tacos! I chose the 3, braised coffee, cherry steak, shrimp avocado...the chips are homemade and really delicious but the 3 salsa they come with are all too spicy for me. Sad they do not have just pico de gallo. I also got the corn on the cob and its really fantastic. The building is really beautiful and enjoyed seeing the architecture structure. New favorite place!

04cy10_d0Bac8hEhv9s65g.text: Wasn't good at all I wouldn't go back I took my sister and she didn't like it and she hit me cuz I told her it was good joke on me

MQi030xBw0R4H_lZ1IQzJw.text: This place is great!  It's in an old church building with stained glass all over.  The atmosphere is so cool.  I love to take visitors here and wow them with the radness.  The chips come with four types of salsa.  Beware of the habanero salsa it's flavor is great but what an ass kicker!!!  I had the mahi mahi Taco and it was excellent.  Sauce was delish and I loved the fresh corn tortilla and cabbage.  My friend had the chorizo meatballs with pear sauce.  They are exactly as described in the name of the item.  Six good size meatballs with a spicy zip.  There was marinated pear shavings in the middle which were full of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Neat-o bar
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mahi Mahi taco

tPigCf6JwdMG4t0syvklcA.text: It's my favorite restaurant in Phoenix! I'm not one to jump the gun on statements like that, but it is so True. I love the food, I cannot speak to whether the food is authentic, but I can assure everyone, it is incredibly yummy. I have tried about 50% of their menu and never was served a dish that disappointed me. The dishes are very creative and versatile, I love how they combine flavors to a perfect gustatory experience. The staff is friendly and very helpful. They seem to always make sure that the kitchen knows about my gluten allergy, because I have never had problems after my visits. That's not a given, I have experienced the opposite elsewhere.  An additional plus, nobody ever rushes you with the check. I don't mind paying up swiftly after I ate, but some places just seem to want to kick you out. I have never felt rushed at Taco Guild. Like I said, my favorite place.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DUy_R9JURQ6UZEMFTUyuIA.text: Such a great little big spot.  Good vibes all around.  I went on a Friday I believe.  They had a guy playing the guitar singing cover songs.  The decor was very original and payed homage to the original church that it used to be.  I believe I got the tacos.  They were good, but I think I would order something else.

6JDuf01pcL0fIh6Innna4Q.text: Came here on a Monday night during their happy hour. I don't understand why this place has such great reviews. It was very mediocre to me.  Food: Got their special taco of the day which was buffalo chicken. Wasn't bad but wasn't great either. Their lamb taco was great but not worth the price ($5).  Service: Our server was good and checked up on us regularly.  Parking: When it said private lot, I was imagining a lot for Taco Guild customers but it's a small shared lot with veryyyy few spots. Luckily valet is free.  Overall it wasn't very memorable. I could have seen myself coming here more often if it was so overpriced. $5 for a mediocre street taco?? No thanks.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Left: Taco of the day (chicken). Right: Lamb Taco

0RuAx9A7LXxdgo4krnOhDw.text: I finally made it to Taco Guild! And it lived up to every bit of its hype. It's kind of funny it took us trying one of their tacos at the Taco Festival this year to actually go to their restaurant. The restaurant is beautiful too! So unique. I love that they kept the Church close to its original form with the original wooden ceiling beams, stained glass windows and the old hand-crafted pews. You definitely catch a vibe when you walk in.  That night we tried a few different things. First we started with their Fundido - melted menonita cheese, longaniza sausage, roasted jalapeno mushrooms, caramelized onion, epazote, house-made tortillas. It was perfectly melty with a tiny bit of spice. And for our cocktails we ordered the Forbidden Fruit Blanco  Tequila, Blood Orange, Apple, Lime, Ginger, Mint and the Sinner or Saint Blanco Tequila, Velvet Falernum, Lime, Blueberry, Rosemary. Both were perfectly hand crafted and not too strong. As for the tacos, I tried 3 different ones. First the CHIPOTLE CHERRY STEAK poblano straws, chile aioli, Bleu cheese. This is an absolute must for me! I think next time I'm getting 3 of these they are just so perfect. I could eat an entire bowl of the Cherry Steak alone. Second the URBAN BEAN COFFEE BRAISED BEEF caramelized onion, mango jicama relish, Cotija cheese. And lastly the PORK ADOVADA mango jicama relish, avocado, cilantro. Let me just tell you... these people know how to make a taco with complimenting flavors. I wish we could have had desert but we were so stuffed we could hardly get up to make our way out. I can't wait to come back and try more. Although... like I said, I will be back to have more of those Chipotle Cherry Steak tacos for sure!

6pjSNCPC2HnK0I4oEnKYaw.text: The first time I went here was about 4 years ago give or take. I thought the tacos, building and atmosphere were delicious, unique and fun then. Now to share with my girls and wife was a great experience.   Great place for guests from out of town, lunch or occasional dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Iz8EXRkQ3DJltE2hseIzNQ.text: Hip joint in CenPho. Converted church plays well with their theme. Nice options on the menu although I kept it simple and had the chicken and shrimp tacos. Both were perfectly arranged, with expertly cooked proteins made for a delicious meal. And they offer flour and corn tortillas, do yourself a favor and get the corn. They're homemade, fluffy, tender and perfect accompaniment to the taco fillings.  They held strong and none of my taco fell out of the tortillas.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Excellent chicken taco on the left and shrimp taco on the right.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enjoyed sitting at the bar and people watching.

n2eyb15EWo24OTPcOwgVvg.text: My friend and I wanted yummy tacos and a good margarita after a long day of travel from New York City and OH MY GOSH this place did not disappoint. The tacos were honestly the best I've ever had. I had the lamb, artichoke, and duck. We sat outside and it was honestly not uncomfortable at all, even in the 110 weather. The renovated church has amazing history, with the original corner stone and time capsule contents adding great character. I can not recommend this place enough!

IZFqcJ2lVfHlhI9s4Cfcpg.text: Best lamb tacos in town! This place is delicious!

Zrgj6hoH2orvufS3M8UgfQ.text: This place is fun and unique, they brought a Church and built Taco Guild. We only had the drinks and appetizers. That alone make us wants to come back... The service was excellent, I cannot give the place 5 stars until we go back and actually get pass the appetizers... So far this place is 4 stars and rising and we can't wait to go back!!!! Or Taco Guild can start their franchise and build in The DFW area!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bar!!!

RRPuTkY2a6eHFw5Hjuv1SQ.text: I had the wonderful opportunity of visiting this restaurant during my road trip.   I was recommended to visit the restaurant because of its history. The Taco Guild was built in an old church; therefore, when you walk in you'll quickly notice the stained glass windows and the layout if the old church which is pretty cool!  We arrived during happy hour which had fantastic deals including their daily taco deal! Their tacos are delicious and full of flavor but you MUST TRY THE STREET CORN. It's huge, juicy, and tasty! My boyfriend and I left with extremely satisfied stomachs without our wallets crying!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3mYKuiJMmmzQtIsJveBvmg.text: This is probably my favorite gourmet taco place in the city. If you are going to splurge, this is the place to do that! The service is prompt but blunt, which I would argue is part of the bucolic feel. I mean the waitresses honesty about what she prefers is symbolic of the church. She was able to guide us on what to expect with each taco. Her perspective was refreshing on which sides, appetizers, and tacos to get. Everything you've ever thought about a street taco has been upscaled, hipsterized, and made in almost a satirical way of deliciousness. The street corn is a must, the avocado fries are better than expected, and the lobster taco is phenomenal. The only bad thing I have to say about the wonderful experience is I wish they did not have a jukebox... it was weird and took away from the natural ambience. Very strange to see an ugly Jukebox in such a perfect place. The bar looked amazing though! Anyway, every time a family member comes in to town I suggest we go here and we do. It is like Americanized Mexican food or what I call True Phoenix indulgence. It is a must.  A Must!!!

4MHZdphhzXbNgU8RcGaHfw.text: This place would be a five star rating if judged it on the food and atmosphere alone. Customer service was lacking which knocked it down a star. It wasn't reprehensible but it definitely was not on the same caliber of the food.  Service was timed decently but both the server and the manager/supervisor who brought our plate seemed annoyed and didn't make me feel welcome. They did check on us quite a bit but due to their demeanor I would've preferred to have been left alone here.  The tacos were amazing, the presentation was instagram-worthy. The place inside of an old mission, and they've got stained glass windows inside, it really has to be appreciated in real life. Tad expensive but nothing insane.

k-6eW6uTl5Y5wgkHo8HMNw.text: This place is great love the street corn. If you haven't been here you better check it out. Tons of tequila very large selection.

YKMKEvxpvJrbz1eWysGkaA.text: It's been a one and done restaurant for me. The atmosphere was great, I like how they renovated the church into the restaurant. The food was average. The parking was horrible. I'd probably go back but we just haven't.

Rlq8-avte3xhg3uwRJG1DQ.text: Feels like you're inside a church. Very good tacos! They have unique meats, such as duck meat.  When you are seated they bring you salsa and chips, which were very good. Ordered the 3 taco combo and it comes with a side. Got the elote off the cob as a side order and it was delicious! The tacos can be ordered with flour or corn tortillas.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 taco combo with elote off the cob

KrXHKy5gSq3yW3fcUNSnPg.text: Went here a few years ago after work and honestly it was good but sooooo disappointing. I was expecting these amazing melt in your mouth creative delights and all I got were delicious tacos.   Which is not bad...until you see the price. Then it's bad.

kgb8VfYMQm5ybM8Rnwo8Ng.text: Two thumbs up shout out to the Manager "Sam" and staff at my favorite taco "tabernacle".  A very enjoyable evening with friends - their first visit, they are looking forward to visiting again soon. The music, provided by the very talented  guitarist- 24 Karat added greatly to the evening. Margaritas were excellent and the spin on "Irish Nachos" was tasty!  Home base is N Scottsdale, but the drive to this favorite spot is worth it. See you soon!

IQoHOIRIiEtKEjlxuqJ6AQ.text: Really interesting place for a restaurant. An old church with murals painted high on the walls, large and open yet designed to make it possible to be close or entertain a large group.  Drinks were small for the price. The tacos were delicious, try the lamb, yummy.  Great wait staff. I'll go again.

l7cgt_sXaLD-CNY7A9dt8Q.text: It's awesome how this was originally an old church they have kept allot of the original windows. Very cool bar with awesome drinks. I would say the food is not the best Mexican I have ever had but it's not bad. We went there for brunch this time which is nice that they have that option.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork taco not very good
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp enchiladas with eggs on top and green sauce.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love there drinks and the names are awesome. The pink one is Sinner or Saint and The forbidden fruit is the other.

r5B02xaiTLzocxL_g4Ecig.text: Hands down the best deviled eggs I've ever had, best queso I've ever had, and best tacos I've ever had! Also, I got to sit in a church pew, and drink beer. What's not to love about that? Amazing service-amazing ambiance! One of my favorite eating experiences ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

49WgNtP_0StTVobA0881XA.text: Love the tacos here!!! The food was on point, the music and the old church was so awesome! Love it here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The tacos are on point!!!! Love the old church feel and the music and our waiter was amazing!!! First time here and won&#39;t be my last!

oOLUW5BRK9es0Ybeh13x7g.text: Let me start of by saying the atmosphere draws you in the minute you walk in and creates a rich environment to enjoy your meal.  The bartenders are fantastic at their bartending abilities and more importantly their customer service skills.  The food is fantastic.  My wife and I had tacos (Duck, chicken and beef) and each one was fantastic with toppings that complemented the meats.  The bean and cheese burrito was hearty with a nice spicy kick to it.  We will definitely be returning to Taco Guild.  We will be making reservations ahead though because the wait can jump up to an hour and a half easily on a Friday or Saturday night.  Thank you for the great food and experience on our date nite! Cant wait to get back for more!!!

MSNyptbh-y27PhwVzrZ5OQ.text: From the beginning to end a great delicious meal. The tacos were so fresh, so tasty, so fragrant. The chips and the selection of salsas were great. Staff was courteous, efficient and knew the menu items well. To top this all the space is beautiful and well put together.   This place does get crowded. Go early if you want to have a private chat otherwise after 7-8 it looks like a tapas bar. Every table was taken by the time we left.  Just do people don't think that I am writing lots of positive reviews suddenly -- everything we ate during our trip to Phoenix was amazing.   If had to nit pick, I think Taco Guild could have a better tree leches. The cake needs to be soaked through and there should be whipped cream. We have some leche and the cake was delicious but dry. Still we finished it so like I said I am just nit picking here.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9bJs6qspaTO7ypE7NmL6nw.text: Amazing food and atmosphere but extremely disappointed that you got rid of the worlds most epic Bloody Mary

8KDmeI2V7UwV26Ahz0VRVA.text: My first time in Arizona and I stopped by this place for lunch. This place is inside an old church and they kept beautiful stained glass and artwork. The staff was very welcoming and attentive which made it even more enjoyable. This is why I'm giving it a 5. I ordered the street corn shaved which was perfect! I also had shrimp tacos which were full of flavor.  The one item I wasn't to fond of was the rice. It was a bit dry and felt like it was made out of a box. So I give the rice a 1    It is a spot I would recommend over all!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YHokesjbx6haoi60aiWZHA.text: This was our first time. We were very disappointed. The shrimp tacos weren't great and the mahi mahi tacos were even worse. The only good thing that we had was the chips. Wouldn't recommend unless you just go for atmosphere.

TxWyXXehdGqvxYDEP5F4cg.text: Such a cool spot! Parking may be tough in the small lot but there is complimentary valet at the door so don't stress. The interior is designed so cool. It's a small restaurant and bar so there may be a wait. 4 different kinds of salsa given with chips! The duck tacos are amazing and the chicken too!

A-wsTj7M-quVqcLcoa3IhQ.text: I swore years ago that I'd never go back to church.   That was before I found a church that served Tacos.   Tacos are a game changer.  I have friends who get all religious about their love for a good taco.   We walked in and were immediately greeted.   The place seemed happening and kinda funky.   The waiter was cool and helped us navigate with some good suggestions.   The Taco's were great!   I got the Al Pastor Pork, Yucatan Shrimp and the Peking duck.   They were all excellent.   My wife let me try the Chipotle cherry steak and I think next time I come back Ill just order three of those.   Wow, really good.   They bring out a huge bowl of chips and different types of salsas (I recommend the Habanero salsa, its killer).   The service is top notch and the place is pretty clean.   The tacos weren't the best I've ever had, but plenty good enough to come back and eat here again.    Can I get an Amen!   Nicely done Taco Guild!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QQBsjcaYW-I8iJiMDvo_7g.text: LOVE THIS PLACE. Great tacos, great old church atmosphere. A little expensive for tacos...and unfortunately, the brunch is meh. Parking is sometimes difficult. But I like it better than Joyride or some other commercial upscale taco places. Service is spotty and often inattentive. But much can be forgiven for great tacos, sauces and street corn!

kRgKZNlBdxJWBnx5l8Qozw.text: Great place for tacos. Went for happy hour. The inside is very nice and they have a great selection of delicious appetizers and other Mexican food. Great place to swing by for a drink and an appetizer.

ikpJbnx_22QvCs8xyb-jPg.text: What a treat. Spring Training 2019 found this restaurant in a converted church built in 1893. Stain glass windows and all. A 20 minute wait but was approached by staff for our drink order. Refreshing margaritas.  Once seated our server, McCoy, took our appetizer order, Diablo Eggs, Street Corn and Chips with 4 salsas. Perfectly seasoned and prepared. Server checked on us numerous times. Our dinner was creative and delicious. A Cartel Coffee Beef Burrito and a Taco Plate, 3 tacos and a side. Al Pastor Pork, Chipotle Cherry Steak and Guild Chicken.  Yum.  Service and Menu was spectacular.

gEpONQjXrTGdWZxBPC1YKQ.text: Top notch food,drink and customer service! The wait staff goes above and beyond. Will definitely go back!

_q60EhimTU7Z5kC7wThYqg.text: Save an old historic church from demolition by reimagining it as a restaurant and bar. Amazing decor, great food, and excellent service. A very unique experience. Blasphemy never tasted so good.

nLMix2farIbZnTiIQGHPYg.text: The atmosphere is great and the look of the this restaurant is amazing, a True aesthetic. Overall, the food is a but pricey for the portion, but it is still really good and definitely worth a trip to this unique taco location!

yAMhtf-DK88DaXSLqsZiXA.text: We frequent Taco Guild and love their food.  Starting a meal off with chips and three different salsa's will make anyone's day better.  The enchiladas are to die for and don't forget to include a margarita.

Lo3bERwb_2w7_S4IzC6qSQ.text: Listen, I am a taco enthusiast. And even though I prefer the traditional street tacos, this places takes it to a different level. I was impressed. Obviously they are always crowded for a reason. And of course I had to try the Pastor, but also decided to try the duck. Duck in a taco... What! And I got it in a lettuce leaf. What! They though about us carb watchers. Excellente!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastor and duck tacos in a lettuce leaf. Yes! A little juicy though.

uOaez2nBcE8YurBAZv2SWA.text: My family has visited Taco Guild numerous times, and we really enjoy the atmosphere, the delicious food (great variety of tacos, the grilled romaine and the corn are delicious), and the margaritas.  We probably visit 4-5 times per year!  I give only 4 stars because the service has been sporadic.  Servers and bussers have been moderately attentive, others just vanish for long periods of time. This creates a problem because the tables are a bit small for all the great food and drinks on the table!  With that said, Stephanie served us this past Sunday and she was outstanding...easily the best server we've experienced at Taco Guild.  We will probably be back sooner than normal due to her outstanding service.

OdY2I4bMRiKozPZY3lhTQQ.text: I've been going to Taco Guild for years; and have referred many friends and family here as well. That all stops today. I had the worst experience I've ever had at ANY restaurant in my entire life, while trying to celebrate Father's Day with my family today. The manager Sean Snelling tried to send our waitress home for the day as punishment because he didn't like the way she explained the new menu to us. (She said the menu was getting mixed reviews). After getting reamed by this absurd manager she came to our table with tears in her eyes to say we'd be served by a different waiter. We asked what happened and she told us. We asked to speak with Sean. He came to our table, arms crossed,  with a smug look on his face. We told him the waitress comments weren't offensive at all and asked if she could still be our server. I couldn't help but interject that I couldn't believe he'd send her home because of her comment. His response " I cant believe I'm having THIS conversation " WHAT THE HELL SEAN!? Verbal abuse to staff and customers,  isn't a winning combo. He expedited the food in the kitchen for the remainder of our lunch....which was CLEARLY why it took an hour for our food to leave the kitchen. Terrible, check your ego Sean.

KZsAfD9Cbi7-ecXPSFdoNA.text: I hosted a company dinner at Taco Guild and the staff was very accommodating. Some of our guests had dietary restrictions and the staff understood and met our needs. Besides having delicious food the ambiance is very cool. The restaurant is in an old church. The whole place bad a very cool vibe and everything was instagramable!!!

iCWVkhbgPMuU3ioHAVQHHA.text: Love this place. Phenomenal food. Unfortunately tonite we head the worst experience there. Part of our order didn't come out till we were ready to leave. No apologies until we addressed the mgr about it.    We were told they were making it fresh but it ended up taking an hr for us to get a small cup of queso. Very disappointed in management not taking charge to make it right properly. Her inexperience was definitely clear.

J_AY6xaJ2CuHv1Mq6xj7OA.text: Quite a good place despite the incongruous  name. Beautiful setting. Had the three taco plate with grilled corn. Delicious. Great tequila selection. Light thin chips with terrific salsa, not too spicy. I'd go back but there are so many wonderful Mexican joints in Phoenix, I'd try several others first but it would be in rotation. Call first. They have a line but will seat you with a reservation.

SbBNR2HtLL1QissZTqTd8g.text: This place is a great lunch spot. The atmosphere is great, especially knowing it really was an authentic old church.  The food is great starting with the appetizer trio (queso, guacamole,and bean dip...), then try the traditional or new wave tacos, but I like the grilled romain with shrimp and the slightly spicy Caesar dressing. Drinks are large and they refill often. This is one of my favorite lunch places.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

baGF3nrrof86w1MUO1xAfw.text: Food was good, but basic. Not sure when fall squashes became associated with Mexican dishes. Coolest thing about the place was the building.

9iCbcASmXfzQ43zzuvlhfg.text: We were looking for margaritas & were intrigued by this " de-sanctified" church! Yes your read correctly .. De-sanctified! I liked that they kept the stained glass windows and lots of the church's artifacts are on the wall.  And Where do you place the bar in an old church, the altar! You should go if just to see it alone. The food is great. The price even better with the daily taco 1.99 each along with the drink special it's a great meal at a shockingly reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Where do you place the bar in a &#34;de-sanctified&#34; church, the altar! Love it!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EZEc95nCOh9RVK_RIw_Z4w.text: Jason, Sunny, and all the staff were absolutely incredible from the moment we walked in. Our visit started with a historical tour of the building, and then we were offered drink and food recommendations which we quickly took Jason up on. Street corn, an assortment of six street tacos, the grilled romaine salad, guacamole... EVERYTHING was incredible. Cant want to go back to visit! There is nothing like this back home. Thank you!!!!

VDWCcB7C5rTq9Dn_yntdNA.text: Asian/Mexican fusion. Great atmosphere, service a tab bit slow however we were also a large party and a Saturday night.  Overall food was superb. Menu is basic (I love it, my opiniin they stick to what is best sellers ). Live entertainment and options for indoor or outdoor seating. Definitely will come back to this place.

-uxy-rfWBb03P5nbumXoVQ.text: Enjoyed a buisness lunch here.  Very cool place with good unique food and excellent service.  I had the duck tacos.  Very unique, very good.

WUXC-9QfcWanvHSKJGTUbA.text: Came to meet some friends. What a great place!  First let me say it was nice and cool inside, that is a plus since it has been super hot & humid! Beautiful seating, not cramped like some of these other taco places. The fresh guacamole was Yummy!! I had a veggie burrito, really enjoyed it. Can't wait to try some tacos.  Definitely will recommend this place to others.

vuj5Nw8ugNlpI94nmnqxSg.text: Met some old high school friends for dinner a few night ago.  Pros: Great ambiance and service was really good.  I really wished I got his name as I would like to have given him credit.  Chips and salsa were good.  5-Stars.  Cons: The food, unfortunately.  I had the beef enchiladas and the sauce tasted like it came directly from a can from Safeway brand, and not the good stuff either.  :-)  2-Stars.  However, if given the opportunity I will probably go back and give them another shot.

GBkdFkWrrxV4EvGzZqrtfA.text: We went in tonight being our first time , our friend has gone here and said GREAT things. We enjoyed it from the moment we got there to the moment we left.  We  were greated right away and it was busy told it would be about 10 mins but we were seated in less then 5. Very friendly staff.  The chips and salsa were so good. We ordered the chicken and steak tacos. I preferred the steak over the chicken but that's just personal preference. Both had great flavor.  The server was also very friendly and attentive. The manager even came over and introduced himself. Very nice to see that a manager takes pride in his restaurant. The restaurant overall was very nice loved the live DJ he ambiance was great! If your looking to try something new you have to go there!  We will definitely come back to Taco Guild!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Thanks!!

rk0x7sXl14OAWQ-pdiqaoA.text: I moved to Phoenix for a summer job about 5 weeks ago, and have gone to Taco Guild 6 times since - each time as good or better than the last. The food is dream-hauntingly incredible. Seriously, I look forward to the one day per week I've limited myself to going (after having gone twice in my first week and realizing the dangerousness of the deliciousness) for the whole preceding week. I'd highly recommend you get the Cartel Coffee Beef Taco (significantly better than its predecessor Urban Bean Beef Taco, sorry, but it's objectively True) as well as the Molido Lamb Taco. Both are phenomenal. The array of salsas, namely the house salsa and the orange salsa (whatever it is) included for free with a basket of freshly made chips is just icing on the saucy, spicy cake. Don't forget to miss the happy hour and Taco Tuesday specials too - big ass $6 margs shouldn't be neglected, though I'd advise you pass on any of the Taco Tuesday taco specials (they're not nearly as good as their regular menu tacos, though they'll get the job of filling you up done for cheap). The waitstaff and bartenders are yet another reason to frequent the place as much as I do as well: Gabe with his expert service, attentiveness (never letting water glasses dip below halfway when his patrons are conquering the salsas especially*******), and friendliness; Harren, who you should feel free to ask questions about the area (he indulged me while I barraged him when I first arrived); and Sunny who also has excellent service. GO TO THIS RESTAURANT IT'S CONSISTENTLY MY FAVORITE IN PHOENIX.

B8zO9DJh9TVS4wYmISM4FQ.text: Worst service ever. I sat at my table for 10 minutes and no waiters had approached me to offer anything. Two caucasian guys come in and sit at the table next to me. They get service within two minutes. A waiter takes their drink order and brings them chip and salsa. I try to get his attention but am unable to. So I flag down the host and he talks to some other waiter. That waiter finally comes over and takes my order. Then I am sitting for another 5 minutes. And another group of caucasian men are seated at table near me and a waiter comes up to them and takes their drink order and brings them chips and salsa. Mind you I have been there for 15 minutes and still no water and chips and salsa. Frustrated I go up to the bar and tell them I still haven't gotten water or anything and that I would prefer to sit at bar to get service. My waiter makes up a BS excuse about why he hasn't brought water out. I sit at bar and have my tacos. They offered $5.00 off. I thought that was not much and didn't leave a tip. Still wondering if you have to be a white male to get good service here. It may have not been about race but it is interesting that the two tables next to me with white males got service right away. I won't be coming back to this place ever. I like being treated fairly with the same level of attentiveness.

sr6B0Rw0ZqFBnJkF8tTO0g.text: This place is A.MAZ.ING!! The food is impeccable, service was phenomenal and they had awesome live music which was SO. MUCH. FUN being 90s R&B covers!!

7zT3piiBm-ELXmQb5QWtKA.text: The ambiance makes this place worth the visit.  The tacos are good, but there are better in the area.

V0Cu5lAoA8rK8U-D3cNq_w.text: Love Love Love the venue and tacos.  One of our favorites!. I only wish they'd make better margaritas.  They have a great assortment of excellent tequila's to choose from. Several of us  ordered the 1893, each one was a little different, then tried a "custom"which was terrible!  Please, please please work on the margaritas for us.  Every time we visit it's, "do we try a margarita again or stick with beer!

pvrYkQUCfH_zqkMDjR7big.text: Busy lives we all lead I have driven past this place at least 100 times and of course have said we need to stop here so today we did and it was better then expected. The building has so much history the server Jaycen was excellent. The tacos are more like street tacos wish they were a little bigger but the flavor they pack is over the top. I had the Peking Duck, Al-Pastor and Thai snapper all three I would get again.  If you are looking for some place unique and looking for Mexican this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Different types of hot sauce
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three tacos, Al-pastor, Thai snapper and Peking Duck. These are not Jack in the Box tacos.

l_HVlfb9LXlrR-2f977H6A.text: I went back for a second time-   My husband liked the building- I noted again, all the different great details: Mismatched china, fantastic ambiance, amazing chips and salsa.  Food is pretty good. But the service just sucks.  A dry, uninterested waitress sort of helped us.  The margarita I remember being delicious is now made from a mix.  The music mixer was ridiculously loud, so it was hard to talk. Kind of a bummer how badly those things ruin everything else

2-K514XU6xNMAjDAllcJ1g.text: This place was awesome. Good tacos, GREAT cheese dips, and very cool atmosphere.

85JoDu3r7_-RoYlN45zEgw.text: Was not a fan. Service was great, but the food was not as good as I expected. Get the guacamole, that is good. The cherry tacos were also good. Don't get the duck tacos. I couldn't enjoy those not even a little. Drinks are good so is the salsa.

cKmXBaUBlbOIUc7HhAzuSA.text: We ate here last night and really enjoyed it. We had the tradition guacamole and cheese dip and both were excellent. I had a taco plate with el pastor tacos and the cherry beef tacos and both were excellent! I did not care for the shrimp taco. I did not like the slaw on top. My husband had a steak burrito and he thought is was excellent. We love the atmosphere and they had live music and the group was fantastic!! We will be back!!

_HSOD5yoqsI8piAFgjGW8A.text: Here for lunch, thus place is not busy and they refuse to seat my party of 3 at a low table in a booth out of center of flow. There are open booths. Hope the food is better than the hostess.

hWPYntsywT_-f1HKYp3CnA.text: Although the tacos here might pass in the middle of the country, given the number of delicious, authentic tacos you can find in the Valley for under $2, I have a hard time understanding why anyone would muscle through the tacos here.  Although the combinations sound trendy, they taste like an expired fad - something you'll regret when you look back on them.  Here, you need only wait a bite or two before that regret sets in.  On our first and only trip here, we had the guacamole, lamb taco, pork adovada taco, and Thai snapper taco.  Although you can choose to flavor your guacamole with tastes like jalapeno bacon and pineapple mint, we opted for the house version since it was our first time.  The guacamole, although a sizable portion, was completely lacking in flavor.  There was no hint of cilantro, jalapeno, or lime in any of the bites we tried.  A True waste of delicious avocado.  In each of the tacos, the flavors weren't well developed and didn't marry well.  Blue cheese and curry sauce might sound like interesting toppings for a "gourmet" taco, but if you can't pull it off, you shouldn't try.  Even the pork adovada was completely nondescript and lackluster, even despite the attempt to spruce it up with mango jicama relish and cotija cheese.  The side of "street corn" that accompanied the tacos was abysmal and tasted little better than canned corn drowning in butter.    This place might be good for drinks since the converted church is a nice change in your average scenery, with high ceilings, lots of wrought iron, and stained glass, but we would not come back here for food if it was free.

muQ1EnqzH4j6xfoJGXK9xg.text: This place is very close to my work and I absolutely love it. The food is wonderful, I have been favoring the guild chicken tacos which is probably their most basic taco but it is full of flavor. I have yet to try the burritos but I have seen them and they look spectacular. They have a touchtunes system so that you can throw on whatever music is available. The church that this restaurant was constructed in is very nice and well maintained, they have even kept the churches stained glass windows! The bar is very inviting and Eric the bartender is very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and of course any drink you can think of. Just an absolute joy to be here, I would recommend it to anybody who enjoys Mexican food. Don't pass this place up!

HO6ogFG9xZmD7p6mK8kw_Q.text: Very nice atmosphere...love the decor throughout the restaurant, very much unique and inviting. Service was just OK. Food was good.

Hl4d3uJX5KN6jjRAiNQzcA.text: Service was great so friendly. Food was awesome. Saw it on tv and was thrilled to finally make it. Street tacos with a variety of ingredients. So fresh tasting. We had their tacos of the day for $1.99 each. Chicken and pork with cojeta cheese with pico de gallo. Inhaled them. Saw the nachos and they looked great. Was told they were great. Perfect for sharing

HFTI5xuQNa4unr0qP9xkrg.text: Love the atmosphere except it seems cold and impersonal.  The menu is great and the food solidly average!

4l8MpeILg9ENTMczy4TbqQ.text: Yesterday was the third time I've eaten here. It was also the third time we have had miserable service experience here.  The food was good. The server was nice and terrible at serving. A member of our party was sampling the beers in order to select one to compliment her meal. Once our friend had decided which she wanted it was too late as the server never came back to our table. I had to track her down to pay for our bill. The server forgot other items we requested as well.  Ironically we received a survey ticket with our bill and the survey website states that they are no longer taking surveys.   The food was good. With so many great places to get tacos Taco Guild is not worth the frustration of dealing with the poor service.

BZvMGTRvV8ev5NwBlNcfsA.text: My boyfriend and I love this place! We usually go there to eat but today I did take out. I was worried about how the food would travel but it stood up well! Highly recommend the corn and the cherry steak taco. I also think it's awesome that they collaborate with another local establishment for one of thier menu items. I can't remember exactly but it's like coffee braised beef. The staff is always friendly, knowledgeable and informative about thier food and drinks. The building is recycled and they just seem interested in doing more then just serving food. Greatly appreciated!

fFqirR2eloOXLClpO5ORhA.text: I tried the restaurant for the first time last night . The place is a converted church . Concrete floors made the place noisy.  We were seated at the back of the restaurant . The hot sauce was mild but had good flavor.  We tried the guacamole with Serrano peppers. The peppers were mild . We really liked their grilled corn on the cobb. By the time I got to my burrito I was full . I had the steak burrito.  . Service was good except for the end when it came to get the bill and pay

kgPgmz5iPKcpnQnzPX_TSQ.text: Two stars for a nice interior and the manager offering to comp our lunch.  However, I was not looking for a free lunch.  I was excited to have an opportunity to eat lunch here as I am usually serving lunch myself.  We showed up after 12:30 and it was still a little busy.  We waited about 10 minutes for a table as I didn't feel like eating lunch at the bar, bad choice.  After 2 different people brought us water and chips our waitress finally made an appearance.  I had the taco plate with a free side and he had a steak burrito with a free side.  My meal came out pretty quick however his meal came out 7 minutes later.  My free side turned out to be ice cold rice and his free side never arrived.  It's not really a free side if you don't bring the said side.  Our food delivery and drink refills were done by other servers.  At no point did our waitress or any other server ask how our meal was or if we needed anything, isn't that server 101?!? Check on your tables.  My boyfriend had to leave and get back to work as it was taking a long time and could not foresee when our server would reappear.  When she finally decided to check on me and brought the bill she apologized for the confusion?  What confusion?!  She told us she would be our server so I expect she will be serving us, not everyone else.  She just flat out IGNORED us!  When she knew I was not pleased she got short with me.  Probably not how you should treat a displeased customer.    Whitney, dear this business is not for you and stop putting blame elsewhere.    I'm not sure I will be back for lunch.  Maybe when it cools off the patio would be a nice experience.  And the food, pretty good but not worth the bad service.  Also, the manager should be managing his staff not tending the bar at lunch time.

kgVijt_8YLaMx1tr2P9YRg.text: Chips, Chips and more Chips! There chips and salsa are sooo good. Tacos are delish and price is reasonable for the amount of food you get. Plus they have Happy Hour taco specials.

kOBvbbCmY8LeCbi5yj8HNw.text: Came in for happy hour on a Wednesday and Opted to sit outside instead of at the bar. Patrice took great care of us. We enjoyed their $5 happy hour margaritas, the guys I was with got the $1.99 daily tacos, and I had one of the most delicious vegetable tacos of my life. I will be back for the great service and yummy tacos.

XaKCoUMqXTs11zRFSWs3XQ.text: food was great, but where is the parking lot? Took me like 20 minutes to find a spot! Duck tacos were delicious though.

ZKPw9vaFFMwi1_TWk8Z1KA.text: OMg! The Cherry Steak with bleu cheese is YUM! Best taco I've had in my life.

KwjmfX_BbyaSCSsSe1vyRg.text: Guess what Paula from earlier reviews. . We had Whitney as a server.. she was awesome as balls! Never an empty Margarita glass and a happy smile!
