Come here often and never disappointed with service.  Happy hour frozen margaritas are well worth it. Pork a Vado do burritos make you see the face of god.

MUMIdMkcvmmixqq2a83Qzg.text: Tacos are overpriced and not that good. The service was horrible. My group was ignored for quite some time. Also the menu is short and there is no simple beef or chicken taco. But the building is pretty cool and very unique, unfortunately It does not make up for the food. I will not be back :(

wiosKr7aZmHBkUvLCVWFug.text: Great food!!  I had the lamb taco which was wonderful and the street corn.  I was disappointed with the service. I can after lunch rush and waited a good ten minutes before being approached.  I will give another chance because the food was fantastic!

yZX1Ef5wJX2aYIhuuccA2w.text: Met a customer for lunch here. This was GREAT. Had fantastic service from a friendly guy named Nick.  Quick with food and conversation.  The food was delicious. I had Al Pastor tacos and the flavors was amazing. Crispy chips and tasty salsa. I can't wait to comeback!!

DjdaCxPfGN3jtfXWKG04_g.text: First of all...the place is absolutely beautiful! My husband and I have been here a few times to enjoy cocktails at the bar but never ate there until yesterday and I have to say it was DELICIOUS! Our server, John who is amazing by the way, brought us chips and salsa for starters while we browsed the menu. They have 4 different types of salsa, each are wonderful but I think the green one was my favorite, and the chips are warm and fresh.  My husband ordered the tacos, which you can mix and match, I got  the chicken burrito, and for our little one, they made a cheese quesadilla. Both plates were mind blowing good and even our daughters was tasty. If you are looking for a new place to try in Central Phoenix, give this place a go! Cannot wait to go back!

fsbMbBYNvZB75dFEhvUeRA.text: First of all, amazing concept to renovate an old church and turn it into a restaurant. Stained glass windows adorn the place and pews converted into booths. Definitely a cool ambiance. The place has a good happy hour along with weekend brunch and breakfast burritos/tacos. Good selection of tequilas as well. The food was delicious and portions were very well sized for the price. I got three different tacos and each one was an explosion of flavor from the pork adobada, guild chicken, and Peking duck. Breakfast burrito is massive too. And of course, complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa is very flavorful and rich. Not watery or boring like most Mexican places. Service was a bit slow to start with a waiter coming over but they were a bit busy for Sunday brunch time. No wait to get seated and food came out pretty quickly. They totally missed an opportunity to put their drink and tequila lost menu in a bible though.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Various tacos. Delicious.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chandelier
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The logo

x5SsVXnTDTyzXY5YRLuaCQ.text: I never thought that I would get tipsy in church, but alas...it happened. This was hands down one of the coolest places places that I've ever been. My boyfriend and I went on a Monday for happy hour after work. I ordered a house margarita on the rocks and he had a Cartel Double IPA. Both fantastic!   We were given a plate of chips and salsa that came with four different types to try. If you're a salsa junkie, make sure to ask for your complimentary basket. Their spicy red pepper sauce was my favorite.   For our meal we ordered three tacos: the ono, the shrimp, and the al pastor. For our sides we got a house salad and street corn. The street corn made us both say hallelujah. It was the best part of the entire meal.   We both agreed that we would be back with a large group of friends. What a fantastic place!

DYDhBEoNvxzVfNjbvSV4jw.text: First off, the building is absolutely beautiful and had a lot of character. I was excited to eat here. I came here with a colleague and client.   The salsas were fabulous. I wish there had been more of the orange and green spicy salsas. The pineapple guacamole was great too. The chipotle cherry steak taco was delicious and I would definitely order it again. The Yucatan shrimp taco was just okay. I ate that one second thinking I would like it better. Someone I was with asked the waitress to pick two tacos and surprise her. She never did come back to say which two she chose. I ordered the street corn but that never came which was fine since I had loaded up on chips before my tacos. We had to ask that be removed from the bill.   Lastly, parking could be better. But I would definitely go back, especially to try some of their tequila and other new and old world tacos.

2V_s0817Ps3bdt6P-MyZcA.text: Tried Taco Guild for the first time on Saturday night! Atmosphere is very cool and the staff was very friendly! They had live music which was AWESOME! Great music, delicious margaritas and the food was killer. We had the beef enchiladas and chips and salsa platter. Definitely recommend it and we will definitely be back!

3ljxQw0fCud937d4OciZqw.text: Great atmosphere, friendly service, amazing food; price point representative of the quality of the food. The tacos are packed with meat. Beautiful presentation also. This place got busy very quickly after opening at 11am on a Sunday. I am impressed and definitely feel we got our money's worth. We'll be back and referring our friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The stained glass windows from when this was a church
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The ceiling and chandelier and art work.

LBuVCP-RyrBvTJKJc3CW3Q.text: First and foremost, this is a very, very cool looking place. Love the architecture. So unique!   I came here with a large group at 3pm on a Sunday. Unfortunately the service was abysmal.   We had a young, blond, male waiter who was constantly forgetting to bring things our group had either ordered or asked for. Several in our party ordered the special "all you can eat" taco deal which serves approximately two tacos at once and then requires you to order another two each time you're ready for a "refill". Our waiter repeatedly forgot to bring several of the people in our party their taco refills. I ordered a kale salad (which was delicious) so I didn't have this problem personally, but it was annoying to witness nonetheless.   I loved my salad. Would have loved not to have to ask for water twice, a drink refill twice, and a "to go" box twice when I was ready to leave! I may give this place another shot but only in a party of two or less. I won't go with a big group again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kale salad with shrimp &amp; fruit.

OxZD2cTD5YlUVTXaV3VsQg.text: Had a great experience here with wonderful service. This place is incredible. By far the best Mexican food no doubt. The chips and salsa were so pleasantly accomplished. The drinks were good but a little pricey.

_CzLMs5gD4WfSvYbW6xxOA.text: Amazing I bing all my out of town relatives here. The love it!  Awesome code with history. Tequila bar is top-notch

zt_GLBElJSTtwJ6AL_8G_g.text: Great ambience, neat architectural features and good LOOKING food in this place but that's about it. I love tacos and really wanted to love this place, but the flavors were non existent for me. I had the Al Pastor pork, Guild Chicken, and Peking Duck tacos and didn't like a one. Even the street corn was over cooked. I will say my girlfriend did enjoy her tacos but this place is not for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guild Chicken, Peking Duck, and Al Pastor tacos with a side of street corn.

zMJG-wTLRB6B8fp1d4XD-A.text: Had the GRILLED ROMAINE SALAD with chicken and it was fantastic, such a unique mixture of flavors, highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great tacos, great salads, fantastic atmosphere

nY4f52ydjheQ_OEI5zqrkA.text: We enjoyed it but the service could use a tune up. Good food and I love the atmosphere.

I7fFaLssHzTdvY-xW6Jkbg.text: Awesome place for happy hour, the margarita is fantastic,  along with the chips and salsa,  yea! Had the chicken with the taco and enchilada was great, the staff is great, friendly,  the ambience is welcoming, a must check out.

NHLLUrXpvGt8yXDF4sYpRw.text: Everything we ordered was amazing! Best tacos I've had in Phoenix and the vibe was a nice touch. Old church, stained glass...great service. Great experience

h5qRrElIT1Us-dkFizYUTQ.text: I'd say 4 1/2 stars.  We were the same as everyone.......  hesitant to stop and, boy, are we glad we did!  The array of tacos, fresh corn tortillas, and the corn is the best "mexican street corn" I have had for a long time in Phoenix!  The chipotle butter sauce was so good on the corn and the corn wasn't a KFC-caliber, marinated and sitting all day type!  I even have to say that their types of salsa were great to try with fresh chips.  There were 4 types that had me wishing I had more!  I also am Irish and German and their selection of micro brews had me happy with me trying a few with my tacos.  I like their 3 taco deal and added a side of corn.  It hit the spot and really didn't damage my wallet either.  My wife's margarita was above average too (but not the best in PHX)!  The reason for 4 1/2 stars was the service.  The food comes out fast, but I wish the server was more punctual at refills and the check.  I think the server could have done better with recommending drinks for each type of taco.  But it wasn't like it was horrible service (hostess was awesome and friendly), but 5 stars, the service needs to be perfect!

EB3_wKhau2wX9LIu6ARSHQ.text: Ambience and food are GREAT!!! I mean what's cooler than an 1893 Methodist church that's been converted to a hip and trendy Mexican joint?!? Went for an early lunch, so we only had to choose from the limited Brunch menu. Chips and Salsa are solid yumminess! Enjoyed all but two of their tacos. Cherry steak tacos were the best by far, chicken and shrimp tacos were good but a little bland, coffee braised taco was good and the lamb was solid. Get the corn appetizer or side...it's huge and VERY tasty!! We will be back and can't wait to try more from the menu. Service was great and manager was really friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great salsa! Love the three HOT options!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good chips
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn is killer crazy yummy in my tummy!

mrV8gL2kGEJZKxHZ7pXycw.text: It's a really cool place and the ambience is cool but honestly the tacos were just not good. After taking the first bite I knew something was off and matter what taco I tried it was just not cutting it for me. The corn was the only thing that I can say was pretty okay.

6GEDXnFybMAH5PYWMddbuQ.text: Best tacos! Per my mom you have to get the grilled romain salad! Best tacos! Al pastor was my fave. The margaritas on point, they sneak up on you and of course the grilled street corn. In an old church a must try if your in phx. Gooo

0hNbUV7_hUUCF5FgFh875A.text: Delicious dining and great service. I've been served by both seasoned servers and new trainees and both have done great jobs at keeping us engaged and happy. The food is great and always large servings.

88eRtmtgLXHJfwEhpMg0EA.text: Super vibe in this place with live music, friendly service, killer tequila menus and delicious food. Highly recommend a combo of old world and new world tacos, and don't miss the street corn! The only reason it gets 4 stars is that our food came out way too fast; meaning, drinks and entrees first, followed by the starter and then the corn. Will be back!

YZrNpS06hcjEDBkLGEG1Ow.text: The art on the walls is pretty amazing. I also like how it's in a church so religious people will feel uncomfortable. It's very blasphemous, heathens unite!

E93OMLgkT3J_g65oU6Zf0Q.text: Amazing tacos! Not just another taco shop! Great twist on taco. The atmosphere is amazing! Staff and bartenders are great! Best margaritas!!!!!!!!

kxOjV6zCgc0qzqQA-lC56A.text: The building itself is neat but the food and atmosphere were average. I believe there is a much better way to design the inside. Lastly, the tequila was overpriced

YC4uUsxr2AnKsuCG2mv2Sw.text: It's kind of a cool venue and there's plenty of parking. The food is okay: more of an "upscale middle-class white people" kind of Mexican restaurant and less "actual Mexican people enjoy actual Mexican food." Chips and salsa were free and tasty and the drinks were pretty good! Our service wasn't great, we had a coupon which had no limits on it but both our server and the manager refused to honor it. This was particularly frustrating, since we had come because of the coupon. Also there's something about eating an old church that either creeps me out or bums me out (im not sure). It's not a bad place to go, but there's lots of GOOD Mexican food in Phoenix so why settle for okay? This place is fine, but nothing special.

lNgUuBXsTT97x1nZnlvC2w.text: I highly recommended. Great atmosphere, laid back, fun music, friendly staff. The food is delicious with a different mixed of flavors, very good! If you're looking for a different fun place to go where you can enjoy delicious food and drinks, Taco Guild Gastropub is the place!!!

O-sNvcBJTeUJNFdijItLgg.text: Building is pretty, an old church, but unhappy with the experience.  They were out of the only item on the menu my husband wanted to eat.  When asked about whether the Asian pork happy hour taco specials were greasy, were told no, but they are deep fried! Didn't have much taste and the pork was hard and chewy. The server said you could get the corn side for $1.50 when you ordered 3 tacos, but guess it didn't count on the happy hour tacos (which he clarified after the fact - when the bill came) Had to order 3 tacos off regular menu to get that price, so we ended up with 9, plus the 3 coffee bean braised beef.. Slow on refill of salsa, beer, and  water refills near end of meal.  Wasn't asked about a dessert.  We were celebrating a birthday and no mention. Won't be back.  Was so looking forward to it!

UjbfPdq28WoHxpBGShpM2A.text: Simply the best tacos I've ever had.  Amazing food all around and a world class tequila selection to boot.  Can't say enough good things about this place.

BvgQSG8iXGI_F7_VcxdFGQ.text: Awesome atmosphere, good tacos, and great beer. Staff is extremely friendly as well!

ABObanCujLwoskLfQkyZqA.text: (Review includes update)  My daughter and I arrived on a Friday night and were seated after about a 10-minute wait.  Hostess was friendly.  The place was quite busy but staffing seemed adequate.  We knew something was wrong when the hostess who seated us said, "I'll have someone wait on you as soon as possible." I've never heard that before.  After two minutes of not even being acknowledged, i.e., "I'll be right with you," we continued to be treated as if we were invisible.  My back was turned but three servers made eye contact with my daughter and they also had time to converse amongst themselves - yet NONE said a word to us. I started the stopwatch and said if no one comes to us in three minutes, we walk. After three and a-half minutes, we got up and left.  What a shame. The menu looked interesting and the ambience was pretty cool.  But the lack of service was the worst I've experienced in a long time. Will never go back.  UPDATE I commend management for responding to my complaint and they have invited us back to try Taco Guild again. I have adjusted to three stars and will update the rating again based on our next experience.  Their manager was embarrassed by the service we received and thoroughly apologized. That's quite honorable.

B_cR83eDSQUZ_2aEJyPYyg.text: I'd driven by Taco Guild before it was open and I was eager to finally try it today. I was excited about the concept and couldn't wait to try the food.  I arrived for lunch shortly after noon with a colleague. I realize places can be busy around lunch, but most are accommodating to working professionals on a lunch hour and are staffed appropriately. There seemed to be plenty of open tables, but we (party of 2) were told the wait would be 15-20 minutes. When I asked why, I was told it was because the kitchen was backed up. Ok, fine... but I asked to be seated so we could at least order drinks. That was not an option and the hostesses were less than polite about it.  After waiting 15 minutes, I asked about how much longer. The hostess informed me it would be at least another 10 minutes. My colleague and I were hungry and becoming a little impatient, but we waited. We then noticed another party of 2 (who came in after us and were below us on the list) get seated before we did. It was nearly 30 minutes before we were finally seated - and outside at that! I realize we're in Phoenix and patio dining is an option, but we were not looking to sit outdoors as neither of us were dressed appropriately and there were seemingly plenty of options available inside. Hungry, crunched for time and annoyed we took the patio seating.  Our server was GREAT! She quickly brought out chips and salsa - which were very tasty. She also explained the menu and seemed very knowledgeable. Because of the wait we were immediately ready to order. Sadly, they were out of a few things we wished to try. Beef and pork. How can a place known for tacos be out of beef and pork during a lunch rush?!  The food arrived - we both had tacos - and it was surprisingly delicious. We both enjoyed the Guild Chicken tacos and the corn appetizer.  We also noticed the randomness of the music. They have a juke box type thing and it does nothing for the atmosphere. It went from like hip-hop to country to EDM. Totally random and ruins the vibe of the place.  The friendliness and the first impression from the hostesses left a bad taste in my mouth. The food and service from our server slightly made up for it, but it remains to be seen if I'll return.

qwGr8Q41RXIZQs0tIJF3_w.text: My motivator for this restaurant was that I wanted to see the inside. It is incredible and interesting and creative! The food was good too. My friends warned me it is a little pricey for the amount of food. I was strategic. You get free chips and salsa which are delicious. I had the happy hour tacos which were well worth it and delicious. I also like the uniqueness of the plates and how they don't match.

yAQ3DStb-gE0C7aIcXyCuw.text: Carne Asada tacos are yum. Beautiful inside and out. Service was here and there. Delicious food and drinks but I dealt like the acoustics were a bit loud.

isSUImIyCYmXMYkgC-N2uw.text: I did like the new concep and design the restaurant .  The food is ok. Drinks can be little $$$$$$$.  I tried the tacos

AnfJDXaEbtPjon571OVMQA.text: My husband and I went for dinner.  He had the enchiladas and I had the tacos.  Both were outstanding!  And then the waitress tempted us with coconut cream pie which we could not turn down.  It was worth every last calorie!

2D_waLR6p6_7DD76dTOVTg.text: ok, i will admit, i was HUGELY skeptical of this place. it had everything going against it...a pilot concept for a chain? no. 'upscale' (read: yuppie) mexican food in a neighborhood that already has a lot of traditional mexican food? no. brand new strip mall that the neighbors i talk to all didnt want? no.  but we finally caved last night and, uh, its very good. beautiful space, great service and selection, everything we had was DELICIOUS. even the salsa spread (regular red, slightly smoked, pureed jalapeno and habanero) they bring you to start is unique and fantastic. my wife and i tried nearly all of the taco selections, all worth it. its not 'real' mexican food in the purist-lingo, but it is damn good.  only complaints: a bit on the pricey side for the quantity you get, the fresh tortillas can apparently be a bit hit or miss as a few were slightly under done and too chewy. everything else was great

QvYPDQPQCBlJ-P7D1MMMDA.text: I love the church converted to a restaurant. The food is AWESOME! Hubby had the coffee braised beef. It was so savory. It has the dark flavor from the coffee but didn't taste like coffee at all. That was my favorite. He also had the cilantro lime dressing. It was so flavorful. I had the avocado dressing and loved that it didn't taste like I had just avocado on my salad. The street corn stole the show though!! It was so tasty

4ANuxa8cA0IPWSAkvwETcw.text: Great selection of tacos - shrimp, fish, lamb, duck, steak, chicken. We all tried the 3 taco special with a free side which allowed us to try most of them...very good! Complimentary chips and a variety of salsas. Inside of a historic building that use to be a church, some elements remain. The DJ was really good but it was super loud in there. Because most churches are acoustically sound, they may just want to add some dampers to absorb some of the sound. Courteous & professional staff. We've already gone back & will return.

EqIOEqskEicldzYQNLPczA.text: So...here's the scoop: Host asked what we wanted when we walked in the door (to eat, both of us, please?) He seated us at our choice if tables, and seemed surprised that we were OK with a "community table"...there were a dozen other people there at the time. A server brought waters, then told us the other guy would be our server. The other guy stopped by about 5 minutes later, and asked if the previous server had taken our drink or app orders, and seemed annoyed that A) she had not, and B) we hadn't decided yet. When he brought our drinks back he didn't get the order right, and seemed bothered that we wanted it right. When we asked for HIS recommendation for what he liked, he said it was all good and he didn't have a favorite.  When Jen asked for hers without cilantro, he asked if it was a preference or an allergy (it's an allergy). Our appetizer came out quickly, followed too quickly by dinner. We had: roasted corn on the corn appetizer, four tacos (al Pastor, Lamb, snapper, and braised beef). The food was DELICIOUS, the place was architecturally noteworthy, and the service was as bad as I can remember, and we eat out way too much. Maybe it was an off-night for our guy. I hope so, because I could be convinced to go back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kP2geGTylMrEhE3gocqVzg.text: Dined last night 1/28/14  First, let me say that  the food at Taco Guild is (mostly) awesome. The salsa is too runny, though, and I judge a lot about  Mexican food experience on the quality of the salsa. I had the grilled romaine salad and a side of corn-off-the-cob that was delicious, and their draught beer selection from local breweries is solid.   HOWEVER, the service is so horrendous that it nearly neutralizes all of the positives of the cuisine. First, our waitress brought me the wrong wine. Instead of allowing the table to keep the accidental glass, from which I had already drunk, she said that she had to take it back from me, or charge me for it. Really?? You'd rather waste a perfectly good glass of wine  than just let us consume it? I surely hope you weren't going to pour it back into the bottle for reuse!!  Secondly, one of the members of our table did not receive his drink, and upon waiting  fifteen minutes for it to arrive, instead of admitting she forgot, the waitress told us it was because the drinks are handmade, thus taking a long time. Said drink arrived three minutes later. Then he did not receive his soup, then he only received a single a-la-carte taco rather than the full plate that he ordered. Then he received the wrong side dish with the plate. It was absurd.   Third, after mentioning to one of the owners (who I am told also partially owns z tejas) that we didn't care for the jukebox (the general public seems to have an affinity for mediocre 90s alt rock), his reply was, "Okay. Pretend it isn't there." What a rude, smug, jerk.   I'll be going elsewhere for my Mexican food. I'd rather not wait 15 minutes for the wrong class of wine, while being forced to listen to the Gin Blossoms.

awOgho4wIbXl02eU6f3fag.text: Love this place. Excellent food and the ambiance is so fun. I love the cherry steak tacos, grilled romaine salad and corn. The weekend has live music and it's pretty loud in there though. Not much of a problem but not for little kids or 80 year old grandmas unless they're hip and into that kind of a scene!

7KQI1kudMb5dssHE2tSJuQ.text: An old church, which has now been turned into a Taco and Tequila joint? I'm in! It was beautiful inside with a full bar and plenty of original church pew seating. The murals and stained glass windows with dim lighting gave it an authentic feel. They give you 4 different salsa dips to try with tortilla chips, which we all loved. The tacos were filling and a great choice (shrimp, fish, and beef) The corn was definitely one of my favorites and was cooked perfectly and spicy but not overwhelming. The queso dip was excellent and I honestly have never had better. We also had spicy meatballs that were good, but to spicy for me but my friends loved them. The happy hour menu was quite small with very little appeal to us, therefore we won't be coming for Happy Hour. Over all we were pleased.

WAL2RloAvx1CaIDS3dgc8g.text: My first Mexican food restaurant experience in Phoenix. So it always will have a special place in my heart.  Food is good. The vibe is trendy. Its inside an old church.  Definitely recommend

6R9Tl5LCY5I9Z_fWrL6vsQ.text: I'm giving Taco Guild 3 stars instead of 4 or 5 because it took them 25 minutes to seat us outside even though two tables were completely open (and the final table remained open for the entire half hour we were there), which is pretty unacceptable. But they have really fun, fancy, creative and tasty tacos and the margaritas are great. They have a three-taco special where you get a free side, but I ordered a Sonoran hot dog taco and you can't get a taco of the day and also get the special. The entire restaurant is in a former church, which is neat, but you really do need to sit outside unless you want to scream over the too-loud music. Also, there's a lot of parking but it's hard to find a spot.

Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita!

YptP9vGu9EswpJ_fLGI64Q.text: Wow... the service was great, held the door open upon our arrival and we were great with a smile and a warm welcome. Our waitress new the menu and was able to suggest items from it. The food tasted is delicious as it looked. The building and theme were very interesting hence the reason we decided to visit it. This restaurant exceeded my expectations by far. We will be back next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior

eOK0vd8C6cykUDzyL5V0Zg.text: I went here with a couple of friends and happen to hit the happy hour. We sat at the bar and started with $6.50 margaritas, 1893. The margaritas were super good and the bartenders were amazing, attentive, and funny.  For appetizers we had the guild duo: cheese and guacamole. I liked the guacamole a lot but the cheese was just okay to me. I'd probably opt for something different in the future. We had the Mexican street corn as well, which was super delicious.  We ordered tacos to eat. The bartender recommended the cherry steak and I went with it. I'm not a huge bleu cheese fan but geez.... sooo good! I'd definitely go for those again.

fyhhs50G4qa7wXH5CMX0Jw.text: ORDER THE CHERRY TOMATO BEEF TACOS.  EAT. REPEAT. LEAVE. TRAVEL OVER 800 MILES TO COME BACK AGAIN. THANK ME LATER.  We first discovered Taco Guild on a whim, during a roadtrip from the bay area down to Phoenix and we were craving good food- TG (as we affectionately refer to this place) popped up on Yelp and we came only to discover the AWESOME church structure it is located within... adds so much fun to the already incredible flavor of this place. Ambiance is a huge PLUS in our books.  We were just in Phoenix again this past December and had to stop by again. Always have a good time here- albeit this time we were trying to sit at the high tables and were told by the front desk lady that we couldn't push two of them together that were just 3 feet apart and would not have gotten in anybody's way... and her response was, "we just don't let people push tables together, that's policy" and we saw another group push other tables together shortly after. A bit condescending and perhaps discriminatory but we let it go since we absolutely love Taco Guild. We then were sat by the manager and she confirmed that there was no existing policy for making it illegal to push two tables together and apologized to make our experience much better (mistakes CAN be fixed and rectification makes things better).   Anyways, we ordered the usual which consists of the Cherry Steak Tacos (much better than the coffee version imho) and the street corn as a side (a must). We usually get a variety of the other tacos also just to remind ourselves that the Cherry Steak Taco is pretty much the only one you should order because it's the tastiest, but the other people we ate with also really liked the lamb taco and the shrimp one as well. The chips are always a nice touch as a freebie and the sauces that go with it are immensely delicious and I slather it all over my tacos.  Great place and great desserts as well. All in all a fantastic unique spot to have lunch/dinner and I've never left this place unhappy- highly recommend!

6r1gdU3dTOvN9W7CyDcLMw.text: Personally did not like the tacos here. They were overpriced and the meats were dry. We expected a better taco Tuesday deal too. The atmosphere was okay, but there was a special event so I'm not sure if it's always that crowded. The live music is a nice touch though. Cool decor, good chips and salsa, and strong margaritas. The elote corn was the best item I tried!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SRLvOtEg5ufVqzHdZ2dHrA.text: First time here .. it was super good. We got the fondido, chowder soup, the coffee taco, and all the salsas were delicious. The inside is really cool and customer service was extremely good. The flavor in all the food was just amazing. Especially the corn tortillas were amazing . I also got a margarita which was super good . I will def come back when I visit PHX again .

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rfGpeuGpkovG3f38Dga1Xg.text: Wow! I'm so disappointed and sad! This place is absolutely beautiful and the ambience is all the way there but the TACO's.....No Bueno!   When I order BBQ chicken tacos but I can't taste or see the BBQ sauce, that's a problem for me! We decided to spend our memorial day at Taco Guild.  After reading yelp reviews, we decided to give it a chance.    Yuck.... on the BBQ chicken tacos... lets just say DRRRRYYYYY. The best part was the three different salsa sauces that I duncked my BBQ chicken tacos in.....   Lord help these tacos, please!   The margaritas were the stanard frozen or on the rocks pretty good for $5.00 all day but only for today's day.   Listen I love ambience but I can't eat it... Taco Guild needs to set up there taco game. We live in AZ people..tacos are the staple of Mexican crusine!   Taco Guild missed the mark.....

SGcDGA51d6jiiaZdqEd4MQ.text: Visited Taco Guild with my family when we were visiting from out of town - and love our experience. We visited around noon on a Saturday and had no problem getting a table (we had a reservation, but definitely didn't need it).  Our waitress was great - very knowledgeable on the menu, paced our meal out, consistently checked back and didn't rush us out when we were wrapping up.   We were able to try a few of their guacamoles - we really enjoyed the pineapple mint & jalapeno bacon varieties and they kept the chips flowing during our entire meal.   We all had various tacos - our personal favorites were the al pastor and the chipotle cherry steak. Also - highly recommend getting the street corn!   There is a parking lot for easy parking while you are visiting as well.

-_EZBUUGLoavALJ47AGwcQ.text: We came to this place after seeing that it was advertised as Phoenix's best taco. We were super intrigued. It was Tuesday, so they had a select Taco Tuesday menu with tacos for $2.75 each. We ordered three carne asada, three blackened shrimp, and one chicken taco. We also ordered street corn on the side.   The street corn was actually the best part of the meal. It was nicely seasoned and tasted good.   The tacos itself were okay. The carne asada meat was dry. They didn't serve any lime with any of their tacos. I would rather go to a hole in the wall taco joint for more authentic tacos. Overall, still good. But I wouldn't say it's the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8iFVVmH_X9UY_8MkMMNLcg.text: Taco Guild  a converted Monistery with great decor and wonderful food their house guacamole was excellent the tacos and brunch items were fresh and vibrant.They have Craft drinks and cocktails and brunch is served on the weekends a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut French toast
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody mary

yXR53mCwvKXJ2J5IJ5dT0w.text: Fantastic tacos! A friend suggested this spot for Sunday lunch, and we were not disappointed. We all got taco plates, I got the Guild Chicken, chipotle Cherry steak and the cartel coffee beef. The chicken and steak were my favorites. I also got the Street corn and would go back for that alone.  Chips & salsa were delicious as well, everything tasted freshly made.   We went around 2:30 on a Sunday and the parking lot was crazy. It looks like they have free valet for dinner, which would have been great.   Only issue we had was my beef taco was just one big blob of fat. But I brought it to the waitress attention and she got me another with no questions or problems.   We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 taco plate, from top to bottom - Chipotle Cherry Steak, Cartel Coffee Beef, Guild Chicken. Side of street corn.

NWE7HQrvoFmJX2zw1i6zJA.text: This was the first time I tried Taco Guild and I absolutely loved the food. It was happy hour all day on Monday and the best thing to get your night going is with the margaritas. I tried the shrimp chorizo appetizer and that was a new twist to taste. And tried 6 different varieties of tacos that turned out to taste amazing. To end the night, the tres leches dessert that tasted even greater with the strawberries on the side.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tres Leches
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Carnitas

ips4dpdFxEHz9cVOar5Pig.text: Love their margaritas and chips. They have the best habanero salsa I've ever had. If y'all could start selling it... wouldn't be disappointed. Limited options as a vegetarian/vegan but food quality is . I'm partial to just their bean and cheese and their deviled eggs. Super dope spot with a unique atmosphere.

4zDJe8fflRDPm6FH6XUzPw.text: Saturday at 7pm. The space is pretty but poorly lit and loud. Reading the menu became a game of concentration; the print is small and as mentioned the space is dimly lit. Having a conversation with individuals seated across the table was a game of reading lips or just giving up and nodding to everything they were saying. The food- I had the shrimp bacon  taco and it was okay but $5.50 for one small taco is ridiculous. The margarita below average since it tasted like old bitter lime. At this time I can't see myself revisiting this establishment.

RvBdqDCukU6MoC5M05MPzA.text: The front house hosts were so insanely rude. Like, each one, without fail. Not accommodating, accused us of shirking our bar bill. (We weren't.) The service otherwise was great, too bad for the first ten minutes.   Update: I went back to Taco Guild at their request. Despite the fact that it is cinco de mayo and so busy, service was friendly and quick. Our food was great. It was a lovely second experience at the Taco Guild.

PRbFAaHTFBOshZo4tGI4mA.text: Good place for lunch. Parking is a bear but worth the struggle. Any time a restaurant is able to retrofit an old building they get points in my book. Food is good and the space is awesome. A little pricey for tacos in Phoenix but overall a good spot.

pMbelvjPlD4dKA3VRJV3gw.text: Some of the most amazing tacos I've ever eaten! Definitely try the lobster one! Been here already 2 times within the past 2 weeks

PnaRTcBFcv60Hbs2aNk0Pg.text: We were excited to visit this place as we had heard rave reviews. We were so excited to the point where we had considered hosting our wedding reception here (and buying out the restaurant for the night). We had just moved from AZ to FL but were flying back to look at wedding venues but decided that we HAD to stop off at the Taco Guild. After working with the Events Coordinator she told us to come in and sample the menu.  I have to say the concept is pretty great. A taco restaurant inside of an old church! We came in and sat down, advised our server that we were working with Jenny (the event coordinator) and were going to sample some items off the menu. We knew in advance that these were not going to be your traditional tacos but would have unique and exciting flavors.  We ordered 4 tacos from the Old World section. Once we received our tacos we could see the beef tacos were dripping in grease and our tortillas were completely soggy. After letting the grease drain out we tasted the taco and it was just bad. It tasted as if it had been sitting out in a bowl of grease for hours! After trying all of the tacos we came to the consensus that the meat was extremely dry and all tacos that we tried were lacking in flavor! Such a disappointment! Our server seemed to care less about refilling our drinks or checking in with us. The restaruant was practically empty and we practically had to chase him down to give him our money  I dont get what the hype is about this place. I am guessing that its the unique idea of the taco restaurant in a church? We wont be back and will be looking elsewhere to host our wedding reception.

IccuWOjfd55-J6yJb6gI_w.text: I've been looking forward to this place for quite a long time.  Unfortunately, it was a bit of a let down.  Still good and had some highlights but overall not a recommend for me.  Came with a small group of 6 for a birthday party.  No reservations between 6-8 (the only time you want to make reservations lol).  No biggie we waited briefly and were seated in the corner by the men's room.  Eh...thanks?  We were brought menus offered drinks all the usual.  The waitress was nice but quiet a a church mouse (get it?) and the place was very loud.  She recommended nachos and tamale app so we did it up.    The craft beer menu was legit.  Definite highlight.    The venue is really dope.  Old church redone into a gastro-pub type feel.  Another highlight.   The nachos were weak.  Nothing stood out and they were pretty plain.  The tamale was outstanding.  The sauce, corn, soft masa, everything about them was right.  Highlight.  I ordered a duck taco, coffee beef, and carnitas.  Also shared some of the chile relleno.    The duck taco was hella dry.  Like hard to swallow dry.  Covered it in salsas and choked it down.  The coffee beef was interesting but also on the dry side.  Not feeling either one of them.  The carnitas was decent.  Moist, some good flavors, and tender.  The sauce on the relleno was amazing.  Not what I'm used to in a chile relleno but the flavors in the sauce would make anything special.  Ordered a michelada and it was mad weak.  No spice, no lime, and it was luke warm.  Poured the ice out of my water into it and choked it down.  Pretty mixed review here.  Relleno sauce amazing, tamales excellent, craft beer menu and venue on point.  The rest really fell flat.  Would I try it again?  Maybe?  Would I recommend? Not at this time.

zoahvbCdbtvYeGYU0FreFg.text: Taco Guild was the first stop while visiting PHX. It was that moment of my youth when I desired an "Elote," or I guess the new term is "Street Corn," and they sure did make it memorable.  Spicy, Sweet and a whole lotta Yum!   The day really was, "Taco Tuesday," so how could I say no. They have have a few to taste (more on the specials menu) as well as a "Build Your Own Burrito," which includes a Vegetarian Burrito.  Let's not forget about the refreshing Sangria to leave you smiling.  Perks: Parking Lot, Outside Patio, Happy Hour Specials.  Taco Guild - 546 E Osborn Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85012 - 602.264.4143  Eating Out With A Girl #EOWAG #EatingOutWithAGirl dot com

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. .Elote.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. .Taco Tuesday.

9X51gRDFKUyqXnO3bKFHGw.text: Great happy hour and ambieance on Taco Tuesday. Have been here once before and it is a happy place. Awesome street tacos chips and salsa selections. Had a shrimp and chicken taco....great duo. Place was busy. Service was great. Attended a birthday celebration with friends. Prices were extremly reasonable and a huge surprise. I kept looking at the beautiful stained glass windows, the paintings on the wall and listening to the great music with ample conversation at our table. I will definitely be back. Enjoyable way to end a long work day!

nLiXLB8rnHlGHfKZ3rbKVA.text: Lunch on friday. I told them I hoped to get somewhere quiet they found a place. Good service. I like the tacos. "fancier' than my usual taco purist style but wanted something new and different. If you are going for more than just "good tacos at good price" and more ambience and style.... this place is good.

ycFZLC49w0xc5OYs8lGwnQ.text: I really like Taco Guild. The location is great. Their happy hour is great! The margaritas are my favorite. The food is decent. Best ceviche I've ever had. I like when they have the music playing or a live band. I like the interior of the restaurant, as it used to be an old church. The service is usually very good.

2cAoAalBBiXcNyxwpb7Bnw.text: Service, staff and people here were great. The margaritas, chips and salsa were pretty good. Decent beer selection. Decent happy hour deals. Food was just painfully underwhelming. Guacamole was nothing special. The beans and corn sides were pretty good. However the tacos we tried all sucked. They were bland, things that were supposed to be crispy were soggy. Nothing special about their tortillas at all. For instance the Korean fried chicken taco -- the chicken had the texture of day-old fried chicken bits that you pulled out of the refrigerator and reheated in the microwave. The ground beef taco could have had flavorless tofu for meat and it wouldnt have tasted any different. Just a "meh" experience....Which really sucks because the concept is awesome. The ambiance/atmosphere is super cool. If I ever went back it would be only for happy hour drinks, maybe chips and salsa. No way would I get any of the tacos again...

KRPsfIadBEQpK3e8fdRtbQ.text: The food here is pretty good, but it's extremely overpriced! Every time I go here I am shocked with how much my bill is and the food and drinks just aren't worth that much. But it's a really cool environment and the live musician is they have there has been great every time I've gone!

FKOJJ5iPTceF2u4t-pyNTg.text: We loved the restaurant. Beautiful converted church. We got a burrito and tacos. Everything was good. Service was good. Would go again.

PTvT2acxFXp2eIn9fUaUXQ.text: My boss took me and some others to dinner this week and even though I live 20 miles away I'm going back! My eyes never got adjusted to the darkness but I could see well enough to tell the guacamole was bomb with chunks of aguacate. For sure go with the taco plate. I had the Clandestino Shrimp, lamb, and Al Pastor Pork and I tell you what boy, I was licking the wax paper! The corn is straight fyah on or off the cob. There was no food envy because I was too busy watching my own food disappear! It is an old church and the stained glass is really awesome. The restrooms are clean but they need another paper towel dispenser though. No the bathroom trip wasn't because of the food. It was because of the three tasty beers I had. Yo for real take the trip there even if you live in Chandler.

IYh2UfItuLKaOrsu1lGJ-Q.text: Many people find the 1800's Methodist church ambiance intriguing, I find it a little eery. There are stained glass windows with paintings and pictures of I'm assuming members of the church. It's a cool thought, but a little odd for me personally.  The food on the other hand was actually very good! The tacos were amazing and the street corn was good. If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, this is NOT the place. But the fusion flavors are pretty good. The only thing I was disappointed with was the grilled serrano peppers guacamole. It was not spicy...at all. It honestly tasted like regular guacamole. Our waiter told us it was spicy, so I was really disappointed when it was not spicy at all. We even asked for jalapenos on the side to try to make it spicy by ourselves. Like most Mexican restaurants, they give you free chips and salsa. They had 3 different types of salsa and they were all yummy! I could have eaten just chips and salsa!   Service was very attentive and helpful. The price was kinda steep for me. I think I spent close to $15 for 3 tacos and street corn. But I'd probably come back just because of the unique tastes.   Environment: 3.5/5 Food: 4/5 Price: 2/5 Service: 5/5

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled serrano guacamole
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos with street corn

L8KWMXUUcfE2mCDyeYJbsQ.text: We loved the setting!   A church! Owners found an artful way to interlace the character of the church with a full bar and a dining room! This alone deserves a 5 star rating. So there you go.  But it only gets better from this point forward. A sampler of four tasty salsa with "fresly" baked oven chips are promptly served. The menu offers plenty of choices for all palates. Beef, chicken, lamb, seafood, vegetables at various heat levels. The staff constant attention to our needs was amazing! We were a big group of 24 friends and we were treated with the best individual attention. Best way for you to judge Taco Guild is to try it. You will be pleasantly surprised and you will want to share it with your friends as l an sharing it with you today! Bravo

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

O7Ow9aYk3EvsiX8e5aIQ0Q.text: I love the environment and guacamole. The tacos are good as well but not the best Mexican I've had.

5VfzxReLYV5irmfisMl-Ww.text: Sigh I heard so much about this place. So I was really hesitant on trying it. But I did. First impression. What is this ?  I felt I was in mid evil times and I was expecting knights to come in galloping in horses    Now to the tacos. Had the taco of the day. Some kind of pulled pork with pineapple.  It was a nice sized taco. But the execution was like a child said I want this and this on a taco. Terrible. Taste. Let's just say interesting. Who makes tacos with root beer and fruit. ? It's like they wanted to experiment with tacos. Don't. Tacos are a simple dish not hard to mess it up. But this place managed to do it.   Hostess was friendly and good service. Food meh. Skip or hop and drive past this place.

Q4U6u5pCQYmE9DWFff453A.text: Taco guild is a neat gastropub set in a renovated church.  They have great ambiance, old world murals on the walls. Complimentary chips and salsa was a nice surprise.   They had a range of salsas including a habenero carrot and onion salsa that was nice and spicy.  Our group had the dining room off to the side where the staff was courteous, friendly and attentive.   All in all it was a very nice experience

LXNYW6IhVz2DbA5JnWkrlg.text: Went with work friends. The duck, lobster and fish tacos were on point.  The fried avacado was delicious. The (complimentary) chips we're ok, the hot sauces are 'hot' (the red one tastes like cocktail sauce)

-8SbGZERmoq5mgxo0sok4Q.text: Came here on a Tuesday night, it was super packed and we had a 45 minute wait. Luckily, there was an open spot at the bar and we got to chat and catch up there while we waited. We were seated at a side table, which was nice. The restaurant itself was quite loud and noisy.   We were greeted by our server with a large bowl of chips and four different salsas. Chips were ace and the varied salsas were good...I wasn't thrilled about any one in particular, but was still good for sure. I had the vegetable burrito with a side salad. The salad was yummy with a cilantro dressing. The burrito was probably a 3.5/5. The rice and bean portion was good, but the vegetable part was a bit bland. The corn looked really good. All in all, I really enjoyed the ambiance of the place. Definitely would be a cool place to come back to. They had a small selection of vegetarian options, but better than nothing I suppose!

OeTvYbzkjKdauBK2WWazFQ.text: I have been here a few times in the past quite a while ago and was very impressed with their tacos.  We went this last time for happy hour, there was 4 of us.  We started off in the bar inside and have to say it is beautiful.  It is worth it to go and have a few drinks and just experience the place.   After a drink inside we went outside to wait for our friends.  Unfortunately the tacos were not up to par this time.  We all had different tacos and nobody was impressed.  I had the lamb taco which I had before and remembering loving.  This time there was too much blue cheese on it which masked all the other flavors.  It didn't even have the distinct lamb flavor that lamb is supposed to have.  I was even wondering if it really was lamb!  The other tacos were the shrimp, pork and beef but nobody was impressed with their tacos.  We also had an appetizer which consisted of green humus and guacamole with vegetables and crisp pita like chips.  The guac was all right but the humus was absolutely the worst I have had in any restaurant.  I was told it was hummus, may it wasn't?  Anyway it did not have much of any flavor to it.  They gave us about a quarter of a cup and we didn't even eat half.  Too bad because I love hummus.  Drinks are good here so I would come back for that.  I like that they have a brown ale and a stout because so many places don't carry dark beers and have like 5 IPA's!  I like a good IPA but so many at one place?  Also had some good red wine here too.  Can't complain about the service inside at the bar or outside.  Very attentive & friendly service.  I hope that this was just an off night for them because, like I said, the past 2 times I was impressed with their tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb taco

LD0p9yfFO_N2FvVK70Up8w.text: I was in town with a group of 7 for a work trip. We saw the reviews on Yelp and decided to try it out. None of us were disappointed. We tried the guacamole, salsa, and queso - all good. There was also a special of fried yuca, which was delicious. I and a co-worker had a burrito bowl with shrimp and we weren't disappointed. The tacos were also a hit along with the street corn. To make the food even better was the atmosphere of the remodeled church. If you're close, stop for dinner. You won't be disappointed.

4MOmEKeslwEh1SIHfZGxmg.text: The atmosphere is worth going here. Very cool place in Phoenix. The Tacos were really good but what stood out was the Street Corn. Amazing!!! Highly recommend!   *Phoenix Foodies Approved!

WMEf97ySvjp85p9l6XA9bw.text: I ordered to go for my staff and it's so bad that we are now ordering from another restaurant. They give you such small amount. They should be embarrassed. This is a joke of a restaurant. Lunch menu is ridiculous   You pay 5$ for a miniature supposedly a taco. The food is not worth it. You would be better off going to Costco on Sunday. The sample size at Costco is bigger than this joke of a Restaurant.  On a prior visit we asked for more chips and Salsa  The manager lite relay said it gets to expensive for us. So don't waste your time or money.

70fHbS5rShKjmRUpJ0zj_A.text: Actually surprisingly disappointed in how unauthentic their food is and that they tout they are rated the best Mexican Food restaurant anywhere.  the meat in the tacos was indistinguishably which was a disappointment as I ordered duck tacos - not very authentic but sounded amazing right? - wrong - tasted like chicken, if that even.  i actually had to ask the server what i was eating as I ordered three different kinds and had no idea which was steak, pork or duck.  Boyfriend had the same issue with his food and didn't even finish his it was so bad.  The rice was over cooked and seasoned with not sure what.  and the iced tea tasted like it was brewed with hot tap water.  The one good thing was the queso fundido which was very good and full of flavor and large sliced vegetables.  Oh and the building is amazing.  Will not return to this place though, way better restaurants with actual authentic Mexican food in the area to be satisfied with.

RvjKQRyLXRqbaXRFRfehJA.text: I've avoided coming here for years because I figured it was the next Phoenix hangout 'omg it's awful food but the space is cool' restaurant.   So the space is cool...and the food is is good!   The hostess was extremely rude on 2/25/18 at 7pm.  Acted like we were inconveniencing her by sitting on the patio. She couldn't be troubled by our request to sit on the patio. Service is lacking big time.

uOymleEY1Cba956ffw01ew.text: I bring everyone here! Because we live right down the street, we take a walk for some tacos and margaritas at least once a week. This is just the coolest restaurant in Phoenix. An old church turned into a tequila bar is the best idea. Everyone always loves it. When someone comes to visit and asks where to eat, this is always what I recommend. I wish I had pictures to post! Will add next time. Excellent service, delicious desserts (don't miss out on the flourless chocolate cake) and always a lovely atmosphere, whether you're sitting inside or outside.

DkaMaHV7d7DHLlMQapHNNw.text: Okay so we just wanted to enjoy a nice Mexican restaurant with a good aesthetic. We were greeted by an excellent waitstaff and were excited to eat. However, when our food arrived we were gravely disappointed. We both got the chicken tacos which were cold and had the worlds strangest texture. I got the beans and they were flavorless and my friend got the salad, which was actually pretty decent besides the fact it was made entirely of iceberg lettuce. Overall, not a great experience but to each his own.

rnXF-KyQ5zkwxiwNMz708w.text: What a wonderful surprise. First time here and absolutely love the atmosphere, food, and service. Had the duck taco and trio plate. Way too much but everything was on point! My other family member love their selection which included unbelievable street corn.

JFnSEHL1YxsHjqYEKAuwvg.text: Service was was not great. Waitress was sparse and order was wrong. Food was ok, but not worth the price. Ambiance is what made this a 3 star review vs 2.

SEh-qMivsEzxfo99DSAnHw.text: My cousin and I went there about 9 days ago and overall we both liked it.   - as soon as I got in, I was welcomed and seated with a friendly smile from the hostess.  - the server was, meh, just okay. I really felt that she was absolutely not interested in being there. Honestly if my cousin and I were not in an amazing mood, it would have been a horrible experience. Still, I know servers   have bad days, but the art of serving is to leave your problems at the door, and walk in to work with a smile. And the art of managing a restaurants and servers, is to notice my server is super blah and should be either given a break or sent home to take care of whatever is making her look the way she was. She wasn't rude, she wasn't unresponsive, she was just bland, no smile and sounded like a robot.  - manager (or someone who looked like a manager) did check on us and ask how the food tasted, and I always feel  that's a good touch.  - now the food. We both got tacos, It was good, BUT it was a bit cold. There was some warmth to it, but I'm not sure if by the time it made it to our table it got cold, or if it sat way too long before it was brought to us. I know for a fact it didn't sit on our table for long, because we were both hungry and didn't have drinks, just waters so we jumped right into it. The tacos were chicken, steak, fish and duck and they all really tasted good, but if they were a bit warmer, it would have been AMAZING. Chips and salsa were great too.  - ambiance and location. Parking was somewhat of a nightmare but my review has nothing to do with that, just saying it so if people are gathering to go eat there, they should probably carpool or uber. The location is very good and central and the ambiance is amazing. The building looks like it was an old church or was built that way, and the stain glass windows are beautiful. High ceilings which I love.   Thanks so much for a good (not great) experience and looking forward to coming back for better service and warmer tacos hopefully.

QqqCjvHnC5dz2RqxxPlbug.text: 5 for ambiance & service, 2 for food. We ordered a happy hour margarita (GOOD), street corn (seriously - if the corn you're getting is that small, just remove it from the menu - or give two cobs), house salad (boring - but the cilantro dressing is AMAZING), and a few tacos: shrimp - YUM, Ono - Meh, Steak/Coffee - YUM, Steak/Cherry Chipotle - Meh. The chips and salsa are ridiculously good and I would probably go back to enjoy the atmosphere.

75f2mVM57PdoxkC9VxTwkg.text: Located in a church built in 1893, this place is full of charm and ambiance. It's a bonus that the food is also delicious!

FC-LggAvqS9iArscz7XEbw.text: I stopped in one afternoon and ordered the vegetable tacos.  EXCELLENT...can't wait to go back.

Yf_1WI5l89cSd53DY5DWCw.text: I come here during my lunch break.  They provide you with fresh, hot tortilla chips and delicious salsas as you wait for their tacos.  The serve very unique tacos in the area, and each are worth a try.  It's very difficult to find good parking here on weekdays at noon and it's certainly not because of that Starbucks it shares the lot with.

T5_X4XMxwhc9iEk6JqW8YQ.text: If you've ever worried about going to Mexico and getting robbed as unlikely as that might be you can save yourself a trip and go to the Taco Guild there you will find unmemorable food unmemorable service memorable noise and memorable cost

0mOa5_KedcEZrNMQKfQisw.text: Poorly made food. Cool idea, but building looks like it's coming apart and cheaply made. Horrible parking lot.

l1z3aIAFYUi236SrYkl8cA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Everything about it is awesome! The place itself is sooo cool, the margaritas were great, then the food was fantastic!! The street corn was beyond delicious! Shrimp taco was pretty bland, and so was the guac. But the pork, bean, and cheese taco of the day was awesomeee! Our waitress was very nice! Definitely coming back here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0a_RiYju2Zpja4Oc1t_MEg.text: This is the third or forth time I've been to the Taco Guild. I'm getting tired of small portions, the smallest margaritas I've ever seen, and the $9.00 guacamole.  My chicken enchilada plate: Where's the chicken? and two tablespoons of rice? come on.  It's a beautiful place but that only goes so far.

XDzM30uSuuf3MfBRSIUv5Q.text: First time here and it was great! Tacos were tasty! The corn was really good, my son didn't like the cheese on the corn but we just scraped it off

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EdAenSdi8AZh4tfWJ0Ptog.text: Went there last night to meet up with a friend. Not my first time to taco guild, but our service and experience were so great, I had to give another review. It was packed when I arrived but luckily I snagged a couple seats at the bar and got a hh margarita. I asked the bartender if there were any sort of specialty margaritas for hh, and she said there weren't but she could add things, or make it spicy. I really appreciated that info. I got the basic margarita but spicy and it was perfect! She was SO on top of service and as I was waiting for my friend I could see her scanning the bar constantly to make sure everyone was taken care of. Wish I had gotten her name, whoever she is she is phenomenal. Once my friend arrived we got the guacamole with bacon, yumm! And after a few margs we got some tacos, which came out quickly and were fantastic. Great vibe, awesome service, and fantastic food. I love this place bc it's consistent. I haven't ever had a bad experience here. It's my go to now for margaritas and tacos!

VSnPlIs52LVwAbnJFjjwzQ.text: I thought the food here was fine. I want to start by saying that. It all looked/smelled good, and I would go back to explore if I had friends that really liked the place. For a taco place, they have a good selection of beers.  But, I would also say it's a very hipster place trafficking in food that's "elevated," which I think just means "more eloquently described and expensive." Vegetarians will have the option of two salads, a pepper-and-hummus taco and standard sides (beans, queso and rice, my veggie ppl). If you're there for tacos and down for the meats, there are a few "new school" tacos that might pique your interest, but breaking $5 for a street taco is something I just can't get behind, even if they are created by self-initiated taco guildsmen creating flavors "worthy of the masters."  Real talk, I'll probably go for the "all you can eat tacos" on Sundays at some point. It's got a good vibe for hanging out, I can eat a lot of tacos, and there's a church altar stocked with booze. But I cannot overlook that this place makes me laugh out loud. It is a parody of itself - the hipster gastropub where an exclusive guild of prodigy taqueros fulfill their destiny of re-inventing the street taco into something more perfect not ere discovered, perfectly situated next to the Starbucks and Buffalo Exchange, across the street from the place where a starry-eyed young man fell back in love with the enchilada by redefining it. (Seriously, you can't make this stuff up. It's like they forgot we turn it into poop.)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guac!!!

rE5jzC49YaKBSkj82iASTw.text: Can't say enough good things about Taco Guild Gastropub. For starters the building use to be a church and what was once the altar is now the bar. That in itself is worth some conversation. The food is amazing. I had chicken enchiladas and my wife had  shrimp tacos. Both dishes were excellent. The service was just as good as the food and the extremely affordable prices added to a great night out. We will definitely be back. For those who haven't been there you need to go. You won't be disappointed.

lJvCIs4GqbLFT7eoshiK8w.text: The food outstanding! Service below margin...not even that many customers. Bring your own beverages,you will never see the waiter again.

Jon6LuvSeCVP4AqzesS8hg.text: Great tacos, cool atmosphere.  The house sangria is a little strong but tasty!

T0ULBP3KpWQpxkCXsQhWDA.text: First of all the place is STUNNING it used to be a church and it's so beautiful. The food is great.. I've had almost all of the Taco creations they have and I have to say hands down my favorite is the cherry chipotle steak. Omg. It's amazing. So good I would only get that one now

vLlL-Zcn90-HVNT4dNiySw.text: Love the ambiance and the food is unique.  The only thing they need to be careful of is arrogant wait staff who think they are too cool to really provide good service.

Y-njXwL4iqnSh_DGkxlbRA.text: Fantastic food and service.  Very interesting setting in that it used to be a church.  The have a nice patio with the cool mist setup however it was so hot we ate inside.  Had the taco (3) plate, the beef taco was my favorite.  Our server Julian did a great job and was very enthusiastic.

4c1zzOoshaPqM8gmqEDe4g.text: Great margaritas and plenty of Tequila to select. Friendly staff. I like the atmosphere.

3QtfmnYW_mbl_xYnw90YlQ.text: My favorite taco place in Phoenix. Try the Moroccan lamb tacos they are exceptional and their ceviche. Live music on weekend nights. Great for groups and families. In an old church with Dutch Master paintings adorning the nave. Really cool, really fun, and really great food.

zyADwWtlXNj5znstZPaeiQ.text: My husband and I went to dinner at Taco Guild tonight in spite of the rating I had seen on Yelp. To start off, I would recommend going here...  Saying that, I would advise that it is more of an artisanal taco restaurant, not abuelitas mexican cuisine. I ordered an Al Pastor and a Pork Adovada taco in the lettuce wraps. They were both wonderful!!  My husband ordered the chicken taco and a cherry steak/beef taco (I forget what it was called), and neither of them were fabulous.. The chicken was very bland, and neither taco was seasoned quite right and did not have enough meat in them. He tried both of my tacos, and loved them both. We will both stick to al pastor and pork next time we visit.  We both enjoyed the chips and salsa, as well as the chorizo meatballs as an appetizer. Spicey!! But really good :).  The ambiance inside is nice. Bad music choices, (we both like country but not particularly in a historic church over tacos...), but they have put a lot of effort in making the place unique.  We both LOVED our waitress, and felt the service was great. I am rating 5 stars now because I think this place deserves higher than 3.5 stars... Previous reviews tear the service apart but we have to be understanding of new restaurants--they don't get to choose the country's top 50 servers and hire them for their grand opening.   This place offer tacos in butter lettuce wraps...you don't find that often!! And they were so good, my husband (who is no tiny twig) is going to order them my way next time and pass up the corn tortillas.   We will be back, and I'll cross my fingers my hubby gets meatier tacos in subsequent visits. It's worth a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al Pastor y Pork Adovada a la lettuce cups. So so good!

r9Q-FmU67B3VGyt68YNVBg.text: The food is fantastic. I recommend the grilled romaine salad. All the tacos are amazing. Happy hour drinks are reasonably priced. If it's not too hot, sit outside on the patio. It's very loud inside - too hard to hold a conversation without yelling.

QkHsGq9BjHgw78BvDaHHTw.text: Awesome Building! The atmosphere is so great. I had the table side guacamole which was amazing. Good food, great place.

aumiVO4gdpoEaIbic3hWcQ.text: I'm kind of annoyed at one of my best friends. He's lived here for nearly 13 years and JUST introduced me to this place. Shame on him.  Situated in an old Methodist Church, this place is beyond unique. The walls are flanked by stained glass windows, the jukebox is inside an original enclave of the church where the service songs would've normally been hanging.  It's very unique.    We opted to start with the guac/chips.  The guac was outstanding and super fresh and we inhaled it.  They also had sides of really good salsa, and some much too hot for me chili sauces.  We each got the '3 tacos and a side' deal.  These are not your average tacos. Think more upscale.  I opted for the lamb which had some delicious crispy sweet potato 'straws'; the coffee braised beef which was rich and delicious, and the cherry chipotle    steak.  All were outstanding and my side of corn was crunchy and sweet.  The only 'eh' was the handmade corn tortillas that I wasn't super loving.  They were a little too doughey for my taste, but they did hold up well to the amount of food in the tacos.   Delicous!

TJZIpIsrWPZWtiqxUcYXSg.text: I love Taco Guild tacos with their street corn on the side. Their cherry chipotle tacos have got to be the best on their menu. They usually have great customer service but once in a while you'll get a moody hostess (at least its not the server.) Servers are constantly checking up on you making sure one is satisfied. Love it!

kS1ikwoEDl7-KLGpneUR8g.text: The atmosphere is just perfect. Love the whole look inside  and out. The cherry steak Taco was amazing!! I also tried the pecking duck taco, never had duck before, and it was so good. Almost like sweet BBQ. Definitely going back but his time going with all my girlfriends for happy hour!!! The staff was informative and friendly . Service was fast! Worth all 5 stars.

hIGV2aLiLPVpJDgEfyjjzA.text: Definitely come for the atmosphere. I love the location and I LOVE the way they've redone the old church. Seriously it's so cool! The beer list is short, but all local. The cocktails are fun and inventive (c'mon, how can you go wrong with one named 'these boots are made for oaxacan'???).  I heeded the advice of previous reviews, and did not order anything to eat. But they did bring out free chips and salsa and they were delish! Overall, a super cool place to drop by for a drink or two.

pK_NIb5CMSE5YKCnjV5OJQ.text: The tacos were tasty, the enchiladas were a little heavy on the tortilla, as opposed to chicken. The ambience was excellent and the food reasonable. Parking was a train wreck. The live music was pretty decent and some acoustic throw backs from the 90s. All around a pretty good saturday night.

Fy0hPFRK5TPBSRmhR6OYRA.text: Great food and customer service, just a bit pricey for what you're getting. If the food was better I wouldn't mind the price :)

ryvt4W4T487OJfOx834s3w.text: Our 2nd time here and won't be or last.  If you've missed quality service and attention come here.  The atmosphere is very welcoming.  We had the chile verde pork tacos.. delicious! Margaritas are the best I've had.

MnwFEKIZWgEHyjgMKq4GBw.text: Our waiter was very friendly and very prompt. Tacos were amazing. Everything looked from scratch including the tortilla. Not only were tacos fantastic but margarita on the rocks was amazing.   I would definitely come again. The decor and historic building make it a lovely experience.
