gNePHbiB5iMqr85sB8pNnw.text: Taco Guild has a great atmosphere, and I have always had great servers, but 3 different times now I have been there either with friends or family and its always just been mediocre food.  I always try to get a mix of tacos so as to try them all and every time they all came out dried out, under seasoned and generally lacking in flavor.  I hope they can work on getting the food to match the level of the service and the atmosphere.

JiUiE9niTvhFpCB1qjzrlw.text: This is my first visit.  The Taco Guild is awesome. They are a perfect mixture of new and old, unique and traditional.  In a crowded field of Mexican restaurants they stand apart    The restaurant is housed in a repurposed church. They have used parts of the old and augmented the decor with thoughtful new touches.  They built a giant iron candelabra in the building and have papered the ceiling with reproductions of Rembrandt murals.    The food is great.  They take great care to look after the little things.  A perfect example is their chips and salsa.  They bring four different types of fresh salsa to the table and one is the "chef's choice".    They seated our group of eight promptly and checked on us throughout the meal.  The manager took special care to ensure that we had a great night.    I would suggest ordering the street corn, fresh guacamole, queso with chilis, and any of the tacos.   Happy hour has awesome deals. Come for a drink and the daily special taco.  The last thing I will mention is price.  The food is affordable.  I have paid more for worse food often.  I will visit again every time that I am in Phoenix.    P.S. Awesome tequilas... Order a flight of three and get a Lyft.

57U6f70yFwx0ghmi1D1Gpg.text: I finally made it to this place on a Friday Night with the family and had a great time. Very clean and good well lit parking.  The DJ was on the 1's and 2's killing it lol beautiful hostess and the waitress was really good. She knew the menu really well. $5 Rita's help relax us as we placed our order. Street corn was good and our tacos are really unique and tasty.  Restroom are very clean and private. The manager there was really cool. So with the atmosphere, the facilities and the food with the friendly staff I have to give this place 5 stars. It's a jewel Of a place.

FQrrL_HnXuOHRWxB1EBFqQ.text: Such a great location and space. WOW I love this architecture. But the food is just bland. I really wanted to love this place. We tried it twice. After the same experience with different choices on the menu we realized it's just not for us. We hope they're still fine tuning this menu.

jjXhggtsREobtAf6QdJLww.text: I've been hearing a couple times, because many of my friends rave about it but I'm not sure what they are loving. The ambiance is great and I love the candles, crosses, and all the fun accessories hanging on the walls! Also, I like that they sometimes have live musicians playing in the evening. However, it is a restaurant and the food is mediocre. I have tried the vegetarian and various seafood tacos here and they are okay. I enjoyed the beans and corn more than the tacos. Plus the prices are a bit costly considering the portion size. This restaurant is in my neighborhood, so if I do return it will probably be for happy hour drinks and side dishes.

AowH9l9NTc4TIV4Q0HCjwQ.text: Love this spot. Tacos are great but my favorite is the grilled romaine steak salad. That thing is bomb Diggity! Great atmosphere, great staff, I've always been happy coming here. :)

5G-g1Z7aD9vt9S2DgtV7GA.text: Really wonderful meal. Ivy was a great server. We followed all her recommendations! Best ever!

9YTCiUM5Pl7OYnR9D3oUbA.text: My fiance & I tried this restaurant on a Friday night. It's inside an old church & is absolutely beautiful as you step inside the building.  The environment was fun & upbeat, they even had a live DJ to keep the good vibes going through the dinner.  My fiance ordered 3 taco varieties & I had 2 different tacos, all of which were phenomenal! This is a must try restaurant, you won't leave disappointed!

ZKQe0LLY11scQTdkH7_n7Q.text: FANTASTIC! The 3 taco plate is the way to go (with a side of the most delicious street corn I've EVER had). Altogether (since we shared) we ordered the following: Al Pastor on corn, pork adovada on corn, Guild Chicken on flour, Molida Lamb on flour, and Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef on Flour. We also had margaritas and beer which were also scrumptious. Our server was excellent and the atmosphere was lively and entertaining. Will definitely be back, plus the prices are really good!

CyKGP9tTUXcgJ_BWHU8ogA.text: Sat down right away and our waitress was fast and friendly. The tacos; Peking duck, shrimp, lamb and pork were excellent. The chicken taco was a bit bland, but 5 out of 6 tacos being tender, juicy and well seasoned is not bad. The margarita was pretty tasty. Great atmosphere and friendly staff.

q_fRcIys3hFHGpXzJqcvzw.text: Here on business and drive past this old church morphed into an absolutely wonderful space for having a taco and a beer. No this is not your neighborhood taco vendor. The space is beautiful, I would live there if possible. Sunday has some specials so look at the web site for more info. Do look at "events" too hint hint.  Started with the taco of the day which was a crispy catfish taco. WELL DONE taco guild well done! On to the Al Pastor....yes again a winner! Finally rounded out by the cherry beef something or other taco and this one owns the crown for tacos. Habanero straws, great tender beef, blue cheese.... Hells yes !!! I may update to full 5 stars but I need more exposure

Vh6C1OykxKl9ztfsh8kY2w.text: I still love the food however I feel that the service has gone down hill recently. We used to love the service if the food wasn't good we probably would not have been back based of recent service. We come here about once a week and have for awhile.  We have had one fantastic server recently the rest have been sub par. When the manager Justin was here we never had any problems with service. We will still come back here because we love the food just want management to be aware of the change in the level of service.

Vd20zl_t2qHHbNO9XA1_rg.text: We have been here twice. Our first experience was so enjoyable we had to come back, and Taco Guild has become a new favorite for us.  We met managers Justin and Garth who were both funny, knowledgable, and hospitable. I appreciated that they both visited the table to check on us, and get to know us.  I asked Justin about the history of the church, and what led it to becoming this restaurant. He really seemed to embrace the history of where this building has been, as well as its present, and where it is going. It was nice to hear that the former congregation has been supportive of the transformation. A lot of local memorabilia has been donated and is on display, including pews for seating. It is very community driven here from the decor to the draft list that is all from Arizona (I liked the Porter). The stained glass windows offer great lighting, and the atmosphere in general is vibrant and fun.  They have so many deals here. Happy hour M-F from 2-7, and 11-6 on the weekend. If you order 3 tacos, you get a side for free. They offer all you can eat tacos (I think on Mondays) DJ on Fridays, live music on Saturdays...  The first time we came was a Friday night, which is a louder, adult setting. Lots of fun. Our second time we brought kids at 5:30 on a Monday which was much more calm and quiet. They don't have a kid's menu, but they made us a chicken and cheese quesadilla, perfect.   Overall the food is flavorful served in good-sized portions at a great price point. The new Ono taco was my favorite with a delicious coconut slaw, and the grilled Romaine salad was filling and tasty with the shrimp.  Taco Guild is definitely worth checking out, and we will definitely be back!

eYCeruKX6bhR9wklo5vQFQ.text: To whoever made the ceviche,  I swear we must be related,  lol.  Great job Taco guild,  amazing

-Om7X_TsJQ-D1aay_JIVBw.text: Great food!! Beautiful atmosphere!! I love  this place and would definitely recommend!!! I apologize to the staff the yelp gave no indication that the kitchen closed at 10 yet the dining room open until 11. I felt like an ass ordering food so close to kitchen closing.  Dulce was an amazing server and took great care of us even though we came in close to 10.  Thanks Taco Guild for an awesome experience.

r9tlHzBnMo1JuJilaYDHWQ.text: We were very pleased with happy hour and our bartenders. Our bartenders were dealing with a crabby customer and I feel bad for them. They treated us great and service was on point. Thank you. Once read DJ was too loud and we sat right in front of him at the bar and music was great and didn't stop our conversation.

zUnbD2zX7rqXE6P51vqOsg.text: Skip the sides and go for the tacos! I had the lamb and steak tacos! The rice was a bit dry. I'll try the beans next time IF I don't go for three tacos. The salsa is also legit.

1Qo92QZI9mFKzC-JXgC1LA.text: Lunch time. Was at a friends house and he suggested the Taco Guild.  What a neat place for lunch. Worth the trip just to see the inside of the old church it is located in. Beautiful stain glass windows.  Now for the food? I got three different kinds of tacos. Don't remember but I think there were about 8 different ones to choose from. These tacos were what I would call street tacos. I may be wrong with my definition but that is what they reminded my of. Lot of other stuff on menu but only tried the tacos. The ones I had was good. I will definitely return. The service was good and everyone was friendly. Their lunch pricing was very good for the quality and quantity of food.  Now the bad. As with most of the new places it is noisy. Hard to carry on a conservation with the people that are with you. Maybe if you can't talk to your lunch partner you hurry up and eat and leave, making room for the next people??? Anyhow I will return as I like the old church and the food.

Xhf4LDeaahT127DHDGrXHw.text: The atmosphere was good, the old church had a very 70s western feel, but the food was merely ok. Don't misunderstand me, the food was edible, but not really anything to write home to mom about.

48E083NWboz8-BTX7sMmFA.text: Way to over priced for what it is. Food isn't that good. You're better off to go across the street to Gadzooks. You'll get better tacos at Los Taquitoes. Service is super slow and they act liek you are bothering them.

2EYXrwlMa4gUNx1UtQBtOw.text: Usually I'm slightly skeptical after a see I restaurant on TV but in this case it lived up to the hype. From start to finish all was good- deviled eggs, guacamole, chorizo meatballs, ceviche, al pastor and duck tacos. Their beer list is also made up from local Arizona breweries and the beer I sampled was great. The church it was located in was really interesting and the service was great...

JVwMl5CKsStx2NXip-pweg.text: We were starving when we arrived in Phoenix after a long flight. We found the Taco Guild and could not have been more pleased. Fast service, very friendly, great margaritas and the food was wonderful!  As if that wasn't enough, the building is BEAUTIFUL and we just enjoyed it all after traveling all day.   I'm hoping that won't be the only time we have a chance to dine there, maybe we can squeeze it in before we head home to the East Coast.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gorgeous!

t4VVdFMPGcS9RtgB8JEQbQ.text: My favorite happy hour! The queso dip/guacamole/margaritas are all spectacular. Fridays tend to be very busy, I'd recommend coming on a weeknight or for reverse happy hour instead.

vIe8iaHjCx7qg8C9JB_7mw.text: Went with a large party of 10 (2 being toddlers). The wait staff and manager were great about accommodating the kids and service was prompt for being peak hours at around 6pm. Food was incredible. Beer selection is awesome. Good happy hour that ends at 7! Decor is amazing and if you have the budget they have over 200 types of tequila. Will be back!

3waInz0UVEyl3LYcH4dYQQ.text: The atmosphere is awesome and the food is not quite to my taste but it's clean eating. The manager is really nice and accommodating to the guests.

B-dr44jimd_-F3y6_iY9WQ.text: Excellent tacos very distinct and unique flavoring and street corn is addicting: atmosphere is old church and they have got an awesome job on maintaining the authenticity and the Margaritas are wonderful!

d72mhCuAN63sEyUWclqVUw.text: Without Yelps help I would have never found this hidden gem. I have driven by the area so many times and didn't know this was even here. . It is such a cool and unique place. Great band and even better service. Tried various tacos and all were great. Tried the house margarita and it was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco Trio.

AxngTeevzdYjzcPjWu--hQ.text: I ate here for the first time the other night and ordered two shrimp tacos, one with the lettuce shell and the other with a tortilla. They were delicious and the perfect temp when they came out. My guy had a duck taco and a chicken taco and raved about them. We each had a house margarita and they were very delicious! I'm looking forward to coming back. This old church is absolutely adorable and the stained glass windows are breathtaking! The only reason I didn't rate five stars is because the music is just too loud. Great music choices but very hard to talk to one another. Everything else was perfect! Will be back.

9QppqAwtpzjSghJok5gQHw.text: Always a great time and the staff is always great. The atomoshpre is always lively and on Friday & Saturday they have a live band.

0SnJKFH0ppzvkF7vJvqmuA.text: Bomb food, amazing chips and salsa. Everyone is nice and the atmosphere is great. Guild chicken taco with the flour tortilla is a must try. Skip the flourless chocolate cake. It's pretty much a bitter sweet hunk of fudge, not crazy about it

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best damn chips and salsa. Everyone here is uber nice and the atmosphere is awesome.

fcBLZtndaPKw6NE4qSS5zA.text: Fun selection of tacos - interesting flavors and something for everyone. The guacamole with jalapeno bacon was frickin awesome. Also loved the street corn. Margarita was fresh and flavorful. Awesome atmosphere. Definitely will be back.

9aYo3C-a8JGO3vXTwyh6NA.text: Love the Ambiance here - the OLD church with stained Glass windows is   a large part of the amazing features - creates a great atmosphere - service is wonderful and tacos are fabulous  Love the Vibe

ND--Ysgjt5MDkjL2GCrvYg.text: Happy hour lasts until 7 and is great for drinks but only food item on the menu is the taco of the day.   Have to get taco if you come (duh). All were solid but in ordering chicken, pork and beef thought the beef was the best.   Is a really cool building which I am sure would make for a great location to take an out of towner.

f0qla3eO47sIjj1ka7OpSw.text: I love coming here for happy hour. They have discounted prices on beers and drinks. Plus they have a happy hour taco that are usually get four of them.

Ltd-Oq59bu3sKKXRaKfn4A.text: This was my first time at the Taco Guild.  We had an excellent and knowledge waiter.  The atmosphere was awesome and the food amazing.

73QLIjM0WktMenis4cURJw.text: Was really hoping my kids and I would enjoy this since I have been here a lot and always enjoyed it. Not so much today. Waited 20 minutes to get seated because the servers were busy which made no sense in a half empty restaurant.  They put us in the back room which was fine except we were sort of forgotten.  A server other than ours handled the other bigger table and we never were offered drink refills. My kids asked for knives and one of the ones she brought had dried food on it. Flies are definitely a problem and  I saw others commented on that. One set of the tortillas my kid had were undercooked but couldn't find a server to assist. Sadly we won't be coming back.

XIu2k78PJ2hp-aZAzWvlYQ.text: Really good tacos with unique flavors! The pork one has a nice cinnamon tone to it while the mahi mahi has a delicious sweet sauce. Also, a clever concept of the looks of the place!

e6y9YfX32sm-eqN4oRF7Ww.text: Do you like Tacos? This place is awesome and their prices are even better.  I really liked the service and how quickly I received my food.  The best part was the beef tacos with extra cheese!  What a great place to enjoy some family time and great food!

HGhbBo7HysWAEgWzE6nPNA.text: The food was prepared very well, great flavor with some bite but not so hot it wasn't enjoyable. The restaurant was an old church at one time so it made for a very unique dining experience. Stained glass church windows and a bar that fit very well with one another was very cool.   The service on the other hand was just mediocre at best. My biggest complaint was the server kept forgetting or just plain forgot to bring us what was asked for. Although this didn't make for a great overall experience, I would definitely try it again with the hope that the service next time would be much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Xy3OHy1bKDkbzVyOrrBsGw.text: I've been here several times and tried many of the tacos. I usually go with a group, but I have gotten tacos to go too. I think they are a bit overpriced for what you get and not all that flavorful. I do understand it's not authentic Mexican food. If you stick to the taco of the day, it's much better on the wallet. I do like that you can get a corn, flour, or lettuce cup for the taco. The frozen margarita is tasty and stronger than the on the rocks version.  The Bad- My last visit was with a large group of 15 people that was called several days ahead to reserve on a reverse happy hour Friday night. We had to wait 20 minutes to be seated while we all stood by the door in the way, but our tables looked ready the whole time. We never got refills on our waters at all. It took a long time to get a drink order. And we waited an ENTIRE HOUR to place our food order. After that service was good, but that first hour was awful. I will likely not be coming back.

6uOo1b23YHYRLOu4eDxXVA.text: Amazingly friendly service! Beautiful venue! Food and drinks were fantastic! Live music was really great! Busy Friday night but food came out in a very timely manner! Tacos were so flavorful and we will definitely be coming back soon!

5FDKfBl_RXKMnfz0UASJfg.text: I really want to like this place but the food is too inconsistent and the service is highly dependent on what waiter you get.   It's almost like dining here for the first time on each visit. You have no idea what the al pastor tacos will end up tasting like. The homemade corn tortillas taste like homemade garbage. Pray that the waiter remembers to ask if you would prefer flour tortillas. Hint: you do.  The only bright spot is the Mexican street corn which is probably the unhealthiest thing on their menu.  I am almost embarrassed at how many check-ins I have at the taco guild. I have a theory that the prime location is the  only thing Keeping it in business.  Stay away

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot garbage

nr1Ud0wIvLQfTD3UIyTcmQ.text: Always good service and great food. The salsa is really good and they keep it coming. They have a main red salsa, and three on the side - jalapeno, habanero some other pepper I can't remember. The habanero has some kick, so watch out. Oh, and the chips are perfectly crisp and warm. Seriously, great chips.   For food, I always get the tacos. So far I've had almost all of them and have yet to be disappointed.   The atmosphere is good, not great. Church pews line the exterior with small tables throughout the room. For those who like the outdoors, there is a small patio and I'm told it's great at night.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa. Great chips.

qFPqHQFbYh2UD8RRSCaHMg.text: A good selection of tacos. Many of them strike at something new and not quite traditional, but are still rooted in Mexican tradition and make culinary sense. The mixed drinks are on point and not too expensive.

Yy3Xv9ynIwcQZ78tQhxCGA.text: This is a pretty awesome spot! Food is great and really hits the spot when I'm in the mood for street corn. I've had some odd/forgetful service a couple times but not bad enough to make me stop going. The patio is nice and gets you away from the louder crowd inside on busy and live band nights.

8jYxGHINtZxz_e-ZwFJ8Gg.text: First time being here and i am absolutely love this place I met with Selena and Aaron very cool people

r88mP0LmzSQx4T5kiOjS-A.text: I'm actually from Chula Vista which is like right on the border in San Diego and we have like crazy authentic tacos there! Too Guild is NOT authentic! BUT that doesn't mean it isn't delicious, it's super experimental, super out of the box, and definitely the tastiest tacos in Phoenix.   I know I sounded high and mighty up there but believe me when I say if you want good greasy tacos  don't go here, but if you want an amazing and artistic experience disguised as a taco? This is the place.

kBfmk_uh33Tyt9Qtb6RPAA.text: Errrrr my gerd!!!!!! I have been to a lot of cheesy just awful taco places in town that just throw up some fancy decor and expect stupid people to show up. This is not that place. With top notch service from the bartender and even a manager and busser that went out of their way to make the experience amazing, it really make me feel like the bell of the ball! I recommend this place, like I recommend making love to my wife, do it if you get a chance.

yehuatgMVP1aQyxYZBGNUA.text: I have no complaints about taco guild. The tacos and margs make me so happy. Their selection of salsas also do it for me.

wvFBpJcW_iSgGHpnjfwoAw.text: Simply amazing customer service. Good is great and the drinks are just as amazing. I little over priced on the food but well worth every dollar.

hymCsy5_vFI6l9QI6S75qw.text: Great place to hang out with friends or family that are visiting! Been here a lot! Tacos are so good! They have complimentary valet which is always great as parking has been hectic every time I visited. Servers are usually nice! Food is amazing!! Dessert is great! I'll keep coming back to this place!

i4JLJvWuZmMrm2Vf7URscQ.text: After thrift shopping for a while at Buffalo Exchange (the store next door), the boyfriend and I got hungry, and I happened to be craving tacos the day prior so we came here! Immediately I was drawn in by the architecture and how the place looked.   The waitress came by with our waters and salsa and chips. We were both hungry, so we ordered the ceviche as an appetizer. It was so damn good. Fresh. The chips served with it were warm, and delicious. (I wish I took a picture because it was so, SO good) Then we ordered our tacos. I'm a pescatarian, and he's on the keto diet. So it helped that there were lettuce wraps for his tacos, and veggie friendly ones for me. I ordered the Yucatan shrimp from the New World Tacos and the Grilled Seasonal Vegetable from the Old World Tacos. Once they came, I ate the shrimp one. It tasted kinda sweet, kinda hot but mostly sweet. I wasn't crazy about it. Then I fell in love with the vegetable one. All the flavors were happiness in my mouth. And we ended our meal with Fundido! The aromas were great!  Everything was pretty good, and plus, we heard good things about this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yucatán Shrimp and Grilled Seasonal Vegetable

ztRwqOx-U2fIqdVZXgcOwQ.text: Went there around lunch time and it is a great place in terms of the concept and scenery. Drinks are good, but no wonder my buddy and I were the only poc's Mexican people there. tacos are super expensive for their taste.  You are def paying for the exclusivity and spot aesthetics, not for the food.  corn on the cob is $4, a taco that looked that came out of an Isadora heated bag $5 ...doesn't do it for me.  Advertidos chicuelos

lnwEYwU7bBRkldQgajXxLg.text: Great tacos here! But this time I ordered a salad, the server recommended the Romain salad with blue cheese!! It was so good and huge!!!! I felt like I could never finish it!! Also got margaritas, since they have happy hour on sundays til 7pm!! $6.25 each! Yummy!  Server was nice!

l_2ayjnioT7Q_xrFhWIxGg.text: Came here by myself while traveling on business. Interesting place. Decor is an old cathedral. Staff was excellent. Lively atmosphere. Ate at the bar. Chips and variety of salsas were really good. The tacos were also good. Recommend.

cOkXmocN9ef7LvGXqox66Q.text: I love this restaurant, being in an old church is a unique and fun atmosphere.  The food is yummy and the margaritas are amazing.  Try a strawberry mango, frozen.  The street corn is delicious and my favorite taco is the cherry steak chipotle.  The habanero salsa is the best and if you are there for brunch try the plantain pancakes.  The staff is great, especially Eden, she is super knowledgeable about the drinks and the menu and is super friendly and attentive.  You can really tell she loves what she does and does great job taking care of her guests.  Thanks Taco Guild for the wonderful food and experience.

zZ5gFdWoi8tyQG26uDK-3g.text: Amazing steak burrito. Great chips with a variety of salsas. The tacos have some interesting flavors to them so you want to be prepared for that before you order. The seating inside is beautiful with chandeliers and bar area. Highly recommend!

Y8WGjUjwY5ZxGMN-Qwkpog.text: Based on the reviews, this place sounded amazing unfortunately, I was extremely disappointed. For starters, there is a sign posted stating that staff may not pet dogs on the patio which was great because my dog is extremely shy. However, every single staff attempted to pet my dog. Secondly, my glass was absolutely covered in filth. It looked as if somebody filled it with salsa, poured out the salsa, let the cup dry, and then filled it with ice and water before bring it out. The food was very very underwhelming. The rice and beans lacked any sort of flavor, my taco was cold, the meat was definitely unseasoned, my side of veggies tasted like week old canned veggies, and portions were tiny and overpriced. Truly, the most flavorful things were the chips and salsa. Definitely do not recommend!

hHZMsfQbPwSruPysthV2Lw.text: I LIKE Taco Guild. Maybe it's that it's located in a repurposed church with a lot of the interior features intact; the bar is where the former altar would have been located, now backed by an impressive array of Tequila bottles to admire as you decide on your food.  The bartenders and servers are engaging and friendly.    Admittedly, I've only ordered the Street Tacos ( categorized into "Old World" and "New World" ) on each occasion I've visited and, thus, can't speak to the rest of the menu but I have not had a bad sample yet. The Yucatan Shrimp, Guild Chicken, and Chipotle Cherry Chicken stand out.  Usually there is a Taco of the Day to choose from as well, which varies. The 3 salsas provided with the tacos vary in intensity so you can choose your favorite. The basic salsa served with the chips is also pretty tasty.  The margaritas are tasty, but not really above average; just pretty damned good. I find the frozen version tastes slightly better than my usual "on the rocks, with salt" preference.  Taco Guild is a great place to hang out at the bar with a few friends, imbibe your favorite cocktail and enjoy the tacos.  It's earned a place in my regular "rotation" of hangouts.  Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frozen House Margaritas. Mmmm
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frozen &amp; On the Rocks. Goodness!

QzaLq3z0mvfzDRRLOpaZ_g.text: Taco Guild is located in an old church, which was very cool. A nice change of pace to the restaurants in strip malls. I got the Street Corn (elote) with no habanero butter because I have no spice tolerance. It was really good. I also got a shrimp taco on a corn tortilla. It was simple and flavorful. Overall I'd recommend this place!

F-I7wSyXQ7dhrQIvVK_d6g.text: I've been hearing about this spot for years and somehow had never come! We were in the area and stopped in at 2pm on a Saturday. Pretty mellow besides and bridal party.  They had a Dj playing which was pretty cool! We got the guild trio with guac hummus and cheese dip. The hummus was too salty for me, but they came with these fluffy chips that were bomb.  Our server Shawna was super help attentive and had awesome rainbow hair she answered all of our questions and made sure our drinks were never empty.  We will definitely be back soon :)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2KWE_VhSADghh34iVfwTWA.text: Solid 4.5 stars. Ambiance is amazing in this converted church. Live music was great on Saturday night. Cherry steak and lamb tacos were really great. Guacamole was pretty good. Duck and pork tacos were a little bland, but they do have a nice salsa selection to help in that regard. We'll definitely be back.

7CY5TYplXplXlP4D1luOIA.text: After last night, sadly, we WON'T be coming here again.   We had been here about 6 months ago with family for the first time and all had a great time and really enjoyed the food and service.   Last night...not so much. Really, it was the service that was the worst. And if management is reading this, we dined out on the patio around 7pm, the table nearest the door, and our server was the taller man (not Julian who was taking care of the birthday party and whom we wished was taking care of us). Oh, I also left a note on my 'merchant copy' of the bill so hopefully you saw that too.   I won't go into a whole narrative here, but our experience from the brunette hostess at the front door to the server we had, it either felt like it was too much for some people or they just didn't want to be working last night. Service we received was cold, unfriendly, impersonal, felt rushed or stressed, not an environment I wanted to be in after working a long hard week and wanting to go out and enjoy some good food, drinks and atmosphere and spend my hard-earned money. Plenty of other places we can actually feel welcomed.   The food was okay, but not as I remembered it from last time. I had three tacos: braised beef was really bitter, lamb dry, adovado forgettable. I opted for the side of mexican street corn which was so watery I wondered if I was eating canned corn. Beef enchiladas were dry and in much need of more sauce which I asked the server for more chips and salsa (best thing we had all night) in order to pour the salsa over the enchiladas.   All this time, we kept hearing Julian (I hope I have his name right) get seated new tables and how he greeted them, introduced himself, was polite and friendly and thinking to ourselves, "Damn, why did we get stuck with this guy?" He should NOT be a server. He didn't even so much care while he was pouring water or setting things down on the table, spilling and knocking stuff over. It was oddly intense. I couldn't even look him in the face by the end of the meal, just get us out of here!  We were going to ask for another server but my trust level just wasn't there in not having been served our food yet and we didn't want to make it worse.

7777kM0jVMH-9LDz_Oj3LQ.text: Get the duck taco!!!! Hubs and I both got taco plates so we could try 6 different tacos. Hands down favorite was the duck with the Cubano a close second, pork chicaron was very good as well. Great local beer and fantastic service!

NgOJd3Tsegioer7raa-oRA.text: It's a church, it's a restaurant, it has tacos, and margaritas too!!   This may be one of the coolest places I've been to in Arizona! Quite frankly, I wasn't expecting it to live up to the hype! Yet, I was blown away. Food is phenomenal, drinks are amazing, service is outstanding, and vibe is great!  The service: From the moment we pulled up to the restaurant, we noticed how great the service was! First, there's complimentary valet! Not only was the valet complimentary, the kid (teenage-ish) was super friendly and polite! We sincerely enjoyed meeting & chatting with him. Once we walked in, our hostess seated us almost immediately and we were able to choose seats without waiting! Our waiter was also very sweet and made great recommendations.  Food: I haven't had good street corn since we left California ..that was until we came here! Holy moly, the street taco trio and  corn is to die for! You are also able to mix and match tacos to your preference.   Ambience: The place used to be a church! It was turned it to a restaurant but they kept most of the decor. The altar is the bar! Being a Catholic, I wasn't sure how I would feel about taking shots in the father's house..but hey , he sees me taking shots everywhere ;) As it used to be a church, it's a bit dark but super cozy. There are stained glass windows and ton of  candles everywhere!  It's such unique and cool place! I HIGHLY recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The entrance
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rq5Sjr55IVnzNR2_JwYVkQ.text: Many thanks to GM Sammie, the wait staff and the musician for exceptional attentive treatment of my dear friends and I to a fantastic birthday dinner.  From the tequila tasting, selections from the Tequila Day menu ceviche appetizer, the scallop and watermelon entree, and regular menu items including the street corn, avocado fries, caramelized pineapple guacamole, lobster tacos, duck tacos and finishing it off with coconut cream pie - Bravo chef and we look forward to many great experiences in the future

qy1lBwOmWhhVngEnf72l0w.text: Taco Guild's setting is awesome and unique (in an old church), but the rest of the experience left us hanging. The staff was a bit dry and unwelcoming and, while certain items were great, the rest were just average. There wasn't a huge taste distinction between the different tacos..I couldn't even really tell you which ones I ended up liking.  I wouldn't say no if a friend wanted to come back, but I would choose to come here myself.

kSuXIInp6W2dpiothvI84g.text: Taco guild was FREAKING AMAZING. I stopped here for dinner before my flight and I wasn't disappointed. I ordered a bunch of things because I couldn't decide after reading the yelp reviews. I got the tostadas, the yucca fries, and a steak taco (the one with the crispy jalapenos and blue cheese. They probably thought I was so fat but I COULD NOT STOP EATING. I devoured the taco in 3 bites because it was so juice and had so many flavors going on! I was able to slow down on the tostada because it is truly loaded with chicken and and beans and salsas that you kind of need a fork rather than your hands. It was amazing. Then I got to the yucca fries and I honestly had to tell myself to stop because I could've eaten the whole plate. The aioli that was on them was amazing and I was so full after. The waitress was very kind and kept my water filled the entire time. I also loved the decor and dim lighting. My only complaint was the parking. It was complimentary valet but I didn't have cash for a tip on me so I didn't want to use it. Fortunately I waited for about 5 minutes in the car and someone pulled out of a spot for me to park myself. I would definitely come back with a group!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak Taco
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tostadas
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yucca fries

K_I4ov5KoQMtzhuI-unfBg.text: Really like this place, went for my birthday lunch and got some tacos and street corn.   Oh and did I mention it's in an old church! My favorite religion is taco Tuesday so this place was right up my alley.   Margaritas are good too and this is definitely one of my favorite taco places in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Fx_R9R1c-D0mOcfWoFC9YA.text: A group of 20 of us had the pleasure of eating at Taco Guild today for lunch!!! The food was delicious.!!! The ambience was great at this is set in an old church. The staff was friendly and always on top of checking on us. The do have a quesadilla but it's not on the menu. You can get it with ANY meat. Omg it was the best quesadilla I've ever had. Also their queso dip was the best I've ever tasted. I can't wait to back and try there dinner menu. This is a place you HAVE TO TRY!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House salad with no meat added! Delicious!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadilla that is NOT on the menu! Best I&#39;ve ever had!!

oDzxOGqTnFRkztMjTIx5gg.text: Arrived at about 6:00pm, they offer valet parking but didn't use it because we were lucky enough to find a spot in the lot right away.  The hostess greeted us right away and placed us at the perfect table.   Then, Rayven, our server, arrived at our table at the perfect moment, we provided our entire order, avocado fries, tacos: lobster, shrimp bacon, etc, and desserts: mango flan cheesecake and coconut cream pie.  Drinks: Holy Grail margarita and a flight of tequilas.  Rayven was right on top of everything we needed...Best Server in Phoenix!  I can't say enough good things about her...she's that great!   The food.  WOW!  The BEST EVERYTHING.     I'm not a religious man, but I said a small thank you prayer after this feast.   Ah-maze-ing!!     Now all I have to do is talk them into allowing me to build an apartment add-on so I never have to leave.   Taco Guild, will you marry me?

nurw8pcscSLdcvH3mymRpQ.text: What a restaurant! So fun to explore the inside of a church with beautiful stained glass windows. There food is delicious and the mexican corn is my favorite! Tacos are delicious and they do lettuce wraps as well. I recommend the lamb and al pastor tacos. Also the pineapple mint guacamole is one of my favorites!

wk4CifRgNnkV-p7khmeTuA.text: A mexican? restaurant with good ambience. The restaurant was built inside a church building so the inside is very traditional, they have a nice patio area too. Food was okay, I wasn't impressed. Was disappointed since they advertise vegetarian and vegan options but when asked, we were told they only had the option of four veggies that they'd basically use as filling in any dish we order (beans,squash,pepper,corn). I got the veggie enchiladas and hubby got the smothered burrito.. wasn't as flavorful, rice was salty. Guacamole could have definitely been better. Savior: frozen house margarita.

lrnFT3WGzN7S4nmCN9rRxA.text: Delicious! This old cathedral is full of history. The stained glass and old church pews really take you to another time. My husband and I got the 3 taco deal each (and margaritas of course). The Al Pastor taco was so good. As was the taco with chicken in it and the taco with a cherry steak were great. We devoured everything on their homemade corn tortillas. There were complimentary chips and salsa too! Our server was great. He was quick and attentive. Overall this is a fabulous establishment. We'll be back the next time we are in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary salsa! Yum! Warning: the yellow and green salsa will scald your mouth! Leather lips only!

rpXMcERhJ0_6pNHdh2Gn5A.text: Meh, 3rd time here, enjoyed it first two times, this time sucked, won't be back for a while, need that coffee beef taste to leave my mouth! Server got everything wrong, forgot the kids drinks, forgot my daughter's meal, got my order wrong. Margarita was basic b*tch, Costco's ready made ones in the two liter bottles are about the same quality, I recall it being a lot better last time. Owner/boss guy asked how it was, wife let him in on our disappointment, I typically don't complain, I just don't return.

KNRJl_25Ch_BtxXPFN_z5g.text: I've been here twice and have not yet got good service. The food was just fine. So go for the extensive tequila menu and average food.

6-4J8BeSLZiruxRpeOamsA.text: Provides a very dynamic offering of non-traditional taco offerings like Peking Duck. However, the portion size offered is not substantial and will require multiple orders to satiate your hunger. The ambiance of this restaurant is what sets it apart as the building was converted from an old church.  With murals and stained glass, it would be the ideal spot for a sunny Sunday brunch.

m4gu8aGnyCMgvhD8-z4MAw.text: Ok if you read the reviews before trying a new place  you must have read that the happy hour menu is subpar and that is an accurate statement. Their tacos are good but nothing spectacular and the service was below mediocre. It can get extremely loud in this place where it can be hard to have a normal conversation with your dinner guests. However their decor is pretty cool if you ask me it is an old church turned taco establishment. A few highlights include the cartel coffee beef tacos and the elote as well as their salsa.

ifnwBqRzpkE4wO--7OJTPQ.text: A couple of times here so I could tell you all about it.  First of all, the tacos are not good. They're bland, meat is dry, and they lack any great flavor profile.   Second, if you sit outside, expect the service to be slow. Two times here sitting outside because we like the fresh air and it's a lot quieter than inside, but we got pretty spotty service.   The last, redeeming quality about this spot is that their chips and salsas, dips, and appetizers are good. We only come here for that. The drip trio is satisfying, tasty, and plentiful. The corn is always fun to enjoy.   Come here for appetizers and drinks, get your main course elsewhere is what I'd recommend.

4zFKC3V6unPHAuGeRqi3tA.text: Location; north west corner of Osborn and 7th st - the restaurant being remodel from an old church to restaurant is gorgeous, amazing decor.   Food; Came during brunch hours and decided to get the Chilaquiles- so delicious Taco Guild has their own swing on trendy Mexican food. Dish was large, very good.  The dish is served with not a ton of sauce, is recommend ordering additional which would make it perfect.    Service; was friendly and always ensuring our drinks were filled.   Super cute place, I'd definitely give it a try.

nlCFDhkq4OTZvmcZVe-F-A.text: Overpriced tacos. They make their own corn tortillas but they seemed undercooked and definitely underwhleming. We got 3 tacos: lamb leg (the worst, and $7?!), Al pastor, and shrimp) and white sauce enchiladas with shrimp, which were bland. Had to ask the waiter to refill water as well when it wasn't busy. Really disappointed because this place looked promising but didn't live up to its appearance.

G_lwNGx2tJRMveQrnuVFnQ.text: This place was great for Mother's Day. Delicious food, street corn was my fav! The tres leches was yummy too!

KTf9-4SLZ1PBSqjccb6W6w.text: Thought we would check this place out after seeing them on TV. Decor was cool since it was a converted church. Food and service were great too. We ordered the guacamole. I had the chicken enchiladas and she had the chicken burrito. Will definitely be back.

cUg1_P3syCoeh4xWXadObg.text: I've only been here twice so far. The food is good. However I have had better tacos. The street corn was amazing. The margarita list is very good as well. The atmosphere is great...an old church with stained glass and huge ceilings and artwork. The acoustics can make it difficult to hear your party as all the noise comes together.

a6I5Xe2kgJJYVVkd71mFzg.text: Our experience at taco guild was fantastic. Rhiannon really made it memorable. She was very proficient, and accommodated our large group with separate checks/ different timing. She made great menu suggestions, and is an irreplaceable asset to the taco guild team. Thank you! We look forward to our next experience.

jTuYJ-WKKe70cRHl43DHBA.text: The lamb taco is the TRUTH. Service is always on point. Great spot for lunch or dinner.

pR6GW64Xzw6NPbltk0JrTQ.text: I really wanted this to be great, I was looking forward to going...  I love the building..  We go in on a Tuesday night, it's not too busy. The hostess was immediately available, and asked if we wanted to sit inside, outside, high top, low... So far so good... And then bam... Screeching halt to the good experience. One of the disgruntled servers rudely stops her from seating us, to gripe at her about a small group that was waiting outside. (Mind you, there are plenty of open tables) He actually took the menus from her, and sent her away to go clean off a table outside!! He was standoffish, and had no idea where to seat us because he interrupted the hostess from doing her job, so he takes us over to a dirty table, so we can stand there awkwardly while he cleans it off, seats us with no menus, and not another word. BAD FORM TACO GUILD.  Our actual server came up, and was apologetic, offered us an appetizer on the house, which was a very nice gesture, and you could tell he was trying to make up for the debacle that we dealt with when we walked in. The meatballs, are interesting, the duck and steak tacos are delicious, but ultimately, the food isn't good enough to cover up the half a** service and the unusual mix of country music and old school hip hop that is playing...

w01wLzKwAJK4W0xr4xy3ig.text: Acoustics are not great, so ask for a table in the old foyer if you actually want to talk with your dining companions.  Otherwise, enjoy the guacamole.  Even if you don't want guacamole, order it.  It could change your life.

WiUwiXdvEVWecCdsosihKw.text: Fantastic!!! ***********  The biggest sales point about Taco Guild is the cool building.  Its everything you've heard about on other reviews.  A wonderful inner city rehab. & preservation of a Church building that has been made into a beautiful restaurant!  The very unique features from the stained glass window and old woodwork with large overhead chandelier are very nice and different than other food places serving traditional az/mexican fare.  Super bar setup with tons of local beers specialized margaritas & a tequila menu to be challenged by only a few!!    The food is great. The price even better with the daily taco 1.99 special each along with the drink specials it's a great meal at a shockingly reasonable priced chow!!  Large selection of specialized taco's  that are made like high end culinary tacos.  They all have unique and wonderful flavors with the combinations.  When was the last time you had a lamb or duck taco's.  They serve 4 types of salsa all hand made in the kitchen that are all very unique and excellent!  We had the Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef taco.  The Corn on the Cobb was off the hook as Guy would say on TV. Very classed up place too. Justin was the manager and he was super with us as first timers and offered a lot of help and conversation on the menu and tequila's in the guild.  Super friendly staff. The ambiance is top-notch and they have a very nice outside patio that has a cool mist setup too.They have sourced AZ things like beer and raw items from local farmers for their current produce! That alone makes me come back for the tacos all the time Justin has a great management style and I would suggest coming during a happy hour off time when less crowded like a Sunday afternoon!  Can wait to bring my Norwegian family here for this outstanding well priced food and drinks!!!

ghVInT5Ife0jtlzlrhL71A.text: This is my neighborhood go-to for food. AMAZING lil tacos (chipotle cherry steak is my personal favorite) and their street corn with habanero butter is out of this world.   This is where I bring friends and family who come to visit! The quirky fact that the restaurant used to be a church makes for a beautiful and intimate space, while still pulling off a fun, trendy vibe. Comfortable seating inside and out is the cherry on top.  Service has always been outstanding. The servers are always friendly, going above and beyond to make recommendations, even conversation if they're not too busy.  Could not recommend this place more! Perfect for all ages, almost any occasion.

Id2jYQAfGb3-V-wOOe6FUQ.text: Incredible tacos and a great atmosphere! My favorite is the lamb, but everyone I've tried has been superb.

ct99ngRzJb_KWdLYinVklA.text: Everything was very good. The drinks are yummy and the tacos I got (chipotle cherry steak and el pastor pork) were amazing. Favorite is definitely chipotle cherry steak. Husband said his beef enchiladas were good but not the best he's had, but he liked the flour-less chocolate cake dessert, which was really rich and reminded me of a chocolate mousse instead of a cake. Well be back for happy hour for sure! Our server Sam was very sweet and attentive.

FID1N8JQGLNs6QbZFP-K_Q.text: Decor and building are really cool. Bartender was friendly. Tacos (snapper and pork) and margarita were meh. Complimentary chips and salsa were delicious

-8DQ_mjK2fdF4qX4IN75PQ.text: I've been wanting to check this place or for a while,  so a friend and i went for dinner after work.  The tacos are so  creative,  all of them tasty and delicious in their own way. You just have to see for yourself which ones soak to you and your tummy.  The service was AMAZING.when i say amazing i mean I've never had better service,  attentive,  nice but unpretentious.  They even have us chips and salsa to go!

QBquvV5cGgKsXa71M9OYQg.text: Such a cool atmosphere!! And the food and drinks are amazing! Highly recommend the Bloody Mary on the brunch menu! They have weekend happy hour which is awesome...we will definitely be back soon!

4tQJf8gWr8GDReLggbUykg.text: Great brunch burritos. Makes you feel the Hail Mary you might secretly seek on Sunday's.  bartender is fab.

vmQk1e5cOTDCFfkHqpJ5fw.text: Love Taco Guild. Great Happy Hour, Tacos are spot on, great drinks and beers as well

U_78pkdYKY2uYsPsmJp4wA.text: Eclectic in its own way. It use to be a church, also fun to see the different plates on table. Good food.  Good selection of tacos. Even for vegetarian there are good choices. Good house drinks. Because of the open space does get noisy. But will return for the food.

nfGNlHkDD9yyU9PSkVl9nQ.text: Great happy hour, good margs, tacos are good but ask for the tortillas to be grilled up before they bring them out, sometimes they are cold :/

Z3yScGZCOqJcYa2u3pXhKg.text: I hate to give you guys such a low score cause the food is fresh. Service was good. But I just don't like your tacos. Guess I like simpler flavors. I don't get the salsa. At first I was excited to have 4 kinds. Two kinds tasted like tabaco. The corn on the cob was interesting. I didnt love the sauces on it but I didnt enjoy the corn.  Now on the other hand if you like gastro pubs this place is cool. If you want tacos not great. If you want an adult beverage this is a very good place to hang. Sorry for the low stars. Cool bar. Not great for tacos.  Some I am sure will disagree with my review. I recommend trying for you self.

mjLZyQuQ_j-nlLrXveBMWQ.text: I went to Taco Guild expecting to love the place but unortunately, I was rather disappointed. Expecting a hefty wait at about 7pm on a Saturday, but my buddy & I were seated at a patio table right away. The space itself is excellent; cool concept & well thought out. I ordered a $10 drink of which the name escapes me, and that was tasty enough but really not worth ordering again. Service was attentive & prompt. The requisite chips & salsa were quite good and I liked all the varieties of the trio of homemade hot sauces that were brought to the table too.   Now for the problems: I ordered the taco trio, which includes a side dish. 1 braised beef, 1 al pastor, 1 duck, achiote rice for my side. The braised beef: flavor was fine, but it /literally/ smelled like a barn. It was difficult to reconcile its' decent taste with its' terrible smell. The al pastor: the pork was almost white, with nary a hint of chile or pineapple flavor; almost to the point of being simply a pork taco. It wasn't awful or anything, but it just wasn't anything resembling any al pastor I've ever had. The duck: stringy, dry. If you've had carne seca & know the dried, sinewy texture it has, this is about all I can compare the duck to. Duck is considered a bit of a 'luxurious' food, but this didn't stack up by any means. The achiote rice: the rice tasted like it came from one of those Uncle Ben's 90 second flavored microwave rice packs and was left in for 60 seconds too long. It was dry & gritty & the corn in it was wrinkled & devoid of any moisture. The rice just had that processed sodium bomb texture & taste to it.   I wanted to like Taco Guild, but 4 food items ordered & 4 strike outs don't bode well. Maybe it was just an off night; I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and try it again. If it's bad again, I won't return & won't recommend it.   One more thing: whoever has control of the music in the place needs to be fired, and fired like.right.now. ALL OVER THE PLACE. Bad nineties stuff like Blues Traveler, R&B, classic rock and multiple country music songs on rotation. I'll readily admit that I'm a pretentious music elitist, but I can tolerate most stuff by just tuning it out. Country music, however, just makes me ill. Besides-  country music at an urban, younger crowd taco shop...  Why? How does that even remotely fit in w/ the customer demographic of a place like this? Nobody there wants to hear country crap piped in to this old church building.

1bVbaqwilYXdntetJ4DkIA.text: I'm late with this review, so can't remember all the details. Despite the name, don't come here looking for authentic Mexican food. It's a trendy restaurant that uses mostly tacos as the medium. Nice large space, well decorated, homey feeling. I had 3 tacos and my wife had two. Sorry, we can't remember the filings, but mine would have been fish or veggies. Just not memorable, and at $55 total, is a bit pricey when we only had one or two drinks.

23WfVrsAMJawKKYbrLMzAg.text: Love this place! All locally grown. Good Food. Reasonably priced. And I love that instead of having a church/building go empty they used the church for their restaurant. Def. A place I take out of town guests to.

B274BWs7LyI3UyaOchctow.text: I work in this neighborhood and eat lunch or dinner here at least once a week. The staff is always welcoming and amazing at getting food out in a timely manor. They have come to know me and always get my food out quick because they know I'm on my lunch break which is very thoughtful.  Food wise the daily taco is always the best for me!

lyfMXQFfrF8U06omGyrXWQ.text: Food is amazing. Atmosphere is amazing. Very loud, be ready to not hear everyone at the table. Amazing beer and drinks.  And let's be honest. Affordable specialty tacos in an old church... = win++   The service was not the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love it.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This place rocks!

gaFPt2uVmEp3JPIrDGuCig.text: Love the margaritas here! I like to add a Chambord floater which is like the cherry on top! During happy hour these delectable margaritas are $5! Their unique flavored tacos aren't to skip either! Tacos are usually about $4/5 each, so catch them during happy hour! They have quite the variety of liquors. The salsas weren't made to disappoint either.

YC9DX2BC2GAb1gC_ZUORFw.text: Tacos are nice fancy if you're looking for the taco with twist it will satisfy your needs. Some of the pairings need to be reevaluated like the duck doesn't need a sweet sauce and the lamb needs a sauce to compliment the delicious meat. Guacamole and signature drinks are great. Please take note: they don't take reservations so don't be douche and draw attention to your conversation because the manager is just doing job and being ethical.

eWi960heRp4QXGAqGT-TOg.text: This place is cool, great ambiance, speedy food, & nice menu variety. This place prides in service, no joke... Just believe me, I know how to spot it. One star off only because it looks like a full bar restaurant, but they seem to be pretty limited to the specialty drinks in the menu and were not much savvy out of it... but they do know their tacos, so it's all forgiven. One thing I would recommend to the cook, owner and servers for a greater success... Bring the food to the table. Hot food on the table is serious business for Hispanics, so if you're anywhere close to the business of Latin food, you need to take that very seriously too.

PiiRASHWjC4hua6QxzSCxA.text: Been wanting to check out this place for a while and the reviews we're positive.    Overall, it was an "okay" experience.    Food taste:  3 (started off great with the meatballs.  Then ordered 4 tacos - meat lacking flavor.  No bueno!)  Service:  3 (nothing special as other reviews noted.  Had to wait a while for a water refill and they weren't even busy)  Price:  3 (not real value for money at almost $4-5/Taco)  Venue:  5 (cool building, was a church I suppose.  Holy one probably left because food sucked)  The most IMPORTANT question of all?  Would I go again?  NO.    Ironically, a friend of mine went there two days after me and also didn't think anything of the place.

iEhXkS6yu8ITky7IbWCivQ.text: Went on a Friday night during Happy Hour - which was our mistake; because we were looking for a quiet dinner.  We asked for the quietest part of the restaurant and the hostess was happy to accommodate.  Chips came with a selection of different fresh salsas - that was a surprise.  All were very tasty.  We had the chicken enchilada and it was very good - not too much cheese like so many places.  Also, ordered the fresh guacamole which was excellent.  Staff were friendly and helpful and the place was hopping.  Wish I could go again - not sure when I'll be back in Phoenix.

WDjVpHPy9XhDzga75AiWnw.text: First time visit to this place and unfortunately, it didn't go well.  I was cut off in the parking lot by one of the restaurants OWN Valet driver, who was parking a car in a spot that was NOT designated for valet parking area.  I had to end up parking across the street due to lack of parking spots.  Upon entering the restaurant, I asked for a manager. The manager that came to assist me was "Bo".  I explained to him what happened, went outside and pointed out the employee, and also let him know it was my first time at restaurant and it was not starting in a good light.  Bo stated he was going to speak with the valet employee.  I went back into the restaurant to join the rest of my party and sat at a table.  The manager NEVER came back to me for a follow up, nor did he apologize for the incident. I will NOT be returning to this restaurant. Not only was the customer service lacking but the food was not worth the aggravation.  The lack of attention to the matter on behalf of management was unprofessional and not the type of restaurant I want to give my money to. BE CAREFUL WHEN TRYING TO PARK YOUR VEHICLE

rogFjMy2vMskTUWtixeWjg.text: The bartender was great, most places when they get that busy the service starts to suffer, not here. Food was delicious and the atosphere was very nice.

fUyFOZCehoCV6XhBc9pGyw.text: I don't understand the hype. And now Guy Fieri has been there so the wait will be even crazier. Much better food, for cheaper, available in the area.

H3aV4eIzwnKpehD71s3sOw.text: SO GOOD!  Wow. Got the shrimp, chicken and fish tacos. So much flavor and sooooo good!  HIGHLY recommend!

OkoGtgrN0qSq9Fxaq9VJrg.text: I didn't expect to love Taco Guild so much. Came in for happy hour and had the street corn which was delicious. The habanero butter with the chipotle mayo were perfect together. My boyfriend ordered the Guild Duo which came with chips and two dips (guacamole and cheese). Sooooo good. The cheese dip was so good you could put it on anything. For tacos, we ordered the al pastor pork, yucatan shrimp and peking duck which we enjoyed. My boyfriend did comment that the pork was a little dry. There are definitely better mexican restaurants in the valley however, Taco Guild scores high as a whole. You can't beat the ambience, the $5 margaritas and the BEAUTIFUL church-turned-resto. We will definitely be back!

YXwbMChMxCNDWVL6ao-wjw.text: The tacos are very delicious and creative. I recommend eating outside, the acoustics inside the restaurant aren't quite right. I highly recommend the cherry steak taco! The shrimp taco is really good too. The green salsa mixed with the main salsa is really good, otherwise the other salsas are really spicy.

hEGS4W3gJmTOkkqrsJ4o2g.text: The place is pretty awesome walking in.  They took an old church and remade it into a taco joint.  I hated their meat in ever taco I got, it was bland and not cooked to perfection the service there was slow and it wasn't even packed at the time. I would personally give it 2 stars, but my partner enjoyed it a little more than I, but as in every opinion they are totally subjective so go check it out for yourself and give them a rating.

62JIqCPfU1yqSE7SJwfGFg.text: Ahhhhmazzzinggg! From start to finish. Superb. Prickly Pear sorbet to finish my meal :) We had a party of 5 & sat on the patio on a spring night. WONDERFUL SERVICE ASHLEE.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pfsVoneEgPZ2ptspXQOSNQ.text: Taco Guild is the bees knees. Salsas are pretty dang good and have good flavor and a nice kick. Tacos were also very tasty! The corn tortillas are nice and thick and don't break on you (yay!). A lot of the ingredients are sourced from local businesses, which I think is super cool and makes me feel good about being a consumer here. Low key and positive atmosphere, informal but not cheap. Also - service was excellent! Our server, Jon, was totally chill and attentive and made the experience that much better. We will definitely be back!!

bDsYYBd24Psh3pzb1MPBNg.text: Awesome food, service and venue!  The tacos are, my husband says, the best he's ever eaten.  My sister, however, ordered the salad and that's supposed to be their #2 seller.  The chips are not greasy and the salsa is yummy!  Got to try this place!  It was a church before AZ became a state and the decor is so pretty.  The inside light was installed and then the structure built around it!  It is huge and so beautiful.  The servers were all awesome, but Kris was our favorite :)

THaGrGZYec8LUoH8TOi7Lw.text: Super friendly staff fantastic raspberry frozen margaritas! Really cool and amazing building love the location!

SIcT-3DEJQ5NdQipSRoV6g.text: This church reconstructed and turned restaurant is a very fun place for a date or to bring family. The tacos are creative, the cherry steak is one of my favorites. An absolute must is there street corn made Northern Mexican style with Cotija cheese. That baby is to die for. If tequila tasting is your passion, you have to put this place on your list.

80LC0Rgm19ZedeZ8TMjvRg.text: First off, the environment of this place is off the hook. It's a sweet remodeled old church building with stain glass and all and it's just got a super unique feel to it.   I myself had the al pastor, and the braised beef, which I honestly didn't think was anything special. In fact I've had better 2 dollar ones. However, I had a bite of my brother's lamb taco which was dynamite, and the cherry something one, which was steak and that one was amazing! So it was those two that salvaged this place, in my eyes, from being a cool place with overpriced tacos.

ztWY1IO_j1Sq_-UDNk16yw.text: Been here twice while traveling to AZ for work (live in CA). The ambiance is great and the food is pretty good too. I'd definitely get the corn as a side to any meal whether it be tacos or another entree.  I give it 4 stars because the food is pricey, but given its one of the better restaurants in the area I understand the price inflation.

73ScYGYy_VQd6HEnQ1amqw.text: Honestly a little overrated. It's in a cool church and the tacos are good. Not the best but good. It's trendy though, so I hope that fills your belly.

BgGhU1nQKyFkQ3E810OjbQ.text: The restaurant manager is a complete prick with an entitled attitude. Karma always has a way of working itself back to where it belongs.

HbT_4SaAh8e_9xDljBbrig.text: There sangria and margaritas are awesome!! The corn and guacamole are tasty! Love the decor

s5H9YOR7d1aMl9ZgBHMPVw.text: Beautiful locale! Overpriced a bit. But being that I am an avid supporter of local businesses I give them a poor for customer service! After contacting them  they said only patio available, i showed up with my 89 yr old parents from Sun Lakes on their outing, we were at the door when we were given a $5 off token, sorry you cannot come in due to a wedding, asked if my parents could just peek in at the restaurant, was told NO !  I commented on their facebook this same comment and it was erased with no response. ......

1rdBta4SbJr63WIrWSRGhg.text: I was driving by and saw what looked to be a church but it said Taco Guild.  Tacos in an old church?  Sounded cool so I pulled in and parked.    Taco Guild has very interesting and innovative tacos.  I only had two.  The Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef taco with caramelized onion, mango,  jicama relish, and Cotija cheese was fantastic.  What great flavors.    I also had the Yucatecan Shrimp taco.  Again very good and not too spicy, which is a problem I find at many restaurants.  They bring out chips, which again are good as well as several salsas.  I found the main red salsa to be a bit watery.  I believe the orange salsa may have been a habanero salsa, and there was an avocado salsa I believe.    Nevertheless, with the fantastic atmosphere inside and very friendly waitstaff , I am giving this place 5 stars.  Highly recommended!

HDxcqGOv-F39NxCUshpw0Q.text: The husband and I checked out the Taco Guild's happy hour after yoga the other day. The happy hour is alright, it includes a 5$ marg, discounted beer, and discounted shot of tequila with a beer. Additionally, there is a special on the 'taco of the day' (2$). Pretty slim pickings, but not terrible. We each got a marg and we split a taco ( just to taste it). The frozen margarita was STRONG. It tasted like straight tequila. Some people may like this... I would rather it have more flavor. We had chips and salsa with our drinks. They bring out 4 salsas... one large container of red salsa and 3 small containers of other spicier salsas ( one tomatillo based, one orange sauce that tasted very acidic and maybe was made with habanero?, and a pink looking salsa that was spicy and tasty). 2/3 of the small salsas were good, but so small they were hard to eat. The large red salsa was terrible... it tasted like marinara sauce... yuck. The taco of the day was a pork taco with onions and peppers... Our server couldn't pronounce the name and I don't remember what it was, but it was fairly good. The meat was tender, but it was a little overly oniony. I would consider coming back, but it wouldn't be my first choice in town for tacos.

WURXO_zwS5HpYwiNXg6Fkg.text: My wife and I are special needs customers (TLC requests for diet, etc) and happened into TG this afternoon. You know who we are TG:) The menu is a tasty cacophony of VERY creative southwest items  Marian could not have been more gracious and helpful throughout our menu item search and tasting. She is a budding litttle superstar.   Justin, who should be the Manager, is a fantastic ambassador for the TG Brand.  While we did not find a nirvana meal today, we know we will on our next try.  When an establishment  has a Team who walk and talk the same message, you know that Ownership has a culture most establishments only hope for or dream about.   AND- What an immaculate re-purposing of a beautiful little church.  Impressive!!!

fISEznI9CzoW-NljADIreA.text: Cool...tasty tacos and the best hot sauces I have tried..looking forward to many more visits.

G_CdYxVwfiko1ckb9N0Ndw.text: Delicious, everything fresh tasting, the veggie taco is yummy, had the chicken taco, also really good. Awesome atmosphere, love the fact is built from an old church. I will be back!

LhNT0_epqzuUZ2u6mQVpLA.text: I was very scared to try the tacos here since I come from a Tex-Mex taco background where tacos aren't sweet. I was very impressed by the taste of the tacos! I'm already recommending to others!

Y_L9FgzCGLT9Wg0Jk4IUcw.text: Had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on a Friday night, great pretty tacos and other good food and DJ there. Great atmosphere to wind down after a hard day of work. Nice cold beers and well drinks too. Saturday, there was live music and the local talent was good too. Lots of TV's to watch sports and enjoy some drinks and food. 5 stars and will highly recommend and pay it another visit when in that area again.

fssTwwmVQjCFbVFA0snOqg.text: So good, it's sinful! I've eaten here twice, and really looove the rustic-gothic atmosphere. The tacos are really good but a bit pricey. Each taco is about $5 and they're not that big:  they're traditional, Mexican-sized, not American-Biggie-Sized. With that said, either the Old World or New World tacos are tasty. The bar is almost full-service and has some interesting liquers. The margaritas are the best I've had outside of San Diego and quite potent, which is the way I like them. The chips taste homemade as do the salsas and hot sauces. Me gusta muchisimo!

Sv5hHJednuQqPFArvT6qpg.text: This is a really nice concept restaurant by ZTejas. The taco selection includes old world tacos (i.e., traditional chicken, beef and pork) as well as 'new world' tacos (i.e., duck, snapper, shrimp and lamb). Also, I like the fact that the partner with local growers and use quality organic ingredients in their food. On top of all that, the restaurant is in what was once a church and they utilize a lot of the original decor and pews. How cool is that?

3qMLlimNUh7aeCkth0cWwg.text: Love taco guild. Best guacamole in az and huge portion.  I like the original one but have had the one with bacon and jalapeno as well which is very bacony. Can't go wrong with that. Unique combo but seems to work. Favorite taco is the steak one. It's bomb and they put a ton of stuff in there tacos. Definitely one of my favorite mexican restaurants in az. Great food, always great service.  Salsa also deserves a shout out. Super good.

EJMv2NaaDMoz9RcvcYn3YA.text: Just yum.  Food was incredible and cool atmosphere. Oh and 2 for 1 mimosas on the weekend - I love the excuse to have the second one!

AO8j-U3sYBhnT8kIcNEnfA.text: I love this place. Food is delicious, I love their tacos. Have tried pretty much them all at this point and haven't disliked any of them. Good margaritas and delicious corn on the cob! The ceviche is fresh and the guac is good. The atmosphere is especially cool. Looks like an old church that was converted to a Mexican food restaurant. Stained glass, funky furniture and art, and  cool dishes! They also have a great private back room that I've used for a company dinner. Worked really well! Fits around 20 people.

-56L9d2fmqmT1x41a1PaGw.text: Beautiful building, great margaritas, and delicious food.  The bacon guacamole and queso fundido was ridiculously good, as are the salsas.  I probably should have stopped there, but decided to order three tacos with the Mexican corn on the cob.  Needed to be rolled home...

gylhmapJelWilkf9Oqivdg.text: This place was recommended to me by someone in SF, CA and he wasn't wrong. The tacos are awesome, margaritas are a bit strong (that's not a bad thing!), and you cannot miss the street corn (recommend getting it off the cob).

eczOvLHJ--ArqE6KOKtR8Q.text: Food is great! The ceviche was awesome, spicy and fresh. Tacos are great! The place is an old church.

WozqytjWU5a1VvhY6QwHwQ.text: This place was for sure interesting and I think everyone should try it just once but would I go back? Probably not. First off their menu is tiny, I felt like I had nothing to choose from and it's extremely over priced for what you get. Also we waited almost a half hour for three tacos and burrito. The food is okay but it wasn't anything to rave about. I remember liking the rice but I did not like their beans at all. I had the three tacos and all were ok but it wasn't anything amazing or that I couldn't get for much cheaper elsewhere. I don't have a lot to say about this place... It's an interesting environment, clean establishment, the service was friendly but the food isn't worth the high price; overall it's not a winner for me.

1VEkpIcM0aimvWJJKOkUDA.text: Went to this amazing Taco church on Cinco De Mayo. It was so busy, but the handled the door well and the hostess was very accommodating. We actually found seats at the bar after stalking it for about 10 minutes. The bartenders were great and excited to have new people sit at the bar. I had the 3 different types of taco (al pastor pork, duck, and cherry steak) and my boyfriend had 2 tacos and the street corn. I'm so jealous that I didn't get the street corn! I know for next time I might just get corn. I've been here a bunch of times and can't wait till I can go back!

KVJFRy5RwbWgGF4012AO3Q.text: I love Mexican food. I love architecture. I love tacos. I love creative uses in re-purposing cool old architecture. Taco Guild, you have impressed me when it comes to my aforementioned passions. Could your tacos be a bit more flavorful and offer some spicier options? Yes. Could your use of an old mission as your restaurant contribute to a loud dining experience? I know so.  Nevertheless, one does not simply visit Taco Guild and forget the experience. It is definitely one-of-a-kind. I was stunned by the beauty of the interior; they did an amazing job with the space, even re-using pews as benches along the walls, and incorporating beautiful stained glass. I totally dig the fact that this piece of land was purchased for $30 back in the late 19th century and was used to build this church!  A "guild" is the name here to signify that they are expertly passionate about tacos, tequilas, and using farm-fresh ingredients from local farmers in their food whenever possible. There's a righteous amount of fresh-made guacamole options, for about $8. I highly recommend the Grilled Serrano variety to add some smoky pepper love to your guac!  As far as the main attraction, the tacos, let's get real. They're authentic when it comes to size, preparation, and griddling of the corn tortillas. Some people have mentioned, and I agree, that there isn't nearly enough spice or flavor as expected with some of the preparations, but I suppose now that you, dear reader, know this in advance of visiting, that you can ask for extra spice. Tacos can be ordered individually, priced from $3.95 to $4.95, and served on your choice of house-made corn tortillas, flour tortillas, or lettuce cups. If it behooves you, you gotta go for the corn tortillas here.  If you're feeling extra frugal as well as hungry, order yourself the Taco Plate, where you can elect tacos, and earn yourself a free side item. Not into tacos? What's wrong with you? Just kidding, they have build-your-own burritos as well as a small salad menu, but I only saw tacos, sides, and guac orders at every table, so clearly this is why people come here.  Speaking from personal experience, the al pastor pork taco, the molida lamb taco, and the Thai snapper taco were each rad in their own right. I would like the chance to try all of the taco varieties here, with maybe some extra something-something picante! Regardless, the prices are right, the service is good, and the atmosphere is unique and awesome.  Oh, and the tequila selection? HUGE. I didn't have the opportunity to imbibe, but the tequila/margarita list looked impressive!

cWZGyXsEERCoSGlhRFl2Ag.text: Revised because they do have excellent enchilada's... & the grilled corn is really good. The tacos are great & the salsas are real. Try the grilled Cesar Salad or the enchilada dishes. They are also excellent.  Happy Hour is a deal. Do not miss this place.

IFbfV4ScDxX3fgMelQ8zfA.text: I arrived at the restaurant today with my family after a 40 min drive to try this place out . As we walk up we were stopped and informed that the restaurant was currently hosting a wedding and that they only had their patio open but unfortunately they had no tables open . I totally understood and began to talk with him He felt terrible that we had traveled so far so he gave us coupons for our next visit and even recommended another restaurant near by . As I was about to leave he calls ius back and introduces us to the manager Garth who was very sorry we drove out so far . He said he would accommodate us and make room for a table on the patio . So we stayed !! And so glad we did . The street corn was delicious as well as the duck tacos . The service was excellent although it was a little hot on the patio . Garth the manager came back to our table and he even took us on a quick tour of the inside . The place was a church and totally beautiful inside . Stained glass windows add such a great vibe inside . He even bought out a sample of the meatballs we said we would order on our trip back . All in all it was a great experience we left stuffed and so happy . Kudos to Garth the chef me the young guy at the door Sorry missed his name ... Great staff Can't wait to go back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nuZhrdOgaJ3R_sgdzedHcg.text: Fresh, modern slightly upscale Mexican food. Very clean, cute place. Refreshing misters outside on outdoor seating patio and generous tequila list! I accidentally spilled my Mimosa and the wonderful waitress brought me a new one asap without me asking. Garth is a great friendly manager.

7-Txp7Rtzyzm1y9C1b6cUQ.text: I try to get to taco guild at least once a month. I love the atmosphere, decor and some of the best free chips and salsa you can find in the area (keep a lookout for the orange salsa ). Sometimes the service is a little slower than normal but it gives you plenty of time to enjoy the house margaritas!

lQj_wTTbu8zHuf3gqQMr_g.text: The tacos are amazing and small enough to try a few different ones and not break the bank. They do a great job pairing food items.  The place does tend to get loud. Speaking of loud. Not sure if it's a new thing or I just don't go later on Saturday nights but what the heck was up with the Techno dance music?!? We ended up sitting outside because the music was so loud and not a good mesh with dinning. I wasn't sure if I should get out my glow sticks or not. Stick to being an amazing restaurant not a rave. = )

4jH4NNt5Ce94aHjQL9AJUQ.text: just finished dinner amazing food service was great Haran nothing but great things to say about him and the food  def worth visiting again when in the area try the myth drink or the blushing senorita also cherry steak tacos are on point

L0eitjTleh_46dEWg6qTDQ.text: The Taco Guild is one of the most aesthetically awesome places I have eaten! Trendy, hip with a cool vibe. Set in an old church there is gorgeous stained glass, old paintings and equally older pictures. You just feel the history around you while you eat the amazing food! The food is delicious and is served in an upscale fashion with spot on plating! If I could I would give the Guild 10 stars!

KZgKbJZrKsKMARPuDylfWA.text: Great atmosphere, inside an old church. Offers indoors and outdoor seating. Full bar with local beers. Free chips and fresh option of salsas. When it comes to ordering tacos, there isn't a bad option. So many unique options and flavors. Highly recommend the Coffee Bean Beef, yes I said coffee bean beef.   Great for family and kids too.
