High chairs and kid options.   Friendly staff.

69wIOmuCU4jf6nJ8QEr6ew.text: Service is always iffy, so that's why I'm not giving a solid 5 stars. Food is great. The al pastor and coffee rubbed beef tacos are the best items on the menu, in my opinion. The diablo deviled eggs are worth a try for sure. I am not a huge fan of sausage, but they're good & the sausage comes from a local shop across the street.  I wish there was more consistency in the salsa as well. One bowl will be full of flavor and spice and the next could be watered down and taste like nothing but tomatoes. If they could work on that, I'd buy it by the tub and bring it home with me.  There is no kids menu, and everything packs some heat- so unless your kid only wants a cheese crisp, this isn't the place for them.  All in all, worth a stop. Would like to receive better service, or at least have it be more consistent.

WI8x5xYoccFrZY5IefnyKg.text: I've been here many times and have ordered many things off the menu. It's always been great every time but the last few times it seems to have lost the consistency. The salsa didn't taste fresh and the taco's were very watery. But if this place is good, it'll blow your mind away. So I will keep returning.

dtJzeS8fWwJ9npob1drTKg.text: Lack of flavor, no hot sauce, poorly cooked meat. Great service, the actually restaurant was pretty cool. Admired the structure.

8Ah9bLODDTJFKO-v2GH3xg.text: Delicious food and Great Service.. I love the tacos here they're DELIGHTFUL!!!!!!

jw4OOnq_8H4ICeoBA6vEXg.text: Great atmosphere! Old Church restored into a excellently themed restaurant. The food is INCREDIBLE. Always too much - not a bad thing! The endless chips and salsa are the biggest incentive to visit in my opinion. Sometimes it's hard to get the staffs attention, but the food and atmosphere makes it worth it. Get the street corn! Great margaritas too!

pSUbY4wWEvU2Mqu9GDrkpA.text: A $5 dollar taco may seem far fetched, but I'd honestly say it's the best taco around town...cherry chipotle steak taco is the best my friends., order with guacamole bowl and some margaritas...

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary chips and salsa, margarita, guacamole bowl....so good

oq6_oklSZG5FO0EsOWex5Q.text: Best food in Phoenix after days of convention bland food. General manager Jason was so friendly. Waiter Alex really knew the food and made superb recommendations.

OdjGvN6W4lwsR5BaqjuxrA.text: Take me to Church! And I don't mean Eric Church ---- Fantastic coming back here for sure.  We tasted tacos, enchiladas, and the Corn.  I'm from Nebraska I know my corn --- this is the best I have ever had!!!!! YUM

F7k_W3xaQLtK1vylmmwndg.text: Food is great and AJ Rodriguez is playing! Best night imaginable. Will be coming back here weekly

6_aAdGfgKggLwnZ7oNZ70A.text: This place was fantastic! The presentation of the drinks and/or food was beautiful. The server was very helpful in making recommendations, and she was attentive as well. (I wish I remembered her name)The ambiance was hip yet classic at the same time. The restaurant used to be a Methodist church, so there are still stained glass windows and the vaulted ceiling has exposed wood which is gorgeous!  I had a blueberry margarita ($6 during happy hour) that was a bit strong for me, so I felt overheated for most of our visit. It had a nice blueberry finish though. The chips, salsa and variety of hot sauces were very tasty. The fundido was a delicious starter, and the tacos served on homemade tortillas (about $5 each) were bomb! I had the Pork Avadado, Guild Chicken, and Mahi Mahi tacos. They were all spectacular, but I have to say the Mahi Mahi tacos were my favorite. I also had a side house salad with creamy cilantro dressing that was superb in flavor. My husband had the Cherry Steak, Guild Chicken, and Mahi Mahi tacos. His favorite were the Mahi Mahi tacos as well. He also had the street corn which he thought had great flavor. We highly recommend Taco Guild, and we will definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Avadado, Mahi Mahi, and Guild Chicken tacos
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side House Salad with Creamy Cilantro dressing
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cherry Steak and Guild Chicken tacos with a side of Street Corn

MGkLRuEs7H8l2DppZpAuww.text: The place is cool, but the tacos were not as good as I expected. I ordered the duck taco, and it was not good at all. I expected the fuck to be cut up, and it was just a huge piece of duck. Too gamey for my tastes when served like that. I definitely recommend slicing/chopping it up, and browning it up a little bit more in the pan.   The carne asada taco, on the other hand, was delicious.   The service was great. Just the right amount of attentive.

g-zUg4_8YWMIYFZQFIKC_A.text: Really cool vibe.  Went during a weekday for lunch.  Employees wear regular clothes so you can't tell who actually works there.   Food took a while to arrive but was tasty.  Really liked the stain glass windows.  Would like to go back for dinner.

HPw45Zx7r7bTjw9Ihmkjwg.text: The Taco Guild offers such a unique experience.  Housed in what is now a renovated church, its interior is ornate and beautiful yet warm and accessible.   Their drink menu is incredibly extensive and inventive with its names, some of which include "The Holy Grail" and the "Confessional."   I would highly recommend their Taco Plate, which allows you to order three tacos, which constitutes only a small portion of their creative yet full-bodied taco choices, alongside a full elote with chipotle mayo and cotija cheese!   I've gone a handful of times, would happily return, and have never been disappointed!

zGD5EmsBUVj5EvsNNgbNQQ.text: Visiting from Chicago and thought this place sounded awesome, so we swung by, just in time for Happy Hour.   I can't say enough good things about this place! It's awesome! Great food, amazing people, and beautiful setting in the oldest Methodist church still standing in Phoenix. Ivy was our waitress and she was beyond phenomenal, same with Wes, who seated us. Make sure to stop by... you'd be missing out BIG time if you pass this place up and choose somewhere else!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AX56cWPAZfMG4SHzhMpjiA.text: I loved the vibe of this place and the music ... 80s! The chips were actually really good and tasted so fresh! I had the shrimp enchiladas with rice and beans. The beans were over cooked and the rice was bland , I covered it in salsa. Thanks to the enchiladas though I will be back. They were so good , I had the green sauce. The shrimp were large the tortilla was thick and also tasted fresh. I loved everything about those enchiladas.

WQTLV2BMw9PdElp0dNw0BA.text: One of the best taco Tuesday spots in Phx!! Took my fam here they had amazing chips in salsa as a starter and their shrimp tacos are great! Taco Tuesday menu have different tacos on occasions but for the most part it's a really good place to eat! And the staff by the way is really really friendly!

e1YNFA8TViBO-CPZ0eAl3Q.text: This place is amazing,  bar in the church ??? Excellent positive service with great delicious food , shrimp tacos were the best. I highly recommend everyone here. Make sure to go there hungry and thirsty  !!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UwmzdPra-7eWbT8U-B_Z8w.text: Yum yummy food, fantastic atmosphere, amazing staff! Everyone was so nice and welcoming. They give you a bunch of bomb salsa with chips in the beginning and greet you with a warm meow.

tyosBOBY0CJVLQbeuevAWg.text: I went to this central Phoenix restaurant with some friends who had been there before. I was so impressed with the beauty of the ceiling and stained glass. But that's not why I was there. I was hungry!   We all ordered tacos. I wanted to order the fish taco, but my friends warned me that it was served with a "very small piece" of fish. So I ordered the guild chicken taco for $4.95. I expected a full size taco at that price. I was so surprised at the size of these tacos when they arrived! They did not look anything like the tacos you see on their web site, or what you would get at any other Mexican restaurant. These tacos are what is commonly called "street tacos". Very small and with a small amount of filling. In addition, I ordered a side of vegetables, which also was a very tiny portion. The 1/3 cup vege side contained oily bitter yellow squash, red pepper, and stringy broccoli stems that were inedible. The TG is known for unusual offerings. On the menu there were items such as marinated lamb and 'coffee beef". My  tiny street taco was flavorful, but after we left, I had to stop at a grocery store to buy a snack. I was so hungry after eating lunch at TG.  So, if you do not mind getting very small portions at a very high price, you might like it. At least go to see the stained glass, and then you can stop off at another restaurant to fill up.

eO0dKL8oxUMY1ZBSc9AwIA.text: Solid spot! Love the atmosphere.  Food selection is exciting and different, great drinks too!

dJesRYLMrZejhxCNqilw9g.text: This place is super cute. It's an old church so the stained glass windows are all original from the church days.  I went for lunch and deal is 3 tacos (choice of corn tortillas, flour tortilla or lettuce wrap) and a side (rice, beans etc) for $10.50. They have a cool spin on their tacos so you aren't going to be getting the standard - they even have duck.  This is a sit down restaurant setting but I'm sure you can get food to go. You shouldn't though because the ambiance I'm telling you is so cool.  The wait staff were all friendly,  service was excellent, and the food came out really fast. I haven't had good service in a while in this area so I extra appreciated it!  I sat in the regular dining area but the bar area looked really cool so I'd like to check this out next.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bar area

SFV0vDs6ZpLY3FyPySpTEQ.text: I loved this place! I came here for a bday trip to Phoenix. It's in like an old church and it was at Christmas time so it was all decorated and was so pretty. They also had a singer. The atmosphere is what I remember the most, the food was good too but a bit on the pricey side. I would definitely recommend checking this place out.

rhALvoLxLOmkn1xiL8rG9A.text: My husband, daughter and myself have dined at Taco Guild in the past and have enjoyed our meals very much. However on our visit today, we were very disappointed in the way the restaurant manager, Sean Snelling, handled our customer service situation. He was rude and defensive to our situation and I am sure delayed our lunch service by at least an hour. We noticed he was the expeditor in the kitchen and thus had control over service. Our meals were mediocre at best, greasy and under seasoned meats for tacos. I am disappointed to have to write this review but hope upper management will look into the restaurant manager's customer service skills.

q1Khb6Hc1gALabUeZxLNqQ.text: Mother. Of. God. This place is excellent! I have celiacs disease and was able to order a cider and 3 tacos the bartender reccomend. Each one was amazing and fresh on home made corn tortillas. I'm just in town for work for the week and I know I will be back every night.  10/10 great food great service

w1-vCJeQnvDqgYSNXwAFfQ.text: Even if you're not a taco freak (and really...  what's wrong with you?), this is still a worthy establishment to visit given that it's in a church.  TACOS.  IN CHURCH.  I'm thinking it might not get any better.  The tacos are yummy and the drinks are too.  It's the perfect venue to nosh on an Arizona favorite and maybe feel the crushing weight of religion to boot.    (Don't bother trying to park yourself.  Spare the couple bucks for a tip and just valet.  It'll get you to the tacos and guilt faster.)

-ywceWauicSlr0WGZ78VHQ.text: I am IN LOVE with this place. I'm so impressed with every single aspect. Seated immediately. Amazing service. Incredible food. We tried all of their popular menu items. All of which were so unique in presentation and flavor. Our party was utterly AWESTRUCK by the live performance of Emily and AJ. So much so that we asked to meet them and followed their social media to show support. Beautiful restaurant. Used to be an old Catholic Church so it's got a very vintage chic feel. I am from Cali and this place makes me wish I was a local. We thoroughly and genuinely enjoyed everything and every single minute of our visit. I will make it a point to come here every single time I am in town. Thank you, Taco Guild for the amazing experience.

NB6LLQy0t09Aa1K_MvwamQ.text: The location is really cool, the service is good, the live music was good, but the tacos are average. Considering the very positive reviews, I was quite disappointed. I wouldn't go back. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't memorable.

HH-t9tn5VpbV0EqCUEH_aA.text: Went for happy hour and loved the house Margaritas and Tacos. The service was great and it was a cool atmosphere.  It definitely a different setup for a bar but I enjoyed it. This is a must try place if you love Tacos and Margaritas. Thy had other drink options but had a limited food menu. Overall enjoyed my experience and will definitely go back for their happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Hour Menu

56TnhSsJr5tntdwyuDgFBQ.text: Wow! And not in the good way. What a disappointment this place is. I yelped it, the photos got me eggcited. The tacos sound really good on the menu. The tacos look really good on the platter. That's where the magic ends.   The tacos do not taste good. One word: bland. The waiter recommended the shrimp tacos. Bland. The pastor tacos. Bland. And dry. The fish taco. Bland. And overcooked. The carnitas. Soggy. On top of that they are so pricy. $3.95 for a pastor taco. $4.95 for a fish taco. The best part of the meal was the side salad.   The only place that is less Mexican than this is, Gadzooks Mexican down the street. (Never been there but the name, wtf Phoenix). Why not open a Taco shop called Chow Fung's authentic Tacos while you're at it. Smh.   So if you want Mexican food, this ain't it. Not even close. If you want bland overpriced Ingredients in a tortilla, this is the place for you.   Three stars only for the free chips and salsa and good service. Food alone is a two-star.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco Guild - Ono fish taco, Al Pastor taco, Shrimp taco. They look good, but don&#39;t be fooled.

Y99x9hnVPlnxLmPRuz76cA.text: I've now been here a few times and had a good experience both times. First and foremost, the atmosphere is great. The old church with the stained glass windows make it very open and beautiful during a sunset. The food has been delicious as well. The guacamole and queso were tasty. The first time I tried the enchiladas per the servers recommendation and they were great. The next time I got a 3 taco plate. I decided on one shrimp, one chicken and one pastor taco. All were good but the shrimp was my favorite. Will keep going till I have a bad experience.

SNNABiov6L_qUMoxvoS66Q.text: Such a neat place with amazing food!! This is one place I bring all my out of town guests. If you haven't been here, go try it! You won't be sorry.

eceOhO8T58g33aNplw1Z8g.text: Great happy he all week- atmosphere is key food is good and service was good. Live music on Saturday we had fun

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The church

hpsBxPSnP2VIXOczkCLC2w.text: First off, we have been coming to Taco Guild for quite some time and have visited them over ten times. We have always enjoyed the food. The problem with Taco Guild is that their service is beyond reprehensible.   There is a specific hostess, a woman with short black-hair that we have had problems with. The first time, we were seated by her we had to wait for 15 minutes to be seen and served. The waiter apologized about the mix-up and said that our seat wasn't assigned to him. He was very gracious about this. We shrugged this off as a mistake. The second time, the same hostess walks us past three open tables and sits us in the back-room behind the wall where you can't see the rest of the dining area. Again, we waited for some time for a server. Meanwhile, other groups were sat at the empty tables that we walked past and saw others get their food before us. This was starting to feel purposeful and vindictive. Lastly and most egregiously, we decided to eat there on a Sunday. The SAME hostess sat my family outside, which we requested. Strangely, the waiter that was working the patio did not come and greet us. In fact, we waited 20 minutes and still nothing. We got up and asked this hostess for someone to serve us and she said someone would be right out. Still nothing! After another bit of waiting we get up and leave and tell the hostess and manager what happened. The hostess had the gall to cheerily say "have a nice day!" as we left Taco Guild for the last time.   The real kicker and important part for everyone reading this is that my family is mixed-race. We absolutely hate the idea that this was based on how we looked, but happening three times by the same individual, makes us question the integrity of the restaurant.

FrsTsQGHYZDsDhzH_EiesA.text: Ok, 6 people in group all had different food and loved it. 3 of us had the corn.  Let me tell you. .. get the corn.  It was the best.  I had the most adventurous tacos with duck, and lamb. Also the al postore which was really good.  Portions were excellent. Good value for the money. Service also was excellent.  The two things I didn't like is how loud it was (dang it I'm getting middle aged) and there wasn't enough of the hot sauces. They only refilled the main one,  which was really good,  but I enjoyed them all and wanted more. I will definitely go back.

d1f-RZPVjsXk8RtkTc9MBg.text: I can't say enough about this place. They have amazing food great prices and rotating draft beer options.... And the ambience/atmosphere makes it even more inviting not to mention the waitstaff knows who you are when you walk in just after two visits. I could literally eat here twice a week.

3u8_PE4M90g0RbY69CPBDg.text: Love this place and here is why: balanced 2-page menu with classic and more 'exotic' type of choices. Fresh food that tastes great. Reasonably-priced. Oh, yeah, drinking margaritas in a church - unforgettable experience ;)

t4iGgW0DDJ4HBr0MuMLRtw.text: I came to a taco place and ordered a burrito, which is typical of me to do. It had steak, eggs, potatoes, cheese and pico in it. Now as awesome as this combination may seem, the waitress suggested some jalapeno bacon, to which I replied, "Heck yes!" Now, I'm no engineer, but I'm sure they just made a time machine, in a form of a burrito. It was awesome and very filling (And I weigh 240 #'s). The atmosphere is nice, but I didn't pay much attention; that burrito was delish. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ‼

Fg-YWspovTJBkcvRTOYTbg.text: Went there for a work lunch and was pleasantly surprised. Nice decor (inside an old church) with lots of character. Food was delicious. I ordered the taco plate with the corn on the cob. Definitely a place to check out in Phoenix!

wSDIzPBw-PaH5StGK2ulNw.text: The meal was amazing! The service was outstanding. We started off the meal with chips and house guac which tastes a step above most places! My fiance is doesn't eat red meat and had the vegetarian and shrimp tacos which were delightful. I had the staples: chicken, carne Asada, and pork. Each one tasted different and unique.  My favorite of them all was the chicken surprising, not because it tasted the best, but because the favors complemented each other well.  We had two beers for the table and didn't touch one of them because of good conversation. When the server came around they asked if we didn't like the beer and we said no, and explained about the conversation. The server insisted he take it off the bill and that was that. Highly recommended for service and food!

qzJ9wPBCDsUTCuLhNQNRug.text: Every bite was absolutely delicious!  The interior is gorgeous! At first when my husband and I walked in with our two young children we almost left because it looks so nice inside and we thought maybe it wasn't appropriate for our kiddos. However the entire staff was gracious to our whole family from the very start and made us feel very welcome.  My husband, who is Mexican, and grew up in New Mexico is a hard judge for Mexican food-- loved everything. Especially the queso  fundido  (hope I am spelling that right). He said, "tastes just like it does back home". A huge compliment! We both had a three taco platter and the tacos were so expertly crafted, they take you to a different place. The fish taco transported me back to my childhood in San Diego and had a very Baja feel. Then there were several marinated tacos that were so reminiscent of our time spent in the Yucatan peninsula, which is a whole different style of Mexican food that most people have never had.  Then the tequila selection! We are always so disappointed by other restaurant's selections because there are so many really good tequilas out there. We will definately be back sometime soon without the kiddos enjoy  a couple of tequila flights with some more excellent tacos!

dzwf-xkB_GjVlDQO-3CTrw.text: Awesome building, great food, friendly service. Definitely some great happy hour deals and a $2 taco of the day

sO4bSw7tuvpDChbLO-ZdFA.text: I recently moved into the area a couple months ago, and decided to try Taco Guild because it looked like neat place on the outside.  Once inside, I was very impressed with the decor.  It is an old converted church with neat stained glass windows and dark, rich wood accents everywhere, very spacious and clean.  The food is amazing.  All ingredients locally sourced and fresh, fresh, fresh.  The tacos are unbelievable and the burritos and street corn are also fabulous.  One thing that has set this place apart in my book-the friendliness of the staff.  From the bartenders to the servers and everyone in between.....these folks smile and talk to you and genuinely care about how your experience there is.  Only thing keeping this from being a five-star affair is that it is a just a tad  pricey (not way pricey, just a bit in my opinion), but I also 'get' that at most places, good, quality food is usually worth the extra cost. Taco Guild is definitely a winner.

B4IZLGpAdJ0IHPx3VsUQNQ.text: Meh!  Very average food, poor HH, especially the wine.  I really wanted it to be good but was not impressed.  I left with a $30 bill after 2 average tacos, a very small pour on a cheap wine( which was $9) and a side of beans.   The bad was beautiful.  Too bad the food did not match the atmosphere.

OzAwI1vDPHgljzn9QkmZHQ.text: Went to this place the other day and this place is awesome.  Duck tacos with the fried cheese stick, cheese dip, crazy cheesy corn (sense a pattern here?) all awesome.  They have the same type of margs as my beloved Z'Tejas (which taco guild is a part of, but that is a secret according to the staff).  I met the bar manager, Darren or something (again, the margs awill make you stupid); but he was very hospitable to my buddy and I.  if you want great food, great service, and just an all around great time, the guild is where its at.  Will be back soon!!!

kBr2Gi9bJsaCmWsRDdWsCw.text: I've been here a few times.  It's a church converted into a bar/restaurant.  The ambiance is cool with the flying buttresses and high ceilings and colorful window panes.    The best part about eating here is they give you an ample serving of chips with four salsas.  I usually get the taco trio.  The Yucatan shrimp taco is the best (I personally did not like their grilled chicken taco whatsoever).  The street corn is good, too  It's kind of cool how they give you a knife to cut off the kernels.    They're very accommodating and on top of their game with service.  I've been here twice in which my dining companions had special requests, and they honored the request without any issues.  I would recommend this for tourists and locals.  It's one of those unique spots that I haven't seen in other cities.  Parking can be a bit tight, but it's worth it.

0bez2_by2Ddnyf2TWiFoBQ.text: Stopped in to try the restaurant transformed from an old church. Great vibe and friendly staff. Mike and Eric were our bartenders, both gave great recommendations. We tried multiple different tacos, they were all wonderful. I couldn't pick which was my favorite. I highly recommend Taco Guild.

GLMx2T_w9E6cRghGmnC6cA.text: Other than the decor, this over-priced, noisy taco joint lacks culinary appeal.    Props to the service -- good and prompt.    I ordered the three tacos and side combo.  The tacos were salty and the fish was this side of bad.

SN_1lzc_vKsejFPjuEeXBw.text: Had the best time and food here!  The place is so unique as it is in an old church with beautiful stained glass windows and gothic candelabras.  Also, there is an outdoor patio which is pretty nice...it faces the parking lot, but still ok.  They have Happy Hour on Saturday!  Yes!  I had the Happy Hour Daily Taco which was delicious, delicious, delicious.  Then I had two more and the street corn.  Food was amazing.  I also had the Margarita which was good and Coconut Creme Pie...delish.  There were four of us in our party and we ate and drank a feast and the total was below $100, so I thought that was pretty good.  Highly recommend.

dHD-KV62WNzmBOi5rQNBEA.text: My wife and I went to Taco Guild for dinner and to hear a friend who was playing there. Taco Guild has both good and not-so-good aspects. So in the spirit of ripping a band-aid off quickly, let's begin the not-so-good.  First, parking is a nightmare. I didn't know that a majority of the parking by the entrance is complimentary valet; not a big deal since it is complimentary until I realized I had no cash for a tip-- the valet was working his behind off and was very nice.  We went inside to put our name on the list and expected a 60-75 minute wait-- the hosts were spot on with the estimation, we were seated about 65 minutes later. The wait was expected and not totally outrageous since it was a Saturday night; however, there was no place to  wait without being in the way of people running food, others trying to enjoy the music, etc. So we kept moving around and around.   Also didn't know that reservations were accepted. While we were standing around there were a few large tables that were half empty because they were reserved. I know, they were reserved, but it still doesn't make customers too excited to wait 60 to 75 minutes with tables half empty. Still not a huge deal since we were listening to the band.  We were seated within the wait-time we were told when we arrived-- so kudos to the hosts! My wife ordered a margarita she said was very good. I had a soft drink and water and my daughter had a soft drink as well.   We started with the Guild Trio which was good. The tortilla chips were hit and miss. Some were fine others tasted like they had been left in the fryer too long and were extremely oily and soft. We also had the Fundido. There aren't many fundido sauces I don't like and the Taco Guild was no exception. The Fundido was good, but it tasted like velveeta queso dip. Which again, I don't have a problem with Velveeta, but when you spend $9 on an appetizer and the chips are suspect, the Fundido should be orgasmic.   The Guild Trio was good and my wife liked the guacamole. I thought the guacamole could have used a bit more garlic or salt and pepper. Now I'm not a guacamole connoisseur so take my opinion for what it is worth.   Then I had the Pork Adovada, Guild Chicken and the Yucatan Shrimp tacos with the Borracho Red Beans. The adovada taco had a nice flavor but was a little dry. The Guild chicken taco also had a nice flavor to it, but the chicken had a weird texture to it which threw me off-- I'm easily put off by foods with weird textures. The Yucatan Shrimp taco was delicious. My wife had the same except she had the taco braised with coffee, I can't remember the name. It was really good. My daughter had a salad which was nothing more than iceberg lettuce with red beans. The Borracho Red Beans tasted like cowboy beans.   Overall the food was good enough that I will definitely try Taco Guild again for different tacos. However, the prices were a little high on some of the menu items.

tT81QvoUO3pzV4m_8zToYw.text: Do not pass up this taco heaven!!! We had the house made guacomale-  the street corn was pretty good, but a very small portion. The Cartel coffee Beef Taco was De-licious and the Molida Lamb with sweet potato hay- Magnificent!!! The service was great and the old church venue was spectacular!!! Also the salsa options- yum! I will be going back, next time I visit Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_Yr7btGwJ4sh1byBl-OAEw.text: So my friend and i had come here Saturday night for dinner because a friend told me i "had to try it". So we ordered the horchatas, guacamole and shrimp and chicken enchiladas. Let me start by saying the horchata is so different here and very very very small on top of being very different(very thick consistency). Definitely wouldn't recommend to anyone craving the horchata you get anywhere else. Since I'm pregnant I'm very thirsty all the time. With the cup being extra tiny i ordered the aguas fresca thinking it would be in a pint glass by some slight chance. Wrong again!!!! A small baby size glass(and thicker consistency which makes no sense since aguas frescas is like a "fruit water" this was almost like a smoothie) each of these costing me 5 dollars per drink mind you almost the price of a whole dish!! I felt bad for any server i get because I'm just so thirsty. I'm sorry! So i then ordered an ice tea and made sure this time to ask if it came in a normal pint glass. I'm sure she was totally peeved with me by this point for ordering so many drinks. I did drink them all but totally regretting everything right now which we will get to.    Onto the food.  The guacamole was probably my favorite thing on the menu next to the Shrimp enchiladas.  The tortillas were like nothing I've ever had before for  an enchilada super thick. Was super impressed with the shrimp and was in heaven and full not touching more than half not including the beans and rice.  I needed a box as well as my friend.  We paid for our tab and were pleased with our experience. Here comes the great part.  Both of us had our stomachs completely done for starting close to 8 hours after eating here so i ran to the toilet and thought something was seriously wrong with my stomach or unborn baby. The whole day my stomach was just not right and is still not right after 72 hours.**update: it's now 5 days still no improvement/after a little over a week my stomach is now back to normal thank god**Both my friend/coworker and i check in on each other to see if each other's stomachs let up. To no luck not much. Constant bubble guts. Sorry for all the TMI but just wanted everyone to be warned while the food is good is it really worth your health being on hold of other delicious food and drinks for days on end? I think not. I can't say I'd feel safe coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small baby glass of horchata and the house guacamole
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp enchiladas

smM6ZqxMXi_M27Bt_kC-4A.text: Great food but service was really slow. Took forever for our beers, and even longer to actually order appetizer.  Would come back for the food though and hope for a better experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eDZI4-AG0v7Hv5-pzyQj6g.text: Must visit for taco lovers. They have common proteins and a few modern concepts. You'll see it on their menu as old world vs new world tacos. Each taco is big and packed with different toppings and sauce. A burst of flavors with each bite.   Tacos are $4-5 each. A bit pricey but you can get a taco plate that comes with 3 tacos of choice and a free side.   Chips & salsa - complimentary as you wait for your food. Comes with 4 sauces - salsa, habanero (good), verde (good, has a hint of jalapeno) and a spicy red.   Elote - good! Option to order it on the cob or off. I recommend off so it'll be less messy. I love the habanero butter and chipotle mayo  Al pastor pork taco - comes with grilled pineapple, jalapeno bacon and pickled red onions  Chipotle cherry steak taco - comes with chili aioli  Peking duck taco - comes with plum and apricot sauce and Brie. The sweetness goes well with the duck

cki1R_BAwm4TCi25TB05mg.text: Never thought I'd write a bad review of this place.  It's been my favorite restaurant for years, and the best place to bring newbies or out of town guests.  I frequented so much at one point I was on a first name basis with many of the staff there.  That said, I've noticed it seems to have gone down in quality over the past year and the staff has had a high turnover rate, and that I never recognize anyone anymore.  Still, when I heard about the new menu, I was eager to try it all out.  My friend and I stopped in yesterday evening.  We ordered two happy hour frozen marg's with a 'flavor'shooter (mango and acai).  The large salsa was completely watered down and flavorless.  So bad, that I mentioned it to the waitress, who commented she noticed the exact same thing, and that it happens when the staff fails to 'stir' the batch of salsa.  She later brought a 'thicker' batch over, but it was still watery and tasteless.  For dinner I ordered street corn, a vegetarian taco and a tamale (new).   The corn was good, although less seasoning and cheese than in the past.  I never received the taco I ordered.  The tamale was cold when I cut into it.  Not like 'luke warm sitting for a bit', but cold as in - never even heated up.  The waitress offered to bring me a new one, but at that point between the bad salsa and not receiving the taco I just declined.  The manager came over and apologized, and offered to take care of my drink for me instead, which I thanked him for.  When we received the bill, however, the drink cost was still on there.  Additionally, the happy hour margarita was $9.  I asked about it and was told the add-in flavor was an additional $2.50.  Seriously?  The margs USED to be $5 with $1.00 for the added flavor.  $6.50 for a hh marg PLUS $2.50 for the flavoring is extreme.  I understand needing to raise prices, but if that's the case, give your customers a heads up about the additional costs.  So between the water-salsa, not receiving a taco, the cold tamale and over priced drinks, both my friend and I agreed it will be a LONG time before we frequent again.  It's a shame too, because it used to be one of the best places in the valley.  *UPDATE* I've updated from 1 star to 3 stars to reflect past experiences at the restaurant.  Additionally, the manager kindly reached out regarding my concerns and assured me they would be addressed in the future.  I appreciate any business who is willing to listen to its long standing customers.

qifT9acn6JXaAkOms7PUBw.text: Taco Guild has an unforgettable atmosphere and I truly enjoyed the dining experience. My server was lovely and helpful. The food however, while good, was underwhelming. I got three tacos and to be honest they all kind of tasted the same, it was hard to figure out which was which. I got the street corn, and while that was definitely the best part of the meal, the portion for the price was not awesome. The sides in general were not priced according to the size. Don't get me wrong, I'd definitely go back but they're not the best option in town.   PS. If I could I would defiantly give this place a 3.5.

tAT6UoAJsjjYRYDzEhyASg.text: Everytime i make a visit. Always great service and music.. The drinks are great and the tacos are crazy nice.. You have different type that you are able to choose from. I like going on Tuesdays for Taco Tuesdays during happy hour get a nice drink and have a great time.. It's best to bring some friends with you that you can have a epic time with while eatting some great food

D4F0-w5__b7IOQMbSsJmJg.text: Had Father's Day brunch with big family group and had  for the most part.  Only complaint I heard was from those who ordered the menudo (I am not a menudo guy so did not affect me).  My wife and I went back for Happy Hour on July 4th and were not disappointed.  Cool atmosphere in an old church.  Food is tasty.  We really enjoyed the HH tamales.  Good beer selection.  Excellent tequila bar.  Will certainly go back when we are on that side of town!

BYoV6t8oY7Ye2z4dQ-skKA.text: If you are looking for traditional tacos like what you get in Mexico, this isn't the place for you.   If you are looking for an upgraded version of a taco, then stop here!!  First thing you will notice is the building! In its previous life, it was a church, and they have done an incredible job of repurposing it into a taco place. The stained glass windows and wood everywhere is impressive. The bar is large (the only place I've sat) and the bartenders are friendly and make a great margarita.   My only complaint (which doesn't change my opinion of the place) is the price. This isn't your typical $20 for a boat load of tacos place. It is expensive for tacos, yes, but the quality of food is great.

MuEd3JEeYyZY-k_UJGMyDQ.text: Taco Guild is spectacular for so many reasons but I think the biggest one is that it's so unique! I mean, where else in the Valley can you get duck and Brie, cherry rubbed steak, or lamb tacos?! They also offer lettuce wrapped tacos in place of tortillas, for all you low-carbers.   They serve a variety of complimentary salsas with chips and their guacamole is out of this world! The service is always very prompt as well. My office is down the street and Taco Guild has become our favorite spot for a celebratory lunch. Definitely a must-try in the Phoenix area!

9_7dx-ITzFvo0VORlQgRFA.text: One of my favorite taco places. I got a pork burrito the 1st time I went here and then tacos the 2nd time. The pork burrito is a good portion-sized! And their pork is AMAZING. The tacos are flavorful! And the best part is their $2.50 Taco-of-the-day during happy hour!! I got the chance to try fish tacos and roasted chicken tacos- both delicious and flavorful. The Peking duck taco is super. It has a weird fruity twist to it. And corn on a cob is absolutely mouthwatering.  And to top it all off, the service was great. I mean the 1st time I went, they were busy and it took a long time, and they messed up our order a couple times, but our waiter was so nice and apologetic and gave us several tacos- on the house. The second time I was there, they overcooked the corn (which was still tasty and not burnt at all) and they gave us another corn on a cob for free.   It's always nice to have that considerate and thoughtful aspect in a restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

27lcXzL0XWymSZ2qxqemHw.text: In terms of a gastropub, this place does everything right. The menu is painfully hard to go through because everything on it sounds delicious. The full bar with their own custom drinks and a decent selection of local craft beers is a perfect complement to the food. Every time we're here we ask ourselves why we don't come here more often.

cFCA57dirJZNvzFfek0ZkQ.text: Came here recently on a Saturday night with a group of friends.  We knew it was going to be a bit of a wait, but after two hours, we found out they didn't have our names of the wait list.  They corrected this issue quickly, which was appreciated.    Food was good, liked having some unique options for the meal.  The duck tacos were fantastic.  The tacos were quite filling, so only needed two to make a great meal.    The decor in this old church was amazing.    Not my typical sort of haunt, but great food, good service, and a fun time.

KnZeue9LZJEdpgnjW2tbSQ.text: 5 stars for the Chipotle Cherry Steak!! first time here, will definitely come back for this taco plate in burrito form!! For sure will ask to be in Ray's section next time :)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qaAvaD5BocJuyOKu1XmgNg.text: Nothing to write home about, other than the building itself being cool.   Came by on a Tuesday evening and was told there'd be a 25 minute wait for a table for two. I received the initial text saying I was added to the waitlist, but 40 minutes later I still never received a text about the table being ready. I went inside and checked on my place in line, and was told that another person came in and took my table, then was told that they texted me twice to say my table was ready (which one is it?) but I never showed up. I showed the hostess the text with just the initial confirmation of being added to the list and nothing else after that. She apologized and took us to the table.   My friend had fish tacos and said they were good. I had the $13 beef enchiladas and they were really just mediocre, nothing special, not worth the 40 or even 25 minute wait. Drinks weren't anything special either.   I don't understand the hype over this place, it just didn't do it for me. I don't plan on returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JcS3_NUAe5Fub28HGx0P5Q.text: My family and I had a really great evening outing at Taco Guild, and I can understand why they're one of the undisputed leaders of the Phoenix taco scene.   Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  As a converted Methodist Church, Taco Guild has one of the coolest atmospheres of any restaurant I've been to in the country, and they combine it with top notch service even when things get busy (as they were on a Thursday evening over the holidays. The food comes out quick and there are chips and dips to hold you over until they do. Star.   Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  My only gripe with Taco Guild is their pricing. I'm no newbie to contemporary new world tacos and the fact that they're often priced well above the $1.50 you'll spend per taco on the street, but the small tacos at Taco Guild will often run you $4.95, which is just crazy given their portion size. I both wanted to and could have ordered six of these tacos just for myself, but spending upwards of $30 for tacos for one person was ridiculous. No Star.   Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  I ordered the Al Pastor, Coffee Braised Beef, and Peking Duck tacos in addition to the Pozole soup of the day, and it was all divine. The pozole was surprisingly the standout dish of the evening, but the meats and peripherals in these tacos was fantastic, and made all the better thanks to the fresh made tortillas. Wonderful. Two Stars.   Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?  It will cost you, but yes I would gladly eat at Taco Guild daily. Star.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pozole Soup of the Day: $4.95
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al Pastor Pork ($3.95), Coffee Braised Beef ($4.95) and Peking Duck ($4.95)

bnt_ioK9yZ7v6wyrzY_Opg.text: Service was great! Food wise, the execution was there, but the ingredients are subpar. I ordered one of the sweet corns, expecting more of a traditional sweet white corn (ya know the one with a bit of a crunch to it) but was surprised to receive a plain ol' yellow corn. I understand it may be a seasonal reason. I also ordered a vegetarian taco, requested on a corn tortilla, served on flour. No biggie, but if I had diet restrictions, I would have said something. Agua Fresca was muy refrescante!

UelOfSGEP1FIlOq6UnMABQ.text: Waitress forgot my order, came back 30 min later to ask me what it was. No discount offered. Duck taco cold. The beans dont taste good. I wouldn't go back or recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa is good
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck taco &amp; coffee braised beef taco. Beans are whole beans and not good IMO.

IA9zvhTn7gyDMcIlJq5QqQ.text: Great vibes. It looks like this used to be a church and renovated into a sexy restaurant. The details of the decor and furniture is really cool. High ceilings. Nice looking bar. They came out with chips and salsa. Freshly made in house and so delicious. Extra addicting. We got 5 different tacos. The cherry steak, lamb, Peking duck, carne asada , and blackened shrimp. The best two were the cherry steak and Peking duck. It's a great place for happy hour. Would definitely come back for food and drinks. Vibes on point  Recommendation: cherry steak tacos and Peking duck tacos

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CIhJ4qi2xbsndCCsBNMO4w.text: love the ambiance of this place. tacos are very different and fun. great corn tortillas. didn't love all the salsa & hot sauces that came with the chips, but that definitely won't stop me from coming back.

dJgsaUpbPyMj3emP2GqU5g.text: So we tried a lot of their tacos. The duck taco was tasteless. The lamb taco had good flavor but was so oily, the oil was dripping down my hand. The coffee braised beef was way too  sweet. The chicken was not exciting. The chipotle cherry steak was the best, by a small margin, but the blue cheese really brings it down. The corn tortillas were too thick. Our server was really sweet, but the hostess took thirty minutes to seat us with 4-5 empty and clean tables available to them, so maybe they were understaffed? I had better expectations for this place.

ZiIJZ_bruds9H9jVwvO_Xg.text: Good God.  That's not a pun just because this place is in a former church either.  I mean, it's nice enough.  Actually it'd be really nice if it didnt feel so weird to be in a former church, and I'm not even religious.  But I was praying that the food here would be so good that I could make a "sacrilicious" joke.  It's not.  I saw a ton of older white people and lots of yoga women etc.  I should have known I was in trouble when there was a Starbucks and a Buffalo Exchange both right next to it.  But I felt committed, and then saw the menu.  Fine, put your stupid pineapple on your al pastor, people love it.  But Jesus Christ, how much mango and jicama slaw can you jam into your handmade but bland as hell corn tortillas?  I don't want dessert tacos.  I blame white people for this.  I love you, white people, but look at what the fuck you've done.   This shit is hilariously overpriced, sweet, and a horrid bastardization of everything that should be right with tacos.  I'm so ashamed of you, Taco Guild.    I'll pray for you.

HAUu6pHu8kwKf9ZWtK4r7A.text: There are so many things I can say about this place but I don't want my review to shape anyone's experience. You really need to visit for yourself. The building is interesting, the interior is fantastic. The food is delicious and your really can't go wrong with anything you choose. There is plenty of seating, a large bar area and extensive menus aimed to please. I choose mix and match tacos. All delicious. Service is really good too. I suggest you check it out, spend a little time gazing at this one of a kind restaurant and ask your server for menu suggestions.

g2SSHko2DSPC8e6B43QB-A.text: It really happened!  It was amazing!  Okay, the review I recently left was not positive. No doubt about that. But the response to the review was amazing.  The GM contacted me and apologized and asked if we would return and see the changes they have made as a result of the reviews here on Facebook.  That is amazing! Our reviews make a difference.    Well, of course I would go back. I love everything about the food at Taco Guild.  So back we went. We sat at the bar...and within minutes we were welcomed and invited to review Happy Hour pricing. We talked about various drinks and met "Michael" - the bartender.  PERFECT!  Honestly.  I barely got my order in with Michael and the chips and salsa - warm and oh so yummy - were placed in front of us. Waters delivered promptly and dishes, napkins and utensils arrived immediately...it was magical.  Did we want to eat?  Yes, yes we do! We ordered tacos and a salad and then more chips arrived and drinks were filled and we were just settling in and our food arrive.  IMMEDIATELY.  Or well, my hubby's food arrived...my steak took longer than the expected so my salad was a tad longer to arrive.  Still unsure how that happened but...it eventually arrived and I had more time to monopolize the warm and tasty chips.  The salad was new to me. I liked it a lot. I would have liked a tad more cheese and nuts, but the fruit and streak was perfect.  The Kale was substantial and very crunchy.  I even took some home for lunch :-).  Kale is the best!  I wasn't offered dessert so I don't know if they have any.  I was offered another drink, and I gladly ordered one and left with quite a warm and happy feeling. For the record, that was three drinks and I was not driving :-).    I highly recommend Michael at the bar. He's delightful and very engaging.  He is thoughtful and attentive.  He works most evenings.  I observed him with the other patrons and he was equally efficient with everyone. Thank you Michael.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I could drink margaritas and eat chips all night!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great Tacos!!

9smZcY9NhYrubz4m_J9hLg.text: I've been here a few times and every experience is terrific. I absolutely  love the gorgeous ambiance. I like that they bring you a salsa sampling to the table when you are seated. I've tried several street tacos and they are all delicious.

xCeZwpC9PG01wuGRdqDfYA.text: Walked in and was impressed by the design of the place, it has an amazing cathedral feel to it (bit creepy, but cool). Greeted by a friendly host and seated almost immediately.  Loved their bacon jalapeno guacamole but not amazed by their tacos. They were a little bland for my taste. The meat could have been seasoned better and was little dry, but was not bad.  Had some fly problems. It could have been because we were seated right next to the bathroom door which I think is a horrible place to have tables. Anyways, overall not a bad place but most likely won't be coming back here.

uBtC_IBwx7jeMWmRMNJaKw.text: Went for a work lunch.  Food was pretty good.  Best part was the street corn.  I may return.  Undecided but the experience wasn't bad.  The location isn't in my normal area of commuting which is why I say I may return.

5ehe3X9_nYg4Y2zyP1CH1w.text: I can appreciate a good taco, and I dug the Peking duck taco, but other than that the pork taco and shrimp taco were mediocre. I was excited to see schrinners chorizo on the menu, but the "prickly pear" sauce was more like a spicy bbq sauce, unexpectedly spicy. My wife's enchiladas were dry, so they were more like burrito rolls. Honestly the fast food style enchilada place catty corner to taco guild has better enchiladas.

T1EKvJQGTNo57ncxscWRvQ.text: Last minute stop and was pleasantly surprised. Loved the street tacos and corn was to die for. Also server was attentive and loved the atmosphere. Definitely returning.

nPl8SQ5c9hCgqA2GNSvOvw.text: Gross gross . Sorry myabe it's just not my type of food .  being a Mexican I thought this place might be good but it's not. Feels like some one tried to remake Latin food but didn't work. Bran were gross the meat taste not cooked . Very mushy..

sNY3fMZKZM6UDVv0ijjXCQ.text: The music by the band Picoso was playing when I was there and they were really fun.  Service was excellent and the food delish.

f2Q_w8ShmB6KQexfb4xpZQ.text: Excellent.  Love the tacos, salsa, guacamole.  They have tequila flights.  Really excellent food. Great service and I had the coconut pie,  delicious, not too sweet.  loved it.

3L7AtFB4yWaOIV1SHoLnVA.text: The cherry chipotle steak tacos! OMG! They are amazing! And the street corn is delicious, just don't have them cut it from the cob for you. It strangely tastes like canned corn when they do that. Never again! On the cob is the way to go! The decor is breathtaking and unique and adds to the wonderful ambience. The salsa trio is also fabulous! I'm so lucky to live nearby so I can frequent taco guild.

SiphMjd9Okgw5BOLFeNwZg.text: Second time trying . The restaurant  is an old. Church building . The. Chairs are uncomfortable.  The chips are thick but I did like their hot sauces.  We tried a variety of tacos .They were average. The meats a little  on the salty side . Service was slow and a weird set up . Music was extremely  loud . Prices high for Mexican food

0ufb92LK9DoGuuqEMhh63A.text: YUMMMMM. Food is SO good. Decor is really neat and I love how its an old church. Beautiful. The street corn...OH MY!!! you gotta get it. The drinks are amazing too. I can't remember the name of the one I got, but it had tequila and it was strong! Not gross strong, but enough to make you feel good about ordering a more expensive fancy drink.

mmwxvOr3DPSqOhlW_J9-Qg.text: We arrived for a birthday dinner.  We sat at the bar before being seated.  Nice bartender, very good selection of rare local beers.  The margarita tasted good but didn't have the punch you thought it would have.  We were seated at our table and waited 10 minutes for chips and salsa and another 5 minutes for water and to place drink orders.  The meals ordered were staggered in time arriving.  The food was so so - steak salad had too dull of a knife to cut the meat with.  The place itself is very cool.  Service SUB PAR/food not that good.  Prices are a little high.  3 out of 5 stars.

SzknldMXPYg3V_TUHsd62w.text: I've been coming here for their tacos for a couple years and it's delicious. They have unique gourmet taco options on the menu and delicious corn (try it, for sure). Their chips and salsa are also addicting.  Atmosphere: old church, unique vibe, trendy.  Parking: Parking lot can fill up, but you won't have to wait long for a spot if it does.

8l3IXqX05bnQMzdgpYFBEg.text: Great margaritas.  The most unique tacos I have ever had.  A wonderful atmosphere in an old church which is beautiful. I sat at the bar and made new friends and stayed a lot longer than I planned.  For an out of town visitor this was a gem.  It's a very popular place and parking is hard to come by even on a week night.  I will go back when in town again.

zSXw1oUmms8TcWGz05Q_dg.text: Your prayers have been answered.  Expertly repositioned in an old church, this place has terrific food.  The chips and salsa (and who can't stop eating chips?!) are fantastic

RGy6g3xnu4A_0uFig8zQ5A.text: I am so happy I tried this place!! We went on Saturday night and the live music was a great match to the atmosphere. I had the build-your-own burrito with chicken. I was closing my eyes with every bite because the texture and flavors transformed me!! LoL.  I'm going back again tonight because if I don't, this burrito won't leave my dreams otherwise. Delicious chicken, cheese, rice and bean ratio in the burrito. It's seriously my version of perfect!! I did ask for it without the pico because I'm just not a fan of that in my burritos. I didn't try the margaritas but looking forward to trying one tonight. The bar is beautiful. Keep up the quality and outstanding recipes, Taco Guild!!
