Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The chicken burrito that changed my life! LoL.

wro5PyQsVeUTQiHCA6lVgQ.text: I've been wanting to come here forever!! It was definitely worth the drive from the East Valley. They have complimentary valet. The inside of the restaurant is SO COOL and has a great vibe. They have daily taco and soup specials. Their cocktail menu is beautiful. I had the Forbidden Fruit and it was really delicious and refreshing. The chips were fresh and tasty, and the salsa was some of the best I've ever had. Be careful...the green salsa is deceptively hot but sooo good! I had a pork adovada and guild chicken taco - excellent!! The tortillas were fresh and perfectly prepared. The meat was quality, and the toppings/garnish did not overpower the taco. I also had a cup of the soup of the day which was a creamy roasted corn and poblano. It was definitely the hit of the evening. So so good and perfectly seasoned. My whole meal was less than $25! I couldn't believe it. I will absolutely be back and can't wait to bring my whole crew.

T5z2zZOqJvt3ICzJqXNddg.text: Good food, somewhere on the border between snacks and full meals. If you want more, order a second or third taco. They are delicious. Also pretty inexpensive. It's pleasant to sit on the patio, though the view is just parking and a drive-through Starbucks. Inside is nice, bustling and a little noisy, but also cheerful. There's music on the weekends.

Qw_ouqBTl_2DGDNYArLvzQ.text: Best tacos I've ever had! Great place for date night. It's housed in an old church with original items.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tonight&#39;s special taco
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome tacos! Best I&#39;ve ever had.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Djj4M8vb4VgIqDZJ0A2DtQ.text: So we are back in town and wanted to go to Urban Taco but they are closed :(  The group asked where else we could go and I said Taco Guild and they did not disappoint.  Service was excellent, the atmosphere was alive, and the food was fantastic.  I will be back next year, maybe soon if I can convince the boss thst we need a week in the desert at Christmas.  Still like to know whst happened to Urban Taco.

t1b7DtKh1w-owLs76Ef9Kg.text: The only thing better than a word of mouth recommendation, is a word of mouth recommendation that leads you to tacos! When my girlfriend heard about Taco Guild, she sent me a photo of what was clearly a church, saying "I want to go here". When I realized tacos were involved, I was more than happy to oblige.  It only took a few minutes, sitting at the bar next to an incredible selection of tequila, for us to realize how wickedly cool this place is. Yes. Wicked. I realize it was a church. It has candles, art work, exposed wooden trusses, the original stained glass windows, and an altar dedicated to libations.  The first thing you may notice is the extra-ordinary chips and salsa (see photo below) which includes a medium spiced main dish. It is complemented with three more varieties of salsa to spice it up a bit. This is the first bowl of chips and salsa that we have failed to finish. It's generous! And there was a lot of great food and beverage to enjoy...  The Fresh Ceviche was a perfect item to follow the chips. It had mango, avocado, shrimp and bay scallops with onion, tomato and peppers. It was light and refreshing and highly recommended.  In order to sample the most menu on this trip, we each ordered a three taco plate with sides. The Spanish rice was the only low point on my plate. It sounded promising but didn't deliver much more than most similar dishes. My girlfriend's street corn was unbelievable. We agreed that if it was the only thing on the plate, we would've been happy. It made up for the less than zesty rice.  We shared and compared notes, so I can say that all six tacos were enjoyable. The only taco she didn't care for was the shrimp. However, the pulled Guild Chicken was surprisingly moist and had great texture. The Chipotle Cherry Streak was a surprise. Great marinade! And my favorite... The Ono taco which had the single most generous portion of grilled fish I've ever had on a taco! Great sauce and the usual cabbage accompaniment. Plus, I've never had Ono on a taco! This was a very filling and satisfying meal!  Our bar tender Selena was amazing! We were greeted and received our beverages promptly. Not only was she friendly, but she had cool anecdotes to share about the premises. We will be asking for her excellent service the next time we are in the area.  Judging by my Yelp! motto, I'd be one happy camper if Taco Guild was my last meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guild Chicken, Chipotle Cherry Steak, and Ono!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tTQWQBET3RSUTt5PVZ9fzQ.text: Take me to church! Or at least if church is like Taco Guild, I'd be there errday!  Located about 3 miles north of downtown PHX (N 7th & Osborne), Taco Guild is in an old church complete with stained glass and gothic candelabras - the coolest vibe. They have a great outdoor patio with light misters to keep you comfortable, but we ventured inside to enjoy the ambiance. The hubby and I really wanted to order the street corn and found that they have a special - if you order 3 tacos, you get a side of street corn (on the cob or off) for only $2.75, so we both chose that. Margaritas ordered, we dove into our tacos. I chose the adovada pork, yucatan shrimp, and the guild chicken. My least favorite was the pork. I should've gone with the al pastor. The chicken was my favorite and I could have ordered 3 more of those! The street corn was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. The habanero butter and chipotle mayo made the overall flavor perfection.  3 tacos and a side is plenty for one person. We were both full after we finished our plates. They do give you complimentary tortilla chips for the table which includes a trio of sauces - a chili-spiced salsa, a green thick tomatilla-esque sauce, and a red habanero sauce. Mmmm!  When we visit PHX again, this place will definitely be on the list!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street corn
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yucatan Shrimp taco, Guild Chicken taco, Pork Adovada taco

EQbj73JjuKkewKc7IwLTTg.text: Went here tonight to bring my brother in law from out of town and wow was I disappointed. I mean this when I say, the tacos tonight were the most underwhelming sad excuse for high end tacos. I ordered the mahi mahi taco and the pork pineapple taco. The fish taco I legitimately removed the mass of lettuce to see if there was any fish in there...there was, but barely! What a joke. I've had better fish tacos from a 2 dollar taco stand on the side of the road. The pork taco equally bad. I remember back in the day it would have all this wonderful fresh pineapple on top...not a single piece present on this taco. All and all a really disappointing experience.

vcUOg5WiQKSx2Noqs4ZS7g.text: Great tacos and service is a cool old church. We sat at the bar and the service was great. A must go!

aN5-WCkUDgUpc0ottxb1jw.text: Taco Guild is great. I've been here a couple times as well as had their food at the various Taco Festivals around the Phoenix area. Haven't had anything I didn't enjoy.

CjinfM7Wwmoz5DEqOXsuVw.text: Awesome food! AAAAHHHHMAZING DRINKS & Great Service!!! If you sit at the bar, Kelly makes a bomb ass Margarita!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Kmc3s07BvZ2WTMTDp8C_Eg.text: This place is a trendy place for sure. The food is different; not great.   If you're looking for authentic tacos and elote, this is not your place.

jgnp5Ku-NwY_Pt3QSa1TGA.text: This is my first review. I've never left a review on a place before. Why? Well if an establishment delivers the service they promote, well good for them. Why review someone just because they do their job? That's what their continued business and paychecks are for.  If it is less than satisfactory, well maybe it was an off day for the staff or management. We all have bad days. I chose to go there and I can choose to not go back.   Taco Guild however does not fall into either category which is why I will take the time to share my experience.   To be honest, I was skeptical about coming in. They proudly advertised #2 Mexican Restaurant in the US right on their website. A lot to live up to don't you think? Well, let me tell you, whoever is #1 better be serving edible gold because Taco Guild would never be a runner up on my list.   From the moment we walked in the vibe was contagious. We were created be exceptionally friendly staff and seated almost immediately. Upon seating our server, Jordan, greeted us with a warm smile and was more then generous with his time throughout the evening in offering us suggestions and tips from the menu. Jordan was readily available at all courses. We never once waited for service. He was friendly, outgoing and very knowledgeable in the food selections.   From our appetizers, to our tacos, to our desert and all the way to our drinks at the end, Taco Guild was second to none. The atmosphere was great! Seated in an old church, it was quaint enough to feel cozy, but light enough to keep up with energy of its incoming customers. This was our first time here but it won't be the last. We left with full stomachs and happy hearts, already talking about our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

flxoz8pxWojLC4j9Dpyq8g.text: Huge fan of street tacos and these did not disappoint. I did the steak, al pastor, and duck, the flavors that came out of each one of these was out of this world. I paired it with the corn on the cob, literally the best corn I've had in my life. Price point is a little high, just over $17 for 3 tacos and corn on the cob.  Size wise; while street taco sized (small) were stuffed!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck, Steak, Al Pastor

qjbIw7Sf4MAR2CXs-rgjHw.text: I had the pleasure of going for brunch today. I was definitely surprised and highly impressed. I will be back for more. Also, looking forward to trying lunch/dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahhhhmazing!

4-m0EN9ERciefBTYa6MzOw.text: Great variety of tacos and their drinks are fantastic.  Evenings are a bit on the loud side but fun atmosphere.   Pricing is about average.

JCNlS2nJha6TbfM1uUcIoA.text: Visiting family and they insisted we stop by! After taking a step inside I could see why! The restaurant is beautiful and they had a busy Saturday morning brunch crowd. Our server Lauren was sweet and very attentive. The menu was nice and we all enjoyed our picks. I personally had the Coconut French Toast and Tres Leches Cake, both were amazing. I would definitely recommend taking the time to check this place out!

FDUqzAbpjYKZs-AzPcJg8g.text: super cool spot, a church turned into restaurant. Their tacos are amazing and the portions are definitely worth the price. A must if you have never been there before!

wn-vz5HypBmA7372AfGtPg.text: Great food, great atmosphere and great service! Their happy hour is awesome and I love all of their selections! I LOVE their chips and salsa and their drinks are great too! Highly recommend!

GkXCXAwlwD8R05Oj6hbL3A.text: Based in an old church, the restaurant has a really cool vibe. Points for atmosphere.  Highly recommend getting the street corn on the cob, and for a taco place, apparently the salads are really good too.

MfpdEiTI1WR9J_ViI5NiQQ.text: Food is good, service is fast but I have one big complaint.  I love a chunky guac like anyone else but the chips are so flimsy you can't scoop it up with them without a utensil.  Less chunky guac or sturdier chips guys.  You decide.

VttbzpjOGm4zzYSrz0G5Hw.text: Been there twice and the restaurant and service have been nice. I love the decor and the atmosphere. The cherry steak tacos have got to be my favorite. Their rice seems a bit overlooked , but it's something one can look past.

GI58QaAz-Y67yahcCjR8Nw.text: This place was pretty tasty. $10 for 3 different tacos. Crazy as it seems, the mashed potatoes taco was awesome. As was the pork and cheese one. Great restaurant inside a converted church. Would come again if I lived here.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mFIhWls4PhXRpkBxyv2PAQ.text: This should be a zero star experience.  Came in at about quarter to 8 on a Saturday night.  Can't say the host was particularly welcoming.  The decor and menus were interesting but we were completely ignored by all of the waitstaff walking by for a good 15 minutes.  Departed.  Phoenix has plenty of other places to spend our money.  Taco Guild fail!

2o1AlHh9Q3CPV_hTusZbcg.text: Good tacos, cool vibe, very busy but I understand why.  I went for lunch a few times but probably a great happy hour, probably a great place for having drinks and not just tacos

dFNkp4yMfv1mP0BS403Sow.text: That was an hour of my life that I will never get back.  The food sucked.  The server had our (cold) tacos to us before our guacamole and queso appetizer that we ordered first.  Then when we choked down our braised beef tacos that they clearly burnt in old coffee, we asked where the appetizer was and she said they were "out of queso."  So she brought the guac which tasted like garbage even after we tried our hardest to Doctor it up with hot sauce, lime, and salt.  F this place.

AUTc8RYj8sVykTs30yqOHA.text: Eric gave great service and information at the bar, his food and drink recommendations were on point. The deviled eggs are a must. The guacamole was good, and the lamb taco was ok, just needed a little more flavor-salt. The chips and salsa were delicious!! Can't wait to come back.

4uvCRnbFeISnEBHLS9pVyA.text: I really enjoyed this clever built restaurante. It's my church session on Sundays to come in and enjoy some fresh tacos and margaritas :). Love to ride my bike here and enjoy the urban atmosphere.

iGpdm3NOtBDDrFSDOYvhcQ.text: I highly recommend you visit Taco Guild once to see how they remodeled the former church.  The tacos are very good.  I also recommend the street corn.  It is loud on a Saturday night in the main dining area, but that just adds to the ambiance.  The service was solid which made for an enjoyable dining experience.

ngyG0bern-jHEtkgQkHc0A.text: high quality ingredients that are well prepared, along with friendly service and downright spiritual experience in this repurposed house of God :)

2wZnCdfBGyVHVcwgvJtFtw.text: Taco Guild is an elitist hipster's worst nightmare. You order exquisite small dishes, start thinking about your next blog post about grilled romaine, cap it off with a craft cocktail, and then see "Z'Tejas" on your credit card statement the next morning.

yqD-sH1PDQaQ0UOrQvlbTA.text: Travel channel, thanks so much.  Glad for the business but, parking sucks. Love the food. Live the service.  Love the "vibes".

LNX1KjlT_brdje3Qm8ym4w.text: This place is a foodie's dream!!! Local ingredients, and I mean like really local, like next block over local, local brews, handcrafted cocktails to go with hand crafted tortillas, no pre blend mixes here! Just awesome all over. Nick is one of the realist waiters I've ever met. So good! I'm so full I can't breathe because it was all amazing. Live the concept, love the food, love the personality!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stained glass makes you feel like singin a hymn...to your margarita!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Urban bean steak, cherry steak, and al pastor tacos with street corn.

TIa_q-SEK_k0eePUZP_Bkw.text: Awesome atmosphere, great service, and couldn't be more pleased with our happy hour decision to come here. We ordered tacos, sweet corn, and spoiled ourselves with tres leches cake. Everything was delivered quickly and tasted amazing. I loved the style of the place. They played good music and didn't overwhelm you with TV's (only two high up behind the bar). They only turned on the TV volume for the Kentucky Derby race but immediate turned it back to music after the race was over and everyone cheered for the triple crown winner. I will definitely be back for more tacos.

gLGmu0ctpr9IgF5u_8GHWw.text: Very unique reuse of an old church, yes an old church that now serves great tacos, beers and tequila!   We tried many items on the menu and all were very tasty, moist and unique overall.  Good salsas (i preferred the smaller red and green salsas personally.  Great atmosphere and decor!  We'll certainly be back again!

i3GI79LZP2mF7O6zjoF7rA.text: Top happy hour spot - classy energetic atmosphere - daily taco specials and two margaritas will set you back a mere $15 - food excellent - chips with multiple salsas - 3 street tacos - special tacos offered daily - and nice strong and tasty frozen margaritas - you will be happy with the hours you spend here

g9z2YWtGDJ-DTuUAwg_r_A.text: We honestly went here as a backup to our first choice that had an hour long wait, but  were pleasantly surprised when this place came up. It's set in an awesome old church with a beautiful layout. Can be noisy, especially with live music, but the patio was just right for an evening date. The house margaritas were delicious and the coffee braised beef was very tasty. Guild chicken taco was definitely good, but pretty normal with the flavor. A good safety net if you need it. Check this place out!

e3qqQtL1F2epdypRZKQ-CQ.text: The church is interesting and worth taking a look, but provides a poor ambience for a restaurant. It really loud and sound echos, kinda like an old church.    If your going for Mexican food look elsewhere, all you will find here is pretentious fu fu taco's. I tried several and they were OK, but nothing that would make this place worth visiting more than once.

WIGoINISSU4SL8Bg1b7Izg.text: This place defines customer service. Wow wow wow. First off let me just say that this is my second yelp review about this place and rightly so. Not only am I a True repeat customer as I have been in numerous times after my first visit i feel like I'm now a friend of of the establishment as I know some of the amazing people that work there. One person in particular continues to stand out as AMAZING in everything he does. That is the general manager Justin. When I first met him I thought I was speaking to the owner as he has love and respect for what he does that is out of this world. This man bleeds tequila to say the least. His knowledge of the product is out standing. I have learned so much from him about not only the different kinds of tequila but the history of tequila in general. I used to come for the amazing tacos, great atmosphere, and good vibes, but now I come for the knowledge and history as well. This is all thanks to the GM Justin. Its incredible what he does for this place. Truly incredible. Taco Guild has a customer for life in me. If you haven't been GO. You will not be disappointed. If you don't know Tequila and want to learn about it, have a seat at the bar and allow Justin to paint a picture for you.   Justin thank you for the hospitality. If you ever open your own place, not only would be amazing but you would have me and my friends as regulars!  Kelvin

rKq7UERh6V4GOhdNNgXSpg.text: Totally impressed with the Taco Guild! Last night was our first visit and the interior is very inviting. Lot's to look at and an intimate but very open feel. There were candelabra's on a couple high tops in the center that were a little too bright but not a deal breaker.  Adam was our server and he knows his stuff. We asked for his suggestions for margarita's and taco's and he was spot on. I am not a fan of frozen margaritas but their house - $5 happy hour margi was awesome. We tried the veggie, duck and lamb taco's with a side of guacamole and their vegan beans. Everything was perfect, seasoning and flavors were bold and unique and the speed & timing of service & delivery was the best. We will be back and will bring our friends!

T0qy5MLLK3vUGTXzKU6N0A.text: Went for lunch. We were greeted promptly, and seated as such. The menu is simple. A small selection of appetizers and entrees. My friend and I decided to sit at the bar after  realizing the chairs at the tables were a bit uncomfortable. The ambience is very nice. Started with the chips and salsa. Very good. There was a sauce that looked like ketchup that was delicious and spicy. My favorite. For tacos, we had the shrimp, the lamb, a beef taco, and the chipotle cherry steak taco. All were fabulous, but one stood out. The chipotle cherry steak taco was out of this world. Amazing. And the wait staff was super friendly. We can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hS5loYQaw4Y7ZHPzqrRcMw.text: First time, and I'll start by saying DELICIOUS! They start you with chips and salsa, 4 different salsas at that! They are all so good and flavorful. I had a house margarita on the rocks, and that was made to perfection. I ordered chicken enchiladas served with rice and beans. Wasn't a huge fan of the beans, but the enchiladas and rice def recommend! It was so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House margarita, chips and salsa
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken enchiladas

MXS_5XtW9pujESSIZo0CpA.text: Taco Guild is in a renovated church and we actually sat on one of the pews used as part of a booth. The stained glass windows are beautiful and the center chandelier is magnificent. The staff was welcoming, pleasant, and attentive to our needs.  That aside, the food was very good. Chips and salsa are complimentary and were really delicious. Our party couldn't get enough of the salsa variety.   We had a party of four and everyone ordered something different. All were satisfied with their food choices although my single taco came with nothing and sides have to be ordered separately. Burritos had rice and beans, which were very tasty. It would have been nice to have a little cup of beans or rice with the taco (you get a free side only if you order 3 tacos - too many for me). I had a shrimp taco and ordered a side of local vegetables. The shrimp was plentiful and very tender; the side veggies consisted of zucchini, squash, red bell peppers and Brussel sprouts (the Brussel sprouts were barely visible - only two leaves). I like that they were locally grown; they were fresh and cooked nicely; however, it was too small an amount (about 1/4 cup size) and made me want more.  I would suggest going at an off time since the parking is horrendous. Good food, great venue.

r4aS9Ja5nXxmmFI1-BR5LA.text: I like this spot. the tacos are delicious and they make a ceviche that is pretty good. Oh yeah, the one thing that caught my eye was a drink called the "conversationalist" (or something) it was a shot of the tequila of the day and a beer. NICE!!!

RCNwglfb7ytF_509q_wgwQ.text: Solid tacos. Solid service. Great place for a quick lunch. I like the taco with the coffee flavor added.

DCaaGIBLKes1Rj3GzUEPcg.text: Ok sooooo I didn't really eat here but I could tell I wasn't going to like it after reviewing the menu and then reading a New Times happy report card on how this restaurant is owned by Z Tejas. There are two things Z Tejas does right which are margaritas and chips and dip. Nothing else. Chips and salsa were meh. The happy hour here is terrible. One taco on special and draft beer for $6? It made me sad so I went to Gallo Blanco and turned my frown upside down.

BsSFdBwIUZOftNRsu3KTaw.text: Super hip place with an amazing musician to entertain us. Of the 4 of us in our party they got one order right on the first try. I ordered one shrimp taco and one chicken taco, both on corn tortillas. They delivered me a lamb and a chicken on flour. It went back and came back correct except I got flour tortillas instead of corn. I just kept them. My husband ordered one duck and one lamb taco on flour. He got 2 completely different tacos. When his came back he enjoyed the lamb but found the duck to be cold and greasy. The third person in our party got the tacos she ordered but they were sure to tell her that the beef taco had no cheese. She did not request it without cheese so they took it back and brought it back as ordered. The manager came by to apologize and offered us free dessert. We took them up on this and got one slice of coconut cream pie which my husband and I enjoyed a lot. Our companions got the Tres Leches cake and also enjoyed it.

ttm48uyAeRQhgUuBq8WNHA.text: I have been meaning write a review on this amazing place! They have such AMAZING FOOD AND ADULT BEVERAGES! The ambiance is soo vibey too! The street tacos are to die for and the grilled romaine salad is DELICIOUS!!!  After trying the tres leches dessert with a friend I was in absolute aww with it. I had requested that my family order my bday cake from here! It did not disappoint and they actually took the time to add a little Happy Birthday card with it! This place is definitely a must!

NqmypR7cWuv2p-7ngP1rGA.text: Solid three stars for sure. The atmosphere is awesome, the staff are great, but the tacos were no bueno. The steak taco was probably the best that we had out of our sampler. The rest were a little fatty, so we didn't get to eat a lot of the meat in our tacos. It was a lot of awkwardly pulling out the fatty parts of the taco meat. The Elote was really yummy though, and we loved the salsa variety.  Oh, also, our server gave us a little mini history on the church that the restaurant resides in and they have items from a time capsule left by the church on their back wall. Definitely an original touch! Loved that!

kl5lw98SCM5saGKY5iiU7w.text: Our favorite of all restaurants!  EXCELLENT food (yay street corn!)  We love the people who work here, and always are made to feel like family.  And, we don't have to tell anyone how hard it is to find that "community" feel at a popular restaurant these days.    Street corn, tacos, meatballs, fundido...all mouthwatering and unique.    We love it SO much that...  We had our wedding here this past August, and there are NOT enough words to say how much we love this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

stZ-PgH5OxwZ56olsOVDtQ.text: Cool place with delicious tacos! I was there on a busy Friday night and even though it seemed a little hectic all the employees were very nice and service was speedy! I got the vegetable taco and cherry stake taco and oooohh my goodness I'm still thinking about how mouth watering they were. Can't wait to bring my friends to this awesome joint!

mRVGYJhCc-HlhMttj76ZyA.text: A M A Z I N G.     The food presentation is fresh and crisp.  They make Tacos glamorous again.  I never get a weak drink there either.   The decor gets best in show for the murals on the wall.  If you have happy feet you will love taco guild and the staff that works there.

oB1uHRF0DNz2l2H4718RIA.text: The Taco Guild was not that great of an experience! The restaurant is trendy, beautiful, has a lot of character, and a creative menu, but that's where the pro's ended, and why they're getting the 2 stars. I found this place through an event advertisement on Facebook for their 125th anniversary, and decided it sounded like it would be quite the event, so I drove my family of 5 almost 30 miles to try the food and festivities planned for today. We should've stayed home and saved the $100! The waiter was friendly and polite, when we actually saw him, which was almost never. We never did get the sugar we requested twice for our ice tea, so we gave up. We ordered a variety of tacos (Tequila Chicken & Carne Asada) some on corn tortillas, and a few on lettuce cups, but the tacos all showed up on corn tortillas. We also ordered sides of beans, chips, salsa, and queso. The taco meats were cold (chicken and steak), and the steak was not only cold it was dry and tough as if it had been precooked and chopped for quite some time. The salsa varieties are good and tasty, but the queso was also very cool, and was no longer a dip since it had already thickened up. I don't know if this was an atypical experience for this place, but to spend $100 on a dinner that was very poorly executed, and waste the gas from Buckeye to fight rush hour traffic is disappointing to say the least. Of course I would've mentioned a lot of these things to our waiter, had he actually came by the table more than just to take our order, drop our food, and leave a check.

WmkT-N34iuj1guRmXMP-xg.text: My favorite restaurant in the phoenix metropolitan area! My girlfriend and myself regular this place even though the drive is far from where we are. Parking can be difficult however the "free" valet solves that issue and the drivers are typically very friendly. I would VERY HIGHLY recommend this restaurant to those looking for a unique and delicious night out

hIQDIbL6Vwi3r7C1BJXMdg.text: The food isn't stand-out but the drinks are pretty good, and the building and environment makes it a super fun happy hour spot! It's built in an old church with stained glass windows in midtown!

gKjvYzmxRgf7vEBIVpPBLQ.text: I visited Taco Guild with a friend recently and really enjoyed it. The decor is very cool and authentic, it is a renovated church and had great charm.  Service was quick and friendly. The salsa choices were delicious and the complimentary chips were really fresh.   I will certainly make another visit as I've just opened an office down the street!

6x_c1plGHg-EuWvsWf7_JQ.text: Don't order to go. Seriously I was told 20 minutes I expected more. It's been 45 minutes and haven't been given an update or anything. It's not even busy either. This rating is solely based on the service I received. And still receiving as I sit here waiting for my order.

FMfrLGgammii87XaP3YPVg.text: Called in on our way back from Grand Canyon to confirm the hours. The girl said they are open until 11pm. Great! We got there around 10:15pm and were told that after 10pm they do not have the full kitchen and have only 1 item available - Taco and that too only 1 kind. Really disappointed!

QBYo-M6bjZ74xhQJIPwjOA.text: One of my go to places in Phoenix. Lunch service yesterday was spotty. Ordered the happy hour margarita took at least 15 minutes to get it.  Friend asked for extra habanero salsa. We never got it. Had the street corn. $3.95. Reasonable price. And my fav in Phoenix.  Cherry Chipotle Steak Taco w corn, is plenty of food.  The lamb taco is still my fave. The Peking Duck is awesome too.  Be a bit patient w the help. Super nice people. I feel they may be understaffed

DnVXw5tOnRPIBIb9Qzy3eg.text: Tacos are on point I have never had ducks or lamb tacos before and man it's amazing most definitely recommend this place.

T6CPnqdG69cA_lZL-2KFWg.text: Neighborly. So, I looooooove the developer of this restaurant. Really good guy that helped out neighboring communities during construction. This place also holds separate special feelings because it is the first place my (now) husband and I went together without friends. But we recently got food to go from here and it was just 'ok' which left me wanting a more elevated experience. We ordered for four ppl and the tacos were good. I got the ceviche and that was really good. We also received these strange seasoned pita chips that no one really cared for. I know this place has more potential and I will try again, because that's what neighbors do.

5nVHMOtYfvnsKcbCyH6w5g.text: We came in with a group of 9, and had the best service I've had in a long time! Our server, Selina, was amazing! We're sort of a wild group (loud and unorganized) and she handled us with the best smile, and quick service! We were very impressed by her menu knowledge and dish suggestions! She even recommended a few local spots to visit while in town from Seattle, and she nailed it! Thanks again for the great visit!

QLROcDX5YIz3fc8SpU2Ljw.text: Too much hype..tacos are over priced and tasteless which they try to make it up in the not so well paired salsas in the tacos. Service was great very attentive. If I was to give it a second chance it would prob just be for the beer and apperizers.

fZARnsJNSeHaAM3g9z2qmQ.text: Outstanding service from Rhianna and Manager Garth.  The food was okay, not great but not bad.  We had the chicken tacos, good but bland.  The shrimp taco was not great, overpowered by sub-par non fried corn tortilla and cabbage.  The beef taco was pretty good as was the rice.  We tried the duck taco but did not care for it.  The manager was great and so courteous that we will no doubt give it an open minded second try.  Our server Rhianna was also outstanding.  The atmosphere is eclectic, contemporary, comfortable and overall urban hip pleasing.  We enjoyed the experience, however wish the food was better.

8srs6Fj1hvqkU_n9RKp5Aw.text: By now, you've probably all seen what this place looks like either on the news, Yelp! or Instagram, and it truly is beautiful inside. I came with some family members for Happy Hour. I was offered a drink, but declined stating I was going to wait a bit for the rest of my party. Well the server took that to mean that I wasn't going to drink at all that night and routinely ignored me when taking everyone else's drink orders once they arrived. The food was decent. Nothing earth-shattering, inventive or innovative. The blended margarita was good, and the wine was tasty, but as my uncle said "just because the restaurant looked like a church doesn't mean they have to give us communion sized portions!" Will I come back? Yes, several friends want to try it out. Are there better options? Yes! I'm dying to get back to Gallo Blanco. Better tacos! And less expensive!

QuqxUjhTyb83VCkeZuOYSg.text: I love this place. My favorites are the sweet corn and cherry steak taco. I crave this place!!

mZ3vGiaTeUfamCCMCISXdQ.text: The food, atmosphere and service was amazing!   The BEST street corn I have ever tasted.  Will  be back here often.

CvpmzdWFB21yPz_AisbBCw.text: Taco Guild by far is the best. The Adovada tacos, Posole, and Street corn are FABULOUS!! Their staff are awesome too including the managers who care about your dining experience. The margaritas are OUTSTANDING! Such a variety and the energy and expertise of the bartenders completes the Taco Guild experience. Wish there were 10 stars, they'd certainly get them from me!!

ibbFpCo5r3ZeiVo2HFvcaw.text: Cool venue. Great vibes on the weekends. The tacos are absolutely delicious and the service is great!

FlRixy78Ugz3IUwsYcHtvg.text: Life sized murals of Rembrandts line the walls in this high ceilinged church turned restaurant. The stained glass inspires one to an earlier age of divine purpose with quotes such as "love...in deed and in truth." At the center hangs a massive gothic wrought- iron chandelier with candles (LeD).   You will find many more like them throughout.  The two large communal tables also feature gothic candelabra center pieces, giving the place the same ambiance and feel of a Guild Hall from the 1600s. Lighting is low and alluring, noise level one you would expect at a gastropub.  On a  Tuesday night the place was very busy, which says a lot about an establishment.  Very impressed with the bartenders, so skilled at their  craft and knowledgable about the menu.  Ambiance and decor I give this place 4 stars. Service and Staff: 4 stars. Food is sadly only 3 stars, and here is why.  First off, the drinks are amazing!  Great craft cocktail menu overall as well as many local beers on draft such as Cartel, Papago, Four peaks and San tan. The Blushing senorita was my favorite! Coppola rosso, hangar one berry vodka, raspberries, blueberries and blackberries.  Order it as the Virgin Senorita for a fabulous non-alcoholic cocktail.  We ordered the The Duo Guild which is one small portion each of their guacamole and the queso. Upon a recommendation, we ordered the Guac with the jalapeno bacon.  Sadly all we could taste was bacon, and I personally feel that bacon has no place in Guacamole, unless you don't like the taste and texture of Avocados.  So, the bartender happily switched out our order and gave us the traditional Guac instead.  It essentially tasted like smashed avocadoes, and lacked any specific flavor or spice level.  You get spoiled when you have Guacamole at places like the "Mission", so we were very unimpressed.  The Queso was unremarkable, it virtually tasted like the Nacho cheese you get at the movie theater.    Next came the House salad with cilantro dressing.  While the creamy and flavorful cilantro dressing is delicious, the lettuce had all the appeal of a cheap bag of iceberg in a bag at the grocery store, and the sliced avocados on top did not help much.  The side of Corn off the cob grilled in jalapeno butter was a side we ordered along with our three tacos, but aside from a little heat at the end also remained uninspired.  This restaurant being called "Taco Guild", I was ready to be wowed and to find some divine inspiration in one of my favorite comfort foods.  We sampled the Al pastor, the  taco, cherry steak, and lamb.  Al Pastor: Grilled pineapple, jalapeno bacon, pickled red onion.  Least favorite.  When you have been in the south of Mexico and noshed on an Al Pastor from a street vendor, with merely the flavor of the succulent and marinated meat and fresh cilantro and a squirt of lime - you get disappointed when every restaurant wants to add pineapple and weird pickled onions or essentially just distract you from the fact that the meat itself isn't all that great. So, no bueno on this one.  The Cherry Steak Taco.  Crispy poblano onion straws, chile aioli, bleu cheese.   Awesome!  And then just a bit strange.  Disclaimer: I love bleu cheese, and it pairs well with a good cut of meat.  Add the onion straws and a little kick of chili and it's a very good combination - but it doesnt really taste like a taco but a steak wrap.  Completely americanized taco, in my opinion not a good choice for the taco purist.  The Molida Lamb taco.  Creole aioli, bleu cheese, sweet potato hay.  Again, same interesting combination as above, but I don't think lamb works with bleu cheese or creole seasonings.  My tastebuds prefer mediterranean combinations.  This would have been great with a garlic tzatziki instead of bleu cheese.  I would definitely come back here for cocktails and socializing, the salsa and chips are excellent, and I would possibly sample other items on the menu - but when I have a Taco craving I would rather venture to Joyride or basically any authentic Mexican taqueria where I know what to expect and pay $1-2 instead of $3-$5 for a taco that isn't really a taco.  Please add fresh cilantro to all your dishes.  I believe I spotted some, but it looked wet and tired and I tasted none of it.  Kudos to your incredible house hot sauces.  We loved all three, in mild medium and hot.  Mild is a green jalapeno which burns a tad at the end but delicious. Spicy, the habanero chili, is amazing!!! Medium is Chili Pequin (chile de Arbol, chili Pequin, tomato sauce, garlic, salt, white vinegar, agave nectar).  The chefs may be hesitant to kick the food up a notch, but I want to be the biggest fan of this place, as I love the space and the staff and the entire concept.  Just adding fresh cilantro and limes to the tacos, and maybe offering some more simple tacos for us purists, would create some enlightenment.

BfU-wikPtB7x7D1BFHFLvg.text: Came in for lunch to celebrate my birthday with some family. I love to try new places especially if it involves tacos. I tried, the lamb, duck and steak tacos and they were all amazing! Our service was top notch and even got a complimentary dessert for my birthday. I highly recommend Taco Guild to all of my fellow taco lovers!

BUk9dfGuOjZq2KlrfKdxig.text: Solid.  Tasty.  Very cool atmosphere.  I thought the service was excellent and the food choices were very good.  I believe many people would find the prices to be very reasonable too!  One thing I want to try next time is their varieties of guacamole.  They all seem to be delicious.    Worth going for sure!!!!

HGxeL6bgUHO0xJF_clSdNQ.text: I tried Taco Guild for the first time a few weeks back. We were booze cruising for a "friends" birthday and this was our first stop to grab some food. Walking in and realizing that the place was at one time a Methodist church was pretty cool and getting drunk in a old Methodist church was even better! First thing we noticed is that there really isn't a ton of tables so I would assume that there can be some pretty heft wait times during the busy hours.  4 of us bellied up to the bar as the tables were packed. Our bartender/waitress was awesome and was very helpful as 3 of us never ate there before. Looking over the menu, there wasn't a massive amount of items to choose from which was a pretty nice change of pace. I got the grilled steak burrito as it looked to be the most appetizing thing on the menu to me (i'm not an overly adventurous eater, I like simplicity). We had a bowl of chips and salsas/hot sauces and I ended up eating a whole thing of it on my own lol. The regular house salsa was awesome, not too spicy but a decent kick after a few chips. There was a habanero hot sauce that was pretty good as well.  Once my steak burrito came out, I jumped right in. I used some of the salsas/hot sauces but the food did not need it at all. The steak was cooked perfect and was juicy and some of the best I've eaten in Phoenix (I am a HUGE carne asada buff too). I destroyed the burrito in no time and probably could have eaten another one but decided against it as we were biking around Phoenix and it was hot.   My buddy got a couple of the lamb tacos and I was blown away by it. I HATE blue cheese with a passion, its gross and just no. I took a bite of one of the tacos with everything on it and it was amazing. We ended up ordering a few more before taking off.  I have been thinking about this place nonstop since I ate there but haven't had the chance to from being busy. I will probably get the same thing again as I said, nothing else looked like my cup of tea (other then the lamb taco) and I will enjoy every second of it.  I gave 4 stars because i will honestly only eat the 2 things I mentioned but its a 5 star joint, prices were very fair and the drinks were made right.

Hpba2Z1MMr1h49BY2l8C7A.text: Oh, it's hipster. Yes, very hipster. But it's cool and good.   Housed in a vacated Greek Orthodox church, they've done a lovely job by leaving the stained glass windows and murals and making the vestibule into a small dining area.  Not many food options, limited menu. I got the tacos because they had interesting options...lamb and duck were my choices. The rest of the menu is kind of meh and overpriced.   Service really sucked but I'll give them a pass on that because they have only been open for two weeks.

Wlw_XDNNb2jAS_jSZDsDwA.text: Writing this actually makes me sad.  I would actually like to rate it a 2.5 but I'm being kind and rounding up because I am hugely appreciative of what they have done with the building.  That being said when architecture is the 1st thing that comes to mind when talking about a restaurant, there is probably some room for improvement.  The usage of the space is remarkable. It's a very trendy looking place with warm tones and despite it being one large open room, they were able to pull off at least the appearance of intimacy. But that's where the warmth stops.  The deafening mix of customer driven music selection is way too loud. It is almost impossible to hear anyone even at a small four top without leaning in and utilizing your best lip reading skills.  And if the owners could limit the techno trance options to maybe 1/3 of the options, I would gladly toss in another half star.  The bar is spectacular however, so if you just want someplace to just soak in the atmosphere, park yourself under the magnificent chandelier and drink it in.  The menu is less than user friendly.  Everything listed is ala carte, however there seem to be combos available which only appear to be available to people on the inner circle.  We even asked if there was a possibility of getting a quesadilla (since tortillas and cheese are key components of several items) and were told that if it's not listed on the menu, it is not available.  The prices are way out of line with other similar venues.  The tacos are $4 per and they are the smallest street tacos I have seen in a very long time. They are not bad. They are just four bites and that is way too steep.  The burros are reasonably priced for what you get, so go with one of those if you don't eat like America's Next Top Model. The salsas (both fresh and bottled) are good but the chips come straight out of a bag and that irritates me. If you are going to sell yourself as a gastropub, you need to be able to carry off the "gastro" portion of the title. Everything else seems fresh, why would you chintz on the chips?!!  And the $8 guacamole? It's ok but no more. Yes it's fresh and clearly made on site but it is not worth even half that. I love that you can select chunky or smooth but that is where the love story ends.  Service is my final pick point. Our order taker was very friendly, but the four other people that sporadically delivered food left a lot to be desired.  There was a five minute lag between the first taco hitting our table and the last burro... unacceptable; and then we had to ask for the guacamole that was delivered and then were told they had given it to another table by mistake. They took that off the check but it just added to the already uneven service.  So I will probably give it another try after they have had some time to work the kinks out.  And I truly hope they do. Like I said, I'm unbelievably happy they have saved the building and I like what they have done with it for the most part. Now if they could just bring the food up to level of the space and work on the service it would be great place to hang out.

Hq8yY0X6I6Vh6Sm94hFsHA.text: Everybody Stay Away...because I love this place and I want to always get a table there!  Loved Taco Guild so much we went on a Friday night and back on Sunday for more of their delicious chips and salsas, burritos and a really delightful ceviche that changes frequently.  On Sunday the ceviche was shrimp and scallop....delicious. Fun DJ playing great music on Friday which made it all the better, oh, did I mention the building is an old church?  So cool. Like I said, don't go, it's all mine.

mHRosYsqoN7Kpri3RYD7vw.text: Love the food! Amazing frozen Margarita. Service a little slow.

XThU8k0v27uX2JhSpAAJJQ.text: Came here for lunch because so many people have suggested Taco Guild. I definitely give the ambiance 5 stars - this place is a remodeled church and it's really cool inside. I also give the service 5 star. Sat at the bar and the service we received was exceptional.  As far as the food - it was a bit mediocre to me. The tacos are upscale and depending on what kind you get, between $3 and $5 a taco. If you get three, you get a free side. For being this expensive, I figured there would be more flavor with the tacos. I've had much better at hold in the wall places to be honest.   The chips and guac were perfect though - I had that for the starter. Plus the salsa is very good as well. I'd give it a try if you're interested in checking it out - I'd probably go back for happy hour sometime.

2zN9-x1Lch5s_bc5T4QVNg.text: This is the True definition of gastropub (A public house which serves upscale food but with a primary mission of being a bar).  So, if a restaurant knows what they are, then I am not going to judge them on things that would never apply.  When I was in Ireland, did I make a reservation at a pub?  No! OK, enough on my thoughts on the commentary of reviews judging them on reservations, waiting on food, blah blah.    Now, let's get to the review.  We showed up with no reservation and I am not sure they even take them; but who cares?  It's an upscale pub.  We no sooner sat down when we were asked what we'd like to drink.  The beers here are only local breweries so if you want bud light, forget about it.    The tacos were unique street tacos. Very tasty and well presented.  I would recommend getting the queso/guacamole starter.  Be careful not to go crazy ordering food.  This operates just like a pub so you can order add-on. They don't have hot plate service so when food is done, it is brought to the table.  Like I said, order in small orders like you would ordering a pint with food in a pub and you'll get it.  The place is very nicely decorated and servers equally awesome.  About the only drawback is the parking and this location lacks it after 5:30 PM - of course that would explain the valet required.  This is a pub with fantastic food.  It's pretty 'dern unique and makes for a nice meet-up place before going large in the naked city of Phoenix.

jjD5F75F_D6zEkj3iRmufA.text: Had the Romaine Salad, which was very good..skip the up charge for the chicken..$4.00 for 4 small chunks of chicken...Won't do that again. The table next to us had ask if they had a Server...

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4XDcetd74AcqkZ50MNkcIw.text: Tacos with a twist. From farm to face, all of the food is very good and super fresh. I love the fact that they embraced the church feel, very trendy.the street corn and guacamole are a must. I am glad I found this place and I will definitely come back again. Overall great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old school feel

pQHhAG4VTkjGsg7BQuh7cw.text: Good place love the church feel,... I also love that they have allot of Spirit,.the taco are amazing get the duck,... you will thank me later.

8i4elfDh4AXhnmGvsEeduA.text: This is actually on Osborn and 7th street. what a great place, complex flavors at a good price. I recommend the "boots were made Oaxacan" cocktail. The building has a lot of history and really puts midtown on the map. All of the tacos were off the charts. Bang!

ECuhQgrJy7m6wMVuJVLZcA.text: I really want this place to be good. The atmosphere is amazing and they have a great concept. Unfortunately, my last 2 outings here have been a huge disappointment.Each time I've ordered 3 different tacos and all 3 were cold, This time, the chicken, which I was afraid to eat, was the coldest. Normally, I would have sent it all back but I was with a party of 5, and I didn't want to mess up the dinner. The side dish was a whole other story. The last time I was there they brought a bowl of corn that was (no joke) 50% oil. It was inedible. This time I specifically asked for street corn, which they normally cut off the cob at the table. After being assured this is what I would be getting, of course, they brought the bowl of greasy glop and denied that they scooped it out of a bin filled with butter. When I called them on it they assured me I was wrong. No point in fighting with them...just won't be going back.

W1c7ghQODjWCrJ-dVp1g_w.text: We went to Taco Guild on date night, food was OK, but they just try too hard.  Building a good Taco is not rocket science, Was a little expenses for two people. Drinks were small and overpriced also. Had great service and the manager came by to check on us.

FM-Nyj-DONDyf7pSig1HKg.text: AMAZING! Food, service atmosphere and prices are great, a real treat!

D5dhFn7eiUlmbG6dAq2nXA.text: Wonderful food. Excellent service. I recommend this gem of a restaurant to everyone. I will be back.

VumwjGMmGTwSMiqkB-KOxw.text: Tasty food in a wonderful atmosphere. Outdoor patio is fantastic. What a great use of an old building. Only thing j would change is the loud music. Conversation was difficult at times.

PDRAl9VI5AvMOT-jTK9XYQ.text: Right after I posted my review, someone from the restaurant contacted me. Super professional, apologized for the noisiness, acknowledged it was an issue and thanked me for my review. I don't know why, but that just totally impresses me. Will definitely go back!

kHqSqLxT2rOb9RzBaBrXJw.text: Let me just start off by saying that the place is absolutely beautiful! I love how they put their own twist to the old church! The place was packed during lunch time, but our server was still attentive and friendly. I got the trio tacos with street corn. A skirt steak taco I think- it was ok, the chicken taco- it was good and the veggie taco- phenomenal! So was the street corn! It was all really messy to eat and I probably looked like I was eating like as 2 year old, but I didn't care. I will definitely be going back for happy hour. The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is because the salsa wasn't very impressive. I mean, I still ate it and everything, but it needed something.. I think a taco place should always have amazing salsa.

chfGMkC2eCpuet7UYYroEg.text: EASILY my new favorite mexican restaurant in Phoenix! When I first saw the restaurant, it reminded me of The Mission in Old Town Scottsdale. Both are mexican restaurants set in old churches that have since been renovated, however upon entering Taco Guild I found the ambiance of Taco Guild to be much different. It is warm and inviting, with vaulted ceilings and almost an upscale pub feel. I loved it. We were sat right away, and we tried quite a bit of food. The chorizo meatballs were extremely tender and basically melted in your mouth. The queso dip had the perfect level of spice and an excellent texture. Their chips are very good, and their guacamole is made fresh and the perfect consistency of "not too smooth, not too chunky." I also ordered the a shrimp taco and a chicken taco on lettuce, and they were both wonderful. I love this place because it's affordable, charming, and has really excellent mexican food that is fresh and flavorful. I will absolutely be coming back soon!

Z1GUHCZp2e8wn3qP-QilTw.text: First let me start by saying I love the Taco Guild!!! My boyfriend and I went to Taco Guild last night for the first time, and it was incredible!  The decor of this place is unlike anything I have seen in Phoenix ever, and I've been here my whole life.  This place is housed in an old church and is nothing short of beautiful.  We sat down at the bar and were promptly greeted by Kristin. She was awesome!!  She was incredibly helpful with helping us choose food and cocktails!  For drinks I ordered The Blushing Senorita, which consists of Coppola Rossa, Hanger One berry vodka, fresh raspberries, blueberries and blackberries and my boyfriend ordered The Myth.  All I can say is Hallelujah! If you want the best hand made cocktail in town, sit at the bar at Taco Guild and ask for Kristin! She's definitely been studying her cocktail bible.  For Food, Kristin helped us decide what to order since we had never been there before.  We ended up ordering The Guild Duo to start and it was amazing! Awesome Guacamole and Fire Roasted Chile Queso that holds the key to my heart.  For dinner, I ordered the Molida Lamb Taco and the Cherry Steak Taco upon recommendation from Kristin.  My Boyfriend ordered the Thai Snapper Taco and the Peking Duck Taco.  These tacos were the best tacos we both have ever had! I have an addiction now and its for Taco Guild Tacos.  If you want THE BEST TACOS, COCKTAILS, AND BARTENDER, then go to Taco Guild and sit at the bar and ask for KRISTIN!!!  She gives impeccable service!!

S3YeBjvTKGMhAt6nlNmPdQ.text: Pros: - Beautiful architecture. The main room is very loud but if you sit in the front part of the former vestibule, it's much more pleasant. - Good sangria. - Friendly server. - Tacos are good, the lamb was my favorite.  Cons: - Expensive. I like America's Tacos just as much (and their corn is better) and my bill will be far less. Granted, not the same atmosphere, but come on, did Phoenix really need another place to get tacos?  - Service was iffy. Our party of five was willing to overlook given the business is new, despite this being a concept restaurant from an established restaurant chain that one would presume has its act together. But the food did not come at the same time, served one plate at a time with about 5+ minutes wait  in between. Only the first person served (who politely waited and ate his food cold) got exactly what they ordered. Only I got my dinner delivered from our server. The rest was brought by mystery staff who weren't all that friendly. - The charge for the bill was wrong. Our server blithely told us to pay however we wanted, so one of our party paid for two people and the entire tip. Two of us discovered the next day that the restaurant had charged each card 20% extra, effectively changing the amount from the signed slips.  The bottom line for me is, I would only go there again for an occasion. And I would take cash.

34bX_wc1l5dUEU4bA2PlsQ.text: I LOVE this place--great service, terrific food and a beautiful place!  I highly recommend that you try the corn (it is amazing) and if you have a hankering for spice, get the fundido.  We love their happy hour and pretty  much everything on the menu!

luke-DLr_VzBLHW6bzXoEw.text: I tried Taco Guild again and the second experience was WAY better the second time around.  I'll definitely be going back.  The service was awesome, music wasn't as loud, food was amazing as always.  This time we sat at one of the high tops instead of a booth and I thought it was way cooler to be able to look around and check out the cool design of the place.  On this visit I tried the veggie tacos and they exceeded my expectations--they were tastier than my non-veggie tacos since they were marinated (I think?) roasted veggies.  We also ordered the corn and had them cut it in half, one of my favorites.  We ordered cocktails and if it weren't for the price to strength of the cocktail ratio I would have given them 5 stars.  The drinks were good!....But, for the price ($9-$11ish) they had less alcohol than I'd prefer.  That's an expensive drink in my opinion and I'm not splurging for a second one at that price if it's a lot of filler.

gTNejT4990Whz-_XpTfL8A.text: I've been wanting to try this place since it has opened. It's close to my house and to have a good taco spot by the house makes me happy. I decided to take my mom out to dinner for her birthday since she wanted to try something new. Atmosphere and ambiance are definitely cool. As for the food it was not even that good. Everything we ordered was missing flavor. We started off with the guacamole with bacon. That needed ALOT of salt. And I don't even like salty food. I ordered the shrimp taco and the thai snapper. They were OK. You can definitely get better somewhere else for half the price. Their tortillas are weird too, too thick in my opinion. We also tried the corn and that was good, but again needed salt. Taco Guild needs to step up their game on FLAVOR!! I would only go back for a margarita and chips and salsa. Our waitress was not that great either. 2 stars is all you get Taco Guild.

p4fR3f3ILJEExiDew4v2cg.text: "A lovely atmosphere, decent service, but unacceptably bad food."  I deeply wanted Taco Guild to be a success.  That's not to say that my expectations were too high, only that I would enjoy a restaurant that fit this description.  I'm not even opposed to the concept - a la carte tacos, many of them gringo influenced.  However, when it comes down to it, this was a horribly conceived menu.  My date and I tried nearly every taco.  She reminds me to tell you how bad the salsa was.  This is True, in addition to all of their house-made hot sauces.  Something different tastes bad in each of them.  The mild red sauce, for instance, tasted bitter and bland.  We ordered an appetizer of ceviche.  Ceviche should be fresh and crisp.  This dish was a pile of mango salsa and scallops.  The tacos.  I don't even mind paying $5 a taco.  All of them were bad.  The meat in each is way too dry. The flavor combinations sound good on paper - but none of them were executed well.  We tried the pastor, the urban bean coffee braised beef, the lamb, the duck, the Thai snapper.  Bad bad bad.  Even the sides were bad.  The beans were a bowl of dirt and turmeric.  I will briefly mention the drinks.  I only tried "The Legend."  Roger Clyne's mescal with an orange liquor and ground pepper.  The $9 drink is a glass of orange juice.  I can't even just get drinks here.  I will say, I loved the decor, the converted church theme, the servers were friendly.  I even like Ztejas - so you'd expect this venture would be better.  Maybe if they retool the menu, but even so the damage is done.  Check out the cool building while it's still open.

0n74eH6X-fBEXfuRMwda5Q.text: These were the worst tacos I've ever had! No flavor at all..  I don't recommend this to any one! Service was  a 3 at best also.

a97S2cUrnErIVYllWanJLw.text: Building was gorgeous. Service had a little to be desired. Friendly, but not very efficient. We ordered burritos, probably should've ordered tacos. They were good, but not enough to bring me back. I would go back to try the tacos.

J5HCNclwJ37pnqBR2Bte8w.text: Loved it! Definitely will be back to try more items. Had the Veggie tacos and tried all the side items, everything was great! Atmosphere and the service was incredible and Timothy very informative.

W_W6WJL3T7k2UKmKEJV5-Q.text: Love the taco guild, the decor is amazing! The greeters were friendly! Service was fantastic, Tim our sever described everything to a T his recommendations hit the spot!! If your a bleu cheese fan have the lamb taco, the guacamole was splendid. Even though there was not a chocolate desert the prickly pear sorbet was to for for !!

J8iU66_NneVCpit2c9jbCw.text: HANDS DOWN BEST TACO JOINT IN AZ. Stop what you're doing and just go.  Go get some darn amazing tacos.  You can order so many different tacos from duck to lobster; lamb to beef. Street corn that's out of this world (on and off the cob available). Start off with guacamole with jalapeno bacon!  You won't be sorry! Reasonably priced too friend!

2BC6lc1VX1KDeKQXh0n2Wg.text: Roasted leg of lamb, coffee beef and short ribs.. Pretty good place with great atmosphere... I definitely would come back

UDcp6bmu0FT0wgP8Xj_-jw.text: Sooooo this is the third time I've been here and honestly it makes me not want to return ever again, sadly. Our waiter, Tommy was the worst. We got our appetizers AFTER our main course with no side of chips for our appetizer of different dips. We had to basically fight for his attention, clear our own plates from our table and wait forever for our checks. Weak margaritas too, which was a bummer. I've never felt so ignored at an establishment in my life. My first 2 visits were great and the food was so yummy but this experience left a real bad taste in my mouth. The service was so bad!!! I don't know if they were just understaffed tonight but their attitudes didn't help the situation. I was definitely disappointed.

u08aYhuJi_raVmmt8Fochw.text: Idk I kinda feel like I got ripped off. The food is good, ambiance is cool but considering three people ordered a few tacos and one round of drinks how did the tab come out to $84! Then with the "suggested" tip it totaled $101.  I mean it's tacos people, way small mini portions. The food was good but not great. Even my senior citizen parents thought the drinks were watered down. I won't be back. So disappointed.

h8zxNc-ktOwuTdu7hDE0ig.text: While nothing hardly trumps great food, the service at Taco Guild was nearly as impeccable. During my last visit to the restaurant, the manager stopped by our table to ask how we enjoyed our food. Undoubtedly, everything was delicious, but my friend mentioned noticing a recipe change - the duck taco was different than she remembered and she preferred the other version. In an extremely candid conversation, the manager explained that their chef had been trying multiple recipes, trying to lock down the "perfect" duck taco. He expressed gratitude for our transparency and treated us to their Tres Leches Cake, which was 10/10. That type of personable interaction, along with a delicious and eclectic array of tacos, is the kind of experience that will make me a loyal supporter of Taco Guild for years to come.   P.S., the cherry steak taco was out of this world!!!

upVyFzIV56xAO05d8kSksQ.text: Atmosphere absolutely great.  A hip place built about 1842 it was a school house and church.  Rich in history with beautiful stained glass windows and a wall full of history that came from a time capsule.   Good and drinks were flavorful and just a bit unique!

HPJJK1ZWnrnJALG-hR1Prw.text: Over Sold on TV and by the Hipsters.   Tacos are avg and expensive.   Staff was Great.    Coffee Beef Tacos were dry and unappealing.   Shrimp & Jalapeno Bacon was missing Bacon and Spice.  Pork Tacos were good but not great.   The salsa lacks imagination.  Chips were warm & tasty.  Beer selection varied and cold.     My expectations were too high going in, it was ok not great.

84d-VHK1PvSdMuLSaTN3ww.text: Delicious tacos at a beautiful place. The staff was so inviting and took great care of us from beginning to end! It's a place I've been intending to visit for a while and SO glad I did!!   I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos on Taco Tuesday during Happy Hour! How delicious!!!!! Beautiful setting, yummy tacos!

5A2oSsgUZ1u-6jR8C2V_bg.text: The tacos here are amazing! My favorites are the Cherry Beef, the short rib taco and the Al Pastor. The street corn is amazing as well!

dVetgpbVZWSlFV70ZJU_3w.text: This place is a masterpiece of upcycling a building.  It's an old church right next door to a Starbucks.  Really cool inside and great customer service.  Food was amazing and really good. Little on the pricey side for tacos but good.  I really liked the lamb ones they had two different.    My only complaints is minimal.    One is parking there isn't really a lot but they have complimentary valet.    Second is the live music because it's an old church sound bounces around. Combined that with yelling customers made it hard to really enjoys the great architecture and style of the restaurant.   All in all really great place and I will come back.

-YBw7Ic3JFZj7epVwkx92A.text: Great ambiance and service.  Tried the Duo appetizer with guacamole and cheese.  I felt like the guacamole needed some salt but otherwise was good, the cheese dip was delicious.  Chips and salsa (critical to any decent Mexican place) were awesome.  I especially like the habanero!  I felt like the tacos were ok, and the enchiladas were also ok.  Honestly the entrees were fine but nothing spectacular.  Didn't love the al pastor taco flavor.  Maybe will return sometime, but would try something new.  I felt like I chose items that were fairly conservative to stay away from the more fusion items, but in the end was underwhelmed.

-dQ1mIWy2SF68TyHYp6qGw.text: Why did I not take more photos you ask? Because Taco Guild is an experience! Located in an old church it has so much design and coolness you gotta see to believe! The tacos. The margaritas. So. Much. YES.  I had never been before so I provided the confidence to my server to not let me down and choose the best for me. HE DID. 3 margaritas and 2 tacos later, taco Tuesday-1, Andrea-0.

HkwaNGjaHsodGPYmD9w7Lg.text: Loved it.. the place is really cool inside. It's an old church with high ceilings and a spacious floor plan.   The free chips and salsa was a great perk. Crunchy chips and a variety of 4 salsas.  They ranged from mild to hot.  So good!     The tacos were really well done.   Everything was fresh and arrived quickly.    Cocktails were done artistically and perfectly mixed.     OVERALL:   Yes. Go here!   Great spot for Mexican and cocktails
