XmdWyPIlQNOpy71Isb87HA.text: Ive ate here 3 times and told the whole city this is my favorite restaurant time and time again. But something rubbed the wrong way this time.  Autograt on a 2 top during happy hour Tommy? That actually has never been my experience before,  and i was bringing a friend here after he lost his job...i paid,  and ill stop complaining now. Love you guys but thats not sitting right with me.

UNhOQJAK1U7ISMIjryH4eQ.text: Great spot , got here a few minutes after opening but 30 min later its already packed. You know its going to be good. We got some tacos the el pastor and gringo tacos. Very good friendly staff. What else can I say !

7VBctS6wRkAZptmixMzXHQ.text: Management seems to have improved and the food is consistently good. The cherry steak tacos and street corn are a must!

rJgz4RpMsToxmr8qyK-jOg.text: Wanted to say thank you to Taco Guild for reaching out and being professional. I have yet to go back but will be soon! If the service is anything like the first few times before I'll be more than happy to edit my review again. Since that's all I'm looking for anyway! I've always enjoyed the Taco Guild and I want to be able to enjoy it again...   None the less, I'm very pleased that Taco Guild took their time to reach out to a frustrated customer, hear me out, and resolve the issue. That's how more restaurants should be like!

8HEUGR2qXjL7GsaZnBc9sA.text: With so many taco joints in the Valley, it takes something special to stand out! Taco Guild does just that! Great atmosphere, and incredible service! The food here is above average, and drinks are delish! A fun place to take out of town guest! There's usually a wait, so be prepared, or take a seat at the bar! Dinner is just as delicious while sitting in those big cushy chairs! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp burrito! Stuffed full, no skimping on the good stuff here!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee steak taco and the mahi-mahi
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar happy hour

dyq3PrOBthQbTDTskeWrSQ.text: Awesome Tacos  like  Duck/Lamb/Lobster in a  downtown resturant built from an old church #goodfoodgoodvibes

RkkE1GL775SUpX5kq9uXrA.text: I really like the ambience and the bar area. The tacos are huge, probably only need two for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco Menu.

cI6l3WGw82nt9KNhwYu7cw.text: Heard of mixed reviews but was overall happy with this spot. Cherry steak tacos to DIE FOR. Corn was amazing as well, try the trio! Place is pretty loud but unique in an old church!

yJRcful6T3W5pt1kagmx_A.text: This place was a pleasant surprise, great atmosphere and the food was delicious. The street corn is by far the star on the menu and their habanero butter sauce has a spicy food lover like myself craving more. I give it 4 instead of 5 stars merely because I was a little bummed that the duck tacos might as well been chicken because the duck wasn't soft and juicy like I had expected it to be, it didn't even taste any different from the chicken which was a little disappointing since I love duck and they serve it at so few places. I suggest a slower cook and more sauce for heavens sake! You make the chili sauce on it sound so good but I could barely taste it. Anyway take from it what you will, I am coming back just the same to try more tacos.

uqrx3rqpqZTeF6sAFREKPQ.text: The aesthetic is amazing, both inside and out.  Looking at the menu...it's easy to get excited about the food, but then it arrives and is completely bland. I wouldn't even call it mediocre. I went back a second time because I thought the first time might have been a fluke, but nope...exact same experience the second time.  There are so many awesome Mexican restaurants in town...not sure why everyone raves about this place. (shrug)

iSUrymilhHTZpDrlUC00eQ.text: Excellent, fresh food. Atmosphere is great. Best chile relleno I've had! Parking gets a little challenging when it's busy because the restaurant doesn't have its own parking lot. You park near a consignment shop and a Starbucks.

vG1UPMUojtBmRq6ClEuBLA.text: Tacos are my favorite food, but I'm here report that there are much better choices in Phoenix than Taco Guild. I love the vibes of Taco Guild and the building's charm, but the food doesn't meet expectations. I was excited to try the many interesting "New World Tacos" like molida lamb and peking duck, but really couldn't get down with the flavors. Even the classic tacos left more to be desired.   Prices match other restaurants in the area, and the hipster vibes are there. The prices do not reflect the taco quality - you're better off hitting a more casual, authentic Mexican place. If I were to return, I'd stick to margaritas or maaayyybeee try something besides tacos. But really, if the tacos don't impress, what's the point?  +5 building's charm +4 drinks -2 tacos

fgCxzDcjfv7QxT155IZcnw.text: Was recommended to go here and was not disappointed.  They had very unique and tasty tacos.  I had the YUCATAN SHRIMP green cabbage slaw, avocado 4.50 and a wonderful CHIPOTLE CHERRY STEAK poblano straws, chile aioli, Bleu cheese. 4.95.

xfElSQ_u14J_8WBWz1cJaQ.text: Our lyft driver highly recommended this place, so we decided to check it out since it's near Steele Indian School Park.  We came around 3 and was seated immediately for four people. On the taco menu, there's old world tacos and new world tacos. It's basically the traditional tacos or new & fusion tacos.  I decided to get the taco plate which is 3 tacos plus a side. My choices: al pastor pork, urban bean coffee braised beef, and tropical ono with elote corn. While waiting for our food, we were given homemade chips with a selection of salsa to dip with. First off, chips were delicious! Each salsa definitely had a kick to it. If you like spicy, you'll like the salsa. When I get my taco plate, I was surprised at how loaded each taco was. If you don't like getting your hands dirty, you may not enjoy this. Overall, my favorite was the beef. It was super good and with the salsa, it made it better. My least favorite was the ono. I've had better. This was okay. The corn on the side was delicious. Order this off the cob if you don't want to use your hands or eat off the cob.  What's really cool about this place is that it's in a church, or what used to be a church. The chandelier is super pretty and I love the stained glass windows.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ptHz_292mBuQ76C5HleRuQ.text: I have driven by this place for a while now and only recently ventured in. All I can say is that I am so disappointed in myself. Why, oh why did I deprive my soul of their tasty goodness? For years and years, I have wandered the earth, an empty shell of a man, hardly aware of the True good in the universe....the goodness that is Taco Guild! I have lived a life of True taco celibacy until now. I have been enlightened. My spirit awakened by the glorious cooks that have surely been guided by the hand of the Almighty! Chipotle Cherry Steak tacos are mana from heaven, able to please even the harshest of food critics and if the Chiplotle Cherry Steak tacos are that good, then the Coffee Braised Beef is communion for your food soul, bringing salvation to our hunger! Being prepared by Angels, their Grilled Seasonal Vegetable taco would bring the most devout carnivores to a moment of veggie weakness, forcing them to give up their meaty ways! From a fantastic atmosphere and phenomenal service to possibly the best tacos I have yet enjoyed, this place gets 10 out of 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee Beef Breakfast!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-Vq8njPfdumCQIZtfqO3TQ.text: The 1893 drink is the bomb!! Only gave a 4 instead of 5 because of the price and small amount of food. We go for that drink now!

n3x0Zz90x-6cD4ZPXYfjxA.text: Amazing!  Great tacos and the street corn (on the cob) was to die for! We will be back!!

y01z5_PY-SBBI0hPtpimuQ.text: This is a unique restaurant serving great tacos! They have a large variety of fillings from meat to fish. The poblano tacos are very, very tasty. I like sitting at their patio. Very convenient location and easy parking. The prices are right!

ZjiqCQLkRbOCZvTl20E1Sw.text: Went here during a weeknight with some friends. The food and atmosphere was awesome! Drinks were really good too! Definitely somewhere to take a look a.

AwcV14NdOnRSU7Lg-Gbe8A.text: This place is one of the best MODERN taco place I've eaten in Arizona. It has different kinds of tacos and tastes amazing. Ive been here a few times and to be honest it gets busy and when it gets busy I feel like the tacos come out a little cold..other then that foods good and if you haven't already tried their flourless cake you need to! It is the most amazing thing I have ever had. You also get free chips and salsa, chips are fresh and the salsa comes with different varieties which are all great! The building itself is pretty cool as well, use to be an old church. This is definitely one of my go to places in Arizona!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1gCosexR_GkeGqTnRF9F0A.text: The tacos were so phenomenal and so fresh. They we're filling but almost light (didn't hit my stomach like a freight train of grease). Red beans and rice reminded me of New Orleans (could use a little more rice in the ratio though).   Salsa was very well blended and the queso was good too.

6nC-HnpxuetKE4Ml-V54GA.text: You can't beat the atmosphere at this place. Love looking around imagining I'm in church, but at the moment eating the best street tacos and having a beer.  Cannot go wrong with dinner or happy hour. Recommend.

CmVcY7hs4vdyD6IQIwoj2w.text: I love the vibe of this old church repurposed as a restaurant. We have been here many times. The parking is tight and we usually have to wait a bit to be seated if we go at popular times. It is worth the wait. The service is excellent and they had live music the last couple of times we have gone. The daily special has never disappointed and we love the salsa variety. Try them for Taco Tuesday!

UfD7328Pti33_371_mNYvQ.text: Having visited this area for the first time. Initially drawn in for the buffalo exchange nextdoor and had seen a comment about the taco guild next door. Best move outside the sweet flair overalls I was able to scoop up next for for under $35. But I digress. This is coming from a non red meat eater and her more adventurous sister.  Uhm things we thought were OFF THE CHAIN DELICIOUS- street corn(off the Cobb) daymn!! Grilled Romain salad-delicate taste hearty salad Queso (sans sausage) and guacamole-fantastic She had some kinda a cherry rubbed beef taco that she couldn't stop humming about. Uhm. Uhm , Uhm with head shake.   And the unique and flavor filled margaritas here to die for. Even the musician was super good. He was accompanied by quite a "spirited" group of sing/shout along fans. Which to no fault of the restaurant was the least favorite part of our meal.(the fans that is)

s2bXKmxgf0LYjO1LpDN5Pw.text: The frozen house margarita on happy hour was so good and STRONG. Also ordered lobster taco and street corner which I highly recommend! Breann was our server and she was great and very knowledgeable about the menu! Gave great recommendations! Definitely coming back :)

mZSa55FaBT9X097by45Kmw.text: 4.5 really. I got the Urban Coffee Braised Beef and Peking Duck Taco. Loved the beef one, couldn't finish the duck, overwhelmed with the taste of clovey anise. Not my thing, but I have never tried a duck taco, so what the hell.  The place was packed, so I sat at the bar and had great service despite how busy they were on a Tuesday during Happy Hour.  The chips & salsa rock- my weakness.  The 1893 Margarita blended was decent, but pretty tart.  I ordered the shrimp taco off the Happy Hour menu because I bailed on the duck. It was decent.

i6NsmroCay92fPTH19zfqw.text: Blasphemy and tequila and tacos!  Went again this week w a buddy from Costa Rica! Omg the !  Another great night, should we go back for 'cinco de Mayo' -  YESSS!!

hS-Np-_wvo3JOcXxrghfrw.text: Of course the food never disappoints. My favorite were the pork tacos and bacon, jalapeno guacamole!!

p4b-cnd8c7RaZ9TXpUarIg.text: Having been here just over a half-dozen times, maybe it's time to write a review to let you good folks know why I choose to come back here more frequently than any of the many other, independent-ish, hip and tasty restaurants in the downtown Phoenix area.    I'm not going to spend time talking about the awesome look and feel of having a restaurant in a re-purposed old church, complete with stained glass windows, beautiful open-beam ceilings and...and I digress.  Food.  More specifically, tacos.  Amazing tacos with unique and wonderful flavors.  When was the last time you had a lamb or duck taco?  On house-made tortillas?  With the exception of the vegetable taco (seriously?), I've had them all.  My 4 consistently awesome, favorites are: Chipotle Cherry Steak, Pork Adovada, Al Pastor Pork & Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef.  In that order.    I'm told that the the Street Corn is not-to-be-missed, but I've missed it so far.  I'll get it eventually.  The guac is absolutely terrific, and the the four salsas with the complimentary chips are very flavorful, no doubt due in no small part to the use of fresh, locally grown produce.    And finally, the sides.  All are good, but on my visit Thursday, the Borracho Red Beans were different than they've been in the past, and as long as they stay this way, they will be the only side I consider from here on out.  Whatever the change, keep it!  I'm tired of typing, and if you made it this far, you're tired of reading.  Check out the Taco Guild, take your friends.  Do it after work and sample the tequila bar too.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. L - R, Al Pastor Pork, Pork Adovada and Chipotle Cherry Steak tacos.

JMsFNM6bT_7b-rFMW0te9w.text: Came here with my husband on an impromptu date night and loved it. They kept a lot of the church feel- so unique! Great selection of beers and the tacos were delicious! The $1.99 daily special was actually the best taco we tried, so I def recommend getting there before 7 for the happy hour! Can't beat $5 craft brews and $2 tacos!! Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love the art around the ceiling!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bar
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Q79nmPodzKXDkhzT8NdRlg.text: Taco Guild is incredible and has some of the best tacos around. My only beef is that the menu never changes! I dont want pizza or anything that doesnt make sense like another post suggested... but new tacos on the menu every one in a while would be great. I know they have a special taco each day but thats not sufficient. Change it up every once in a while!

qm1DEfR5mTpY3StDj__vgg.text: This was our 2nd time here & again was not disappointed. The atmosphere is great as is the food but  what really sets this place apart is the staff.  Met Garth the Service Manager who I can tell you definitely belongs right where he is. He made our evening a complete enjoyable experience. It was my boyfriend's night to plan a date night & I would have to say I got cheated for going here was too easy for him to put me over the top & outdid me on date night. Their Happy Hour & tacos are awesome & Garth turned us on to some really smooth great tasting sipping tequila. Can't wait to come back & try more items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1vSSWVgjYVL1IfoLBwdSGg.text: I have always been a fan of Taco Guild. I lived super close when they first opened and frequented for happy hours and days I didn't want to cook. Flavors are great. My complaint is with consistency. Every time I go, something is different... and not in a good way. I love the ambiance of the restaurant and the flavors, but even their salsa is inconsistent, sometimes spicy, sometimes bland as could be.

z_8HEBeXZVFjk8wGoo3fLA.text: I really like the vibe here. Excellent food, trendy but comfortable. Built in an old church. Conveniently located and plenty of parking.

UxPSqkH48AJie_1ZiORYuw.text: A friend and I came here for lunch, as it's pretty close to both of our jobs. I really like the church conversion of this restaurant- there's a lot to look at and see visually. We did come right at lunch so there was a slight wait but we were seated in the "quieter room" as the bigger room does echo and can be noisy. Our waitress was really attentive and serve was great overall. Chips and salsa were wonderful, I liked that was a mild salsa and other options to spice it up. I ordered the chicken enchiladas, my friend ordered the taco plate and corn. I personally thought the tacos were pretty expensive but they looked great! My chicken enchilada plate came with 2 enchiladas, rice and black beans. Food was great!!   I will definitely be back- probably would like to try again for HH or dinner.

san0u4OolCgtNt7D2OthaQ.text: Enviorment: amazing decor, love it! Service: decent, nothing to complain or rave about Food: chips and salsa were amazing but the meatballs, our tacos and rice were bland...nothing to write home about. Margaritta was way to strong...it was like taking a shot of tequila, some people may like that but I don't like the taste of liquor at all. Price: $40.77 before tip  Overall: glad I tried it, but would be okay never coming back. But because I'm on the border of good and bad I would be willing to give them another chance...just no time soon  and only if I'm not paying :)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iVk-F3UEy-MixtJenTq74A.text: We met here on a Friday night to connect with friends. I am so glad that we were seated in the back room away from the main dining room as the DJ began a set at 6pm and the music was very loud and would have made conversation nearly impossible. I want to try this place during lunch when the music isn't deafening so that I can truly experience the atmosphere of dining in the old sanctuary. Perhaps management should consider having the DJ after 9pm.  After reading all of the reviews, I was worried that I was going to have bland tacos and dry street corn, but I experienced exactly the opposite. The tacos were yummy and very generous in their fillings and the street corn was fresh and delicious. I had the cherry steak with cojita (not a fan of bleu cheese) and the peking duck taco. The duck taco was a great combination of spicy and sweet and was my favorite. We also ordered the house guacamole. It was lacking salt and lime, but was okay with tortilla chips.   Complimentary valet is the only option for parking, so we chose to park in the neighborhood and had no issue nor safety concerns. We will be back, but will try it during lunchtime instead.

UUWCTYidtVn2fHi3nNL8Tw.text: They should name it Taco Gentrification. I been looking for a good Taco Tuesday spot that has good taco/drink specials but the kicker is I'm not a fan of real authentic Mexican tacos. I'm looking for a great tex-mex taco so I decided to try TG. Y'ALL this ain't it. I got the lamb taco  and 2 chicken tacos . Service was whack too but I'm not even going to go there right now.

PNQZurF6i9jMxe3frgnRxg.text: This building is awesome, food is decent. I like the corn and the enchilada.  It's not the worst place in the world but definitely lower on my list of place to visit, I am glad it exists.

2fd2Bpc7NLKFeYcVpixe2g.text: I met soon to be daughter-in-law here :)  We had 3 tacos lettuce cups MOLIDA LAMB  Creole aioli, Bleu cheese, sweet potato hay PORK ADOVADA mango jicama relish, avocado, cilantro. PEKING DUCK plum sauce, fire roasted poblano apricot compote, Brie cheese i think my favorite was the pork adovada, but all of them had so much flavor it was like taking a trip to favah town! Chloe also had the Street Corn, she said she thought that was the best! Great service, beautiful atmosphere, most interesting taco combinations, thank you for opening my taste-buds to new and exciting  flavors  Will defiantly be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1H-a3pgfaLW8aY7Rh4VyKg.text: Amazing tacos!!! Spicy bloody Mary's! Beautiful venue!! Great chips and guacamole. Worth the drive across town.

VF-xMqrA2C7Z8Gqs8PZ_RA.text: Overrated PERIOD! Overheard manager speak to a family who had been told "dog friendly patio"... talk about humiliating someone in front of everyone when they found out it wasnt.

TMrOxUd9MBrho0EfIN21uQ.text: Very cool building, architecture and atmosphere.  This place is super close to my office and a great place to go for a quick lunch.  Taco Guild has some of the most interesting Taco combos I have seen anywhere.  My favorite are the Shrimp Tacos.  If you are really hungry, don't miss the street corn.  The tacos are a bit pricey, but it is definitely worth trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two Yucatan Shrimp tacos (flour tortillas)

R5yo_mjl7Wo4rJBOyZ6RUg.text: So freaking good. I had the "all you can eat taco and 1 margarita" for $20 and I was stuffed. The venue is really beautiful and this restaurant is very popular spot because it was packed! If it was not freakishly hot outside we would have sat in the patio instead of waiting for a table. Will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huge chandelier
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bar
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ALL YOU CAN EAT TACOS!!!

GZ1ojDt76ZTZZE957b8q8Q.text: Such a great atmosphere and awesome staff!! Honestly the best queso I have ever had... and I always get the queso wherever I go!

ncgwqoHUMY4clDE8_nk2qg.text: Whenever architecture is discussed churches are bound to make their way into the conversation, and for good reason. Churches are beautifully constructed, so it makes sense that the creator of Taco Guild would keep the building close to original when renovating. However, I wish the owner put as much thought into the food. The tacos were disappointing, not very flavorful, and overpriced. Phoenix is a city rich with Mexican culture, and with a bevy of delicious, reasonably priced Mexican places to choose from, Taco Guild is a let down.   Cheers.

Cnut_5u3_1aRf7QbbrXtIg.text: My girls and I met up for happy hour in the middle of the week and couldn't have been happier. I love what was done with the church to keep it alive and part of the feel of the ambiance.   Service was friendly, prompt and food was quick to come out of the kitchen. I appreciate that our waitress didn't give us the stink eye for being slow to order since we were so busy chit chatting.   Always order the taco of the day. It's $1.95. You only live once. The guac was amazing and evenly balanced ... the margaritas were just ok. But I'd still go again.

aav50KhtxA7_rnR-X7G5pA.text: My boyfriend and I were traveling here and this place was suggested to us for Cal-Mex food. The day was gorgeous so we sat outside. They need to work on their outdoor lighting.  The food itself was excellent. We shared a few tacos and the corn. We also got the bacon jalapeno guac... YUM! It was huge though, so since that came out first we were pretty stuffed by the time the tacos came out.  I think they could work on their beer selection a little bit; they seemed to be out of a lot of stuff when we were there.  The setting was gorgeous. I love when places can take old buildings and churches and repurpose them, while appreciating their original usage, instead of tearing down the location.  Check this place out if you're in the area!

oU2nmxQZDdJkx69nEJAMXA.text: Loved the Ceviche. My kiddo had the chicken quesadilla it was amazing. Full of flavor. Salsas are awesome if you love spicy this is the place to be. My husband had tacos and the street corn. The amazing amounts of flavors that danced in my mouth. We can't wait to go again. The desert is the only thing that I made me do a 4 stars instead of a five. All the amazing taste in the rest of the food were very defined but the mango on the tres leches was not. And the flavor of the threes leches was off. I couldn't put my finger on it. Next time I will try their Flan.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome prickly pear sorbet
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yeyQ3762dI2HjCpsd7TkwA.text: If you know me you know I'm a fan of places that do just a few things and do them well.  The Taco Guild does exactly that.  A small, simple menu with a few salads and appetizers with tacos being the main event.  I went with the New World side of the taco menu choosing ones that featured lamb,steak, and Peking Duck.  Every one of them was on point as were the roasted veggies that came as a side. I can't wait to go back and try their take on the classics.

R2Gd5f783Kxu1Qu7bsBh1Q.text: Visiting Arizona for the weekend to see Dodgers Spring Training. After the game my family and I all decided to stop at Taco Guild for the first time. Once entering Taco Guild my family and I were in awe of how beautiful it looked inside.  Service was fast, friendly and professional. When eating at Taco Guild we had a party of 14 and each of us all enjoyed our food. I had the chicken enchilada plate. It was full of flavor, tasted fresh and homemade. The food was AMAZING!!! Definitely found us a NEW spot to come to when we are back in town next year.

CAtgRRAfahXdDNL491FSFA.text: Brought my parents for Taco Tuesday.. Very disappointed... Brittany our server didn't smile once, we have never been here and we were hoping for an introduction of what this place is all about and what their specials were... we didn't get nothin... didn't even tell us her name (found out from the receipt) once we got the food it was very bland dad and I liked the shrimp taco, the chicken was awful (maybe that's why they put it in the middle) don't think we will be returning. The atmosphere is neat but the service ruined it for us.

cOJThxdsFaLy2O18Wh3gBw.text: I love this place. I just moved to Phoenix and have been 3-4 times in a month. The atmosphere is really cool with the old church feel. The queso is delicious. Go with the Guild Duo as an appetizer, queso and guac are a heavenly combination. I've tried several tacos (which were all good) but the romaine salad with chicken is by far my favorite. The chicken has the perfect charred taste that I like to let you know it is grilled but not overdone. I would eat here everyday if I wasn't concerned with my health.

oxWnmK7P6cOKBskxtnjd9w.text: This was my first time to Taco Guild and it won't be my last for sure! I have frequently stopped at the Starbucks in the same parking lot and the smells have always made me think I have to try that place out!! Well today was the day and I am just sorry it's taken me this long to enjoy the foodie delights that awaited me inside! My friend, her son & I went the Children's Museum and it was the perfect way to end the fun filled day! Carlos was are Amazingly attentive server and her guided us through the menu! We did the taco platters- we each had 3 different choices with the corn added! I had the beef, pork and Delish Duck!! It was like a Flavor Party in my mouth and all the tastebuds were digging the vibes for sure!! Desmond our little man had a quesadilla and he devoured half of it enjoying every bite! The margarita was perfect as well!! Well done Taco Guild!! Great atmosphere, food, drinks and service!! A+

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco Platter Two with their corn that is Addictive!!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our picky eater wasn&#39;t so picky today! He ate half all by himself!! And he loved the chips &amp; mild salsa
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco Platter One!

LGn8k4sLUnE9biS1fIplAQ.text: It was our first time eating here and I was thoroughly impressed with the margaritas and our server Haraan. He definitely took care of us and made out first visit great! I was also surprised at how fast our food came out! We will definitely be returning!

3E4SNIESgNgHQ4NETtnSXQ.text: Nasty flies in the building , over price for some gourmet tacos .. place is a dump to me

m_6Nb86BGa7GvmApflDNkg.text: Tasty combination of classic styles and new at a reasonable price. The setting in the old church is a nice touch. Will definitely be back next time in town!

e-sieKLWOnC4S2HL10reFw.text: The world needs more taco guilds.  Great ambience amazing food a variety of music and great service!  The street corn is DA BOMB!!!!!!

h3jqU3YmEXgm_gxXSQ3v9w.text: Cool vibe.  Great Mex.  Great atmosphere.  But, a little loud at times.

maLqP4YgKXr1T-iq1TE0Fg.text: Went to Taco Guild, beautiful inside! Tacos were good. Enjoyed the chips and the 3 different salsas they offer. Had a great server named Eric. Bar looks like a great setup, need to check out there happy hour.

tk87UBdpT_J5UQ_V323CQA.text: I loved, loved this place! Food, delicious. Atmosphere, relaxing. A.J. 's music, wonderful. This would be my go to date night destination if I lived in Phoenix! Chicken enchiladas were so marvelous. My husband loved the coconut pie.

sSRf0h0Gxv_uCKxOCKc35g.text: Really good. Wonderful atmosphere in old Methodist Church. Only small constructive suggestion is the rounded chips served with the ceviche hard to use. But I'm being a nit picker this place is very good.

CReHelbd86_4ZCmOMpgibg.text: Amazing flavors. Taco of the day happy hour. $1.99/taco.   There is a nice variety of beer as well. I ended up getting three different tacos because I wanted to try them all. Everything on the menu looks great. Everything I tried was great!  It's a perfect lunch spot for sure !

KurRSPiiZGZCbr1bRLne_Q.text: This place is the quintessential trendy taco place. Most everything is made in house (tortillas and chips too), which is great. I'd like to see a few more traditional type tacos, but im a mexican food purist. Anyways, chips and salsa(s) are great, I had the braised beef tacos, shrimp tacos, and also pastor. I would say the al pastor is a little weak, but the beef was excellent, as was the shrimp. The street corn was farrrrr from the best I've ever had, but it is corn covered in mayo and cheese so I can't say I didn't like it. The only warning I would give is this place is suuuuper trendy, so expect a long wait, and very loud music.

kQz2Htf-eJyzdz_O3z3EVw.text: This is an awesome place to eat! You have to try the street corn! OMG! I dream about it! The guac is soooo good and you can get grilled Serrano, pineapple and other "flavors" added to it. Ask to sit in Ivy's section. She.is.the.best!

z42obfFGgQhOHhF276gdLA.text: Definitely in agreement with the four stars on this restaurant.  I actually found them on a list of the ten top taco places to try in the country.  Not sure where the list came from or if I'd actually put them on that (criteria are subjective on any list), but I'm glad I looked them up and grabbed dinner on my recent visit.  They have a pretty diverse menu with interesting choices.  Food is well prepared and portions are generous.  The drink menu is interesting and diverse.  Decor is nice and service was prompt and friendly.  The live music was a bonus.  I'd definitely recommend a visit.  Or more than one.  As for specifics, the chips come with a variety of salsas that range from fairly mild to quite spicy.  One had a garlic flavor that was amazing.  I, the one who leans away from spicy, kept going for two of the spicy varieties because the flavors were completely worth it.  We also ordered guacamole.  Great flavor and nice sized portion.  And more chips came along and were hot so I'm guessing they are not coming out of a bag.  We ordered a variety of tacos, all of which were good.  I found them a bit spicy but was able to eat them; flavors were really good.  The side of beans was good; the side of rice was superb (I'd opt for that next time, but got to taste my daughter's).  I heard her drink was strong and well mixed as well.  Cheers!

k5o4CPrkTHKpQS-5t2xgiQ.text: I really enjoyed this place as they raised the bar on the typical taco. The menu is very trendy and the place is housed in an old church so it had a great ambiance. Noisy and busy and the food was great. I had the Al pastor pork and Guild chicken tacos that were fantastic. I will have to return and try other menu choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The chips and assorted dips were a nice touch.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

x8MDRPuRo-2pLXjHUQb0Ag.text: I joined a friend for dinner and we had a great meal and fine experience.  Neither of us drink, but the ice tea was perfectly brewed and my glass stayed full.  We each had the three taco plate with side, which was quite delicious.  My favorite being the Chipotle Cherry Steak taco.  The fresco art of the Dutch Masters, the dark wood, and the stained glass brought a great style which made the church renovation quite beautiful.  The staff was excellent and our server,  Mike, provided great customer service.  Good food, good service, and good decor - it's a win!

Zvw0UseLMsyDcJjpeVI8Jg.text: great way to re-use space, converting an old church into a taco eatery.  The good: the service was good, the waiter was prompt and friendly The chips were warm and refilled quickly The water was cold.. The location, easy to find The side of corn was very good My favorite taco - beef and blue cheese  The Bad: the portions were small, for the price 12+ for three small tacos, we should have listened to the waiter when he said he can easily put down 6+ The music? all over the place rock? country? elevator?  The next time I am in town I will probably go back, but I would wait for taco Tuesday night..if they have one

f5SmzFSsopqpIaRqK9gwLA.text: Terrible service. Good food. Am sitting here right now while my husband finishes he enchiladas. He took his first bite of food as I was taking my last. Food is delivered at different times. Not the first time. Two nights ago at dinner, his are his tacos before my dinner salad was delivered. Unacceptable. Deserts are delicious. I recommend the flour less chocolate cake. If you want a refill on your water, prepare to be thirsty. Unless you ask some random employee who happens to be walking by, you have to wait for your waiter. Today, our waiter seems to be hiding in the kitchen.

-6OMHUy6YBmTRYS1KAq24Q.text: The best tacos and street corn I have ever had! Make sure you get there early because the place is small and fills up quick!

K2_WOUyB5t-AN-6iBzc8PA.text: Lovely Ambiance, super sweet decor, AMAZING new age/Modern twist on Mexican cuisine. Eat here every chance you have, get the Guac.

BsYpn-zAfBFpFUqJjK9RVg.text: I am a big fan of street tacos so I was happy to give this place a try.  By far the most expensive street tacos I've ever seen or tasted.  They are good but $4-$5 each is crazy for a 3" taco.  The ingredients are good.  I wasn't blown away by the thai inspired taco but the al pastor was great.      The best chips and salsa I have ever tasted in a restaurant.  I would score the place lower if it wasn't for the awesome chips and salsa.  Everything is made in house and it was awesome.  The decor is very nice and the service was excellent.

iUrXK-AhLFWStrMhR8o4uQ.text: Taco Guild has all the trappings of a great taco joint.  Located in a spacious renovated church, it's no doubt a great place to grab a beer after work.  But the food?  That's a different story.  Like everything else in the restaurant, the menu looks like something you'd see in a great eatery.  You'll find street corn, creative aiolis, slow-cooked meats, pungent cheeses, and freshly made tortillas.  But the chef seems either unwilling or unable to properly use the tools at his or her disposal. I had street corn and the lamb and cherry steak tacos, each one of which was drenched in their homemade mayonnaise.  And in the case of the tacos, both were loaded with so much bleu cheese that I barely noticed the well-cooked and seasoned meats stuffed at the bottom of the tortilla.  This place has potential, but right now, it clearly misses the mark.

sVfT9dsinocNUgvpG8g8xg.text: I love the old church that houses Taco Guild. It's such a pretty, unique dining experience that if nothing else, try this place out to enjoy the ambiance. Luckily, the food delivers, so you aren't just enjoying eye candy at Taco Guild.  I like that the tortilla chips are warm when they're served, and the accompanying salsa is fresh and delicious. My husband and I started with the Guild Duo - guacamole and queso. The queso was great, with fresh tomatoes and cilantro. The guacamole was good, though a little lightly seasoned for my personal taste. The portion size was big, though, so I can't complain too much.  We tried the guild chicken taco, vegetable taco, and molida lamb  taco. The chicken was really nice, with a touch of sweetness. I could see this becoming my favorite go to taco at Taco Guild. The veggie was great, with wonderfully seasoned vegetables. The molida lamb was rich and delicious. Make sure you like blue cheese before ordering this, and I would suggest only ordering one because it's rich and heavy. The lamb was moist and wonderful - really liked this taco. We also had the beer battered onion jalapeno straws, which were your standard fried goodness, but nothing spectacular to write home about. I think I'll try the corn next time.  I think the prices were pretty reasonable, and the service was good. Parking was easier than I thought it would be. I would forgo turning in from Osborn but instead turn in from 7th St behind Taco Guild and Starbucks.  I will definitely be back to try more tacos.

yAb5anx4Xd0sZyoVH8QvFA.text: Great ambience, especially for a Friday night. The elote (street corn) was really good. They had a spicy mayo that was yummy. My taco had a bunch of cabbage that made it hard to eat, and it was cold.

mWToQdWnIl7_mFPUpXbIIQ.text: Ambiance is pretty cool.  And the food is pretty good.  I mean, you don't walk out thinking "holy s*** that's the best taco I've ever had", but it's still quite good.  Salsa and sauces are nicely done and the drinks are top notch.  They have a great little selection of "gourmet" tacos.  Check it out!

8cORJnQBlpP748umtYE3Pw.text: This place is great.  Like all the tacos but coffee braised beef and Peking duck are my favorites

e_Fbv7J4AC3K-K1I4_7YXw.text: Honestly, the atmosphere is amazing. The interior design, flawless. Super cool vibe and our waitress was very attentive and helpful, one of the best i've met in a while. The only reason we are giving 2 stars is because of the tacos. We were expecting amazing tacos. The appetizer- ceviche was definitely delicious, the chips that came with were my fave! However, we were disappointed as soon as the main entree came. We eat tacos all the time, especially in Az- you can go to the taco trucks and have an amazing meal for $1- $2 a piece. Just because their "fancy" doesn't necessarily mean they are good.  If they fix that, the place would be a 5 star quality restaurant.

6JBh_dU4O2hOGb6b5N5m-A.text: Great service.  Great portion sizes to their tacos.  Good appetizer- meatballs.  But like other reviewers have mentioned, their tacos are under seasoned and dry.  I ended up adding guacamole to them just to compensate for how dry they were.  Don't plan to go back.

lsDM5PqFKPZjey5Vb9kn4Q.text: Love this place. Taco Tuesday here is amazing since they offer organic ingredients and they have really good drinks, as well as beers. Their guacamole is delicious! I love the fact that they work with local farmers to get fresh ingredients. Love love love that!

rLM7JFdlwx4NoEGXmLMRzg.text: Great place to eat. I loved the atmosphere as well as the fact that they buy their food locally. Props to them for keeping business local. Great twist on traditional Mexican food. I kind of loved the old church feel. I have already been telling my friends to come check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loved this... Street corn is a must try.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Added to the atmosphere

93CAmIFkIiQJ2cCGEQWnqQ.text: Had the worst experience ever with their food i new at the time it tasted funny but i should've followed my gut now im going on to my second day with stomach problems. The waitress was good but the manager cut us off at 3 beers in. We asked for the manager but he never came to talk to us. After we asked for him it seemed like the staff became rude towards us. We had a birthday party there but never will again. This place used to be a regular place for me and 6-8 others but this Diminished Any Chance Of Returning. You Would Think Spending $400 or so per visit with my triends and family would be worth respect from the Manager. So To Say The Least Worst Experience Ever.

a3tIZJSGJLdS_IOhwlYLTA.text: Strange atmosphere. Ok tacos.   This old Spanish style church is filled with Spanish style tables, chairs, etc. They also have a strange renaissance painting near the ceiling. The staff are youngish hipsters and they have live music that is hipsterish too.   The food well plated. They provide you with chips and salsa and water when you initially sit down.  The Peking taco is the opposite of what it says. It's full of beef with a few duck strips on it. Also, the tacos are not nearly as good as a taco truck at 2.95 a taco not worth the money.  No plans to go back.

tYA1OKqDKizS0EwVGLznXw.text: Begin with a frosty glass of Grand Canyon Pilsner, add a Pork Adovada Old World taco and a street corn and you have a meal straight from heaven!  Now just when you think things can't get any better, someone orders a Jalapeno Bacon dip for you to try and ...BAM you know you have to get back to this place soon to sample the rest of the menu!

xE88DqSrX5m6DyyjqONfKQ.text: I love love love the tacos and the magaritas!!! Omg the corn on the cob amazing I highly recommend it very chill spot to go hang out and have a few drinks with tacos I also love the tres Leche cake

I-hRJQgXSkKdzeJYvp_oIA.text: Really damn good duck tacos. Service staff was awesome. A must try for anyone going there must be the Deviled Eggs w/ Longiniza that was epic dynatmite.

zlmqRSlMX-spXSp_9aMU9A.text: Love this place!! This is the spot I take all my out of town visitors. I have been here too often in the last month!  Their specialty tacos don't disappoint! I've tried practically everything and my favorite two are the peeking duck & chipotle cherry steak.  They have happy hour till 7pm which is great and they have daily tacos specials that are $2.50 during happy hour as well. Great ambience and in the evenings they sometimes will have live music. Great place to grab happy hour with co-workers or friends.

n0nTEro7t0b6jetGSLdjvA.text: The tacos here are so good! I love the fact you can taste different ones and all are excellent! Very flavorful, tasteful and all visually appealing! The ambience is delightful as well with you eating inside an old church turned cafe. I love it! The staff are always a great help as well constantly filling your cup with water and beverages. This is how a restaurant should always be! I will definitely be back for more tacos! Thanks guys!!!

Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sJxzfQ3VgSBU8c4WIlmNlA.text: We've been coming to this place for three years and don't plan on stopping anytime soon. As such, we figured it was finally time to drop a review! Over the past three years, Taco Guild has become our go to spot for everything including anniversaries, graduations, date nights, birthdays, finishing exams, hosting family when they visit, Friday's, basically we look for any excuse to go here. The building itself is awesome, being a converted church. When you go to this restaurant you feel like you're in old world Spain. All of the decor and furniture is beautiful wood and there are amazing mural paintings on and around the ceiling. When we found out the owner was from Ocean Beach, CA we knew this place was going to be legit. The menu has something for everyone with a large selection of tacos of different flavors, as well as side dishes and non-taco items such as burritos and enchiladas. The place also has a great drink menu with lots to choose from. Staff is always very friendly and service is great. Sometimes there's even live music in the restaurant.  Naty (The Veggie Perspective): I have grown to love this place so much that I even had my med school grad party there LOL. You can make anything on the menu vegetarian basically, and the veggie taco that's already on the menu is amazingly flavorful and unique. I typically judge Mexican restaurants on the quality of their chips and salsa, and theirs are the BEST. The chips are thin, crunchy and usually still hot from being freshly made. Their salsas are sooo good, and they bring you a plate of 4 different kinds so you can't go wrong. Also I definitely appreciate that they don't judge us when they end up repeatedly bringing us refills of chips/salsa like 5 times during our meal because we inhale it so fast....(sorry not sorry, it's just that good).  Drew (The Omnivore Perspective (I Eat it All): I've had almost every taco on the menu and they're all pretty awesome. My go to's are usually the guild chicken, pork al pastor, and the Urban Bean beef taco. The veggie taco is also pretty good. Their salads are also great, and the cilantro lime dressing is life changing. The drink menu is also delicious and unique for those that like to partake. I particularly like the Jalisco Mule, since I love Moscow Mules. This drink is basically a Mule with added tequila.  N&D: Dude we've been coming here for 3 years, and go at least once a month...what more do you need to know?

SZz7yUVUQX5TpPsbf17P0w.text: I really wanted to like this place but I just have to be honest and say it's just ok.   I read reviews and prepped myself for what I thought was going to be the best taco experience I've had in Phoenix.   I ordered the cherry steak as suggested, my favorite al pastor, and the ono cause I wanted to have a fish taco. I also got the street corn as my side.   The tacos all were bland and the tortilla overpowered them. I did however love the street corn. I got it in a cup not on the cob.   The building is a good reason to go try this spot but that's about where my enjoyment ended. Sadly I doubt I'll be back.

DXPuoL-9tDYdiQ8u7bWN9w.text: I first visited Taco Guild in November, then came back again with a different group of friends in early December.  Loved it both times.  One of the fun and awesome parts of a visit to Taco Guild was the fun cocktail menu.  The format and drinks were very clever, church themed and great tasting!!  I brought a different group with me on Christmas Eve to find the cocktail menu (book) is gone and so are all of the fun cocktails...what!?!?!?  This was one of the things that made Taco Guild unique and really fun to bring a group of friends to try the various church themed drinks.  The food is still fantastic and I love the building, but part of the draw and fun of Taco Guild is gone.  Why did they do this????  Please bring back the fun drink book!!

uaWygo9g3enJoaY949WN1g.text: I only give this restaurant a 4-star rating because the wait was so long. If I were able, I'd give it 4.5 because that really was my only complaint.  My fiance and I went in on a busy "Taco Tuesday" and all couples had a 45-50 minute wait. They should definitely expand their area because they were obviously a hit!! Once we were seated our waitress, Lauren, was immediately attentive and very friendly. She brought menus, took drink orders, & came back with chips and salsa in no time. I loved the variety of salsas they offer!!  Once our drinks were being served, we were already ready to order. Our food came out promptly and perfectly. I attempted to take a photo of my steak tacos because they were AMAZING and I wish I could've shared with y'all, but my phone had other ideas. The waitress stayed on top of refilling our drinks & we even ordered more food =) If you have a craving for tacos and a chance to stop by this spot, you won't regret it!! Yummm

5Uro5lzJaylXlFd38RHSyw.text: Still love this place! The atmosphere is inviting even when it's packed. But I prefer to come when it's a little more quite.   Salsa to die for and the tacos......

k2A5uN-eDO4rRYprYbkmcQ.text: Passing through Phoenix and was referred here by our Uber driver. Loved it! From the church build to the decor to the service and the food. So glad we were pushed this way. Will definitely recommend it to friends going forward.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LxL-_J35wApKrJzSM6hLtw.text: We found this place on the recommendation of other Yelpers. The building is an old Methodist Church which has been converted into a cool restaurant space with some articles of the original church and unique lighting and a very impressive chandelier in the center.   We began our food journey at the Taco Guild with chips, salsa and guacamole. The chips were warm and crisp, the guac was tasty and good-we added a bit of salt to bring it up a bit. The salas were really great--but HOT!  We are salsa people but were going light due to the heat of these three salsas.  Note, the tacos are not your standard traditional fare, unique combinations and flavors make for tacos you're likely to remember and be amazed by.  We each ordered three and found that to be about right for dinner. I had the duck, cherry steak and shrimp.  Each was incredible, lots of flavor, texture and taste.  Service was fast and our server was very friendly and helpful.    When in Phoenix-check out the Taco Guild.

CrFmbK-BbRtjxe9fnNv34w.text: Went here last night after a small hiatus, I know now the reason for the hiatus! I ordered the chicken enchiladas and a cherry steak taco. The taco was good, but the chicken enchiladas, the main meal, was Nasty! It was like chicken surprise! Chicken skin, gristle, I was so turned off I threw most of it, un the trash! Blah!

EHMDq6-baivPGaaKrK5idQ.text: WOW! Been here many times, with friends, family and today, all by my lonesome. Food was INCREDIBLE! So good, I left nothing on my plate. In fact, I considered licking the plate of the crumbs I did leave behind. Happy Hour, Sunday afternoon, PERFECT time to visit. LOVE this spot, LOVE the concept, and LOVE the food!

R4Kft32l1_NnUgHMjqFw7Q.text: Pros: atmosphere is just great - this restaurant is inside of an old Methodist Church complete with painted ceilings, beautiful light fixtures, and stained glass windows. It's always very clean and the employees are very nice. Food is amazing, and never disappoints. I highly recommend their veggie tacos and the street corn!  Cons: long wait (but well worth it) also, its located in a more run down area of the city.  I recommend this restaurant to everyone!

eUfuq1yUszYyeyHdpCfhaw.text: Fabulous restaurant and the service was superb.  Our waitress just went above and beyond for us!  The grilled romaine salad is fantastic and guild chicken taco also so yummy.  Parking is limited so used valet. Great venue and awesome food.

6DLNdhN-VSFntAj__FqVzw.text: The coffee taco was my favorite. The tacos are a bit small for the price. They are a bit on the non traditional side as far as flavors but overall really good.

dIhoBhcLwgBRAJv12s1miQ.text: Cool ambiance, but the tacos aren't anything to go crazy for. I feel like I could make them easily at home. It's also pretty loud, probably because it used to be a church so it's basically one huge room that echos.

2Lm6-jLi_OQVIWCv2olwrg.text: The only reason I didn't give 5 is I'm still salty "The Holy Grail" isn't a happy hour special, lol I could put dent in my budget at this place but I loved it!! The street corn was fantastic, the taco menu creative and flavorful!! And did I mention The Holy Grail?

LUBv5knGQi3nRblPfDc9sQ.text: Oh my gosh I absolutely Love this place! If there is one stop you make while you are in Phoenix I would recommend going here. We ordered jalapeno margaritas, the cheese dip, three tacos, and the corn on the cob and everything was out of this world. Our waitstaff was absolutely amazing , the atmosphere of this spot was really cool and I can't wait to go back next time I'm visiting!!

qZOiKZOzyke3V_AnKiFqMg.text: I have fallen in love! We were hesitant to try this place despite the unique theme, only because it did seem very hipster-y. Parking was a little bit of a hassle but at a certain time they do have complimentary Valet so you're not having to continuously circle the tiny lot. It was a matter of, should we stay or should we go, but finally someone left and we snagged a spot. I was actually pretty excited to try this place, had a craving for tacos and all the pics on yelp looked super delicious.   The inside wasn't that packed, they had at least 10 tables in the front open area inside but the waitress wanted to stick us in the dark library room in the back. Felt it odd because being our first time that's partly why you come here, for the experience. We simply asked to sit in the open area so we could see everything and they happily accommodated. We joked that maybe we weren't hipster enough to sit with the cool kids but it could be they try to put tables of two in the very back, who knows.   The menu was a little daunting, I'm not opposed to new foods and combinations, but I also like simple ingredients. When I read a menu and it sounds like a chef on one of those cooking shows describing a dish with things I've never heard of...I get lost and it's hard to imagine what even sounds good when I can't process all of these ingredients coming together.  HOWEVER, I was proven wrong as each dish from the salsa to the entree. First off they serve chips and a sampling of salsa. Chips were perfectly thick, crispy and just enough salt. Their salsas are made in house and their main is super flavorful, I forgot to ask if they sold it to-go I wanted to take some home. We also tried their guacamole, super fresh, a light sprinkling of flavor that didn't mask the nice big chunks of avocado.   I had the Taco Trio with the side of Corn. The tacos are about the size of your palm. The pics make them look larger but they are actually more like street tacos, small in size but BIG in flavor and you will get full. These were a big surprise, the flavor combinations were out of this world! I got the Guild Chicken, Pork adovada, and Veggie tacos, all of them got me trying ingredients I don't particularly enjoy on their own or would never try, but together they were delicious, one bite and my eyes perked up from amazement. The mango relish and even the vegetables, never thought I'd like cucumber but the way they put it together...I'm craving it now.   Lastly the best part, the street corn! Holy hell! No pun intended, it was literally the first thought in my mind when tasting how delicious it was. I'd actually recommend getting this "off the cob" they cut it for you and put it in a small bowl but you get all the juices after. The habanero butter, chipotle mayonnaise, Cotija cheese melt together and you kinda get this delicious soup after that I used to drizzle on the taco remnants. I was so full but the corn was so good And I didn't know when I'd get a chance to return that I asked for another order. There's always room for more street corn.   I don't think there is anything I could truly find fault with this place, the food was absolutely amazing I just wish it was closer to the west side. I can't wait to go back!

KW7bRbvLjc7LIF84tB3JJg.text: I would love to have recommended Taco Guild from today's experience, the fact we walked in during brunch and were promptly seated with menus at a very clean table was the most exceptional part of my service today. It was also the only service they gave us.  We sat for a good 30 minutes waiting to have our order taken and no one even tried approaching us. We eventually left and no one said a word, including the hostess who had sat us 30 min prior. Maybe in the future I'll try here again, but it won't be any time soon.

tzuL4AemUF-qEaskdJpNIA.text: This place is out of this world. Great food and the building, a converted church, is sooo cool.  We were there during live music, talk about the best accustics you've ever heard... Built for a choir and sounds great.  Chips are light and salsa top notch, thin with a bite. Not thick and clumpy.  The Taco trio with free side was really good.  Although not on the menu, they have a flour less chocolate cake that is yummy and again not on the menu, they will do a flight of mescal for you.  Make sure you're not driving after.  Soooo much fun!!!

4BDObXIEZx__A5GZ7ATatA.text: Jalapeno margarita + steak tacos are amazing. Ambience with live music is also a plus!

GGRnVD7Cc01jlBuCMN6hEQ.text: Beautiful building great atmosphere yummy  yummy yummy tacos!!!!! Great service and love the options of different salsa!!!

xpjYUosmpcDbEmJkZRbtbA.text: We first heard of Taco Guild from the Travel Channel and it looked amazing. We flew into Phoenix and came straight here and it did not disappoint. The food was amazing, I would really recommend the chipotle cherry steak tacos in lettuce cups. Everything tasted sooo fresh and the service was amazing!!

AYKP2PG9rPmqG0rGm5MmEQ.text: GREAT ATMOSPHERE.   Had the ceviche to start (tuna) and I ordered the burrito. The food was good to me but the rest of my group were just ok with the food. the service was a bit slow. It was hard to get ahold of our waitress. The overall atmosphere of taco guild was great! I can see why people love it here. They had a live band covering oldies and new songs.

fFYj9BqM4BRwRndi9pTGLg.text: This is by far the best taco place in the valley,  even the state. The staff was amazing,  the Peking duck taco is one of the best tacos I have ever had. Food was brought out fast and totally accurate. I would also recommend the cherry chipotle steak tacos. I would give more stars if there were more.

MoStYSLQ952MPddIj1z6Yg.text: This place is good my gf recommends it she and a friend went here for lunch I hear the food is really tasty

z-vJulBKAD2EZWGzDnJxTw.text: Highly creative approach to the simple street taco establishment.  Wide and interesting options and excellent ambience.  Recommended as a very high quality offering in this  (admittedly  limited) space.

cKciZTmKYr9M8Mgw7Qb6Ww.text: Taco Guild is AMAZING! The Happy Hour margarita is delicious and super strong. Best $5 marg I have ever bought!   The tacos, salsa and deviled eggs are all delicious. And on top of the wonderful food, the restaurant offers complimentary valet. I would absolutely recommend Taco Guild if you're in the Downtown Phoenix area.  The only 'con' is that the inside seating is very loud (because the restaurant is in an old church). Ask to sit outside on the patio - there are misters and cute lights.  :)

gP04oEqNmNrQLkG849A0dA.text: This was a perfect place to celebrate Cinco de Mayo last night! We decided we would arrive about 445pm to attempt to  settle in before the celebratory rush would ensue..  and somehow as our luck was with us!.. Our party waited less than 20 minutes for a table! After that! The queue to get in was very long! I had forgotten how lovely this place is on the inside. The old church windows and some having excerpts from the Bible give it a very eclectic feel. The decor is just so cool and you find yourself looking around at all the windows and ceilings and murals! We were sat in the back room of the building and immediately there were chips and a variety of salsas on the table; waters too! I like that. In my previous review, I noted not liking the chips and salsas, but tonight I loved them! The variety of the salsas ranged from hot, to one that was a bit fruity, to a more chunky, garlic version. Happy hour here is great! Tonight was special drink that was a Paloma type cocktail with grapefruit; champagne; cerveza and Roger Clyne tequila.. and a wedge of grapefruit too.. fruity and fresh for $5. The management of Taco Guild was having a cool little contest for anyone who took part in this fresh libation: name the drink and if your entry is chosen, get a $50 Taco Guild gift card. In! Thats a few tacos and margs! Speaking of margs! The 1893 Margarita is their version of a 'house' margarita. $5 on happy hour! AND, its really, REALLY good! NOT too sweet and not too tart. I asked if this was smaller than the regular menu one, that is still a great deal at a $7.98, and our waiter said they were the same size. Happy Hour Monday thru Friday is 400-700pm. There is also a reverse happy hour later at night AND on weekends.. MOST of the day. Can anyone say, "Sunday Funday?!" The Brunch Menu looks fab and so do the Brunch Cocktails. Breakfast Beer?!   The 'Daily Taco' is a daily unique street taco of greatness available during the weekday from 300-700p and late night for a cool $1.99! Because this was Cinco de Mayo, we started with a round of drinks for all in our party and some starters: The Guild Duo: Housemade, fresh guacamole and amazing green chile queso that comes served warm over a tea light.. like a fondue. Seriously so good! We also started with the Diablo Eggs: Taco Guilds spin on a deviled egg that has a bit of serrano pepper, truffle oil and topped with a longaniza sausage to give it just enough kick. You get an ample serving of six of these! So, so tasty! Because this was my cheat day, I was seriously about to cheat my way through this with carbs and tequila! My entree was the Chicken Enchiladas. These enchiladas were so FULL of chicken and goodies that I was full half way through the first one and ended up giving my husband the other one! House made corn tortillas are filled with annatto braised shredded chicken, just enough jack cheese, green chile and tomatillo sauce. They are topped off with a bit of cojita cheese and corn and a drizzle of sour cream. The beans that are served with these are out of this world; NOT refried! This super filling entree is just under $10! I also had to try the Daily Taco. I can not tell you what it is! Not because I had a margarita, (okay, I actually had two!), but because even after I asked our waiter to repeat it twice, I could not remember! It was shredded pork and it was marinated in tequila! That's all I needed to know. Super delicious. Despite the fact that was a crazy, busy day for any restaurant serving tacos and tequila.. our waiter did not try to 'churn and burn' us out the door. We were given fresh chips and more salsa to go with the numerous drink orders coming from our group. He never let our waters go dry and apologized for the 'wait' , (not really a wait, at all!), for our drinks since it was Cinco de Mayo. The live music started in the bar around 5pm and it made the ambiance a lot of fun!  I decided to delve into the history of Taco Guild after dining here last night . The Taco Guild building history is pretty neat!  Fun Fact: The lot that the Taco Guild sits on was purchased for $30 to build a church. When construction began in 1893, it evolved into a one room schoolhouse named Osborn School. A year later it opened as a church and remained that way until 2012 when the property was deconsecrated. Taco Guild uses local farms for its produce for freshness and flavor.  The use of 'up cycled' plates kind of goes along with the history of the building and what you have when you dine here :  a story. This is the downtown place for trend, mixed with history, great service and amazing food and drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Diablo Eggs...
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Enchiladas ...I held the rice :)
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

68mOYIgZdIckU-_scnrpPQ.text: (Lyrics - Bruno Mars - Grenade)  Easy come, easy go, that's just how I eat Oh, try, try, try it all and I always give Should've known you were tacos from the first taste Had my eyes wide open, why were they open?  Came to you with all my friends and you tossed us some shots You tossed us some shots, you did To give me all your love is all I ever asked Cause what you don't understand is  I tried the Taco Guild for ya Throw my name on your place for ya I'll Bo Bites my reviews for ya You know I'd try anything for ya  Taco's in a church!?  This I had to try!  I came with my running gang to celebrate a birthday.  At first sight the place was pretty enclosed with some stained windows around.  High vaulted ceilings and the bar is up front where the altars would be.  This place was pretty cool in my book!  Complimentary chips and salsa at the start.  It was a hefty size and perfect with 4 different salsas to dip.  I ordered the Chorizo Meatballs to start.  Doused with sweet pear sauce it had a tad bit of kick as you chewed through the soft and warmly served meatballs.  For my tacos I shot for the Al Pastor Pork, Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef, and the Chipotle Cherry Steak.  My favorite was probably the Al Pastor Pork; topped grilled pineapple, jalapeno bacon, and pickled red onions.  I didn't really care much for the Coffee Braised Beef though it did sound fun.  It was topped with caramelized onions, mango jicama relish, and cotija cheese.  The Chipotle Cherry Steak again sounded fun, but was okay at best.  It was topped with pablano straws, chile aioli, and bleu cheese.    Overall, the place was a delight and beautifully nestled into a church.  Live bands during the weekend and service was lovely.  In the end, I would rather much prefer my street tacos...Street, but this place is a still a cool place to hangout.  Enjoy!

3trUSXOhTUJnwx8UFnqCVg.text: Great place to take a group or have some team building. And their lettuce wraps are more then enough food so come ready to eat.

zrD31CGXiuBMvcqaqpUXsQ.text: I love this place ! It is so different, so creative and that bar is beautiful. I love how nothing matches. And the tacos are so different yet taste magnificent. The service here is great as well.....

auM32ClIKDtub7OjAhg1hQ.text: Fun atmosphere, amazing chips/salsa/guac. Tacos are the bomb, and so is the corn on the cob. Definitely would recommend checking it out!

qOqZbLGlgwnCIVnExKQ1mA.text: This place was formerly a church now converted into the Taco Guild, making it a unique place to grab tacos and drinks.  The ceilings are high, and the windows have colored stained glass. In the center, there is a beautiful candle chandelier hanging from above. As I was walking in, the bar was located at the front. Two large TVs were playing near the bar. I immediately sensed the cool, pub-like ambience.   Arriving around 4pm on a Friday, there were plenty of seats around. The server let us pick our favorite spot. He immediately brought us complimentary chips, salsa, and 3 hot sauces.  We had fresh made guacamole to dip our chips. The guac had nothing special in terms of flavors; it's something I can easily make at home. We ordered at least 3 tacos to get a free side. The al pastor was my absolute favorite, and our server's favorite as well; everything was juicy and flavorful. I also enjoyed the pork adovada as the meat was very tender and delicious. The urban bean coffee braised beef was our least favorite since the beef was a little dry. Each taco was generously loaded with a lot of meat. It would have been perfect with a little more sauce and more toppings on the tacos. I'm not counting carbs, but I personally prefer double tortilla instead of the given one tortilla as it keeps the tacos intact better. It would be nice if they routinely provided lime on the side instead of the customers requesting them. The side of veggies did not have much flavoring, so expect it to be plain vegetables.   Service was wonderful. Our water was refilled in a timely manner.  They also serve a lot of delicious mixed drinks on the menu. I shall return.

vAm9osP-63yVc6ZSHLRo2A.text: Love the atmosphere. And I'm totally in love with Mexican food but I have to admit the deviled eggs are my favorite dish on the whole menu. Followed closely by the corn.

_CFPLnDMKykGpf_cDGmY2g.text: Stopped at Taco Guild after a couple of friends recommended it... have to say that it was a somewhat disappointing experience... besides the fact that you can't hear anything over the way too loud music and the guacamole made with avocado that wasn't ripe (big difference between firm and unripe/green avocado) the food was just average. If you like overly spicy food and and very alcoholic sangria, then you probably would give it more than 2 stars.  I am giving it 2 stars because my salad (even though it was overdressed) it tasted yummy and it was fun to checkout the decor. Good thing my husband gave me the heads up about the bathrooms (how much louder the music was in the bathroom), otherwise would have given 1 start instead.

ylJAvU-qTCz7koyvEgkn9w.text: Five Stars !! The best tacos in Phoenix hands down.  It's a extremely popular restaurant with the locals and out of towners in the know.  Service during their peek lunch and dinner hours can be somewhat slow but their tacos are worth the wait. I like the setting in an old Phoenix church with the stained glass windows and other unique trimmings . Highly recommend Taco Guild .

3Q-Z69yn_fiK6gkLlH8oxw.text: I am a big fan of tacos! This place has an ok selection of tacos not a lot of vegetarian options! Happy hour it's good their frozen margaritas are yummy and the usually have a HH taco (not vegetarian) but it's usually a good one! Great service!

5YRlUfug9ASTYaHQ1EzrPg.text: Tacos are amazing but the side dishes are mediocre. Especially the street corn which they charge more for.

dpEOKm1fu_XA_m460Jzi6A.text: I enjoyed this place very much. Not scary at all that this place use to be a church, and they still kept the benches and decor in here. Love the stained glass windows. And the lighting decor in middle was a nice touch.  We came here for taco tuesday. Weeeeeeee. COMPLIMENTARY CHIP AND SALSA. Yummmmm. The sauces were really good. I had the 3 tacos and corn on the cob on the side. Oh my goodness. It was a lot of food. On my three tacos I had 2 with vegetables that had zucchinis and bell peppers and the third taco was with rice and beans. It was mediocre.. I had to add hot sauce for flavor. They added too much cheese in it. Especially my corn. Ekkkkk. I had to scoop it off. :/   The server didn't ask me if I wanted corn or flour tortilla.. so I had to flag him down to ask. No biggie.  I'd come back....for chip and salsa :D

5lN7Z3YLGqxQ1fSXCYj4QQ.text: Last night my wife and I went to the Taco Guild to allow the restaurant to redeem itself.  Our previous experience was not positive.  On this visit, we were begrudgingly seated.  Then it took close to ten minutes for someone from the staff to come to our table with water and chips.  We found this to be unacceptable.  Once the waiter did come to our table, we asked that he summon the manager to our table so we could air our grievances.  She arrived at our table and we explained our dilemma.  We promptly left, never to return.

qRrEJXNr5znD9ij_XeaA0w.text: Better than Sol, great food at reasonable prices.  Salsas and guacamole are delicious, plus they have a wide variety of vegetarian food.

d6sJhFWeddudMiXmm1nfzQ.text: The duck tacos were amazing! I also had the salsa trio with an Al Pastor taco. The habanero salsa has the perfect bite to it. The 1893 was very tasty frozen. I loved the interior with the high ceilings, naturally allowing hot air to rise away from the patrons. I will have to visit again the next time I am in Pheonix.

1kPTdTooQi8CYooXCMg8Jw.text: Called several times for reservations and was hung up on 4 times. Very poor customer service. The people who answered the phone was very rude.

fZbc1ttThkFPFX0jXn7zKA.text: We took the family here after a basketball game and we all loved it. The ambience and beautiful building was breathtaking. The food was great too. The Corn was to die for as well as our tacos. We will definitely return.

Plsvfd1yngEesJmTwuYQaw.text: Second visit, disappointed. Al Pastor tacos were mostly fat and gristle. Guacamole was terrific so that was nice.

V2NUK7qsG4nhexZFK5AeaQ.text: Almost thought we weren't going to stay because our first impression was how unfriendly they came across but that changed quickly. Our waitress first seemed rude but was not that way at all once we decided to stay.  After the first impression,  everything was up from there.  The happy hour Margarita was great,  the shrimp and daily taco was ok, and the Tres Leches was incredible.  The waitress recommended the steak and blue cheese taco which is worth coming back for by itself. The old church atmosphere was icing on the cake.  Definitely recommend.

mkk-_V1L_og1h3VB0LP6Pg.text: do you like pooping wet stuff?  this is the place to be.  i've been here multiple times.  Service seems aloof.  Margs are good.  Food is VERY hit of miss.  And all of it will make you poop wet.

J3PDjv7hnr3wWDgErlvJmA.text: Ate here during my annual trip to Spring Training.  The building and the decor are absolutely beautiful!!  My advice is to definitely try the prickly pear sorbet. You WONT be disappointed!!!

0gAm0cP_nj-Wl46SqpCEIA.text: I loved the chorizo meatball with the spicy beets. Amazing!   New world tacos  Shrimp- 4 stars  Peking duck- 10 ducking stars. Haha. Fatty, exactly what I wanted  Cherry steak- way too sweet for my taste   Also side note, the mint guac tastes like a Vietnamese bun bowl.

FSuoDuKWDLnRqJpKmW7Eqg.text: I live down the block and was excited when it opened. The food is terrible. They have goofy tacos like Tye snapper abd burned veggies. The service is good however. This a a Z Tejas resturant and that says it all. Lets hope it changes hands soon

vh1zfvEdhlBSch16BZhChQ.text: Wonderful guacamole and queso. Duck tacos were my favorite. Margaritas were just OK. Loved the old church. Great place for dinner.

bJ95Ef1kMr-vA5y77YcHKw.text: Taco Guild is good, not the best, and ended up being a little pricey, but it's a really really neat environment. It wasn't busy at all when we went, which was good because our food came out quick. The tacos were about 1/3 of the size you would have thought they would have been. I highly recommend their lamb taco. It was delicious.

AGY6Ut7xLG8r7GucQ4my7A.text: Nice atmosphere.  Super friendly staff.  Food average at best.  The chorizo meatballs were tasty.  However, the beets used to garnish this appetizer must go!!!!   I talked to several who who are on the payroll and all advised that 90% of those who order do not eat the beets.  Maybe a shoestring potato instead....the beets are absolutely horrid.  A cat's coughed up hair ball would be better.

eFczl8wo9YU-sIhaDi9XmQ.text: 4 stars for the ambiance...eating in a dark-ish church makes you feel like you're in a repurposed building in Europe. Definitely well-done. I feel like they should host a gothic dance night here.  5 stars for chips and salsa and guacamole. VERY good!  2 to 3 stars for the rest of the food...not that memorable.  2 stars for service. We were ignored for the first 10 minutes we were there. The manager came over eventually and asked if we'd been helped. Then he found a server for us.  Expensive for what we got, we probably won't go back. But the ambiance is great...probably very good for a date.

1OAH3spq7-_YNFNSwALABQ.text: Chips are tasty and light with refreshing salsa. I tried the steak burrito which was filled with delicious flavors. Cocktails were also amazing and strong. Definitely recommend if you like an upbeat atmosphere.

J93F74APuzRo6ZPpu_69_g.text: Great tacos ... service can be a bit slow, otherwise I love the place.

waj0DoIwO8t1WO1ddaHc2w.text: Probably one of the most interesting settings for a restaurant.  HH tacos were great and they have a nice craft beer selection.

zDhENkseKOFkr44S55dpiw.text: Came here for taco Tuesday and margaritas everything was absolutely fabulous highly recommend this place will definitely be trying it again legal aid Indiana

bhQ0PiUB6LxzmZ681mU0dw.text: One word - three or more times!! AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME if you want innovative unique and DELISH this is the place! The tacos are simply amazing!!!  Try the coffee braised beef and the adovada and the Molida lamb - you can't go wrong with anything here!  Staff is great friendly environment - love this place - seriously I would travel hours to eat here!  Have to get the street corn and the tres leches cake and do NOT forget the margarita!

ENITYhklltAd36SNf6deZA.text: This place is beautiful and the food is fun and super tasty, especially the coffee taco and the street corn! Love the cocktails as well!

oEqLtQA1fJPJcY4KtXcMCw.text: This is a beautiful place to have lunch.  The stained glass from the church days is certainly unique.  Good portion sizes too.

3q_KxqcEnHTNg5hY2GPKIQ.text: I'd return at a less busy time.   We were there about 730pm on a Saturday night without a reservation.   The bar was loud and packed.   The bartender doing the best he could, they must've been short staffed, service was so slow   Margaritas were good, the chips and salsa delicious.  Guild trio was very good.  We were seated about an hour later and service again was really slow.   We ended up ordering several items, one didn't come and we were charged for it.  They delivered it to another part of our table, they thought it was a side dish.   I liked the locale, definitely want to try more of the food at a return (less busy) visit.

ak0N_vS8720GqDwZOBXmiw.text: This place never disappoints. It's an absolutely beautiful building with perfect decor; it really has a great atmosphere. The food and drinks are on point. Best tacos in Phoenix, quite possibly the world. This is a MUST if you are visiting Phoenix!

BPg-xEcRop2JNZjH1XdD-w.text: Wanting to get out of Scottsdale for a change a friend of mine recommended Taco Guild. Wow! Can't believe I've not heard or been yet before to this unique gem!   Located in a former decommissioned church the decor instantly catches your attention. This is unlike any other dining ambiance.  Stained glass and vaulted ceilings still remain and add to the allure.   I laughed out loud when I was presented by my server with 'The bible'.  Which is their separate menu of 100's of varieties of tequilas. I opted for 2 separate tequilas that the server recommended. Both were fabulous!  After that I went with their margarita with a mescal topper, which I have had previously at higher end Mexican restaurants.  Mescal adds a touch of smokiness to the margarita and takes sourness down just a touch. Highly recommended for my fellow margarita connoisseurs.   The chips came with 3 varieties of all hot goodness, which I love.   Tacos were phenomenal, steak and shrimp! Definitely had zing!    I'm literally debating driving over there right now just writing this review... It's making my mouth water and stomach growl! Maybe I'll see you there as I plan on numerous future visits!
