kqpAjMV58TmGos8pn2Db-g.text: First, you have to start with the wonderful atmosphere. Its in an old church in central Phoenix and has a warm and charming environment.   The menu is small, but of course most people are going to order the tacos.   We had the guacamole for a starter, can't complain! I love guac and it was yummy! For dinner, I tried the yucatan shrimp, chipotle cherry steak, and urban bean coffee braised beef tacos. My favorite was the chipotle cherry steak - it was a unique flavor combination, but completely worked! My friend had the enchiladas and was very happy with the dish. It was a decent sized portion with a great flavor.  I also tried one of the margaritas, it was pretty strong, but still tasted yummy! Definite win!  I would  go back.

HYmO195qkm3n9dFMwxHoGQ.text: Great place for taco Tuesday! Bar is quick, we worked with Adam really professional and was telling great jokes at the bar. He put the hockey game on for me which makes me a happy girl!! Definitely check it out, great happy hour!!

AM1oiNQlRliPUASW77cs_A.text: This place is pretty awesome.  The decor is like nothing I have ever seen before in a restaurant.  It is in an old church with stain glass windows and high cathedral ceilings. We sat at a high-top table in the bar area, and were served very quickly.  I tried the classic margarita and was not disappointed at all.  It tasted very fresh and not margarita-mix like. I enjoyed the elote, guacamole, and the al pastor tacos. The food was not as memorable as the margaritas though.  Not sure if that means that the drinks were just that amazing or if they were just really strong :)   Next time I am in the Phoenix area I will definitely be back again.

Nfk5KpovkXSUSTJPPDSXag.text: Looking for taco heaven? Your prayers are answered here.  Outstanding tacos and other delicacies with the only problem being there are so many great choices, you'll be full before you can try too many. The street corn is a must-try.  It's on the cob and on the mark for best side dish ever.  The tacos are nice and hearty, so two should suffice unless you're super hungry.      It's almost impossible to do, but save room for dessert. The Coconut Cream pie is outstanding.  The Prickly Pear sorbet was also refreshing and had great flavor - not overly sweet.    The atmosphere is beyond hip and cool - it's an old repurposed church.  The service is fast, friendly and efficient.  Prices are reasonable too - Hallelujah! I've found a church I'll frequent.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Cream pie.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos and street corn.

Qq2ac_sUDOVeZ1qfUc6GIw.text: If you had told me that someone decided to put a taco restaurant in an old converted church, I would look at you skeptically and tell you, "Well those tacos better be damn good." So now I will tell you, someone decided to put a taco restaurant in an old converted church and those tacos are damn good! Located in the shopping complex right across the street from Urban Beans, Taco Guild definitely delivers on personality upon first glance. With a high chandelier and stained glass windows, as well as wallpapered pictures of characters during times long ago, you feel like you've just stepped into a time warp situation. The menu includes delicious tacos with large helpings, and if you order three you have a choice of an appetizer or Street Corn. Please go with the Street Corn! The Chipotle mayo is divine and it is some of the best corn you will ever taste! The tacos we ordered included a range of meats and we sampled half of the menu, with the most notable being Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef. Each taco had its own unique flavors, but this one stood out amongst the rest because the beef was very juicy and paired well with the mango relish and cojita cheese. For drinks, they offer tequila samples, and although I passed on that the tequila based drink I ordered was very smooth. Their beer selection was average so I recommend anything with tequila to pair with the drinks, tasted much better. Finally, can't complain about the customer service either. We came during lunch time on a weekday and Eric, the bartender, took great care of us! We can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Popular tequila based drink, so smooth!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Unique decor

QN9taEq5CIUynqSax5Ga7A.text: Did you ever have a fleeting thought about having a big pour of wine during Communion on Sunday? Well you can have it...kinda at the Taco Guild weekend brunch!  Enjoy a casual Sunday Brunch with a beverage of choice in an old Methodist church, really!  The menu selection offers choices between old world cuisine or new world cuisine.  No matter your preference the flavors are delicious and the portion sizes won't put you on the couch for the rest of the day.  The food was hot and flavorful with a depth of spices that most would appreciate. Although the brunch crowd hasn't picked up that much yet, the ambiance was unique and I liked the ability to have a conversation with my guests without too much noise.  Their location near a light rail stop makes it easy to get to and enjoy the mimosas and Bloody Mary's without concern.  Enjoyed visiting with the manager as he explained the history and vision behind opening a restaurant in an old church.  It just works!  Amen.

KrZebhv6hJ2uoFesf3-NAA.text: Great atmosphere! Great repurposing idea! There is a pizza place in Times Square in an old church that I love and this is even better! Huge stained glass windows and they carried the design through with the tables and candelabras. Nice.   My burrito was totally great! Loved it! The salsa selection was fun, but the main salsa was too watery. Our server, Joshua was terrible! Very disengaged. He was way more interested in talking with his co-workers than serving tables. Ten or more minutes after saying he'd get more water, I finally went to the bar for it. That is just one example of how lame he was. BUT, go to Taco Guild, just make sure you don't have Joshua!  Food great! Atmosphere greater! Service terrible at best, but need to give it another try!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great table lighting!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You must be perfect. Ha! Gotta love churches.

s2lCeUltzI7toG7IbrcqSQ.text: Amazing atmosphere--in an old church! The food was excellent--recommend guild taco and  chipotle cherry steak tacos were amazing, and the street corn was delicious. Service was excellent. Great drink options. Fun place!

g36sMwtDLPyXJclLp6KFJw.text: Cool place. Inside of an old church. First time I went I was impressed. Good drinks, good food, excellent service. Second time couldn't have been more opposite. Service was garbage from the jump. First guy said he'd be back with chips salsa and water. Five minutes later he strolled right by our table with chips salsa and water and went to another table. Then a new server came up and asked if we were ready to order. I said I'd like the chips salsa and water to start. She came back with chips and salsa, no water. She took our drink order, ten years later she came back with them. They were decent, not as good as the first time I'd been there. My first time we sat inside and the server Jen was awesome. Acted as though we were friends, told us a bit about the old church, told us her favorite drinks, her favorite tacos. Told us about there salsas and how they're made. Super friendly without being over bearing, and on top of shit(and it was a busy Friday night). She get 10 stars herself.  This second time we sat outside, and that must be where they have the dum-dums work. Super slow, felt like we were totally forgotten, and there were other guests outside too. Drinks took forever, when I looked inside I saw our server chillin, flirting with the guy at the front entry, not doing shit.  When drinks came I said it'd be nice to get that water we were told about. Drinks were ok, not as good as before. Ordered our food, took forever. When it came mine was as advertised, but my girlfriend who ordered the Al Pastor tacos(grilled pineapple, jalapeno bacon, pickled onion, pork) had just pork and onions on it, WTF!! I told the server and she tried some bullshit line that the pork is actually cooked with pineapple and bacon flavors. I stopped her mid sentence since I figured this would be her logic. I told her I'd been here recently and ordered the same thing and it came with all the stuff it described. She look perplexed(I'm guessing that's normal). She took it off the bill though, so that was one thing she managed to not screw up.  Second round of drinks took forever again, so we decided to settle up the bill. At this point I'm still planning on tipping 20% like I always do(I've served tables myself, I know the struggle). But it took longer to settle the bill than it did to suffer through this shitty dining experience. She was no where to be found. I pulled some dude in that worked there to have him do it. Then she magically appeared, and then took forever to come back with my card. I put up with slow shitty service, the sloppy lazy kitchen, dehydration, and now I gotta wait 30 freaking minutes just to pay and leave. Now she's getting stiffed. She got 2 bucks on a $70 ticket, and we wanted to spend more, we were out to get lit up and blow money. I've never stiffed before and hopefully never will again but this was ridiculous.  Consistency is what carries a good restaurant. If I go one time and I'm impressed, and I tell my girlfriend about it all week, we go and get shit on, I'm never going back again. Too many other options, especially in Phoenix.  Step your game up Taco Guild. If you go, sit inside, hopefully you get Jen who waited on us the first time, otherwise good luck!!! I'd like to have given a 1 star, or none at all. But the first time was really cool.

J5kZSFldRtXjhyGyETgkmw.text: Attended a bday soiree, planned in advance so we had an excellent room off to the south end of restaruant. Approx 25 people (flight attendants) & we were all impressed with the organization of menu, serving, selections etc!! Their roasted corn totally amazing& no real secret to grilling corn in a husk, but somehow it tastes better here! I highly recommend, quaint interior, excellent food, wonderful staff!!!

EZi6Jx71qvqUHUzQhCWsgA.text: Go for happy hour. Get the taco of the day. (and maybe a side of that delicious street corn) The margs are delicious and the food is pretty good -- but nothing especially unique that you can't get at other taco joints in Phoenix. Taco Guild is always on the list of considerations when we want to grab a bite in the neighborhood, but it rarely ends up being the choice of the group.

ZnyvKd-o4vvfdZ6GbUFBsg.text: For phx this is a 4 star but outside of phx closer to a 3.5/3.   The environment is cool. It's an old church and it has lots of original stained glass (from what I saw) and a badass chandelier globe made of wrought iron. The bar is equally visually appealing with iron and wood.   The drinks are definitely well assembled but not very strong. I asked for a cucumber gimlet at the bar and they more or less understood the instructions. Points for effort (drinks still 3/5).  Food was hit and miss. Grilled corn app was delicious. Tacos were all over. The lamb was excellent and their pork tacos are both solid but their Yucatan shrimp and thai curry snapper were both 2/5. I got nothing uniquely Spanish or thai out of those last two, respectively. These are back to the drawing board tacos IMO.   Overall a solid place but nothing that really blew me away. I might come back if I hear some fellow yelpers giving updates but for now it's a one and done for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai curry on left, sweet potato and beef in middle, shrimp on right. You can probably skip the thai and the shrimp.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco plate
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing grilled corn

pJ12lvM3O98hBBnUuTCidQ.text: Orgasmic food! 3 tacos, corn on cob and a margarita ---HELL YES -- HEAVENLY....in a church environment! LOVED IT! Our service was over the top excellent too!  I'm glad we had a side room---because it was super loud and we were celebrating my mom's 75 bday. She didn't like the blaring music...

DckYEq3BaT3c9-Kv5wnmrw.text: Went for lunch with a friend, we both had 3 tacos and a side. The duck and lamb tacos were excellent, I did not enjoy the shrimp taco however. My side was Mexican street corn, very good as well. Pretty reasonably priced and a large meal for just a lunch. Parking was an absolute pain during their rush hour, but their service was quick.

vvhe-yIEsYxeMfLOi1AOew.text: This place was amazing but incredibly loud!  Sit outside if you go but do go!  Very cool building and great food and service!

EJFcs6OEHL9fXBkORsT7hg.text: Favorite tacos around. Atmosphere is amazing, live bands during the weekend. Corn tortillas here are PHENOMENAL. Love the unique selection of tacos. My husband says that the romaine salad is equally amazing. Street corn is on point! Can't go wrong at the guild.

DvCCD5BlNel-CeYhrBMAPQ.text: Restaurant is very nice and like the vibe. I ordered the enchiladas they were good not like the best I have had but good. Not impressed with the rice. However, the salsa and chips they give out are yummy. Would try again.

MaCHy063GifJJm-Qse5i5A.text: Food was fantastic. Really eclectic place. Had a DJ playing music and had a really cool vibe. We took our son who was 13months old and he loved the music and the guacamole. They made a kids quesadilla for him and the waiter was really knowledgeable and very attentive. Try the different tacos!

rOwX8rjiVkBjZMTRyZRF_A.text: A little pricey, but the old world tacos are great! The margarita was just okay. The new world tacos are great for those with a sense of adventure, but I will stick with the more old fashioned ones if we return.

XoOFtZqENsrFMfxZB4Ua5Q.text: The food was really good , I like that they offer the lettuce wraps because I can't have the tortilla. The street corn was sooooo good lol and the service was really good to. Over all the place was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggy &#34;taco&#34; and the cherry steak &#34;taco and the street corn

xQxnAGe54ZfsFqCuWVCBdg.text: This was a waste of my time and money I wouldn't ever go there  again I toook my sister and she didn't even like it

NPvNQ_IH24mvTMn-Bh7vpw.text: Found this pretty cool lunch spot with some coworkers one day. Really digging the theme with the church stained glass still intact. The tacos were great especially the shrimp taco. The salsas were okay, good for Phoenix standards but I've had better in SD. I'll be coming back for more tacos and tortilla chips (which sprinkled with lemon and salt are heavenly).

0l8gRI0E88Op0IUWMs4abA.text: Always loved taco guild. Great service and even better happy hour! We would come here often for their frozen margaritas and to visit our favorite bartender Selena! She is THE best!

qEZx4xfG4fNLuZy2mB_6Ng.text: This place has instantly become my favorite place for tacos. Upon entering we were greeted, and promptly seated. The waitress then took our order, she was very nice. The atmosphere is really unique here, converted from an old church. Its a wonderful clash of old and new.  The free chips they serve you while you wait come with an assortment of salsas. Ranging from guacamole dip to a mango salsa with some heat. I ordered the special of the day ,orange glazed chicken tacos. Just wow, let me tell you, very very good. I got three of them, skipped dessert, and was more than full.   This is certainly a place that I will be revisiting. The service, atmosphere and food were all great. Next time I will probably get something a little different just to be adventuresome.

UGX4ZvKYiIBbABkCW9kAfA.text: Sadly, the Ferrari of Minivans is no longer... she met an untimely demise a few weeks ago.   The whole famdam, including our St. Louis branch, decided tacos were in order before the St. Louians headed back home. We bandied about this place and that.. until mum (MUM!!!) suggested this gastropub. Natch, I've heard of it... just hadn't had time to venture down there from SoTem yet.  I'm firstly grateful that the historic old church building was saved from the wrecking ball and that Taco Guild left some of it's rustic charm in place. Who in their right mind would demolish stained glass?  I wouldn't go so far as to say this is a great place to bring kids, but we had a 5 y/o and a 2 y/o. The restaurant was more than accommodating, but the atmosphere is more grown up in nature. Not holding that against them.  Some of the famdam got the 1893 Margs (happy hour!) and said they were stupendous. We stuck with water... so we'll take their word.  The salsas... they give you FOUR... a big bowl of their house salsa that's on the mild side, with a slight kick and three small bowls of various other heat levels. I enjoyed every single salsa they had. Each had their own unique depth, flavor profile and heat level.  Our table also got an order of guac. It was a little "too chunky" and had to be hacked a little more, but the flavor was perfect; nothing missing.  Now for the tacos... they do not disappoint. I'm already plotting my next visit so I can try a couple of other meats. Several at our table got the coffee braised beef. It had a smooth, complex flavor to it - just like your favorite cup of coffee (not of the Char-Sucks variety). You can't "taste" coffee, but you know there's a smoothness to the flavor of the meat. A few of us also had the Adovada and that was incredibly flavorful and rich. There is no question every single taco filling is lovingly and artistically created by the chefs.   My husband also got the Cherry Steak which was a religious experience in and of itself. I could have rubbed it on my body and died happy. My sister got the Peking Duck and it was a shockingly pleasing flavor adventure. My brother had a shrimp taco and - while he said it was a little light on actual shrimp, the flavor of it was spot on.   These tacos are amazing. Again - I can't wait to go back and try some more.

QwbKMTUYuDF8luO27RDn6g.text: Last evening I posted a review of this restaurant from the standpoint of booking a special event. I gave the restaurant one star because of problems I had. However, this morning the operations manager called me, apologized and took responsibility for the issues. Mistakes happen, miscommunication happens; however his phone call was much appreciated and I will give them another try (and their food is good!).

DmqCyslt37byZgQsefZweg.text: Upon arriving we were seated promptly and that's where all the good parts about this trip stopped.  Our waiter took no less than 15 minutes to get to our table to get our drink orders.  But before our drink orders came (other than water) he asked us if we were ready to order.  We purposely spaced out our appetizer and entrees so we were sure to get our appetizer first (We told him we needed another minute we really didn't we were famished and tired of waiting but we just know if we didn't we would get everything at the same time).  Our drinks took 20 minutes to get to the table after they were ordered.  At that time we placed an order for our entrees they came out within another 10-15 minutes when we told him we never got our appetizer he bragged and said "Yeah food comes out pretty fast here." So we just struck the appetizer from the bill and told them not to bother.  The food was generic fare but for the price you'd think there was something I was missing it's completely ho-hum not innovative or cutting edge (There's literally a thousand taco places within a stones throw of this location)  And the thing that really ate at me about this is how they tried to paint themselves as some trendy upscale hipster hangout even dubbing it as a "Gastropub" well Gastropub.. I ordered a beer I ordered a 10% Double IPA not only did they serve it to me in a shaker pint glass (that was also dirty as the lacing only stuck to one side)   first of all anyone who orders a premium beer of any kind should get a proper glass not to mention something that's high gravity!? They have an extensive beer selection and yet still serve these massive high gravity premium aromatic beers in pint glasses.  This isn't a VFW in the midwest  slinging Bud Light this is an establishment painting itself as a premium restaurant there is no excuse for not providing a premium experience!  The main takeaways are this: Slow, unprofessional and boring.  There is no shortage of good places to eat in the valley so there's no reason to put up with mediocrity.

U-tzrv1sOgrBSNKa4qZcSg.text: Omg we went late and all they had was happy hour tacos but they we re to die for and the chip and salsa was amazing. Great atmosphere. I want to come back already. I recommend the chicken tacos because I ate 4 but I am pretty sure ever is delicious.

oZc2kq3b2ogVmJKt3qOQmg.text: Love this place!! Walking distance to the house, great food, different feel and great bar. very local, trendy, hot spot.

I5Fn3GNU5cJewa9IjKVGkg.text: Excellent choice for tacos and drinks!  Happy hour tacos were delicious. There happy hour margarita is also really good. I was surprised how long there happy hour lasts (2-7 mon-fri). I would recommend the lamb taco on their main menu. Yummmm

u2b1zEduTC1mTsEHHZFU8Q.text: great food,  great atmpsphere! Only draw back was live music was a little loud but overall an excellent meal and place

C9eyDQbK9acVjVOMkDNsjw.text: Tacos are good, corn is great, decor is nice.  Music on a Saturday was so loud I was yelling at my companion.  Full on yelling.  It was a dj who was dj-ing music which was odd as the place isn't really that kind of place.  No dancing was going on, and I requested to sit as far away as possible and found myself screaming "what?!" about fifty times.  We eventually just gave up and ate without talking.  But we had to listen to top 40 crap music.  Seriously, don't talk about authenticity and then blast autotuned music in my ears.  All in all, the food was good, the place really nicely decorated, but not at all a relaxing dinner out.  I went in the afternoon with someone else prior to this and it was very nice...maybe just avoid weekends?  I want to eat and chat with friends, not listen to a dj and sit in relative silence.

SiVbDKGT5Gi7ohUN8yKlAw.text: This is by far my new favorite place! $5 Happy Hour Margaritas are delicious and I even have a favorite server! Try it! You won't regret it! My fav taco is the coffee bean braised beef but every taco I've tried is wonderful! The sides have changed over time but I'm honestly never disappointed!  P.S. Ask for Tim as your server...he's the BEST!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I LOVE this place and even have a favorite server! Every experience there has been amazing!

1nW_z6KFsFqapcm9TqWhyQ.text: Not very impressed.  We had samples of 5 different tacos and 2 enchiladas. All of the food was very bland. I'm not sure if it was an off day, a new chef or something else. But at $4.50+ per taco, flavor should be a priority.  The ambience is really cool (though I find irony with a bar inside a church themed restaurant). The lack of flavor in the food will keep me from coming back.

8g1tDTJCgu58nD9XmxbBxA.text: The building is definitely different for a restaurant. We went on a Friday at lunchtime and it was packed, had to wait about 15-20 minutes. Enjoyed the chips and different salsa's provided. Tried the Chipotle Cherry Steak taco and the Al Pastor Pork taco, both were tasty and satisfying (which made me overlook the price for a "street taco"). Side note: the restaurant shares a small parking lot with a coffee house and a retail store, so be prepared to park along the street and walk.

I36gCt3wR-pu-zNzghNYcA.text: Oh... Taco Guild.    I bitterly resent having to give you a single star.  Pretty much everything is a disaster... from high-top stools designed by Torquemada, to the brazenly over priced drinks fetched by surly independently wealthy cocktail servers.  Our server looked like a lumberjack, yet acted like Serge from Beverly Hills Cop.    I had two tacos, "torn lettuce cups."  What I got was half a head of wet butter lettuce with a neat tablespoon of sodium soaked protein in the middle.  The pork adobo was indistinguishable from the coffee braised brisket.  Truly stunning for $3.95 EACH.  I have eaten more satisfying fare out of an MRE packet.    It is loud inside, which amplifies the horrific choice to put a jukebox in a restaurant.  There is a ton of service staff, none of which will make eye contact with a patron begging for a drink.    The chips were fresh and crunchy, and the salsas offered were not bad.  Perhaps that merits the single star I was forced to give.

VVV63G1PZdXlxvrvqqcBJg.text: Happy Hour Rocks...had yummy 1893 Margaritas for $5.  Ended up ordering the duck and beef tacos off the menu, delicious!  Came while I was waiting for my daughter to get out of school.  Loved the atmosphere.  Felt comfortable eating by myself at the bar.  Great atmosphere in a fun area!

54D9AbpMpd_w5XJON4tA4Q.text: The ambiance of this place is amazing. Old church turned into restaurant. Original stained glass and original ceiling. Had frozen margaritas - which were very good. Tacos had great flavor! Service and everything was great!

nbGLmcVb80guMhbMrEmEGw.text: Went in for lunch and the place was quiet. Ordered two of their specialty margaritas. 1 was great and the other was not for me. Thought for $10 a drink they'd be a little more impressive in size and flavor. Server was friendly and spent the right amount of time with my friend and I. Ordered a light lunch and opted for the bowl of the Posole. Mmm! Lightly spiced but full of smoked chicken and hominy. Chips and salsa were tasty as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Posole! Mmm!

HxJtzDnF7h_9j6h8OTufyw.text: Delicious tacos!! Love the street corn as well. Atmosphere is so fun in the old church and the live music nights are awesome.

uf-gStr8NxVmGteMS3utLw.text: Ok, so I did go back, because I received a nice response for the manager. The next time I went, the service was great. The tacos were okay- I prefer a little more flavor and spice though. I get that it's not traditional, but it was just too bland for me... I'm into very flavorful things and it tasted like they didn't even use salt on the meat at all.  So... It's alright. If I'm in the area, I'm not opposed to going again, but it's not really a destination for me...

cor4UYFMpSPFqV9I4Qg-fQ.text: Good stuff! Really interesting tacos 4 homemade salsas to start ? I'm sold. Service is a bit slow but the ambiance makes up for that. It's in an old church ! Didn't have any drinks but they do have an extensive tequila menu. Good prices too. Definitely be back

O_qB1ExJw6tksUnWi5lIVg.text: I've always enjoyed the Taco Guild but last night we celebrated my dirty thirty.  I had made reservations for 12 on Tuesday and then when we arrived our reservation was not on the list.  I immediately thought my birthday was ruined and was so sad that one of my favorite restaurants was a let down.       However we sat at the bar for a bit and they had a table within 30 minutes for us.  For the miscommunication they provided our party guacamole and cheese fondue! I love the taco guild more than even before!   Thank you so much for making my birthday so memorable and starting my dirty thirty with melted cheese and guacamole!  Much love!

8mzAnhnmvfJrdbzOy9X18g.text: Correct me if I'm wrong!  Taco Guild is brought to you by Z'Tejas!! Explains a lot.  I knew I recognized those cheap weird chips!!!!!  Tacos were just ok. I may go back for just drinks hold the chips and salsa.  The place is so stinkin cool it's a shame the food doesn't do it any justice.

kk8Qoxber7WdrQVfveREUw.text: Clearly, you come to Taco Guild for the atmosphere. Which is great. The tacos are expensive and sound better than they taste. The use of local ingredients earned this place its 3rd star.  The Happy Hour specials are reasonable and the orientation of long, group-style seating and dim lighting make it a good spot for that.  Bikes out front, set in an architecturally interesting church, hidden behind a Starbucks.

E6x397GEm4tc5hneBuPQwQ.text: As good as it gets when it comes to tacos.  Excellent deal for the 3 taco plate plus a side of street corn.  (We could have eaten the corn all day by itself).  Great margaritas.  Awesome atmosphere being in an old church with all the stained glass and lighting.  Highly recommend this place for any time of the day...

W3mxj3UDsxLDPnIYZ3VQFw.text: The restored church is unbelievably cool. The El Pastor pork is my favorite as it's like a gourmet version of a 2 am Mexican street taco. I love the chips and variations of guacamole as well.   The strange downside of this place is there is no clear hostess station and because of this they're horrible at receiving patrons through the front door. Now I love the food enough to endure this, but I've stood at the door so many times to the point it was awkward I had to stop someone to get seated. I've also been told they were on a wait while I could see open tables and simply needed to get somebody else to get a table.  On a sidenote the jukebox can be a blessing or curse. Lots of horrible music but they also have old soul music like Joe Tex on it. My advice is take it over early if you're going to stay for a while.

H8AG3n8axYLRZlUONc_QGg.text: We did not plan on going here but luckily we changed our minds and found our way to the Taco Guild. The service was excellent. The food was outstanding. You have to try the fresh made guacamole. It was excellent. The sweet corn was great and the fresh made corn tacos very good.  This was followed up with a very interesting conversation with the owner about the history of the building.

cD7Z1xOqtpl7GhE2yfYbOw.text: This would be a 5-star review if I left out the food.  I love the building, the decor and the layout.  It is a bit loud and the waitstaff seems to wander a bit without real direction.  We were so looking forward to having a great new lunch spot near our office.  After our dining experience we have no plans to return.    The food looked great... But it didn't taste great.  That's a real problem for a restaurant to overcome.  I did not enjoy any of the things I tried.  I had three different types of their tacos and only ate half of each.  The coffee beef was the worst.  The shrimp was the best of the three but again, wasn't great.  Heck, it wasn't even good or I would have polished it off.  The beans tasted as though they came out of a can and were off-brand.  The corn was probably the best thing we ate (besides the chips--but how do you screw up chips?).  When my parents came to town recently I took them there to show them the building.  My Mom was very excited and wanted to eat there and I dissuaded her based upon my experience.  There had better be some HUGE changes in their kitchen ASAP or there will be no hope for their future.  Great name but they don't deserve it!

JA1msijqr_mef40j4-OBVA.text: These are some of the best tacos I've ever had. Reasonably priced with tons of different options that vary between traditional Mexican favorites like Pork Al Pastor, chicken, and coffee braised beef. If you're feeling adventurous don't be nervous to try the Molida Lamb or Peking Duck! The service is friendly and fast, and people always come by to fill up your water and get you more chips and salsa. The salsa comes on a sampler platter of sorts that ranges from a traditional tomatoes based salsa to a mango/habanero salsa. All on the house including refills. If you get the taco plate, be sure to pay the extra 3 bucks for the Street Corn, which is freshly grilled corn cut off the cob mixed with chipotle cream and cotija cheese. Go during happy hour to get $6 margaritas that will beat any other margarita available at that price. This is foodie food for sure. And enjoying it while hanging out in an old church converted to taco bar just seals the deal as one of the best restaurants in PHX. Only issue is parking, but Taco Guild is worth running a marathon for, let alone dealing with bad parking.

NeJFV8U2XBPeA0BmlLsUjw.text: Pray to the taco gods at Taco Guild!  I came here recently for happy hour. We'll get to that in a minute. The first thing you absolutely notice when you walk in is that this place looks like an old church. And that's because..... SURPRISE! It is! They have amazing stained glass windows, high ceilings, and anything else you could think you might need to have a religious experience involving tacos.  We ordered a few tacos, street corn, some guac and queso (which I remember coming as a duo appetizer type thing). Everything was delicious, albeit somewhat unconventional. Who knew peking duck would be so delicious in taco form?! The coffee braised beef taco was also delicious. I remember we had a taco of the day as well - it was alright - nothing worth writing home about but not bad by any means.   The real standout was the STREET CORN. Granted grilled corn is always a winner in my book. But whatever they smear and drizzle all over the top really makes it outstanding.  Overall we were quite pleased. It was a pricier than other happy hours I've been to with similar menu options, but none of us left feeling dissatisfied.  Raise your corn cob in the air and pray to the peking duck taco gods!

yhSrDndIvLadTD-255AUpA.text: 5 stars. This place is super yummy.  To start, we had the chips and guac with pineapple. A really good combination. Super fresh.   I got the pork adovado taco and a coffee braised beef taco. Incredible. I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.   Also ordered the sangria and it was a bit strong but really refreshing.   Love this place. The decor is awesome and low key vibe. Highly recommend.

tdcK9KAs3BB-Z9MR5taJZg.text: You need to try this restaurant. The vibe is so cool. Best salad I've ever had. What a great experience! Look no further. Come here.

uD3XrIzk--evKN_r5kgKBg.text: My friends and I went for happy hour last Friday.   A bit overrated.   Service, horrible.   Food, less than mediocre.   Atmosphere, eh.   I wouldn't go back.   But if you like the loud "hipster" scene that doesn't offer much in return...this place is for you.

d9xZ1Fs1_WGozyCD5c_E1A.text: I am here for the first time but not the last. The street corn was awsome and so we're the Margaritas! I also had the taco of the day which was a pulled chicken taco! Yummy!  Come for happy hour, you will not be disappointed. The service was also amazing!

pn1bO_2YpmwMnDP0aMcYKQ.text: After work....on a Sunday....Fathers Day. But thanks to Taco Guild, that frown turned upside down. First off, the interior is absolutely gorgeous. It's an old church, although you can drink yourself silly if you choose. We had their fish tacos. For lunch, the prices were good for larger than street size tacos. Plenty of fish bites in the tacos. 2 each were enough. It came with a side of beans and rice, both also very tasty.  The food and service were great, but I wasn't impressed with the beer bloody Mary drink. I normally love bloody Mary's, but not this concoction.  So glad we found this place by a random drive by.

c5ldPkYcABLL2q3o14CRDw.text: Cool little spot in Downtown. Had the corn and 3 tacos. All of it was awesome.  Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome tacos!

q6CyDzHj9GTYsX491OzVUg.text: Very cool place with a terrific assortment of yummy food. Parking can be tricky but well worth the effort. Drinks and food are solid and the staff is very attentive.

BKpDrpDvSC0tByIn2S9IXw.text: I dont understand the hype of this place. I have had tacos just as good in my home state of Maryland. Perhaps because it is in a church? Nothing special enough to warrant numerous trips. Not to mention the manager could learn the meaning of "good time''.

-tD5J9znoWFhThCGme5S8Q.text: If you've never been here, change that right away. The tacos are nuts, and they're not expensive. I'm a big eater, and leave stuffed when I take advantage of the "3 tacos, with a free side" deal.   The molida lamb tacos are worth their weight in gold, and imho set the bar for what a an artisan taco should be.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Molida lamb, duck and plum sauce, and coffee braised beef.

p4cdD-XVTh_FmYJwuVThZA.text: I have been to this restaurant on two occasions and it is so fantastic.  The ambiance is so nice, I think it was a church turned restaurant it is nostalgic. You need to try all the tacos they are all delicious in their own right.  But my favorite is the lamb followed by chipotle cherry steak and the street corn is a MUST although I saw the salad that a couple next to our table and it really looked good.  Can't wait to go there for my third visit.  YUMMY!!!!!

IRHTk3ri_A7oBZVfOWpoxA.text: Great food and late night happy hour. Service can be hit or miss. Drinks are good as well.

0j-wdk72lbuMgvLc0H2W0A.text: First times guests this past week and what a delight. The old Baptist Church is such a divine setting and many of the church's features remain such as the gorgeous stained glass, the wood beams, huge metal chandelier, and more add to the ambiance. The shrimp burrito is my new sin. Huge and loaded with shrimp. Get their early as parking requires a prayer, but well worth the trouble for a delightful meal.

U4o7Gw0m3FDS-NZ0k4nA9w.text: Beautiful place. Nice environment. The food is great but I've certainly had better tacos on the street. Come here for boogie dates and expensive tacos.

LPCKwi-JJZeg94VCJPBAhg.text: Nice atmosphere and the service is good the food is okay but I'm a bit biased on Mexican food being from Cali however I did have an enjoyable experience on my visit to Taco Guild I ordered the ceviche I liked the way they cooked it but did not like the chips.. my only suggestion be more traditional on certain dishes

tYjdBE-SY-LSMjU0DgEebA.text: The food here isn't worth the price. Had the burrito and there was no flavor to the meat and the side was small and bland as well. If you are looking for good Mexican food chipotle is a better option than here.

V5HXChDmYxY4wh6huQhP3A.text: The establishment itself is awesome, then add good food and drinks and you have it made! Only drawback, the EXTREMELY LIMITED parking - it's horrible.

wlRbaYYEY-WKK1uoD6cVSw.text: This place is amazing. Everything from the tacos to the Street corn to the salsa. Do yourself a favor and get a chipotle cherry steak taco (or 3) and you won't be disappointed. The Street corn is also amazing and the free chips and salsa come with 4 different kinds of salsa and fresh thin chips. Highly recommend this place! Also they have great beer which is hard to find at most Mexican food restaurants!

VBNQNOW74mNGxv2PjdVedw.text: Really cool atmosphere!  It's like an old church... I ordered the three tacos with a free side and they were great.  The guacamole seemed bland to me but the queso was fantastic... order the guild duo and toss some salt on the guacamole and you'll be set.  Great and varied drink menu also!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JjDdvIXuA8OkopSHumxpGw.text: Amazing atmosphere. We keep going for this alone. I can't rave about the food though...its just ok. Live music is fun on the weekends though. Service wasn't too memorable either.

RCKYUzms2wfe18OStt58eA.text: I love this place! the tacos are amazing. especially the cherry chipotle. the chips and salsa they serve are always fresh and I have always had good service. the atmospere is cool. it's a low lit area and feels like a real guild/tavern!! check this place out - even if it's not tuesday lol

onB1AbK1YoBbW_yhE4s_HA.text: This establishment is groovy-mellow yet stylish and hip. Originally it was a Methodist Church - built in the late 1890's AD. The original church burned down and the current building was constructed in 1948 AD.  They have the original stain glass on the windows which show scenes from the Bible. The food was delicious and the service was superb. Call or check their website for current musical acts for their Friday & Saturday nights. They offer courtesy valet service on the weekend - please remember to bring some cash to tip the valets.  I will return and will also recommend this restaurant to my family and friends.

sLlUhe8Ubs4VdridB-hVHw.text: formerly a historic church, Taco Guild has a fabulous interior with artwork that is hauntingly authentic, harkening back to a more gentile era of Lords & Ladies in exquisite attire, the stained glass windows are stunning, the menu, traditional Mexican fare the modern sports bar with tvs, is in stark contrast to the classical paintings, adorn the walls, a truly unique dining experience and pleasant surprise for art lovers, Rated G

NuJAlNJIRjysJy7KUyALIw.text: Good lunch spot - get the ono taco; otherwise, it's hit or miss. We like the burritos.  Yummy corn tortillas are made in house. Tasty cocktails, though.  Fun atmosphere.  Try taco Tuesday.

9Msh1_-VYuh4-r4wXU334g.text: Service:   Fantastic. Friendly, and she did her job well, no complaints. Dark haired waitress. Quick, checked back often, and even easily split the check.   Happy hour:   Ended at 7pm tonight, we got there in time for $2.50 daily taco, which was bbq pork. Got 4. So perfect. Juicy, and those crisps in it were delicious.  Appetizers:   Deviled eggs were made just right. The serano peppers is just blended into the yolk and it wasn't spicy. The sausage that came with it was overcooked and dry, but the eggs were the primary item and were great.  Meatballs were good. The sauce was just the right blend of sweet.   Chips: Crisp, not hard and thick like many Mexican restaurants. Salsas were great, came with a large mild dish, and 3 small cups of the spicier salsas.  Verdict: Will definitely go again.  It was a Thursday and packed up just before 7pm. Seating smaller than most places. Not sure if they take reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great ambiance in this old church.

u-SU70wtS-wJCsOzuwZHdQ.text: Awesome place, good Mexican food that is on par price-wise with the other restaurants that are in the area. The building itself used to be a church so the architecture and atmosphere are cool. I've tried both the burritos and the tacos and both were very good. Food choices are similar to that of Joyride.

qiLTP4QCoRWINh851j40wQ.text: Enjoyed a business lunch with colleagues here today.  It's located in what looks like a cinder block former church building, and it's loud in the main room.  It's definitely a trendy atmosphere.  We sat in the back room that is a little smaller and quieter so we could have a conversation. Obviously tacos are the star of the show here, but I decided to get the grilled Romaine salad - pretty good, perhaps a little too much dressing. It's a big portion.  Also got a Lamb taco to get my protein and that was fantastic, very flavorful.  Service was very attentive even when it started to get very busy about noontime. All in all, a nice lunch but I'm sure there are more standout tacos in the Phoenix area so I might try something different next time.

CTTe-31VAG-d-AHGReryyA.text: This is one of, if not the best restaurant I've been to since moving out to Arizona 3 years ago.  The service, the food, and the atmosphere all get 5/5 stars.  Trish is a great manager and I constantly saw her helping out waiters/waitresses and the bus boys with their tasks while the dinner rush was still dining.  Jon was our server and he was extremely helpful with recommendations and provided great service.  I recommend any of the margarita flavors and especially the chipotle cherry steak tacos as far as an entree goes.  You will not be disappointed.  Live music on Friday's and Saturday and the guy they had Saturday was great.  The building is equally great to look at and the renovations to make the church into a pub/restaurant were extremely well done.  My wife and I live in Mesa and I'd rather make the 25-30 minute drive to Phoenix to eat here than most places by us.

eJ7Nwgic_4E8WDpHeoEcSg.text: This is a unique and interesting restaurant housed in an old church.  The building is interesting and features stained glass windows throughout.  I tried the street corn and the 3 taco sampler (shrimp, roasted veggies, and fish).  While these were all good, I don't understand how this place earned the reputation for being one of the best taco places in Phoenix.  Yes, the restaurant itself is interesting.  However, the food wasn't any better or worse than any other so-called modern gourmet street taco places.  Would I return?  Sure.  It is a neat place.  However, don't expect to be absolutely blown away by a delicious and unique menu.

cg6jfvQ15vGoq9sUFEyhiQ.text: Good food, good choice of tequila, fun atmosphere, but it is noisy as heck. I mean at times its just down right loud and you really cannot expect to have a conversation across the table. Its inside an old church and given that they kept the interiors as is to a very large extent I do not think the acoustics do not lend itself to playing R'n'B or techno or anything at that volume that the music is currently played at least.   Now that I am done complaining about what is wrong, what is good is the drinks. The selection of tequila is extensive enough to keep me from complaining and that takes a lot. The service is fast and the bartenders are fun and great to talk to and do not rush you when eating at the bar. The tacos are good, but not necessarily make me want to go back right now kinda great. The chips and salsa is also pretty legit and happy hour prices are well the kind that make you happy.  Regular prices are I believe about a 150% more (2 vs 5$) and I have pretty much never been here at any other time, so take the taco pricing at face value.

VU_giFV9BbLMwGzs3P_yYQ.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon. The place was moderately busy but we came in the early afternoon so not quite dinner time yet. I will start off with the pros. Chips were amazing. My wife and I literally went through 3 bowls of chips before the meal was over. Salsas were decent. I liked their house salsa and the other 3 were unique. Service was also very good.   Now on to the cons. Overall, tacos were very unimpressive. I feel like they are trying to do way too much with their tacos. I feel like the idea is there but the execution was lacking. I had the vegetable taco, al pastor, and the pork adovada. All of them were either lacking in flavor or were spiced too heavily. For example, it tastes like they put a lot of cinnamon in the pork adovada which would be good, but it was just way too much of that flavor. I got flour tortillas which are supposedly homemade but you could have fooled me with that one. Best taco they had was their daily taco it was a smoked chicken taco with a mustard aioli and coleslaw. That one was really good. The side of rice literally had no flavor, super bland and it tastes like they didn't even put salt in it.   I most likely won't return. Their deviled eggs did sound good, but now I don't know if I will return to try them.

8WYyaMf8-b94WIKV4lNQIA.text: The first time I came here was for lunch with my dad, we had to wait nearly 15 minutes to be seated as this place gets very busy around lunch hour. The atmosphere was beautiful, with its tall vaulted ceilings and frescoes painted on the walls, the full bar is majestic, making you forget that for decades this building was an ugly rectangular church.   Oh and you cant forget that the outside looks like a gdam castle!   Those are the only good things I can say about this place. The menu is small and the food is bland, made with seemingly store bought materials and lacking any flavor. The drinks are over priced and the waite staff seems dead inside, at least each time I've come in.  All in all its a cool place to point out to people, maybe even to grab a drink, but definitely not worth getting food. Especially not when Gadzooks is across the street, amazing, and cheap!

E3KlsMO_ZwBVb07QO3OWFQ.text: Second visit so we were able to confirm that the food is good! We had the taco of the day, Asian Carne Asada tacos,  elote, margaritas and blue moon! Happy hour delights!

VBbNamlnq9Jj9BhyBG3FJQ.text: First of our three taco places that we visited today in the same general area.  First, we all agreed the setting was great. How can you beat an old church?  We came in the afternoon and had no problem getting a table for four. Service was good and friendly. Tacos were just okay. We each selected two and stuck to that for the other two places we hit. I had the shrimp and the lamb. Lamb was decent, but a little dry. Interesting flavor. The shrimp was very bland. Shrimp doesn't have a lot of flavor to begin with so I was expecting something to give it some staying power but there just wasn't anything there. Others in my party were pretty much the same with their selections - one so so and one ok-decent. Worth a stop in, but not sure the building is enough to get me back considering the other options around.

B54Z8LTWnhtA9VRqWii7SQ.text: STREET CORN. If that's all I ever ordered I would be happy. However, the tacos and other sides are also amazing. I love the little surprise taco of the day.

yEk0ooPRV8mOhUhP-pQsCg.text: This place was a real find in Phoenix! Visiting from NYC it was open and hopping on a Sunday night.  Great tacos and fun place!

_KBC1A2pn57QFHF_TBxtkA.text: Tacos, margaritas and street corn taste delicious, staff friendly and fast! Decor different from the rest of the taco restaurants but interesting.  The only negative thing I would say is it got a bit loud inside. If your looking for a quiet dinner this is not the place for you but if you don't mind the noise have it at!

34KIqwvEDE8DBYJFROvDIw.text: Great building with stained glass, candelabras, and super cool decor overall. The staff was very quick and attentive. Tacos were great and all local brew was served. The deviled eggs (Italian sausage) were amazing and well worth the 20 minute wait for the seating. Good prices also, but then again, I'm from Long Island where prices are always disgusting. Check it out for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FqUj9Eue998wqNAqJx3zHA.text: I'd been craving Taco Guild for a couple weeks! It's one of those places where you know everything is going to be flavorful & seasoned well. Tonight, I got the daily special taco, an Al Pastor Pork taco & a side of their street corn (off the cob). I also had a bite of the Chicken Enchiladas, which turned into me finishing them! Our waitress was soft spoken & very nice. I've always had good experiences with the staff. Friendly & they know the menu well! Ask for suggestions & you won't be let down! Oh, & should I even mention the building? It used to be a church! The decor inside & out is something you'll want to check out at least once!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tres Leches Cake
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Cream Pie
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily Special Chicken Taco, Al Pastor Pork Taco &amp; Street Corn

0Y_irfFNjpI9tVTHAcVzPA.text: Old church converted to a Mexican restaurant, I guess the heathen in me is okay with that. Chips are pretty good. Tacos, not Mexican at all, they're definitely Americanized. They're still pretty good though. This place is always crowded so plan ahead. The time I was there, they gave my table away. They made it right though. I still have the free drink token.

MIMpXfZX08AbUcZnPdGKAQ.text: Had high hopes for my first visit based on the reviews.  Unfortunately, the experience was average at best.  Trying to do a lot with the food and flavors,  with marginal execution.  Food  quality and preparation were mixed,  some well prepared and warm, others over or under cooked and cold.   Guacamole, salsa,  and sauces bland without richness of flavor or texture.    Nice interior and pleasant servers.  All in all,  unlikely to make our dining rotation.

uK39PXC-3GH6UeCvUtILwQ.text: This place Introduced me to street corn.  Now I have to have it all the time.  You have to try the Cherry chipotle steak tacos.  I have them with lettuce wrap.  Amazing.  This restaurant is in an old church.  Love the reuse of the building and kept the original parts.

tOKLaIs0CIO1FSKe-bFaGg.text: Didn't have reservations and showed up with 8 people for dinner on a Saturday night at 530.  We were told we got lucky and a long table at the entrance was just clearing out so we went outside to wait.  20 minutes later, we were seated.   Server came over to let us know it was still happy hour and took our drink order. We started with bundido and 2 orders of deviled eggs with chorizo on them. Both were good.  After seeing all the corn and taco pictures, we almost all had to try it. I also had the ceviche which I wouldn't recommend.  The chips are good but very oily. The salsas were all good. They gave a big bowl and 3 little ones with more flavor and heat.  Service was just super slow.  All the food came out separately. It took forever for 4 people to get their food and everyone had to start cause the corn was getting cold.   The last 2 guys got their food 15 minutes at least after everyone else.  Server said sorry but my corn also didn't come out.  Great on asking if we wanted more drinks but I felt bad for my birthday dinner guests who watched us eat.  The kitchen must-have been backed up.   The interior is beautiful in a side note. Old church with stained glass windows and beautifully decorated. Loved the wood benches and the owner or manager seemed to be at the front entrance trying to keep an eye on everything.  Would have been nice for him to stop by to at least say sorry for the delay.    They also have a patio that looked cute.  Located right next to a starbucks and they have valet parking in their lot.  Food is good. Service time was really bad thus just 3 stars. Definitely try the corn...it's great and even the soup was delish.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ceviche
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 more tacos and awesome corn
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 tacos and amaze balls corn

TIpfk5XHXdBQ99JuMqAyWQ.text: While vacationing in Phoenix, we tried many restaurants. This place is awesome! Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu. Being from the mountains of NC, we weren't sure what to order because we're not use to spicy foods. He was so helpful. The food was great, the atmosphere delightful, reasonably priced

cntnCR41aeW8gu6--eAh7g.text: 3rd time's a charm! First time I went with co-workers for lunch & it was amazing. Food & service were both great so a few weeks later we decided to go for happy hour. I was disappointed by the happy hour menu, not really a place to go for happy hour if you're looking for good deals. I also strayed from the margarita and wasn't happy with the vodka berry drink I got. Server was very accommodating & switched my drink out for margarita. Unfortunately the margarita tasked like sour mix with a drop of tequila. The food tasted like it was almost a completely different restaurant - the Guild Duo we got during lunch was amazing, unlike any other queso I'd ever had...not so much the 2nd time. First time at Taco Guild I got the guild chicken & seasonal veg tacos & they were both delicious. 2nd time Al Pastor & Guild Chicken but it just didn't taste as fresh and there was something else missing that was there the first time. The other difference was - first time we were seated in main restaurant area which has a really cool vibe but there is this overflow area that is slightly separated from the main restaurant &bar area. The room has 8-12 tables but it absolutely feels separate from main restaurant and when it got busy it felt like our server forgot about us. My third visit that room was my only complaint. I was the first and only person in that room while I waited for the rest of my party and I felt like an outcast. Everything else about that third visit was spot on. I told the server that last time I was in I wasn't thrilled with my margarita. He convinced me to try the frozen margarita  even after I told him I am not a fan of frozen. 100 times better than the other margaritas on the rocks I had tried the 2nd visit (too bad the frozen margarita isn't on happy hour menu). That same server convinced me not to exclude the blue cheese from the chipotle cherry steak tacos. I hate blue cheese but he was 100% right, there is just something about the combination that makes the blue cheese melt in with everything and enhances the flavor bit not with that typical blue cheese flavor that I'm not a fan of.  Also had pork adovada which was awesome. My guests, out of town consultants I was working with, truly enjoyed taco guild and vowed to be repeat customers when they return in a few weeks for our next set of meetings. They both loved the taco guild version of sangria which I wasn't a fan of but I didn't realize it was supposed to be a version of sangria since there really isn't any wine in it. ( it's berries vodka and something else that definitely isn't wine). The only other issues I have had at this restaurant is the servers really seem go get confused with table numbers in that back room and servers are very eager to take your order. During second visit we had at least 5 people try to bring us food that wasn't ours. Third and fourth visit servers tried to take our dinner order at least 6 times before we were ready (and 3 or 4 of those times were before we had our appetizers). Then  when we were ready to order our server was no where to be found. If they can figure that part out this is easily a 4 or 5 star review. Maybe I'll be able to update in 3 weeks when my office moves & Taco Guild becomes an after work meeting place!   *CHIPOTLE CHERRY steak poblano straws, chile aioli, Bleu cheese. 4.95 PORK ADOVADA mango jicama relish, avocado, cilantro. 3.95 AL PASTOR PORK grilled pineapple, jalapeno bacon, pickled red onion. 3.95 GUILD CHICKEN annatto-braised chicken, grilled corn, red bean pico, avocado, Cotija cheese. 3.95 GRILLED SEASONAL VEGETABLE fire-roasted peppers, roasted jalapeno hummus, Cotija cheese. 3.95

F2NbAjx2Cy1hVQnUBKFD4A.text: My wife and I just happened to be at Starbucks when we decide to try Taco Guild. Once arriving we were seated very quickly. Unfortunately it was at a table that hadn't  been cleaned (kinda gross if you'd ask me) which shows a lack of communication between who ever is cleaning the tables and who ever is sitting them (or they couldn't care less where they sat my wife and I). The tables and chairs are booth style so it was a bit uncomfortable for me. The server was very nice and greeted us very warmly. Unfortunately (and I might attribute this to a busy night on his end) we weren't really told about the menu. Once the waiter left my wife and I felt as if we knew nothing more about Taco Guild then when we sat down, this could have been excused if this places had been open for a couple of months but this was the third night it was opened. All in all the meal was great it came out quick and hot and the server seemed to have adjusted better and was accessible more and more throughout our meal. I recommend the Taco Guild the food was great at the atmosphere is killer and I'm very excited to see if there are any sports nights or weekends coming up at Taco Guild. If you're a selective eater please make sure to ask questions (next time I'll take my own advice as well). Please see below for a personal side note...  *The meal went fine and I seldom felt a I need to call my waiter over. As we were leaving a man which I presumed worked there (he was standing around looking at the tables and standing with the host and what I assumed to be the owner...or maybe he was the owner) went to the door and held it open. What I hadn't realized was that he was holding it open for a couple (white and in there 50's maybe) coming in and not for my wife and I (Hispanic and white respectably) which were going out. The man after noticing my wife and I motioning towards the door continues to motion the couple which was entering to come in. Awkward at best this situation left a poor taste in my mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One was amazing the other was a mistake. Lol
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is pretty rad looking!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool Bar

vyK5qimMmLV_KfgPPvCkbg.text: Food was really delicious. Had the taco and side combo. Had the Al Pastor and Braised beef. Corn for the side. The pastor is definitely the best, and from opinion of my other 10 coworkers, it was amazing. The corn was extremely delicious. I wish i had more but overall satisfied. It can be pricey but its worth it. Its definitely a cool concept and environment. I will definitely be back.

H23Gev-tDmfLCYS2fGTj0w.text: Unique tacos on the menu and tasty salsa options. One taco, the lamb was out of this world... The others pretty basic and I have had just as good elsewhere. The tortillas seem pretty thick and a little chewy. I would try again, just to see if other options on the menu are better, but there are other restaurants that are just as good.

Mn2GHVHSv2WGpfitmADJsA.text: I am not sure what the hype is all about, but this place was not very good. We were seated at one of the tiniest tables with no room for the silverware or plates of food. I dropped my silverware a few times during our dinner. They were closing pretty soon so they could have easily given us a bigger table since it wasn't occupied all night.  The chips and salsa were very good. The elote was really good. The guacamole was fresh and delicious. I will give this place two stars for those reasons.   However, the tacos that are actually mini tacos that are priced the same as regular sized tacos were awful. They were filled with dried meat and completely lacked flavor or spices. It was as if someone blindfolded the chef and told him to grab three ingredients and throw it in a taco and put it on the menu. The duck taco is literally fatty duck meat, and fatty pumpkin seeds. Throw something fresh on there to cut the fat of the duck off! All the tacos tasted the same. They were all equally bland. I would have been much happier going to Chipotle, sadly.   The service was also subpar. The waitress had poor time management skills when we were waiting for our credit card back and she spent 20+ minutes returning it. It literally takes two seconds to put a check on a table. I understand if you get caught up in stuff, but come on! I also let the manager know about our awful dining experience, and he told me that he would call me back. That was a month ago. And here I am writing this review because this is what happens when management doesn't take care of the issue at that moment. I would not recommend this place if you're looking for tacos. If you're looking for drinks and appetizers, go for it.

9S8165dHr5qFXbO6Y-LKRg.text: The food lacks flavor and has no spice. There also is no Mexican atmosphere. I gave it two stars because I think the building is kinda cool and I like the lettuce cup option for the tacos.

_ZAsAOJWXQeEFelGpMrofg.text: We were visiting Phoenix from NY on our annual baseball trip, we like to eat at gastropubs to try some of the local brews.  The food we ordered was absolutely delicious, especially the chipotle cherry steak.  Garth (manager) had come over to speak to us, explained to us where he got the meat from, and that it was all from local sources. He offered us a small sample of the Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef, also delicious.  If i lived in Phoenix i would become a regular here, it was that good.

7Ih9lJM5R8OxQhLcVldf7g.text: Gourmet Taco, not for my taste buds. The combination of the flavor did not do it for me. The Guacamole was ok but I have had better. The ambiance is fantastic and maybe for drinks and to chill with friends but I do not recommend for food. Old school street tacos are still the BEST.

WEgA6oubjbcR1Jgb_pS3og.text: Same owners as z'tejas. Decent food. The old church they set up in is pretty cool, like the concept but the execution was mediocre. Bartender told me to hold on a sec...which upset me a little bit. Tacos were bland and nothing had that much flavor. I've tried twice but can't bring myself go in again. Sorry guys, hopefully things change for this place. The concept is cool, but the food and service need work.

-tvMMeIstjp4bl7BOG9IhQ.text: Updating my review to 4 stars. I've been back a few times since giving it 3 stars, and Taco Guild has found its stride. Grilled romaine salad is rally delicious- add chicken! Some of the best complimentary chips and salsa I've had. IV wonky ever been here for lunch. The queso is my personal fave. The veggie burrito was good but unmemorable. The chicken enchiladas are awesome and shareable. The building is cool and service was solid. Taco Guild, you earned a better review!!

F8t-8xhpEFrBlb5uW11vyQ.text: Incredible architecture as it is a wonderfully renovated Church.   The tacos, drinks, and salsas are very, very good. The meat choices for the street tacos was both fun to choose and delicious in taste. This is a lot more of a "get your eat on" type establishment than a "where is my selfie stick" type place.   The only thing that kept it from getting the full five stars was the parking - which is difficult, but not terrible enough to keep anyone away.

9J5FkHBFUNXeayYTmbr8pw.text: Good food but not that good for the price you pay.  Have had better eclectic tacos for less the price.  Love the decor but because of the structure it really can get loud.

VxOLBdGhuFl4Ny2bKN54Eg.text: You ever want to eat and drink in church now is your chance.  Friendly attentive staff superior food at reasonable prices. Clean...... My new favorite place and they also have live music this is a True gem in the city.

KDS955LuB4QXj1m3fcD5uw.text: This place is like no other place in Phoenix! The tacos have a luxurious taste & every single one has a unique flavor. You must try the cherry braised beef one (personal favorite)! You can choose between corn, flour, or lettuce for the wrap- I recommend the corn! The prices are very reasonable & when you buy 3 tacos, you get a free side. The seasonal veggies are flavorful & locally grown. The service is on point too. Every time I come here, I am greeted promptly by an upbeat server that is down to earth & really knows their stuff. You can trust their recommendations, no doubt! And if you don't check out out for the tacos, go just to experience the rad architecture & art because it's an old cathedral.

UqbPPRCpQFXY35rhOTSAKg.text: Nicely decorated inside with a nice size bar yet the food is average. You would think Taco Tuesdays would drawl in a crowd, yet not this night and now I know why. Service was mediocre and food was slightly below average. I can careless about the portion sizes but come on, add flavor to those Tacos. Let's now discuss the beverage. The Salty Chihuahua was a melted down grapefruit drink with salt rub against the rim. I think I can get a better buz next door at Starbucks. $9 cocktails seem a bit spendy and especially for it arriving after my meal. Overall disappointing and management should really consider hiring staff that is upbeat and friendly.  It inside an old church for God's sake!

n9zjVQZPHOrfG_EHkBb4ag.text: I have no idea why people like this place. I have been here several times with co-workers and dread it. The first time I went, I asked the waitress to surprise me with a taco trio. The flavors she picked sounded fantastic, but I was woefully disappointed. The flavors were drab and the tacos were greasy. I tried different combos afterwards, but none of them had a distinct flavor that left an impression. It's a cute concept being in an old church, but none of their food stands out.

0x3fobfgESxH3F02DYswHQ.text: Tacos are o.k. There are alot of great non-traditional tacos available! Service is non-existent, unless you sit at the bar with the long haired guy, who also makes great margaritas!

GHYt3_j-DBGGjYoM2qtNIQ.text: The lamb tacos are the best thing in the world! Absolutely love this place, & the ambiance is super cool.

X_FpVEifFOB9hwlNquqpuA.text: Very blah! All of the meat in our tacos was cold when they arrived. There are many other great places to get tacos in PHX.

9h3h8OcV0OgApfkA2l60tg.text: LOVE Taco Guild!  Super yummy food + an amazing atmosphere!  Their sangria is amaze.  Last time I tried the chipotle cherry steak taco, SO GOOD.  Be sure to order some sweet corn on the cob. You'll be happy you did.

8Bm6-YnBjde2lyIgo8z9VQ.text: Excellent tacos with a perfect choice of local Arizona craft beers on tap.  The chicken and braised beef tacos were delicious.  Great guacamole and homemade chips.  Very cool dining in an old neighborhood church reconstructed into a vibrant restaurant.  A+ for friendly and professional table service.

UOeT3MOkTgqZmOTjbm3h2w.text: Let me first state this review is coming from an LA Foodie and Im comparing the food and experience to DTLA.  Disappointed with the food.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either.  Service was fast and the atmosphere was ok.  Move on if you're looking for great Tacos (exotic or otherwise).

JODd5Ccia-iFFmoqNb15og.text: I am going to return to Taco Guild and hope for a better experience than the first. I went shortly after they opened and it seemed they still had a few kinks to work out, but I know that is normal for any new spot so I will go easy with the criticism. It took up space in the old Methodist Church and maintained the beauty of the structure by repurposing the gorgeous old building instead of rebuilding it. The stain glass windows, giant chandeliers and alter bar truly are magnificent.   The tacos were gourmet street tacos and they were not bad, but for their price point I expected a little more. (Gallo Blanco knows what I'm saying, they've got it down). The chips were delicious but I have to admit the salsa reminded me that this is the child of Z'tejas. I like that they serve all local crafted beers, but I was disappointed there was not one Mexican beer on tap. Who wants to wash down a shot of tequila with an IPA?  The place is family style which I don't mind, but the table they sat us at was so cramped I barely had room to move. Also the brick walls and high ceilings really carry voices, and I had to shout through my meal to hear my bf (not the best thing when you are sitting next to 4 strangers).  The service was horrible, but I won't harp on that because they had just opened.   The valet service was atrocious, this has no impact on my review but hopefully they can get the feedback somehow. We went to get the car and it was raining, the valet wouldn't leave his post because he was waiting for another guy to come back, he wouldn't give us the keys because the car was parked across Osborn. We stood there for over 10 minutes in the rain. They weren't that busy, there was no rhyme or reason for this.   I will return and hope for a better experience (and maybe skip the valet), it really is a cool spot, and it just needs to work a few things out.

3RqKQkyAm5ZpU45ytUmWnw.text: Be you sinner or saint, Taco Guild is a place to pay penance and make peace with all manner of spirits and eucharist. Their tacos and other sides take your palette to heaven on earth. If I was a "sister", I'd make a "habit" of coming to this taco sanctuary.   The place is jumping and popular. Great location and well executed on the use of the church, makes the artisan guild concept really work. The "duo guild starter" is great for a party of three or four to start. Pray that you get sat in kutie-Kyle's section. This guy is heaven sent: sweet, sincere, efficient, and charming to boot. Take him up on the jalapeno bacon in the guacamole - delicious!  It's a loud place, has a juke box, and the acoustics of a church. So if you're old, lame, or kind of a "stick in the mud", probably not your scene. The night I went it was swarming with couples from the Biltmore and Arcadia area, followed by Melrose gayberhood crews and Roosevelt Hipsters came about 7ish - fun scene if you don't take yourself or religion too seriously.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The main chandelier at Taco Guild.

4-irIonIYFd6wHoIxkBdcg.text: After tasting many tacos in the Phoenix area, I will only recommend Taco Guild to people!!! The environment of the restaurant is so unique and the food is just incredible! I recommend trying the different variety of tacos as well as their corn on the cob! You won't be disappointed!

SOz6z3PHKKbGeviori0KKQ.text: Tacos were very bland. Queso tasted like it was from a can. Female bartender never once smiled. Won't be back.

O6Du8b7H1InzukNSgYVu2Q.text: This place just started bad from the start. We were sat and waited for a while before we were even greeted by our server. We both ordered the shrimp and chicken guild tacos. First off, the shrimp tacos were cold. Second, the Guild Chicken taco was tasteless, little to no flavor actually. I even put salsa and lime to try and give it some flavor and still no help. Third, they didn't have a "taco Tuesday" menu which was odd being that it is a taco restaurant. Fourth, their happy hour was little to non existent. In all, the only reason this place received 2 stars were for the only TWO things that deserved it. The chips were warm and seemed to be made in house, and the elote was actually really tasty. Other than that this place was over rated and over priced. Save your money and time.

6HqiOVo49b_oz1dk-HjzRg.text: Fantastic homemade tortillas, meats are all savory, drinks are superb - loved the renovation of the church.  Definitely must try!

hXNhmpwQxP9WJMQUPp-f6g.text: The atmosphere is superb. The food is very good, though at bit overpriced. Nice beer selection, friendly service.

ZbN5EnIr64smP9dABB4_dA.text: Love the taco creations and the decor! Taco Guild is housed in an old church. Complete sense of repurpose! The Stained glass windows (They appear to be original) give an ambiance that is unlike anywhere else in the valley.  The Food: Guacamole: The choices! I added jalapeno bacon to mine- it was delicious!   Tacos: My favorite is the Lamb (served with blue cheese which is a nice compliment). The Yucatan Shrimp, Red Snapper and Urban Beans Braised Beef were also favorites.  Drink: Friends who had the margarita's were huge fans.

4p0NAqvxD5ze4DoXDPDvEA.text: We got take-out tonight and several things were wrong when we opened everything up at home. My meal consisted of the house salad and onion straws. The salad was missing the avocado and onion straws did not come with the aioli sauce. So annoying! Especially since the salad came with few toppings anyway. The salad was very bland...probably since it was made with iceberg lettuce. Green leaf lettuce or spinach would elevate this salad.   My husband asked that they not add jalapenos to the guacamole but it parts of it were very spicy. Not sure what else would have made it hot. My husband liked his tacos but my meal was a total fail. Seems like they need to iron out a few kinks.

PdewrfjKQpFKgOZ0lFNPUw.text: Everyone must come here! Built inside an old church, with the bar where the sanctuary was (lol) great margaritas and the food is delicious. The drinks are great in case you just want to hang out at the bar. They'll serve you some delicious chips and salsa! Parking is a bit tough but it's definitely worth stopping by and having at least one experience there. It's one of my top 5 favorite restaurants!

MvOpa2YbKq5BNsGz2eq9iQ.text: Awesome atmosphere and incredible margaritas (always get them frozen) but not my go to if I'm craving "Mexican." Options are unique and always delicious, but not your run of the mill taco place.

glS0sRsEZkGiYTQuPUjvYQ.text: I first tried Taco Guild about 2 weeks ago.  We loved it so much we returned with a friend to share our new find.  I bragged on the chicken tacos and jinxed it.  They were not that great this time around. We did enjoy the chorizo meatballs and margaritas. From reading other reviews, it seems the food is not consistently great. Maybe different chefs and they don't follow the same recipe?

0lq2QGF7BFffxPpiX3XVZA.text: We were super excited to try this place...mostly because it's in an old church that has been repurposed.  Pretty cool!  Anyhow we visited on a Sunday night and were seated fairly quickly.  Then the waiting began.....no waiter/waitress....no menus....no water.  It started to get uncomfortable/irritating and my husband was on the verge of finding someone to wait on us.  I think it was the manager who finally came over and gave us menus and a water.  Not impressed at this point.  Yet, I was hopeful for he food.  We ended up getting a happy hour margarita and the guacamole/cheese dip duo for an appetizer.  We also both ordered two Daily Tacos for our meal.  As far as the food goes....the guac wasn't too flavorful but the cheese dip was delicious!  The tacos were cool/room temp and lacking flavor as well.  The margarita was decently strong...especially for happy hour.  So overall I'd give his place a grade of "average".  And I'm not sure I'd go back....maybe because the building was so cool and unique but I'm not sure that's really a reason to go again.

EQjlKzo9ihoRi8L7x9KPEg.text: This place is alright. The food is slightly above mediocre for Mexican food. The best way to describe this restaurant is "Gentrified Mexican Food." This does not compare with most street taco places, and the price is significantly more. When we were ordering the waitress said the tacos are "slightly bigger than normal street tacos, so that is why they are around $5 per taco." The tacos were brought to us and they were very small, about a 4" diameter tortilla. They are definitely trying to capitalize off of Mexican culture, without bringing the benefits of good food. Pick another place if you are wanting authenticity.

zJeZ7FuAediNG1ckuEnu6g.text: Food is average. Service is terrible.  We tried this place a few weeks ago and will not be returning again. It took several minutes before anyone even greeted us at the host stand. I believe it was the manager that finally came and acknowledged us. He quickly looked for an open table and mentioned one open towards the back of the restaurant. He didn't even walk us to the table and instead chatted with another table before coming over and handing us the menu. 5 minutes go by, 10 minutes, almost 15 minutes later we finally asked a waiter if someone could take our order. Maybe we were forgotten since we were in the back, idk. Not sure why we didnt just walk out. He mentioned that our waitress was bringing us our chips and salsa and would take our order soon. She finally comes 2 minutes later and takes our order. We haven't even gotten water at this point.
