They bring our food (chicken soup and 2 tacos) within a reasonable time after we order but I'm so hungry from all the waiting that I nearly finish the big basket of chips and salsa. Boo.   The soup was okay. It came in a cauldron-like bowl that is NOT ideal for soup. I had to bend the spoon for more convenience. The tacos were again average. Nothing special. If you want gourmet tacos, go to El Hefe on Mill. Our drinks were not refilled until after we finished our food. None of our dishes were taken away from our tiny table. Crappy service the entire night.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Plates not taken away, glasses not refilled, chips almost all gone from waiting so long. Bad service.

3qFirWi1SgX2W6Qd5uNh4w.text: Bad service!!  Sat at the bar and had to flag the bartender every single time for every little thing!! They both just kept walking off and hiding in the back. The food is good but the drinks are watered down and weak. The guy closed me out because New shift came in, I found this to be strange and somewhat rude, but was told it's normal. I do not plan on returning.

Ra1fdyZAT81_rn7soeFwRg.text: This restroom really left an impression on me. The single urinal affords privacy and time for reflection. Very clean, and the lack of a door keeps the lively noise from the restaurant going while you wash up.  And -- as I'm leaving -- I see portraits of dogs in military uniform lining the walls, the coup de grace.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zbLhSrTJSrMKqiqWdBC8QQ.text: Unique! Gotta have corn-on-the-cob. Interesting tacos--Peking Duck?

pUWPZ33E4GostbTxMiHqyA.text: Great place for Sunday Fun day!! The tacos are awesome!! They give you four kinds of salsa with chips. They have happy hour starting at 2pm on Sunday. We were able to watch football too! Service was great!!

7TaDSGiApQiIf2ZUmdtFng.text: Somewhat new restaurant in the downtown Phoenix area. Great addition to the neighborhood. It is located in an old church that gives it a majestic open space and feel. Plus they still have the stained glass and original woodwork which is very beautiful. Great selection of tequila and local craft beers. I had the Chipotle cherry steak taco, Peking duck taco, and the pork adovada taco all were excellent made fresh to order with great marinades and spices in a freshly hand made corn tortilla. They have a great happy hour. Everyday of the week. See my pictures for menus and happy hour specials. If you have not come down you have to give it a try. Very helpful friendly attentive staff and bartenders. Also has a nice diverse crowd and a great patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Braised Beef n Pork Tacos
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tasty complimentary homemade Chips n Salsas
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guavaba n Rosemary margarita.

N0IY7idaHeVj00EpAUUu9A.text: Interesting place.  Not sure if they had an off night but many issues with food orders and delivery and drink orders for our party of three.  Food quality was good but not amazing.  Indoor space is really cool but extremely loud.  Patio is nice.

Bv2KjSvvqQb7ONE_hEbXbQ.text: The location looks so awesome inside. It's like an old monastery or old church.   Happy hour prices are where it's at with this place if you are looking to get lit. They have a couple of combo one is "The Socializer" which is any draught beer and a shot of Sauza Blue Reposado for only $9. Or they have "The Americana" which is any draught beer and a shot of Roger Clyne's Mexican Moonshine 12.   They have a couple of TV's situated high above the bar. Not ideal for sports but can do in a pinch.   Overall the tacos were good and the vibe was solid. Ill be back.

GE9cs1kN9P6VMsFPoAYojw.text: I had a pretty good experience here. I like how this place is nested in an old church. I really enjoyed looking at the paintings on the wall and the cool chandeliers while waiting for my food. I always appreciate any place that gives you chips and salsa. The chips were a little salty for me, but I like the variety of dipping sauces and salsa for them. I ordered the three tacos plate with the red beans (which were delicious). My favorite was the Yucatan Shrimp. It was full of flavor and had a generous amount of shrimp in the taco. The Al Pastor Pork was good but I found the Guild Chicken just OK. I never know what to think of the prices of these street tacos. I think I'm used to getting $1 street tacos in Mexico where the whole point is good food at a cheap price. Majority of the places here in the U.S. I have visited (like Joyride) charge $4 to $5 a taco. I guess that is just how things are these days. Overall, I had great service and the food was pretty good. The story of why they named it Taco Guild is kinda cool and creative (on their website).

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guild Chicken, Yucatan Shrimp &amp; Al Pastor Pork Tacos
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chip &amp; Salsa

iyYewcpciXV8jjX9T2Ygpg.text: Late night happy hours!!!!!!!  This restaurant/bar surprisingly had the most decent music playing during my stay in Phoenix (to my taste at least), except their DJ at that time packed up at 9:30ish. Womp womp. Still a cool experience though!  Their steak tacos are delightful. Their margarita was a tad strong for me, but delicious nonetheless. They added a berry twist to mine which was just right!  Overall, this place is very much worth a try! They have great service, yummy food/drinks, and is definitely a cool place to hang out. The high ceilings make you feel like the place is very spacious, which I love!!!! Wish we had something like this out in LA, I'd frequent it.

3aBiGSbbuyTrdwc3eVi0mA.text: What a wonderful concept. To be fair, my significant other's family attended the location when it was a church, so it made it even cooler. When you walk in, they have the place somewhat gutted with the exception of some of the pews left as aisles.   Now, in our case, we went with a party of 10 and our server was new, so we had a few rough spots. One being, we ordered drinks that were missing, and food that didn't get put in.   However, the food was phenomenal. I had the steak tacos and I could have eaten 1394723 more. We also got drinks, We had mescal mules and they were also great. Not to mention, the manager/owner came over and had us try some $1300 tequila, told us all the history of it, etc. and there was live music that was REALLY good!  I would definitely recommend this place to smaller parties, or dates. It is worth the price and they have done a great job.

aeua4yBfeAZh2nwxIiJqmQ.text: Solid tacos and chips/salsa. Was in Phoenix for business and went here twice. All local draft beer, which was very good. Sat at the bar so I can't comment on the table service, but the bar servers were on the ball. Would definitely go back.

CDOVUHajunQzD5A2iNoYVw.text: I love Mexican Food and have been to many different Mexican restaurants. I especially like the enchiladas here and the burrito's are also excellent. I usually have lunch here when I am in the area. If I lived closer I would probably eat here much more often.

voFNB0g5pICpM-9jv9r77w.text: Terrible service, we ended up walking out.. I did love the decor. Went at the start of happy hour and the place was not busy. Once we were seated, we were completely ignored by any and all wait staff, not even an acknowledgement of "someone will be with you shortly." We sat there for 20 minutes then took our patronage down the street to have a delicious meal and great service. Won't ever go here again.

wiZSW4SIKixQ0OJeDcXxwQ.text: Wow! The food is great and the service is better! Its not often that you find great food and amazing customer service. The building is fun and something different from your regular taco restaurant. I recommend this fun atmosphere for a fun date night or a fun time to catch up with family and friends. Price is fair for the quality of food you're enjoying. The guacamole is fresh and green!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious salsa and tacos....I took a bite before I took the picture. So good!!

XigdLMjkU-3FgCyLCb4V0Q.text: Cool place, in an old church that predates AZ as a state. Manager showed us the cornerstones. Tacos were great. Started to get busy around 11:30 for lunch. Happy hour and daily taco special after 2pm. Would definitely recommend.

cbOmz_0n94ml4tfn-R2tgQ.text: Cool building. Quick service. The tacos were so good - the steak taco was my favorite.

LKYMbyyExTLjHH4WCWVGuA.text: Cool vibe! Make sure you get the Mexican corn on the cob, absolutely DELISH! Depending on the day and time, it stays pretty busy so reservations are recommended.

fsGSA0doDBEgQHBxw9kwlA.text: Seriously... Get a taco plate. That lamb taco is freaky good, and that coffee braised beef is to die for. Finish off that with the guilds main dish, the street corn. For real, that can't be a "side dish" it's the main role of the meal here. So dang good.   4 well deserved stars. I would give it 5, but I don't like odd numbers.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. In an old church... Awesome!

U5JY-dT55_7AXn51iYlHUw.text: The building is an old church. It's beautiful - inside and out. It is still kind of shaped like a church... with the bar as the alter/shrine area and the kitchen behind it. The bar is decorated nicely. They have a big chandelier in the center. The top of the walls by the ceiling have painted murals. The whole, entire place just has a great atmosphere. The place itself is in a little corner with a Starbucks and a Buffalo Exchange. My co-worker and I sat at the bar. The bartender, Eric, was friendly and provided outstanding service. We never had to wait long for anything, and our drinks and chips and salsa never went dry. I ordered the chicken enchiladas with rice - no beans. It was a very generous portion. They were delicious! Seriously. I ate what I could, but I couldn't finish it all. I took what was left of it back to my hotel, and I actually ate leftovers! I never eat leftovers! Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The entrance from the interior.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chandelier!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Enchiladas... YUMMMMM!!!

eQuN5tNl97L0bAsFalh4eA.text: I wouldn't return. The food was not what I was hoping for. The decor is beautiful though. The chips and salsa were very good.

FTgaTn-7EJlhT2pFrmL_ZA.text: Love this place!  -Amazing atmosphere. It is very unique and cool. It was converted from a church to a restaurant. -Staff is awesome! Every person that we spoke to was cheerful and courteous. The manager rocks too.    :-) -The food was more of a 4 star but I'm not going to give a 4 star review because overall, my experience was great. The food is not bad by any means, it was quite good actually. However, it was lacking spices and wasn't that authentic tasting. I did love the corn on the cob that they serve though! Overall, I would say check this place out! You'll be happy you did!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome ceiling

TGlzHFpJoZ8IAmqEtkwY_A.text: This place is amazing. We lucked out with the most exceptional waitress, Shauna. We had a large group and she was on top of it all. The food was outstanding. We will come back again!

Z_2L38vOQiSq6aLZCnAecA.text: Wow...My new favorite restaurant. I hadn't seen the travel channel review but I had two separate people that told me about this place so I had to try it.  I tried the ceviche first...Amazing. Had shrimp and small scallops and included flour chips with a chipotle seasoning...Second, I tried the grilled corn.  Best I've ever had.  Next we tried the tacos...Cherry Steak taco and the Urban Bean Beef taco were both out of this world.  Might be the best two tacos I've ever had.  We also tried the Al Pastor Port taco but I wasn't as happy, it was good but not like the other two.  Adam the bartender was really helpful with navigating the menu and Garth the manager was so pleasant and welcoming.  We ended the dinner by splitting a piece of their Coconut Pie.  Soooo good.  Even though the drive is 30 minutes, I plan on coming back over and over.

WsogwtOm9bZuOVglOicAkg.text: Read about this place online, seen reviews and all I have to say is if your votes #2 in the USA for tacos they should be mind blowingly satisfying, now don't get me wrong I did like the street corn, and I felt as if the coffee beef tacos were ok, el pastor wasn't the best I've had. Restaurant is cool. But the food sits on pedestal that it really doesn't live up to.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6F30BQ73s6ICg_Mu3UvvrA.text: First time here was 2015. I picked up my brother form the greyhound and took him to buffalo exchange next door to this brilliant designed restaurant. Decided I must try!!! It's a old church turned into a Mexican Resturant serving up some of the best Olates (corn on the cob) I have ever tasted. And a unique flare on their taco options! Bar sits at the head or front of church beautiful stain glass window a and must try and experience place!   Happy Travels and Happy Eats!

LLC3qRDSxHLRK0Dh3ejL6w.text: Taco Guild has been a tradition when I visit Phoenix since 2017. The kitchen staff here are artists, and their medium is tacos.   Their Carnita and Lamb tacos are divine - which is appropriate given the place is inside of a former church where the bar is wrapped around the former altar.   You get a unique experience when you come here, and they do not disappoint. Go for street corn and quest dip all day. Worth it.

s9rfuvKmXwRwDBXf1YVnwg.text: This is by far one of our favorite Mexican restaurants.  They make everything homemade and the quality is world class.  We had the enchiladas and the steak burrito this most recent time along with the guacamole and it was amazing!  Try the Jalisco + mule cocktail...you can't go wrong.  Say hi to Jason Kline who is the general manager.   He made a point to stop by and make sure our experience was awesome which it was as always.  If you Lauren as your server, you will be totally taken care of.  Enjoy!    So we came back today which was a week later after our review and I tried the chicken enchiladas and they were amazing.  You must try them during the next visit.  Also try the green chili queso!  Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BbYeDcY4zEtlHEMkZ50jag.text: We stopped by for a margarita and after talking to the server we decided to go back for dinner. So glad we did. Tacos were spot on. The grilled romaine was the best salad I have had in years.

stUV4AvCjEScdAKWhFILzg.text: Great brunch! Obsessed with the breakfast enchiladas. Bloody marry was delicious too!

SCpSNMlFfe4C0FcVb0GxBw.text: Some good food and service here. The only thing I didn't like was that they put cilantro on our appetizer and one of my tacos after I told the waiter that I didn't like it. The menu said it was on the product and I did say no cilantro please. Aside from that the food was very flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Sm-V_zqwdq_d49H2hTsJKw.text: Love Taco Guild! Great food, great service, and ample seating. Only downside is parking on a busy lunch day. I always order tacos, two tacos are decent, as they'll serve you free chips and salsa. But if you're really hungry they do offer a 3 taco plate that comes with a side. All the tacos are good, so you can't go wrong, and you can get either corn and/or flour tortillas.

gl7ng4MPCSO7x61STl6Mcw.text: I would give more stars if I could.  The food and service is top notch. However, the location is what sets it apart - the stained glass and the feel of this converted church is outstanding!  So great.

HNYUW2ltWtomtN7Glkabiw.text: I was so looking forward to dining at Taco Guild.  So unique inside, great decor.  Great service,  chips and salsa were good.  After that, the food fell very short.  Very bland,  each taco I ordered tasted like the last one, even though I ordered 3 different ones.  I had a coupon for a free dessert and it wasn't taken off the bill.  Very disappointingly.

kC5pFfjX_TbVQqHuvbQMsg.text: If this place shut down I would literally sob. Where would I get my street corn and habanero salsa? It's just not the same anywhere else. And oh yeah....TACOS, dude.  Really, really good ones. My fav is the chicken. I took pics of the corn, salsa, and the totally addictive chorizo meatballs in prickly pear sauce but I didn't get one of my taco on this visit because I basically inhaled it the second it hit the table. I may or may not have chewed. Anyway, the location is super cool too. It's a renovated church but it still looks like a church with all of the stained glass.  The only negative about Taco Guild is the parking SUCKS. Half the time I end up having to park down the street and walk. But you know what? It's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It burns my face off but I LOVE this habanero salsa

fPmqSYvmqhvLvCo2wrPtMQ.text: This has been a restaurant I have been dying to try every time I'm in the Phoenix area. Overall, I have to say it was okay. The restaurant itself is an old Korean church that was converted. The decor in the interior resembles an old cathedral. Upon entering we were immediately seated and drink orders taken. On Fridays, they have live music and it can be a little hard to hear. Our waitress was very sweet, and after she brought our drinks, she quickly took our food order. Everyone in my party ordered tacos and one person ordered a burrito. The tacos were good, not great, but good. I had a pork taco and a shrimp taco. The shrimp was over cooked and rubbery and not good. The street corn you can get as a side however, had great flavor and was good. Lastly, definitely a place to try out and take a gander, maybe next go around will be better!

Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

z7EmTElRijjnakpAF1Fnqw.text: Let down as far as the food goes... the building itself was interesting.  Tacos lacked flavour . Had the fish taco: dry and very firm fish ( microwaved?) the cherry steak was oh hum ..  I recommend they lower their prices to be more in line to the quality of their product...

AFVPeRjak8KQFHL8WTEX6A.text: Awesome dining experience tonight at Taco Guild.  Tried some old world/ new world tacos, as well as their daily taco on HH special.  All were delicious, and we enjoyed excellent service from beginning to end.  Personally, I thought the "converted church" novelty could potentially come across gimmicky, but inside was beautiful, classy and really enhanced the ambiance in ways that made everything utterly memorable.    Weekend Happy Hour is always a bonus... M-F 2pm-7pm Sat 11am-6pm Sun 2pm-close

CXavU6a82Mi1aMjE1w5yIw.text: Wow. Beautiful place, cool music, incredible food...oh, and great service! What more to be said?

hfSxXkkfTF6P9oLz70tvMw.text: The food was great but limited options for a vegetarian. The service was far from great. Our waitress seemed like she would rather be anywhere else than here and that we were inconveniencing her. The wait for our food was reasonable and the food tasted great and was accurate to our orders. The drinks we ordered came out right away and the atmosphere is wonderful, great for a low key night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dYIld0KeMfP-F4NfIjbCCQ.text: We came here because of the happy hour that starts at 9 pm. The menu selection is fairly limited, especially for vegetarian options. The food was really great. I ordered 3 different tacos, which included a free side. I also tried the street corn. However, what was not great about this visit was our very inattentive waitress. We waited several minutes for water, to place orders, to be checked on, for our dirty dishes that were sitting in front of us to be cleared while the rest of the restaurant was not that busy. I will possibly try here again because of the food, but I am not impressed with our service tonight.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

J-T6iJdhjgZY_rWMC7sXgg.text: I have experienced Taco Guild in person and delivery. YAZZZ! Love this place. The food is AWAYS on point! The lamb tacos are DELICIOUS! The customer service at Taco Guild is STELLAR! The food is STELLAR! It is BUSY, BUSY so reservations usually is A MUST! It is a very interesting building as a former church to have a restaurant in but it works. LOVE IT! LOVE IT!  My husband and I have had it delivered twice--It is his favorite place to eat as well. We always get the same thing: street corn,rice, beans, 3 chicken tacos and 3 lamb tacos.  The Fundido-AMAZING!

e2hDNgftTod9IozdHI2G6w.text: Beautiful setting here with a gorgeous full bar. The service is excellent and the food is good if you're a fan of 'trendy'. It's located in a refurbished church with amazing decorum.

BIJzva08kKVg2hp7bEsoNg.text: Outstanding restaurant in terms of ambience, the idea of turning a church into a restaurant gives it a different look altogether.  Pros:  Good service Great ambience Unlimited Chips and custom sauces  Lamb taco is to die for - I get it without the blue cheese Corn is very flavorful   Cons:  The chicken taco is a little dry Pork isn't exactly the greatest   Definitely one of my favorite places

Ks0I4v0R4c8QSaHKXiNuPQ.text: Had some friends in from San Diego in this past weekend and decided it would be a great time to check this place out. We had a party of 11 so it took about 40 minutes to get seated which wasn't bad considering it was a Friday night.. The hostess was as sweet as can be and totally kept us informed about when we would get seated.   First of all this place is downright gorgeous.. The whole church architecture makes for a great space.  I heard others saying how loud it was but honestly I didn't find it bad.. It was louder than most places but gives it a hip vibe.   We had a great server.. He was working hard to get all our drinks and food out and kept all our drinks refilled. Took him a while to sort out all the separate checks but considering it was busy and all I totally didn't mind the wait to get the check.   The menu consisted of pretty much only burritos and gourmet tacos.. Everyone seemed to enjoy them..I had the grilled steak burrito with this really good cajun aioli sauce.. But the side of onion straws it comes with was a definite fail.. No seasoning and mostly crumbs..seems like they could do better than this.. A few complaints about the sides but overall everyone enjoyed it. Price wise it's not cheap for what you get and food wasn't anything mind blowing.   I don't see myself visiting this place much but if others wanted to go I would go back..maybe they will improve some as they go along.

B2SPqzvp5sExLq0t_eBJkw.text: Love love love this place. Really good tacos and the street corn is to die for!!! The building it's in is really cool, and the paintings and murals are awesome! It's in like an old church and it's pretty authentic. I love the Gs everywhere. The atmosphere is fun, sometimes they have a live band, and it can get really really loud, so if you plan on talking to your friends, you may have to shout. That's all outweighed by the goodness of the food and the sweet ambience. I'd go there any time!

LPbfAxu50m7K3LV4TxyXPw.text: Awesome food. I was not disappointed and enjoyed every bite. The atmosphere was great and I'm a big fan of the Chipotle Cherry Steak tacos! Perfect spot to hang out smash a couple of tacos and have a beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

498FVZz-okxjdPsoMPaBhw.text: Pros: Weekend happy hour deals, drinks, and BREAKFAST TACOS!!!  Cons: NONE  We go here almost every weekend now that they started offering breakfast tacos.  Eggs, little bits of jalapeno bacon, salsa in a corn tortilla = delicious!  Breakfast tacos are essential in Austin (and TX in general) and I've always wondered why all taco shops don't have them.  They also have cheap margs and a taco of the day for a couple bucks.  Two of us were able to have drinks, 6 breakfast tacos (they are street taco size) for about $20.  They also did a good job on the building, with big vaulted ceilings, and church-ie decor.    John at the bar is always helpful and happy, and the rest of the staff are professional and polite.  Good job z tejas and co.

QVW2L0pBJyW4hXM9CY4jpg.text: I have been anxiously awaiting the opening of Taco Guild for months. I drive and walk by frequently since I'm a nearby Cheery Lynn Historic neighborhood resident. I checked out the menu online before they opened their doors and could hardly wait to taste each of the deliciously described taco creations. So tonight we were excited to finally get to check it out.   The very first thing I noticed when we walked through the doors was how freaking LOUD it was!! Like really loud!!! The music is blasting right over your head and my husband and I felt like we had to yell to each other over the 2 feet of table between us. It is a big open space with concrete floors so not a lot to absorb the sound but the music needs to be kicked down several notches. I have been to places where I think to myself it is too loud (and I watch movies and t.v. with subtitles because I can't hear all that well) but for this reason alone, I could not wait to get out of there. It stressed me out the whole time... so uncomfortable.   The tacos on the other hand were pretty yummy! It is not on the menu for some reason, but our very nice waiter told us that you can do a three taco platter that comes with a side (the menu only has everything a la carte). It was my husband, myself and our six year old son. We got two platters, so six tacos and two sides for us all to split. We did the Al Pastor Pork (delish), Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef (the only thing our kid could eat since everything else was on the spicy side and there's no options for kids), Guild Chicken (my third favorite), Yucatan Shrimp (good, but my least fave), Thai Snapper (my second favorite - so good!) and the Peking Duck (my favorite - surprising flavors - very creative!!)  The sides were pretty bland. The descriptions on the menu make them sound so good. I was disappointed in the Grilled Corn "off" the Cob and the Green Chile Achiote Rice. I just wished they lived up to my expectations and were more flavorful.  Another thing is I realize with the loud music and the bar that they are not necessarily catering to families with kids, but there should be something kid-friendly on the menu at any restaurant. A chicken and cheese quesadilla or bean and cheese burrito or something. Take it from St. Francis and Postino's: both more adult settings, but have kid friendly options on their menus. We eat out A LOT and pretty much always have the kid with us. We don't want to have to get a babysitter just because we want to have good food in a fun atmosphere.   Since it is just down the street and we love to support local owned business we will most definitely come back and give it another chance. Like to try some guacamole since I saw the people that sat at the table next to us order it and it looked delicious. I also want to try the Grilled Romaine Salad since the pic on the website looks amazing.  I've reread my review and I hate that I sound so negative. I'd like to think they are just getting into their groove and it will only improve with a little feedback. I want to see them do well since I think it is a great addition to the neighborhood!

QM7RgkhO8Z1gGg_gjsUCog.text: This is probably my favorite Phoenix restaurant. I could eat tacos every day and these are seriously the best! We usually get the taco plate and share. Don't be fooled! After a bowl of chips and salsa (the salsa is so so so good), three tacos and a side are pretty filling! We always go home full. I love the duck taco and the lamb taco, but you really can't go wrong with any of them. We've never been disappointed.

NCPnWk1vhaxwJdYf7VY-AQ.text: I love the feel of this place! It is such a treat in downtown Phoenix to have this kind of restaurant with delicious food and awesome decor inside. The bar is grand and super fancy! I take all of our guests visiting from out of town to this restaurant for some delicious food and corn on the cob!

33-Epy18R1mlds2oOi67sA.text: Good food, not great. Maybe a tad bit pricey for what you get. Good, unique atmosphere.

4GiDwUtdKyvahyTbpWIw3g.text: On a busy Friday evening, they only have one person working valet? I'd rather not valet anyway. No place to sit or stand while waiting for table. Feel like I'm in the way of staff. Very dissapointed.

zz5HDELEBaz3XjZsn7ONpQ.text: The best part about Taco Guild is the atmosphere. It is a gorgeously restored church with original stained glass pieces and a few newer decor items that pull it together seamlessly. They had a nice beer selection with a few from Cartel Coffee's new brews as well. The downfall was the food. The menu made ordering so exciting, but what came out on the plate did not match up to the description. Everything just tasted so bad. Like very surprisingly bad. It's upsetting because I really wanted to like this place too.   If I am in the area again I would go back for the beer and some chips and salsa but that's it.

_b80i13XeHA0m2tLPR7m_Q.text: I ordered a cup of tortilla soup and a few tacos for take out for my boss and I. The tortilla soup was delicious. Chunks of yummy chicken in a broth laden with melted cheese and a little kick. I also had the al pastor taco. Tender pork cooked in sweet and spicy yumminess. It also had pickled onions, which I loved. The tortilla was soft, but held together very well, even when I kinda rolled up the whole thing to eat. BossMan had the Guild Chicken and Yucatan Shrimp tacos, which he really enjoyed.   The three tacos were a plate dish that included one side and I chose their rice. It had corn, which I love, and was good, but overall it wasn't anything spectacular. Our order also came with a bag full of delicious freshly fried tortilla chips. Probably some of the best I've ever had!  The taco plate and cup of soup with tax was $16+...a little on the pricy side considering my favorite tacos are the $1-2 authentic street tacos, but Taco Guild will be a good treat once in a while! This point is where they lack in receiving a 5-star review.   The restaurant is located in a renovated old church and I think they did a wonderful job keeping the beauty of it. Even though everything is new, it has that old world feel to it.  Also to note, I believe it was created by the owners of Z'Tejas, so a lot of their flavors may have been brought over. My boss said the tortilla chips and salsa were similar, as well as the looks of my tortilla soup.

ivqHkQyPTsRXNwJ1dP8INg.text: OMG.  I never know what to brag about more.  Frozen margaritas - perfect.  Cheese and guacamole appetizer - can't stop eating it.  tacos diverse in option and I love every one.  I wish they has a sixth star.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pure carnage

CiAhBGzucASiql0ii0cYTQ.text: Hands down the best tacos in town. Their guac is delicious too. The building used to be a church, so the vibe in there is super rad. Taco Guild is a great place to hang out with friends and eat great tacos.

nyKr1KQeSwH2UWsTWC_ojw.text: I wanted to love this place but unfortunately, this just wasn't a good night. We went on a busy Friday and waited 30 minutes to be seated. Apparently they have a dj on the weekend so if loud music isn't your thing, might wanna go during the earlier week days. I however thought he was good and didn't mind it. I'm not sure how busy they typically are on fridays but they didn't seem to be prepared for it. My bf and I both ordered chicken items; he ordered 3 tacos and I ordered chicken enchiladas. A few minutes after ordering the server let us know they were completely out of chicken. The only meat we typically eat is chicken but since we needed to make a quick decision on substitutes, I agreed to the pork enchiladas and he got some steak tacos. He actually really enjoyed the tacos (chipotle cherry and adobada). I personally wasn't a fan of the enchiladas. There was a hint of mole taste which I'm not a fan of. Perhaps it said this on the menu and had I seen it I wouldn't have ordered it. On the other hand the drinks, complimentary chips and salsa, and my bf's tacos were delish. The building itself is a restored church with news bulletins and stained glass still intact. I loved the feel and it had some real positives so we'll certainly give his place another go

me0A-HOBgF1Jz4auVhY3gg.text: We went here for a work lunch. I loved the vibe.   I had the chicken burrito. Its quite a different flavor but it was very delicious. We received unlimited chips and salsa before our food arrived. I mixed the salsa with the habenero chile sauce to make it spicier and it was delicious. I actually made the sauce too spicy but it was soo good I kept eating it.

qFPx8wGpCN1R5h6XemwkwA.text: Fast greets both at the door and the table.  Our server Marion was quick and knowledgeable, which helped us because we were starving and wanted everything on the menu.  The coffee braised beef and the spicy pork tacos were our faves!  And the street corn...AMAZING.  Can't wait to go try more tacos!  Loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AcT7i7_N8nCO5QDKQVBfIw.text: Beautiful place, great food! The lamb taco is my favorite!  I went one time and there happened to be live music, I wasn't a fan of that because since it's an old church the acoustics are off the charts so it was loud for me. Otherwise delicious!

F_yVXU23_Vu4ePZpm_3rFA.text: So this used to be our family's Friday night dinner spot.  But only because we had the BEST waiter ever, Miles, along with some other gems on their staff (his girlfriend, the lovely girl who used to be the hostess, the asst. mgr, etc).  However, some things are better than others:  The service varies too much when we don't get Miles or one of the waitresses that we know.  As in, its been so bad that we've just left.  It shouldn't be that inconsistent.  They have not been anywhere near as adventurous with their tacos daily tacos as they were a few years back.  While never bad, many times they are just OK.  The biggest selling point is that the daily tacos are only $2 each.  The salsas are not robusto!  This one hurts as, again, it used to be much better.  Plus, this is where my toddler learned to love salsa.  The decor is, of course, amazing!  Seating is good and the valet service (in such a tiny parking lot) is welcome, even if the poor guy has to hustle all night.  We may return again but, sadly, never every Friday as we used too.

V3N_KDIvCptZEotjQq44FA.text: Totally impressed with the atmosphere!  Good food and excellent service!  Tip: tacos are awesome, but do not forget the guacamole to start with.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-DA7cYp7vba3pOZUZkV5Cg.text: My wife and I live in the area. We've eaten here three times already. The food quality is awesome! My favorite is probably the Cherry Steak tacos, but I've enjoyed everything I've had so far.  The experience gets better each time we go!  Tequila flights rock!!

9ODpliRYmqRlBmh_2hfTKQ.text: The food is amazingly delicious.  The atmosphere is a little loud with laughter however, not too loud to be annoying. On Sunday morning/early afternoon, we enjoyed some great live music. Christina, one of the lovely servers there, goes about and beyond to assure visitors have an excellent experience.  Highly recommend.

EZCqBqFrrojo3mKwIVcVyA.text: I have not been here in a while.  I decided to have lunch with a friend here yesterday.  I will say the menu changed looks to me like there are more taco options.    I got carnitas and coffee beef tacos with beans.  The beans were excellent.  The tacos were okay.  I talked with a employee and they said the have a new chef and changed somethings.  The next time I come back I will try three different tacos.  With the selections I am sure I can find ones for me.

c0Nct6w_2usM_471hfkLDw.text: So I'm probably going to sound like a total a-hole, but I have to say it anyway. Being a native Angeleno, I really know my tacos. Not only do we have the traditional, street, guisados, and mainstream, but we also have the fancy new styles popping up throughout the outlying cities and counties.  So far, I've never had anything quite like this.  My dining companion and I are well versed in the language of tacos and all things delicious. We happened to be in the general area for a few days and decided to test out Taco Guild ("it's rated highly - let's see what they got").  The appetizers: Diablo eggs, Tostones (with coffee beef) and Queso fundido  The foods: Taco flights (Al Pastor, Cladestino Shrimp, Chipotle Cherry Steak, Duck Breast) with a side of Street corn.  I still can't believe that we at it all. But what is most surprising is that this place isn't Michelin star rated (okay I may be exaggerating a little). But from beginning to end, this meal was a masterpiece, the drinks were great, the servers were friendly and happy to provide suggestions.  One of my favorite things about this place is that the restaurant is a decommissioned church and the back bar is where the altar once stood (now an alter to tequila).  Also, free valet parking. (Coming from LA - this is huge)  In conclusion, since visiting Taco Guild in May, I am now in the process of finding gainful employment in the Phoenix area so I may move and be near my beloved tacos.

Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco flight with Street Corn
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Specials Menu

jxzgEulaKxzMEeIenejCzg.text: What an amazing experience we had tonight. The food, librations, atmosphere and service were superb. I know they are known for the tacos, but the Carnitas Cobb Salad didn't disappoint. The avocado dressing recipe is worth stealing.  #dukeofeats

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carnitas Cobb.

-EQeMnd8lyoKyX8fWPC3gg.text: I'm not sure how this place gets good reviews. The tacos were overpriced, and the wait was way too long. Perhaps we came at the wrong time?  Thursday night? We ordered 6 different tacos, and they were not as tasty as other places. There are a lot of other taco joints that are way better than this. Only good thing about it is the environment.  Looks interesting.

NJAS9Kr9Y5LW5sFShQXSpQ.text: Excellent.  Between the three of us we tried a bunch. The avocado fries were so good. Also the owl margarita was soooooo perfect.  Not too sweet.  My fav was the coffee beef taco.  Wasn't sure at first about the coffee flavor, but it was really tasty. We also had the Korean fried chicken, el pastor, shrimp, lobster, chicken tinga, and duck breast.  All were really good. The space is so cool in the old church.  The staff is incredible, all very friendly and professional. When we are in Phoenix next we will definitely be hitting this spot again.

b8M3YxyLnvxmjsU3o62M9g.text: Holy sailing ship this place has awesome food and ambience!    Best tacos I have ever eaten to date.   The salsas are perfect.  We mixed the gold habanero sauce with the regular red salsa for a killer combo.  Service is great.    Love the lamb taco.  Next time I plan on trying the  duck taco.    We're talking quality eating and libations here at they're best.  Tacos are generously sized, artisan, and perhaps surprisingly,  reasonably priced.  Located near Uptown Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really like this new IPA from Coronado Brewing Co. It&#39;s dry, crisp, and refreshing as advertised.

ZvTxXnj57reqc7V2UyzjnQ.text: Server was great! Tacos are okay,  the lobster taco and cod were pretty bland and a lot fancier than it needs to be. I'd probably try somewhere else next time I'm in downtown Phoenix.

i95Cw-Q43-8-mpO-re62Tg.text: This is a must go to place. Rachael was fantastic and Luke has created some "off the hook" cocktails. The Gospel Brunch is for everyone, don't be mislead by the name. Make reservations if you have 4 or more, you'll need them! The Avocado Lobster Toast was awesome!
