Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado lobster toast w/Benedict
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Celebrating birthday!!!

nlu2yw51xEWTSh9qfnWKMg.text: One of the best taco spots in Phoenix. Very tasty complementary chips and salsa varieties and very generous with their refill.  The margaritas are a must try, and a nice on tap beer selections. The prices are ok.  The street corns are to die for. Now here is the reason why I would come back: it's for the cherry steak tacos! Super delicious with I house made corn tortillas! Absolutely phenomenal! They also have other tacos, but the cherry steak is where it's at! The carnitas are good too!  Jon is the guy you wanna have waiting on your table, such an incredible, friendly and informative guy!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cherry steak tacos and street corn.

hCv-DPFFzfnluv_7jaKEpw.text: Cute place. The food was really good!!! It really surprised us! The waitress was super nice, fabulous customer service!

fsSDMPukefqdRPW_V40E5Q.text: I think it's pretty interesting that they were able to convert an old church into a restaurant. Although it shouldn't be too surprising due to the fact that a lot of old churches in different cities throughout the country are converted into nightclubs and restaurants as well.   Well anyway, the overall atmosphere of this place is pretty great. It is generally busy and the wait staff, despite being busy, is still pretty attentive. They have a great selection of alcohol, and the food menu has a pretty nice selection.  The food is okay. The tacos lacked flavor, and the tortillas they used seemed to be a bit dry. Given the ambience of the location, I can see why their menu prices are the way they are, but with the overall taste of the food, their prices should be lowered so it can reflect the actual taste. What they try do in making the tacos' presentation look great, they drop the ball in terms of taste. The chips and salsa are fantastic though so that is a redeeming aspect, and the avocado they served with my taco was plentiful so that makes up for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fZCb1sshnzf4vemyHLqtxg.text: There has been a lot of hype about Taco Guild, and I was pretty skeptical that they could really live up to it. But we were more than satisfied with the stellar meal we had at Taco Guild.   RESTAURANT AMBIANCE/DECOR: To start, the ambiance was so unique. They had decorated for Halloween already which I think was brilliant! They really capitalized on the creepy old church vibe, and I thought it was a fun way to enhance the dining experience. It's also worth noting that we went on a Saturday night and they had a live band. They were FANTASTIC and because they were so talented, it wasn't distracting like live music can sometimes be in other restaurants.   FOOD: They bring out chips and a selection of four salsas while you're waiting for your food. The chips are warm and crunchy, not too salty or soggy which is something I'm really picky about. The salsas are all delicious, but our standout favorite was the pequin pepper salsa. We ended up asking for a large bowl of it and used every last drop on our chips, and our tacos! It had a really delicious flavor profile and also a solid kick of spice.  And miraculously, it paired well with every single taco we ordered even though they were all very different in flavors and spices.   Of course the star of the show was the assortment of tacos we ordered!  We tried the taco of the day (chicken fajita) and they were a great deal at $2.75 each!  We also ordered the lamb, the pork adovada, and al pastor pork. They were absolutely delicious and I'm not that big of a fan of lamb, but the lamb taco actually ended up being my favorite of them all! They grind the lamb so they avoid the problem of tough meat that can sometimes ruin otherwise delicious lab dishes.  The side dishes were good, but nothing spectacular. We didn't order the street corn, though we saw a few come to the tables around us and it looked great! We'll definitely try that next time.  Overall, we had a great meal at Taco Guild and will definitely be back on account of the salsa alone, but obviously ato try even more tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jFpJUGsz3LmJnGDWFN4doQ.text: Great atmosphere! Very friendly and helpful bartenders. We loved the delicious variety of dips that came with our chips.  We had the burritos, I had the carnitas which was wonderful and my hubby had the chipotle cherry steak which was delicious and had a unique flavor! Both were great portions- enough that we ate about half and took the rest to our hotel for lunch the next day.  The only reason I'm not giving a 5 star is that the happy hour margaritas are... eh. I think I'm more of a gold tequila persona and they use silver I think I'd skip and go for a top shelf next time. Other wise a wonderful place to stop in!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar area
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar

KmSxG0FS0L1szYgu6-ydkQ.text: Great food. Fun atmosphere. Valet parking! Will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool atmosphere!

JTpFs7i4e4hm6HZWKXWkDQ.text: I really wanted to like this place more, but after going a few times, my experience has been just average overall. I've really enjoyed a couple of the menu items but was sorely disappointed by others. It kind of seems like the flavor balance is off on many of their tacos. The Al Pastor tasted primarily like pineapple, the carnitas was mostly just onion. Appetizers were underwhelming. For positives, the chips and salsa were great and the cherry steak taco is a gem on the menu.   Servers are always nice but service is generally fairly slow, so prepare for that. There is very limited parking so expect to park on a nearby street and walk.

yeM_1vILY6tSP18FwISUCA.text: I looooove Taco Guild. TBH, I love tacos, so maybe I'm biased. But these are GOOD tacos. If you're not going here for Taco Tuesday, what are you doing with your life?  In all seriousness, this restaurant is pretty cool. It's in an old church near downtown Phoenix and still has the gothic, cathedral feel. The owners did a great job of creating a new, modern restaurant while maintaining the integrity of the building.   My husband and I both do the tacos a la carte. He orders the corn, too. I posted a photo of it - I'm not a photographer by any means but every time I look at it, I want to go back for more! They have vegetarian options as well.   It's pretty busy during peak hours (Friday nights, Saturday lunch and dinner) so be prepared to wait a little bit, but it's worth it. Have a drink and enjoy the atmosphere. The service is great too. It's very casual and the pricing is reasonable. If you've got family from out of town and want to show off some of the Phoenix food scene, this would be a great spot to hit.  I don't have anything negative to say about Taco Guild. Highly recommended by this Yelper!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 a la carte tacos and the street corn

-eG4CKFqn6LSTiHlCuu0Pg.text: My boyfriend and I are golfing with some locals, recommended this restaurant and I couldn't be happier. This is exactly what we wanted to do while we were in Arizona. The food was amazing, the drinks were great, the staff was friendly, and the environment was also great. Would definitely recommend this to anyone and I want to come here again.

yrPv0qojJtVIOuKgQ4yhkw.text: Obsessed. Truly amazing food and service. In an old church! The chips and salsa trio were amazing. If you are looking for authentic Mexican this is your place!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5nFb5cwz3JnDH3MpekMYKw.text: This place is all right. However there's not a real taco Tuesday deal or special here. I was told before ordering that the tacos or mini tacos , mini as in the size just bigger than a tennis ball which is one taco sliced in half theoretically. Each regular street taco on any other day is five dollars they just took a regular street taco and cut it in half and charging 2.50 per . They are more like mini samplers. The over place is cool and the service is great but I will find a real #tacotuesday #Minitacotuesday

EwYoNJoY_Xk-ZYFR6NlafA.text: Was the best tacos I ever had. Pluse the chorizo meatballs were to die for. A tad bit pricy but well worth every penny. Wait staff was friendly and always had smiles on their faces. All in all my favorite place in phoenix

1NbaP4-w7IoIgKwn6gUzQg.text: Yum yum yum! The guacamole is awesome, margaritas rule and the shrimp taco is scrumptious!! Never had a a bad meal here or a bad server!

8hYTs4HxKRgYAipbe8f9Aw.text: This location is so cool! I love the decor and concept of the restaurant. The menu is pretty small, but the tacos are good. I had the short rib & the chicken, with a side of corn. The corn was delicious and so was the chicken taco. I will skip the short rib next time. Service was great, and so were the different hot sauces to try.

-XvRG7WhXTVbRafwHPXerA.text: The food is good however the portion sizes are extremely small.   I would pay $1.99 per taco not $3.95... the atmosphere is good but not worth the price for the portion size...  Probably will not be back any time soon with so many options for tacos in Phoenix!!!

WcxnKso_ZyOXslAZoZ3tyQ.text: Just went here for the first time tonight. I had a duck taco and a coffee braised beef taco and their homemade corn tortillas. Excellent food! I definitely look forward to going back to try some more items off the menu. Also, their margaritas are delicious!

eQzS_4tQv-1VIOlKKbjsPA.text: I have been so excited for this place to open!  What a treat to have a surprise birthday party here last night! Drinks were amazing, food was delish, and service was EXCELLENT! Thank you, Kyle, for your patience with our (probably annoying and obnoxious) table! Get the STEAK (can't remember exact name) TACO. Yum!!!!

f6b42_qbj7VP8ugwVlEGNQ.text: Perhaps a little pricey for a taco joint but I did have the best taco I've ever had. Duck confit with an apricot jam with feta cheese. I'm not usaully a huge fan of corn tortillas because the tend to be dry and coarse but they make their own masa there and it is wonderful. Fresh, chewy, and compliments the tacos extremely well. The bartender was a cool dude who made an effort to be entertaining, I appreciate that style in the right setting, cheers to him. The building is way cool as well, it's in an old church, but you don't feel bad pounding tequilla, well played Taco Guild.

5PGLUHdfdwW3LACLEuvtyw.text: Great atmosphere, solid local beer list, flavorful tacos. Not the traditionalists type, but very good none the less. We loved the coffee beef soft taco. Chips were addictive, especially with the fresh guacamole

maYvAZheMfwRY_HQ8Ib7qA.text: The staff here for the most part is pretty friendly.  The food was less impressive.  I am a vegetarian.  I ordered the veggie burrito with the rice side.  Both were extremely stinky.  I'm not sure if there was a stinky cheese or veggie in there but it was inedible.  We also ordered the appetizer duo (queso + guac).  The queso was decent.  The guac although fresh was severely under salted.  The perks were the fresh salsa and the street corn which was the best I've ever had.  Butter and spiced.  Super yum.  Bottom line:  I'd only go back for the street corn and what was that smell?

P8UuOrWGuCmV8MJnsS7rMw.text: Beautiful place with great food, the chips and salsa are to die for. They have a wide variety of margaritas that are all worth trying. I have been there twice this past week and loved it all, the tacos are amazing and the sweet potato chicken tortilla soup is outstanding. Fun spot and I'm glad Z'Tejas built this is in phx.

8sFTft8RVt_sGrUWpaG0Mw.text: Gorgeous building and space.  The bar is done up nicely.  The food is fairly good although the rice I got was a bowl of mush so I take off points for that.  Decent service initially, waitress kind of disappeared between ordering main and having it served.  I would give it another try for the building alone and I need to get there during Happy Hour!

y1JqJBpP23Y_SaDs1BIBZA.text: I've been here a few times now. Stunning room, decent food, decent service, but could improve. I'd recommend it for people in the area, but wouldn't expect them to be blown away but the food... the best thing I've had is their guacamole.

qiul204ubXpp4UDwA-lsmw.text: First timer to the Taco Guild drove by it a couple of times and just decided to do lunch there with my co-worker since we work 5 mins away!...First off it's a remodel of an old church..SO DOPE! the layout is very cool! Hostess was super nice and server I believe her name was Laynie was very good! I had the Taco Plate your choice of three tacos on the menu (there are 10 choices) for me it was the Al Pastor Pork-BOMB, Chipotle Cherry Steak-Very Good, and Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef- Good and you get a side, I picked Green Chile Achiote Rice which was really good too!. Will absolutely go back for dinner soon

xX9iblqTL3U0eAzCsDTnjg.text: Very unhappy with the wait. Over an hour and a half wait after being told originally 30 minute wait. Checked with the host team every 20 minutes and was given the estimate of 10 minutes each time. Finally the last straw, asked how much longer and host stated "we can't really quote a time there was a reservation that came in after you" really should not have waited as long as we did but after 2 hours we finally left.

9iVUegJSa2JLUkcPlOPihA.text: Tried this place out today.  Had the duck taco, it was very well done.  The shrimp taco also captured my heart.  The coffee braised beef, was not a flavor to my liking.  At all.  The atmosphere was very cool.  I like the use of a historical structure.  Seating was comfortable, in a church way.  Pews and high bar stools.  This is not the place if you are looking for classic tacos, but it's amazing for new twist on 'em.

gpW76zKB0ja3MYhE4TbFGg.text: The salsa is great...the chips are great and the food in general. The corn tortilla used in their taco's is one of the best I have had.  The building is historic and adds to the overall feel.

w04UxAaZBnku6py9KMhNIw.text: Good but a tad pricey. Cool people and service. Nice location. Jukebox is a cool idea.

cSv0qqeATHtx5u7PPCRLpQ.text: Fantastiic old church building. The service was great. We enjoyed some of the tacos, didnt like some. Our server was very helpful in telling us what things were and what the specials were. Very glad we went. Probably won't go again.

qCJa54rqivp0_o-u8tnezw.text: Our new waiter was not familiar enough with the menu to talk about what was gluten free but said he would get a manager. The waiter circled back around trying to take an order until he comprehended the four of us would not give him our order until I had information about what was gluten free - or not. So finally, the front of house manager shows up with an allergen menu and proceeds to explain the items on this very short list were gluten free which I knew immediately had to be backwards. If Tres Leches cake is on the list, its the gluten list, seriously. Scarey! But scarey became laughable when he proceeded to tell me that so many of their items were not gluten free because they contained dairy and the chef could not guarantee the dairy was gluten free because, after all, " certified gluten free milk would cost them $12 a gallon." Fellow celiacs, you know jiggery pokery (I believe that's the latest for supreme BS) when you hear it. The manager went on to recommend a salad which contained blue cheese, an iffy cheese in the world of celiacs. I gave up on the gluten free menu, ordered a plain side salad, and plain corn which turned out to be an overcooked greasy soggy mess. My partner really liked the salsa!

fEMYVwyYe6AWQVsSzX7_fQ.text: I loved Taco Guild! I had not heard of it and some friends wanted to go. My first reaction, honestly, was "how great can ANOTHER taco place be in PHX?!". I was very pleasantly surprised! From the get go, super yummy chips and salsa and margaritas. The taco selections are range from unique to the expected. Their beef tacos were amazing and a definite recommendation. I also totally recommend their side rice. I will definitely be going back and not hesitating to tell others to check it out. :)

xii57zGLrXU5FcvFbWDJJw.text: The very first time I came here, I wasn't very impressed.  I thought the tacos didn't live up to the price.  I've been back now on Sundays for the last few weeks, though, and Taco Guild has definitely grown on me.  The happy hour pricing for house margaritas is excellent, and I've discovered that some of the tacos (especially the lamb and duck!) are exceptional.  My mouth is actually literally watering when I think of them... they're that good.  Staff has been very friendly and accommodating to our group, and the outdoor patio area is a great place to bring a bunch of friends or co-workers.  I still think it's a little expensive for the quantity of food, but for the quality, I'm now a fan.

aeUOBsjrfTxeijLd2IliXA.text: We tried this place today because we were across the street at Starbucks and every time we are there we see people coming and going  I'm not necessarily unhappy with the food I only had the guacamole which was very good and my husband had some tacos - we really wanted to eat light but what we weren't happy with was the fact that we walked in there at about 4:45 in the evening when the restaurant was half full and the waitress took us all the way to the back corner extra room and put us in a small table almost as if she was hiding us in the closet  I wish I would've said something - it was absolutely ridiculous - we couldn't enjoy any of the ambience of this old building which I believe used to be a school or a church  I thought it was rude and I believe she treated us this way because are seniors and didn't think we would say anything which we didn't and that was our mistake  I get tired of being treated like a second-class citizen because I'm 67 years old I don't look 67 I look about 57 My husband is 82 and looks about 70 - we are actively energetic people - we go out to eat a lot and we have money to spend  So shame on this girl for not treating us with more respect and seating us in the main dining area of the restaurant when there were plenty of tables for us to be seated at for a meal We don't live in the neighborhood but I am sure we will go back on occasion

Drsnu5xVcBzl_h4_DRcS1Q.text: Went in the other day after almost two years.  Not much changed.  Still no pizza.  Weird.  If you like cultural appropriation and acts of blasphemy, this is a good spot.  See you in the after life...NOT!  Good spot for happy hour.  Those frozen margs' will make you say "to all heck!" to your sins in a Jesus-minute.  Get the bacon guac.  Fancy dog portraits in the bathroom?  Fun!  Manager with the damp hair and tired eyes even walked me to it and latched the stall for me.  Also, it's about time a restaurant had the nerve to play Ginuwine & Sisqo back to back.  Refreshing!  Shout out to Doo-Doo hands!  Thanks bro for the tacos.  Parking needs work.

QiLTYs4vXAIT7z6LMUC6NQ.text: Sooooo good! Second time here. Not disappointed.  Great service. Ceviche is delish and fresh! Chips and salsa are fresh! I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FY_K79a7OBeIW3Yg4Mf1aA.text: Love the street corn here!!! Good vibes overall!! Love the decor as it is a converted from a church! Bartenders have been super friendly ever time I've went, Lauren (I believe was her name) was a very attentive, friendly server! Cherry tacos were bomb!!! And free valet??? Forgetaboutit!!! Do it!

jT2hqNROF50VtX1PViYHxw.text: First time here - Excellent! They were slammed with unexpected huge parties and we still received prompt service!  The history of the building is cool, decor awesome, and food delicious  Definitely will be coming back!

kLoeri1cZKb9faI-6GlBzA.text: Amazing!  Food is delicious !atmosphere , loved it ! Guild duo  Homemade corn tortillas

npZl4-bI88Vi3BSlAA4U8Q.text: Really cool place inside a converted church! We came here at 6 on Friday and got seats at the bar. Chips and salsas were free and yummy, margaritas were strong, and they had a dj who was spinning some sick beats. However, all of my tacos were under-seasoned and drowned in mayo, especially my street corn. I probably won't come back here again. BUt extra star for service and atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck, lamb and shrimp tacos

e2YVydbzZA8ivScB_U_nkA.text: Went with some local colleagues that had never been and we were all impressed.   The atmosphere is unique and upbeat with enough historical references that you recognize the building's history goes back more than a century.   Started out with guacamole and the deviled eggs,  which were both remarkable. We had a variety of tacos that were not your average fare. My favorite was the coffee rubbed carnitas,  bold flavor with a bit of heat and a sweet finish.  Our server, Nick, helped with the selections and we were not disappointed with any of his suggestions.   No room for dessert, but I would consider taking home some more tacos.  The beer selection is primarily local brews with a varied selection.  For a Thursday night it was impressive that they were on a wait by 6 PM.  Complimentary valet is suggested as the lot fills up fast and double parking is the norm.  Any time I am back in the area I will be looking forward to a return visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Wp2zR86QcHkaBv6Bw0RwkA.text: This was my first time visiting this restaurant. Service was great. Ambiance is lovely. Tacos were mediocre. Tried the chicken, Peking duck, and beef tacos. The sauces and sweet fruits took away from the marinated flavor of the meats. Stay away from the side of veggies. :( My Mexican-American grandmother has a "two-rule" about places that serve street tacos: 1.) If you don't see any Latinos in the place, that's usually a telling sign; 2.) If the price of a street taco is more than $4, you run the risk of being less-than-satisfied. I didn't see Latinos (and this is Arizona!) and all taco prices where $4 and up. I won't be returning, however respect those that appreciate this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Mq3aYxTXkiyItOCQ7nMNyQ.text: Got fooled by the number of reviews! Tacos are decent, not bad at all.. Our waiter told us the dessert portion sizes were very small, so we ended up with two huge tres leches bowls barely touched.. because they were soooo bad!

CLj0fwdukj8XNCYPjqNkYg.text: Tacos lack what Mexicans call "savor" Not worth the prices  Too Americanized If it wasn't for the location, it would be tacoGuillotine

cEZiCoNnEsm_sSJwcHHM5Q.text: I like going to church but I like it even more when tacos and margaritas are involved. That's right, Taco Guild is located in a sweet, renovated church. As my friend says, the atmosphere is "on fleek." Now let's talk tacos. These tacos are good. Better than good. These tacos are great. The corn tortillas are some of the best I've had and the fillings are all so simple but so delicious. In addition to the standard chips and garden salsa, you are given three other salsas (habenero, jalapeno, and picante) that are bomb.com. I'm told live DJ on Fridays and live music on Saturdays or some such variation, which could be fun. Awesome happy hour specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa combo
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool, renovated, historic church
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne asada tacos

BenOpz9uPKiK1ZwWzW9wSA.text: We moved here two weeks ago from the Bay, and we have already eaten here four times! This might be my favorite restaurant ever. The food is so fresh and delicious. The staff is so friendly, and super knowledgeable about the menu. The duck taco is a must!  Prices are very reasonable, especially given the high quality of the food. Bravo!!

9Z4oMIL-w0FIe-f8XPuKYg.text: Excellent tacos and margarita!! The chips and salsa was delicious and the place is super cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious!!

xh3-6OmGD8t02ZAjhIHA_A.text: I love the fun atmosphere and tasty tacos.  Fun place to come for happy hour drinks and hanging out.  Parking can be tricky because it is so popular, but worth it.

uTNY2h-lv1CntbBAIeeGYg.text: Sorry Arizona but this place doesn't come close to any Mexican taco in California or Nevada .. I can see why people love this place.. the vibe the music the decor .. as for food.. salsa was mediocre .. ceviche was plained.. tacos ...sigh one thing over power others.. either too much cheese or too much sauce.... walked away still hungry n angry for the price we paid...

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SqJFS-MLF3sB7t0lTtfTcg.text: Went to the taco guild, was very happy with the service provided the waitress did an awesome job. Didn't get the order wrong and I am very specific and picky with what I want. Happy that they were able to accommodate myself and my husband and the excellent service they provided. We have been coming here for years, this is one of the better places to get tacos in Phoenix!!

vRZqzPUF271m6QW6rlZr0Q.text: Came here for dinner and I thought the tacos were okay but not great. To me, the tacos tasted a little bland and not very flavorful as they looked. I ordered a trio of tacos and a side of corn. The best thing of the whole meal had to have been the corn that I got. It had a different and unique taste that made it stand out more. On the other hand, the atmosphere of the place was great and the staff were quick despite being pretty busy. The decor was interesting in a good way and it looked like an old church. It is a good place to check out if you want to try something new.

le4aysRa37jWwLEhhDCqRw.text: I rarely give 5 star reviews, reserving them for places that I can't stop thinking about. This place qualifies!  We came here for dinner and were not disappointed. The taco selection was excellent, and between the four of us we tried nearly all of them. Fantastic, each and every one. The guacamole was delicious, and I would highly recommend as an app. Their own hot sauces were good too.   Drink selection was decent, and the margaritas were amazing. Also affordable. I will definitely be returning when I'm in Phoenix!

heEiiG2AbxZ46269gAandA.text: The food was great.  So was the service.  The building is cool, as is the bar.  We won't go back. The music ruins it.  Bad call guys.

qBdBwoP2kSedSiP7nlRFZw.text: The ambiance is awesome!! I love what they did with the church. The service and food was good as well. Nicely priced as well.

Xm6A01jlbO34p14YT8lXoA.text: We absolutely loved this place the two times we came before. Today was not the same experience. We sat at the bar. Good food, okay service as usual. The waiters thought it was okay to keep refilling water by us even though we were nowhere near the service station. Biggest upset was finding out that they had taken the jalapeno straws off the menu as a side. (They still came on top of the chipotle cherry steak taco but we could not get a side of them.) They did not bring our food at the same time so I had to wait awkwardly to eat.  Somewhere  we were planning to go frequently turned into somewhere we may go if we are in the neighborhood.

_-rpTzAbsgTuVsiVBA7mgQ.text: really liked the tacos - we had duck, lamb and a few others...and enjoyed the sangria. the building itself is just beautiful. love that it's been repurposed in such a practical way. a nice addition to the neighborhood.

SDHwC0mNPVI1JlVk7cx6kQ.text: I have been here a few times now and I love it! The tacos are delicious (recently tried the lamb - yum!), the margaritas supreme, and the atmosphere is fab. I recommend this to anyone wanting to try a new place in Midtown.

iDqaZ6S3yYBWFNFMb2_qqA.text: Been here twice! Our first experience was beyond terrible. Servers and hostess's were bad! First time, the server never showed up to offer us any drinks etc, we were waiting for over 20 minutes. We left. It's really nice inside. But the service and food is just all around bad. Tried the tacos, $5.00 for a dam taco? Have had way better tacos than that. The chicken taco was drenched in fat, the only one that was semi-good was the adovada taco? I think. The salsa was delish! I'm a salsa freak, so I would know.  The rice was gross and the beans?? Don't even get me started on that. On a scale of 1-10, 10 being yummy, I say their food is a 3!! Overall, too expensive, bad service and "blah" food.

woI7xVF0TRjTBURIWrlCrQ.text: Our food was awesome!  I had the vegetable make your own burrito with Honest Tea. Very very good.  Our waitress Kelly was  outstanding!  Very friendly and very quick with refills.  She has a great personality and was full of energy and enthusiasm.

y1MpGTLqyUnV7_CEC_X2Yw.text: The food doesn't stand a chance when the service is severely lacking.   As mentioned in all the other reviews, the building is beautiful.  Now to what is important... We were a party of 6 and it was a Friday night at 8 pm, but it still should not take 25 minutes for our cocktails to arrive after we ordered them.  And when they did start to arrive, they came out a couple at a time.  So by the time we all had drinks, some were ready for round 2.  And we all thought the margaritas were more like large shots.  3 sips and the drink was empty.  Small glasses, lots of ice.  Decent taste though. I will say the salsa was decent and the warm chips were great.  The tacos were just ok.  I have had much better tacos for a lot less.  And the sides were forgettable.   I would return to try other tacos, but the service just left a really bad taste in my mouth.  It just fell short.  From the terribly long wait for the drinks, to having to search the entire restaurant for the server to get a bill, it all just was disappointing.   We had 2 apps to share, 2 cocktails each, 3 tacos each with 1 side and the bill was $46 per person.

ugr1TGAJpajjTLWsylHuFQ.text: I love the building and how they kept a lot of the church's features. The food was very good! The service and the timing of the food was pretty slow... They were not even busy and it took 45 minutes to be served.

VSvoN5EVvdiLdrss3skI4g.text: Excellent tacos! Ordered a chicken, pork and steak. Each had a wonderful combination of flavors. Salsa was great. Service was great. Beautiful dining room. A bit loud with music. Will definitely return soon.

_sCwcFHoC8THBLVJDUDtPg.text: Cool concept and cool atmosphere but bad service and ok tacos. The tortillas used for the tacos are too thick for the delicate flavors inside of them which over powered all of my choices (Thai, duck, pork adavada, and cherry steak). I was looking forward to tasting all the ingredients throughout a bite, which were amazing, not momentarily and then followed by nothing but tortilla..

zknZ-CJox2xLg74nEvFb7w.text: The hostess was GREAT & the atmosphere is trendy!  However, my immediate impression was how EXTREMELY unfriendly my initial waitress was.  Bluntly asking what do you need & not greeting us with a Hi or Hello.  I told her we needed a few mins since we'd never been in before.  So WHAT DID SHE DO ... she took my 15 yr old daughters menu to make room on the table!  How was she supposed to make her MEAL selections?  I waived down the very polite and kind hostess who sent over the manager.  The manager offered a VERY half-hearted apology.  I can see why her team thinks its ok to be rude to PAYING patrons.   The replacement waitress was NO BETTER per her nails were unkept with chipped nail polish and lent in her hair.  We ordered ceviche, 3 tacos & corn that came on a husk that needed to be chucked!  If I wanted to chuck corn, i'd eat at home.  I saw other patrons with bowls of corn & she said I didn't order a bowl.  My mistake, who knew.  She also told me it isn't that hard to chuck & instructed me on how to do so!  The food was sub-par & the manager did her good deed for the day by waiving the cost of the ceviche.  NEVER again...avoid this place at all costs!  Read the other reviews...rudeness is their signature service.  I've NEVER written a review but felt compelled too.  Enough said...

as6krdl1nxGbSzHVPE7ujw.text: We loved the atmosphere, food and especially the service.  Tim was amazing!  It was our first in and he lead us through the menu effortlessly.  His cocktail suggestions were right on.  It's like he knew me!  We will be back very soon.

cP-NYiuXHEiVErE9xSn9ZA.text: The building is beautiful.  I loved that they didn't try to 'modernize'.  As others have mentioned, it is very loud inside.  The open rafters lets everything echo and then the music was loud.  As this was the first time there, it would have been nice to get an explanation of the tacos.  Unfortunately because of the acoustics, it was almost impossible to hear the waiter or any explanation.  The food was good, but I did think it a bit strange that when our food came out, it came out piece meal.  We were a group of four.  One plate came out, then two, and the last plate came out five minutes later.  When we place our order, we indicated to the waiter that there would be three individual checks.  When the check came, it was all together.  He offered to split the check, but got the splits incorrect.

p4U7FA5Ou6yNyT022KAwew.text: Every time I come here I get great service.  The managers are caring and the wait staff is attentive.  The happy hour is a great value, their blended margaritas are delicious and they have the best salsa I have ever had. The venue is also beautiful, inside of an old church. When the sun comes through the stained glass windows it is magical.  Last night we met friends there and as the server was clearing the table, one of the empty taco sleeves fell and grazed my boyfriend's back and red sauce got on his shirt. The server let him know right away, brought over soda water to clean it, then the manager came by with a Tide stick and spot cleaned his shirt. Then he left his card and asked us to send him the bill for the dry cleaning. Then as we left, the manager came by again and gave us a discount card and insisted that we take his business card, as my boyfriend had left it on the table.  I noticed too that they bought us all a round of drinks.  It was over the top nice and their efforts were really appreciated.

68wUZ7YWaUWrflqO2Ug_xw.text: The decor and atmostphere was really great!  Kind of restored church meets industrial. couldn't stop looking around.  I had dinner with my son and we ordered a variety of things and everything was really tasty.  We started with the guac w/pineapple and serranos & queso duo.  I never would have thought to add grilled pineapple to guac but the sweetness played well with the spice of the serranos.  We had the Schreiner chorizo meatballs.  That came with slightly sweet and sour shredded beets and their prickly pear sauce.  They had me at Schreiner's.  We sampled two of the tacos - the taco of the day which was grilled chicken, corn and I don't remember what else as well as the chipotle cherry steak.  We enjoyed both and loved the (I believe house made) corn tortillas.  We also ordered the Adovada burrito.  Good stuff.  My son somehow still had room for dessert and ordered the tres leches cake.  It was fine but we both agreed we've had better.  Cocktails are handled well with a strong emphasis on craft tequilas.  No maragarita mix here.  2 thumbs up and we're looking forward to the next visit!

tlKDTlu4dtM6fAwNZDHH7g.text: We had heard the media hype and decided to give Taco Guild a go. Have to give them credit for the converted church to taco restaurant idea and ambiance- it's really a lovely building with an inviting atmosphere. For those of you that know, good Mexican food is not that easy to find in Phoenix and we were hoping this might be at least a minor Holy Grail find, but alas that is not the case. Food is good, but not great and the prices are really kind of steep for what you get. Out server was really good, helpful, courteous and funny. The drinks are actually quite good. We ate outside in the patio area early evening and it was a cold evening for Phoenix. There was only 1 outdoor "torch" heater working and it was by our table. After we finished the meal we were talking and finishing our drinks and another server came by and asked if we would give up the heater so it could be moved to a nearby table where the customers "were eating dinner soon". So what is this? You don't have enough working heaters and we're supposed to give up ours right this minute because we are waiting for the bill and finishing our drink? Not very good customer service when we had drinks that were $10 and tacos that were $5. Someone else said their esp was telling them this place was more about the $ than being a good restaurant and having good food, and the evidence coming in seems to support that. Probably not going back. Good concept, nice server, but not worth it for the price, quality of food and customer service (again, our server was great!).

IsJYIQQJfnFm0jo1f7t5xw.text: We tried out Taco Guild because we had a hankering for  tacos and America's was closed on Sunday. I love how they re-purposed the church building and the bar looks awesome. The drink menu was attractive but that isn't what we were there for. I might come back to hang out at the bar sometime but we came for the tacos. On par with every new, hip restaurant in town, the music was too loud , the place is designed to be loud and it's not conducive to having a conversation. I'm being a little more generous in my rating than I might be because it's only been open a week. If I were only rating the food I would only be at two stars because you can get good street-style tacos elsewhere that are just as good at almost half the price. I was surprised that ala carte tacos were $4.00. I expected them to be bigger and better at that price. We ordered the ceviche of the day which was nothing more than tiny shrimp and a few pieces of white fish with some mango and onions. When I saw how small the portion was I immediately thought it to be was overpriced at $10. It was nothing special. I won't be ordering that again and I don't recommend it unless you want to spend an extra $10. We didn't enjoy the chips they served with the ceviche either. They looked interesting and there was twice as many as needed for the small amount of ceviche, just didn't like them. We liked the chips that were served with the guacamole better. The guac was which was fresh and very good. Maybe I'll give the food a try another time but I think I'm more likely to come back for drinks and eating will be my secondary focus.

FHVtT1T-qLPlvRFhyal3TA.text: After seeing all the reviews, we were so excited to try this place! Unfortunately, we ended up completely underwhelmed and disappointed. I wanted to love it, but the atmosphere was as cold as the queso and the tacos were a bit try hard - especially the braised lamb...but in all fairness, it's my fault for thinking it's ok to put blue cheese on a "taco." Rookie move. If you order flour tortillas, they are the Mission tortillas you find at the grocery store. The corn tortillas are hand pressed and grilled - very tasty. The skinny margarita was delicious (late night happy hour 6pm-close) and our waiter was pleasant but not worth the $ and wait. Good news: it shares a parking lot with Starbucks so if you get sleepy during the long wait, caffeine isn't far. Overall: skip the Guild and head to The Mission.

0dhNgZtmtCnmwDzcjjBapw.text: I'm never coming back here again! All the meat tacos were bland and the rice was even worse. Suffice to say, the chips and Salsa were the highlight of my meal. Ambiance was great, but never eating here again!

NPUVWNIWXBkPrc8fg9b29A.text: If you have been in Arizona for more than a year you probably won't like this place. The food is kind of bland. If you like the novelty of eating in the old church great. It took me 15 minutes for the server to tell me that the beer I ordered is no longer carried and then another 10 minutes to get it. The chips and salsa or the best part of the meal.

Ea2em5OU19GmzPRUXROTsQ.text: Taco Guild is not what it use to be and I left disappointed. This use to be the place I recommend for out-of-town family members but now I'm contemplating if I should even return myself. The salsa today had bitter after taste, my server never asked or refilled my drinks and the portions have become smaller than usual.

BV-kVjSCjUNVi0KPW2Wy_w.text: Everyone's consensus: Unique atmosphere being in an old church. Food is good but not great. Brought some friends from out of town and was stuck in the back room by ourselves when there were plenty of seats out in the main sitting area. Closed in to look at keys. Obviously our waitress had tables in the main sitting area because we rarely saw her. Everyone had tacos except For me, I had the grilled romaine salad with chicken. I actually love this salad. Everyone loved the street corn, "best corn I've ever had".

l5tNqAr9SZ35JkpQmbYmAQ.text: Let's be honest... if a Mexican restaurant can't make decent rice, then it's likely to fail in every other regard. The tacos were lackluster and the margarita was equally tasteless. Great venue, lame eatery!

dhl4pH6oIOrh4z1AW1_Ctg.text: What do you get when you cross an old church, craft beer and cocktails, and modern mexican food? Perfection. I just took my out of town guests here for my 2nd visit and I realized how much I need to make Taco Guild a staple in my life.   The staff is super friendly, all the waiters help eachother out and ensure that every diner has what they need super fast. I've probably ordered every taco on the menu at some point and they're all delicous. My friends got the guac and loved that too, although I'm weird and don't partake myself. The lamb taco reallllllly stood out to me last time, I wish my entire platter was just those. The drinks are as good as the food and everything is reasonablely priced. After Gallo Blanco closed and changed names on me, I'd been on the lookout for another modern mexican place and I'd have to say that Taco Guild is even better! Check them out, its awesome.

fNKs6OdO7YB74DXB14WsGw.text: One of my favorite taco spots in Phoenix. The three tacos and the side of rice is a good deal. I usually get the chicken or steak tacos which are both delicious. Service is always good, and the place is so cool! A renovated Methodist church, they've used pieces of the church to decorate the restaurant and it's so eclectic!

bkXDU8SzRmmSSn-_Tk4m0A.text: Saturday night ambiance: mood lighting, crosses in stained glass, cherubs staring lovingly across the walls at each other, live music from a guy and his guitar in the corner. He's playing covers of 90s, 2000s, and today. A bar at the front dimly lit and with architecture vaguely reminiscent of a dungeon. Everything about it is unique and eclectic.   Loved the generous serving of chips and salsa. All the salsas offered were fresh and delicious. The chips we salted a little for taste. My hand kept reaching over for more.  Tacos themselves were okay. Most of our party of 13 got the 3 tacos combo - select 3 tacos and get a side for free, or street corn for $2.50   Al Pastor Pork taco - super greasy, dripped all over my hands. Flavorful. Pork Adovada taco - large slices of avocado. Mango jicama relish was delicious.  Yucatan Shrimp taco - a crowd favorite, generous with the shrimp. Local veggies side - soft, salty, lacking in oomph   According to dinner companions: Tropical Ono taco - Ono was dry and lackluster Crackling Lamb taco - too many flavor combinations that didn't work well together Street corn - awesome presentation but not the best ever in terms of flavor. I wished I had gotten it when I saw it, but according to my cousin, the corn wasn't spectacular and could've spent a little longer on the grill.   Our server was really accommodating and friendly. I'd be back to try some of their other tacos, probably on a Saturday to enjoy some of that live music.

Q8_eWLwsQ_MluMEZcy93Cg.text: I love the atmosphere there. The waiters are attentive without being suffocating and the food is phenomenal. They also serve gluten-free treats.

uYhZhM7HNwH2rUF4INhmsA.text: Decor, 5 stars! Street Corn, 5 stars! Tacos, a let down. The fact is that here in Phoenix there are so many options for tacos, and when your tacos are overpriced and not as good as others I'm not going to go back. But their corn is great, I've gone back just for their corn. The corn and decor is the only reason I would think about giving them 3 stars. It's no doubt a cool spot to grab lunch and post pics on Instagram if you're into that sorta thing, I just prefer food over decor.

kHJLeZANBfNDyA2BcxYtCA.text: Top places to eat when in Phoenix! More than something to eat, you get an experience because it's an old church building turned into a restaurant! And kudos to them for keeping the beauty of the church with the stain glass, pews and altar. The food is definitely up to par with the looks. They start you off with chips and 4 different salsas and of course-bottomless! We ordered the bacon jalapeno guac, a taco for each of us (al pastor), and their street corn. A must is their corn! My wife and I left stuffed, satisfied and will visit every time in town.

2Hu63trD0uKPbjlJY20qeA.text: I came here after work with some buddies from work. Parking wasn't an issue when I arrived, different story when I left though I noticed, It gets crowded. The food was great! I had the chicken enchiladas, and I definately recommend. I also couldn't leave without trying the tacos so I got a pastor taco, it also didn't disappoint. All in all the service was on par and the atmosphere was good. Go check it out.

34FkYdpd9SDEkjHczDyyyQ.text: In the past the everything was good. That said, this visit was a disappointment. The size of the duo guacamole is much smaller than what we received in the past. The number of shrimp on the salad seems to have also went down. They were busy, but  the service was subpar.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DUFbDi4QvqxR041S8mkYQg.text: As many times as I have been there (and as much money as I have spent there), I could not get a simple romaine salad as it was not on the brunch menu. Never mind it has never been a problem in the past. It was very disappointing so we left.

nhtG-Twa85qs6tryRxcL4w.text: We came here for dinner the other day and it was pretty good.  The place was on old church converted into a resturant.  We enjoyed looking around as they kept all the stained glass windows in tact.  Nice touch! We were seated immediately even though they were pretty busy.  Our server came with chips, salsa and waters for our table.  We all orderd margeritas and different tacos for dinner.  I did order mexican corn for an appitizer.  I had them put it into a cup so it wasnt as messy or so it wouldnt stick in my teeth the rest of the evening.  However by doing so it was not that good.  The flavors and spices were off.  They didnt even cut the corn off the cob.  It was out of a can.  The tacos were just ok.  Nothing I had'nt had before unfortunately.  They were hot and fresh so nothing bad about them. Just nothing jumped out and said.I must be back tomorrow to eat that again.  All in all it was a good meal in a cool enviroment.

SLmqB7B8QgiRHZ1iuXj6bg.text: Food is delish, and the ambiance is really cool! Happy hour margaritas are good, but lots of ice. Had the daily special chicken tacos which were really good. Service was great, and our server was friendly!

1FnChIDyCdOKV4FdzcUnCw.text: Wonderful experience! The restaurant is in a beautifully renovated old Methodist church that has been there since 1893. The bar is in the original altar!  The service is impeccable and so is the food. I recommend the chipotle cherry steak tacos.  The bar manager Sam was on the floor making sure everybody was taken care of. We asked I'm a few questions regarding the building and what tequila we should try he was very knowledgeable and personable.  We are looking forward to our next visit!

O8OsmcWJFiuGHyWAVXta2g.text: Great atmosphere and tasty food.  Happy hour until 7pm so that is a big plus.  We were well taken care of at a very busy bar.  In fact the bartender too the time to share some background one of her favorite tequilas in the inventory.  The Forteleza was a great recommendation and we also enjoyed our happy hour tacos, plus the chips and salsa.  Chips served piping hot.  We did sample the "bacon" guacamole.  Very fresh, but lacked a little kick or something...  This place was packed on a mid week afternoon.  Think it is well liked, so they must be doing something right.    Keep up the good work!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A wonderful tequila!

lX_PWLHEUQYScZ0YGFjN4A.text: The ambiance of the restaurant is really what makes this place a good dining experience. The salsa is actually one of the better salsas  I've ever had. We got the taco trio plates and had the beef, chicken and pork. Overall very good ingredients and tasted good, but I expected "more". There are a number of hole in the wall taco stands throughout Phoenix that actually serve a better taco. I

FxxrMk25gyaxOLCrpATmww.text: Love this place, unfortunately it is far from my home so I only get to go when I am downtown.   Steak tacos with blue cheese are great.

TOsM90_SH2zuJ5hJSdTboQ.text: 2 words   PEKING DUCK TACO! $%!#@!!!  Okay, 3 but I figured the taco was implied.   There is not a single taco here that I'm not in love with. Mangoes, lamb, braised beef, pineapple, poblanos, jicama...everything that's right with the world goes into these lovely folded corn circles of goodness.  And wait, the staff is friendly, chatty, fun, they joke around with you, and they give me compliments when I ask them to.  Evening DJs spinning very cool vibes in a beautifully renovated old brick church.   Poetic

g4kx9McOfAJiIKvopG9k7A.text: Reliably delicious, and attentive wait staff. The cherry beef tacos and street corn are to die for!

5b0VpdR89vTI1NQ6ohlycw.text: The different assortment of the tacos that I had were pretty great. Different than I expected. However still very delicious. We definitely will come back. Although I did not like the salsa.

y7rKP5AtTxmaITlRov-3oQ.text: Heard about this place from many others.  Food was quick, delicious and didn't disappoint!  Loved the atmosphere, building and decor!  Stopping by for sure when in the area.

Z7faICuedE4FbwMzSRa95g.text: Went to Taco Guild for lunch during the weekday with a friend. The good: - we were seated and served our food very quickly and it was packed there. -you get large portions so the price you see is more than fair -atmosphere and design -staff are quick and responsive to customer concerns - the salsa was good particularly the green  The bad: - flavor was mediocre despite the prettily presented food ( the meats which both my friend and I tried 4 different agreed the meat seemed to have no season though adding the green salsa made it much better) -chicken had too many bones in it  -trying to find parking is atrocious,  it's a small lot shared by multiple vendors  All I personally do not recommend this place if you like flavor but other people seemed to enjoy it!

A-CyexJN-IcgBJlf-R-aEA.text: I do not give 5 STARS. But we struck gold here. This is my second visit In a week, ( I live 20+ miles or so north east. But my friend Dan Z. Turned me into a junkie on the first go. So now I am like a pusher hooking up all my other victims as they are willing to follow.   To be straight here "THEY EFFING NAILED IT" so they get a 5 star. There is no downfall  The STREET CORN ( a must )  Great menu, local beers, extraordinary atmosphere.  I hate to give secret places but Taco Guild should go viral  "Cheers"!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7OpgvAKvGM-S1efGCvCQSA.text: Wanted to place to go order. Hostess directed me to bar. Bartender didn't acknowledge me and no space to squeeze it to order. I ordered 3 tacos and got charged for 7 when I got his attention again he got rude with me. No one said welcome or come back. Music so loud you can't hear yourself think. Have no chips with guacamole in to go order

pEYixI7V3mnsRD1Z-HCmUQ.text: Last night Taco Guild hosted a group of 22 of us for a surprise birthday dinner. They were so accommodating and helped us have a good time. They were very knowledgeable with our group, explaining the different types of tequila. I would recommend for a group setting anytime! I will go back again on a date night as well at the bar. Thank you Taco Guild! Oh and also very importantly, the food and drink were great!!

_RV38oQSmG7cc8v4YXdXYA.text: Cool space and great staff. I had a really good beer, and the chips were awesome. Ok, that was the good stuff.  The salsa that went with those chips? It had a little texture, but no life - badly needed some brightness, more spice or a little smoke.  Our "old school" tacos failed on almost every level, starting with house-made corn tortillas that desperately wanted some time on a griddle. Not only did they fall apart while trying to contain the generous helpings of bland filling, but the pale color and weirdly-smooth texture were more like rubber than anything else.  The coffee-braised beef taco needed more than java to perk it up. No spice, under salted, and the jicama relish was missing its crunch. Sorry, Urban Beans.  Pork adovada, at least, had some flavor. But the cilantro was leathery, the avocado not quite ripe (poked through the tortilla!) and that same, sad jicama relish.  Finally, the al pastor. Reliable, safe, al pastor. Uh oh.  Bland, greasy, and chewy, sweet like sugar instead of pineapple tang. Even the pickled onions were bland - a real shame since these badly needed some zip and crunch.  The final disappointment was the local veggies, a halfheartedly-warm cup of brussels sprouts, zucchini and others that were sorta-cooked in such a way that I can only assume they were tented in foil and left in the hot Phoenix sun for a few hours. Roasted, sauteed or grilled? No. Steamed...maybe? It's a mystery.  Thanks to the host and server who kept our early-afternoon visit from being a total debacle. And let me know where to buy those chips for home, since we won't be back.

j-h8m4Jf-jWYmGLhWTndiQ.text: My friends love this place but I don't get the hype. I do enjoy the chips and salsa variety with cheap margaritas on happy hour. However, all of their food is very pricey and quantity just isn't there. I have tried the taco plate and the meat consistency reminds me of dog food. The church presence creeps me out and the chairs are kinda uncomfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and four different types of salsa!

xDDljF8HPVII_-26RJhEhA.text: beautiful place for a nice dinner date. Their tacos are on point! want to go back an try some of their other items on the menu

4BG922_u5JcahXXZ6ovGBA.text: One of our favorite spots! The staff is always so kind and the food is fabulous.

67zOczk5nS86CEJUWyDQjg.text: So, IMO, this place is way over hyped.  Pros:  - This restaurant has an awesome vibe. - The chips and salsa. - Queso dip  Cons:  - The chorizo meatballs were meh. - The taco meat in every taco was very bland  The service was fine, which I see a lot of people complain about. Didnt try anything from the bar, so cant comment.  So, why 2 stars? This is a taco place and if your tacos are bland or not great, I have to judge that hard.

DSJWPIsKExOnlL1isOCkUA.text: Came here just in time for lunch by 1pm they had a bit of a wait. The decor and set up is cute and unique. To drink I got the special for the day. It was made with grapefruit which was light and refreshing. For an app we got the duo which comes with queso and guacamole both were very tasty I enjoyed them a lot more than the salsa that came with the chips. I did the 3 tacos pork, chicken and shrimp with the street corn. The AL pastor was very dry, chicken delicious and the shrimp was OK but nothing special. The street corn was fabulous and sweet. Would definitely come back for apps and drinks!

Tacos good, not a huge variety of tacos but overall a good menu it's got burritos salads enchiladas and sides full bar very impressive fun place to go. Only complaint was mediocre rice says is house made tastes like instant rice skip the rice

LH_ZsbYCpy5kbLdudWGNrQ.text: Great food, flavors.  Didn't try a margarita due to work but they looked good. Lamb tacos were good.

OGEy1x_Bu4sD5lgNr5ndmA.text: Friendly service!  Meatballs....not good!  Tacos bland. Street corn....good. Chips and salsa were yummy!

n8X-p--F1Zhuu_OnSfFX3w.text: Mmmm get the steak taco with the blue cheese. It's so good!!! Margaritas for happy hour are great, but they just increased the price. Kind of lame... it should've stayed at $5 flat, but it's a great margarita. Kind of wish they had more taco options for their $2 taco during happy hour. But get the steak one. So. Good.

ZwWRVjpg28ogHWBVxSydXw.text: Pork Adovada, Yucatan Shrimp and Peking Duck taco. Street corn w/ habanero butter, chipotle mayonnaise and Cotija cheese. My mouth is on fire and I love it. Combination of flavors and spice are really interesting. Need to serve corn w/ some lime. Coconut cream pie, very dense even more so then a cheesecake. A bit odd but tasted spot on, fresh whip cream makes me happy. This place is an old church, great atmosphere!! Guitarist sounds good. Pleasant variety of guests.

JcUAU2OMVUONYS61Skp5cA.text: Taco Guild has a fabulous atmosphere, being in a converted church. Great guacamole and salsa sampler. My f as Emily had burritos with shrimp and lamb - they loved the complex flavors. I had 3 tacos with street corn. I tried a different wrap on each - lived the homemade corn the best. I loved the salmon special. The coconut cream pie was light and tasty!

XsMgyayjLdMQ8AnGPFk3-w.text: Great place! Stopped in as one of our bar hop stops. Medium sized place, the noise was not excessive. Food was delicious, I had the carne asada taco, a friend had the chorizo balls and another had the fish? We all thought the food was great. Parking is a little tight. Would definitely go back.

vkX4LxIP3QiiiJsLbKw0Dw.text: We visited the Taco guild recently for the first time on our anniversary. We had reservations and were greeted and seated promptly. Next came our server, Samantha, who made our guild experience incredible. She first greeted us with complimentary salsa and chips. She was very knowledgeable and suggested guac as an appetizer. Great choice! It seemed fairly busy that night, but with her speedy service we wouldn't have even noticed. She kept our water filled, got our margaritas promptly, and helped recommended sides for our entrees. The blueberry margarita was the highlight of my meal. Parking was a bit irritating, but next time i will be usuing their complimentary vallet.  Overall it was an amazing anniversary dinner! Samantha helped make it specail with her service and she even took a photo of us at the end of our dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blueberry yum yum!

x94YOX5RCQpcEA0YZ2jDJA.text: Revived church turned into a taco restaurant. Super cool and intricate detail as this was an old church. Good food!

tZOoo0-KrJ6_CCcIx0peZg.text: I REALLLLLY wanted to love Taco Guild. I just can't. The only good things were the chips and salsa, ambiance and acai marg. The tacos in my opinion were very bad. I ordered three different kind, I believe the steak, duck and crispy fish. The crispy fish wasn't Terrible but it wasn't great either. I feel the pairings of toppings on the meats are just bad choices and the flavors are not brought out very well with the options they selected. On all of the tacos I noticed that the corn tortillas tasted like they were right out of the bag.. not warmed up at all, very gritty. The rice tasted like it was out of a box and the service wasn't the best either. Again I hate writing negative reviews but in all honesty, my 3 stars for the margs, chips & salsa and ambiance is a bit generous.  Sorry guys.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6N12bfLB7Izb4FMrO95pag.text: So delicious, so delicious but kind of pricey. Shrimp in there is fantastic I would defiantly go back

liTh1ljRn-apaTx-g2NHbg.text: I will not be returning to the Taco Guild.  The food is mediocre at best, and to expensive to be worth the rather disconcerting experience of being in a bar that was a community church for decades.  It's not the servers' fault.  The developer and the management own this abomination.

fTfnA_TixmyPyQb8JF_wVQ.text: One of the best dining experiences I've had in a long time. While the food and drinks are a bit pricey, the quality of food and service withstand the price.   Gabriel, our server, did a phenomenal job. He was funny, personable, and did a great job at anticipating our needs. He even overheard it was my friend's birthdays and made sure to tell him happy birthday at the end of the night. Been awhile since I had such great, thoughtful service.   And that street corn.... oh my. HEAVEN. 5 stars. I will absolutely be back. The tacos were great, the salsas were delicious, the drinks were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Built inside of an old church building!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guild Trio app
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House sangria

LgosIFwehQhJ3sA78T_Ccg.text: Holy new menu!!! Wow. Where to begin. Pork belly taco, LOBSTER taco, short rib taco, roasted artichoke taco - all amazing. I would have had more but I was full.   Blown away by the service and the food and it just happens to be in one of the coolest buildings in town. What a gem. I really need to come back more often.   I eat out all the time. Rarely do you see the managers on the floor, helping staff and interacting with tables like here. They care, the staff cares and it shows.   Hey YELP - can I give them more than 5 stars?

IEuecQfJPWpGGiToLLTggg.text: Five stars for the venue, and the food, however I can't give a full rating to a place where my credit card was charged more than what I actually wrote down on the bill. It's not a huge difference but that really is a bummer to have that happen.

kCwAI9Fh9rZKmkEcVgyYnQ.text: This was our first visit to Taco Guild. We arrived at 5:15 but there was no parking to be found....we ended up all of the way down the street. We liked the church setting, the stained glass windows were pretty cool. The not so great....it was super noisy in there. Some noise absorbing bolsters or something would help. We had a hard time even hearing our server. We sat at a raised long table, it would be nice if their raised tables had foot rests other then just on the chairs. We also weren't very impressed with the service, in general. The good.....the chips were great! Perfect amount of salt, still warm and plenty of them. The dishes we ordered were all pretty good. The tables are arranged nicely so you don't feel like your are on top of the table next to you. They worked with me on dairy avoidance and substitutions to my meal, so I appreciated that. Not sure if we will be back, mostly due to the parking situation and the noise level, but glad that we gave it a try.

-n2TTrf4_ddhnkPamY-Zxg.text: Aaaaand I think I've found my newest favorite Mexican spot! Although parking was tough to find when I went, the service was quick and attentive, so we still got out quickly.  The restaurant is in a former church, so there's beautiful stained glass windows and there's a mural (there's a better word but I can't come up with it right now ) on the ceiling as well, which is also fun.   To start, you get a bowl of perfectly fried tortilla chips (you can get refills for free!) and 4 different salsas. The menu isn't super large, which makes decision making easier, especially because everything sounds and tastes great. I got a taco platter with a side of Mexican corn--totally worth the $2. The flavors were complex, and the ingredients fresh. The margs we're good too ;) Totally worth checking out if you haven't been.

Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frozen marg

dzuRqC2n5okQxVF4noi2eQ.text: Get the avocado fries! They are so good. I also got the Chipotle Cherry steak taco & the Cubano taco. Both were delicious. The tacos were loaded with meat & interesting toppings. The space is really cool--its an old Methodist church that still has stained glass windows.

exxBFSescxK40j_FK4RIoA.text: UPDATE 1: I recently went back to Taco guild to have the AMAZING brunch again, and had a very odd experience. Let me just say, the issue is not the food/server/runners, but the hostess. The hostess on shift was extremely rude to my family and I and completely soured our whole experience. I went in to ask about outdoor seating at first, she shrugged it off and gave immediate attitude when I simple "I'll check!!" Would be suffice. She then tells us there is a seat, but it'll take 10 minutes to seat us. I asked why and she said "cuz I have to clean it". She stood at her stand for 5 minutes just staring a wall (also checking her phone once) , then proceeded to take one thing at a time to the table. It was like she was dragging out the experience on purpose. She then, gives us attitude when calling us over to our table and plops us down.  Our service from there was amazing but we had very sour attitudes for the first half of our brunch due to her rude aura. When we were leaving, she said bye to another family leaving the patio, and just stared at us.   Taco guild is a hidden gem in Phoenix that houses GREAT food for GREAT prices. I went to Taco Guild on Father's Day, for brunch.   I was sat with my family the moment we got there, which was a nice surprise since it was Father's Day at lunch time.   The waiter we had was very pleasant and very attentive to us overall.   I ordered the coconut French toast, and it was DELICIOUS! I opted for no coconut, but it was still amazing. I ended up boxing some of it, but I ate it later because I was craving it so bad! The sausage was okay, pretty average and very, very greasy.   Everyone else's dish was received with no complaints.   I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant, it is casual, but feels very upscale. The fact it's in an old church makes it seem even cooler.  Overall, I would definitely recommend to a friend and return back. My only complaint is, I wish our plates were brought at the same time. But, it's easily fixable!!

Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bzbqKo649fE4Xd1HQM2FzA.text: If you're a vegetarian and love tacos... come here! This place is a remodeled old church, with super high ceilings, beautiful decor and plenty of space. The vegetarian taco selection is so great, usually I go to places that just have one, and they are super tasty. I would also recommend the margaritas and the elote. The parking is pretty tight in the lot but they have valet, and get you in and out pretty quickly. Love this place!

Huzat9vYmo760ZWS1s_WAg.text: This is probably the coolest atmosphere of a restaurant I've ever been. This restaurant was created inside of an old church built in 1983. The manager was so nice and personable and gave us a tour around the whole building, showing us the relics from the original church. It has the original floors, ceiling, church pews and member sign. SO COOL.   So now to the food. Also so good! We way over ordered appetizers so we didn't end up eating a lot of food, but the tacos we had were great. I had the old age pork taco. If I had to key in on one thing other than the atmosphere here it has to be their AMAZING deviled eggs. I don't even like deviled eggs and I swear I couldn't get enough of these.

slQTXRANB79eCiUw4eMzFA.text: Great food! Always room at bar. We never drink much, and our bill are very reasonable. Deep flavors that linger, not heat. Good place to take a person who may not like hot mexican food.  The sauce can make the food as spicy as you want. Totally yummy!

MOOSZggsAstFKB2InGotVQ.text: A truly unique experience with amazing food! I love the use of the architecture here. I've been back twice since my first visit, and it's always been a pleasant experience! Parking is tight, but they do have free valet, if necessary. I usually go for the tacos, and I think I've tried just about every one now! That being said, I honestly can't place my thumb on a favorite.. they're all so great!

_8tEMUpLNuCWDUFQr3cqpA.text: Excellent place for Tacos, Tequila, and atmosphere! This place is gorgeous! If your looking for a place to take out of townees look no further. Very original and fun!

MdS_e32fVoiwWsUKOkQnxQ.text: Gorgeous location, great energy. The tacos were ok, the meat on all my tacos was overdone. Salsas and slaw were delicious. Overall it was just ok.

4GIDfrImsBHqY6psbqpCOg.text: I am so happy to have stumbled across this little piece of history. The stained glass windows are gorgeous the lighting and decor just take you back in time:   Service was great!  The manager (from Australia) was so incredibly knowledgeable with the history of the building and takes pride in sharing its story   I had lobster Benedict... it's not something I would normally order but it was good.   The husband and our friends did the 3 taco plate with coffee rubbed beef and other types of meats and liver it.   The salsa and chips are a meal in itself. Really fresh and tasty

pb-QyaEG5fvOdqmBzys1EA.text: I'm always up for trying unique and atypical tacos. I've heard so many great things about this place and wow, did it disappoint. I'm giving it 3 stars based on the salads and drinks. The salads are unique and are very good.  The tacos.... well, they just are ok.   I understand the concept and all, I just feel they are totally missing the mark on flavor. The duck tacos are over done. The lobster is ok and the steak is ok.

I6SGE6J7-rH6FOPjTEtPYw.text: Tacos and drinks were good. Service was horrible.  Our drinks came way after our food. Took over 20 minutes to get our check and you have to use their dirty nasty hand held devices.  Disgusting and full of germs probably.  Waiter kept making excuses for why he was taking forever with everything.  Just be honest instead of making excuses for everything!    Some of the worst service I have ever received!  Oh the device I mention also does an auto tip of 22%!  Very sneaky if you're not closely paying attention.

3DLKqDq6gyN-aX2PClSH9A.text: Taco Tuuuuuesday! We love this place, it's only our second time dining here but we'll definitely be back again. When we got there we had about a 20 minute wait, which we expected. The crowd started to clear out around 8:30 so if you don't want to wait, that might be the sweet spot.  Taco Guild h have a great taco Tuesday deal but the tacos are really tiny. I had three lobster tacos and a side of queso, my husband had steak, chicken and lobster he ended up getting 5 because of their size.  These tacos are amazingly good, they top it off with a piece of fried avocado and I just couldn't get enough. Three tacos were plenty for me, I ate a lot of the chips and salsa which is also filling.  I will say the queso was not my favorite. Initially it was ok, but became cold and hard really quick. I wouldn't order it again. I also had the 1893 margarita, that also wasn't one of my favorite things. I wouldn't order it again either. Seemed like a tiny taste of tequila with a lot of ice and mixers.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside

Q7mjVJWIeXGFrCkfCsSH_g.text: Pretty tasty! I love the subtle flavors that go into the dishes and make them so interesting and fun to eat. I've had speciality tacos and happy hour tacos. They're all good! I think getting the specialty tacos are worth the extra costs. Their soup of the day as the time which was the jalapeno clam chowder was also delicious. Their salads are also great! Thick with lettuce, and they give you a steak knife to cut through! Friday wasn't too hectic, and they had live music. It was kind of loud, but it may have been because we were seated next to the performance.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour tacos and tamale! Sorry it&#39;s already half eaten. I was too excited!

ANsPTBto-ke2c05F6vaFrg.text: Within a month of moving to Phoenix, I'd been told multiple times to try Taco Guild. I don't know why it's taken me this long as it's clearly a downtown favorite, but I finally made my way here for Taco Tuesday last week. My overall impression of the food was kinda meh (minus the complimentary chips and house-made salsas, which were stellar), but the decor and creativity were impressive. It definitely felt like I was paying more for the experience than the food though.   Located in the same small plaza as Starbucks and Buffalo Exchange, parking is an absolute nightmare during dinner time. There's a complimentary valet at the door and street parking in the residential area close by though. The decor inside is rustic and roomy, and I think the interior designer really pulled out all the stops, down to the modern-antique chandelier. Because the inside is one huge dining room, it did get pretty loud with the echoes of everyone's voices bouncing off the walls. Service was fine.  Taco Tuesday wasn't a specific set of tacos; instead, all tacos were 50% of their original prices for a smaller portion. Tacos ranged from $5-$7 generally, and the Taco Tuesday portion was about the size of my palm (I don't have very large hands). There is the option to choose between corn or flour tortillas.  Chips and salsas: Ohhhh my goodness, hands down the best chips and salsas I've ever had. The chips were so fresh I could inhale them, and they were the perfect thickness and crunchiness. Paired with the variety of salsas, I was really impressed at the beginning of the meal. I liked the original the best, but the green sauce had a lovely freshness and bite while the orange yielded a nice sweetness paired with spicy. Definitely my favorite part of the meal.  Red meat tacos: Short rib, leg of lamb, and molida lamb tacos weren't bad, but nothing to write home about. Carnitas taco was dry as a bone and tasted like jerky. Combinations were creative, but I don't know if all the ingredients really went together to elevate the tacos.   Seafood tacos: I probably liked the fried cod taco the most. The cod was battered and fried well so that it was super tender inside. The overly crunchy cabbage slaw ruined the texture a bit, but I thought the combination worked. The lobster taco had impressively poached lobster that was very tender, but it was cold to the bite and made me not want to take another bite. I also think this would've been better with a flour tortilla because the corn made it a bit gritty.   Duck taco: I think this was maybe the Peking duck taco before, but I'm glad they renamed it because it was not reminiscent of Peking duck at all. I could barely taste the duck because of how many components there were, and they all seemed dissonant.   I'm all for innovation and creativity, but sometimes I think that can go overboard. Taco Guild falls into that category for me, and I left somewhat disappointed and craving a hearty traditional plate of tacos. It's pretty unlikely I'll be back.
