Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Molida lamb taco (left) and leg of lamb taco (right).
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carnitas taco (left) and Korean short rib taco (right).

u2qFyw9p6_d_TEWeKpFo2A.text: Meh. Really meh. I had such high hopes for this place and was utterly disappointed. Nice looking menu in a great historic building. Seriously overpriced tacos - one of my tacos arrived cold and congealed, the other too spicy to swallow. Others at our table had mixed results as well. The flavored waters were refreshing. Service was slow and waitstaff seemed uninvolved with our party of six. I won't be returning, sorry.

6hkJ2w_5aHYdRnaEZU5Lvg.text: I heard about Taco Guild from a Phoenix local and was excited to try it out on a Friday night. It's a bit removed from the downtown area (where I was staying), but an Uber/Lyft ride there is definitely affordable.   The restaurant was crowded, but my friend and I were able to stand at the bar and have a drink before our table was called. Once seated, we ordered the queso fundido with chorizo for an appetizer. The portion was on the small side, but the queso was excellent. We both had the three taco plate for our entrees - I had the al pastor, chipotle cherry steak, and clandestino shrimp. They were all very filling and the meats and toppings were excellent. I got the bowl of street corn as my side, and it was extremely oily/buttery. I'm normally fine with a little extra (and it's not like I was trying to eat healthy by going to Taco Guild), but the corn was swimming in the oil.   All in all, I'd definitely return to Taco Guild. I loved the old church vibe and beautiful ceiling frescos. The tacos were great and the service was decent!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos and street corn
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Close-up of the tacos

blyNXrwq2NufJucmYVdSWQ.text: Really enjoyed my visit here! First off...a renovated church that serves tacos n tequila?!? Can I get an AMEN!!!?  So, it goes without saying that the decor is on point here! But, the food and drinks live up to the hype as well.  They have a generous HH from 2-6:30pm with $6.50 margs & $2 off all other alcoholic bevvies.  The frozen marg is pretty delicious and well-made. I also had their house Clandestino Mexican Lager (with a lime) and it was perfection with my taco trio & street corn.  I got the coffee braised beef, clandestino shrimp, and lambo tacos. All we're absolutely exquisite and flavorful and each was a fav for very diff taste reasons. The sauce on the shrimp taco was wowsa, the sweet potato hash on the lamb taco was nom, and the coffee braised beef was a taste-extravaganza unto itself!  The street corn was also abfab delish and a must have on the cob!  I had their horchata w/the shot of tequila as my dessert and it did not disappoint!   Also, the service from the min u walk in is top-notch! The bartenders were so good! Gracious, engaging, and knowledgeable about suggestions!  Will definitely be back with recruits as I have seen the light!

EOqUsiikuprTLC8KUnNvPg.text: Was hyped up from the reviews.  Pretty weak in all aspects.  Taco Tuesday half price half size, great we can try more proteins.  Wow pretty bad all the protein, had 6 different kinds, none were memorable, ones most memorable in a horrible way is the molida lamb, it had blue cheese a shit load wtf, couldn't taste anything else, it could of been horse or snake meat, grounded absolutely weird.  Korean fried chicken, omg soggy sadness, I think you would be punched in the Face In Korean town Los Angeles if you served that shit and called it kfc,  call Roy Choi for some tips.  Chicharron, hard af burnt parts.  Not even gonna go into the rest, fried cod like filet o fish mcdees flavor, all the tacos had 75% garnish and 25% protein.  I'm not a fan of this Americanized fancy tacos but came here for some tequila and vibe, that was good.  Tequila flight and margarita house was more tart than sweet, I liked.  But yea just meat cilantro onions and limes, done.  Not of this bs.    Fried avocado. Breading too thick.  Guacamole pineapple mint, needs more acid, maybe juice from half a lime.    Chips were the best!  Salsa was all about same heat level.  Most real deal Mexican spots would make a super hot salsa upon request, not here.  They have a habanero , weakest I've had.  Like habanero for beginners, or for middle school girls.    Flour tortillas a bit thick and undercooked.  Corn not much better.    Come here for drinks, can't go wrong, salud!  Arriba!!!  Sorry gonna change to one star.  I remember server saying salsa is homemade, how hard is it to blend up a bit more habanero and add to your habanero salsa to turn up the heat.  Pretty pathetic and lazy, I hate lazy people.

aPHXYFd6SZXhjh09OHqWgQ.text: Taco Guild is hands down my favorite restaurant to eat at in Phoenix! Their cherry chipotle steak tacos are absolutely phenomenal  and to top it off, the customer service is some of the best that I've ever received at a restaurant! Every time I come in, the servers are super friendly and polite, always have great suggestions for the drink menu, and the no matter how busy they are, the food comes out really fast. The wait is usually a little bit long 20-30 minutes is the average, but it is SO worth it. If you're looking for a top-notch taco place, Taco Guild is your best bet! Not to mention the awesome live music on Saturdays, yummy margaritas, and tres leches cake that melts in your mouth. You'll be glad you stopped in :)

1ZFNpZGWsEN0F7j96lnQ_w.text: I know Taco Guild comes highly rated but it's expensive for a subpar experience. It's so disappointing. I went twice just to make sure it a flook.   We got there after the dinner rush which was great. It was quieter, the music was fire, and our waitress wouldn't be frazzled. But service was still slower than I expected. It took 25 minutes just to get our cocktails. When I got mine, it did not taste anything like mango so that was a waste of money. Then we ordered. I specifically asked for my duck taco not to have gorgonzola and it came with it anyway, I think it ruined the taste. When I asked for a new one; it was 100% better without the cheese. The steak and lobster were both creative but not very memorable.   The saving grace of the dinner was the plantains. They were wonderful and the added sweetness it's sauteed in wasn't overkill. I loved them. The atmosphere of the renovated church is so cool! It's just not worth the price tag.

YNnBbQrjfNN-xzOPLfP5fQ.text: My partner and I tried six different tacos between us and each was excellent, as were the chips and salsa (four flavors). In addition to the great food, the environment and the service were very good. Our server Christina was fantastic as she offered great suggestions and attentive service. Highly recommended if you're in the Phoenix area.

7IJqW19hsPKUa-GA6hgtjA.text: This was my first visit to Taco Guild.   Parking was a little difficult, thank goodness they had free valet! Use it.   Walked inside and took a little bit to get seated and even longer to get greeted. We also had reservations :(   The ambiance of the restaurant was really cool, it's an old historical church! Super unique. When you are inside I could literally imagine where the pews would be and the stage, etc.   Tour meal comes with chips and salsa- a little disappointed with the salsas. They were very mild.   But then! I got 3 tacos with the corn off the cob and all of those were super spicy. It was like two extremes. I was not impressed with the shrimp tacos with bacon- it was a weird combo.  Chicken and steak tacos were good though.  They have a Jux box you can play music on with the app on your phone too! I didn't get a wow experience, but it was a nice, unique place with some interesting flavors.

i6cxuBctW-a4UIk0NFZQqw.text: I'd been wanting to check out Taco guild for some time now. Finally got a chance to visit on a Sunday evening. It was a pretty busy weekend just before labor day. I ordered a burrito but they made a mistake and brought me veggie enchiladas, the food had taken awhile too. I will say, I'm happy for the mistake because the enchiladas were phenomenal and I'm not a big enchilada fan mind you. Next time, I'm definitely ordering the burrito and expecting that though. My friends ordered tacos and a burrito I think the lamb one, boy their burritos are HUGE!!! We were unfortunately too full for dessert. I like that they have options for vegetarians and vegans too. Overall our food was good with the exception of the burrito arriving not really too hot (which they did reheat and bring back) and the mistake w/my order. Our server was available and around but felt they could've done a better job with clearing the table as we sat with dirty dishes in front of us for awhile. I also did not like when you go to pay, they bring you the electronic device for you to swipe your card at the table and then the server stays with you while you sign and put in the tip. This is kinda uncomfortable I feel and puts pressure on the customer at that point. Due to some of these experiences I'm giving them a 3 but I will say the food was a 4! Definitely will be back again.

1uO6VUxR66850awuGyVlsw.text: Mediocre for a taco Tuesday, with subpar service. Definitely try the elote. The presentation of the food is good but the taste doesn't match.

HkTY4RZAZoHt7e_rnF9Zqw.text: We were quoted 15-25 min wait for a table.  But it was only about 10.  We ordered margaritas from the bar and the mango one w sucker is AMAZING.  BUT AFTER THAT IT WAS ALL AN EPIC FAIL.  SERVER CAME OVER AND WE ORDERED QUESO. we talked about adding chorizo.   And after that we waited about 20 min.  No visit from server and no queso.  Finally got up and just asked for our check bc we were hungry and over waiting.  Suddenly server showed up as if she had been gone 5 min and asked if we were ready to order.  We said we asked for check bc we were tired of waiting for the queso. Her response was. U ordered queso?!?   Wtf.  Yes. You have a handheld and asked if we wanted the chorizo.    She then became defensive when I said it had been 20 min and she hadn't been back. Her reply was she was busy   Paid the tab and left.   Chips/salsa and drinks great.  Service horrible.  No idea about food bc we never ate anything     No Mgr in sight. Would have given zero tip but the handheld auto did 20%.

RbdAZs_uzBLWV-Po-Wpxow.text: I'm really learning to open my mind and take more chances on Mexican restaurants like this instead of dismissing them as inauthentic or unpalatable. Taco Guild takes some basics from south of the border but isn't afraid to take many liberties with them. This can be hit or miss.   I liked the vegetarian tacos.  They were a bit on the sweet side for me so I couldn't imagine having them as an entree, but I would definitely redirect the vegetarians in my life to give it a try. My friend ordered a tamale (stuffed with green chile and cheese), and I was pleased when I had sampled it as well. Nothing that blew my mind, but it was different. In a good way. Just keep in mind their happy hour menu is an entirely different menu than everything else, with each item containing noticeably cheaper and less creative items. This is opposed to having at least some regular offerings at a discount. That feels rather avaricious, but at least you'll feel confident you can enjoy *something* here.   What really impressed me was the salsa--it's surprisingly good. I absolutely adore the habanero variety, even if it had me fronting like I'm not tearing up and burning a little bit inside. Trust me, I love that feeling, and can't wait to torture myself again. Overall I believe Taco Guild keeps things different enough to warrant a return trip, and I'll be sure to stick with the dinner menu next time. In fact, I'm excited on that prospect. If I get dragged in for another HH, however, I will be content.

reIt4XQl0S2nWLNyXkTW_A.text: Taco Guild is a special place bc that's where my main squeeze took me on our first brunch date. Awwwww  Cheese aside- the tacos are YUM! Fresh ingredients and flavors put together by the chef make for interesting and tasty tacos. Love them all!   The guacamole is also a must try! I get the regular but I hear the pineapple one is darn good.   The margaritas are my fav. Both in the rocks and frozen are equally my favorite options.   This time in we brought in my mom visiting from San Antonio, Texas. She had the chicken enchiladas and said they were "Sooooooo good!" She loved the atmosphere!   Taco Guild will forever be our spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 tacos plate with side of rice. Not sure where the rice went....

9IWM0m0NsmyHNkhs63o5bw.text: My girlfriend and I first dined at Taco Guild several years ago and felt kind of neutral about the whole experience. While the church is impossible to forget, I have very little memory of the food itself. Recently, we decided to make a return visit in order to refresh my memory.  Admittedly, I've never really been a fan of corporate concepts. And when you look at Taco Guild from an objective standpoint, that's kind of what this place is. Nevertheless, the idea of converting an old church into a lively restaurant and bar arguably has its charm. Plus, my Mom will be proud at hearing that I attended church for once, since she's been nagging me about it for the last decade. Hey, it might not be Sunday service, but it still counts!  Anyway, there's a spectacular little restaurant making all kinds of positive noise over on Broadway known as Cocina Madrigal. The reason I'm mentioning this is because it happens to be operated by former corporate chef Leo Madrigal, a man who previously had connections with Z'Tejas and Taco Guild. And if you're familiar with Cocina, one of the first things you'll notice is, despite the fact that he's moved on, Leo's fingerprints are still all over this menu. The guacamole options, dessert pies, and even some of the tacos themselves are very similar in style to what you'd find over on Broadway. Taste? Well, that's another story entirely, but I'll get to that in a minute.  The guacamole here steers more towards the pureed consistency. I like my guac to be creamy, but this felt more along the lines of what you'd find at those fast-casual chains that make it in mass bulk for convenience purposes. The fact that it was delivered in less than a minute has me thinking that's probably the case here as well. Street corn tasted fine, but was a bit too soupy compared to what we usually prefer.  Now, as for tacos, it's kind of tricky. I've had incredible bare bones tacos that use nothing other than the meat itself. At the same time, I've experienced some that are unique, inspiring, and delicious as a result. Taco Guild is shooting more for the latter. The cherry steak taco was a notable standout in terms of flavor depth, while their soggy pastor just wasn't really my style. Carnitas and coffee beef were just bland, with the additional ingredients providing minimal help. Please note that they do not provide limes by default, but you can always request them. Unfortunately, by the time our server returned with limes, our tacos were almost gone, defeating their purpose.   For dessert, we opted for their coconut cream pie, which came with some very good cinnamon cream on the side. The coconut itself, however, just didn't have that "pop" that you find in some coconut-style pies. It was fine, but not something I'd ever order again.  Overall, I still think this is a cool place when it comes to atmosphere. Service was very friendly and prices are pretty similar to most joints that are going for this particular type of taco style. If you're a full-blown taco snob, I doubt you'll be blown away. However, in terms of what they're doing here and based on the crowds, they've running a pretty nice operation that most people appear to be very pleased with.  If you haven't been, they're definitely worth checking out. And whenever the tacos slip from my memory again (which they undoubtedly will), perhaps we'll return one day and give them another go around.

PC_-qWooVPjsGvzh3sXOEQ.text: The atmosphere was awesome! The food was very bleh! I was so excited to eat here. The parking was terrible,I felt relieved when we got inside because it is the coolest place.We were seated in a church pew. The food either lacked flavor our had too much flavor it was very inconsistent. Ordered the bacon jalapeno guacamole and it was exactly that, bacon jalapenos and avocado.No flavor no salt no acid in the mixture.It's a fine balance when you make guac and this was just so bland. The tacos were just ok but I've had better from the taco truck at Charlie's. The "chicken" taco was awful, the meat was unidentifiable.I honestly could not tell it was chicken very soft but a weird soft, the shrimp was o.k. small pieces. Pork was o.k.I had hopes for the cherry blue cheese steak but it was a total fail. I get that these are more upscale tacos but you still need to have taco staples, you need the basics not just crazy tacos with a bunch of interesting ingredients.I feel the restaurant has a ton of potential but it's just not there yet. Better quality meat I expected grilled steak and chicken, nice pieces of shrimp for $89.00 for 4 people we left starving because we could not eat the food.I didn't even have liquor.Oh and I ordered the corn it was decent.The rice was bland, the red salsa was good I reminds me of Baja fresh salsa but better.  So, it was a cool place I'd go back for drinks but not the food. Maybe it's because I'm Mexican and I've had tacos all my life but some people say if there aren't people of the same culture as the type of food eating there it's not good. I must say the service was excellent! But still....I'm never eating here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_GpnAtKmmc8gS6Kdy6mh9Q.text: Taco Guild gets points for atmosphere and style but I'm not impressed with their food. These are "gourmet" tacos with lamb and peking duck(cough), but I didn't find them any good for the price. I prefer La Condesa for this type of fancy tacos.  For real street tacos, stick to holes-in-the-wall or stands/trucks. Given that, the old church setting is actually kind of cool and worth a one-time visit.

k_beQ2SA071_FbfmfPn6Jw.text: This is officially a new favorite for date night. Love the ambience of the renovated church setting. Great decor, albeit the space is not huge and the best seating is definitely at the bar. The bartender was fantastic. Didn't catch his name but he's a taller bald guy with lots of tats (everyone has lots of tats there but he'll stand out). Very friendly, interactive, and gave outstanding service. Things move a bit slowly here so go in knowing that this will be a leisurely dinner.  Drinks: order These Boots Are Made for Oaxacan. I'm a tequila girl but rarely like any sort of mix drink...this one was out of this world, 10 out of 10.   Food: build your own burrito and the shrimp and snapper tacos were TO DIE FOR. And definitely worth the wait (the kitchen was allegedly "backed up" but the place wasn't overly busy..) It's satisfying to leave a place, look at each other and say, "every single thing we had was amazing!!"

IElKK-bwN2sOhr4UH8Th5g.text: My husband and I were in town from Colorado to visit our college daughter for her birthday. The hotel we stayed at recommended The Taco Guild. We came for brunch on Sunday. The atmosphere was beyond incredible.  Such a good job was done on preserving the church the restaurant is located in. The stained glass windows are fabulous, the re purposed light fixtures are amazing! When the chips and offering of salsas came they didn't disappoint. There was spicy options for my fire loving Hubby and daughter and more mild yet flavor filled option for me. I ordered the veggie omelet and it was so yummy! The veggies inside went way beyond the regular offering of peppers and mushrooms I usually find. There was asparagus,  thin sliced Brussels sprouts and so much more! I loved the mismatched china, great touch! My family loved their taco combos. I look forward to our next visit to Arizona and the Taco Guild!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stunning stained glass
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great light fixture and stain glass
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome bar area

8-gGhAKssHQUBEwqAC7tng.text: There are too many choices in Phoenix that are better.  I was so excited to go to Taco Guild since it looked like a cool place..  When you walk in, the church vibe of the restaurant was really cool, but that is when our cool experience ended.  Our server was nice, but the food service was so slow. We sat down and immediately ordered since it was just two of us, Food took over an hour for a vegetarian burrito, and when it came out is was average at best, and the side was a bunch of fried veggie things. The salsa was uninspired, and the Guild Duo was not great either. Gallo Blanco has better guacamole. La Contessa's burrito's are far superior.  Then it was insulting that they wanted to give us $5 each to take off our next meal, WHICH DOES NOT ADDRESS THE SLOW SERVICE AN BELOW AVERAGE FOOD ON THIS VISIT. They did take off $10 because we vocalized our displeasure about their offer,  We will probably use the $5 off for a beer, since that we be hard to mess up.

1FhlM-3-H6rxgSpIwGXMJQ.text: It was my first time visiting Taco Guild.  Everything was delicious from the guacamole, margaritas to my Guild chicken burrito.  The service was good and the atmosphere was awesome.  Can't wait to return for my second trip to Taco Guild!

MI-dvStTeHhsaR2Ov9t7vQ.text: Beautiful location although it is hard to find parking at lunch time in the middle of the week.  The menu was small which isn't always a bad thing. They serve you chips and salsa on the house as soon as you sit down.  The salad was actually delicious.  Didn't taste like any other salad I've had before. Didn't try the tacos so cant review on those. I would go again to try the rest of the food. Servers were very nice as well.

PHBC2SsUVkPmrzr42kf93Q.text: Off the charts cool. Atmosphere is unique. Food is wonderful and the staff super friendly. Lots of tequilas as well

BhsTbk2ThTmF-PHydKteqg.text: From start to finish what a great experience. Burrito and Enchiladas were amazing.  Meatball appetizer was incredible. Staff and Management beyond attentive.

MADiayl5Jsy0oQSNE6i-0w.text: Fun atmosphere with very helpful staff. Menu include tequila flights - dependent upon your wallet, street taco - order three and add a side. The tortillas are made the same day -- super fresh and tasty. I tried the pork adovado and shrimp .. the pork was one of the best tacos I have ever had. the shrimp was tasty. Sat at the bar - bartender John.. great attitude and service. only draw back was the marg - only had it frozen on happy hour - would have like it on the rocks at happy hour price ($5) -- having said that - it was a good marg.

NjfwP_C3McH6ya-mjK-oeA.text: I agree with everything that has been said about the stunning interior of this restaurant, but you can't eat the eye candy. Unfortunately the food is sadly lacking. Every good Mexican cook knows soft tacos should be warmed a minute on the grill before stuffing. The sides seem like after thoughts that have not been seriously developed. The house sauces come in 3 small bottles tableside, but it's nearly impossible to get anything out of them. La Condezza on 16th Street with its impressive salsa bar delivers this same concept much better and cheaper.

oJID1LA9WLK6lEkeNUM44A.text: While the food here was pretty good, I felt like it was quite overpriced. The tacos were really small for $4 a pop. We had the lamb, pork, duck and one beef taco. The duck was the best. The meat on the other tacos was dry and lacking flavor. I would probably go back, but only at happy hour prices. Their chips and salsa were actually fantastic and I'm not a big salsa eater. But I actually took it home.

EsVlRqFGdvt5JhibP_WdMA.text: We went last night first time.  Julia did an amazing job explaining the restaurant and the basics on what we ordered.  We were able to order in lettuce wraps to save on the carbs.  Everything was fresh and deliious and great atmosphere

K_dALt_pZCdxxAru7eDzOg.text: One of the very few restaurants in Phoenix that has pleased me. The margaritas are tasty and strong, the tacos are quite delish, and our server Laura was a sweetie pie and attentive. My only complaint: We all thought is was pretty disgusting that there are no doors covering doorways to the bathrooms. Yes, you don't walk directly into the bathroom, but when you are sitting anywhere near the open doorways, which lead to a tiled "bathroom looking" area, it can be enough to turn your stomach. Why not cease the opportunity to place another beautiful and creative piece of woodwork? Come on, Mr. Fox.

KtckE_eO34Barz7GCkjcvg.text: This place is the jam. I was pleasantly surprised from the moment I pulled into the parking lot. The Steak taco with the tempura style poblano was one of the best tacos I've ever had. The guac was legit too. I think this is one of the few guac servings that we weren't able to finish being it was such a heaping pile of goodness. And the frozen margaritas are the way to go, tastes just like the famous Z-tejas margs.

feGTm4GnJhL7GidCePQbUg.text: AWESOME!  The Lamb tacos were to die for, The duck taco totally quackers good, and the bar maids in low cut t shirts were, for a gay guy, totally worth the trip! ;o)

dy1Cf95pq3T5B5-XYAxOGw.text: WOW... just had lunch at the new location on Osborn!  Great food and excellent staff.  Had the Urban Bean Beef and the Duck tacos.  Crazy good!   The interior of the building is outstanding... excellent job of honoring the history of the building.  Taco Guild is now one of the office favorites and we will be back!

dZn-Gs0dAyPoQKNH4SnbZA.text: So lets start at the beginning.  Nestled on the corner of 7th St & Osborn is an old church building that now houses Taco Guild.  The decor and architecture is an amazing mix of new and old so you get an ethereal feeling from the minute you walk in.  Then comes the whole tequila and beer experience!  Nothing like sharing a shot of tequila and a cold beer on a Thursday night (their happy hour lasts till 7 PM) and feasting on a duo of queso and fresh guacomole infused with jalapenos and bacon.  I honestly didn't know if I would have any room left for dinner, but where there's an amazing taco, there's a way.  The tacos are divided in two groups, Old World and New World, which basically means old-traditional, new-mind blowing.  I had two off the New side, the Yucatan Shrimp (a favorite of the entire table) and my favorite, the lamb with Creole aioli, bleu cheese and sweet potato hay.  I can not wait to take my next group of out of town visitors to this amazing little place and I will ask for Joshua again.  He was knowledgeable, helpful, funny and a great waiter.    PS:  They do not take reservations, however you can call and get put on a wait list.  Its worth it.

mg8GhPENsHWkJjxJ-uxdVA.text: I was brought here by a friend, I was reluctant because I wasnt totally in the mood for mexican.  Boy am I glad they did.    Walk in the large beautiful front door and you walk into a very large room with the bar at the front to worship.  We choose to sit at the bar.  Chips and salsa were pretty good, on par with what you would expect from a mexican joint.    Coctail... I ordered the Gentlemans Agreement, this is a solid drink.  I cant recall exactly what was in it but I can remember being skeptical on how smooth it would be.  I was very pleased.    For the tacos.... hands down the best taco I have eaten was the chipolte steak taco...  I will be back just for these bad boys.    The ambiance was enjoyable, they had a live band that started playing as we were leaving, heard one song and they were pretty good.  Wish we could have stayed longer but had to leave....   Bottom line, if you go here on a Saturday night and have a few too many drinks and sleep in late on sunday, dont worry, you were already at church last night.

IT6ZfDhnMT-NvMhDqLu39A.text: Unbelievable! 5 star experience. Drinks were constantly filled, chips and salsa constantly replenished, salsa was on point. The veggie burrito my girlfriend and I each got was incredible and filling but not very heavy. Our server was brilliant, and out check was under $30. And not to mention this place is ALL atmosphere, what a trip! Can't wait to bring out of town friends here and show them a great phoenix hot spot!

ZvX1jAKb7pCsH3yWwESrNg.text: Went there this weekend and it was a huge disappointment.  The food was so bad I took a couple of bites of the ceviche and a couple of bites of the meatball dish and I couldn't eat anymore it was so bad.  I highly recommend saving your money and going elsewhere.

mudSl4yn0kTEITsGR2nqvQ.text: Lunch date...ambiance great.  After we receive our drinks we are told they are out of beef and pork.  What?  How can you be a taco restaurant and be out of the 2 most popular meats for tacos?  Waitress was spacey and brought only half of my date's order.  Salsa was good...chips over cooked.  Too bad...such a cute place.  Won't be back.

spgxwPvJUiJkAQui3T24hQ.text: very cool place but the food was mediocre at best, i've had better out of a roach coach.

D_14_VpLcrIHNzBFBn5x9Q.text: Awesome experience.  The venue was so cool and historically interesting. Like an old museum.  The food was unique, Interesting and melded yummy flavors. I loved the variety.  My margarita was perfect. I am definitely taking out of town guests here for the experience!

BoSvdFwTw30CPwI0AElCXg.text: Terrific food, great decor but lose the TVs and turn down the music.  The guacamole is superb and no matter what kind of meat you have, it's so tasty.  Today it was too cold inside and the canned music so loud that we had to move outside.  I don't get what the din adds, and I honestly think that the TVs detract from the ambience.  If people want to look at a screen, they probably have their own smart phone.

m2JvINtkWi48XsFvW1MHfg.text: They got this right. We have been on several occasions  including with friends last Friday night and on St. Paddy's day for the corned beef tacos - which were fantastic! The restaurant is located in an old church and the bar so where the altar used to be. The stained glass windows and decorations are unique and interesting. Best of all is the staff and the food. We haven't had anything that we didn't enjoy and we have tried almost all the tacos, appetizers and desserts. Always great service even when they are busy everyone works together and makes you feel welcome.  Can't wait for my next trip back. My husband and sons love to go to learn more about the different types of tequila. The manager, Justin is very knowledgeable and takes the time to explain how they are made and the differences between them. They have a large selection of tequilas and offer passports that you can purchase to try the different tequilas as you learn about them.  My guys all love this place. Definitely number one on our list of places to go eat.

KsZ5vSFjAZEKeWgyLoCyiA.text: Friendly staff, unique location, and awesome food! Have yet to try something I haven't enjoyed! The local farm to table concept and beer are killer!

lEyHBv_JhCiKXwZLdst27Q.text: it was Recommended to us!! by friends,my hunsband and I like to discover new places!! we went for Lunch and loved it!! we are going back this coming sunday!!

qdAnfeM6X6J7XZPfhaIqnw.text: The idea of this spot being in an old church was very appealing and unique. I had my eye on this place for months. Finally went with a coworker for lunch. What a let down. The place is very nice inside but that's where it ends. 2 stars for ambiance. Do not expect real Mexican food. It's all trendy bar food. The beef taco I ordered was greasy. The carnitas were dry. Portions were small and expensive. I will not return but it was nice to see the beautiful interior.

v6CJyvcd-gQPHpdFcfKSIQ.text: Great location.  Awesome setting in a church.  Guacamole was great.   Lamb tacos were amazing.   Burrito was so good.   Drinks are average price but try the frozen margarita, It's really good and strong.     Only reason why I didn't give it a 5 stars, the Spanish rice was undercooked.   It was borderline hard.   But other than that, the food was great and amazing service and I'm full.  Capiche.

7_Gla9PNaCDDkSmAtWpYaA.text: This is a great find! In an old church which the property dates back to the 1880's, the current church building was constructed in the 1940's. Exposed wood beams, original stained glass, eclectic decor, including enlarged copies of Rembrandt's on the upper walls. The huge bar takes the place of the old altar complete with 2 60" tv's that almost appear to be floating above the massive back bar. They squeeze a lot of fresh fruit for their cocktails. I had the Blushing Seniorita.. It was so good I ordered a second;) it's a berry sangria. My husband had 2 craft beers. The tacos are street tacos, so they're small but packed full of flavor! I tried the coffee beef, Peking duck, and shrimp tacos with a side of onion straws. The Peking duck was my fave. My husband had the coffee beef, the chicken, and the al pastor. He enjoyed the coffee beef the best. His side was the corn off the cob and he said it was really good. History+good drinks+good food+ atmosphere= cool place ya gotta check out!!! The service at first was a little slow, but the place was packed. We were seated immediately, but it took a bit to order and get our meal. To be expected when its a new place and the place is packed. I know we'll be back again:)

q6HHVe08jq9r8ghz-M6ppQ.text: Excellent Service! Excellent atmosphere and of course Excellent food! I went to this restaurant for the first time last night and i knew i would like it from the moment i walked in. The manager on the floor was very accommodating and so was our server.  They placed a generous amount of chips and salsa on the table and we indulged in the ceviche of the day (which was the bomb. com. ) I tried the lamb taco and a side of if i remember right habanero corn. YUM! The history of the restaurant was very intriguing. Also they have 100+ tequilas on hand and a jukebox with 3 million songs on it! If you are looking for a good crowd, good vibes,and  good food this is the place to stop by!

hGWPx9ib4wV5wA3L2y1rXQ.text: I went to Taco Guild for my birthday, and the food was absolutely wonderful.  They have a simple menu, but what they have is exceptional!  I am a bit of a guacamole snob, and theres is the best I have tasted anywhere, period.  The server, Jesse, was exceptional, friendly, and made sure everything was up to par.  One of the owners came over, introduced herself, and was very friendly.  The service was just to the point that you weren't annoyed with them constantly checking on you (face it, we all know what that's like), but checked enough to be sure we were completely comfortable. (and full!).  The restaraunt is near downtown (ish), so it isn't a long trip.  Service was fast too.  They took an old church and made a restaraunt that is functional and works.  Stained glass windows, and even have old church buletins on one wall.  I will be going back.

ydnMc2ZjYi6zZuHqliNByw.text: We had a fun date night here. Cool space good atmosphere. A bit on the loud side. Our drinks were tasty and we really enjoyed the tacos. Our dessert was not special, and this is coming from a girl who will eat anything dessert wise. I would skip next time.

NMxijgGODGW5DUzXzureOg.text: Great old building. Beautiful stained glass. Food was good - interesting pairings. The tacos were small but filling. The guac is fantastic. Waiter was very rude to a person in our party. Overall - fun place to lunch. Will I return. Meh. Maybe.

BLM5BisZMoTkgyEoZ3I8wA.text: My only thought about Taco Guild is that is it not worth it.  I love tacos, so it's safe to  say I was looking forward to trying this place.  Now I'd like to make it clear that my star total is strictly for the food.  The service, the decor and the ambiance are wonderful.  This place is beautiful and everyone was super friendly.  I will go back just because the experience was awesome, but I won't be the one suggesting it, because of the food.  The food was alright, but not outstanding.  I do like the options.  They have a duck taco and a lamb taco.  So that's fun.  However, the tacos were small.  For $4-$5 a taco, two should fill me up.  And you don't get a free side unless you buy 3 tacos, otherwise they run about $2.50.  I had a side of rice which probably wouldn't have filled up my hand.  I get that they are quality local ingredients, but I feel like the markup is a little ridiculous.  If you have a large appetite and a small budget, I DO NOT recommend Taco Guild.  Being that we live in Arizona, there are MANY other taco options around.  If you do go, go for the building.  It is really lovely.

kZdwil6UbVahWcI_xUsytA.text: Wow what a great restaurant! I was visiting friends for weekend and we went to the Taco Guild for lunch Saturday.  I love what they have done with this historical church.  Fabulous bar, spacious restaurant seating area, good acoustics and the decor is great.  Whitney was our server and she could not have been more helpful and friendly.  Once we poured over the menu, loved everything we ordered.  Grilled romaine salad knocked it out of the park!  Coffee marinated beef taco was beautifully prepared and huge portion of meat that was tender and great flavor profile.  We also devoured the roasted corn.  Thank you Whitney for the wonderful service!  Can't wait to come back!

qNAaTQdoGYTuOblNLh9K8g.text: To start off with the building is ultra cool being in an old church with the stained glass windows still intact and all.  They have an extensive tequila list and also feature local craft brews from Cartel, Papago, Four Peaks, etc.  The portions of guacamole were large enough for a group of 4.  Very interesting mix of tacos to choose from from lamb with blue cheese to peking duck. Prices were fair and service was excellent. Could turn into a new regular place for us.

t2hh6tdv9rNSRqF8rijnvw.text: Sometimes the third time is the charm but not this time. This time it is 3 strikes and    you're out.  I want so badly to like this place but the food is so bland and disappointing !!!  The service is good- great atmosphere. Please ,someone, show them how to add flavor to their food !!

osTRDWFZ1_5tNPd6GJPHug.text: I was so excited to go to Taco Guild. A couple of friends had good things to say and I was eager to see how the Church had been turned into a restaurant. I was a little concerned with the 3 star rating in Yelp. The restaurant was really nice inside and out. I love that they kept the stained glass. To start off with it took about 10 minutes for our server, she blamed the long wait in another table. As an starter we had the Handmade Guacamole, it was super bland. It seems to be really basic onion, a little tomato and the avocado. We tried adding some salt and pepper, it didn't help. My husband doesn't like a lot of spiciness, when we asked for a recommendation the reply was "everything has a kick." I tried three tacos and received a free side. The Yucatan Shrimp was only ok. The Peking Duck was bad, the duck was very dry and the taco was over powered by the Apricot compote. The Thai Snapper was good, really small for the size. Tacos for $4.95 not again for us. The best thing I had tonight was the Pacifico, maybe I should have had more than one.

u87dU7P3fpTJw_rvGxQRuw.text: Found this place on accident. Never heard of it . Was meeting a friend in the area and had time to kill. Went to Starbucks to wait them out. Noticed all these people walking in and out of the building next door. Called my friend to meet me there. So glad I found it. It was delicious. A little pricey at $4.25 par taco but if you get three you get a free side and it always comes with chips & 4 kinds of salsa. The coffee braised beef, lamb, or Pastor pork are amazing. Never tasted anything like them. Went to work the next day and told everyone about it.

AYUeYsXRHBoSsiR7MWLUlg.text: A friend and I had been wanting to try the tacos so we went at 5 PM on a Friday.  It was Happy Hour (3-6).  We were seated immediately.  We had the guacamole and the 1.99 daily taco to start. Very good.  I also had the fish taco and the lamb taco.  Delicious.  The venue in the old church is so charming.  The stain glass is beautiful.  Service was very good. Pricing was moderate but the food was worth every $$.  I plan to go again and bring more friends.

0HHu2LDnpfz9SHoe-a2HNg.text: This was my first time eating here and it was fantastic. I will definitely be back to try more tacos and possibly the whole menu. Yea, that's how good it is. The service was great and the atmosphere is perfect for groups and dates.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street corn and a beef and lamb taco.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wall art

Z1t6Ow9ZPKgOjNLkHaxgJg.text: It's hard not to be instantly impressed with Taco Guild, with its beautiful placement inside an old church which they left tastefully in its original form. The food was as inspiring as the surroundings, with some of the best tequila and margarita drinks that Jesus ever transformed from water. The complimentary chips met all of my expectations of crisp and fresh chips, and the diverse mix of salsas that accompanied them were fresh and tasty (my chips were a bit over-salted though according to my blood pressure readings).  It was tough to settle on food choices, but I chose the scallop and shrimp ceviche, the cherry beef taco, and the Pork Al Pastor taco. Three solid choices. The ceviche was beautiful and perfectly seasoned with cilantro and onion, served alongside ridiculously addictive chips. The tacos were both great choices, but I will have to say that the cherry beef topped with bleu cheese was probably the single best item I enjoyed on my Phoenix Mexican gourmet tour.  The service was excellent and very attentive. I do believe Jesus is calling me to come back to this church again.

fQL73HfyqzzMq6OMMKvWow.text: Great ambiance, friendly & efficient staff, food was very underwhelming. I ordered tacos and my husband had the grilled steak burrito. We both had a side of their rice; which was dry & tasted like it had been sitting in a pot for some time.. the cherry steak taco was an interesting flavor with the blue cheese, but the pork tacos & steak burrito we're lacking any kind of spice or flavor. Texture of the meat also tasted like it had been in a pot all day.. when I first walked in I was so impressed with the beautiful restaurant- then when the food comes out 5 min later - you can tell it wasn't cooked to order. If u are looking for fast & mediocre, then this is the place! Prob won't be back unless it was for happy hour drinks.

heFd4s74hibbwcYpFmjXmQ.text: 5 stars for the atmosphere and decor & 3 stars for the tacos and appetizers  I will definitely come back for drinks/happy hour, but won't eat here again.  The service was friendly, but nothing that stood out.  This place has so much potential, so hopefully they'll step it up with the food.

RPv4U3xn5zVs_dMu_Xao2g.text: I used to love this place tell they went crazy high with some prices changes. Like the socializer it went from 6-9$

5LbgfEbHa3wemdgOwTzNAg.text: I was drawn to this place because of the historical building and quite frankly, that's where the quality started and ended for my husband and I.   Service was very disjointed and food was average at best. I was particularly disappointed in my 8.00 cocktail which was their take on a Salty Dog (one of my favs) that tasted like watered down grapefruit juice from a mix. Other flavors promised were nowhere to be found.  They advertise using local farms... How about some Fresh squeezed juice?  Probably won't be back. I'd drive to Mexico first.

hokPGHkaqRnQumFSosRV6g.text: We have a party of 16 with reservations for a big table on the front portion of the building. The server wouldn't seat is until our entire party arrived. So we had 10-14 people standing around in the entrance and crowding the bar with servers getting annoyed that we were in their way. Patrons appeared disturbed as well to have so many people hovering over the bar and crowding the walkways. Had trouble getting a drink at the bar. Not a very intelligent seating policy. Bad start to a hipster dinner.

FqanmjoxMkZYr-k284hzLw.text: Great atmosphere for tasty Mexican grub. Be sure to try their duck and lamb tacos...outstanding! Chips and salsa are very yummy, and they make a few great cocktails as well. This place can fill up fast; sometimes it's best to go at an off-peak time to avoid congestion. Staff is friendly and speedy.

Ns_uFDD7q91xyYJv-u2d8w.text: And her name is Dulce. Wonderful service, fast friendly and nice. The food is always good and you can cross off going to church as you eat tacos on your to do list. Thank you Garth and Jason for offering one of the best places in Phoenix to eat.

ZGvh0tGi0vHED3ZlrXsJww.text: Delicious elote!! And great hot sauce selection. I came for a weekday lunch and got the taco platter. It was amazing. They are very popular and it's a small parking lot so be prepared to park across the street or need to wait to be seated. But it's definitely worth it.

DHhy5v4MMKfQ-STPPE4EPg.text: The minute you walk in the door, you know you're exactly where you want to be. Amazing historic decor, tacos, daily specials on a hymn board... All senses engaged.   I appreciate their inclusion of both old world and new world tacos. I recommend trying one from each camp: duck for the new, coffee-braised beef for the old. Duck was slightly too sweet, but not a deal breaker. Beef could use more jicama crunch, but no complaints in the flavor. Mmmm.   The corn LOOKED amazing, but I wasn't hungry enough to get it. Definitely will next time.   My cocktail was decent, but the waitress didn't have enough knowledge of the menu to guide me toward the best option for me. If you're going to drink, opt for the craft beer or straight tequila instead.   Taco Guild is holy ground indeed. A Phoenix must!

mWCfhOUhL9tr02dPrrp3sw.text: This place is amazing. They took an old church and breathed new life into it by turning it into a great architectural space that makes incredible tacos and salads. Tacos are "street" sized and can be purchased a la carte for about $4 each.  They are smaller tortilla about 5" in diameter.  I've had the shrimp and the pork tacos and their flavor was unique and delicious!  Even the complimentary chips served with four different kinds of salsas bring do much flavor and variety.  I have found religion at The Taco Guild!

AFEiDBM2NyelveoqsoUJnQ.text: Came just for food after the Fiesta Bowl parade the tacos were honestly not that great especially for the price. The service was decent. I would not recommend coming just for tacos maybe if I was here for the bar it might be different.

WZC_twojuBbhSEpWXQFP5A.text: Fun place with good food - especially the street corn. Unfortunately, the last few times we went the wait for a table was really long, so plan accordingly. The tacos aren't very filling, but you can definitely fill up on the amazing salsa and queso.

-PvdJbCFR12DhzKHscYe0Q.text: While waiting for service on my motorcar a few blocks away, I stumbled across a historic church bldg dating back to 189something that was converted into a restaurant, specializing in unique and equally tasty tacos like "thai coconut curry red snapper." Among an otherwise ubiquitous landscape of corporate empires, a unique find indeed. Why not 5 stars? They forgot to give me a place setting (fork and knife). Otherwise great service.

Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xQ3Oj1Csr7Jr3cidnwk5zQ.text: Great atmosphere, sneaky amazing date spot and tacos that will knock your fancy socks off for sure. Drinks get you going, food makes you want to come back sooner than later.

SOIuvAQvbKODlv2i0kiZlA.text: Great chips and salsa, free, and the bowl of chicken soup was the best. Great kick to it and loaded with shredded chicken, I mean loaded. It was a meal.

DScW71tOP-8z5v5qDDQOKw.text: As many have said, the decor is amazing.  But Taco Guild implies expertise in tacos. It brings pain to say, because hopes were high, that the tacos are not great. - Shrimp taco: the amount of sodium in this taco was such that I couldn't taste anything else. - Snapper taco: although the snapper was dry, the flavor was actually pretty good. If Thai curry were to be a taco, this is the one. - Veggie taco: this was probably the most confusing...and sad. It was listed in their "old world" taco section. I took this to mean that this was going to be standard southwestern flavor.  Nope. Soggy Brussels sprouts, tomatoes, cheese, and...guacamole? Why?!? I love Brussels sprouts. Taco version was horrifying. -Pork tacos: flavor was, for the most part, absent. Meat was dry.  Overall...sad times.

z3Tq8OiXVHi-BThvoVHtXg.text: If you're ever in the neighborhood on Tuesday please be sure to stop by and enjoy their fabulous Tuesday tacos. Good selection of beef, shrimp and chicken tacos. Great atmosphere with friendly service.

DCDSC0D-WRFIMnSKB3Cb0g.text: Taco Guild is not my type of church. Yea, the theme and the concept is kinda cool, but the layout was off and it was so loud during lunch that I couldn't even hear the person next to me. It got really busy and there was a group that wasn't attended to at the host stand so they were just looking for a table to sit - which they decided to sit at one of the long tables where two people were already dining at. Very unorganized. Service was mediocre. Food was not that great. I had guacamole and chips, the Mexican corn and the taco trio plate: duck, shrimp and Ono.I took one bite of each of the tacos and corn and only could consume all of the shrimp taco. Corn was drenched with mayo and the Ono and duck taco were bland. Guacamole was ok, salsa I liked. Overall, I probably will not be going to this church anymore.

DrBoMIM_BBnqoEbE3x60ag.text: Downhill over the past 2 years. Patrons dont matter. So long to the epic staff, and awesome management.  When scouting business lunch locations,  this one can be nixed

GsNsjy_bZ7jjpNiLs48mWw.text: This was my first time into Taco Guild and I was very impressed. My girlfriend and I went during happy hour and started with the Duo appetizer which had guacamole and green Chile queso dip. After trying the appetizers, I told my girlfriend that I wouldn't mind coming here again in the near future. Then our tacos came out.  We ordered the carne asada, shrimp, sweet potato, and chicken tacos. All of the tacos were phenomenal and I was particularly impressed with the quality of the tortillas. Looking forward to coming back and trying some of the specialty cocktails.

ii5F8mwiF1LvZ3eaafWu-g.text: We went for a late dinner. We ordered happy hour tacos on a lettuce and pot roast soup. The tacos was a take on left over Thanksgiving dinner. Since we try to avoid fried food, they were able to substitute it with pulled pork. The gravy was bland but the hot sauce gave it a good kick. As for the soup, it was really good. The service is always top knotch.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thanksgiving Tacos, fried turkey but sub with pulled chicken, mashed potato &amp; gravy

9wZZws7pjVwqsQN4obU9Pw.text: Just got done having lunch there.  Two favorite tacos were the Ono and the Cherry Beef.  If you are reading this review......stop and go to this place!!  Great food and the old church just adds to it.  A new favorite and glad we decided to eat there.

RFRL95gqaOCWl1C_wNJWAg.text: Possibly the best tacos in Phoenix. It's located in what used to be a church and there's a bar that takes up practically an entire wall. Has a very cool vibe to it. Everyone I know raves about it

byZvasFgHEwC97xGxsaV1Q.text: I personally think they have the best tacos in town.  I recommend the cherry beef tacos.  I know it sounds weird but they rock!  The bar is awesome, the place used to be one of the oldest churches in Phoenix.  Even if the food wasn't good (It is great!), the place is totally worth checking out due to the historic value of it.  I also like the salsas they give you, you get three different ones with your chips.  I like the hot one so much, I order a container to go when I go there.

JnhtdkKidD49a7LdataxHg.text: Food is decent but the margaritas are amazing. It is a little pricy for me to want to go there all the time but it is fun every now and then

UQlWLwzxN0zxTHKMRhUVzA.text: Man, I really wanted to love this place. The building is neat, the decor is super cool, but the tacos were just 'meh.' I'm always extra disappointed when Mexican food comes out bland -- so many different flavor possibilities, but this just fell flat for me.

9Ota5iBuLJ5CGTlLUzKWPg.text: The venue itself is aesthetically pleasing, I wasn't sure what to expect of the church-turned-restaurant idea, but it was nicely done.   As for the food. I'll start with the good -- tacos off the menu (my shrimp taco and my friend's coffee-braised-beef) were delicious. A little bland, but their give chips/salsa with various salsas that helped add a nice little kick. I also got street corn, which they drizzle/slather jalepeno mayo and cotija cheese on. It was amazing, I ate every last bite of it. I have to take a star off though because the daily taco (chicken with a jalepeno marinade) and tres leches cake was not impressive. Daily taco I can understand, it was a $2 deal at happy hour. And salsas helped make it pretty good. But the tres leches cake was more dry than it should have been. It did have a nice mango topping though!  I sat at the bar and had excellent service. My receipt said my server was Eric -- thanks for taking good care of us! Everything came out quickly and our drinks were quickly refilled :)  Oh and parking isn't the easiest -- the lot gets packed and has some reserved spots for Buffalo Exchange nearby. There is street parking nearby. I drove around the lot twice and found a spot that (thankfully) wasn't reserved by buffalo exchange.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tres leches cake

GsPRf16FNjteiXCTIkhEVQ.text: Came over for lunch.  I had the breakfast plate which is def pass on, nothing special.   The trio taco plate was super popular.  I'd def get that with beer.  Great place to hang out!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The other side of the inside.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Original stained glass windows.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The inside.

mXnfV7i0nlbZt3XBHZqaqw.text: What can I possibly say about Taco Guild that hasn't been said?! The menu is insane and there are so many options that its hard to narrow down to just three! I've been here just enough times to try nearly all, and I have yet to be disappointed. What I fell in love with the most was their street corn. BEST. STREET. CORN. EVER! It has a lot of heat, but the sweetness of the corn makes it so worth every bite. I also love that their drinks don't feel skimped on the alcohol and I can leave with a good buzz after two and a very happy and full stomach.  The service here is incredible as well. The first time I visited, I sat at the bar, and the gentleman was sure to take his time with us, and really personalized our service. It made me come again, and again. Each time, my waiter/waitress has made our meals really awesome experiences. There is also live music, though I have to admit, nothing has been able to compare to the first time I went and there was a gentleman singing with his guitar, I swear I fell in love.  Thanks for the great atmosphere Taco Guild, I'm sure I'll be seeing you again soon!

q9jn7dD9F5Bq5bpw18ilRw.text: Love the veggie tacos with hummus and of course the chips & Salsa!! This place is cool. Artsy, yummy, good music

KKm6kTBUQYym2KmCSjF4PQ.text: If you're ever in Pheonix you gotta try Taco Guild! It's a pretty unique resturant that has settled in to an old church building built back in the 40's. The atmosphere, however, almost seems to take you back to a modernized version of the middle ages. My group and I decided to sit in the outside patio area to enjoy the embracing hug of Arizona's dry heat.   The menu choices, which all seemd to be original creations, had a sense of foreign familiarity. I chose to order the Taco Plate which allows me the option of 3 tacos and a side. My choices were (from left to right) the Chipotle Cherry Steak, the Tropical Ono, and the Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef. (Each were satisfying in their own way, as I'll explain in more detail below.)   The Chipotle Cherry Steak, which contained poblano straws, chili aioli, and Bleu Cheese, was amazingly flavored packed! If flavors were colors I was definitely chowing down a rainbow. Now I'm dedinitely not a fan of Bleu Cheese, but the combination of flavors gave it a homey feel, and for the first time in my life I can say that I enjoyed the strong aromatic taste of Bleu Cheese. Overall, this taco kind of had a BBQ sauce ambiance about it (despite the fact that it did not have traditional BBQ sauce) which caused me to be more critical, since I'm a BBQ sauce fanatic. That being said, I rate it with a 7.5 out of 10.  The second taco I tried was the Tropical Ono. Ono, also known as Wahoo, is a fish closely related to King Mackerel and is found in tropical waters, especially around Hawaii. Although this fish is commonly know by the name Wahoo, the Hawaiians called it Ono, which means, "sweet, very good to eat". And "very good" it was! The Ono was lightly breaded and a wonderful crispness to it. With menonita cheese, roasted tomato salsa, coconut slaw, mango, tomato, and cilantro, this taco was definitely the freshest tasting of the three. The taco did have a sweetness about it, especially due to the mango and coconut, but it was balanced with the right amount of saltiness from the fish. Overall I give this taco an 8.  I was the most hesitatant about the third taco, mainly due to the fact that I don't like coffee, but I gave it a go anyway! This taco came topped with caramelized onion, mango jicama relish, and Cotija cheese. When I took my first bite, I immediately knew that this was my favorite of the three. It was the taco that surprised me the most! Although, I did taste the coffee flavor and it's bitterness, it was beautifully balanced with the sweetness of the carmelized onions and relish. The braised beef was shredded and perfectly tender. Overall, this taco was a surprising win for me. I honestly didn't think I was going to like this one so much, and so have to rate it a 9 out of 10! Definitely a must try.  Lastly, I finished my meal by eating their famous street corn. It's a grilled corn on the cob with habanero butter, Chipotle mayonnaise, and Cotija cheese. This corn was a combo of sweet and spicy, but not an unbearable spice, despite the fact that it contains habanero. It was more of a "tickle the back of your throat" spice. I would totally recommend this as your side if you come here.   So, in conclusion, if you're ever in Pheonix, this is a MUST try place! These options I tried were definitely not the only options, and I guarantee there are others just as good or even better. Go check it out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My first experience at Taco Guild and definitely won&#39;t be my last!

ZfcHvet96Q3K-Na3VqWImg.text: This place is awesome. Amazing space, bar is gorgeous, bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly. We ordered one of every taco. Every one left you wanting more!   Drinks, food, service and ambience were all 5 stars!

oqqJnqL665ayFXQs6SpZYA.text: Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  Really, pleasantly surprised with this place.  I had heard that the atmosphere would be cool (which it is, stunningly nice, even), but not to expect your traditional Mexican fare.  Armed with that knowledge, came in with no expectations and left very full and quite happy.  We started with the Guild Duo of their guacamole and green chile queso.  Both were good, but not amazing.  I would say the tableside guacamole at The Mission is a superior guacamole, but this one is just fine.  The green chile queso lacked a little green chile punch, but I would still order it again based on my love for melted cheese and chips.  The ceviche comes with an order of what are basically totopos - deep fried tortillas, and the are delicious.  A little over-seasoned on this trip, but hard not to like in any situation.  The ceviche was a shrimp and scallop ceviche and it was good.  Not great, but good.  Could have stood to have a little more acidity but it is a dish I would order again.  As for the star of the show.  Ordered the Taco Plate which comes with 3 tacos and your choice of a side.  I was getting full so I ordered the side salad, which was great.  I couldn't help myself, at heart I'm a taco purist, so I went with two Old World tacos and one New School taco.  The Old World tacos were the pork adovada and the coffee braised beef.  The new School taco was a Yucatan shrimp.  They were all tasty.  The braised beef was well braised, juices dripping from it.  I was the coffee would be overpowering but it was not - well balanced taco.  The adovada was similarly balanced between some heat in the meat with the mango relish on top.  The shrimp taco was perhaps my favorite.  Los of tender shrimp with some avocado - it was subtle, mildly flavored, and very well executed.  So again, don't come expecting street tacos.  This is elevated Mexican with some additional pizzazz.  Together with he friendly service and the setting - it's worth the trip to this old church.

Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elote
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side salad

y1p6WDOK9kIkM9QwKNelHA.text: I love, love, love their happy hour.  They have a very generous happy hour time.  It goes until 7p.m.  Their margaritas are delicious and only $5 during HH. The daily taco is only $1.99 during HH, that is the only HH food.  I used to not like corn, but now I am addicted to their street corn. The salsas that come with the chips are great, most are super spicy for me, but my husband loved them. First time I was here, it was with our International Supper Club.  Now I come with my husband a few times for they amazing HH.   The place is very cool, I haven't been to a church in ages, but  I will come to this one anytime.  Parking is a little tough, you might have to find some parking around the corner on the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street corn and daily taco

lSAC036IfzNHE_WZl0xDdg.text: Taco guild was amazing! Everything was as I had expected! Atmosphere was nice and our server was pleasant. I sat at the bar with my boyfriend and ordered a few margaritas along with some tacos and appetizers. The guacamole was great and the chips were nice and crispy. The tacos amazing! The corn tortillas were made To perfection it was light and and airy so it did not overwhelm the overall taste of the taco. My favorite was the beef chorizo at only $2,50 during happy our and the street corn with chipotle mayo was bomb! We also ordered ceviche which to me lacked a little bit of salt and lime. I also like my ceviche well diced and the small shill came as a whole so that was the downside. My favorite margarita was the 1893 at $6 during happy hour.  The price value was good for the quality food you get, differently worth the trip! Everything was fresh and tasty or the most part! :)

i8r6l8SGjw8qPqJOXOyY8Q.text: Please serve normal tacos, tks. I will not add more details yelp.

wMEXjVQTmDXNGAh8hPY8Lw.text: My husband and I absolutely love this restaurant. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is unique and fun. I don't live in Phoenix anymore so it's hard to get over there, but anytime we're in town, we try to stop in. The Chipotle Cherry Steak taco is absolutely TO DIE FOR, PEEPS. If I could sing it from on top of a mountain, I would.

Jd9Y-t1YT4H9W-Tth4bc-A.text: I went here for an outing with my coworkers and I was really disappointed... to start off, the music was way too loud. We couldn't even hear each other and we were all at the same table. Then, there was an immovable center piece in our table so for me to see half of my coworkers I had to practically get off of my chair. Then came the food... I ordered the guild chicken tacos. I noticed right away that it was very salty, and after asking my friends (I had to practically yell) I found that their food was too salty for them as well.   The food is way too overpriced for it to not even taste good and the atmosphere was disappointing.   The only good things were the margaritas and the service! Our server was prompt and helpful.

WrnaueNKxdY0f5ViWUc6-g.text: I love the guacamole and queso app. You get both for $9 bucks. So you don't have to pick   They have four different salsas to pick from. Ranging for mild to fire. I love the tacos and burritos also. During the weekend they even have brunch. I highly recommend taco guild. The service is great , food is amazing and it's in a old church! Haha

evfeTs4H82w6mzcB5XfsNg.text: Best tacos I've ever had! Get the ones with mango on it. Cool atmosphere too. I also had the burrito and it was good too. We went on a Thursday night and had no wait but I've heard there can be long waits on the weekend.

PqWO2fKEjP5P_iXwBKCqKw.text: I liked the happy hour, daily tacos were good. The pecking duck taco was alright. I think I'll have to try the pork tacos next time:)

gkKdnitwpvIB1D11cgjl9A.text: I love Taco Guild!  First of all you're in an incredibly cool, older remodeled church. Instead of gutting it out and starting fresh they went along with the theme. Stain glass and everything.   The tacos are amazing. You have a few to pick from and you can't really go wrong. I typically will get about 2 tacos. With that and chips it's more than enough to feel 100% satisfied.   The servers are great and the atmosphere is relaxed. This is the place I go to whenever I have people in town. There are a ton of cool places to eat in Phoenix. But, this for sure is one of my top 10.  I use it to show off how cool Phoenix can actually be. If you want great food and a cool experience do yourself a favor and check this place out.

hhAM7HYBPy-cs8Z3v7vCzQ.text: Came here for brunch with some friends - food is solid and service is good.

12qXUD6-rC4bW47kQq0Fiw.text: I had high hopes with only a little concern about some of the less than stellar reviews. However I was a bit disappointed. Came here for a date night with my husband on the recommendation of my masseuse. The service was fine, despite being busy. And I have to agree with the reviewer that said their salsa and chips are great. That ends there. The tacos had a good amount of meat, certainly filling and the corn tortillas were soft and good. However the meat was a tad dry (with the exception of the lamb) and not super flavorful. Additionally, my margarita was good and not too sweet, but the actual volume of the drink was small and mostly ice which was disappointing. Overall an okay place with a neat atmosphere and service, but the tacos and drinks leave a bit to be desired.

EVNYLLOFsbj31uUYsJDgrw.text: This place was the first place we hit when we got to Phoenix. This place is pretty amazing. It is a converted church and it is definitely a unique place to eat. It gets 4 stars only because I was really looking for some authentic carne asada tacos and sadly there weren't any. What we did get though was something amazing. I got the the al pastor and pork tacos. They were good. My girlfriend got the chipotle cherry steak and those were amazing. I would definitely recommend.

bVt3my0nIJs4jANwCvod4w.text: Not a big fan. The tacos are way to generic tasting and I didn't care for the guacamole. The location is interesting and I can appreciate it but the food isn't up to par.

chb41cJnsxKq3kpNv4P-0A.text: I have to say taco guild is a must stop when in Phoenix. The inside is so charming I love it!   Had a lunch date with my son here I was really craving some tacos! I ordered the taco plate with the chicken taco, shrimp, and steak. They have specific names but I already forgot sorry guys! However, the best one was the steak one I think it was like a cherry steak concoction. I do have to say the food is a little too bland for my taste. The rice lacked a lot of flavor and so did the tacos.   Our waitress wasn't very attentive I had to flag her down for a refill of my water after waiting 15+ min to spot her. It wasn't busy either so I was a little confused as to where she was. It took longer to get my check and pay for my food than it took for us to finish our meals :(   I do have the say the chips and salsa were amazing. And the host at the door was amazing. He was very welcoming! All in all it's a cute place maybe next time I will just do happy hour. I would love to try their drinks and maybe a different dish

C17do2YrFnPMKCUGF31IzQ.text: Great service. Great tacos. In an old church...looks really cool. Also! The band was amazing.

XeuE4N7xBfBHzZL5Dzbb7g.text: I really wanted to like this place. Unfortunately, that's now how it worked out. I have to start by saying, the two stars are for the service. My waitress was great. She was very sweet, and she was attentive. Also, the young lady who walked me to my table was an absolute doll!! She really wanted to make sure I was happy where I was seated and it showed.       Now for the food, EXTREMELY overpriced, very small portions, and not very good at all. I got the Queso dip to start. The dip was ok at best. The portion was VERY small. I got three tiny tortillas to dip with. Those were pretty good, but the dip had a dark flavor that I really didn't like.       For the main course I got the three taco plate. I had the pork, the duck, and the beef tacos. When they arrived they were TINY like street tacos. When you're charging almost $5 per taco, they should be three times that size. My total for the night was $27, for three really small tacos and a small portion of dip. I can go to the Beach House on Camelback and get three large fish tacos that are fantastic for $6 total.      The tacos were really not good. Just not much flavor to any of them. This is what happens when you try to make gourmet tacos and you don't make sure the flavors are top notch. They were a bit mushy, the flavors were not meshing at all. Just not good!      The building was an old church, which is very cool, except for the fact that, it was EXTREMELY LOUD. I couldn't hear the waitress at all, even when she was shouting in my ear.      I won't be back, mostly due to the price and the quality of the food. Waist of money to go here when I can go someplace else and pay $15 dollars and get much better food, and a great deal more of it. So much for Taco Guild.

Uy4UlIF_X24HG6AsCTQmcg.text: Two words best describe this place : Duck Tacos!  That didn't do it for you? Let me try two other words for you : Lamb Tacos! Are you kidding me? Lamb tacos and Duck Tacos? This place is the bomb! I love it here! And the street Corn they serve here is super delicious. I am a fan! Don't ever change.

wnqn_OxjMLQgc9XFMv3riA.text: I love the grilled romaine salad with the grilled steak! ABSOLUTELY DIVINE! The fundido is great for a group! Haven't been disappointed yet! The only complaint is the lack of parking due to your popularity!

8ElL49e262x4KAPG_sxSVQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! My bf took me here and I got the Chipotle Steak tacos and wow, some of the best tacos I've had. The atmosphere is really cool as well. Ran into them at the Taco Festival as well and ran right to their stand. Definitely recommend!

eN5NBscPWFvuh84YD7EZhg.text: My now boyfriend and I went here on our first date. The place is amaizng to look at and the food and drinks are awesome. Only down side is it is so loud in here. They do have live music sometimes which is always a treat. But for a place that is a restaurant  not a bar I shouldn't have to yell for someone to hear me. I could barely hear our server when she spoke. Grear good gorgeous place but just too loud.

XLjGotx4u7YRjG3qPe4wbw.text: Always great food. I am so glad they left many things from when the building was a church. It is very charming. Great patio!

z81D6yuX3bKnykhKQ121PQ.text: Nice Ambience.. Average food.. Below average drinks..  Loved: The street corn and the chips and salsa.  Liked: Vegetable tacos  Did not like: The cocktail "gentlemen's agreement". The drink was nothing but ice cubed. A total waste of 11 bucks.
