0Pt3ib2WYlqXwv6MdTFFJA.text: This place is really cool, and right around the corner from my daughters apartment. It's located in an old church, in an area called Old School. We were in a rush and told the hostess. She found room for us immediately on a crowded Sunday, and relayed the time constraints to our server. The service, food and drink were top notch. The tacos were fresh and fun. I like that you can order just one, or get a selection. Perfect for if you just want a light snack to go with your sangria. Chips and salsa selections plentiful. I can't wait to go back and spend more Sundays in this church of tacos. It's going to be a regular spot when I come to visit.

D5RzxmxRt1SKnkaKtyrlwg.text: First time here.  We will be back. I tried 4 different tacos and liked the Pork al Pastor the best.  Get the corn it is very good.  I will be back for more.

VObOzIKFacZA7u7ax3U4fw.text: Amazing food! Amazing service (great job Madison) I stopped in for lunch today and had a wonderful experience. (Thank you Steven) This restaurant opens Nov. 18th and I can't wait to go back.   I had the guacamole with pineapple and mint, it was very refreshing and a must for AZ warm weather, house salad, and two tacos. I tried the Urban Bean Beef and Thai Snapper. I love coffee and Urban Bean (the local coffee shop next door) so the beef was my favorite of the two. I recommend the Cilantro Dressing on everything.   The decor and ambiance is wonderful, so glad to see that they kept many elements of the old church but it still feels like a restaurant. They have happy hour on both Sat and Sunday which is really nice.   Thanks for a wonderful lunch Taco Guild, I can't say enough great things about my first dining experience! Excited to return and try the Lamb Taco and Ceviche.

elT_iRfq5cRvqzrfa1xsBA.text: Two words. Pork avodado. The most amazing thing I've eaten in a long time. The side of rice was only ok. The chicken guild and lamb tacos were nothing special,  but that pork!!! Amazing! !! A bit loud on a Friday night with the live dj in a small space. . . But that pork is enough to pull a 4 star and I'll be back! !

oGb0dpVCN7oWlhcZgtdUrg.text: Beautiful, beautiful spot. The food was beautifully presented, but lacked flavor. Five stars for ambiance and service, but knocking it down because food taste is very important.

UfhpC4jiHqGbfwBrMr9Dug.text: Met a girlfriend here for dinner. The wait was about 30 mins on a Tuesday night but definitely worth it. This use to be an old church but now a taco joint. They still incorporated some of the church originals in the restaurant, which I personally feel like gives it a lot more charm. Food was fantastic. Try out their guacamole, it is so yummy. The chorizo was yum yum yum! The tacos were larger than I expected so I should have ordered 2 instead of 4 lol. Overall, I had a great experience here and will be back with more friends.

8WB5O-ou2jcHvLw1o7mh4A.text: Enjoyed Sunday lunch here earlier this afternoon. I love the 'Church' presence and how the owners used and added decor to this theme. Tacos were tasty. Servers were nice. I love that this spot isn't too far from home. Taco Guild is a Keeper. Cheers***

Z95FnDf0c1_n36oHcR0Tsw.text: Chips and salsa is reason enough to go here. Tacos were delicious. Unfortunately none of us truly got what we ordered.  No cilantro means no cilantro usually, but at the guild it means extra I guess. 3 of us made small changes to the menu items and none of them were complied with.   Also, refills were non-existent (water or tea).  The poor hostess had to come through with out only refill of tea as we were about to leave. I apparently forgot to ask for iced tea as all we got was warm tea in our cup.  So to recap, chips and flavor of food was awesome. Don't change anything on the menu. Don't expect solid service. Maybe they were busy. Or had an off day.

WeGZRcd8jqaLFRU7E3qxYw.text: So so so good. The church is beautiful, the food is incredible and the wait staff are super knowledgable and fast! My Aunt and I had Kelton, he was so nice, gave great recommendations and knew so much about the place! Felt like we were guests in someone home for real! He recommended the Chipotle Cherry Steak tacos they the BOMB.COM I will def be coming back, thanks Kel!

bd9lEPj4WAWCD2kVBq3kiQ.text: This was a blessing of a meal!  Very delicious food here and I hope they stay in business for a long time. I can't wait to go back for some more delicious margaritas and tacos!

Pvvv_tvOWvbF_ZUInppnqA.text: Another great addition to downtown!!! I love that they use the same kind of tortillas you would find in Mexico. Interesting history in this church. I love how they kept a lot of the original church in the remodel. At this moment I am eating their salsa which is perfect. Spicy but not like you ate the sun. The tacos are Mexico meets urban. Super creative. I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My tacos came out super fast
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ny0I43mVyEEFsWmVE6hMcA.text: Good food, excellent drinks, and great patio  The taco's are interesting and flavourful but not my first pick for upscale taco joint.  The decor is amazing, the patio is really nice for an evening out.

ZGaq1uvWJwvclQSUQa6YUw.text: Okayyyyy first of all, we came here on a Tuesday and ANY respectable taco place would have specials!! But Taco Guild does not. This place should be called "Tequila Guild" (because the selection is vast) and not "Taco Guild" because the selection isn't great. My girlfriend ordered chicken enchiladas and her beans tasted like straight up Hormel chili!! Everything else was really bland.I ordered 3 tacos and was only impressed with the shrimp one. All in all, it's a really cool atmosphere with lack luster food. For the price you pay the quality of food you receive is not adequate

tUUNSZRJf6VA3pc_urI0hQ.text: Place looked beautiful and the food was great. However when we got seated they sat us on a table that looked like it was brought in from the outside and they placed it right in the middle of a walkway. Waiters were having to dodge our table, other guests were having to go around us all the time and when another table got up to leave they stood right behind my boyfriend as he was trying to eat and he got very awkward because one bumped him. It almost felt like we needed to eat and get out quick because of where we were awkwardly sat. I wa a pretty bummed out because we drove all the way from east Mesa to eat there for my boyfriends birthday

xNxKp0wFTBSJE5EHFOsjkQ.text: Had Chicken Lettuce Pico Taco and Beef Lettuce Pico Taco.  Both were flavorless and the beef was 1/2 fat.  That's what happens when you use chuck roast.  Save your money. #NotWorthIt

aL15ffAoSuVTY_c5ZXlU2Q.text: The duck taco is fantastic ! Rebecca is wonderful, she has great energy and makes the experience exceptional!

EyyIpwCl-F9Hh-zk2OMKmA.text: What a great place! The tacos are absolutely delicious and the staff is friendly and accommodating. Fresh ceviche is there for the carb conscious. The enchiladas are very good, but check the sauce for heat-level if you are at all sensitive.  There's live music on the weekends, good but extremely loud.  There is seating on a small side patio and in the former entrance lobby to the old church that mitigates the noise and allows conversation.  Love this place!

l-683Meim-j-xiyrBJIyPw.text: "Take a seat at the bar"...because Selena will be attentive to your every need !Along with a perfect margarita her personslity connects with the customers and that's why i keep coming back along with  the other repeat customers  i have met. Selena always has a smile and excellent customer service .In addition to T.G uniqueness ..Sam and Garth 'Super Rock Star Managers' always through out a  friendly hello when i walk through the door .They Truely care about the guest dining experience . Kelly,Eric snd Adam also top notch bartenders that always cater to the customers .The team there deserves 5 stars ! And Wess opening the doors Truely makes dining there non stop fun . Life does get better when eating ,drinking and meeting all the cool staff at Taco Guild!!!!

tMTiod-83Xto6qexogEueg.text: Where to begin...  The food is phenomenal. We started with the nachos, which were completely different from any nacho I've had before, and now any other nacho is ruined for me. They were amazing.  Moving on to the tacos, Also awesome. They simply can't be beat. I had three; the Cherry Beef (my favorite), Coffee Beef, and the Pork al pastor. If I could have eaten a dozen, I would have.  The old church setting is classy, but casual. The service is top notch.  You can't go wrong here.

KxC48THCku8wwtxUd4tjbQ.text: Went there a few weeks ago, heard so much about it and had to check it out. Love the interior and it has kind of a hip/trendy vibe (without being too much). Really enjoyed the decor.  Had a margarita, some tacos and a side and it was very, very tasty. Do plan on coming back.  The only issue I had that I noticed when I was looking at my online banking, the processing charge on the card I used was 20% more than the receipt, which left me confused (also I tipped with cash instead of on my card). I called the following day and talked to a manager, they said it was charge for the proper amount and wasn't sure why it showed up as a higher charge. Maybe it was because it's a fairly new business or with my bank (BOA), but wasn't completely clear why. When the charge was processed, it was for the proper amount. Not sure why that happened, maybe next time I'll pay in cash...

Ut1l4c7OZiT_nJicncagHA.text: Our plan was to order tacos but our waitress sold us on the grilled salad and it was incredible.  The chips and salsa they serve are delicious and a nice variety.  The atmosphere is great and unique.  You could enjoy a big meal here or just split some appetizers - you can't go wrong.  Service was great and we can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy, refreshing dessert!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The spectacular grilled salad!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa served when you are seated.  Delicious!

3hzy0Yo3ScEpyHZfrw11pA.text: Food is excellent as well as the house margarita with great service, what more can you ask for! We will definitely be back!

7zGMpbXYJehGOIXwIdckSA.text: I love everything about this place.  The charm of it being in an old church is really unique. They have one of the best margaritas in town.food is delicious and unusual. It's one of my go to places with out of town company.

Lh_Uy2wImP9tb-kDImtXjQ.text: We decided to go to this rehabbed church for cinco de mayo.  The atmosphere is so cool with the stained glass windows and mural on the wall.  The bar looks awesome, though we sat in the booth.  That tacos are mostly good.  There were very few that I didn't like.  During happy hour, the taco of the day (that day was pork carnita) is only 2 dollars.  We got 3 tacos (you get 1 free side then and the rice is a must try) and 3 of the happy hour tacos and were stuffed at the end of it.    Like I said the rice is awesome.  Its got more flavor that you typically get, bits of corn also adds to the appeal.  I really liked the pork adovada and the carnita.  The others were decent but not too exciting - shrimp, duck, guild chicken.  A definite must try if only for the scene!

kY8KqPcxbm4OZQEMbcqQBw.text: Was in Phoenix for a night and this was down the street from hotel. Holy hell...this was the first time I've ever eaten at the same place twice in one day. The apps, the tacos, the margaritas, the service at the bar, all top shelf. And a beautiful building.

3EdLZGKahzHjgzCYNFEV8Q.text: Very fun place good food, cool building with the church thing going; I'm really surprised the reviews aren't stronger.  I took a client here while in town and we had a very nice lunch.    Food Solid, I can't remember everything I ordered but 3 tacos is good size order here- everything at least sounded good and everything I had was.

6P24PB2TEU4lZd6GZekOMA.text: Wanna be Pink Taco. Bad service at the bar, the manager explained my friends meal at "beef" even though she is a vegetarian and it wasn't that taco. Juke box is a horrible idea. Had to listen to eminem and heavy metal. They send out meals according to when it's ready and prepared so it doesn't get cold in the back, yet it gets cold because you don't want to be rude and start eating without your company having their food. The place itself is very cute and could be really cool, unfortunately I was let down. Save your money and go to chipotle

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love to cook and try new and up incoming restaurants. Been in the service industry for years

Hphx93gIp2fmxU7FZhtBAA.text: My only disappointment is that I can't give you rave reviews that are original, everything has already been said. What a great place; the staff is friendly, the food delicious and the atmosphere fun. The lamb taco was sublime. This is a neighborhood gem.

ovSaFlGUiw-hfQpBGh-bLA.text: e really liked the atmosphere and how they have kept to the character of the church. Four of us went for lunch on Sunday. The service was ok though we were confused about who our waiter was because it seemed it was someone different all through our time there. Can't say it was great because they didn't even keep  my water glass refilled and when they finally did (after being asked) I didn't get any ice.   We LOVED the salsa that comes with the chips. Just the right blend of flavors and quite unique. It was also nice to have the different sauce bottles of varying heat but really not necessary as we are now addicted to their salsa. We tried five different tacos with mixed reviews. The chicken and the lamb were good, the veggie and the beef were okay and the fish was awful - very fishy tasting. It said it was snapper on the menu but I have never tasted such fishy snapper. My sister had the veggie burro and that was pretty good. The side of rice was so-so but the beans were great. We also had the prickly pear sorbet with berries and liked it.  The owner?/manager was quite friendly as was the staff. This is just a preliminary review as this was our first visit. Since we just bought a house in the neighborhood, I'm sure we'll try them again - if only for the salsa and the beans!

7Q-ZQs8-9x0PDINYj9to-g.text: Super cool! Taco place inside an old Methodist church. Beautiful and classy. All the people that worked there were gorgeous to look at and the food was delicious. We were there on a Friday afternoon for happy hour. Parking is a challenge so be prepared to pay valet or park in the neighborhoods and walk. It shares a parking lot with The Buffalo Exchange thrift shop so it was fun to poke around in there after the meal.  Live music was excellent. We will go back.

GysigdSSiFdASDsQzQjY8Q.text: Tried this place for the first time today and it was an all around great experience!  My fiance and I went during the weekday lunch rush and were seated without any waiting.  First of all, I LOVE the whole feel of the environment.  They did an incredible job of converting the old Korean church into a trendy hangout spot.  The presentation of the bar is really great, and the balance between keeping some of the original features of the building with new accents is spot-on.  Between the 2 of us, we ordered 5 tacos: an al pastor pork, a duck, a snapper, a lamb, and a veggie.  The al pastor was incredibly good!  Probably the best I've had in town.  All of the other ones were also really delicious.  I also love that they have their own sauces that are made in house!  All of their draft beer is local.  My fiance had the Cartel IPA and it was really good!  Food service was quick and all of the staff was super friendly.  We will definitely be coming back here over and over!  There wasn't a single aspect of this place that I didn't enjoy.  5 stars for a job well done!

QAiQJmdS4WmA7S-3YRSIiA.text: Such a great location and the food was really good. We ordered the enchiladas, both beef and chicken. The pineapple margarita and the sangria were amazing to say the least. The only disappointing part about our experience is that the waiter gave the incorrect bill and once it was corrected thought he may have charged the wrong card for the wrong bill. Despite the unorganized pieces, we are likely to go back!

_Z9PPh1r6Ke0r3ryX0G9Mw.text: The Taco Guild is just ok. I really, really wanted to like this place, but the food and service aren't all that great. The building is awesome. Some really cool historical features were kept, and they did a great job with the decor, but unfortunately it doesn't really make up for what they lack in the food and service departments.  My only complaint with the building was it was really loud. The place wasn't half full, and I could barely hear my dining partner.   There wasn't anything exceptionally bad about the service, it just wasn't good. It took them forever to greet us, and then to take our order. Drinks and food took a long time to come  and they switched servers halfway through our meal (which was at like 7:30).   Chips and salsa were good (often a determining factor as to if we go back), but none of the tacos really stood out. The lamb and cherry steak were the only tacos we actually liked. The snapper was awful, and the pastor, coffee braised beef, and duck tacos were mediocre at best. And the sides...I opted for the onion strings and the little lady got the corn.  Both very boring. The only other options were beans or rice (not and).  I like beans and rice, but find both uninspiring by themselves.   I would love to go back to this place, but with so many great places around (including Gadzooks across the street), I don't know how I can justify it. Maybe for drinks one day...

dy01GnZWASWLlkg6-BVhcA.text: Ambiance was pretty cool its an old church turned restaurant. Stained glass is original from when it used to be a church as well as some pews used for seating. I really enjoyed the salsa and the street corn. The tacos were not great sadly. Lacked flavor and were very dry. However their house made corn tortillas were yummy. With some menu modifications it could be great.

1qJIgOmQwIkEkxv4jvvuJQ.text: We have been here several times.  We love the atmosphere (an old church), the food (a modern twist on Mexican), and the service (friendly).   Try going for Happy Hour (they have them on weekends too) - for a great value.

cByS9CGQA7IV0RBLpq2ZEA.text: Good food, good ambiance. Staff is super friendly and helpful.

cVSgkpna7p1UGfJvkbYsyg.text: Very cool how they turned an old Church into a restaurant.  Food is great but don't go if you have a big appetite considering the price of a single taco $4 unless money is not a concern for you :)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old Church turned into a restaurant.

YJdqzYjb7UN1iECSJm0uxg.text: Went there with some friends Nov 16th because their Facebook said it was open. We didn't seeing the big "private party-open Nov 18th" outside. Got the big 'no service' polite hustle out even after pulling up the Facebook page and showing the owner the green "open" on FB. Very sloppy planning!!   Owner reluctantly gave us a $5 chip after that. I gave it to one of my friends that night and I live 2 blocks away. I remember when this was a Korean Methodist church.  Decor: cheap looking 'Christopher Columbus' italian border on the former church's inside. Big plasma tv sets by bar. Bad use of such a amazing space!  Food: friend noticed only soft tacos on menu, no hard. My espn says the goal of this is makin $ not good food.

PiebY_mSktqHLlmDpQqrsA.text: What a killer joint!!!! The place was a visual piece of art, open and bustling with the ever evolving mid town vibe. I would have to say that the music was loud..and I had to holler at our friends...but maybe next time go during the week when live music isnt playing. The tacos and duo queso/guacamole are my recommendations! But my husband was smiling ear to ear over the enchiladas....its five star according to me!! Valet parking and excellent service !!

DYuz1NgtLKGZWhbl2nIbyg.text: This is one of my go-to restaurants for lunch with colleagues.  Highly recommend the guacamole, any of the varieties, but I am a traditionalist.  Love that you can customize your taco choices by picking different varieties.

hLdhEeqincj2R98SXKyLbQ.text: I thoroughly enjoyed the two lunches I have eaten at Taco Guild. The service was excellent, and the ambiance is fun and different from the normal restaurant experience. I recommend getting the three taco plate with a side of street corn. The corn is so delicious. I dream about it long after eating there. The three taco option is fun, because I get to try different things each time. I love the cherry steak and the veggie and the Ono, but all that I've tried have had fun combinations of flavors, and I've really enjoyed them. You will love this place!

4lRW76dLI-AAfsOrq9QJ_w.text: We came here on a Thursday around 6, and it was super packed. The hostess said it was open seating near bar and gestured to the whole area, but didn't differentiate if the high tables still counted. She rudely told us otherwise.   The happy hour drinks were good, as was the street corn. The red beef enchilada wasn't as flavorful as the other reviews said. But the grilled steak burrito was flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef enchilada ;P

lHr2Q9O6HqefmJjrxUXDhQ.text: Extremely disappointed in the host. We sat down and we were not served for about 10 minutes. The host came over to us and asked "have you been served". We said, "no", and then he asked us "do you mind moving to a different table, someone was on the list before you and they just showed up and they wanted a booth because they have a service dog." We said yes to moving, but thought about how we were moved to a different booth, so why not put those people at that booth. As a manager, I would reconsider your host. It was extremely rude of him to ask us to move. He called the people's name and they weren't there so he sat us. I was so excited to bring my family whose from out of town here based upon my previous experience which was a 5 star. I will not return because of the host, the food was delicious. I am shocked the manager didn't come over to us and apologize for the rudeness of the host.

jtS1tW9hx1scYxdcJkZkYQ.text: Saw this place on the travel channel and had to try it while we were in town.  For starters, We had the chorizo deviled eggs which were tooooo die for. That was so delicious, generous slices of flavorful chorizo on top of deviled eggs! So yum!!! The complimentary salsa for the table was good, i must say the salsa was fresh, abundant amount of fresh tortilla chips! I could not stop devouring them. The corn was delicious as well!   Had the duck taco and the lamb taco. I must say both pretty underwhelming. The flavors sounded great on the menu. The duck had a sweet taste to it, i always look for the gamey meat taste that I crave from duck...and the lamb was overloaded with bleu cheese :(   The service was great and the server was super attentive!

kkw8iKQaL3QEALbV64KfFA.text: Taco Guild is awesome, as always. I don't post new reviews every time I go there, but I did want to add a new review to mention one of their new tacos, the Ono Taco.  The menu describes it thusly: "Tropical Ono menonita cheese, roasted-tomato salsa, coconut slaw, mango, tomato, cilantro."  I was not familiar with ono. I found it to be a pleasant, fresh-tasting fish. The Taco Guild grills it. The taco featured a heavy amount of coconut slaw; I'm not a fan of coconut shreds in food, but I really enjoyed this slaw! It had a pleasant crunch without a lot of flavor. I couldn't really taste the cheese, but the mango and tomato complemented things nicely. I'm not sure if I would get this taco again because it's not up to the level of my favorites of lamb and duck, but it's still good. This would be great for folks practicing Lent or wanting a healthier taco.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ono taco
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Romaine salad.

qKYrKUtMIbWDvg77yRncEQ.text: This place is great! Love the chips and salsa! There tacos are yummy too and cute atmosphere inside an old church!

GcwRdkVx9sETqzLRtDA0xA.text: A very unique experience to say the least. I come from Southern California, so I'm kind of picky with my tacos. The tacos are a little pricey, starting $4.50-$5.00 for a street taco. I had the Pork Adovada and the Taco of the Day which was Cod. Both were very delicious and was packed with a lotof flavor. They tacos were filled with meat and toppings and the tortilla is strong enough where it didn't break or get soggy with all this filling.  I could've and would've eaten more, but $4.50 for a taco is still quite pricey, no matter how good the taco is. They also give complimentary chips and a variety of salsa.  The interior is actually really cool. From the outside, it looks like a church, and they preserved some of the insides to look like a church from stained glass windows to redesigning the alter/tabernacle area to a bar. Lots of history behind the building, if you're into that sort of stuff. I was really surprised. I was a little skeptical of purchasing a $5.00 taco but it was all good in the end. Probably wouldn't  eat here on the daily because of it's hefty price tag, but definitely worth trying if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Adovada &amp; Taco of the Day (Cod)

SV3QaurFa6zJOl_qjjdIwQ.text: I rarely get to the downtown area, but happen to be in the area and seeing that it was taco Tuesday we, decided to check it out. Was not disappointed! Tacos were all freshly made and delicious. In particular I really liked the Ono fish taco and their freshly made guacamole. What was even cooler was that this place used to be a church, one of the oldest in the area. The original church was built in 1893. The decor and ambience was really nice, and they have a great patio as well. Thoroughly enjoyed our lunch and plan to come back. Think it would be a great place to have a family dinner as they have nice, big and long family style tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

o9sbCbQBO4AkKdMEcqGRgg.text: The food is very good, but their sauces are amazing!  My daughter and I ordered different dishes and sampled each other's.  Not a bad bite to be found . The waiter was attentive and the wait time was minimal.  We will be back!

s6tBHpUZCo2lgVvGRW1BBw.text: Set in an old Spanish church this cool restaurant was a pleasure to visit earlier this week. My company had a dinner for my department here.   Taco's are the dominant menu item but there are also burritos and salads offered here among other items. I ordered 3 different taco's along with a side of borracho beans. We also had chips and salsa. I thought this was a weak part of the meal. Plenty of chips but the salsa servings were small. However I gave them a 3. The taco's arrived in a timely manner and were very good. I wish I could remember their names but one had duck meat, another was chicken and the third had pull pork as the meat. These high end taco's were very good (4).  I really like the interior decor of this place. Being in an old church gives it such a nice ambience with the stained glass windows and original furniture.  This is a restaurant that I would be happy to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 tacos and borracho beans

cWZONWplPcWcyDfAXDhPnQ.text: This is really fun place to meet for an early dinner, before the crowd gets too loud. We bring out of town visitors here because it's such a fun place to hang out.  Their tacos are, of course, delicious, but their side dishes are excellent: the grilled corn and the beans are amazing!  The staff works hard and your food comes pretty quickly.  Parking can be a bit tricky, but otherwise: highly recommend!

eZ3CuBmAGbOqpTh-5uS0jg.text: Food was horrible. Not good at all. Cold food. No flavor. Service was even worse. There was 4 of us. We asked for straws, like 3 times. Finally the server brought some. She only brought 2. We asked another server for another 2. We ordered 2 drinks from another server. Our server was m.i.a. Then they brought the wrong drinks. We got charged for those two. Even after we told them they were the wrong drinks. They brought the wrong ones. We adding notice we payed for those until after we left. Disappointed. Way over priced! Would never recommend this place to anyone.

MsoFaJCdQR8gyYpgL8u2KQ.text: I love this place. The ambiance is unique and the food is tasty.  I don't like crazy fruity drinks as I am more of a purist with my favorite tequila drink.  They have a selection of both.  The chipotle cherry steak tacos are to die for!

tAAe5_TiboV2DrwTCIWDYQ.text: My buddy, Paul, and I went here on a Thursday night and it was packed! Which was a good thing. Paul was able to have a cocktail and order another in the time it took us to be seated, which wasn't more than 15-20 minutes. Which was a good thing. During that wait time, we were able to admire the reused space and discuss current personal situations. Which was a good thing.  After being seated, we were brought chips and a salsa sampler. That was great, and tided us over whilst waiting for our tacos to arrive. I ordered the Molida Lamb and the Peking Duck; Paul ordered the braised beef, grilled veggie and street corn. He said all his items were average and under-seasoned. I thought mine were flavorful, if not messy to eat. The lamb had a nice gamey-ness that was enhanced by the bleu cheese; the duck was sweetened with plum sauce and apricot compote, topped with a tiny fried mozzarella stick. Which was a good thing. But those things were packed full (which was a good thing, for the value) and a challenge to eat. Paul said it's because I try to eat all proper and stuff.  Overall, this was a good dining experience for me. Not so much for Paul.

VBH5BlfeOdc5NQmgV8jrMg.text: Have you ever had a duck taco? Well here is your chance! Come on down to Taco Guild and experience my favorite taco in all of Phoenix. If it walks like a duck, and quacks like a duck... it just may be a duck taco! #BB20

63ULzOcNarvA2SuquLYTWQ.text: We love the old world charm this place has. The food is wonderful and unique. A must try is the roasted corn which they do in house. This a must stop for when we have company in town. We also enjoy it as a romantic date place although it can get a little loud during the afternoon crowd. During the cooler months wonderful outdoor seating with the right ambiance to take one back in time or to a magical place. A must see when in the Phoenix area.

09xImZ6KjzxzAptAF09TpQ.text: I went to Taco Guild once, and I don't think I'll ever give it another try...here's why: There was a live band playing disco music in an old church, that was fun. The server was kind of snotty, inconvenienced by my menu questions and recommendation requests. The margaritas were decent...the tacos and fundido appetizer were just meh, nothing to write home about. My gut hated me within hours, and that hatred lasted well into the next couple of days.

-EFnKNVfYXOAVVVItbiP5A.text: Wow! How did I not know this great place existed! This is one of the best places I have been in some time! I'll start with the food since that is what you always come back for. Basically, it's fantastic.  We began with the guacamole which was fresh and very good.  The chips and salsas were also excellent. The main "medium" salsa was neither too mild nor too hot and had a great roasted tomato flavor. I then had the chicken taco (very good) and the cherry chipotle steak taco (outstanding).  Another in our party had the lamb taco, which he said was ok, but 2 others had the veggie taco, which they raved about. You get your choice of flour or corn homemade tortillas - perfecto!  And now for the setting - old church building built in 1895, original stained glass windows and more. Just a great, great ambiance.  Service? Impeccable also. When we had questions about the building and restaurant our waiter sat down for a few minutes with us and shared some of the history. I simply cannot think of a single negative about our experience. We will definitely be coming back!

D7UpkksKchUUVvJLaPBb3A.text: Wow! We are from the the SF Bay Area and nothing we have compares.  Aside from the delicious food, the staff has been wonderfully helpful as we plan our way south. A shout out to Raven for being a great server!

mH4TqYYDe2iX-jHLguCKBg.text: I booked a table here for lunch for myself and 3 colleagues very last minute using OpenTable. While booking, I was asked to confirm our preferred seating: outside, standard or high table. We requested standard. Upon arriving at the restaurant, we were warmly greeted and I told the host about my reservation. As I was explaining we had originally requested standard but it was so beautiful outside, he said, "I was wondering if you would prefer outside - the weather is great!" And so he put us at a great corner table out on the patio. (Later, a huge great delivery truck pulled up blocking our view and stayed way too long, but nothing could be done about that.) My colleagues all ordered margaritas as it was happy hour (during lunch? on a Monday? Awesome!) but I had a delicious agua fresca. We started off with chips and salsa - the chips were really thick and crispy and the 3 salsas were amazing. Each was a vibrant colour and very appealing. I particularly liked the habanero which was bright orange. We each ordered the 3 tacos and the menu selection was overwhelming. The server in particular recommended the Molida, lamb with blue cheese and also the Chipotle Cherry Steak. I went for the Molida, the Mahi Mahi and the Clandestino Shrimp. I had a real problem with trying to figure out which was the best and most delicious of the three after eating them! I probably found the Molida the most flavourful, but the Clandestino was terrific (that slaw!) and the Mahi Mahi was modern and delicious. Tough choice! I hated to leave the fun, cool place but we had to get back for some meetings. I absolutely loved this place and hope to get back some day!

aq9DJ8-9aSLmyBSyYWBqCw.text: I was really blown away by Taco Guild. A very unique ambiance, that suits the restaurant well. It's located in an old church, with stained glass windows, and intricate architecture. In addition to that, the food is outstanding.  I ordered the breakfast burrito, and the others at the table ordered the YUCATAN SHRIMP taco (green cabbage slaw, avocado), the URBAN BEAN COFFEE BRAISED BEEF taco (caramelized onion, mango jicama relish, Cotija cheese), and another breakfast burrito (GRILLED STEAK BURRITO with scrambled egg, grilled steak, pico de gallo, Jack cheese, seasoned potatoes, green chile sauce).  The prices are incredibly reasonable, and the menu is both simple and original (both good things in my mind). Each taco has the right combination of flavors, and the breakfast burrito is both filling and delicious. Overall, a great place to fill yourself up with great tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yucatan shrimp and urban bean coffee braised beef

rUZNeW_rk3kIO_CSOp_KKw.text: Came here for Valentine's Day and the drinks are amazing ! The food on the other hand was bland . Not very authentic tasting . I'd recommend this place for drinks for sure ! As for any of the food I'd have to say no . The guacamole tasted as if it was chopped up avocado and nothing else. I got a chicken enchilada and I was not a fan . The tacos were mediocre didn't taste like the meat was seasoned at all. My fiance on the other hand said he did like his shrimp enchilada. I will be coming back for drinks only probably ! Shout out to the bartenders

Ll30YtAoJyzd_F4SpcB83A.text: Ok - I admit I am a white girl from CA. I have a rule when traveling to not go to any chain restaurants (unless desperate)! I chose this place for lunch as it had good Yelp reviews. I am sure locals would likely love the food, but it was way too "hot/spicy" for me. I had the Al Pastor and could only eat a couple of bites. I did order the Ono which wasn't spicy but wasn't the greatest fish taco. The street corn was delicious but once again I could only eat a small amount. The service was great and the venue was interesting with the stained glass windows. Maybe adding a heat scale to the menu items would help a wimpy white girl like me

AtN1ANl0gmaW2wJWkPmhUw.text: Management did not staff for the American holiday. 90 minute wait for a server with terrible customer service. Food was cold. She did not care. Front of the staff sat us in a community table despite asking for a table. Never called us never talked to us. Kept sitting others that came in later than we did. Absolute terrible experience. Very surprised anyone would give this place 4 stars. Nothing they did was remotely close to meeting the expectation of 2.5. Adam the manager on duty decided to tell me verbatim he didn't care about my experience and said my server was busy what was she supposed to do? My food is cold, and you're giving me attitude. Why don't you manage risk and ensure noise is mitigated?

DJ9cDN7tbJJdhOt3ePWLog.text: Love the atmosphere but it can be noisy at lunch and expensive.  Variety of tacos is nice. Roasted salad was yummy

qCj8amUCxVI0TBk9nDK1xQ.text: First time here.. Kept an open mind.  My mind was blown! I got the Soup of the Day and The Guild Chicken Taco. The taco itself looked pretty good but when I tasted it, it was gone within a matter of seconds. After I wanted another one it was that good.  The soup was a beef and veggie soup, overall it was soup. The beef had a good taste to it and the cast iron bowl it came in was convenient and kept my soup nice and hot.  The Hubs got a smoked pork torta. Which he thought was good as well..   My favorite part was the chips and salsa. I make homemade salsa all the time and am usually doctoring up restaurant salsa but this one. Nothing to change it was great! Spicy, Peppery. And just right!   The only reason why I did not give a 5th star was due to the long wait. We asked our waiter for the check and it took him about 5 min to do so. Which we were in a rush that's why we asked. But besides that everything was good!   Next time I will plan better but definitely going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soup of the day with the Guild Chicken Taco
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork torta
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The stained glass by my seat! It&#39;s neat!

9PQLyxTUXouREEKCC_3h0w.text: My friend and I try a new place every week to celebrate Taco Tuesdays. We decided to visit this place based on another friend's recommendation. God bless the man! Let me start with what first meets the eye.. its a church! It literally couldn't be more church-y. Stained glass windows, Renaissance reprints on the walls, an altar converted to a bar.. it's got it all. It has a really cool vibe overall, which already makes you feel positive about the restaurant.   Their margaritas are alright, but I generally stick to beers to play it safe. I've tried a bunch of things here over the last few months and almost every one of those items have delivered! Their version of fundido is actually pretty fantastic.. I would highly recommend it. Also, they have phenomenal elotes. I would absolutely recommend that you get them on the cob. I tried the alternative only to find corn kernels floating in a pool of butter. Stick to the cob.   Two words- Lamb. Tacos. Holy hell! It has got to be the most well balanced flavor profile on a taco I've had thus far. I despise blue cheese with all my heart but it totally works here! They top em up with fried sweet potato strings.. absolutely genius! I have a pretty standard order when I visit.. it's two lamb tacos and elotes. There's no way you could possibly go wrong. I have friends who've tried other things and none of them had anything negative to say about the food. It certainly is pricier than other taco places but I think the lamb tacos are totally worth the splurge, so to speak. Try it and thank me later :)

iDaNVSSovNesQDCg17lrWg.text: I honestly only came bc of the hype ive heard about this place, honestly it's beautiful but the food was decent don't get me wrong I ate all my food it just wasn't as flavorful for me as I hoped it would  be , maybe next time will be the charm

Hnphg3VdPZ4aBcHXJvkSnQ.text: Great Food.   Service is very good.  Atmosphere is perfect.  Would highly recommend The Taco Guild

df9tT_lS23Q_oK6NetmzXQ.text: Yeesh, time flies. I started this review about a year ago. The food and drinks were good, they had some creative menu items and the tacos were delicious. Service was OK, but I try to be patient because we had a big group. My biggest compaint is the terribel acustics. We ended up going to the Starbucks next door to have a more pleasant conversation there.

ZAEiTY2dJrOuqT-k1rcR6A.text: If you're a real Mexican don't come here. The rice has the taste of some generic southwestern seasoning, the chicken burrito wasn't above Taco Bell's, and we waited an hour and 15 minutes when we were told 45. We got placed right next to the speakers in the front room when we have two baby girls. The only reason it has 2 stars is because the service was amazing. Our waitress Lauren was on top of our area and one of the busboys, Ray, asked if we wanted to move to another spot away from the speakers. Overall, the service is great but not worth the semi-large price tag for mediocre food

AFAhRnoRmJ1YTv4SqV1ahw.text: yes i go to church......on taco tuesday! love it so much! confess your sins and have an amazing taco after!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

na1WTUU6HkA5nYubX3SEtg.text: I like the environment. Nice ambience and a cool setting. However, very expensive. Additionally the waiter, while very nice, spilled food on me. I understand it was an accident, but naturally I would assume he would provide some sort of compensation for the dry cleaning. Unfortunately, I had to ask for that myself.

nqOrBMsr9CDpd0QxDMmxSQ.text: This place is amazing! Apparently it used to be a church that is now remastered into a hip taco joint with craft cocktails. We sat at the bar on a Saturday night. They had a very talented artist playing guitar and singing. It was beautiful and very pleasant. Remember to tip them too by the way if you enjoy their music! Anyway, I tried the grapefruit cocktail to start. It has grapefruit and some jalapeno which surprisingly complemented each other quite well. They offer 4 salsas to start And they are all different heat levels, with the orange one being the spiciest although tolerable for my palate. Very yummy! If you order 3 tacos, you get a free side. I ordered the cherry beef, the old age chicken, and the carnitas. Honestly I wasn't a fan of the chicken taco, but the beef and carnitas were very tasty and juicy! I wasn't really a huge fan of the rice either.  I also tried the margaritas with elderflower liquer and wow! It is up there with some of my favorite margaritas, and I have had many margaritas in my life. Definitely try it if you're visiting this place.   Amazing atmosphere. Great cocktails. Tacos for anybody's taste and salsa too! I really enjoyed this place. Service was also exemplary.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. More tacos, including one with lamb
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Assortment of salsas to start
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grapefruit cocktail

PUysE7wGm2XgRThpuOxJ3w.text: WOW, always amazing, between the different tacos to the unusual tequilas.

AbEGBbcIDKDC_tf1_A1tKw.text: The food was good I like there Chicken guild taco. But for 4.50 a taco it to much for so little of a taco. I can understand 2$ a taco. But 4.50 for just one is sad.

oYjjwSWJ-uJEqAyAIMKK1g.text: It's been a long wait for me and my first time at Taco Guild.  Part of the reason is, well, there's taquerias pretty much around every corner in the valley.  But the biggest reason for my hesitancy was the lackluster early reviews.  The complaints were pretty wide ranging but the price point of the tacos seemed to be the biggest beef Yelpers had with this place.  Lately it seems like the trend is much more positive so I can only assume that means they've gotten themselves into a better groove with their customers.  My brother-in-law suggested we go here for dinner on a Wednesday so off we went to the northwest corner of Osborn and 7th Street.  The biggest selling point about Taco Guild is and likely always will be the building.  Its everything you've heard.  Its gorgeous.  A spectacular rehab and preservation of a longtime valley Church building that has been transformed into a beautiful restaurant space.  The multitudes of unique features from the stained glass to the murals, to the woodwork and chandelier are enough to make for an entire dinner's worth of conversation by itself.  When we arrived around 6:30pm the place was packed, but fortunately there was room at the bar which was where we were headed anyway.  We started with the usual chips and salsa, though here you get three other sauces to go with it.  One of which tasted like a cilantro veggie sauce, another tasted similar to Tobasco, while the other I'm pretty sure had a tinge of habanero.  Nice variety and I was quite fond of the cilantro option.  The menu here is pretty straight forward with a heavy emphasis on the tacos (appropriately enough), but also with some other Mexican fare including burritos and enchiladas.  The 3 taco plate seemed like an appropriate opening salvo for my first time so I went that route.  I went with a Pork Adovada, a Guild Chicken, and a Yucatan Shrimp taco with a side of rice.  Total price for the tacos, tax and tip came to about $16.    The tacos were terrific with the Pork Adovada being my favorite of the bunch (I think the relish was the biggest reason why).  The rice was a lot spicier than I had expected (I only later discovered the rice has green chiles plus two types of peppers).  In the end Taco Guild provided me a tasty, filling dinner served by friendly staff.  Yeah, the price per taco might be a little steep, but not completely out of line.  The quality of the ingredients and the tortillas were such that I was still quite pleased.  And as mentioned earlier, the environment and the aesthetics were outstanding.    As I write this, Z'Tejas Inc (Taco Guild's parent company) has filed for bankruptcy so I hope I'm not going to be among the last to write a review about this place.  I can't speak to the current condition of the Z'Tejas restaurant chain (admittedly I haven't dined at a Z'Tejas in awhile).  Though if tonight was any indication, it doesn't seem like Taco Guild is anything but a success story for Z'Tejas.  Even if Taco Guild itself doesn't survive, there is absolutely no reason any other business shouldn't be able to succeed in this breathtakingly beautiful space.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three taco plate (from left to right):  Pork Adovada, Yucatan Shrimp, Guild Chicken.  Plus a side of rice.  Good stuff

HNNNElmmDp2AfIEsAQY0Hw.text: Some of the best tacos in Phoenix!!!!! I had the El Pastor, Duck, and lamb. All three were amazing. My husband had the chicken enchiladas and it was hard to stop him from licking the plate XD The waiters are super friendly, and even when busy everything was super prompt and fast. Their happy hour is FABULOUS! $5 margaritas that are just crafted beautifully! Great selection of ales and beers as well. The inside is GORGEOUS!!!!! It is a converted church and is so stunning! I can't wait to bring the rest of my family back.

Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. (Left to Right) Duck, Lamb, El Pastor
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Diablo Eggs! A MUST TRY!!!!!

63713OPqEjI5QnHtyqcnhA.text: Order the frozen margarita not the margarita on the rocks. Cherry steak tacos were good. Service was a little slow.

oNyeTr3aefAHz7b6ltiXuA.text: Taco guild is the coolest taco shop in AZ. We have a lot of great mexican food here but this place has the vibe and beauty that tops them all. I want to give a special shot out to the manager Sarah! This woman made our lunch exceptional!   I strongly recommend a visit... get the cherry chipotle steak taco and at least 3 margaritas!

r0sBZ3RcFuCpSF0cFJqjtA.text: The tacos at Taco Guild aren't in my opinion great. For starters the tortillas on my tacos where warm at best the food smells and taste like all the ingredients are in the kitchen pre made then kept luke warm until it's time to use them. Not to mention the tacos are over priced I ate here on a taco Tuesday and their special was only 4 tacos off the whole entire menu, and they where 2.75 each. I'm only giving this place a 2 stars because the margarita was great.

3fAxFSQqvHQ4GicN5r4Flg.text: What a wonderful evening! Even though Taco Guild has only been open for ten days, they clearly understand what is important to their diners! We had great cocktails, delightful local beer, and wonderful food! I highly recommend the Chicken Guild taco and the Coffee Bean Beef taco! There were eight or nine different tacos at our table, and each one was thoroughly enjoyed. The side dishes and chips and salsa were also top notch! And save room for dessert; best Tres Leches I have ever had! There was one small issue with my cocktail, but the bartenders, servers, and manager went above and beyond to apologize, correct the issue, and make sure that we were happy with our experience. I was very, very impressed... And will be back again for another outstanding night!

05sBvH6vV-hNGCjTpyzd_Q.text: Every aspect of my experience at the Taco Guild was amazing! My friend and I were over at the Urban Bean when we realized we wanted dinner. The word Taco caught my eye so we wandered over for some dinner.   The environment of this place is amazing. Everything is beautiful, I feel like I could look around for hours and hours. All of the plates are from the Salvation Army. It's so fun to see what plate you will get next since they are all mismatched.   I got the taco plate which was about $10 with the Al Pastor, Urban Bean Coffee Beef, and the Veggie taco. The al pastor taco was extremely flavorful and had very tender pieces of pork-no nasty grizzle. The coffee beef with mango and jicama salsa was wonderful with the contrast of sweet and salty. I especially liked the veggie taco with roasted brussel sprouts, peppers, and mushrooms with hummus. All were very flavorful. The Corn with Habenero Butter was also amazing and flavorful.   Service was extremely friendly and we never had an empty glass. I can't wait to come back!

ZbuuLgxHqyCZ913Mw_CRAg.text: Awesome place. The staff was very nice. The bar and ambiance are great. The food was very good. The service is almost too fast. I was just starting to enjoy the chips and boom, the tacos showed up. Three tacos is a meal. A side is included. Local vegetables was good.

aD05TYMUtlRjSgT1EFNC_A.text: So I visited taco guild for the first time, charming building (loved the foyer) the server Miles was outstanding, the food I found to be tantalizing to my palate, the True gems of this place are the architecture and the service provided by Miles.

fSc33sICpXvIbFeof3WD3w.text: The building is spectacular!  The service is horrific.  Have tried the place three times:  1) Soon after the main openng...the service was slow and chaotic.  They got a "pass" since they were new and getting going.  2)  A bar visit which was noted for slow service, expensive drinks and very unfriendly bartender.  3) Sunday lunch visitc tables were not cleaned from prior patrons' visit.  Request for clean up was met with excuses, resistance and attitude.  Walked out after waiting for a few minutes to no avail.   Manager notified;  her resonse was a half-hearted apology.   Better food and superior service elsewhere...ie La Santisima.

oN_i2asPrsIz5EZJmYPR-A.text: Taco Guild is wonderful!!   The old church atmosphere is cool and the service was beyond amazing. There were so many helpful people that were all very attentive. The juke box is a little weird as far as creating a "vibe" in the restaurant, but that can be easily remedied.  As for the food: I got two Yucatan shrimp tacos and a snapper taco. The shrimp was SO flavorful with just the right amount of toppings in the tortilla. The snapper was very tasty, but not my favorite. My husband got an al pastor, lamb, and a cherry beef taco. He raved about the beef the most! For a Sunday afternoon, the service was fast and the food was so fresh and tasty! We will definitely come back for more...soon!

ssbJtH_TAnLqImXtmfbtOQ.text: Ambiance is great. Service needs a bit of help.  I normally like to drink and eat on my time table and not that of the server.  They don't seem to like it if you don't order fast enough for them.  The tacos are pretty good.  The place is OK, I won't rave about it.

bSf4Lh89EAkTCkxXwM-ZfQ.text: I got the coffee rubbed shredded beef tacos, two friends got the burritos and those were enormous. The chips were fresh, the four salad they brought out were various levels of spicy but flavorful. The wait staff was attentive. Were going back soon. The restaurant is in an old church and its lovely.

iPZ631DShhiNCaqIS3_nIg.text: Love what they did to the building, the food, not so great. Sunday night, 4 of us ordered 3 tacos ea. and got one of every side dish. After 3 different servers auctioned off our food around the table, all the tacos were cold. The ancho chilli black beans were unedible, they tasted like a handfull of chilli powder and cumin. The chorizo rice was bitter and no one ate more than 1 bite. The happy hour $5 wine could not have been much more than a 5 oz pour. The happy hour margarita machine was down, no subs offered. Had a small $9 margarita that tasted good, but no value at that price point. Never offered a dessert menu, still not sure if they even have dessert?  This look like a case of spending a ton of dough on the building, and trying to make it back by cutting corners on the food and alcohol. Probably wont be going back anytime soon.

nlmOQ3wdt_Jahe0-mSPcEg.text: Hip place in an old church. Lots of seating and affordable food. Good gluten free options and friendly service. Margaritas are strong but very nice.

M-xgZsnREzwB6-ql2ldvrQ.text: Love this restaurant! Cool interior and vibe. The server was on it! Very knowledgable and helpful. Great DJ on Friday night. The duck taco rocked!! Just don't order it at the same time as the lamb taco. Kind of like drinking a shot of whiskey and tequila back to back. On their own delicious. Why this place was not packed is beyond me. Wake up Phoenix a great restaurant is in your town!!

3fSyGqkcoYjXduELxD4LhA.text: The scenery as others have noted is stunning. The renovated church is awesome, the food, not so much. The guac was divine, but everything else was uninspiring. You can't be a great Mexican restaurant if your tortillas are mediocre at best. Go for the drinks, the atmosphere and the guac, then go someplace else for dinner.

zUFGyqJPtOyBGI9cFyQ1tw.text: 2nd time here. Had lunch today. Corn on the cob appetizer is messy, but unbelievably good. Tacos are fun and different. I like some of them more than others. You've got to be willing to try new stuff. Atmosphere is unique. Old church - stained glass. Open environment. Can be a bit noisy. Everyone seems to be having fun here. Looks like a great happy hour place. Not convenient for me, but I will return when in this area...maybe even whenI'm not in the area.

jQPtYRWwRGYn4fXnsMWQ9A.text: Had lunch there today. The building is exquisite and a must see. We sat at the bar and service was very attentive. Guacamole was very well prepared. I'm had a shrimp taco and a coffee dusted beef taco. Both were enjoyable. I can't wait to go back.

D5-gRJ6ZB71IQf5hNL5axQ.text: I really liked this place- great tacos, and great beer selection. Customer service upon first arrival was a bit lacking on my visit. Prices were alright.

SsHGyJyR0aF6fvCC2J6aig.text: I've visited this place 2 times. The first time they were new so I wanted to give them a chance to work their kinks out. The service was what you want when you go out to eat so that was another reason for me to give it a second shot. Both times I was not impressed with the tacos. I give them credit for trying to do something unique and special with the menu like a Thai taco and duck taco, however the delivery falls short. The first time I went my tacos were cold and the second time they were just warm, but almost like they had been sitting out too. The service still remained likeable, but I could hear that they hadn't done away with their mish mash of music which had no cohesiveness from country to oldies to pop. Don't get me wrong I do like different types of music, but they had nothing really similar that it was just distasteful. The building itself is beautiful and well done. This place really could be great, but for now it's just as okay spot, with slightly pricy food that I don't see myself returning to.

VAzS8ymh1SXeuP-nDm3faA.text: This place is amazing! The service was impeccable! Our waitress knew the menu and offered suggestions- she was right on! I enjoyed the grilled hearts of romaine salad with chicken and it was literally the best salad I have ever had! The ambiance was beautiful, but it felt a little awkward drinking margaritas in a church. The decor is very simple, yet elegant. We had the HH margaritas and REALLY enjoyed them. I'll return in my next visit to the area.

_mf19VFluUlpJtQB9i1aTg.text: Went on Easter Sunday, great service from the young man.  Suggested red chile soip, excellent.  Ordered the corn could not of got any older field corn (terrible) and overpriced. Tacos are small snd overpriced also, but taste great.  Probably wont go back.

SNSSJ_dQPFxAwbgbPUF_WQ.text: Just left Taco Guild. The building is great, but there is nothing else good about this place. We ordered two taco.  the Happy hour taco was a sloppy joe  and we ordered a lamb taco off the regular menu.  The waitress who brought the tacos presented the pastor taco (not order) and it turns out not delivered. We did receive the two tacos we ordered. The lamb was the better of the two, but had they been served at least warm they would have been better.   The table next to us had food over the surface, the plates and been cleared, but the table not cleaned.  When we left 45 minutes later, we informed the hostess(?), she didn't really care that the table was still dirty. Then we are over charged.  The waitress thought the lamb and the duck (which we were charged for) were the same price.  After asking her to look at the menu she agreed they were not the same and adjusted the bill! Someone need to train the staff and the person at the door (normally the hostess)!! We will not return.

sc1vqxCfaFuD2qJ2Z10MFg.text: I live down the street and I have many options to choose from. However, I continue to return to the Taco Guild because their service is impeccable. The food is amazing. Julia is a great Manager, and there's some amazing talent behind the bar. I don't work here...I just respect that this establishment takes pride in representing our Phoenix community, from top to bottom. Try the smooth house guac. It will literally take you there. When I mean there, I mean THERE. The margaritas will BLOW your MIND. Like...I'm still looking for my mind. It was that good.  For men and women alike....go to The Taco Guild and get saucy together, and Eat Drink and Be Merry.  -Ruby

tOP6J2EimTQ_AmU_wJyVHw.text: Tacos is the new religion.  Rushed in after work with the wifey, the minute we walked into the restaurant our mind were blown.  The concept and the theme was spectacular, we rushed in around 10:30pm thinking that their kitchen is probably closed but they actually ended up bringing out the full menu for us.  When you first walked thru the front door the entire dining hall opens up, the acoustic and the setting made me felt like im going to have some tacos with St. Peter himself.  Here are the things we had ordered, 1. 1893 Frozen Margarita. 2. Jalapeno Bacon Guacamole  LOVED IT! 3. Fresh Ceviche of the day (Shrimp and scallop!)  I had ordered all the New School Tacos and my personal favorite was the Chipotle Chery Steak, and the Peking Duck.  Just beautifully done, the texture of the steak just melts in your mouth.  Their Tortillas were so fluffy and fresh if i had a bed  made out their tortillas i would sleep on it and eat myself with it.   she had the Pork Adovada, Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef and Guild chicken. She really enjoyed the Pork Adovada out of the 3 (Old World Tacos)  They also gave us 2 free sides, the Green Chile Achiote Rice, and Crispy Poblano Onion Straws.    The service was fantastic, loved the jukebox and the restroom was pretty cool too.  I really enjoyed my experience there, and have since sent quite a few people that way, and have heard nothing but good things about it.

TMsB6rF2sE76fGRJ4xtYzw.text: Went for lunch with coworkers while in town. Found this place on yelp and wanted to give it a try. Unique building and even more interesting inside. I loved the stained glass windows. The service was just ok. We ordered the guacamole and queso duo, while at the same time ordering our lunch. Our tacos came before the appetizer bc the server forgot about it. Not a huge deal because the food came out fast, as did our late arriving appetizers.   The chips and salsa where so good! The guacamole was good, more lime to taste than I'm use too, but very good. The queso was very good. We probably could have had a meal just from apps alone.   For my lunch I got a trio of tacos. 1. Guild Chicken. 2. Yucatan Shrimp. 3. Chipotle Cherry Steak. All three were very good! My favorite was the steak. I could have easily eaten three of those also. For my side I got the corn. I had them take it off the corn for me so it came in a bowl. Very good. Not as messy. Full of flavor!   Overall good meal. It was good to get away from the downtown meals that we had night after night in Phoenix. Would recommend you give it a try.

8E2f27EipZnEHonOhuPGaA.text: I went on a Sunday afternoon with a date.  The place was suggested by her even though she had never been there before. I think that it being an old church being made into a restaurant was a factor.  I loved the design, architecture, and look of this place with it's stained glass windows, old church style doors, and paintings! We were seated promptly and water brought to us by our waitress (who did a great job!)  Chips and 4 different types of salsa was brought out while we thought of what to eat.  The menus reminded of old church hymnals. We went with chicken enchiladas and they were superb! I highly recommend this place!

13y38NRqX1tD_w7AhPj3yw.text: I went there a while ago and really loved it.  Lots of different choices.  Gr8 atmosphere.

5yRM352ZiarXHT84MJ6A2Q.text: My first time there. Took large group of family from out-of-state. Loved it. The food and service were excellent. Unique ambience. Nice selection of micro breweries on tap. Not cheap but I felt it was good value. Will definitely be back!!!

iyl9VSQ_2rUGNc9JVyOdaQ.text: I had such high hopes about Taco Guild.  I really really did  I was looking forward going there for awhile.  So my date and I went there with the highest expectations.  Yes, I think he liked it a lot better than I did, but he just really loves tacos.    Now, the place was gorgeous inside, I have to give it that.  It was old church and they kept the beauty of the structure, which actually made me happy.    The service was alright.  Nothing that stands out there.  But I was looking forward to the food.  The menu is limiting.  We started off with the chips and guacamole.  It had NO FLAVOR!  None at all.  It actually made me very sad.  And the tacos?  (I had the chicken and shrimp) was actually bland.  I wasn't impressed.  But I will try you again Taco Guild.  Maybe it was an off night?  But I do have to say, your margaritas were great!

AShXKylp6bw_GNKHUcVMJA.text: The old church building that this place is in in phenomenal.  What they have done with the inside is just extraordinary (except the lame TVs that are playing way above the bar...take those out!)  Right when I walked in, I felt like this was gonna be a great place to take anyone that is in town that wants to see a cool spot....until I ate.  I'm not going to say that the food was bad, but the Tacos don't even grace a spot in my Top 10 taco places in Phoenix.  They are okay, but just feel very corporately made....very standard products, bad tortillas, no love at all.    I would not suggest going here.

P2j0OEcv8A-PA6Rs6uaytQ.text: Yes this place is gorgeous; a restored church turned gastro pub with a great vibe!  the bar is the alter, how sweet is that?!! My new Sunday spot & Happy Hour starts at 2 with a secret menu including an egg brunch taco. WIN! As a vegetarian suto vegan, I have many options.  This place is like the 'Whole Foods' of tacos.  The veg tacos are to die for with rotating local seasonal vegetables...which included brussel sprouts, carrots & collard greens! The tortillas are fresh made soft corn, YUM so tasty! The rice & beans are veg too. And as for the drink, it was so delicious --- I got the Osbourn -- nice & strong, well worth the price using a top shelf smooth Anejo Tequila & all the juice is squeezed fresh.  I don't think they use mixes at all. Great bar & delicious food. & also the chips & salsa are complimentary. Like I said, this place is my new Church on Sunday.

bs3WJjmu2vwqUgOQBMwQWQ.text: My co-worker recommended this place last week and I met my friend there for lunch. Absolutely delicious! Amazing atmosphere with friendly service. Loved the pork tacos with pineapple. So original and tasteful. Would absolutely recommend this place.

oR9eHmVniZze4Zi2wHBt2g.text: I have not been so impressed and pleased with a place. For a week or so after I found myself talking about it with friends and coworkers. Great atmosphere. Excellent food. And happy hour has affordable but delicious margaritas. The cherry steak taco was my favorite. I might get two next time. But I tried 3 or 4 others and those were all good as well.

_7B-_LLAFdM1CUEfyDq7Ng.text: Where do I start, well first of all the decor and repurpossing an old church was well done.  Keeping the context of the original building and woodwork, two thumbs up.  Now let's get to the food, the tacos, Holy Sh#t they were out of this frikin world.  The waiter was spot on, attentive but not smothering, Caleb.  They had live music and that just fit right in with the whole evening.  Job well done guys.

Itom906FHY5iGshKOfNELQ.text: Do not go if you have kids. Me and my wife both gave Taco guild 5 stars in the past. However, when someone from Taco Guild contacted us to thank us for the review, we mentioned that it was extremely inconvenient for a restaurant to have one high chair for the whole place. They said they would "work on it. ". We have been 5 times since and 5 weeks have gone by....and they still have one high chair. You can get restaurant high chairs in a single trip to any supply store. It's obvious they do not care for families or care for suggestions. Great food but don't go with kids or large groups.      Won't be going back until they can accommodate more than one toddler in the whole restaurant.

N-2Y1bN123ScFa9YOt4UrA.text: What a great Mexican food restaurant!  My companion and I tried this place based on a friend's recommendation.  It is in an old church and the stained glass windows, stunning chandelier and wall murals set the tone for a great dining experience.  The warm, fresh chips are served with homemade spicy salsa and three different types of sauces that are fun to try.  We have now been to Taco Guild four times and have haven't gotten past the tacos on the menu-they're that good.  The Mexican street corn is delicious and the drink selection is great, as well.  My companion is a bit of a beer snob and he loves the selection here.  Service is attentive and polite.  We recently held a special occasion party at Taco Guild and they made the experience extra special for us.  I highly recommend this restaurant.  I didn't give it five stars because parking is a bit limited.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious tacos and beans.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gorgeous!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amen!

XYcu0twjJ9YyCJtoqwFzcw.text: I was excited when taco guild open.  So, my husband and I decided to try it out before we went to the ballet in downtown on a Sunday afternoon.  First of all we waited ten minutes before a waiter came over to give us water and chips.  Then we waited five more minutes before we could order our food.  Last thing my husband ordered a burrito without rice on it and it came with rice on it.  :(  At least they were good about getting him a new burrito pretty quick.   The atmosphere was pretty cool and I liked the look of the place. But the service was not all that great and the prices are a little high for a street taco.

dIR9sKKnYGZXEfdZDp5jhQ.text: Food is delicious, however service was a bit slow. Don't go if your in a hurry, plan to take in the surroundings and enjoy your food.

wHWXmN5-s4HC7SGATK_vlA.text: One of five recommended eateries.  We go to a new place on Thursday. Three years now and 150 experiences later we settled on five. The food is great.  The wait staff has a high turn over that is disappointing.  They hire one off humans with no dress code. This is distracting.

-eb6YeDpqW-MtnVytL3ULA.text: I love this spot; it is awesome. The tacos were amazing and their homemade nachos and salsa were amazing as well. I went for my birthday lunch recently with some colleagues and I will be back for their happy hour. THey have some great drinks specials and food specials listed.   THe ambiance  of the Taco Guild is awesome as well. They converted an old historic church into an amazing bar and restaurant with some of the original stained glass and chandeliers and art.  I will be back soon!!!

bXOlCZAKpdDQhlQdg3mBcg.text: Excellent restaurant!  I would highly recommend the shrimp and steak tacos, as well as the fundido, guac, meatballs and corn.  Our food was delicious, and our service was even better.  It was such a nice change of pace to visit a restaurant with a kind, accommodating staff who made our group feel very welcome and provided speedy service when we were tight on time.  The restaurant was so good we ate there twice in one week during our stay in Phoenix.

dxQk3zdcCbK4KPFNEJ78aw.text: Delicious Queso and the pineapple mint Guacamole is not to be missed! I always love everything I order here.  I deducted a star for the noise level. Unless seated outside or in the small room in back this place is LOUD. I mean club level - have to scream - loud. The ambiance makes up for most of the noise since it is an old church with stain glass windows and fantastic decor.

XiNfSoXyOK8Ulv815xqTWA.text: The food was banging...granted all we had were tacos but they weren't ur Nana's tacos if yang know what I mean. We had the MOLIDO LAMB, CHIPOTLE CHERRY STEAK and PEKING DUCK tacos. Now I know what u r thinking lamb n peking duck tacos....WTF but seriously they were good.  The Lamb n Duck were a tad greasy but that's to be expected I guess because of the type of meat. But the Chipotle Cherry can b summed up in one word DY-NO-MITE!!! All the unique flavor combination for each taco worked perfectly and was down right fabulous.  I would highly recommended this joint to family, friends & even enemies cause it's that d@m good. The wife & I have already agreed to make it a date night destination to kill off the rest of the taco list. Try it u won't b disappointed plus it's in an old church...Taco's & Tequila in a church what could possibly go wrong.

0VLhoo7Y5dPPndwyyxun7A.text: I tried this place out for lunch with a co-worker and was pleasantly surprised. The place was crowded so we sat at the bar. I ordered the house salad with creamy cilantro dressing and the sofrito beans. My friend orders a couple of tacos. My friend actually received her plate 10 minutes before I did, which didn't make sense, but whatever. The salad was really good. The beans were a little salty, as though the sauce had been reduced too much. I added the beans to my salad and it was heavenly. The atmosphere is a little loud but tolerable. I definitely recommend!

YxADfJuU1-B6TuyThVQiwQ.text: This is not your typical Mexican food!!   If you want authentic Mexican this is not the place.  The food is very Caribbean, Puerto Rico, meets Central America.  The food has much more of a sweet seasoned flavor over a savory spicy flavor of typical Mexican food.  All Spice, pineapple, mango, banana, apricot, basil and is used and the flavors are unexpected.  This restaurant is a subsidiary (of sorts) of  Z-Tejas, a Scottsdale based franchise.  The conversation I had with the staff lead me to believe they plan to expand as Z-Tejas did to other locations within the state. They also intend to open restaurants in San Diego and several other locations.   Don't get me wrong the food is good. It was so fresh and tasty, it's obvious that chef has been inspired and is trying new things.  It was just not what I was expecting so do not go expecting "typical" Mexican.  Read the menu before you go to get an idea of the flavors I am talking about.   They have the coolest location/building. Check out their website to learn more.

qWA5305oxrq-4gsUTHjQzA.text: I can't believe I went to church to eat. It was a marvelous,heavenly time. Tuscan shrimp taco,followed by the best house salid I've had in a long time. Followed with a beef enchilada with rice and beans. It's definitely a return trip for me

9OMUtZu9Kvy4aj7Sq3IGQw.text: Tacos, tacos, tacos. Yum! Little morsels of deliciousness. The Taco Guild does not disappoint! Walking into this unique and beautiful building to taste one of the cities best tacos- was pure joy. For starters the chips and salsa ( just the way I like them) are served light and crispy with the choice of mouth watering flavorful salsa, from mild to hot habanero. The made in-house corn tortillas the tacos were served in are great. We ordered the Yukon shrimp, both al pastor and pork adovada taco, and the lamb and all I can say is; let the choir- start singing:~ :~ :~   The most moist and delicious coffee braised beef in a taco I have tasted in a restaurant yet. Wow! Not to dishonor the other tacos that we enjoyed, but that one was outstanding. We ordered street corn to eat with these tacos. Pallet pleasing Street Corn -full of flavor! They might have just given the Mission (in Scottsdale) a run for their money on their street corn- which has always been one of my favorites. I am so thrilled that we went to church at Taco Guild! I truly cannot wait to go back to enjoy some of their decadent delicious dishes. If you are a fan of tacos, you make tacos, eat tacos and enjoy them as much as I do - I would suggest that you make a Heavenly stop at Taco Guild Today. Amen & Amen.

H1VjNh1JPbYNVmzUhMtLOQ.text: I was hesitant to go to Taco Guild even though several of my friends had told me it was great. This is a challenge with Social Media. The other Yelp reviewers that I read were luke warm to negative. I am a very picky person. Well traveled. Very demanding. A group of five friends all ventured into the Taco Guild on a Friday night after Thanksgiving, and we were thrilled. The atmosphere is hip and rocking! No wonder the reviewer thought that it had no kid friendly menu! They are right, but they should not knock the place! It is not meant for kids. Shame on them for expecting that from a Taco/Tequila Bar!!!!! It is also loud in a good way. The vibe is super modern, really epitomizing what is happening on Phoenix. The energy was awesome. The drinks were adventurous, if not always successful. We all had a different one, and some were better than others, but none was boring. The food was reasonable in price and tasty, with the hot sauces really awesome. We had planned on buying some to take home, but, sadly, we forgot. We will be back to do so! The tacos were delicious, the burritos were also great. I had the chicken burrito with a side of beans. Others had the steak burrito and various traditional or modern tacos. All were really very good. Service was great, prompt and fun loving. Really hip!  All in all I am thrilled that we ignored the rather mixed reviews on Yelp. They were often missing the point of this urban marvel. The architecture of this converted church alone makes it worth the trip. The food is an added extra. Don't hesitate! Just go!

5R8NNuckSPKeC-MPycR9CA.text: It was a Friday night and my husband and I had tickets to a DBacks game so naturally the question was, where to eat? I'd much rather spend $40 at a nice restaurant than on a hotdog! I'd been to Taco Guild before for lunch and had been itching to return with husband in tow, but we are never on that side of town. I texted my husband to let him know I had a surprise for dinner! Little did I know, it was also National Tequila Day (how I didn't know this, I'm not sure as Tequila is often my drink of choice). We arrived at Taco Guild to find there was no room to park and an hour wait, but I reassured him it was well worth it. We passed our time listening to Roger Clyne and the Peacemakers while sipping on free samples of his Mexican Moonshine Tequila. Once seated, we accompanied our margaritas with chips, salsa and chorizo meatballs! My husband ordered the Tequila Day special--three tacos and a margarita for $7.24--and I ordered two tacos wrapped in lettuce, which trust me, does not sacrifice any flavor. Together the architecture, food, drinks, service and overall atmosphere make for a perfect night in North Phoenix! We will return to Taco Guild again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Peacemaker Margarita at Taco Guild

dV9nZL6f8bJa9kI1jHMQuA.text: Phoenix has more than enough places to eat Mexican food every single day of the year but I had being wanted to try out Taco Guild with a friend for some time. We finally went and like so many others, I have to give it a 5 for the atmosphere and the building. It's unlike any place I've ever eaten at to be honest. But...for the rest it's a big "meh". There little tacitos are similar to what you find at nearby Joy Ride which I found to be very close in terms of coolness but with tastier tacos.  I took a dive into what I thought was some creamy avocado and it though it wasn't something that set my pallet on fire it was later confirmed by our waiter prior to ordering that the avocado sauce was with jalapenos...now that I could believe.  As for the important thing, the food, I went for the "safe" chicken tacos but there was just something lacking. Not as tender as flavorful and the tacos felt a little too thick.
