I'll be honest that I'm all for mild tasting salsa and it would have been nice for the waiter to warn that the dipping sauces provided (they are all good and probably perfect for most) are on the spicy side. It also didn't help that there were flies in the restaurant. Not the most enjoyable thing.  I would recommend the place for a drink and happy hour for sure but I'm not honestly sure I'd be back for lunch or dinner. Worth checking out and hopefully having a higher opinion of it then me, amazing decor aside.

TsNtjxFq1aZktipDtN97Hw.text: Visiting from out of town. Based on other YELP reviews and scores, I scheduled this place for a lunch business meeting. Everything was FANTASTIC!!!  Great environment. QUALITY and PERFECT food and EXCELLENT service.

zF9brtAMou5Cll8R5wW-fA.text: This was my first time in and I was not disappointed!! I loved it so much that I am going to return tomorrow for lunch!! The chips and salsa are delicious and tacos are perfectly portioned! I can't wait to go back and try it all! The atmosphere is great too! Once you try this place you will be hooked!! :)

Gd8xWJHOLCIF0JXnyBlimw.text: Awesome experience each time that I've dined here!! Atmosphere is as equally impressive as the food and the service! Our server, Whitney, was delightful each time I've been there, as is the rest of the waitstaff! This place is a gem :-)

G0EepbljB11c-1uKOxI2nA.text: so I decided to get some takout from Taco Guild and have a drink at the bar. The design of this place is AWESOME!!! it's like an old church in there with the stained glass windows, tons of wood beams and huge gothic looking chandeliers. I had a margarita on teh rocks, just the perfect margarita. For food, I wetn with three tacos: The peking Duck, the Lamb Molida and the Carne Adovado. The wife had the house salad and a side of crispy onions. Now I will say the tacos are a touch expensive at $5 each for the specialty tacos, but they're quality and loaded with great ingredients. My fave, hands down, was the Peking Duck. it had this peanut and carrot slaw and just perfectly fatty roasted duck..stupid good. I wasn't a fan of the molida lamb taco, it just tasted funky. Teh adovado was pretty good, and had a great apricot chutney on top that worked well with it. From my experience, it was 3.5 starts. Wifey didn't have a good experience. her salad was under dressed, plus done with cheap iceburg lettuce..ickey. And they forgot the aioli with the crispy onions, which they desperately needed. they also left off the avocado on her salad. All in all I'll be  back for sure to eat the peking duck tacos and try a few others out.

toKk3bQ1jMBQX1Uv8BcQCA.text: Awesome concept but very poor execution...  I really wanted to love this place (ambiance, price, beer selection, all great).  But overall, the appetizer and dinner came out before our beers, we had three servers that were constantly tripping over eachother and were rude (we got asked 4 times in a row if we were ready for our check and we had to inform them that NO we are still waiting for our food and drinks!)  I was hoping by waiting until after they've been open a while they'd have it together but wouldn't go back...

96bXiknrfet0s2NwvbZy-w.text: If its too loud, you're too old! Okay, like music or don't come...its a bit noisy! Tacos, exceptional! If you are coming for your typical American over-stuffed plate. ..you won't get it here! Some say pricey,  I think its worth every cent! Great happy hour, decent selection! Three tacos gets a free side, not advertised, be sure to ask! Definately coming back!

cB7RWpFt0w6leq70OMHnUQ.text: Tried this place for lunch for the first time yesterday and can't wait to go back. Delicious burritos and Margaritas in an old church building. Lunch hour for a Saturday was pretty slow, but that meant great service for us. I tried the pork burrito with the street corn as a side. Margs are some of the best I've had in a long time! Overall great experience and would definitely recommend.

nRXs_TvxkacW4_YA9rTm1A.text: We just tried this place for the first time today and we loved it! The chips, salsa and queso were great. We tried the cherry beef, lamb and shrimp tacos. All were amazing, but the cherry beef is the best! (Lamb is a close second!) Give this place a try and forget about all the lower ratings who care more about the music than the food.

bmEuJSRegAvLarMN2o7CoQ.text: Great tacos..beat to go sure happy hour..prices better. Drinks good too!

dbX235E_78hvAJZ3WV9NdQ.text: Usually not a fan of chains (Z'Tejas), as I try to keep my business with locally owned organizations but  happy I checked out Taco Guild. Super neat space and great ambiance. The food and drink menus are excellent and the service has always been very good. Happy hour is also a nice treat.

aLt6v3Eof7bgw1_Ss1z_AA.text: Our family went for an early dinner around 6PM on a Tuesday based on a recommendation from our hotel concierge.  Stephanie was right on.  The staff was very friendly.  Jen, Justin and Julia (guess you need a name starting with J to work there) all greeted us warmly, offered insight and assistance for first-timers and seemed to genuinely enjoy what they were doing.  Whether describing the history of the building, the flavors of the drinks and salsas or recommending meals and sides based on our interests, they were knowledgeable and informative.  I was glad I listened to Justin's recommendation to go with the street corn as my side over another selection.  It was delicious, as was the rest of the food.  The guacamole was fresh and flavorful.  The salsas provided a good variety of heat and spice.  The classic tacos were solid, and the modern tacos were creative and tasty.  I wouldn't say it is generally a kid-friendly place, yet they welcomed our tween and teen, and allowed our one son, a somewhat picky eater, to custom order off the menu.   While it may have had an impact on other patrons' experiences (see Tiara's review about "unusual mix of...music"), the juke box allowed the boys to program a few songs for their enjoyment during dinner, which were played at a reasonable volume, so you could still easily carry on a conversation.  Parking was the only draw back, as the lot adjacent to the building was relatively small and not surprisingly full; but I'd gladly park a block or two away and walk to the Taco Guild again.

HgWdfZzfhKu4BefJlzbGyw.text: A fan but not a huge fan. We went for happy hour and sat up at the bar. Except for an extremely over served patron sitting next to us we totally loved the atmosphere. We had the bacon guacamole which I didn't love but my boyfriend seemed to enjoy. What did blow me away was the lamb taco! I could have eaten a dozen of them. I highly recommend it and do to anyone who tells me they are going up there for dinner/lunch. I am sure we go back.

THYIztUAgLuba6OtYygVnA.text: This was another restaurant that I really wanted to like. The wait for the table wasn't a big deal at all, it was a Friday night at 7 - needless to say, we knew what we were getting in to. But the hour wait after that to get food was awful...  especially when you are only getting a couple of tacos. Very tiny tacos at that. Then it took and another 30 min to get the check and pay our bill - no bueno Between our small party, we had duck, snapper, shrimp, steak, lamb and chicken tacos. All were 'meh', nothing to come back for. My friend said the lamb was good, but not something going out of his way for. The specialty drinks were equally unimpressive, and the very average house margarita was still ten bucks. Just for me, 3 tacos and 2 drinks was 37 bucks, for food that was tiny and nothing special to boot!   The design of the building was very cool, well done ambiance (but some really douchey people congregating at the bar who wouldn't move out of the isle as I am trying to walk by with my 4 month old sleeping baby.)  The tequila list looked impressive, but I am not going to spend $200 on a single shot of tequila. Again, everything was in place for a cool dining experience - then the food and service got in the way. (Although either the manager or owner who sat us was very kind and accommodating)

Q1AdH6jGeXQHlfj5rHeJJg.text: Tried this place out last night after hearing so much about it. My hubby got the shrimp burrito with street corn and I got the mahi mahi taco and cherry steak taco with street corn. The mahi taco was soggy which is why I gave the 4 stars but the cherry steak taco was amazing. Hubby enjoyed the shrimp burrito and our frozen mango daiquiris were great as well!

VfOFDUc4pIZpecceCq-q4A.text: Waitress was friendly.  The restaurant smelled odd the minute we walked in, and I couldn't get over it the whole time I was there. I ordered three tacos and they were okay.  P.S the horchata is not worth it; it's poured into an 8oz glass filled with ice; so there's probably only 4 oz of horchata. And oddly enough it's really thick (kinda weird).

hYpco05Cl4h8RyGNi92Trg.text: Very overpriced for just average food. They have street tacos... nothing special... no better than I can get from a good street vendor. I love Mexican food and I will never bother with this place again

W1ZyZVvdy7B4qVvMxBM7eA.text: The inside of this place is really unique and interesting! Not sure if it was in fact a remodeled church or if it was just designed to look that way.  Food was fantastic (Mexican). I had a specialty tequila cocktail as well and it was delicious! We went during lunch time on a Saturday and it was pretty crowded. I can only imagine on a weekend night it's probably a lot of fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3_wn4vZlNbvIFyRWYJuLyw.text: Great vibe and even better food!  Highly recommend the Al Pastor and Mahi Mahi tacos as well as the Street Corn.  All day drink specials on Mondays- really enjoyed the house margarita. We will definitely come back if we end up in Phoenix in the future.

hLaQQOqF1SRw-3OPKpmfgg.text: SCORE!  I have to say I've avoided the Taco Guild - a friend had said ehhh... more hype than substance.  That was good enough for me.    So last night - when the group suggested we go - I went along cuz that's what I do - if I don't have a strong objection, I can usually find something on the menu I can enjoy.  So how did it go?  First - I love the complementary valet parking.  Score!  Second, love the interior - it's so funky and lets me know they take the experience of eating a great meal seriously.    Third, LOVE LOVE LOVE the process for the wait list.  We had a twenty minute wait ( I think it was actually less - but who cares when you are enjoying the wait.  Am I right?)  I loved that they rang my phone when it was our time.  SCORE!  Next, the bar while we waited.  Happy hour - great margaritas, friendly staff who could hold a conversation while they were working.  Chips and Salsa on point and with out asking.  SCORE!  When it was time to sit -we had a great table and serving staff were right there with ice water and menus.  We ordered THE GUILD DUO - guacamole and fire roasted green chile queso. (Actually ordered it twice - it was so good!) I'm a guac lover - and this was great.  I would have added a bit (more?) garlic - but I'm not complaining - it was great.  The star - OMG - the queso.  I'm in love with the queso.  I could take a bowl of it and eat as a main course.  I'd like to know  how they got that balance of flavor to enhance the cheese without overtaking it.  I tasted cheese AND green chile!  SCORE SCORE!!  My entree - the BEEF ENCHILADAS - birria beef, peppers, tomatoes, house-made corn tortillas, Jack cheese, birria sauce, avocado, sour cream, red beans, rice.  Two enchiladas stuffed full of the most incredible flavored meat - juicy, flavorful, beautiful, and filling.  The sides of beans, rice, avocado, etc were great - but the enchiladas themselves shine bright! SCORE SCORE SCORE etc. etc. etc.  Taco Guild, I'm sorry I doubted you.  Please accept my apologies and my love.  I will be back!  Soon.  Really soon!  And maybe I'll try the tacos.  I hear you do tacos, right?  SCORE!

A4z7a9mxCQD_2ayzXZTWqA.text: Excellent tacos! Great place, wonderful food in a fun atmosphere! Definitely recommend!

6fksIbEryXdgJ9Tc3ZYvBw.text: 3 stars because this place is the definition of mediocre. I'm unsure why I've been back here about 4 or 5 times in hopes that it would amaze me. Atmosphere and hosts/waiters are fantastic - unfortunately all blame here falls on the chef. Tacos are extremely underwhelming despite having a ton of ingredients. Simplify and focus on your freaking proteins and sauces. Chips are great, 4 different kinds of salsa - all equally bad. Food needs an overhaul to match this place's vibe and great staff.

x3HCvD3s_-XKubg0J_nKEg.text: The coffee cartel braised beef tacos were my favorite.  So flavorful and juicy.  The habanero butter on the corn was spicy but so good definitely something different.  Loved the variety of salsas that they bring to your table some hot some mild.

sSj4pcgkWQlBkFJz14oW5Q.text: Food is good but service is lacking. Every time I go there I find the wait staff arrogant and not that friendly. Maybe they don't like me. Who knows. I also find the menu limited. Could use a bigger variety of tacos.

yiAqS_Ti8JsJP9h2DPluvA.text: Live music. Delicious food. Amazing cocktails. Great service. What more could you ask for? Oh yeah, TACOS! This place is definitely worth the hype- highly recommend it if you're in Phoenix.

8SRKpbcA1st5BtizEffhdA.text: Delicious food and drink. Really interesting place with cool church ambiance. I had the fundido and the corn on the cob. So good. Definitely unusual but I really liked it. The only negative was the live music made it impossible to have a conversation or hear each other. I'll definitely go back!

8HG4ilNj44pmtY8NHKC8tg.text: Good food, great atmosphere! I can't come here without devouring a cherry steak taco and some street corn. Just thinking about it makes me want to come back.

Sru4hvw7H28Wka2X-oUWDg.text: The new menu is amazing (SO many new tacos!) & the blackberry margarita I had was awesome. People are friendly and it's a cool, hip place.

GIuTp4CexFQDLfpG4KyesQ.text: Absolutely amazing tacos and sides guacamole was the only downside but thats only because I like mine with a whole lot of spice! The food was to die for definitely coming back

RR5iQOI-1UV26zwhFzD_xw.text: STREET CORNNNN with Habanero Mayo? OH JEEZ. I've had elote before but never with Habanero Mayo. Usually it's just cotija cheese, mayo and hot sauce. This was absolutely scrumptious and you shouldn't be ashamed with stuffing your face because it is a messy snack, for sure. Highly recommend just eating it off the cob because everyone else here is doing the exact same thing. It's time to get your hands messyyyy!  I came to Taco Guild during dinner time and we were able to snag a table for our large group. The server was super nice and more than willing to provide you with his recommendations if you're unfamiliar with the menu. I went with the three taco platter and it came with the elote. I highly recommend the Chipotle Cherry Steak Taco. It was my favorite one of the night. If you're looking for a more nontraditional taco, then the Peking Duck one is cool to try. Also, you can't really go wrong with Al Pastor and Taco Guild made a pretty dang good one.   I was very satisfied with my meal. My elote was a little on the smaller side but the chef just provided me with an extra one, so it was definitely worth it. The meal was complete with a nice refreshing bottle of Mexican Coca Cola.  If you're in the area and you're craving Mexican Food and Tacos, Taco Guild is definitely a spot to check out. I will be dreaming of that habanero mayo for months to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco Plate with Street Corn. Pastor, Adovada and Cherry Steak

sELNJVgH-myZSzfOK02pOg.text: Loved the cherry chipotle steak tacos and happy hour margaritas! Old church converted into a great casual eating space. Interesting menu- definitely worth diverting a couple of miles off of the 10 freeway for!

0aDIs0TDa1QbMpVp_K3xfg.text: This place is a must if you're looking for a place to have authentic Mexican food. The restaurant is on a small lot, so the parking lot fills up pretty quick. I didn't dine in but while picking up my dinner the ambience seemed relaxed. One day, I'll dine in to enjoy their pleasantly flavored enchiladas, but until then I'll just enjoy it on the go.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Take out
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The enchiladas were delicious.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I love their salsa &amp; chips

cyazsga0aI3wV5WXDnHi7w.text: Omg! The best place for Mexican food we've tried! Ambiance, service and food was top notch! Best chips and tray of four salsas! Harlan, our bartender and server was amazing! I only wish it was closer to our house

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yuca Fries! These are delicious! Not greasy at all. My husband and I always sit at the bar because we just love the atmosphere here.

ewv5XcW_YzrLwaZKPRg5ug.text: My first visit to Phoenix and I found the most amazing restaurant! Just stepping in the door you know you're somewhere special. Staff was friendly and kindly explained the menu, even giving recommendations. Appetizer must is the street corn. ( We got the trio so to sample all of the seasonings). The three of us ordered two tacos each, all different, and every type was delicious. I highly recommend Taco Guild for casual, delicious food!

_qe0a0y5Qo6srJ2EKx4C8w.text: This is my first time here. It was highly recommended and suggested by a friend. The atmosphere is quaint and personable. The service received was very attentive and thorough. The food was amazing and had zesty taste. I ordered the taco plate which comes with a free side or their sweet corn on the cob for an additional $2.50. You can get any of their tacos on a corn or flour tortilla or in a lettuce cup. I was very satisfied all around with the food, service and atmosphere. I will definitely be back again and highly recommend this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Serene ambiance and atmosphere here at the Taco Guild in Phoenix

v-UcuNgt1wKf-PwiRpozVg.text: First time here. It's an old church so the inside is super cool. It's a really trendy place. The drinks are a little pricey but I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super cool appetizer.

7jaWUP-YUlFSlPD182c9Jw.text: OMG!!! the street corn is AMAZING!!!. It is a must if you go. The street tacos we shared 3: the steak, chicken and shrimp, All where fantastic!!! So flavorful and delish. There where five of us so we ordered the fresh guacamole and fire roasted green chile queso, both where fantastic.  The fresh salsa is a little spicey, I loved it but a couple of friends in our party couldn't handle the spice. The atmosphere is also amazing, trendy and hip, yet homie and warm. The servers where all very knowledgeable of the menu and super helpful with ordering. The samples of beer where a very nice touch! We will definately be back. So many other things to try!!!

yPjBIdu4gcqgiarnj89Dvg.text: Four of us dined. The restaurant is very clean with great decor; being a remodeled church. Mom ordered the soup of the day. My Aunt had a pork taco. Sister had three chicken tacos, and I had a customized vegan burrito. The guacamole and chips were excellent. A poll of our Jolly Diners was that it was a 3.5 rating out of 5. Issues: my sister had a 1 inch chicken bone in one of her tacos, the soup of the day type that the waitress quoted when ordered turned out not to be what she told us, so she brought another she thought my mom would like but it was too spicy, so mom ordered a taco. My aunt's taco was not put together very well when served(messy). When the chips were served, they were nice and warm and included four types of sauce. The first and most mild was hot as purgatory. The remaining three were hot as Hades. All were too hot for all of the Jolly Diners and so we needed to order non-spicy guacamole which was delicious. The food was good but because of the issue mentioned we gave it a 3.5. Well come back and try it again sometime in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Four chip sauces. Too hot for the Jolly Diners ranging from hot as purgatory, to hot as Hades.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh Guacamole and warm chips. Good.

FJwfa62jTsgGXjVMytnEjg.text: While the tacos are decent, I much prefer getting The Guild Duo (guacamole & queso). The queso is some of the best I've had! My fiance and I like to go during happy hour and get beer (they have the Papago Orange Blosson on draft which is a huge plus in my book) and share The Duo.   4 stars because we never know what we're going to get from the staff on any given visit. We've had a couple very nice waiters but also a few very awful ones (to the point where we had empty glasses, an empty chip bowl, and cold queso because we had no chips to eat it with so we had to sit there awkwardly for several minutes until we could continue our meal).  Overall, the ambiance is wonderful and I love what they've done to the inside of the old church. The food is good and I'll happily continue visiting.

7c7mNQKu8k35AOa9XOUBnQ.text: Visited this restaurant when I was in town because my sister had heard such great things about the tacos so we gave it a try! First impressions matter and this "little" restaurant was really great from the outside. The huge, wooden door and stained glass added a lot of character to the entrance. Upon entering the restaurant I realized it is much bigger than I had expected and judging by he crowds of people waiting for a table, I could tell that the food wouldn't disappoint. I think everyone at our table of 5 ordered a taco trio so between us all we tasted every one on the menu. Unfortunately, I wasn't blow away by them but there were some interesting combinations and flavors going on. I'm more of a traditional taco girl and these were pushing the boundaries a little on my tastebuds. The tacos were filling, the presentation was great, but I just wasn't digging them as much as I could have. The margaritas and other cocktails were delicious however! The service was impeccable and I was really impressed with everything else this restaurant had to offer so I'm happy to give 4 stars. I applaud the unique flavors and simple menu. We enjoyed our evening here and the live music was just the cherry on top!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome exterior!

uUvi_QG7kN90uFncHx1tpg.text: I'm not sure what I like better about this place...  The atmosphere of an old decommissioned church is awesomely unique. The lamb tacos were tremendous. The service was very simple and personal. The beer selection has some great local beers on tap. Me likey.

zi4c66mo7An5ZmQ_QYbKUA.text: In addition to my bad experience with the food on 5/12, I have a pending transaction for the regular priced ritas, not the happy hour ones I signed for. Waiting to see if there is an adjustment or if my bank has to fix it for them. I am hoping they don't run both charges, and that bartender should be sacked.-no bueno

CueWoshNlGCOph-8dBZ8XQ.text: It was interesting that they made this church a restaurant. Their complimentary chips was stale or wasn't cooked properly. Was not crunchy at all. The food looked good and presentation look good also BUT it tasted awful. Just terrible.  Duck Taco! Where's the duck? Just a terrible experience.

mgAMgv70PN6KfqAN4EAtrw.text: I've been here a few times and both times I've been disappointed. The shrimp they use tastes like it's been frozen forever and very rubbery.  After the second time I've decided that there are other Mexican taco places I could eat at.

49AxLEeuxlVM_ib27DwdJQ.text: This place is awesome!  Really good food.  Staff did a terrific job.  Atmosphere off the hook and the building unbelievable - Beyond cool.  For lunch, price is a little high but thoroughly enjoyed it.

xPEFWNC7SMu59IzK4ydPnA.text: Taco Guild is your go to favorite church spot on Sunday, that will have you praying for more. It leans in the middle for high quality food and the unforgettable taste. When you walk in the interior is a church like duplicate from the windows to the the design, very awesome! But I also heard it used to be a church. There brand is to serve local and organic products which is very good it's always good to go local. Hey! You get what you  pay for. As the first time going here, I had a delicious 1893 which is very 2017, see what I did there?! But for 5 dollars why not get a margarita. It's part of their happy hour menu drink they also do 1 off draught beers. Also a awesome thing is they give you free chips and salsa, not just one salsa but 3 other flavored ones to try! Be careful it might be spicy to the taste but nothing's wrong with a little spice in your life. Definitely a totally different menu from your regular taco shop, they take it and make it an adventure. Tacos were awesome, and I guess fairly priced, definitely check it out If in Phoenix. Cool vibes, cool people local too! Stay hungry Phoenix !

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Appetizer Chorizo Meatballs served in spicy chipotle picked prickly pear sauce fave! 7.50*
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily Taco Special x Al Pastor 4.50 (2.75)

asxkQU0J21rT2hcL5J7zMA.text: Met a friend for happy hour.  This place is amazing.  Great drinks and they have a daily taco special during happy hour.  Our daily taco special was a BBQ chicken taco.  Absolutely amazing.  Margaritas were super strong and you definitely get your money's worth.  Our waiter was friendly, professional and attentive without being pressuring.  Also, loved all the stained glasses and architecture of the former church.  Very cool setting.

PjAL6rTLEsTrylLJ4ejTOg.text: Hipster taco place in a church? Really?   Yeah, Really. This place is just awesome. I am by no sense of the word a "hipster", but it seems like that type of joint. But make no mistake, you're getting great food, great drinks, and TOP notch service.  Lets start with the tacos/food: They have two styles: Old World and New World. Cherry steak, Chipoltle chicken, lamb, thai snapper, a bunch of tacos that deviate from the standard. But they are fantastic. Some of the best tacos i have ever had in the states. When i visited Phoenix, i came here three times and tried every taco on the menu. The thai snapper was my favorite. The tacos were pricy for what they were but the quality is great.   Second, the bar: Awesome. The bartenders are the best part of this place. We did a sampling of mezcal (first time id heard of it). The bartender (hipster guy with beard and tattoos) was just awesome. Told us all the nightlife spots, and knew about seemingly everything behind his bar. Explained how certain liquors were made, local craft beer selections, just awesome.  We came back one night just to talk to him and have some drinks.  Ambiance: Oh yeah, this place is a church. I dont know the history of the building, but its made to look like a church. Steeple, stained glass windows. I have never really been to church before so getting wasted in one was a pretty cool experience. Don't miss this place if your'e in Phoenix.

JVKNh51BS0a57i_QvHUuEA.text: I've never seen a location like this! An old church turn into what seems to be a high-end Mexican food restaurant with its own personal twist. Me and my guess we're both there 4 our first times and we both thought the food was amazing the environment was equally up to par and the staff was extremely friendly all of them working hard absolutely amazing experience would definitely go there again!

N9mORpRgJvNczFaV2aYlpw.text: This restaurant was featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, and that recommendation alone was good enough for us, having looked forward a long time to trying it out. It is also touted online, in the menu, etc. as the "#2 best Mexican restaurant in the US"! After this experience, I think this must be a rating the restaurant has given itself. At almost any other Mexican joint we go, the food/service is better. The building and main part of the restaurant itself are super cool. We loved the feel and atmosphere, and is the only reason it I gave 3 stars. It was not even half-full when we arrived at 5-ish on a Sunday evening with a group of 20+ that was split up at three tables in a back room, six at our table. It was too warm with no atmosphere. Near the end of our meal, they finally opened an outside door in the room to some fresh air with 70+ weather, which was nice. Now to the meal. I ordered red wine which was so bitter, I sent it back. I got one each of a Guild Chicken and Al Pastor Pork taco. These are literally the smallest tacos I've ever seen, on a minuscule corn tortilla. The chicken was fairly tasteless with "dry" grated cojita so tiny (I like crumbles of fresh) that it was like a sprinkling of canned Parmesan cheese. There was no "grilled corn, red bean pico or avocado" visible, so very disappointing. The pork was to be served with grilled pineapple, jalapeno bacon and pickled red onion--sounds awesome, doesn't it?! The pork was good, but the only condiment visible were the onions. I had to douse each taco with one of the sauces served with the chips. My fiancee ordered the chicken enchiladas, which took so long that the rest of the table were half-way through their meals by the time it arrived. (Another guest ordered the same entree and his plate came out at the same time as the 4 plates of tacos. We insisted they go ahead and eat after waiting several minutes so their food wouldn't get cold.) I will say the enchiladas were pretty good. But $9 is too much for the 2 tiny barren tacos, with not even a veggie garnish of cabbage, lettuce, tomato, or anything! I wish I had asked what the $1.99 "Daily Taco" was, but by the time we could order, I forgot and the waiter did not offer a description; $4 wouldn't have been as bad. Anyway, except for having too many chips while we waited to be served, I left a bit hungry, disappointed and unsatisfied. We might return again to enjoy the atmosphere of the main restaurant and maybe, if we aren't a table of 6, the food would come within a reasonable time and the tacos would appear as literally described in detail on the menu.

P9G5LAupBbAO83kq_0MZ_Q.text: The location doesn't offer much parking. The food to say the least is bland. People hype this up too much and honestly it's over priced.

3akEyjPgLk8R7t-MroSGMQ.text: Given my love of tacos, eating tacos in a church felt pretty fitting.  And, even more fitting, they were some of the best tacos I've ever had.  The chips and salsa they brought out were amazing - there were 4 salsas including a really good verde salsa.  Two of them had quite a kick.  We had the guacamole with caramelized pineapple and mint - delicious!  It was a very generous portion of guacamole as well.  For our meal, I had the chicken, shrimp, and lamb taco and my husband had the chicken, lamb, and al pastor.  All of them were very good.  The tortillas were amazing.  Highly recommend!

4CjH_tAeGsGvHqzlKr6fDw.text: Drinks take forever.  Ambience is the only great thing that differentiates this place from other Mexican joints.  The food certainly does not and was very disappointing.

LTBRhXUbxIBWC-GBaau8dA.text: I went on the 13th/Saturday of August.  The real reason why I'm giving this place a 5 star is because of how nice and friendly their customer service is.  I was picking people up from the airport at 10 pm. I called before 10 pm to order specialty tacos, since they serve daily tacos after 10 pm. We got there around 10:40 pm, and when we walked in, there were mostly workers there.  We sat down at the bar and instantly our food came out within minutes. They weren't sure if we were still coming, but they made it for us. That was amazing!  The bartender and server was the real reasons why this place rocks. They were still full of energy and actually enjoyed having us there. They made jokes as we did with them.   The drinks were cool, and tacos were amazing!   I would definitely come back again.   I can see why this place is famous.

Nq-fdy_aoqXp5AXkdjxTlg.text: I consider myself a taco aficionado.  I know a lot of restaurants have their style of preparing tacos, and a lot of them are excellent (even the typical fried or greasy goodness that represents well, but is not the best for the body).   Enter Taco Guild.   Was this building a former Catholic church? Very cool decor, chic/modern with touches of the inquisition.  I like the portions (small) for several reasons.  You can order as many as you want, but 2 will probably suffice.  I had the AL PASTOR PORK grilled pineapple, jalapeno bacon, pickled red onion. 3.95 and the URBAN BEAN COFFEE BRAISED BEEF caramelized onion, mango jicama relish, Cotija cheese. 3.95. Priced reasonably and very delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_Y4w4Svtwt0jlRoEvBICKw.text: Amazing tacos. Personally, I recommend the Chipotle cherry steak and the coffee rub tacos. Outstanding salsa, one of if not THE BEST. great servers, reasonable price. The tacos are also larger than most. Very filling and satisfying, try not to fill up on the chips and salsa.

vugrdBc98zgMfY7R9shW0w.text: I have to say this place is interesting. The atmosphere is nice, I love the old church vibe. The service was up to standards. Very prompt and friendly. Though the vibe is nice, the food is the most important part!   I ordered the taco plate. I got the adovada, duck, and shrimp with rice as my side. The adovada was amazing!!!! I wish I ordered three of them. 10/10. However, the duck was gross. Actually gross. It tasted dirty. The shrimp was OK but definitely not anything special. I would not order it again but I wasn't horribly disappointed. The side of rice was obviously old because it was crunchy and tasteless... sadly.  Finally, the food came out extremely fast. Too fast. Too fast to be anything close to fresh.   Overall, I would come here again but I wouldn't come for dinner. It was too spendy ($19 with tip) for only one good taco. I'd be more willing to come for happy hour when things are cheaper and I won't be annoyed with subpar food because the menu was interesting. Though, interesting is only good if executed properly.

RdLKWnvqi1XZEoklYdHB8g.text: Wasn't too impressed by the food. The drinks were good and stiff. The atmosphere is cool. This is a nice place to hang with a group of friends or co-workers after work. Parking is a bit tight. I would give this place another try.

Jeg2KOGNmrMg4__4Os8vJg.text: I think they are trying too hard - the food, the setting... We ordered a few diff tacos. I didn't care for any of them. We tried the street corn- everyone said it was amazing. It was not amazing... Even the setting, an old church. It looked cool from afar, but in the end - not impressed.

3ILWJmfKjzmbcmr4WkNSXg.text: Incredible atmosphere, delicious gourmet food and super friendly service.  We'll be back soon, for sure!  The building alone is worth the trip - the resturant is inside a beautiful old church, complete with high ceilings, stained glass window and atmosphere out the wazoo!  The trappings of the restaurant (tables, bar, etc.) are blended nicely into this gorgeous setting.     Excellent food:  The guacamole was delightfully fresh and delicious and the complimentary salsa was tasty (chips - a bith thick for my taste, but fresh).  The tacos really stole the show.  I got the Thai Snapper taco and the Shrimp Taco, and both were super impressive!  I was delighted to discover that, in addition to corn or flour tortillas, you can order them in lettuce wraps!!  I'm not a huge fan of tortillas, and this means I can fit more guacamole in my tummy, plus the lettuce is fresh and delicious, giving the tacos a lovely summery lightness.  I also had a bite of the seasonal vegetable taco, which somehow tasted even better than mine - woah!  The seasonal veggie side was small and tasty, too (I sampled my husband's).  We took advantage of the Sunday Happy Hour (starts at 2pm, all day!) and had beers and wines at a bargain to complement our tasty eats.  Their beer list is short but super local - Four Peaks, Oak Creek, Cartel.  Our server was funny and attentive (excellent drink refills).  Overall, a big win!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dee-licious tacos in lettuce wraps!! Shrimp on right, snapper on left.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. From left to right: shrimp, seasonal veggie and red snapper, with side of seasonal veggies. Dang, tasty!!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa in a beautiful place

T08F-CfHMFh5KjBOPDiLSQ.text: I go out of my way to eat here. The food, service, prices and ambiance are all top notch. The drinks are strong too and brunch is a definite DO here if you're fond of spicy food... If you're not overly fond of spicy beware the smaller salsas they hand you with chips. Taste sooo good but hurt sooooo bad. Wow.

fITmAgjNj2Fp8hB1TEHeyA.text: Awesome Mexican food!! Came here with a friend, and was wowed by how cool the place is. Such cool decorations and the stained glass windows were awesome! I got the enchiladas which I thoroughly enjoyed. Would definitely come back. My only downside was that it is a little on the pricier side, but worth it as they use organic products and local foods!

2Pi7_AwHmQHtBn1-2hyszQ.text: This is my favorite Mexican food restaurant in Phoenix. The food is great! The atmosphere is really cool and every time I have gone for dinner they have live music which makes it a lot of fun to go their on a date night or with friends.

VXEXzxY6fwYtfMpZqS64tg.text: Wow and wow again! I loved this place!! Definitely was my favorite spot when I visited Phoenix. I think everyone should come here if they visit or even pass through. Totally worth it! Excellent margaritas and fast friendly service. And they serve elote!! The whole restaurant is made out of an old church so the decor and architecture go with that theme. Loved my time here. The food was excellent! I loved how they had old world and new world tacos lined out on their menu. So you can get carnitas and pastor but also duck! All decked out with different kinds of veggies and salsas. So rad! They have an amazing queso dip and their guacamole was perfect! I will most definitely come back to this cool spot the next time I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elote corn on the cob, duck pork and chicken tacos, different salsas, light and crazily chips, a great margarita, and their queso dip!

LsL0odnVCpjQIoS4KXt3aQ.text: Really great food and drinks... Nicolas at the bar was great.  I can't wait to go back.

IkJfJqgcA-95s1jWLNynFw.text: Food was pretty good.  They were generous with drinks.  Had a good time with friends, definitely will be back!

3ql0YSSivL3uqsw8yZZTlA.text: Yes! What an amazing place!!! Came here for dinner with friends and OMGeeee, talk about a cool place!!!! I loved EVERYTHING about the place. The tacos are amazing, the flour tortillas are OUT OF THIS WORLD. Lime rice is delish. Also, the free chips and salsa are UNREAL!!!!! If you haven't been here, STOP here for some real, authentic tacos!

iA1BUq9NEUjHGMg4Rnn49g.text: go for happy hour great deal, good drinks incredible building with piece of phoenix history  parking is not great

H5dEG_T8VtIK8sYcVhZVJQ.text: The daily taco is delicious and a great deal. I prefer the daily tacos that are not chicken, but they are all good. Also the pork Posole is very very good.

mbPSv30VAJDq5uDDlUUCLA.text: Apart from the amazing ambiance I sadly wasn't impressed with the food. I was expecting the greatest tacos and I knew after my first bite I would be disappointed. I ordered 3 different kinds of tacos including chicken, beef and pork and all I kept thinking was that each needed just a little more flavor. If bland tacos are your thing then this place is definitely for you. Otherwise I would say go here for the drinks and pass on the food. Bummer because I really wanted to like it.

BAI8gT2z7K7nUCu86UH8Aw.text: This place was great. It was the bomb!!!  Their street tacos were delicious and they have friendly waiters!!!!! 1 million stars. I have to go to there again.

Kq15SyWtSi4_JXYEQpE50g.text: So I FINALLY had a chance to stop at Taco Guild today and my oh my, was I blown away. The inside of the church is revamp porn. Glam/Midevil/Missionary/Catholic/Vintage and Goth rolled into one amazing place to enjoy a meal.  The salsa was delicious. The tacos were amazing! I was incredibly thrilled to see they used home made tortillas in their tacos. Great happy hour menu! Friendly staff and QUICK serving times. Quality ingredients and unique flavorings. I have a new favorite spot to add to my regular outings list. I am thrilled to have Taco Guild in Phoenix. The music is pretty random as well, but I liked it. As I told my friends, Taco Guild is basically church, tacos and Drake all at once. Enjoy lovelies! Five stars!   (Brown person approved lol)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tikeaeEtjvhhjEqTMj2lGQ.text: The ambiance of this place, along with a great waiter, Chris, made the good that much better. Lamb and Duck Tacos were delish! Keeping the church structure with the stained glass windows along with other rehabbed items are awesome! I look forward to coming back to town and trying something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This place used to be an old church and has been very tastefully remodeled.

fdSW82X0VDObFj2AjU2_ug.text: Mimosas are delicious here! Bloody Mary was spicy and tasty. They start you off with, you get complimentary chips and four types of salsas.   The pineapple mint guacamole was a great start to our meals. Sweet and perfectly seasoned, topped with caramelized pineapple.   All together we tried the duck, shrimp, lamb, and thai curry tacos. My favorite, hands down was the duck, it's topped with roasted peaches that compliment the juicy shredded meat just perfectly! Second was the shrimp, flavorful and the sauces it came with with chosen just right for this one. The lamb was overpowered by the tartness of the blue cheese, and the sweet potato hay made it too dry, decent at best. Coconut thai curry was also one we could have left behind, bland and simple.   The interior was pretty cool, and staff was friendly. Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caramelized pineapple-mint guacamole left me speechless. One of the best guacamoles I&#39;ve ever had by far!!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mimosas were fresh and delicious, Bloody Mary was tasty and very spicy. Complimentary chips and four types of salsa yumm!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp taco (left) was zesty and flavorful, lamb taco (right) was a little dry

q7tZbdgnzbxwAW7rXLaLvQ.text: This place is awesome!!!  Service: pleasant House Margarita: really good (Frozen or rocks) Food: excellent Beer selection: surprisingly good Tequila selection: They have a tequila bible, so...... yeah

HzL700m4RzZt5jBH5rmVVg.text: Cherry steak taco was excellent and their tres leches cake was delicious with cinnamon and nutmeg.

SXoCjFPjVM5nKz-cu9KQHw.text: Overrated. Overpriced.  Nice reclamation project. Decent food & bar.   But like I said:  Overrated. Overpriced.    Some investors place no doubt.

JQufvETQP0o1VvP7VPiy2w.text: Love this place!! The Cherry Chipotle Steak Tacos are the best tacos in Phoenix, MUST TRY!!

ksjAQVLqVuhtUchtsmxldQ.text: The atmosphere was gorgeous and very unique, however the food lacked flavor. I left unsatisfied after eating the bland steak enchiladas platter with rice and beans.  The beans had zero flavor and the enchiladas were dry on the outside (hardly any sauce). The only think I liked here were the chips and salsa. I won't return unless I am in the area and I am craving chips and salsa and a margarita.

n4fqhftxZK1TtfPGnYXLuw.text: We haven't been greeted with anything but top notch service! The salsa selection is just wonderful, and their tacos are exquisite. The happy hour could be better, but that is a fact lost by the time I leave.

oAZb2urpacFMImbtR-NVew.text: Both the interior and the exterior are beautiful The hostess was super upbeat and sat us in a matter of seconds Our server was just OK I could rate less on the serving aspect of my visit but I'm a nice person He wasn't horrible but he was a little slow  For lunch I got the Taco Plate The Taco Plate consists of 3 tacos and a side I went with the Al Pastor Pork, the Grilled Seasonal Veggie, and the Chipotle Cherry Steak... While all were good, my favorite was the Al Pastor Pork It had such good flavor and the toppings complimented the meat very well My recommendation: The Al Pastor  Also, they have great deals on drinks during Happy Hour

qVXSROHHptHBjh1CqdNQxQ.text: This place is nice but the tacos are not good and too expensive!! The hand made tortillas they advertise are not even warm when they deliver the tacos. Worst thing is a cold tortilla!!

5RnkGBF0N6INUDPOGetOVQ.text: Appetizers were the best part of the meal. Had high hopes for this place. Atmosphere is fantastic. But the tacos left us dissatisfied. Very bland. Appetizers  had more flavor. Service was slow. Won't be coming here again

TROTKftc4zyOBnNSY6eoeg.text: The atmosphere, service , drinks and food are equally balanced in their quality. All excellent.

s6eePouxhtF5dU02m-2cjA.text: PLEASE CLEAN YOUR BATHROOMS. I've been here multiple times and each time the bathrooms are like a Frat house at 2am. I know a restaurant is so much more than it's bathrooms but it just gives a gross feeling to the whole place. The carpeted room out the back is always in a state of disarray too, carpet in a restaurant is never a good idea from a sanitary point of view. On the plus side the food is always good (not great), drinks are spot on.

WZpkiWZ5wsd5LZ8SCHJ9tA.text: Duck and lamb tacos? Are you freaking kidding me?! If you're branching out into unconventional stuff but can't make a decent carnitas or carne asada taco, you should rethink your restaurant. Taco Guild is all flash, no substance. It's biggest saving grace is it does have decent local beers on draft and some nice cocktails. Come for the ambiance and drinks, not the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The interior of the restaurant is an old church. The wood roof is visible and there&#39;s some stain glass windows on all sides.

npEHESa8V6hpZjifF1YSyA.text: Best tacos I've had by far. I had the shrimp taco and the Ono taco. They did not skimp on the protein portion. My boyfriend had the al pastor, peaking duck and chipotle cherry braised steak and he was in love. Must go back! The chips and salsa were great and their margaritas were really well done!!!

_DvIo7hE7IqRD1i3a5MMPg.text: The place to be on Saturday night. Great ambience and wonderful live music. Went with the Lamb and Duck tacos. Also started with the meatballs. Delicious! Staff is wonderful and very customer focused. Can't beat the prices and surely can't beat the environment. Glad we stopped in and will definitely be back.

srwEJIS3RPK0AI33BAqBAQ.text: Excellent service here, and the decor is interesting. I'm not sure I love it. It doesn't offend me or anything, it's just sort of odd.  The food itself was pretty good, but I've had better tacos elsewhere.

m8mqD5H7NO_zZVdqTwiysQ.text: Just moved into "the hood" and excited to have found this gem!  The husband and I stopped in for a quick bite Sunday brunch-ish time, and had a great time. I am pretty sure that we were the first patrons in the building and the bartender was very eager to serve us. We parked ourselves at the bar and looked over the brunch menu.   We each picked a few tacos and decided to split a street corn. Our bartender was very nice to ask if we would like them to put the corn off the cob, I very enthusiastically accepted. No need for corn teeth.   The tacos were delish!!!! My breakfast taco, was ok, but eggs don't have a ton of flavor on their own so no fault of theirs there. They put this awesome jalapeno infused bacon inside, very interesting and yummy! I also had the chicken taco, which was perfect! Very juicy and flavorful, usually chicken can be underwhelming, but they hit it on the mark. Jon had cherry steak (I think that is what it was called) and a pork taco and a breakfast one as well. The steak was killer, they put these pepper fried string things on top that made the whole taco. The pork was very good as well, but probably my least fave of the tacos we had.   The street corn was my only disappointment. It isn't what I am used to like at Blanco or Gallo Blano. Theirs is spicy, less creamy and kinda watery. I don't think I would get it again, but some people might like it, you decide.   The place looks great, and being walking distance from mi casa I can see me being there often.

umsKOPElVLdD9CRAQIYRgg.text: Today was my first time at Taco Guild and I found the entire visit to be very disappointing and the entire reason was because of the level of service I was provided.   As a person with food allergies (dairy, gluten and corn) I try to be as straightforward and responsible about my understanding of a menu as possible before visiting a restaurant. That way I can arrive with some ideas for what I will eat and ask some clarifying questions/inform the server of my needs to ensure that what I am ordering is something I can eat. This is so I do not haw to send something back or take too much time making a decision, which is what I did today.   I ordered three tacos all without cheese and in lettuce wraps rather than tortillas after explaining my food allergies to the waitress. We cut the cheese and and were good to go... So I thought.   When my food arrived, my two beef tacos had breaded and fried green chiles (not gluten free) on them. The menu simply says green chile strips and the waitress failed to inform me they were breaded and fried. Well, alright, I'll pull them off. No one is perfect and my food allergies make things a little difficult. Then, under all that is meat that is covered in a cream based sauce... Great. Well, I guess I'll just move on to the other taco.   I took a bite of the Peking Duck taco and bit into a 3 inch bone that was shaped and was as sharp as a toothpick. I should have taken a picture. I was so frustrated. So I finally waived the waitress offer. She said, "Oh, well that happens sometimes. I can call my manager but she's just going to tell you the same thing." Which she did. Are you kidding me? That is the answer you give a customer? I was done after that. They comped one taco and I paid $19 to go home hungry and eat leftovers. Oh, they also gave me a $5 coupon for my next visit. Well, that was a waste of paper because I will not be returning.

HCBUkgltFE88iJS7XzAsLA.text: I was passing by this place on my way home today. And I was hungry so I took my phone out and checked out yelp to see what people were saying. I would have to say jackpot. Because it was great. The food , service and the prices wasn't bad.   I like that you can buy different taco in stead of some kinda comb plate. So I got three different ones and the street corn which was great.. For me the shrimp one was not that spicy like the different review said. And I really do not like to give 5 stars but this place made my day!!!!

1Ze-nzR4ga0gE_gdm7hpIQ.text: After having a really bad first impression and writing a review about a month ago we were contacted by Kennedy Turner from Taco Guild and invited us to return. This time things were much different. We walked in and was immediately greated. We decided to sit at the bar and was greeted by a wonderful bartender (forgot her name but she was pregnant). She told us about upcoming events and about the awesome new live music they have on saturdays. We asked for taco suggestions and we got some great ones. We ended up with the Pork Adavado, Thai snapper and the shrimp. They were all amazing.  I decided to update my review because I belive that they were very deserving of it. We will definitely be back and I highly recommend  this place! !!  Thank you Kennedy Turner for taking care of the original issue and going above and beyond to make sure recaptured our business.

ucPCOH-5e0gHXOz4fZwkFA.text: I have driven by this place many times and today I decided to check it out with some work friends. The chips and salsa was amazing. I got the chicken and shrimp street tacos and they were both yummy. My friends had salads, see pictures. They loved their food too. The grilled veggies were really flavorful too. We are going back for happy hour soon.. The Parking sucks since there are other businesses close by, but be patient and you will find a parking spot. I would suggest car pooling to this spot with friends. The decor is awesome and it was very clean. Great place to take friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad with Chicken..
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very flavorful grilled veggies!!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Taco and Chicken Taco. Delicious!!

KT3aTtPju19NdC8g0IA2QA.text: It was ok, but I honestly expected better based on the way everyone talks about it. I came in with a group of about 10 with a reservation made two weeks prior, and our table was not ready until about 20 minutes after the scheduled time, with no apology. Also due to the layout, there was nowhere to wait, so our big group was just milling about in front of the door trying to stay out of the way as best as possible.   The tacos were ok, but very pricey for the size of street tacos. I couldn't get anyone to refill my drink. Ultimately, if it were up to me, I would not return here, although it is a staple in Phoenix, so I imagine that I will. Maybe just for drinks.

eXTqEl6IjR7VhBrUnMO5vQ.text: We came here for a happy hour to celebrate a coworkers anniversary. I had heard some great things about not only the food and drink selection, but the super cool ambience.   As the previous reviews and pictures imply, the ambience is absolutely one of the highlights of any visit here. Not only is the whole renovated church thing super neat, but they have this GINORMOUS chandelier that hangs in the middle and is a focal point right as you walk in.   I was a little disappointed with the HH selection. None of the food seemed to be discounted other than a daily special taco and one margarita was available for HH pricing. I think they maybe offer $1 off beers, but overall the HH selection was a little bit weak. It would've been nice to see some discounted apps on the list or maybe offer a wider selection of margs.   The service was spotty. The best term I can think of to describe our waiter would be aloof. We had to flag him down to order apps and when we wanted to order a second round (all our drinks were empty at the table) he only asked the two people nearest to him if they wanted another. Again, we had to flag him down after he walked away so that the rest of the table (only 6 of us) could get another drink.   I'm not a tequila buff, but this place has an extensive selection. Food-wise, there's really not much more than tacos and a few apps. I'd love to see a salad or quesadilla on the menu in the future. The food was really good I will say, I had a steak and blue cheese taco and sampled all the apps. Queso is really yummy and the guac was super fresh. The meat ball app was a bit spicy to my liking but it was still tasty.  Would come back here... But would hope to have a little bit better service

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yFLzKfnq1v6ltGCKuHbwEw.text: I gave this a five star even though a little bit pricey that New York tacos... I love how they convert the little chapel into a taco restaurant. Overall the food are amazing the staff are awesome. Not just that the owner also, is very helpful and inviting.

Hz4R4y72oP16kf73Ob_ETg.text: This place was included in 20 places to check out in the US I this article I read. I had to come on my next visit to AZ! Its  an old church converted into a Mexican food restaurant/ bar. Beautiful stained glass windows and Holy deliciousness! The cocktails are unique and delicious the salsa variety is nice. The fundido dip was very tasty and the tacos were fantastic . My favorite were the steak tacos. It's definitely worth crossing over the threshold of the large heavy door marked with a G to experience the ambiance and food and drink. It would be an extremely cool spot to have a private event. As well as to try a variety of tequila drinks and yummy tacos and you might even be tempted to do the sign of the cross after its so good

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very cool light fixtures
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Braised beef taco and steak taco so good
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fundido dip

uq2-14xZYvw3ho_iN6jqZw.text: This is probably my favorite taco place, the Pork & Chicken tacos are amazing. The service was quick & the staff appeared really happy to serve us. I went there for lunch with a friend and we shared 4 taco plates of the shrimp, veggie, chicken & pork tacos and they were all so, so good. We'll be back for sure!

N_f8VToIDedC8b9uhoXV1g.text: On a 1-10scale the food was a 7 but the environment, live music and service was a 10.  Really cool place and would comeback again.

4uRqBtgkWLJfezYpGcfkcw.text: Super fun environment with great food! Try the barbecue romaine salad! And corn! Tequila flights are fun as well!

7qCjetfD31VIJv09x7yYDA.text: Loved this place!! I had the daily special tacos and they were fabulous! The atmosphere was very cool. They turned an old church into a restaurant. We all really enjoyed it! Great place for a celebration!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CoVUihMfFY88LgL66L2EPQ.text: This place has amazing food.    For starters, I sampled their 1895 margarita, twice.  For our appetizer, we had the guacamole with pineapple mint.  I had a difficult time deciding between this one and jalapeno bacon guacamole, but I'm glad I tried this unique fusion.  The caramelized pineapples complimented the light mint flavor, and the creaminess of the guacamole smoothed it all out into one amazing little dip.  Added with the appetizer was the complimentary salsas.  The standard salsa was full of flavor.  The spicy salsa was habanero salsa, which was smokey and sweet.  I had to get some to go! For the main course, we had every taco available, excluding the taco of the day (we think!). This ended up changing my understanding of tacos altogether.  For example, the Peking duck taco was topped with fried Brie, so we had a stronger flavored meat mixed with a mild cheese.  Delicious.  My wife's favorite taco was the taco with pork and mango (al pastor pork).  My personal favorite was the pork adovada.   For dessert, we had coconut creme pie and prickly pear sorbet.  The sorbet was just right.  It wasn't saccharine by any means.  If you've had the fruit, it is just like that in flavor profile.    All in all, I'm really glad we came.  For being rated number two in the country, it's earned this position.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The entranceway to heavenly food
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The spectacular bar
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The unique guacamole

dhwulOmtr49aqxwqXny14w.text: Tacos were the greatest ever! I loved the lamb taco. Then I had the Tres Leches cake.  I will definitely revisit.

QkTfO1zt2BogqQASgIcwLQ.text: So delish! Chipotle cherry tacos and street corn are to die for!! Great atmosphere and food. The margs are strong and great.

eys_faqio9HniefI4i1O9g.text: After several recommendations my coworker and I decided to give this place a try. Very cool decor it was a former church turned restaurant. Try the chipotle corn it was amazing. The steak and chicken tacos also did not disappoint!

6Lcy3_qJsw6RmEPmBgqVmQ.text: Food was great but too loud for this old rocker. Staff needed either training or coffee, was slow. Maybe because it was jammed. I recommend them if you like a rowdy delicious meal.

Yy78gtLL8nKdGNUvcJqPOg.text: This is one of the coolest restaurant venues in Phoenix with terrific beer, cocktails, and cuisine. The building is an old church and the architect was careful to maintain and highlight those aspects creating an elevated, upscale environment.   The food is elevated Hispanic cuisine, lots of vegetarian options, I've never had something I didn't love.

QcsTNrwDo2mb_g4rJrFEZw.text: Wonderful! We enjoyed each plate. The guacamole with Serrano peppers was a perfect way to start. We had a number of different tacos, each was balanced and delicious. The Street Corn was unusual and memorable. The Fundido was also very good. The bourbon signature cocktail was also very good. The setting (an old church) reinforce that this is not a typical restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street Corn and three different tacos

e7azFpaAoTweGcpxquwFWw.text: This is probably the second or third time that I came down here with both times being right before closing because that's usually when I feel like turning into full fatass mode. Parking is alright though during busy hours like during lunch and dinner, it's certainly difficult to get parking especially with Starbucks a literal stone's throw away.   The place certainly has enough space inside though to house a good sized crowd with huge bench tables for probably a 8-12 people on the larger ones. There's also an outside covered patio which is smaller but also looks like it could hold a alright sized group.   They used to carry the Four Peaks brand of alcohol but stopped since they try to only carry local and Four Peaks sold out toe Anheuser Busch. I had a Woodchuck though and it was quite good. I prefer apple-ly stuff like Woodchuck, Strongbow or maybe a Stella Cider when I don't drink liquor. Aside from that, they still have a wide assortment of local crafted alcohol.   Food was good. I wanted the ceviche that was the chef's special for the day but since the kitchen was just about closed, I got the daily special instead which was the red chile pork tacos. They were still pretty delicious. I had three of the tacos and combined with the salsa and chips that are complimentary, I walked away quite full.   Service was fast and friendly. Place was clean and looks pretty of cool since it's built around a church...really nice stained glass windows.  I would recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp and Scallop Ceviche
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Red chile pork tacos

Z6oMMQJ-einUi-sqg7V__g.text: Really quaint place to grab food & drinks! The salsa was the best part of the meal in my opinion! Definitely check it out if you're in the area!!

e7UjE5Ipoo_QIBuQXnT1uA.text: Place is legit   Came here with a local and fell in love with the charm.  $6 top shelf margaritas at happy hour! What a deal  Got the Ceviche and it came with flour chips. Bomb  Deviled eggs with Chorizo stole the show. Tacos were ok. If gourmet tacos are your thing it's a must visit. I'm a street taco guy and from California so...  Manager hooked up two duck taco and they were excellent.   All in all loved the place. I work in the industry and they knocked it out of the park

lEFh5e03aLPF6XOJ7Dl8Sw.text: Love this place! Historic location, screaming tacos and kick-ass margaritas. What more could you ask for?

V1qGEFKXwGuJT6HDB-878A.text: Great happy hour. Ceviche is excellent and their happy hour margaritas were good enough that we came back twice. Definitely a must-stop in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RF6HW5gogc_cDRqhutcivQ.text: I always get the street tacos, dinner or lunch. You can mix and match any three and they are better than the others I have tried around town. I always forget this until I go back. There street corn is amazing... not as good as Joyride,.. but a very close second. They have great beans. I think there might be two kinds, but the house beans are the ones to get. If you just want to go for a beer with chips and salsa, you will be happy too. The thing that makes this place a 5 star is the fact that its made in an old church. It sure makes up for the parking :-)

T39RfQvaxTrqHdSBaGdJvQ.text: This restaurant really impressed tonight. I had read a few mixed reviews and went in not knowing what to expect. Not only was the food impressive (diablo deviled eggs were awesome) but the service was on point. Everyone in the restaurant was focused on the end goal from servers, to bartenders, to managers and the executive chef. It's been a while since I have seen service this impressive.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jOJDl2ajeFT64BGozI0HHw.text: I absolutely loved my first experience at Taco Guild! First of all, the restaurant is set inside of an old chapel and the story of the restaurant can be found toward the end of the drink menu. I really liked the stained glass windows and huge chandelier! From the very beginning our server was very friendly and attentive. I'm a self-professed wimp when it comes to spicy food (more on the menu later), and I never had to ask for a water refill! The servers were amazing. Next, the tacos were great! I ordered the Yucatan Shrimp Taco and the Chipotle Cherry Steak Taco. Both were great! I especially liked the flavor combinations in the Chipotle Cherry Steak taco. Our group ordered a wide variety of tacos and we all said we would order them again. We also ordered an appetizer of the Fundido in addition to the complimentary chips and FOUR types of salsa!! Can't wait to go back to Taco Guild!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Left: Chipotle Cherry Steak Taco Right: Yucatan Shrimp Taco

zN0qmRjJzt3RfHDzDUvP_Q.text: What happened?  I've been to this place a few times before, but last Tuesday I brought some family members here, after talking it up, and was very disappointed that we didn't have a good experience.  The tacos for 'taco Tuesday' were very bland.  No flavor on them.  The chips and queso/guacamole were good.   I'm bummed because I love the atmosphere of this place and the wait staff is great, but the tacos seem to have lost their flavor  ;-(

CChBdAcpxUfqtlg7UjgM6A.text: Great place! Beautiful building, used to be a church. Very good service. Delicious tacos and I'm not a big tacos fan. Awesome margaritas. Live music. Everything about this place is great and worth the wait.

MrFlwvoVq-SzE-wHVrBqkQ.text: Very interesting and cool place in Central Phoenix, I felt like I was out of the country for the night and in Europe. The decor and atmosphere of this restaurant would absolutely hands down get 5 stars! The food on the other hand would get 3.5 stars. So I've decided to give 4 stars for Taco Guild.  The best part of my evening was the chips and array of salsas they give you to start the meal. They were all so different with their own little kick.  (Can't wait to enjoy again soon).  As for the remainder and entrees, we opted to go with the Jalapeno Bacon Fresh Made Guacamole. I will say that it was fresh but it was not that tasty for my liking. We finished with a trio of tacos - Al Pastor Pork, Tropical Ono and Grilled Seasonal Vegetable.  The tropical Ono was probably the best with flavors, but all of them lacked taste according to their descriptions. We also tried the street corn and although it was juicy it lacked flavor.   I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere at Taco Guild, job well done!

Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa starter!
