yNbUTSA-S5HasKPbCZsY9Q.text: This most definitely is in my top 5 favorite steakhouse here in Arizona and my oh my do they have some amazing corn on the cob. I can't not wait to go back and their service is on point, also the place is super cute from the inside out.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

s4yioXM2YvZ6k14_RBfg2A.text: The guacamole puts all others to shame! The drink is called The Legend and there is no doubt why. The Tres Leches cake...I had to take a 2nd picture half way through devouring it. My first impression looking at it was "WOW!" My next impression was "this cake has a soul!!! And it's delicious!" You just can't find food that captures the essence of the culture like this. A must have before you die!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their signature guacamole, the drink is called The Legend and Tres Leches cake. Such a celebration of life!!!

EoIO46M11zpKaTGKbJVIVA.text: This is one of my favorite local Mexican Restaurants. The converted church is one of the best reuses of a space in Phoenix, including their awesome stain-glass windows. I love their burnt romaine salad--and their street tacos are amazing. You will notice a lot of folks ordering the corn on the cob w Mexican cheese and spices, too. They have a great Sangria and their chips and guacamole is fabulous. Highly recommended!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old Stain glass window delight this converted church to a fabulous local restaurant

a0FQSWhFrF1YXgoiLkKZ6w.text: I highly recommend 10/10 great tequila options! Amazing food! House-Made corn tortillas are so good! They even have vegan options!

Dg1rXm1xqk_vq2Uhbq1Uhg.text: We had dinner and drinks at this place last weekend. The setting is so cool... in an old church.  The food is fabulous! Make sure you have the Mahi Mahi tacos!  The service is exceptional and the tequila selection is the best in town!  Don't miss going to this place - no matter where you live in the valley, it is worth the drive.

_LcT6y-u2U_9dBloQVVh9Q.text: The historic old church building is beautiful and so different than most places in Phoenix, history and a great energy.  Taco Guild has a younger vibe but offers amazing fresh tacos with flavor and creativity, crisp street corn, desserts and a lot of fun adult beverages.   A must for taste and ambience.

SheMX6rrnYLFiDGnmyHRbQ.text: Great Tacos, Margaritas and Atmosphere. Give them a Five out of Five. Although their Drink Menu is the most ridiculous thing I've ever tried to use/open....whoever designed it must have thought it looked great but never tried to use the thing while sitting at the bar.....

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NEZmfVDl8vG-qK84pPYRUg.text: I have been to this amazing spot more than a couple. I go about 2 times a month. It is always a great place to go and enjoy drinks and food. The chips and salsa are top notch with 4 different salsas to try at the table. My favorite is the habanero orange salsa. Very good with the right amount of kick to it. The main reason I go here is the tacos. They are always amazing and come out very quickly. I would recommend this place to anyone.

nf-vltBiLuxvgZ0GMcD2dw.text: The coffee braised beef is my fav, and don't miss out on the corn!   As for the staff, if you're wanting to be seated inside at a table, you'll probably be waiting for a bit - even to just be acknowledged. Grab a seat at the bar, and you'll be better off!   Drinks are a bit pricy, but well made.

QTNO2au4qIFzFmohhbW2Mg.text: I have been wanting to come here for a long time. It's such a unique environment. Bathroom is so nice  and clean. Our waiter was awesome a long with the door greeter, very friendly and helpful. We ordered the diablo eggs and we loved them! We also had the guacamole, very good! Ordered the street corn... Amazing!! I think it was my favorite of everything! We had the chicken guild tacos, different but good, the shrimp tacos very crisp n clean tasting, everything was so good, their different salsas each unique my favorite the tomatillo. Overall we really enjoyed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco Guild
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beauty
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa

B05zemjUD9ZLXZfHMGXghw.text: In an old church. Decor tried to keep many of the church items, pews against walls, stain glass, murals, in the center are all high seating which are difficult to move in and out. A few candle stands and love the jukebox in between the old Methodist Church sign.  Music is very loud and upbeat and sometimes drowning for conversations.  Chips and Salsa are very good. Salsa and 3 different sauces, that go up in heat, but the salsa is still the best.  Ordered 3 street tacos pork adovado, shrimp and Peking Duck along with the corn on the cob. Out o f the street tacos, like d the Pork Adovado the best followed by the Shrimp.  Eating for happy hour is the way to go for $1.99 per taco rather than almost $5.00 per taco regularly.  Service was very good and the interior was fun and upbeat, prices were a little on the high side.   With all the mexican restaurants in town, if you want real mexican food this is not your place, if you want hip mexican food and a chic place to be seen or even take out of town guest, this is unique and a place for you.

pXm7Oqpljtn51uw_60r4PQ.text: Dining inside a renovated Methodist church from the late 1800's is a 1st for me and a must for others , church goer or not this place is a must visit ! It's decor alone is a must see .. the food is very tasty and you won't be disappointed ! Even the salsas are memorable if your a salsa person !  Ask your server about the history , very interesting ! Teaser , the bar use to be the altar !

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2oTpVhtKxgtkgQ_Voz66AQ.text: Food is just ok. Service has never been great. I usually go there with my in laws and maybe they aren't "cool" enough to get good service. Pickled onions are disgusting.

l0S7nY3VBYf98o0_8BUPfA.text: Very cool set up with the hole Mexican church vibe they have. Tacos were delicious, especially the lamb. I would suggest you come during happy hour since the drinks are cheaper.

EdWaUvukzYG9tZ3V-SjdnQ.text: This place looks cool on the inside. Their chips and salsa are amazing. The coke tasted really good. I was shocked at their prices for the tacos. Almost $4 for a regular size taco. SMH. It's a ripoff. And I had the chicken enchilada which tasted like the ones  you buy from the store and heat up in the microwave. You are better off going elsewhere. I will never come back here. I honestly don't know how people can say it's great.

sXwJqjLovV9e7AV_z0TXlg.text: Food was good, roasted corn was excellent. Minimal options for vegetarians, which made it difficult for my friend to eat. Got somewhat loud due to being such a small space. Great atmosphere and decor!  Waiter seemed a little disappointed that no one I was with would be drinking.

_oVP11vh-WsxuNtIkNpwNg.text: The decor looks cool, but then you notice it's an old church- and they left a lot of the original church stuff, so it's creepy. Look, I'm not even religious, but it felt wrong to be drinking and hanging out like that in a former place of worship that was obviously so sacred and special to so many people for so long. It felt like I was tap-dancing on graves- you can read all the previous donors to the church- undoubtedly devout religious people from the neighborhood that are certainly turning in their graves that their donations to their beloved church is now a freaking bar. The food is meh, so I will NOT be back here. It was too forced and felt wrong.

bjXSLzFoM-WNTaiGziKCUA.text: Place looks amazing, food not that great.  There are way better mexican and taco places around the area

m7tzZc6-nGZI31GZ7vUa9Q.text: Not a fan. The atmosphere is high tops and large bar in what looks like a mission but also lots of tvs for the sports fans.  We tried a bunch of the tacos. The only meat that had flavor was the coffee beef. The others were sweet..  Just weird

qBobIwSNQ1-SH1doHcrRag.text: Hands down, the best tacos you'll ever have in Phoenix! The Chipotle Cherry Steak tacos are truly to die for!!! The Margaritas are outstanding as well!

o-5xMyngIMgIzbxs1wNLoQ.text: not bad. good unique tacos. some flavors are better than others and margarita are good but not great. AWESOME Guacamole though and a lot of the tacos are good! just need to know the flavors.

OgBLhAyam87pXhxfTSspVg.text: This restaurant is amazing. The atmosphere is really nice with some religion into it. The food here is really great. My girlfriend had the diablo eggs which came with chorizo on the egg. I had the chipotle taco and it was just amazing.

osrjZgdaXp14XgoPoWh0YQ.text: Had a great meal!  Can't beat the atmosphere, but the food definitely held its own.  The enchilladas were great - mainly because of the tortillas.  Everybody at our table liked their food, and the sides of beans and rice were perfect.  If anything, my only complaint is that the food came out so fast it felt like we'd just sat down and then were ready to go.  I'll be back next time I'm in town.

P-IAPPhHltxe67bTr2KPJQ.text: I want to like this place more than I do. The atmosphere is amazing. The old church setting is unique, the servers are friendly, and the overall place is well kept. The food itself is par, but nothing I would drive out of the way to have. The portions are small so prices are higher simply because you have to buy more to fill up. I did enjoy the unique types of tacos, but the tortillas themselves sometimes ruined them for me (they default to corn tortillas if you don't specify and they don't always ask which you prefer). I have been here 3 times and will go again if a large group decides to go out, but I won't return just to grab food for myself or be the one to suggest going.

PAg0Bf2etU5GIPEpjC_iGg.text: Originally, reading the menu, I was extremely iffy on eating tacos from Taco Guild. Now after having gone twice, I can certainly say I'm a fan. The flavors are so original, and extremely good. The street corn is heaven sent (which is fitting since the restaurant is an old church), and the service, while not over the top, didn't give me anything to complain about! I definitely recommend, and have already taken several friends.

v0Ff2eUkgnjORpI8vTTwbw.text: We have struggled with the service in the past year, but a shout out to the bartender Salena for the great arrive last night!!!!

hgTHejm0LePgkT-jo0Q4nw.text: Wow. Fantastic. nothing else to say. Excellent quality and selection.

hgJAJtJSTGN0eSrnT7iwVw.text: Usually, I really like the tacos here but I had a terrible experience that forced me to go somewhere else from now on. Tried to park here only to find that half of the parking spots were empty and blocked by green cones. I called the restaurant to inquire about the parking situation only to hear that those spots were for valet parking which wouldn't start for another fifteen minutes. Don't start taking valet spots if you aren't going to start the valet yet. No apologies or solutions were offered which prompted me to immediately drive somewhere else. Really, parking and common courtesy are the first steps to a successful business, if you can't get that right then no one will go there.

lkV3Y9uJHa28Ff81aZ1awA.text: Went here after church with my aunt and daughter. It was freakin bomb. Very unique, but all the flavors mesh well. Different kinds of salsa, and these crispy deep fried onions they put on the tacos are so delicious. I will be back. Busy, modern, and the building is an old church, which is cool.

JTIrULMwqk2iV2sW5hazpg.text: --I have visited here four times. The venue is stunning and the serving dishes and utensils set it apart from your average place.  -- I had always felt eating a taco was a must , but no more! I was tired of walking away over full from three tacos. I had tried all the different varieties and was not disappointed overall. Next time if I get a taco I will try lettuce instead of corn tortillas to save calories and the tortilla is not that stunning.  --The reason I say "If I order a taco" is because of the grilled Romaine Salad. You can add chicken or steak, but I did not.  I swear the salad tasted just like a steak. Maybe it was cooked just before the lettuce on the grill top. Either way is was delish, This salad is not to be thought of as a side or something to eat because you are on a diet. It stands alone as a meal. Paired with a beer you cannot go wrong.  --I will also put in a 'go for it' to the street corn. If I came it for a small bite and drinks this corn is the only thing I would order. Outstanding. Two could split if easily if you cut if off the cob.  --The reason for 4 stars instead of 5? The service. I wouldn't even say i expect fast service, this is a place you want to visit and linger, but constant service would be nice. Four times I have visited and each time service lagged in the areas of taking the order, refilling the drinks and checking back to see if we were done and bringing the bill. I will go back because it is close to family and easy to jump into happy hour.  --I also recommend the TACO of the day, which is half the price of a menu taco.

d5dhPmcLcYVVzI0zTWi38g.text: Underwhelming.  The tacos seem exciting on the menu, but the flavor is bland and missing a bold punch (the tortillas in particular tasted like store-bought Mission tortillas).  Nothing special about the food and likely wouldn't come back as the Taco Guild is an overpriced, blase restaurant with too many other flavorful Mexican food options in the area.  However, they deserve credit (hence the 3 stars instead of 2) for their interesting decor and effort repurposing an old church.

JCMjdraswnPj98ID7Uy1Jg.text: Great atmosphere! Amazing tacos!!! Great frozen margaritas! This is the best taco place in Az!

GsLFwpslCVZuumnrsruWRA.text: One of my favorite places to go in Phoenix. The building is memorizing and I love the chapel theme. They make one of the best margaritas, and have a fantastic tequila selection. Sitting at the bar is a MUST. Order the grilled romaine salad with steak , because there's so much flavor and the portion is generous. This is a place to bring friends if you're trying to wow them, and get a taste of Phoenix culture.

JzC1FubkdNq13yT833DrQw.text: Been wanting to try this place since it opened and so glad my Hubby and I went tonight!   The building is so cool to sit there and look around as you are eating. We loved looking at the old stain glass windows and then talking with our Server about the history of the building.   The food was amazing. The chips were fresh and warm. My hubby is a super picky eater of tacos and he LOVED them! We each tried three different tacos! The Lamb taco was by far my favorite while my husband loved the two different pork tacos they offered! And the margaritas were pretty tasty as well!    Our server Mike made the whole experience even better. He was very helpful with everything on the menu and he was probably one of the best servers we've ever had.   I think we found our new favorite restaurant!

FWJm-D5cFPQZoFyvbP1I6g.text: The food was very goog and drinks too. My husband and I first time here and I will be back. The restaurant has a mixture of crowed of people and we like that.

9OpoPvBb5hF9TVKwqqAndQ.text: Great Vibe, wonderful service.  I was a bit disappointed in my food, but the rest of my party loved their food and raved about it. Fun place to take a group and enjoy food and conversation.

Ctxw4rXQcWFYyE8Px-e15g.text: Great food!  Great bartenders!  Great drinks!  Close to home!  Any time friends or family come to town, I bring them to Taco Guild.  Queso and the lamb taco are my favorites!

HH_QIFpMqhkLkRQTwirhnw.text: I was very excited to try this place out. Read the reviews before I went.  First off, it took 3 people and 2 separate trips to get a beer and a cold glass. We ordered the Serrano guacamole which was just average it didn't taste fresh. The chips were good, salsa was mediocre at best. There was no heat to any of them, that may be what's one people like but when I'm having Mexican food at least the salsa should have a little kick.  Then I ordered ONE al pastor beef taco, and it was served on the wrong tortilla. It was ONE taco for Petes sake!  The rest of my party had been having frozen margaritas and had had 2 already, their third one was brought out on the rocks.   Service isn't the greatest and their food is mediocre. I'm giving them two stars because at least the place itself was cute, quaint setting in an old church but definitely not enough to come back.

UfsGlKlzBbW3osW-0sz0sA.text: Cool interior. Came right after a show ended and the music they were playing afterwards was horrible. Hard rock even my grandma wouldn't listen to anymore. Sat at the bar. Happy hour margarita was alright, nothing special. Ordered four tacos. One was amazeballs- the lamb. Wish I had just ordered that four times. The daily taco was pretty good too. The other two were decent but forgettable. The corn tortillas were pretty thick and chewy; not my favorite texture. And the side of veggies were mushy and didn't even taste like they had salt on them. The service was great.   Summary: cool interior; okay drinks; decent tacos; amazing lamb; horrible music; good service

M0JbNg5cGMDkrSi2E_Igag.text: I remember having gone to this place a few years ago when they newly opened and being amazed! I had dropped in a few times for lunch, and it was always amazing, we were thoroughly satisfied. But this last visit, which was for dinner, was completely underwhelming. Not only was management and the staff lackluster, but the quality of the food was subpar (compared to previous experiences). They made it seem as though it was a huge inconvenience to accommodate a party if 8-10 persons, and wouldn't seat us until the entire party arrived, even though we expressed that we would be ordering throughout the wait. The manager basically rolled his eyes at the request of us being seated, mind you, it was a Tuesday night and the restaurant was at about 50% capacity, so we expressed frustration. Now onto the food, besides the service taking longer than it did for us to be seated, once we got the apps, nothing tasted fresh. Everything tasted as though it had been sitting under a heat lamp for houses, oh and did I mention that they decided to tell us three minutes before 10pm, that the regular menu ended at 10? (our reservation was for 9:30, we weren't seated until 9:50). Yeah, even though I called in advance to confirm their kitchen would be open late, which the hostess failed to mention had its conditions. Even the tacos (because what else were we there for?) tasted the same as the apps, dated and dry. I was saddened by the realization that what was once one of my favorite gourmet taco shops, had been, or is continuing to be run to the ground. They have not changed a single thing on their menu since their opening back in late 2013. Needless to say, we will not be returning. I generously gave them a 2 star rating, vs what would have been 5 stars back in late 2013, early 2014, for not truly expressing concern or care for us, and the lack of progressive efforts.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Urban Bean Coffee Braised Beef, Peking Duck, Molida Lamb tacos

17kliAttBeu_j37MelVdbQ.text: It was my first visit to Taco Guild love it. Loved the food and the history. I got a mini tour of the place by the manager. The atmosphere is very nice. Love the stain glass work that was there when it was a church in the 1800s. The food was really good. I'll go back for sure. :)

kmnoz0NlF8hQiDibHKC2Yw.text: I live around the area and I have to say, one of my go to places.  House margaritas are wonderful, almost too easy to drink.  I sat at the bar by myself and it wasn't a pick up place ( much to my liking!!).   Garth, the Manager, is fun to chat with.  If you want to know about tequila, he's the one to talk to.   Tacos are really good but I would avoid the rice.  Seems to be always under cooked and dry.  Quite a shame because a side would be nice.  Instead Order a salad.    Beautiful and unique building.  They recently added music on Fri and Sat nights.   ( ok for kids but would suggest not)  Local favorite hangout for me.

iWhvy3J-JszNjKD03A001w.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat! I love the shrimp tacos and chicken enchiladas! Attentive service and great atmosphere!

7c0PHUwfCElGitvrUzIMzw.text: Amazing.   Building and atmosphere is wonderful. I love the architecture and design of this old church.   The food. Wowza. Everybody needs to try the street corn here at least once. Outstanding. I could eat it all day every day! I prefer the old world tacos to the new school tacos. They also give you a choice of flour or corn tortilla (or lettuce cup for the health nut). My favorite is the braised beef taco on a flour tortilla. As for sides, the house salad and red beans are great choices.   I will definitely be back as there are many other things I still want to try...and it's just a cool place to hang out anyway!

njm84R5lCR6FZJP6CAVu7g.text: The street tacos are amazing! The place was super busy but the manager was very attentive and the food was so worth the wait!! Definitely a must try and we will be back!!!

iF8n9zO725jmNk_JvcDIPQ.text: The Taco guild should rename itself to put if the box modern taco heaven. Though that is a mouthful. Speaking of mouthfuls the Chirizo meatballs are certainly a fantastic way to stuff your face. The nectar of the gods (beer) slaw is also stellar. The Atmosphere is great here, really cool vibe and the live music on the weekends adds to that a lot. Oh yeah, service- also solid. The Hot Sauces were great, but let's get to the places namesake, tacos. The Steak n' Blu, though not traditional, is one of the best modern fusion tacos I have ever had. The Coffee Beef was also good, but if you are going to go just one beef, try the Steak n Blu first. The Pork was all right, little dry, but the flavors were there! Did I mention the hot sauce? I'm a bit of a fiend for hot sauce, and this stuff really impressed me, which is hard to do in this category. I mean I make about 20 bottles of 12 varieties of hot sauce a year from peppers I grow, plus have a dedicated cupboard in my kitchen to purchased hot sauces. So for me to say a hot sauce is good-- that means something.   I'll be back.

89f82NSiBIZOjl1SLPg1rw.text: Awesome place to eat. The decor is unique just like the craft tacos they're serving up. The location in regards to parking can be a bit hectic during the lunch hours so I usually just find a spot in the neighborhood next door. Great service, great food, and great atmosphere = me returning for more and for you to go for it because you won't regret it!

6C7LWUT77vMuXqpezlfJrQ.text: The tacos are tasty and sometimes amazing. For  $5 a taco, I'm expecting amazing. But extra points for originality. The appetizers I've tried were fantastic.   Our service was very friendly and knowledgeable,  but slightly forgetful as it got busier. The lunch rush was definitely a factor in the timeliness. We make sure to come early, but it's still difficult to get in and out in an hour.  The ambiance is super cool. I love looking at all the stained glass and murals. It's a very hip place to grab a bite or a few drinks.

V5Xxc-LG3eX3HTm0OB58cQ.text: This restaurant has a beautiful interior.   We had a large party so we had to wait for seating.  The hostess was kind enough to call a reservation holder to verify their arrival, which she found out they were not coming, so we got seated a lot quicker.   The menu is small and everything is made fresh from organic or local businesses.  You get chips and 4 types of salsa while you wait.   I had the beef taco and the shrimp taco.   Both were good but I think the beef was my favorite, I was a little worried about the description of the mango pico de gallo on top but the mango was not overpowering and the beef had excellent flavor.  The shrimp one had a little too much house made cabbage salad on top, so the dressing, cabbage to shrimp ratio was off a bit for me.

Jpk0QroWx4SYpRIK9VDAWQ.text: Excellent service, I admire the decor, and the design of the interior. Their Al Pastor tacos were excellent. Nothing was too spicy. If you have a chance try the street corn, I strongly recommend you try it, as it is absolutely delectable. But a note of caution - have the corn de-cobbed first, as they'll likely bring it with the husk attached, as I encountered. Not a major imposition, but surely something which may off-put some individuals. I would visit this fine establishment again.

Xpg9Wt-BV5jDTQTWhjQytQ.text: My favorite place for fancy tacos. Seriously. The flavor combinations are superb. The salsas are incredible and will punch you in the mouth with their flavor. I love taking people here.

VF21xhGJYi3YuEOFBPc11A.text: This place is perfect if you are trying to impress someone on a date.   It has a great vibe and decor.  I would recommend it for drinks and appetizers.   The dishes here are good,  but take a different approach to flavor than the traditional Mexican cuisine.  For example the green enchiladas here don't come with a traditional tomatillo sauce.  Great for a date,  but don't expect traditional flavors.

T1KC5IkqmggdQ9aLa4zDhw.text: OMG!! So much food!! Fresh chips & salsa.... Tacos to die for!!  had to take mine home to finsh.... would've tasted better that night. So my tip?? don't fill up on salsa & chips!!  TRY NOT TO!

zUMqsxbpA8BgPXSUJRxn7g.text: I love Tacos and I love this place! Great selection of food. Food was very flavorful. Service was good and the place was clean. It is an old Catholic church converted into a restaurant which is cool because items found during reno are hung around the building.

eVKBahJKL4i18RK_WJlkXQ.text: Poor service, we found ourselves ordering another drink when one was dropped off...  Every time.  The margaritas were super cheap, but tasted weak.  The tequila was non existent.  Our server was kinda rough around the edges, but seemed to warm up afterwards.  Although, the building is beautiful, and the tacos were excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AUkAXA_6J0JSldv4Tw8IPQ.text: Good chips and salsa are free! Also tacos pretty good and so are enchiladas. We like their margaritas.

CvQphcvuEnn8jMWRCTLtKQ.text: I love the ambiance at taco guild! It's so fun and a place everyone should see! The tacos are good and you can try different kinds on one plate. 2 tacos is plenty!   Try the sangria!!  The coffee bean enchiladas are top notch (pictured below)  Valet Parking, so bring cash!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee bean enchilada!!  Yum!

76uLTOZiIJBm86RIV6V1tw.text: First time in today and loved it! Love the whole theme, reminds me of limelight and service is quick! Happy hr wash nice and drinks are heavy!

UatwNwo_Us5USSThW9_ngQ.text: So I finally checked out Taco a Guild after reading an article that it was voted one of top 10 taco restaurants In America. Couldn't believe that I was holding out so long. Plus I heard that it was at an old restored church. Super cool!  Came on a Sunday night and sat down at the bar. It was happy hour all night so I ordered a local beer and my wife had the house Margarita. Both very good. I love local breweries and was happy to see that Taco Guild carried all local taps. Went with Historic's Pie Hole Porter. See my review  View of Historic Brewery in Flagstaff for more on that brewery!  We shared the 3 taco plate. Went with the cherry steak, shrimp, and pastor. All three were amazing with the cherry steak being my favorite. Wife liked the shrimp the best but you can't go wrong with any of them. If you order 3 tacos you get a free side which we chose the rice. Also when we sat at the bar we were served chips and salsa which was really good. All the salsa's were tasty and the chips were quality.   What I really liked best with Taco Guild was the building. You can read all the reviews on here but it's really cool that it's in an old church. The bar was the alter and they kept the stained glass windows. I took a few photos of the inside and share them on Yelp.   I was really impressed with Taco Guild. I can't wait to show my out if town friends and family that Phoenix does in fact have some quirky and unique restaurants. I can't wait till I come back for the food and the ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Testing out new phone camera. Awesome lighting at restaurant at night.

b0MjpV4boRC1DHRFMLaO0w.text: Very cool atmosphere here and the food was good. I had the chorizo meatballs which were not like chorizo and eggs that I have experienced in the past. Could have had a little more spice for my taste which would add more flavor. The disappointment came as half my meatballs were soaked in the pickled beet juice which my severe disdain for beets prevented me from fully enjoying. The street corn looked amazing and did make me wish I had went that route.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The chorizo meatballs

d67sefSNGAP7GOGPyXH9gA.text: Cherry steak old world tacos were fantastic, beautiful restaurant with welcoming atmosphere.

Xshz2QUBl3Gqq3Z57QravA.text: Way over rated.  I give it 1 star for ambiance.  Excellent ambiance but that's all.  I ordered a Cabernet during happy hour and was served a 3 oz glass (seriously?).  Our hummus appetizer (combo of hummus, guacomole, and roasted peppers) was pasty and bland.  We mentioned this to the waiter and his response was "It's not our most popular item.  We're thinking of removing it from the menu" (really?).  As for the tacos, they were a decent size but were cold when we received them and dry and bland.  The duck taco had a strange mid eastern spice to it and the lamb taco was served with bleu cheese (very odd).  I left almost all my dinner on the plate.  My husband, who has a very healthy appetite, is not a picky eater, and always cleans his plate had a few bites and left the rest.  We will definitely not be back to Taco Guild.

_hLuEPieSGiReMYvb5-Bzw.text: Love this place. We are here quite often and today we tried one of the new brunch items - waffles and chicken.  It was delicious and would definitely recommend it.   Garth, one of the managers, is the best. He truly cares about his customers having a great experience. If you have any concerns, he will do what he can to make sure you are satisfied.   The wait staff is always pleasant and attentive.   They must be doing something right or we wouldn't be here as much as we are.

TxaATl2mejCTRM2MiItySg.text: I've loved this place since before everyone found out it existed LOL it's an awesome spot with great margaritas, queso, salsa and chips. Not to mention their guacamole is fire! It's sometimes hard to get into this place because it's so popular now but I'm happy for its success because it's a great spot. Check it out!

zCq8KeD55VcGoAckLbV3Ng.text: You can't go wrong with any of these taco selections! Friendly staff, great food & cool location!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eHOw-ltVig7ur52iHXjeoA.text: It's creative and a fun experience as the building was a church but the tacos are lackluster.  Look everyone can make tacos out of just about anything, but should we?  Sounds great, looked great - tasted meh... at best  and seriously... never use cold tortillas on tacos....NEVER  this is Phoenix, we know better

r2uIih2JARrN_oDtkrceaw.text: I friggin love Taco Guild. Like, do I really need to say more than that? Amazing chips and salsa, amazing tacos, great atmosphere- the fact that it used to be a church adds to the ambiance and just puts it a notch above all of the other Mexican food restaurants in the area. My only complaint is parking- it's in a small center with a Starbucks so parking spaces are limited. Get there early enough to get a table and you'll get a space, but wait until "traditional" dining times and you'll be circling the lot for days. But that food though....

KRENmIbIB7GUNfgXHsRowQ.text: It's all about the blue cheese steak and peppers taco. Wow.

HEZb9gF-cvXw3hDj5DgBng.text: This place is AWESOME! Chips and salsa were delicious and very authentic. Our tacos and street corn was amazing. I had the lamb taco that was excellent and my son loved the coffee braised beef taco. Very cool atmosphere, it's in an old historic church, pretty cool actually and they also have a small patio area for our wonderful weather we're having these days. We will definitely be back!

CG-sr2NDFyyp-6yDd1b_Dg.text: Beautifully designed restaurant with good food.  The grilled corn is amazing and the tacos are very tasty.  A nice place for lunch or dinner.  It's a bit noisy and could be an issue if you bring friends with hearing deficits.  Parking is shared with a Starbucks and retail shops and can be a bit difficult.

oQm6BjDuoH41eDE-y5eJUg.text: This place is amazing from its unique decor to all the friendly staff and delicious menu.  Can't wait to try all the different menu items.

_v6slvmjF2wBtnuNkrvwfg.text: I've made three visits here with family and friends, and will be back again.    The good:  It's a great concept.  They converted the old Bethel Methodist Church into an eatery.  They kept the stained glass, added some "Reformation" murals, and obviously made an effort to respect the architecture and history.  Kudos putting the bar at the altar - an ironic twist.  It's a great little strip center, with Buffalo Exchange right next door.  Parking sucks when it's busy, but it's a safe surrounding neighborhood.  More good:  The taco menu is creative and many of the taco choices are genuinely tasty, if (as others have noted) some are a little bland - the salsa choices help remedy this.  The "taco of the day" and "three taco" plate are great introductions, but it's worth a couple of visits to branch out and try a broad range of the traditional and fusion choices: the coffee-braised beef, chipotle cherry steak and peking duck tacos were unexpected, and absolutely delicious.    OK:  Waitstaff are friendly but service suffers a little when the place gets crowded.  It's like they haven't fully grasped just how popular they've become and don't schedule / scale their staffing to match the crowds.  First visit wasn't long after they'd opened, and I figured they'd adjust.  Second and third visits (most recently a few months ago) were a little better.  Service, especially at the host counter, has never been what I'd call "attentive."  Not-so-good:  "Street Corn" (Elote) is a very specific thing (albeit with lots of seasoning variances from place to place ...); it is not executed well here.  Twice now, it has been dry, food-bank quality corn, overcooked and slathered with a nasty mayonnaise and not much else.  If, as the menu claims, cotija cheese is involved in the preparation, they must wave the block over the top and move on.  This could be a "signature" menu offering if it was done as well as, say, the 20 or so recipes I found on a web search just now.  Don't go cheap on this, guys.  Start with fresh corn, make a quality sauce with actual garlic and herbs and good chili, and *roll* the hot corn in the crumbled cheese to make it stick - don't scrimp!  Also Not-so-good:  The noise level in this place is - at best - not conducive to conversation.  At worst (e.g. during the Friday night DJ sets), it is genuinely hazardous.  Live music and / or a DJ are great, but this is a midtown gastropub, not a Scottsdale hip-hop dance club.  Turn the volume down and consider installing some dampeners (some banners would be cool ...) up in the roof structure to mitigate some of the echo.  Back to where I started:  I'll be back,and I'll bring friends and out-of-towners!  This is a great concept, with a wonderful setting and many gems on the menu, which reaches the "good" level in execution.

k2q9RJylQ0v32J4QOqV0TA.text: I can't believe I waited this long to try this place!  We happened in during Happy Hour and they have some great specials like a $5 margarita, The tacos are amazing, they have traditional flavors like Al Pastor, and then they have specialty ones that include tacos made with lamb and duck.  I had the one with lamb and blue cheese it was amazing!!  I was super excited about the chips and salsa, you get a larger bowl of tradiational salsa and three smaller ones that are a bit hotter and all were absolutely declicious.  I also had the street corn which was fantastic and is a great presentation, you really do get excited about them coming to your table! I can't wait to go back and try it again!!

VDkSeJxQ2eULRUCeQ_yUQg.text: I saw this place on a travel show. Supposed to be great food. I think it was mediocre at best. The tacos are $5 EA depending on what you get. I've been to great Mexican restaurants but I've never seen a taco worth $5. The steak burrito had sickly sweet sauce that made me want to be sick. Rice was fair. I didn't see anything the was above Cipotle actually not as good. Service was slow and we really didn't like anythi g other than the cool building. I wanted to love this place after the show I saw but was very disappointed with the good and very over priced.

m1cRcd2laMXcuSvCotuyCw.text: Not the best tacos in town; they're good, but not great. Customer service is terrible (during a time that wasn't busy, too). Luckily, there's far better tacos to eat in the downtown area.

V6r1pNPv_qEvzFZB3uOmSQ.text: Love the tacos here! the great fresh selection! Plus the margaritas are amazing! Even if you don't love tacos and tequila, you need to go just to see the beautiful stained glass windows! The atmosphere here cannot be beat!

yLfC0J0OjbuJYB-33K197Q.text: Food is very good. We started with the Guild Trio Dips and the Borracho Bean Dip is great. Be careful not to fill up on chips and dip though cause the dinner is still to come.  I tried the 3 street tacos, but went with very unique types, MOLIDA LAMB, CHIPOTLE CHERRY STEAK, & PATO ASADO (Duck). I decided to try them in a lettuce wrap. They all tasted amazing but I wouldn't recommend the lettuce wrap as they fell apart really quick. Go with the tortillas as they are freshly made.

vTCHervCb7u_S4m28ihRkg.text: Hands down the best grilled chicken taco I have ever had. My entire family loved their meal. The homemade quac was outstanding. The venue was so cool to see! We will be back soon!!

SDN-nhc0MeVga3DJjkTNLA.text: 2.5 stars  Conceptually, Taco Guild is really cool. It's an old church converted into a modern day eatery. The interior is dope because it still retains the old stained glass pertinent to the church.   The food. Meh. Meh. Meh.  My sister and I both did taco plates where you can order 3 tacos and get a free side and/or tack on a street corn for $2.50.  We ordered the following tacos:  -al pastor pork ($3.95): grilled pork, jalapeno bacon + pickled red onion -urban bean coffee braised beef ($4.95): caramelized onion, mango jicama relish, Cotija cheese -Yucatan shrimp ($3.95): green cabbage slaw, avocado -chipotle cherry steak ($4.95): poblano straws, chile aioli, bleu cheese -peking duck ($4.95): plum sauce, fire-roasted poblano apricot compote, Brie cheese -tropical ono (($4.95): menonita cheese, roasted-tomato salsa, coconut slaw, mango, tomato, cilantro  The good: the coffee braised beef + Yucatan shrimp - good flavor and fluid in taste.  The okay: the al pastor + cherry steak - good, but not memorable. The bleu cheese on that steak taco was no bueno because it basically overpowered the steak.  The bad, bad: the peking duck had this congesting aromatic flavor after every bite. It was overwhelming and unappetizing. The ono also bordered on gross because the coconut slaw was a bit too sweet and too much.  The real downer? The corn. Our corn was overcooked or something because it possessed an unsavory dark yellow tint, which we thought was odd. After shaving the corn off and mixing it with the condiments, it was inedible - pretty gross. My sister justified it by saying that perhaps corn was no longer in season?, but after glancing at other tables, our corn was clearly an anomaly - other people had normal looking corn.  We're from LA., so 5 dollar priced tacos are digestable, but if I'm paying that much for a taco, the ingredients better be top notch. And, be forewarned - the tacos are substantially much smaller than they photograph.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 tacos + street corn for an additional $2.50

k5Fa8b1ZMNVfg92Ps9-kNQ.text: Wow.  Our Epicurean Toastmaster club reserved their private room for a Friday night meeting. There were 23 of us and we fit nicely into the foyer room.  Let me tell you what we loved:  - the service. Both servers (Alex and Alex) were fun, efficient and helpful. They accommodated special needs, and even brought us fresh whipped cream.  Nice! Great teamwork from management and staff.  - the ambiance. This restaurant is located in an old church. Beautiful, yet modern and chic.  - choice. What great menu options!  This is not typical taco fare. Yum!   The one challenge is that there is a DJ and the acoustics made intimate conversation a challenge. But we knew that when we booked a Friday night.   Fabulous, filling.  Worth dealing with the parking.

4jxESI3S1f5oZ2PDVr4WVQ.text: Very good tacos.  Their soft taco shells are the best I've had.  And their creativity is killing the game.  They give very good portions with their tacos.  The reason why I'm giving it a 4 out of 5 is because they blast their music.  If you did not know it was a restaurant you would have probably thought it was a bar.  The music was extremely loud that no one at our table was able to hear each other at times.  The seating is not very comfortable, kind of awkward. That's all they really need to improve on.

HIugSsvE05Na4lA_RQVNXQ.text: Hair in food + Flies = Disappointing (to say the least).   My husband pulled a hair from his throat early into eating his plate. Normally this would be enough for me to leave but we drove an hour to try this place so we carried on. Then the flies arrived. They were landing on our straws, our chips, and our hands while we were desperately trying our best to enjoy this place. One of the items on the menu we were looking forward to was the street corn. It didn't taste fresh and reminded me of old corn you give to livestock. It was lacking in sweetness and the butter/cheese/mayo stuff that it comes in didn't help. The waiter sold me a drink that he compared to an apple mule, but it was made with tequila not vodka so this was yet another surprise and disappointment.   I'm always on the lookout for new and interesting places to try, places I can take friends and family.....but I think I'm gonna scratch this one off the list. Simply too many things going wrong to consider giving it another shot.   On a positive note, the inside of the church is beautiful. Our waiter was OK. Not the best I've ever had, but he got the job done.

R8LTBqqanh7_mXbATd4EvA.text: The only thing I like about his restaurant is the building.  It's an old church that is beautiful.  The service has always been good as well.  However, the place is very loud because of the acoustics, and at some point on Friday evenings, they have a DJ that is even louder and plays dance music.  I find this kind of silly, because it's not a night club.  I love music, but when it's appropriate for the place.  As for the food.  I am so not impressed.  I'm not sure what they are trying to do here.  Maybe trying to put a southwestern spin on an already perfect food.  Tacos.  If I want tacos, I'll stick with the traditional type that are reasonably priced.

Coqu_91PbrZksmLnM6iKLw.text: Beautiful atmosphere and very friendly, attentive service.  Our group got a variety of tacos and sides.  The salsa trio offered with the chips was very good, very unique tasting.  Make sure you try each one.  The street corn is out of this world.  The guac is divine.  My only wish is that they'd offer more vegetarian items so my boyfriend could get something other than the veggie taco.  The veggie taco is a nice thought but pretty tasteless and was his only option.

uiHh0nZmSCcPxuNCIMndDQ.text: This place has been on my "to visit list" for a long time now, finally got around to checking it out. I have to say this is a cool place to hang out, it has a nice vibe. Imagine an actual church turned into a restaurant. That was about the extent of it though, you would think with the name "Taco Guild" this would be the place for tacos, NOT!!! Ordered two tacos both being El Pastor tacos which took about twenty five minutes to come out, only to find them to be cold and bland. I didn't bother complaining wasn't worth my time, I'll never visit again. How hard is it to make a taco.

C-U8K2YqZh5XOaqYKfTBVw.text: The host told us he would get us a low top after we checked in on our reservation we had made. He then sat people without a reservation at a low top and told us he'd run out. Our waitress was good but knew nothing of the menu. Food was mediocre. Not going back.  Oh by the way,  we reserved through Open Table to earn loyalty points. This place shows us as canceled.

uaMBpS1v0sI8PgA8EExK7g.text: Great food, I recommend the duck taco. So good. I went here with a friend and we had great food and drinks. The margaritas are amazing!

R1HAXXYbzfuTtF-2CsZffg.text: It's alright , food is over priced . Paying for environment. Parking is a big issue.  I'll give them three stars

wUxa4sDPhRiIJEzH21W2Rw.text: I'm currently waiting for my bill, and I can't wait any longer to review this place - I'm shocked it's not 5 stars.  I had the street corn, the Mahi-Mahi Taco, and the Peking Duck Taco. All were phenomenal! I love how fresh the mahi mahi was, and that it wasn't breaded. The flavour was amazing. The Peking duck taco had such interesting flavors - really good spices to it. Had both tacos with the lettuce cups, instead of tortillas, and it was fantastic. I love that they have options.  Also had the 'burning bush' cocktail - and it was stellar. Not sweet. Not spicy. Just perfect.  Would recommend this place to anyone!!

pvLRrTRSFcsmpcXXJQ2mYw.text: Great atmosphere. Love the history.  Had a papago Orange blossom beer yum and mashed potatoes and chicken tacos. Nice.  Coconut pie.... Not so much. Nice attentive service

WAXAQrat8kXgdfS0oIu-FA.text: The tacos and margaritas were amazing! I also love that they have happy hour all day on Monday.  Like many have said, the ambiance was enough to get us in the door but the delicious food and drinks will keep us coming back .

YwT90ZnnJuZp0ejpJeXG8g.text: I really liked the architecture and history of the building. If I come back I'd definitely sit at the bar. Service was eh, over heard the table next to us ask about a discount for having a drink spilled on them. One party asked if we had seen their debit card; Waiter dropped it. Had the bloodies to start. Definitely on the weak side and pale red mix never boads well. Christmas style taste like a limade. Was told they came with an special hard boiled egg. Did not. However chef made us two deviled eggs with a chorizo topping. This needs to be on the starter menu. Had the enchiladas. Meh not enough meat. Tortilla turned to soup. Had the taco trio as well. Not bad. Little pricey for what you get. Needs some seasoning.

bR5GiA3oiswpPde_pSxZ0g.text: I'm going to go slightly Foodist here...BUT, this is a great place for folks who don't know Mexican food. Street tacos are their claim to fame..good..yes..expensive..yes. Flavors? They remind of someone who is throwing things in at the last minute in attempts to cover up mistakes. I ordered the shrimp taco, which included rubberized cooked shrimp which tasting without the mess of toppings was flavorless ( I think it was $5 which was $4.75 more than it should have cost.) The tortillas just don't have that vibe of authenticity you can get from about 1000 other places in Phoenix. I know I'm in the minority here but the food is just not worth the wait, (it's the Applebee's of a Friday night place)   Yes it's an old church,which  does not improve food. The surfaces of the interior are all hard surfaces, coupled with folks ability to play DJ, the vibe is more 'hey look at this place I found' vs. 'I want to show you some great food/time that phoenix has'   Skip for other more awesomeness places.

hk9Xb2m-PdNwCF2-1HvDFw.text: Intereting spot in an old church. The food was good.  The service was good and the staff was super friendly.    I had a few of the tacos and they were all excellent.  The elote was delicious and so were their micheladas.

XI9pok12gg2mql65wE_R6w.text: This place is amazing!  Converted from a beautiful old Church,  decor is incredible, very comfortable, excellent food and service and great happy hours, including lunch and all day Mondays.   Bartenders are always friendly and excellent customer service!   5 stars easily!!

xQxaYc50BU0wGiD8viTlIg.text: I ate so delicious taste greatly soft different duck, lamb & steak of tacos. & I look at wall very old antique was this building chapel look alike 1800's & very neat in restroom & bar as I love this place nice restaurant & server are good communicate write & note very good server worker, respect & friendly!

eGnpKVYu8Js6PgGLbaPheA.text: I have lived about a mile away from Taco Guild for about a year and a half and earlier this month I decided to finally give it a shot. We decided to go on a Sunday morning for brunch and we had really heard a lot of hype about this place. The first and most memorable part of my visit here was how cool the building was, which prompted me to read about its history. Pretty neat!  We got seated and ended up waiting for quite some time before we were greeted by our server. When he came to take our drink and appetizer orders he seemed to be somewhat overwhelmed, but we put our order in for the street corn and drinks and sat back and talked. After about 10 minutes we got our drinks and chips, and shortly after received our appetizer and put our food orders in. I asked for a recommendation and told him the breakfast hash sounded good, so I ordered that and my fiancee ordered the chicken enchiladas.   We were happy to see that our food order had arrived until I saw that my order was completely wrong, which was frustrating because I had spoken to the server about it and he recommended it to me. He promptly apologized and sent it back to only get the order wrong, again. At this point my fiancee had finished half of her food and I was frustrated and ate it. Our server came back with the bill and had taken off my food from the bill, which was very nice and professional of him and the restaurant.   I came away very disappointed, especially after hearing over a year of rave reviews and recommendations for this place. I would be willing to try Taco Guild again, as the number and quality of reviews shows that it must be good, but I really hope that it is isn't this much of a disappointment again.

KDAeSljp01eADG-CajjrRQ.text: This place is beautiful. I loved the vibe and decoration as well as the light fixtures. They have a good food and drink menu. I went in during happy hour and got the taco plate 3 tacos and a side and had the happy hour sangria for about 17 dlls. They give you a complementary big bowl of chips and a variety of salsas. My favorite was the mahi mahi taco. The fish had some type of adobo, delicious!!!!

ZgHAHh8ZIX1YnaqFuYQU9Q.text: Dont believe the hype. The tacos were, by far, the worst tacos I've ever had and that's saying something. Tacos were overstuffed with mediocre ingredients. The meats, one chicken and one pastor, were also not good. The chicken was very dry and the pastor was mysterious in a bad way.  So mysterious, that one bite was enough. Oh, and pineapple, gtfo out of my taco.  2 stars becuase the chips and salsa were okay. With so many better choices around, I'll not be back.

Ha6gSfgjfIPMAsr5EtHbSA.text: First time visit to TG and differently the last.  The salsas taste like marinara sauce. Too sweet and no kick to it not even a nibble. The red sauce was  a bit better . Tried the carnitas taco no flavor tasted life boiled pork no smoky flavor you get from True carnitas , the Adobe pork was ok a bit dry , the braised coffee beef tasted like burnt plain , no salt , no flavor pot roast.  The cod fish was ok a bit fishy.  The Koren fried chicken taco was ok if you like chicken nuggets from KFC drizzled with sweet and sour sauce topped with greenery. And to top it off the table beside us took his floss out and proceeded to start his oral hygiene early and in public.  Service was good and so was margarita . Overall to pricey for mediocrity. Tacos Celio and Tacos chiwa  the same price range with the food  to justify the prices.

Gqa8TBOHXg-kl0-olhqQ5g.text: Taco Guild is THE place for the Taco-aficionado! I happened upon this place because it was close to my hotel in Midtown Phoenix- I had NO idea how awesome it really was! First off, it's in an old church so the building is beyond cool with stained glass windows, cathedral ceilings, big wooden doors, chandeliers, etc. I came straight from the gym so I ordered my meal to-go from the bar, but I'm very sad I didn't stay to dine! They have a full bar and a variety of table-side guacs and I feel like I missed out (guess I'll have to return!!) They also have patio dining- I never met a patio I didn't like....  I ordered my To-Go meal from the bartender who was pleasant and gave me the low down and recommendations. I got the taco platter- with 3 tacos (you can pick any 3) and 1 side. I chose Ono (fish), shrimp, and chicken with a side of their street corn off the Cobb. Food arrived promptly and they even threw in a chips & salsa order without me asking. A+ Service!   Everything was YUM! The corn tortillas were handmade and every taco had amazing, individualized flavor! And that Street corn..no words!! I can't wait to go back!

tsZuz7vYedUzFPGXDJu_-g.text: Food is to die for. Street corn is awesome. Many different salsas and the cherry steak tacos are killer. This is a must have when in the Phoenix area. Look forward to this spot every year when in Arizona for work.

wbE525psBBF3IaeuNPvzMw.text: Best. Tacos. Ever.  I came here during my most recent trip to Phoenix. I had done a little bit of research ahead of time to find places that had been dubbed the "Best Mexican in Phoenix" and came across Taco Guild. Boy did it live up to the hype.   Upon arrival, we were quickly seated at the back patio and given chips with four incredible salsas. It was happy hour so I of course ordered one of their $6 margaritas (definitely recommend!). I already knew I was going to order their taco plate special (order three tacos, get a free side), but it took me a few minutes to pick just three tacos from their amazing lists of "old world" and "new world" tacos. I finally settled on the pastor from their "old world" tacos (pastor pork with grilled pineapple, jalapeno bacon, pickled red onion), and the chipotle cherry steak (poblano straws, chile aioli, bleu cheese) and peking duck (plum sauce, fire-roasted poblano apricot compote, brie cheese) from their "new world" taco list.  Oh. My. God. These tacos BLEW MY MIND. The marinade on the pastor pork permeated every little bit of the meat so it was absolutely packed with flavor. The salty bacon with the tartness of the pickled onion and sweetness of the pineapple was sheer perfection. The steak in the chipotle cherry steak was also marinated wonderfully, and was SO tender. I often get beef that's overcooked in my tacos, and was so happy this was still on the medium rare to medium side. It had a slight charred flavor to boot. I LOVED the poblano straws for a bit of crunch, with cooling bleu cheese crumbled on top. The peking duck was like nothing I've ever had. The brie was actually lightly fried which was an awesome surprise, and provided a nice contrast with the sweetness of the apricot compote and sweet plum marinate for the duck. The duck was tender and delicious. All the tacos were wrapped in a fluffy, homemade corn tortilla. So yummy. I really enjoyed the achiote flavored rice too.  My mom ordered chicken enchiladas and said they were some of the best she's ever had. They were made with white meat chicken but the meat was so juicy--not easy to do with white meat. They also packed a lot of flavor. She also particularly liked the variety of salsas, which were actually spicy (not like the wimpy salsas we're used to in the Pacific Northwest!).  I can't recommend Taco Guild enough. I will ABSOLUTELY be back during my next trip to Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and four incredible salsas (complimentary!)
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken enchiladas
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. From the patio

_ECve_A9X0rSnRszovqA7A.text: My husband and I just finished eating the best tacos we have ever had and I am not exaggerating how delicious the Cherry Chipotle steak tacos were.  Hands down, the best we have ever eaten. Raven was our server and she gave great suggestions like the fried avocado and steered us to the Cherry Chipotle steak tacos. Great atmosphere, outstanding food, and super friendly servers.  We will be back!

lOKIn_9grztIi7TQNyd9Lw.text: Very neat atmosphere! The chips, salsas, quest, guacamole were all great. My entree (enchiladas) were not my favorite - it was basically huge chunks of chicken is a tortilla with sauce on top. No other filling. Wait staff was attentive. Super noisy though, you have to talk pretty loud just to hear the people at your table.

1fpOzA6-oaSlqjj7SQ6rIg.text: It's hard for me to give a comprehensive review of Taco Guild when I only ordered a couple of their tacos, but here's my take after my first visit:  First, it's an engaging atmosphere. An old church restored and reclaimed into a hip (and decidedly upscale) restaurant. Hip, to be sure, with an even hipper menu of artistic tacos and other Mexican items like burritos and enchiladas. I like how their menu is small - doing fewer menu items and doing them well resonates for me. They have a daily taco - which is only available after 2 pm (except for Taco Tuesday, when it's available all day...I know, it gets a little confusing...). They also have a daily soup and happy hour, where the prices go down to a bit more reasonable, at least by my standards. We stuck with the tacos for lunch. I did appreciate that you can order your tacos with either corn or flour tortillas or just go with lettuce as your wrap.  I ordered Yucatan grilled shrimp and al pastor. We also tried the molida lamb and coffee-braised beef. I mostly tasted the pickled onions in the al pastor tacos but the pork was moist and had a wonderful sweet flavor; the grilled shrimp tacos lacked any sort of flavor for me - even after adding some of their delicious jalapeno salsa, they were just bland - to my tastes. I love the assortment of salsas and fresh chips they bring to the table after you arrive. I think I'd like to return perhaps for happy hour or Taco Tuesday to try a few other tacos - I'm sure I'll be able to find one or two tacos that become my favorites! All in all a fun place to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor and Yucatan grilled shrimp tacos

tXwIeE2k-bFT6j4LKa1Rjw.text: Happened into Taco Guild late on a Tuesday night, and we weren't disappointed.  The building itself appears to be an old church, or modeled to look like one. The murals and stained glass are gorgeous, as are the exposed beams and old-world feel.  My brother ordered a burrito and I ordered the three taco plate, each of us added the corn as a side. He really enjoyed the burrito and corn, and had left overs as the helpings were pretty big. I ordered the veggie, ono, and coffee braised beef. The veggie and ono were delish, I have the beef to my brother (as I wasn't that hungry). I was expecting small street tacos, but they were actually pretty large portions. I personally did not like the corn's flavor.   Our waitress was extremely helpful, despite it being late. She even sent us home with to go drinks and extra salsa!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GrwO8MuHKiGulk6K3Lf-ag.text: I normally write lengthy reviews but I don't have much to say about Taco Guild.   My husband and I met friends for lunch Tuesday. The chips and salsa were good. The guac was boring, couldn't taste the lime or cilantro. The veggie tacos lacked flavor and were a little cold. I brought home the leftovers to doctor them up. The price tag for the 2 of us with tip was $48. Could have gone to Chipotle several times and been very pleased.  The ambience was cool.

E41QvPfvOfXR4mjPkoOH7A.text: Amazing tacos, gets busy but worth the wait.  All their tacos are quite flavorful.  The shrimp and steak are my faves here.

ijJrJ095oQeRnG5CLrHqig.text: Pineapple/mint guacamole followed by the carnitas burrito. Finally.  Great Mexican food. Outstanding.  4.5 stars actually.

SLniIIHZQAHLajBE939roA.text: The building and atmosphere of this place is 5 stars. We had the bacon guacamole and I didn't think it had much flavor. The margaritas were very good, but the descriptions of the drinks were so overwhelming that we just asked the waiter to recommend us drinks.   I liked the corn tortilla flavor, but I was disappointed in the flavor of the tacos. They had good descriptions, but I didn't find the taco flavors to match their descriptions, meaning the tacos flavor was a bit of a let down from the awesome sounding descriptions. The cherry steak taco had little to no cherry flavor. The coffee braised beef had an impressive amount of beef.   Overall: come for the atmosphere and drinks and you won't regret it.

zkahWaf_JZsYCQmVGTFj1g.text: Me and my lady went here and we need to go back. They can get my money anytime they want, it's that good lol. Tacos were

70rJ3T16ofb5FUkMRptVKQ.text: This place is amazing! The atmosphere and the food is so good!!! Heather with the cute turquoise bob helped us and made perfect menu suggestions! The chipotle cherry steak tacos are like no other!!! Great beer menu and possibly the beat blended margarita I've ever had!! 5 stars for sure

DCKiPN-T5ramfq8R9KL5hw.text: Jordan was a great server! We each got the 3-taco plate w/ a free side. They've sadly changed the duck taco that used to have cooked cherries and a piece of fried Brie cheese! That flavor and texture combination was perfect! I'm bummed they made the duck into a standard taco  w/tomatoes and cotija cheese :(  Duck deserves better. The lamb taco tasted great but looks a bit unappetizing. The sharp taco had wonderful flavor. Of course the street corn was amazing, and the Happy Hour margarita was so smooth and yummy! Just bring back the cherry duck w/fried Brie!
