Gx_y4STSxdXLdkAHXu6sIw.text: Beautiful design,  and I would check this place out for that reason alone. The menu was fun, & just the right amount of options.  We only did happy hour, but everything we tried was delicious.  Definitely want to go back again.  Plus, the valet service they offered there was top notch!

tLUM89EOh0NIg3iUKW89eQ.text: They have great chips and salsa and pricey tacos. The location was built out of a old church and the inside is gorgeous. They do make a really good house margarita for happy hour. Their best deal is the taco of the day!!

ODqdjCV8yozGeKfq121NEg.text: OMG! One word, totally delicious!  Oh, wait, two words, fantastic! Ok, three words then, totally delicious and fantastic!  Technically four words but "and" doesn't really count. The pork tacos are wonderful. I had the beef enchaladas. Full of flavor and reminded me of New Mexico cooking. The wait staff was very polite and attentive. The salsas are full bodied and full of flavor, not stupid hot so you can enjoy the food. They aren't afraid of special orders either.  Next time we're in town,  we'll be stopping by again.

pk6JddVHVe41ZxoZzhaxbQ.text: Came here for lunch on a Friday. The place was packed, but we got a table pretty quickly. The ambiance and place itself is amazing, as you can see by the pictures and other descriptions. I couldn't stop looking around at all the cool features. LOVE the stained glass windows and giant candle chandelier that hangs over the center of the room. We ordered our food, and about 30 minutes passed. Then the waitress came by to tell us that the kitchen was slammed and our food would be a bit longer. Another 10-15 minutes later, our food came out, but not all at once.  The food itself was very good. We couldn't stop eating the freshly made chips and salsa that they brought out. I got the pork and beef tacos with a side of corn, and my boyfriend got the chicken burrito. Everything tasted fresh and authentic. The tacos are really small, and I could have eaten at least 1 more. The waitress came over after our meal to let us know that our meal was totally on the house because of the long, ridiculous wait. She sat down with us for a minute to explain that they had just opened up (we were aware of that) and really weren't prepared for such a busy lunch hour. I really appreciated her taking the time to apologize and explain things. I told her that we understood and would definitely be back to try them again. Overall: Cool place, great tasting Mexican food, but they are still working out some kinks with the service/kitchen so don't expect a quick lunch experience.

tatwGN1zb0VU4Zi4Fv8_Ww.text: My husband and I ate here on a Friday night around 7pm a few weeks ago. Given that it was prime dinner time during the city's busiest month, I wasn't surprised by the 30 min wait.  There wasn't anywhere to sit at the bar so we waited outside.  Wait quoted was accurate.  Once we were seated we ordered drinks (a beer and a margarita) and the chorizo meatballs.  The server also brought chips and a selection of salsas.  Meatballs were good- spicy, but we were expecting that.  My husband got the steak burrito and really enjoyed it.  I ordered 3 tacos (in order of preference): beef, al pastor, and duck.  If I visit again I'll stick with the beef tacos which were very good.  We also got the signature corn, we were not blown away by it.  Service was decent and the manager stopped by our table to check on us. The setting in an old church is a neat idea, but I am not sure if it was just an ugly church or if the restaurant ironically redecorated.  The stained glass and murals are gaudy.

zTGtMoV4PQ3qxEDcF--YGQ.text: Tacos were way over priced for what you get! The food was OK but nothing special. I would for sure next time choose to go across the street Gadzooks!

J9pWQLCuLjODhc_agT-ZDQ.text: While the building is amazing, the food is not good at all and the service is worse. We waited over 30 min after we paid our check to get a to-go bean burrito. The "acting manager" was also the cook and was not concerned about the issue. The corn was dried out and tasted like it was from a can. The cherry chipotle steak tacos got its flavor from the slathered on chipotle mayo. Phoenix KNOWS great Mexican food and this is not it. Save cash and go to Ranch Market. Our experience was an expensive nightmare.

oma-MaN7Qcssrf3xWLn7CQ.text: Love coming here for happy hour with my man.  They have HH prices until 7 and we can eat on the cheap with the yummy frozen Margaritas, guacamole and chips and the taco of the day. The vibe is great and the renovation is cool. Plus I went to preschool here when it was a church preschool years ago, so I have a sentimental connection.

zX79S7Fq-WsbSHQk2JFgVQ.text: Really good tacos. Their house salad the best. You have to also try their corn. Delicious

Cezvw-w0Q0tJLOTZrJDFiA.text: This was a first time experience for me and it was AWESOME! We sat out on patio (which is much quieter than inside) the weather was perfect, we sat with great company, had an awesome waiter and delicious food.  I really couldn't ask for more. I love that they had gluten free options too!  This will be a regular spot for me as long as I can sit on the patio.  I admit if I sat inside I might have a different opinion of this place.  When i walked inside to go to the bathroom I realized how LOUD it was inside. They definitely need to work on the acoustics to make it more personal for each table.  AND pretty please arrange your table better so there can be a more clear path to the bathroom.  All in all, this places deserve a 5!

-d5utqWH1rswkb7qLSmVtQ.text: Excellent and UNIQUE food, paired with a beautiful space and good margaritas has quickly earned Taco Guild the title of Adrian F.'s new favorite taco joint! I especially love the housemade-to-order guac! The service can be a bit... sluggish... at times, so I wouldn't recommend this place if you're in a rush, but aside from this small blemish I give Taco Guild 5 stars all around!

_1DuKsip6GxQC6PWqBpcmQ.text: I thought we were going to have traditional tacos. There's nothing traditional about this place. I loved the Chipotle Cherry Steak taco, Guild Chicken taco, Yucatan Shrimp taco, and Street Corn. Great service. Great atmosphere. In an old church that was built in 1955. Come for the novelty, come back for the food.

36WkH9WBDZowmasEjTfBpg.text: Great tacos, the chicken was especially good.  The street corn was probably over 1000 calories from the butter and cheese, good but not my style.  The salsas and hot sauces provided were awesome.  Then there's something about ordering and drinking a great local beer inside a church where the Holy Water flowed warmed my cockles.   Friar Tuck would be proud.   Great experience on my two visits and I will be back.    Service was descent as well.

Z5SnkfD0HEDgPMFfCePJ0A.text: We like this place. Food, drinks and service are great. But vegetarian taco? For a daily happy hour special? Poor choice. Give us more happy hour choices.

lLEd-QCoMcPocsSZ6APAzg.text: came here for my "sisters" 40th birthday last night sat on the patio it was spectacular! the food, environment, staff, customer service was such a pleasure! if you haven been here you need to!!!!

e9JrDPyYzB_8c7O8Nqsajg.text: Burritos are just so-so no matter how you make them. Tacos are excellent however.  Bar service is poorly stocked, unless beer is your thirst quenching choice.

f8ryEGpuVVBv767Y2vjzSg.text: The building is super awesome but the food and drinks haven't impressed me yet.  I've been here a couple times and some of the tacos were good and some were lacking.  The al pastor was good but super spicy and not as sweet as pastor usually is.  I liked the shrimp taco but there wasn't anything amazing about it.  Maybe go once just to see it, maybe have a drink, but go across the street to Gadzooks or down the street to America's Taco shop for better food.

-WJxiTnxcBnFRC3kRWvDFw.text: The place is so unique! The food was great! Was treated out for my birthday. I had a free birthday slice of tres leches cake, it was okay not the best. (not a fan of cake) but extremely sweet of them. I had the shrimp tacos and corn on the cob, speechless, so delicious!

3vSjTp6eyEkygdQDb_J81A.text: I was hoping to like Taco Guild more than I actually did. The decor is truly awesome - converting an old mission-style church into a taco gastropub is genius. However, the concept is a bit poorly executed. The music selections were odd and clashing. Our server was nervous and redundant. For example, when I ordered a water: "Would you like a straw? Or lemon? Or both?" It was just an awkward way of asking.  The bathrooms are not clearly marked. I watched as several men walked into the women's restroom without knowing it. All of this would have been fine if the food were good, which unfortunately, it wasn't. My chicken taco had cold kidney beans on it, which were highly unappetizing. My husband ordered 3 small tacos, each of which left him underwhelmed. I'm not trying to be overly critical of a new restaurant, in fact, I badly want them to succeed! But right now, Gadzooks is the better Mexican place on that block (Osborn/7th).

m7CcwuJZexyRwk6V8eqY9Q.text: Awesome happy hour! Special 1.99 tacos and 5$ margaritas with a good pour! I will def be back since it's just so quick and convenient. Not to mention its in a CHURCH! Cool

oAoyiQa9VkP7Fu1NPxlwMQ.text: Taco Guild seems to focus more on style than substance.  The building itself is beautiful.  I love restaurants that are inside old houses, so a restaurant in an old church is right up my alley.  I admit I was confused by the decor choice of having Dutch paintings in a taco restaurant and Johnny Cash playing on the jukebox, but once I got past that odd juxtaposition, I decided I liked it.  The giant chandelier is amazing, the bar is gorgeous, the stained glass is really pretty, etc, etc.  The food however, was the opposite of all the complimentary words in the previous sentence.  I like fancy tacos.  The tacos here are overpriced and extremely basic, despite all the frou-frou words on the menu describing them.  The prices are extremely high for the amount of food you get.  For $3.95 each (some are even $4.95 with more "premium" ingredients,) you receive basically four bites of taco.  I don't mind paying almost $4 for a taco, but when I'm shelling out, I expect the taco shell to be filled out, if you catch my drift.  My al pastor taco at Taco Guild arrived at my plate with a meager amount of pork and some sad looking pickled onions.  Allegedly there was pineapple and jalapeno bacon as well, but I didn't notice either.  I also ordered the coffee braised beef taco, which strangely had loads more meat on it than the al pastor, but was really lacking in flavor.  The meat was dry and the cotija cheese was kind of an odd accompaniment.  My dining companions both really enjoyed their chicken tacos, so perhaps I just made the wrong choice or they have bad taste.  The free chips were my favorite thing about the meal.  They were really good!!  Lightly salted, not greasy at all, and served warm.  The salsa was eh, but oh, I ate LOTS of those chips.  Service-wise, we were greeted and seated immediately, our server was attentive, and we were thanked numerous times as we left the restaurant.  Essentially I enjoyed everything about our experience except the food, which should really be the core of one's restaurant experience.  I'd maybe come back here for a drink, because the bar and interior atmosphere is truly very cool.  For a good fancy taco that is worth the upcharge, go to Gallo Blanco or even America's Taco Shop.  Still pricy for street tacos, but definitely higher quality filler than you'll get at Taco Guild.

FfkoVwzmBcDr5MNMhWByPw.text: Great lunch destination in a cool up and coming neighborhood. Love the building!

BwjPxgj8TRytdBXhOMvEug.text: I've been stalking Taco Guild for months now. Every time I'd go to Starbucks next door, I'd creep on Taco Guild, snapping pics of the structure and the dope typography on the wall. Being sure, of course, to upload it on Instagram and hash-tag it with things like #omgtacos #imadesigner #typographynerd #wheredemtacos. So as you can imagine, when they finally opened, I was quite excited and had high hopes for the restaurant.  First of all, there was a lot of meticulous thought put into this entire concept. Being a designer/art director, I know what it takes to maintain a level of consistency throughout a restaurant. This place was just excellent in terms of execution and aesthetic. The actual building itself was gorgeous, and I'm a huge sucker for stained glass windows. Everything from the logo, to the murals, to the design of the menu - color me impressed. Which is the color of chartreuse, I heard. Anyway, we all know why I really went - to stuff my chipmunk cheeks with savory tacos. You can have awesome design, but the food is key (duh). I started off with the chips and salsa - pretty standard, good salsa. Whatevs. I was particularly hungry, so I ordered 3 tacos and 2 sides. I had the peking duck, molida lamb, and guild chicken with a side of red beans and grilled corn. The tacos were very delicious, I loved the unique toppings and flavors to all 3. My favorite however was definitely the lamb. The sides didn't disappoint either, both were packed with flavor and by the time I had consumed everything, I was quite plump and happy. There was no way I could eat any more food and...oh what's that? You have a prickly pear sorbet? Sure I'll take that as well. This turned out to be an excellent idea, as it was the perfect amount of sweetness to satisfy my sweet tooth.   So why the 4 stars instead of 5, Lindi K.? Cause I felt like it yo! Just kidding. It's because I felt the food was a wee bit overpriced (but not surprised by this) and because the tacos weren't as good as Taqueria Los Yaquis, which is literally $1 for a taco. Although, Taco Guild does have a bar...bonus. No matter though, the entire concept was impressive and I had a lovely time there. I think this place will do very well.

ReDDs2M8a2TEXCQEHDAQrA.text: Okay, so let's start off by saying I tried these guys off balance and out of their location at the AZ Taco Fest on 10/18. The tequila pork and the chicken taco they put up were IMO, the best ones I had all day. I spent some time chatting with one of the reps at the tent about the food and how they do things and was pretty enthused about house made salsa, seeing as how everyone has their own version. The tequila menu would be a big draw for those looking to step out of the Patron/Cuervo repertoire, but I like that they now offer a special where if you buy a regular entree, you get a penny Margarita! I am looking forward to visiting the home location and seeing just how they stack up against my taco testing to urge zones when they have a full kitchen.

tmYVTuU3tMFm2k-f7R-rYg.text: The ambiance was great! I had a red sangria that I would highly recommend.   We were so disappointed with the food. We had guacamole and chile con queso; they were both bland. We also got tacos (shrimp, chicken, lamb, braised beef) that were equally bland.   Despite all of this, I would definitely go back...but only for the drinks and the unique environment.

YO-MDIQM4_6fgbZ-IfDXWA.text: For a while, I frequented this place for lunch around once per week.  Love the veggie tacos.  The Habanero salsa is wonderful as is the pesto hummus.  On occasion, the kitchen has made a couple of errors.  The management has been great in trying to fix this.  I

ACHr66YhZ48QFSt7nOJLog.text: I absolutely love this place! Whenever friends or family visit me in Phoenix, this is my go-to spot.

G7XS3agp5HkTSu1LdE5Qpw.text: The atmosphere was great.  We had taco sampler and they were good. Salsa options were good.

EndTdUbeDmQExqbb4nmDrg.text: I've been around my fair share of restaurants and taco places in particular being from California but this place by far is the most impressive to date. The atmosphere is very welcoming from the moment you are greeted to when you leave. If you are a fan of lamb meat as a source of protein their lamb tacos are a MUST TRY!!! Seriously I've been to numerous Mediterranean places and Taco Guild is head and shoulders above the competition. The Peeking duck has a very unique texture and taste as well but back to the lamb...if you have ever ate lamb and haven't tried this place you have NOT experienced life yet. Same goes for if you have eaten tacos but not at this establishment, you are missing out! I'm here in Phoenix for work but if I ever lived here I'd be a regular at this establishment. Did I mention the local craft brews? Large selection from blondes, ales, lagers, and pilsners to stouts, browns, and IPAs you name it they have it. Great service as well even on a busy night my food was prepped and served in less than 10 minutes maybe even faster. How this place does not have 5 stars for every review I do not know. Must have gotten a bad bartender or server but don't let that steer you away from this amazing place. Just for a little piece of history..this place is an old Church...how cool is that? Next time you go out for tacos and you don't chose taco guild you should probably slap yourself. Don't make the mistake I did of not coming here on the first day of my visit in Phoenix.

gWLLn5kxUNShFe_5RjnIdg.text: I visited this place on a Sat night and they had live music. The music was too loud and made it difficult to carry on a conversation.  However the atmosphere was good. It's an old church that was converted to a restaurant. The food was very delicious. Not your typical tacos though. I had the urban bean coffee braised beef taco and chipotle cherry steak taco. Both were delicious. Between $4-$5 per taco. The side of rice was dry and bland. I would recommend this place to friend.  Friendly and attentive staff. Good place.

b7EgHZRQ406vFdHO374GlQ.text: Margaritas and daily taco special were both amazing! A great bargain.  I liked the atmosphere as well. Great and friendly service.  I would have given it 5 stars but... Then I tried the corn on the cob that everyone was raving about. It was disgusting. Do you people not know what real corn on the cob is supposed to taste like?!? This was like eating cardboard, slathered in butter and cheese.  I had to drink two more margaritas just to get that awful taste out of my mouth.

0L5Os0my2OqFLM278w06Dw.text: Our experience at taco guild was great! Our server Latim (I hope I spelled that right) was knowledgable and well trained. Our chips came out fresh and hot and the salsa to go with it was delicious. I ordered the margarita - one of the best I've ever had, you won't be disappointed. But the highlight of the night was the duck taco - get it. Everyone at our table loved it!

mC--MbId-yRkDtCnKlBfcA.text: Decided to try this place out due to the awesome decor but was sadly disappointed. Coming from a restaurant background I know what to expect and what is incorrect. To start off my boyfriend and I were greeted with an unfriendly guy who looked like he was more than ready to leave for the night. he brought us our drinks then disappeared for quite some time. By the time he came around to ask for an appetizer order we were already losing patience. The food took forever to hit the table. The food was mediocre and the service didn't help. We had to ask several different people to fill our waters and were only checked on once which was when we asked for the check. I had high hopes for this place but simply left with leaving a note on the check saying "service needs a lot of work, step it up." Won't be going back.

Z0YPZEU9fKDnVwGcl8sPtA.text: I was buying a guitar across the street at Guitar Tree..and wondered over to Taco Guild for lunch. My girlfriend and I were so blown away by the decor of this place! Like an old church slightly converted to a great place too eat, drink and hang out. The service was great and we thought the food was excellent..Chips & Salsa great..My taco's were so good and they had all these different sauces..You know, if you're a cheapskate you might go somewhere else..but we were perfectly happy to shell out 50 bucks for lunch and drinks..it was fun and we'll be back

TeiMyx5L37ZLtK3ykQlf6g.text: the overall concept of the chapel vibe is really cool and different. some of the booths are even reused chapel pews. the stained glass windows are awesome too. the chips, guac, and house sauce we all amazing. I had the chicken burrito and was really satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. chicken burrito, guac, corn, chips, house salsa, mexican coke yum!!!!

F33FUlQa5Y_XXD3kjJPIlw.text: The Taco Guild.(7th St/Osborn).  It's an 1893 original school house turned Methodist church kept alive and well with some original artifacts still displayed. The atmosphere is well worth the visit. Beautiful stained glass windows abound with a very high ceiling and murals on the high walls create an almost Gothic surreal feel.   The food on the pallet is clearly Spanish fusion, something I'd describe as southwestern/New Mexico with a splash of Mexico. The street corn on the cob is magnificent. The salsa fresh and original. The food has a delicious smokey flare as if cooked over and open camp fire. The cost is appropriate. The bathrooms immaculate. Service outstanding. If your looking for spicy flare ask for more of  homemade house brand hot sauces - dishes are on the mild spicy side, but not  without flavor. There is a bar there and they advertise craft beers, but I don't drink so I don't even know what a "craft" beer is! Bonn Apatite!

-awvdDOtgreXqPxX9XfC9g.text: Came here for brunch/lunch this Sunday; I wasn't overly hungry, but luckily everything was made a la carte, and priced fairly! I shared the chorizo meat balls with my friend (it came with 6 and a pile of shredded beets), the sauce was sweet and savory with leafy bites of cilantro. I often find anything with chorizo to be too salty, but it was just right, especially with the sweet sauce pairing. They have the healthy option to get lettuce wraps instead of corn or flour tortillas, and seeing as there was an abundant amount of free chips and salsa, I didn't miss having a tortilla-the lettuce was perfect! The free salsa and chips also came with three smaller and unique tasting salsas/sauces that varied in flavor and spiciness-it was awesome to have variety. To top of the great food and service, the atmosphere was amazing. I loved the high ceilings and stained glass, a huge rustic chandelier and beautiful well kept bathrooms. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ceiling

tDb5hke2R-3zgB0DYxxRHg.text: I am in love!  Since the moment I walk in everyone has been courteous, genuine and just awesome!  The bartender showed us to a table, there has been at least 4 servers that have helped us and the food, oh Lordy help me, the food is drool worthy!  The chips, which are complimentary, are the best I have had in a long time.  The salsa is not a great ball of fire which is good on my book.  The guacamole we tried was the one with pineapple and mint. Mmmmm! Mmmm good!  We did want the one with bacon and they were out but whatever, we were happy campers.  The tacos we had were out of this world!  The Thai snapper snapped me back to my honeymoon in Thailand only last month.  I swooned and was transported back to the most romantic trip I ever took.  We also had the Peking duck taco with apricot compote, it got my taste buds ready for the holidays.  Michael was our main server and he was so personable and well versed on the menu, such a plus since they have only been open 3 days!  There is a jukebox so you can pick music and the frescos are custom made and have "The Masters" seriously check them out.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2rN6i_fBAKqwDKA_2_bJIA.text: New favorite restaurant! The location is so stinkin cool and the food is unbelievable!! I could have drank the salsa... The staff there is just phenomenal, everyone treats you like you are a regular, so friendly and when the ask if you need something or how the food is, it's like they REALLY care! Seriously. You can tell they all care about their jobs and care about their customers. Love this place and can't wait to go back!

AshIspXgBxBfzWiCKF9iaQ.text: Our first visit to Taco Guild was fantastic. As I'm sure other reviewers have noted, the restaurant is an old renovated church with high ceilings and a classic and vintage feel. The atmosphere is warm and the servers are well dressed and generally attractive, lighting is low and the bathrooms are unique and clean. Overall the establishment is top notch. As far as the food went... phenomenal. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because it's on the pricey side for street style tacos- but they're definitely more on the gourmet side and worth it for a nice outing.

aXy4U6jo9jiJBY7amVXGfA.text: The food here is garbage. I ordered a steak bowl with rice instead of quinoa. Literally tasted like they threw some canned beans into a box of two minute rice, added a packet of mexican seasoning, and topped it with bananas. Don't go here.

6RygPm8D_nfFwMZR8o_zow.text: The Taco Guild has a great atomsphere, but the food was...just okay.  This is first restaurant I visited in Phoenix, and I really had high hopes; particularly since the reviews were so good. Boy was I disappointed. The service was not great and neither was the food...Well the Queso Fundido was pretty good, but everything else tasted like microwaved, or some form of pre-made food. I had ordered the Shrimp Enchilada...Big mistake.   The shrimp were not right...Nothing about the meal was right...Except the Queso Fundido...Go for the Fundido!  The waitress was nice, but elusive. Perhaps she knew the food wasn't going to be great.

4L41cSCaS0Ms95-QVN-m7Q.text: Kind of disappointed in the tacos. The service was great but the flavor and options for tacos was lacking in my opinion.

tQ_8ld8Z5E2aluE6MP0q4w.text: I think the worse service ever . No one in the resteraunt and st least ten staff chatting with each other. I was there with two friends maybe ten people in there. The employees rather talk with themselves than deal with customers. We went there on the recomendation of my friend who was with me. He said this was not the service I had when last here. My friend said I should vidio the employees who were all gossiping standing around. She actually called over a manger and told her we have nee. Here ten minutes and we have not seen bartender. -xjVYJtYtxkFTJAXHc_Qag.text: If you're looking for tasty tacos and a cool atmosphere, this is the place. The only issue is that they raised the prices, so happy hour isn't really worth it anymore. The tacos are authentic and pretty tasty. The house margarita is a decent one. They do serve chips and salsa with every meal. However it does get super busy, if you're trying to go for happy hour on a Friday-you will have to wait at least 30 minutes.   I don't know that I will come back here too often because there are too many other places that I can get a taco and a marg for a better price.

PcyjNn_ekncWBcv_pUZsLQ.text: Tacos are top shelf. I enjoyed the Mexican Corn off the Cob as a side dish mostly.  I have tried several tacos and my favorite is carnitas.  The variety of salsas offered are fantastic, ranging from kid friendly up adult spicy.  Space gets crowded and parking is horrendous is the only reason not to be a 5-Star.

TY-P_4jwVjArBXqXLcPt3w.text: Rated one of the "top 10 places to get tacos in the US" - not sure where I read it, but that alone was reason for me to come.  Located in an old, repurposed church, Taco Guild has a cool vibe with stunning decor.  I'm not much of a taco eater, but I obviously had to order some while hear. I wasn't in love, but they were good. I loved the chips and salsas they bring you before your meal. The salsas had varying temperatures and all were delicious. I also tried the corn which was amazing and I loved that they gave you the option to get the corn off the cob (less messy!)  Overall a fun place. Could definitely see myself coming back if I'm ever in the area again.

53bPvXmqIbtwat59ropJBA.text: I was referred to to place for good tacos. Love the concept of a old church. The ambiance is super cool and upbeat! Sat at the bar and the service was the best they checked in with us but not annoying and very friendly.  The food we very good we had 1 special taco if the day habanero chicken taco it was good the chick was a little dry and not as much flavor as I personally would like and cherry steak was delicious very flavorful and the meant was juicy!  The chips are excellent not super greasy and very fresh the salsa was great flavor and I enjoy the three other sauces they give with it. All three very different and tasty. We also tried the chicken enchiladas with rice. The enchiladas could of use a little more sauce but the flavor was tasty and the rice was good  enjoyed the add in corn and celery etc.  The corn tortillas are fresh I just wish they could make the taco shells crispy but it will not stop me from going back! Definitely need to go down the menu and try everything.

ocdo4PG6mVv1fGoPIL7ycA.text: I don't know how else to put it other than the best tacos I've ever had in my entire life, and I eat a lot of tacos. Also it's in an amazing repurposed church so the atmosphere is ridiculously cool. Loved it!

EgIurs4WxoajWhoKiw6cSA.text: My favorite Mexican place in Phoenix. The tacos are inventive and addicting. The deviled eggs with chorizo are the best deviled eggs ever and I feel like that's a weird thing to say. The chorizo meatballs from the appetizer menu are also amazing with a sweet and spicy glaze. The cocktail drinks are really good. They give you main table salsa but also three specialty salsas that are amazing- I especially love the vinegar carrot one.   Fun atmosphere, live music occasionally. Highly recommend!

-ON4TKLNV03XJILriSBCYA.text: Great food! The tacos are delicious. However I would stay away from the fish, definitely did not taste the best. Everything else there is damn near amazing. if you decide to go for taco Tuesday give yourself plenty of time as the wait can be over an hour. While you wait you definitely need to be sipping on a margarita!!

fz0yYka-SF_UdA2E0Cmfag.text: Taco Tuesday is the best! Amazing delicious food! It's a bit far from where I live but it is worth stopping by here!!

euVsmn08UXV2avs2GYpSfw.text: I received multiple reviews from people that this was the place to go for a good taco in Phoenix and it gives up to then hype.  It's situated in an old church so the vibe inside is really cool.  Dark, high ceilings, like an old gothic cathedral.  The tacos were on point as well with a lot of meat and good flavors.  My only draw back was the time it took just for 2 tacos to come out was a little long.  The tacos were also a tad on the expensive side, 5 and up, but for gourmet fancy tacos I guess it makes since.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chiptole cherry steak taco

jFKC5aa4AMi-T5m4PKTioA.text: Nice vibe to the spot and in a nice area!    The tacos are different which made me hesitant but they worked lol. The tacos bring like a different flavor than a traditional taco but they convinced me to come back again and again. My personal fav was the cherry steak taco

mNtmIwgRRBeYbWO8BIdDxQ.text: Taco guild was a fun dinner experience for my husband and I. The restaurant is a historic building which used to be a church. There was live music, the two person band was taking requests for songs which was fun. The food options were great, but my husband and I specifically went to try their tacos. We each ordered a taco plate which came with 3 tacos and a side. We decided to get all 6 different tacos and shared to try as many as we could. The least favorite was the Mahi Mahi. I feel as though the fish lacked flavor and seasoning. The best taco was the molida lamb (I'll probably order three of these next time we go). Service was average, nothing out of the ordinary but no complaints. Why did I rate it 4 stars and not 5 you ask? Because i find it very difficult to find tacos that compare to Mexico City tacos :)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stunning chandelier
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary chips and salsa.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco plate w/ side of chefs choice rice. Tacos from left to right: Mahi mahi, Molida lamb, chipotle cherry steak

EXwhmYzOA-VZQmhr6sXY6g.text: Good food, but pricey. I know. Don't compliment then say "but". Takes the value away.   I can't complain. I prefer a burger over tacos, so there you go. Thank you, Shawna

GW5pLv-ba96YNWSSg2TLLQ.text: My all time favorite taco spot! I've been to Phoenix five times now and we prioritize a stop at the Taco Guild each time! I love the salsas, the guacamole menu, and the hand pressed corn tortillas!! Also, excellent craft cocktails!   Getting a table on a Friday night can be a bit difficult and you may have to wait a while but they've made it a bit easier to order drinks to help pass the time!   On Friday, the background music was a solo guitar player/singer doing covers and he was SO good!   But my vary favorite part is the ambiance and the building this gem of a restaurant is in! This old early 1800's church is gorgeous with stained glass windows, giant chandeliers, and would details! Just beautiful

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck tacos, veggie taco, street corn!

pN1bNlXux0LjjYiQ8eahYA.text: I came across Taco Guild when trying to find a new spot to grab some tacos! The decor and old church setting is such and experience. From the stained glass windows to the gothic looking centerpieces. This was definitely a fun place.  Service was a little slow and we didn't feel like our server was excited to be serving us. I had 3 tacos: the Cherry beef, coffee braised beer and the Shrimp taco as well as a side of rice. It was super yummy! The happy hour margarita was also good!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour margarita!!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp taco, Cherry beef, and coffee braised beef! With a side of rice
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and Salsa.  A salsa with hints of chipotle and 3 speciality salsas!!

P4UwZsG125SlPzFsXgc4PQ.text: A new drink menu just opened today. This calls for a cocktail.   My server, Tommy, was at the ready with recommendations and a friendly smile. He was knowledgeable about the spice factor in both tacos and drinks.   Apps: ordered the ceviche but it never arrived. Not sure if the server forgot or just didn't hear me; or maybe he was distracted by my sweet smile. Either way, I'm kind of glad because with the hefty complimentary serving of chips and salsa, I had more than enough to eat.   Drinks: arrived after my meal but it was also put in after I ordered my food. Into dress the Serpent. A close replacement for a Moscow Mule, the cucumber and ginger fusion is a refreshing choice for a hot day. At $10, I'd be happy to have a second or third.   Main dish (Taco Apovada): I went against Tommy's recommendation for the Al Pastor taco (he indicated spicey and I'm kind of a whimp). The Apovada had my attention with the jicama salsa. It was good for sure (the Salsa) but was a smidge on the dry side. Maybe a touch more salsa would help or some type of a drizzle. The corn tortilla was thick!   Atmosphere: it was a little chilly inside but that is typical the warming AZ temps. Music was going, typical bar noise from where I sat. At 130 pm, the place was busy but not packed. Bar was full but I was sat quickly at a high top bar adjacent. I enjoyed the atmosphere very much. A fun place to have a lunch by yourself and people watch, work (as I was doing) or with a friend / date.  Restrooms: clean as a whistle after the lunch rush. This is always a good sign to me of a well-run restaurant.   Cost: a skinny girls lunch: $15.69 for one drink, one taco, and complimentary chips and salsa.   Side note: I was a smidge thrown off by the tweety bird plate but I'm all for keeping it light and reducing / reusing in this world!   All in all, definitely heck this place out for lunch or a post work bite! You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-J2f5IrFA5eudKHTRyVIQA.text: Wow, food is amazing. The fresh locally sourced produce is awesome. Service impeccable. Hearn is great. First time here. The taco Guild is in an old church ad the atmosphere and ambiance is romantic and cool. You can feel the happy haunts.

bUxbPyhEPCDmNoPVlSy9zg.text: Oh my goodness...where do I start?! Didn't eat here but every single drink I tried was amazing. I tried 4 different drinks here and every single one was unbelievable. Friends in the area say the food is equally as impressive. Building is an old church, character, history, everything is A+. Our serve was phenomenal, wish I caught his name. Definitely will be back

U-PJ9-DgZiZCge26b3nUDQ.text: I'm a bit of a Taco Guild addict. It's walking distance from my house, so it's hard not to be. I'm pescatarian so I've had every fish, shrimp, or veggie taco they've got and they're all amazing. Even though the tacos are small, they're super filling. Other things I would recommend: salads (watch out there is a dressing that is SUPER spicy- can't remember the name), shrimp enchiladas, CHIPS AND GUAC! Service is always great here. The patio has misters and it's nice even in the summer. Can't beat the vintage church vibe.

5vzPrisGcyHqTuKQHUA7zw.text: Took my girlfriend for the first time this afternoon as she is my most trusted taco connoisseur. We ordered the three taco plate with a substitute for street corn as our side and the food was very satisfying and we enjoyed being adventurous with our meat selection. My girlfriend ordered a horchata and a mango margarita. The margarita was disguised with sugar coating around the rim however upon picking up the glass, my girlfriend was pierced with loose shards and began bleeding. A concerned wait staff approached and promptly sent over management to see if we needed any assistance. He offered a bandage and ointment and we appreciated the concern. We finished our meal after having our drinks replaced and even ran into a friend. Although a complementary drink was not offered, I would have assumed the blood soaked napkin my girlfriend was using would be more than enough to get a meal comp. Instead my bill was rung up at full price and drinks were charged in full. An active bleed caused by a lackadaisical wait staff and a poorly managed restaurant has left me with a bad taste in my mouth and glass shards literally in my girlfriends fingers. As we prepare out spring 2019 food blog we will be sure to leave your restaurant out of the listings. Needless to say that is my last supper at the taco guild.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

l8uq8DzzSyEcRsGLYBrg4A.text: Ha! Not much to add. 1154 reviews. Apparently I am the only person in The Valley that had never been here. Free valet parking is helpful. Waited 5 minutes on a a Friday night at 6:30 pm for a table. Warm chips and a variety of salsa were good. Happy Hour ends at 6pm. Live music was a little loud for a small, open space. Affordable tasty Mexican food and cocktails. Menu is limited but they have your standard options. I really liked the tortillas with my chicken enchiladas. We were served quickly. Affordable, hip place with an outdoor patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken enchiladas

rr1UmZLJd_M_mD8r47W8MQ.text: The place is nicely decorated and it is an interesting concept.  However, the space is not well utilized.  The service was attentive but trying to compensate for the lack of refinement. For example, the live music was horribly loud/booming, the drinks took 15 min to arrive (after the food arrived) and instead of an apology we got an excuse.   The acoustics of this place are horrible - if you are trying to have quiet night or a date night stay away, especially if there is live music.

WYtt_XvqDx59KEU9QSfBNA.text: The food is tasty but it lacks fast consistent service. Initially we were kept waiting to place drink orders for several minutes, possibly because our waiter couldn't see us for we were seated in the back room. After our drinks we ordered our food, our waiter said it'll be out quick because the kitchen is super fast; ironically the table beside us got their food faster even though they arrived ten minutes after we ordered. We also had to wait several minutes for the check. Although there were a lot of negative aspects, I've only been here twice so I can't say if it's always like this or if it was an off day.

9PO5fRr0H4MBM1KTOHG4ww.text: It all starts with the building. It is composed from an old church with high vaulted ceilings and ornate stained glass windows.  The salsas that come with chips are fab and come in varying heat levels. We consumed the Taco of the Day and it was quite delicious. They are only $2.50 or $3 dollars each. This haunt sports a nice bar small patio adjacent the front of the building. Located next to the Buffalo Exchange lends to fun after dinner shopping. It is worth a visit for sure. #vinosquared #vino2ultimate

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4W-polgNp2NFYGPS1-FiQg.text: The service at Taco Guild was really good. I went with my boyfriend yesterday at 5pm and we were seated right away. They served us nachos that were nice and warm with 4 choices of sauces. I ordered 3 tacos (al pastor pork, pork adovada, Yucatan shrimp) that got me a free side (I chose salad). My boyfriend ordered a burrito and he also got the free side salad. I'm a picky eater and I'm not a fan of onions and cilantro so I asked for the cilantro on the side for the pork adovada. Our server, Candice, mentioned that the cilantro was mixed in with the pico and that the al pastor pork taco also had cilantro. I told her it was fine to leave it in if it was too complicated. When the tacos arrived, I was pleasantly surprised that she had remembered to separate out the cilantro for me.  My favorite taco was the al pastor pork. The pork adovada was a bit dry so that was my least favorite. The Yucatan shrimp taco was good but I didn't find it as satisfying as the al pastor pork taco since it felt like it was mostly slaw.   In the end our server Candice was able to get us a to-go container for one of the nacho sauces that we really liked.   Overall my experience at Taco Guild was great. It was my first time seeing a restaurant in an old church building which made for a unique experience. The service and food were great.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NTVx58Yf74xL3TTPNhzwJw.text: It's Friday evening and we're out to celebrate my sister in laws birthday. The whole gang shows up ,  Accommodations were what's expected when you show up 18 strong , Not enough room , but glad we came. . Food was delicious. Our servers Mike and Stephanie were very attentive. We will be back!

amyAGUiOPqLczXABoclmlw.text: Drove by and noticed the unique exterior. Then realized it was a taco joint in an old church. Right when you walk in you will see beautiful stained glass windows and the old world decor! This place is so cool!   Food was good, trendy tacos with classic flavors and new world flavors. I really wanted to love the two different pork tacos, but they were a bit dry. But the cherry beef was really good!   Service could of been a little more attentive, but they looked a bit short staffed. But otherwise service was great!   Will be back soon to try the other meats.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OFK2hucLn3mx9AS4kvm2Xg.text: Amazing, filling tacos. The meat and sauces they combine to make the tacos are delicious. Great drinks and happy hour as well I'd say! It being in an old church makes eating inside there a unique experience visually with it's old architecture.

8l7hJHsLIZw19FfnvS1N-A.text: Do you like Chili's? Because if you like Chili's you might like taco guild. The food was fine but barely. I tried three different tacos; the chicken the duck and the Carnitas. The pork was the best of the three, but not by much. I imagine that all of it would've been better chased by a margarita, but i can not attest to the quality of those.

e9HC-vI7ZDVX7xjI1mYJGg.text: The atmosphere is pretty cool and unique. The tacos are delicious. Definitely a fun place to try. Our waiter was pretty good too. BUT, I just have to mention that the hostess at the door was pretty rude and acted pretty pissed off when I politely asked if we could wait for a better table. She said "WHY? WHAT DO YOU NEED?" I mean, Jesus lady. Chill! People wanna feel relaxed and welcomed in a restaurant. All things considered, try it. Its a cool place.

3GxGvk0jm8Rf3ezosTZOiw.text: Great food. The burritos are substantial...it's a whole meal for sure. They make a great crema that goes with it. Sauces they provide are fantastic and pleasantly spicy. Give them a try!

RpI30p1drql2Lh8Jzpiv4w.text: I have been here several times and the service is always wonderful. The food is always cooked to perfection and the music is very entertaining. Once I placed an order for Valentine's Day and when I got home a few things were missing from my order. I called Taco Guild right away and the manager was kind enough to provide me a credit towards my next meal.The next time is stopped by for dinner not only did they provided me the credit but they also comped my entire meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchiladas

3kjHz8o3iupyBdvLwgOFYA.text: This is my second time eating here and it has been great. The associates are really friendly, and the atmosphere is pretty chill. We did have a 20 min wait for a table on a Monday, so if you can call ahead of time and reserve a seat I would highly recommend doing so. The food did not take long to arrive after being ordered. I ordered the 3 taco plate with cherry steak and a side of corn on the cob. The tacos were good but not amazing, which is why I gave it a 4 Star. The corn on the other hand was delicious. My wife and I did not try their desert but if we come back that will be worth a try. Overall I would recommend trying it out and having a taste for yourself. =)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZVEpNjN6691_lIhCoOgWgQ.text: Honestly, if I could give this place six stars, I would. They served some of the best tasting tacos I have ever had. They also provide you with a gigantic portion of warm tortilla chips to share with some tasty salsa. The atmosphere is very unique, as the entire restaurant takes up a refurbished old church. The service has always been quick and friendly, and I need to reiterate that the tacos are AMAZING.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5P-Gc3mLyy4QSFMg6eliLw.text: Tried this place for "Taco Tuesday" considering it's Tuesday and I wanted tacos but....this place doesn't even have a Taco Tuesday menu. First red flag...this place was mediocre to say the least. Here are the issues I had: 1. The service SUCKED! The waitress literally went MIA for a long time and barley checked on us.  2. The menu was very limited and they barley had any main entrees.  3. The taco menu was just okay. Considering taco is in the name of the restaurant.  4. The happy hour menu was HORRIBLE! The only food item on the menu was the Daily taco. Today's daily taco was BBQ chicken. Mmmm no shanks I'll pass on that.  5. I ordered the taco guild chicken and the shrimp taco. I make better chicken tacos at home and the shrimp taco was not good at all. The shrimp was soooo cold. We sent back our shrimp tacos and they were removed.  6. The margarita was basic and there was only one margarita on the happy menu hour for $5.95 for cheap tequila. Doesn't really sound like a deal to me.   The positives: 1. The elote was AMAAAZZZZIIINNGGGG. Literally the best thing here.  2. The chips and salsas were good.   It's safe to say I definitely won't be back.

0mut9br9JRUG4Fj_2VGHAg.text: Great service. Jordan was our waiter and made us feel like regulars. I had never been and a business partner of mine was in town and asked to go. We got tacos and a few beers. El pastor, duck and coffee braised beef or whatever and they were awesome! Really neat concept and the beer they brewed for the restaurant was good. I will come back for taco Tuesday... I guess they have a dj and deals. Must see in midtown!

fda1gHkLEZU_YOxMWXZqOA.text: Where to start???? Chips and salsa 5 star Street corn 5 star Tacos 5 star Atmosphere 10 star   So if I average this place out its over a 5 star but Yelp won't let me do above 5 star.  Thanks again Yelp. My chance of coming back is 100%

gREbFmxzUa1JkbdA0TN-8w.text: Dont go here looking for your typical Mexican street taco. DO go here if you're looking for a tastegasm in the form of a taco. I got the 3 taco plate. Peking Duck, Lamb and Pork Al Pastor.  with the free red beans side. It was fabulous. We also did an extra anejo tequila flight that was out of this world. The staff was excellent and attentive. I totally would give this place 5 stars if not for the ambiance. It is a barn, sound bounces off of every surface in the place.  Loud. I'd love to see them hired an acoustic engineer to try and help that some. but the food is definatly worthy of a try.

zhsrkIqU3JMwbbGdS-BdbA.text: I absolutely love this place! Amazingly Stellar homemade house guacamole in three different flavors - so good you can make a meal out of just that but their tacos are Divine as well. Don't miss out on the Moscow Mules!

8iKz45eEv4AbV5k3CawPgw.text: I absolutely LOVE the ambiance of Taco Guild. Set in an old church, it has beautiful stained glass windows and various eclectic pieces that give it so much personality. If you're heading downtown for the evening, this is the perfect Midtown dinner spot prior to your night on the town!   I love their Sunday Happy Hour from 2 PM -Close. They have $5 drink specials and their daily taco is only $1.99! & Honestly, the daily taco is usually my favorite one in the mix. :) The Guild Duo is a must {guacamole & fire roasted green chile queso combo}. My mouth is watering just thinking about the queso! The street corn is also a winner! It makes the perfect side to your delicious tacos.   We will be back soon to try out more of their fabulous menu items!

FjCILsAfA4lYsEMsh6hyNQ.text: Must try the coffee braised beef tacos! Well worth the trip! Atmosphere is great and the service was great! Love these types of places!

yxRYY4m5Zxvc3cvSkd3a4w.text: Really cool location with a  really cool take on tacos.  They mix traditional tacos with trendy "New World" tacos that are always interesting.  The Ambience of drinking a craft beer and eating Elotes while surrounded by stained glass is quite the experience.  Good place to take out-of-towners.

eWmXUmgY2D2RmpUu40eeeQ.text: Excellent tacos. We had shrimp, pork & steak, all good. The hand made corn tortillas are delicious. Grilled corn side, likewise. Food just spicy hot enough to enhance flavor, not overwhelm it. The happy hour frozen margaritas are very very strong, on the rocks less so. Good service from Chris, who was soft spoken, humorous, and had good timing.

sWi8lQ2g4cEbEnUubtTonQ.text: Wow!  I have no idea why I can here a second time but my dad wanted to try. What a mistake!!!  We arrived at 3:40 place what's pretty much empty maybe five tables with customers all waiting for chips water and drink. Our server and the managers seemed more important or focused on socializing instead of attending to their table. We waited probably 10 minutes before anyone came up to us and finally brought us chips but no waters no drink ordered another five minutes went by before server came in finally took our drink order. The food was mediocre at best I had a grilled romaine salad that tasted like I was eating smoke to the point I had to stop midway through and still have the taste of smoke in my mouth. We had ordered a second drink before our meal even came out another server brought our drinks out that's on the table I stopped him from leaving and said excuse me can you please take our empty glasses he looked at me with disgust and took them begrudgingly. It's safe to say I will never come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

x_1v7pXaJIoEIUq1T9a1pw.text: At atmosphere like no other, except besides of course, a church.. this place makes Mexican food taste holy - and the salsa practically is.

r7L8Dag5SH-PRkTgCK8C7A.text: Great time here.  The tacos were super, and inventive with the ingredients.  Service was tops.  A bit loud if you're trying to have a conversation.  The interior of this place is very cool.  Will definitely go again.

B3eHn-zDn1XpIiHnB_hDrA.text: This place is as good as it gets.  Hopping Happy Hour, Live Music, Crazy Good menu, Creamy blended Margaritas, Amazing waitress (Rebecca - This is your chance to ask for a raise / bonus), and that man who makes it all happen (Jason - Marissa already said you are amazing).  We were visiting Phoenix for our daughters graduation from Grand Canyon University.  (We hail from San Diego, so we know a little something about good Mexican food.)  Anyway, we figured that as a special celebration dinner that our daughter would choose a fancy place like the Biltmore.  Even though we don;t have a ton of money, we would have splurged on a place like the Biltmore.  (Shh.  Don't tell our daughter but the bill for 6 people with drinks was under $100.)  Our daughter came up with the idea to come here.  Good call to our genius daughter that graduates Cum Laude in 2 1/2 years!!!  We ordered several of the corn on the cob and my mother, who attended boarding school in Mexico as a child, had the biggest Cotija Cheese grin.  When my husband asked her if she liked it she just grunted and smiled as she grimed away on it.  Classy!  We also ordered the Fundido (because it is fun.)  We had never had it and it was super yummy, cheesy, sausagey... I guess I am my mother's daughter because the drool on my chin is definitely NOT a classy look.  Did I mention that I am a foodie, ... hard-core!  In fact afterward I hunted down poor Jason with the look of a stalker and pinned him in the corner until he revealed the basic idea on how to reconstruct the corn.  My family was like "Mom!  Taste the sauce so you can make it for us at home!"  Usually, I can pick out the nuances of just about anything.  Ironically, for as easy as the recipe Jason explained, such simple styling, such lovely ingredients, such a homily of flavors ... each lifting the other up.  Okay, I'm starting to palpitate!  I'm so glad we talked Jason.  You are my new best friend.  Regarding anyone who gives poor marks (or less that 5 stars).  Um, you either had a one off experience (every restaurant has hiccups sometimes) or you are an idiot.  This place has great food, beautiful ambiance, neat backstory, and super cool people.  Best restaurant we had been to in all of Phoenix.  I just wish there was an old church in my neighborhood that we could take over their building and make into a Taco Guild West.    Jesus would be proud of how this old building has been reinvented into another place which brings peace to mankind.

xNZPRzwAQtPNf84Mvti7sw.text: I've been a patron at the Taco Guild for several years now & haven't been disappointed yet.  I try to go right around 5:00 before the after work crowd starts arriving.  By the time I leave, the place is packed.  It's a tequila & taco place - no wine list, fantastic drinks, over 100 different tequilas.  The site used to be an historic church & the owners preserved much of the original building.  The stained glass windows are impressive & I love the decor & ambience.  I'm longing for another visit soon.  The selection of tacos is extensive - some classic & some more edgy selections.      There are several other options as well.  I'm recommending the Taco Guild whole heartedly - have a margarita for me!  Tee hee

DEinJbBK56wTeyJvp8exfQ.text: The space is fun and the staff are friendly, but the tacos and bar are disappiointing. The half dozen tacos we ordered lacked flavor and the beef and chicken proteins were pretty dry. The mixed drinks were just plain bad. Solid ceviche of the day though!

Lw3cmZvMunYLI5Ez2We_dQ.text: Love this spot. Get the daily taco. Doesn't matter what it is, just go for it. The best daily taco I've had was corned beef and mashed potatoes. Sounds weird, just went for it, now I can't stop thinking about the flavor explosion. Please bring that one back!  The bartenders are super friendly. The service can be slow at times when you are at a table, but if you sit at the bar, the service is outstanding. Good local beers on tap, top notch margaritas, and plenty of other mixed drinks.

Du02DB5WVAgUuE_DrmL_7Q.text: Found via Yelp reviews. We are from out of town and have to thank other Yelpers once again for a great find . We ate outside on the patio and it was perfect weather for it ! I had a taco trio with a side of street corn off the Cobb and everything was delicious! For my drink I tried the Blushing Senorita - wine with raspberry Stoli and berries - divine ! Waitress was kind and attentive - this place is a must for in and out of towners!

pfwjyi58Dpccv7OHDyD0gQ.text: Amazing taco spot- food, ambiance, drinks! Happy Hour from 2-7 is one of the best in the valley!

heggU_bxHq6TaiH1qbDxMg.text: What makes this place is the ambiance!! We ate here on a Friday and they had live music! Which I love!! The food started off amazing, their salsas are tasty and the street style corn and guac are def two thumbs up. Out of the three tacos I ordered (which were all different flavors) I only loved one. But the one was unique and really good; It was the urban bran coffee braised beef. My husband had the same experience with his set of three tacos; he only loved one; which for him was the molida lamb. The thing is we are Mexican- and having al pastor on the menu means we are judging and comparing to traditional street tacos from Mexico- which is hard to match or even come close.  This applies to the bean and rice. The drinks are also really good and unique. Overall, great place to try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zbEzaRMVDY6qlS32ypcaFg.text: This used to be better. But now it's not worth the price. It seems like they got some apathetic cooks.

k3_J4v-UaaR4VbWMTK10ig.text: This is a special place.  Using a small church was a brilliant idea.  The paintings on the walls tell what looks like a Dutch masters style story and the giant light fixture above the bar draws your eye up into the very high church ceiling.  The seating includes booth style, regular small tables under stained glass windows, and high top table and chairs in the middle of the room.  Well done!  The parking area is used by several small businesses in this location and can be a little tight during business hours. The salsa is a tasty three small bowl samples.We ordered a mix of street style tacos that came in a taco stand.  They were all good.  The staff was attentive.  We will go again.

-D9k-k96EAPD7NYnBSZ_JQ.text: Really wanted to like this, and it wasn't bad but I think they tried too hard. Lets face it, this is Phoenix, there are good tacos everywhere that were made with passion by someone who has been doing it for generations. A taco should be simple and that is what makes it, Taco Guild seemed to make it something it was not. As a gastropub only this would easily get another star as it fits that bill perfectly, but when you add taco to your name, you get held to a higher standard.  If you want a place to relax with friends go here, if you want tacos go to whatever hole in the wall you find south of downtown or on West Indian School because that is where the real tacos live.

I5zddg95yOpD0KbVLFOZ4g.text: Ambience is always a nice addition when entering a restaurant or anywhere for that matter. This place is awesome. Situated in an old Church, they have remodeled but kept a lot of the character traits such as the stain glass windows and everyone has to sit in a pew. I am kidding about the pew.   The food was great, very authentic and fresh. We had the beef tacos and burrito along with street corn (which was phenomenal) and then we also partook in their delicious chips and salsa. My daughter loved the salsa so much she asked if we could have some to go (she is 6) and our waiter brought us a huge bag of chips and a large to go container of the salsa. Needless to say we were both very happy!  I think I am going to go there today!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

25B-FRkQF4-04FnF8Q049g.text: Please please please get the elotes by far the best thing ever!! You could stack 5 of those and they would gone in 2 seconds.

0ZLr2Yo4KWIdAp0L7b0lnQ.text: Fair Whixican Food,(white Mexican Food) but not worth the price.  Rice is chewy instant rice.  Corn tortillas for enchilada and tacos were not warmed up so they came as stiff.  Tacos are served as street taco sized taco for $5 each.  Its a good thing this isn't a house of god here anymore because what happens here is a sin.

ktUNv9rqIPqiTPmsA8Oa8g.text: This has been one of the worse dining experiences my group and I had ever have. We were here on a Friday night & from the moment we sat down our service from our server was horrible.  The server did not smile, didn't greet us and had an attitude. When we ordered freshly made guacamole as appetizers, it came out cold. We informed the server and he was adamant that couldn't be the case. After a few back & forths, the server got his manager and the manager got us a freshly made guacamole again just to reaffirm that something was off with the avocados.   Once we got our main entree- 8 different variety of tacos, it was again NOT meeting our expectations. First of all, the sever didn't ask if we wanted corn or flour tortilla & the lamb, duck & chicken were undercooked without any flavors to it.  I would NOT recommend this restaurant besides just stopping in to check out the ambiance and the cool "church story"   Do NOT fall for the trap.

CfQ0V99CfCawPROKYSysSw.text: Nice addition to the neighborhood.  Walked in on a Wednesday at 5pm and was seated immediately.  Fantastic job turning this old church building into a beautiful restaurant.  I like how they kept the stained glass.  Our service, although very nice, was bumpy.    We ordered the soup of the day which we were told was tortilla but not what we got.  No big deal as what was served was terrific.  Not sure what it was exactly but it had ground beef and fresh veg.  We then ordered our dinner, the duck tacos were delicious as were the shrimp tacos.  We also ordered a side of corn that never arrived.  We let the food runner know we were missing the side but he did not seem to really care.  He said it would be along shortly but never came.    If you get a chance, ask for the Tequila Book.  The book (menu) contains a huge list of pages of different kinds of Tequila they offer.  I did not bring my reading glasses so at first I was sure I did not read the menu correctly as I saw shots of tequila for $500... what???  I asked my dinner partner if that was five dollars and he assured me it was indeed $500.    If your bank account does not allow for five hundred dollar shots, be advised they do have a great happy hour where you can get a draft beer  and shot of Tequila for five dollars.  (pretty sure it is not the five hundred dollar shot)   They might have dessert but did not see any on the menu and we were not offered any.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco Guild

Uk4tOp5vFIUpDrabxtW3kw.text: Taco Guild has an incredible atmosphere and lovely service, but their menu recently changed and I have to say that while most tacos were still quite yummy their switch in the lamb taco was, to say the least, disappointing.  What was once filled with scrumptious morsels of perfectly cooked lamb topped with crunchy sweet potato strings and crumbly salty cheese has been replaced by a texture-less jumble of too many flavors combined with dry, stringy, braised lamb.  If you go I would, ironically, recommend the enchiladas. They've been perfect every time I've gone and you get a much bigger portion for what you pay.

lz3odNxcPLKGmHF0LDxR5A.text: This is the best Americanized mexican restaurant (if I'm wrong, correct me, for I have never ate any mexican dishes that come close to this) I have ever tasted.  If you like Chipotle, take that and up the taste x10.  The dishes are unique, the drinks are unique, and the old church is unique.  There are some very interesting mix of flavors in the menu.  The pricing is a bit on the higher side, but I feel it is worth every penny.  It's definately a place to check out if you're in the neighborhood but be warned, it's packed.

xrPSNIDUVv9UMljnhjPdlg.text: Cool spot... had a few tacos...listened to live music...it was a good night (Friday)!

G0WD7VIOlD7YppoaVFtSPQ.text: I love this place! Every time my friend and  I go there, we are seated fast, served with water and chips, our orders taken and the food comes out perfect every time and let me tell you we always go at Lunch and it's packed! This place knows how to do it right! The lamb tacos are my favorite! Try them!

olczxiyiV5BxevA5ItZVwg.text: Yes! The Taco Guild is a little bit in your pocket as far as price but let me tell you what you get!!! You are getting the most picturesque ambiance at lunch time in the middle of downtown Phoenix that you could not get anywhere else. Here, let me set it this up for you. Picture the beautiful sleepy coastal city of Ensenada with its perfect beaches and small town vibe. You wander the streets in search of what others have come to know as the best taco's this side of the California Peninsula otherwise known as "The Cinderella of the Pacific" and you approach what looks to be like a church. You get closer and notice a visible line outside the door adorned with the letter "G" and you ask yourself "What kind of Church could this be"? The crowd standing in front of you whispers of a gourmet taco obviously sent from the TACO GODS (probably best that this special place is located in a refurbished church) and you wonder if you have stumbled upon a real live FIND. Not just any kind of gem its the kind of gem found by the best archaeologist  kind of gem like  Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade kind of gem. A gem for the books. Once inside this remarkable edifice you are seated immediately that's right no wait time and If you remember earlier in the review I mean novel I mentioned there was a visible line in front of the door! We sit and order a frozen margarita and while we take in the breathtaking art and stain glass windows our drinks arrive. The menu isn't remarkable and not very extensive but when you know you have a good product you don't need 3-4 pages you just need one really good page. There's something to be said about a little simplicity. He ordered the famous Yukatan Shrimp Tacos , Barracho Red Beans topped with Cojita cheese (Awesome). I decided to try something different and normally my good sense would have stopped me from making the "lets see if this taste good" mistake but in this case with what I had already seen I WASN'T SCARED!! So I ordered the Chipotle Cherry Steak poblano straws, Chile aioli, blue chees tacos, Barracho Red Beans and the famous ELOTE corn. When they call the tacos "New World Tacos" that is exactly what you are stepping into a NEW WORLD... These tacos were a beautiful delight and I couldn't eat them fast enough. So much so I couldn't eat my corn because I was already full . Our waitress was awesome she had our food to us so quickly and asked along with other TACO GUILD personnel if we were satisfied or needed anything ... Of course we were fully full, happy and content. Excited to tell you, yes you that the TACO GUILD is a win. Run don't walk to the BEST STREET TACO you are ever going to get. Please excuse any grammatical errors : )

bJO9BlVzjh7LdvyykQn3sw.text: A great place to grab a quick bite or to relax and enjoy company. Food was excellent. Extremely friendly staff! I forgot my sunglasses at restaurant, they kept them there until I got them! Overall, excellent place!

pXJIuopSd43axXFNuA1u0g.text: Came here for dinner recommended by my daughter.  The place is in an old church building and the way they have used the decor is just great.  The place looks just amazing. The staff was super friendly and very attentive.  They offer a taco plater where you can choose 3 different tacos, This is what I ordered. I ordered the Veggie Taco, the Pork taco, and chicken taco.  The Veggie taco was darn good. I'd order it again. The Pork Taco was better, I would really order it again.  The chicken taco was the least of the three, but it was up against two great tacos. It was very tasty, but I loved the first two.  the Chips were also very, very good.  I would really recommend this place.

5R2J8a4Ou9BIuWjvZ2Mung.text: Dinner was fabulous and the margaritas are yummy and the lamb tacos are out of this world!!! It's a must stop to see and eat!!!!

d_V6_4M3fjgQarUD4ncWrQ.text: Great modern street taco style food with the innovation of creative culinary flavor! Easy to navigate menu, friendly staff, service was quick and easy. Tacos were very immersive with flavor- well thought and well planned. I would recommend this place to even the most snobby food connoisseur. May fave that I tried was the Yucatan Shrimp taco. Very well-cooked with developed flavor.   You guys totally get-it! People love their salsa and you came strong with the selection. My only critique was no green chile. A green chile pork taco with hominy would destroy here too!

Y495LH6IaYgXvJwzdB9FXg.text: This is one of the most beautiful restaurants in Phoenix! It's an old church they repurposed and it is so tastefully done. They are also one of the few spot that offer happy hour till 7, and if you show up around 6 it's usually calmed down and you get can a table pretty promptly. The chips and salsa they give you are . The free tray they bring has a chunky salsa and three sauces that are pretty spicy.  I would also recommend getting their guacamole if you're looking for an appetizer. I haven't had a bad Taco there either. My favorites are the Yucatan shrimp and the al pastor but like I said you can't go wrong. Overall, if you couldn't tell, I love this place and would recommend it to anyone!

OYCt7eybpwB1D0boIV-dyw.text: I decided to try this place out for take-out last week after work. I ordered the steak burrito and picked the salad with cilantro dressing as the side. The staff was very friendly when I picked up my order, and I was very pleasantly surprised that it came with chips (a big bag of them!) and salsa. The burrito was tasty and the steak was tender; my only suggestion would be for the kitchen to not pre-cut the burrito in half for to-go orders, as it got a little bit soggy around the cut line. (Side note: I heated up the half of the burrito I didn't finish in my toaster oven the next night and it was perfect!) The salad was good but the dressing was a bit too sweet for my taste; I may try the avocado dressing instead next time. Overall a solid meal and good value for the price - I'll definitely order from here again.

EHoGT85IcRe2Ng-4n8ZAOg.text: Let me start by saying we really were excited to try this place and really wanted to like it! The service was okay, our server was pretty busy and we take that into account.  The place was really cool, old church. Live music busy but not packed.  The food presentation was beautiful, it looked great but just fell flat at every turn.   Chips and salsa, decent nothing great. We ordered the guacamole and queso dip duo, the dip was decent the guacamole was f.l.a.t. We have never not finished guac before last night :( We both ordered the tacos trio with the street corn. Our food arrived looking amazing! Sadly it was cold and again very flat.  Just not worth the hype. We may go again but probably not.  I think there are plenty of other great Mexican places that may not be as cool but the food service and price are better.

tRVWnKNpwUUlYDjttzF5Nw.text: Cuuuute ambiance!!...Took a moment for the numerous available staff members (including management) to recognize me as a new, THIRSTY and HUNGRY customer, though. They do have excellent happy hour specials every day of the week. The daily taco special for yesterday was chicken tacos, and they were were flavorful! The complimentary chips and salsa are super delicious - especially the habanero one! I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 because customer service is needing some attention (I noticed that other yelpers had experienced the same thing!).

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great HH specials!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa-LOOOVED THE habanero (the orange colored one) a lil bit too much!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JeZ3s9CPd6Vt3d8V4cgaiw.text: I don't know what mexican street has corn like this. the habanero butter and chipotle mayonnaise are at once both sinful and heavenly. they only have one pick for vegetarian tacos and they were just so-so, but i'll go back just for that corn. i mean... it's life-altering good. notes: good craft beer selection. also, if you're meeting a group, they won't seat you until all in your party have arrived.

JSkShxf_8h541VxWv4Jg7w.text: A taco restaurant in an old church! Great atmosphere, awesome food. The coffee crusted meat is to die for.  The salsas were delicious and flavorful. Glad I ate here!

PrI387AtCmNLqTwbpqIO2Q.text: Disregard all the negative publicity, this restaurant is a True gem...  Great ambiance,  amazing atmosphere, excellent service and phenomenal food...  A Must!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful Place!

lg0X_OMMiU2K_UuLHYZLsQ.text: Fun place. Friends had recommended it, just got around to going here as its off my usual paths. Great decor and environment in a former church.  Good beer selection. Liked the chips and dips.  I tried the chipotle cherry steak, Peking duck, and pork tacos all were excellent...fresh ingredients and lots of flavor.  I'll be back to try more...

hxBH4oAX4EEsyVFijYXFhw.text: I feel this place is overhyped. The only things I liked were: the queso dip with the chips + salsa variety, and the atmosphere. The whole Taco Church concept was super cool, so were the beautiful stained glass windows. The patio was quaint and cute. But if we're being honest, I wasn't there to admire the structual beauty. Let's get down to brass tacks here. So, I got the 3-taco plate. The 2 shrimp tacos I got had so few  pieces of shrimp in each taco, accompanied by a ton of saucy cabbage. The al pastor taco I got was ok, but it was insanely spicy (and I actually love heat). Oh and the salad I got as a side to my meal was awful. It had Mexican style beans in it but it had this weird vinegarette which didn't compliment the beans at all. It just made it into a weird vinegarette-bean paste, which made the lettuce very soggy. Over all experience was meh. I had such high hopes after all the things I heard too.

bKQSJPUuFJOu2oiW-jc4uw.text: nice looking place, they actually have a good chicken taco which is rare for places but the price and the rest of the food is comparable with Rubio's but with a premium.

Pnl-l0L9j3Kl3YKAnYBVuA.text: Went for lunch. Tacos were delicious and the corn on the cob was amazing! Good ambiance and good service. Would definitely come back!

SD74KI7Q3_v5v6awrjsjBA.text: Drinks here are super good. I loved the service and such a beautiful architecturally stunning place to have dinner. Great happy hour.

z2sQDeBF-TeJZ11MRWMpEA.text: Loved this place! Fantastic atmosphere, fun and friendly service, and great food (try the chipotle cherry, and the urban coffee braised beef tacos). The margaritas are fantastic, and they even have one of my favorite beers, Papago Orange Blossom on tap! On Saturday nights they have live music, making it a great place for date night or even a small group!

f2_sOjJVWEJAiNmJexbScA.text: Great food, great beer on draft! Street corn was amazing and Ono taco so good! Band playing- good Music, just too loud to talk without straining to hear.

a40Dlc3jWqkYzxRQysC8cg.text: Awesome fresh food! Tacos were out of this world! Margaritas were perfect. You gotta try this place! I literally feel great after eating here. It's also built in an old brick church atmosphere is the best.

clogUHZcatBzoJm1pW8p4Q.text: Fun place, good service, tacos are ok

6uSs7_FzSOpFlw7_mdpPTw.text: We went there during the Phoenix Arts Festival at Margaret Hance Park.  The crowd was very light.  We drank, had 8 taco's between 4 people and an appetizer.  The service was horrible.  Food came out cold.  Repeated requests for silverware.  On and on....In the end we paid $140 for the entire experience.  I can see how the taco's would be great if they weren't cold.  Not warm, cold....In the end.  I will not return.  No way.  For the four us to pay that, granted alcohol was involved, for the level of service you would get from a stoned Chili's waitress.  Not trying to do that to myself or anyone I know.  IF, the taco's were hot and the service impeccable, I would be telling a different story.  But they weren't, so I'm not.  Don't do this to yourself.  Go somewhere else and feel like they want your business.

vVMdHkPxBnzy2BvXyIIJBA.text: This place is a great option for quick nice dinner or a casual night out.  I went to Taco Guild specifically based upon the Yelp reviews and my trip did not disappoint.  The atmosphere is pretty striking and the options are spot on.  The taco options were fascinating and tasty.  This is a solid option for an evening or a great lunch.

fkSSCKwiql6pO42S8ez_Cw.text: This place is so amazing....I took my husband who doesn't like to go to far from his normal places and he was impressed..very reasonable, however, great selections of food and alcohol...this is an old church converted to a restaurant and they did a remarkable job...parkings a bit hazardous so be patient and Friday and Saturday is extremely busy here! Great place!!!!

SG2w7IRzoOzQJX_LKlvQXg.text: I loved Taco Guild! Such a nice remodel to the church- they still have some of the original photos and paper copies in the restaurant as decor. I loved the food, they have a simple menu and the wait staff has always been very helpful when I go, they take the time to sit down and talk to you about the menu. No dress code either, come as you are. I'll definitely visit again and again!

hMMMQjFAN2yWt7jfUBaODA.text: Gave it a second try after an underwhelming first experience and once again I'm totally underwhelmed. I think business is due to the trendiness of the building.
