The tacos are so average, mainly due to the bland tortillas. Queso tastes like something you can buy at the store. The best part is the chips and variety of salsas. Service was good though. Probably won't be back.

j866c6iAxzc6YbTZin2tUQ.text: Went here with the girlfriend cause a friend of ours recommended it. And man was he right, the food here is amazing and they are very well known for their queso which is a MUST try!! They also have an amazing happy hour and reverse happy that serves food late and will load you up on food and drinks without destroying your wallet. Also they start you with a selection of three kinds of salsa which is a great way to begin the Mexican meal or drinks. We will definitely be back!

Q3A5-C5Rf8OnSfZ1PYON3g.text: Let's start with the fact that I gave Taco Guild 3 stars because it's really gorgeous inside.  Great ambiance.  I would bet it's super sexy at night when the lights are low.  Amazing reuse of an existing church! If it weren't so pretty, I would have given it 2 stars.    One of the remaining two stars can be attributed to their GREAT happy hour prices.  $5 for a killer margarita that certainly was NOT stingy on the tequila, is worthy of it's own star.  Without the yummy margarita at $5, I would have given it 1 star.  It was NOT WORTH $60 FOR LUNCH.    For a place that uses the word "Taco" right in its name, the tacos better be top notch, mouth-watering, dreamy.  Two out of the 6 we tried fit that description.  One was the Pork Adovada.  It was delicious.  The other was the special taco of the day, chicken with mexican cheese and some delicious sauce. Hopefully they put it on the  permanent menu!  It's far better than the dried up, tasteless options we unfortunately chose at the suggestion of our server (who was very nice btw).  So disappointing.   We also had the ceviche of the day, which happened to be Ahi tuna.  Although, had they not told us it was Ahi, we never would have known it.  The dish was $10 and there were maybe 4 minuscule pieces of fish in it. And the chips they served with it completely overpowered the ceviche.  To the point that we used the tortilla chips they gave us when we sat down (paired with 4 different kinds of salsa...each one more bland than the other, with the exception of one, that tasted like sriracha poured directly into a ramekin...which isn't bad.. not just very authentic).    Sadly, the street corn was soggy and bland. It was the first time in our entire lives we've left street corn uneaten.  Normally we battle for the last kernels, licking our lips along the way.  Theirs simply wasn't worth eating. Better to save the calories for something good.  Like their margaritas.   So the net net.  Go after 10pm for their late night happy hour. Sit in the gorgeous candlelit room, sipping on fabulous margaritas for $5, order yourself a couple of the tacos of the day for $1.99 each (that way if they aren't that good, you won't mind so much), and you'll get to experience Taco Guild in a great way.  Otherwise, I fear you may leave like we did.  $60 poorer, hungry, and feeling like we just got rolled.

RkiTPmjiNNEtWgxOEoQaCw.text: Beautiful inside!  Large bar and extensive tequila menu. Best grilled romaine salad ever!  A little pricey but worth it. Parking is a bit challenging.

YQm1kcM6VKg_Hdi7dGt2QA.text: This is my new go to for my taco fix.. The queso dip is the best and the guacamole has bacon as a option , absolutely incredible ! Rice needed a little help though, over all we had amazing service and great interaction with management..  Can't forget to mention a gigantic variety of tequila choices. Very unique and comfortable atmosphere, fun place, check it out!

QVjR0QjEzmo2nDzaJfIxlg.text: This restaurant was amazing! I would absolutely recommend them for stopping in and having a bite or for a large party. They were so accommodating and every person provided excellent customer service. I can't wait to eat there again!!

aD40YSPuKZN5OmdZmvUBhw.text: So first off, I have to say that what they have done with the church is amazing and renewing older Phoenix structures is exactly what Phoenix needs more of. Also, the inside decor is amazingly beautiful and it is obvious that it was thoughtfully chosen. The one thing I have to say about the ambiance is that the music was WAY too loud. I could barely have a conversation with anyone at my table. I would like a restaurant ambiance and not one that I would find at a Scottsdale club.     Despite the awesome decor, I had many issues with the food. First of all I thought the guacamole was WAY over priced for the small little dish that we received. I honestly felt totally robbed for a guacamole dish that wasn't particularly special. Second, I thought the tacos were also way over-priced for what we got; $4 or $5 a taco left me again feeling totally robbed. Our waitress did let us know that if you order three tacos then you get a free side, which we all took advantage of. However, these sides are quite small and if ordered on their own are $2.50. Definitely not worth the price. Overall, the taste of the tacos was very good so they did get that aspect right.    Finally, we went during the opening week so I won't be entirely harsh on the service, but what service we did receive was very poor. Once we were seated we waited 20 minutes for a waitress to come to the table and she wasn't even our actual waitress. She kindly took our orders, but we still had to wait ten more minutes for our waitress to come by the table and fill our waters. Thankfully, she took an item off our bill to show us that she was sorry. I'm sure the service will get better with time, but if prices stay where they are then I'm not sure I will return.

NgnJUVP0xxT3RbolIBnoBQ.text: DELICIOUS! The Lamb taco is nothing short of Amazing! So rich and decadent. The salsa selection is very flavorful and Service was first rate. Get a TEQUILA flight with your meal.

0ap6WH0h5Dy5lmwZuHv1aw.text: Went here for lunch Saturday February 9th, 2019. Great chips and salsa. Awesome queso. Had the coffee marinated beef tacos. They melt in your mouth. Exquisite!

6sKhAG_095h0-Dv2RT33Ww.text: This was so much fun! There was live music that was great. The ambiance was really nice. An old church turned taco place. And the food was really good. We ordered a Guild Trio. Yum! We had a variety of tacos. So good! And our server Amanda was really good. Loved the whole experience.

ha5jFeEexccd7LgIUKt_Bg.text: Taco Guild, unexpectedly delicious. We didn't know what to expect when we came but we enjoyed every moment.

bh7GeaOZEXGnBvETJf61KA.text: Out of town coworkers loved this place. Food was great and live band was perfect touch for drinks

yba3muOAA7ZRWbXWo9S5hw.text: It's was an okay spot, tacos aren't as delicious as the menu makes them seem. But more on the expensive side for the amount of food you get.

YNhU7Z80pKLXjQohpqtAow.text: The ambiance makes this place worth checking out but the food is only ok. Would come back for happy hour

qVzeMI6qeZJ0mMUxb1UD3g.text: Super cool restaurant in an 100+ year old (Methodist) church with great margaritas. The food is pretty good, the staff is solid and the kitchen is flexible with special requests. More than anything this is a great place to have a drink in a place with a story to it. Just the fact that your having margaritas in a church is cool.

kc4U4wyctclUWjkvEz1HAA.text: Can someone in Chicago please copy this idea? I went here with my husband and some of his co-workers, so I avoided being that person who takes pictures of their meal, but this place was outstanding!! Such a unique ambiance, and I love the way the church is still incorporated into the decor and menu (stained glass windows, biblical paintings above, and drink names - i.e. the serpent). The guac is topped with perfectly crispy bacon, and multiple people at our table raved about how ridiculously good the queso is! The majority of us went for a variety of tacos and just raved about them. They also have a great variety of FROZEN MARGS with flavors beyond regular and strawberry. This place is a MUST DO if you're looking for good, affordable Mexican food. This is also spacious enough for groups and has a cool factor if you're looking for something unique to the area. Loved everything about it and would definitely go back next time we're in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i16KGeuEHk_YcGTE_ncSvw.text: Really unique tacos. One of my favorite taco places. I love the chipotle steak tacos with fried poblanos from blue cheese. Husband loves the lamb taco topped with shoe string sweet potatoes. Suck creative tacos! Service is hit or miss. The location inside an old church is pretty cool.

FaYjjTE-cVY2LUOrNs-L3g.text: High ratings pulled me in this place..... Bad decision. Waitress was snotty, if there were specials, we never heard about them.  When I ordered my taco, I asked if I could have a small side of guacamole, not an unreasonable request at a Mexican restaurant?  Apparently so!  I was told it was only sold as an appetizer.  I said that I wanted really wanted to try it, but couldn't eat an appetizer sized order. The waitress, with the GIANT hoop earrings, shrugged her shoulders, "too bad" plus attitude.   So no side of guacamole for me! I ordered the URBAN BEAN COFFEEE BRAISED BEEF with caramelized onion, mango jicama relish, and Cotija cheese.  With all those ingredients, you would think that it would have some flavor?  Very under seasoned.  Although there WAS an overwhelming part to this Taco, it wasn't greasy.....it was oily.  Everyone loves a greasy taco now and then, but oily?  Yuck...  The Mexican Street Corn was a disaster!  This is the description right from their website: STREET CORN - grilled corn on the cob, habanero butter, chipotle mayonnaise, cotija cheese. Ok see in the description where it says "grilled corn on the cob"?  Well there was NOTHING grilled about it, just a soggy, and I mean SOGGY, piece of corn!  I have included a photo.  Just look at the husk, when I picked it up, so much liquid streamed out of it that it went right through my napkin on my lap and soaked my jeans.  No grill marks, no charred grilled corn taste, just soggy BOILED corn with mayo,  I couldn't identify any habanero butter taste all.  I hope I can get the spot out of my jeans,  I don't need that as a reminder of my dismal food experience at Taco Guild!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beware of soggy, boiled corn!  Not grilled like the menus described!

Yxwu-_jnX3aQV7qY8rmSwg.text: Come after lunch hour and parking won't be an issue. This place is perfect in every way, shape and form. It is GORGEOUS inside and out, oh my gosh. I wish I didn't come here alone... I'm honestly pretty bummed. Seriously, I would've love to come here for a date night! And the staff, oh my god, the staff. SO KIND and accommodating.  And the tacos were so flavorful! Also, they immediately welcome you with chips and four different salsas (I'm a huge salsa critic and I loved every single one of theirs!). I had the pork adovada taco and the chipotle cherry steak taco. Both were so amazing, despite their lack of spice!  I originally asked for the spiciest taco and the waiter said that there wasn't much spice here, but said that she could substitute in a habenero butter into my tacos. LOVE. LOVE. LOVE. The butter wasn't spicy, but it was so delicious and I really appreciated the waitress' willingness to accommodate me. Can I please live here?  You HAVE to come here! Bring a friend, bring two.. honestly, just bring everyone!  So this is what love at first sight feels like.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu snapshot.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gorgeous interior!
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Starter chips &amp; salsas and pork adovada taco, left ($3.95) and chipotle cherry steak taco, right ($4.95)

rUPKZUpGUkrFZSZBmSnEXQ.text: The renovation of Bethel Methodist Church was well done providing an interesting and delightful atmosphere. The tacos were excellent and filling. There was a good drink selection. Great place, deserving of five stars.

NCknwTxLUJTCqO4RBTMxcA.text: We love sending our friends here for a good "first date" dinner spot.  The energetic vibe and physical restaurant atmosphere (the restaurant was formerly a church) makes a great place for carrying out good conversations. Food is good, though I believe that the price point is a smidgen higher than it should be (tacos are on the smaller side and costs an average $3.50 each).  While it's really difficult to have spectacular Mexican food in Arizona, these guys have done a really good job making creative dishes here.  Lastly, their hottest salsa is actually spicy-- we love it!

yctvHNAq2GNfygHkG7ixww.text: Great place for taco! The El Pastore taco was my favorite! Would recommend this to all taco lovers!

LA73Afa0tIzmYt-5_3XFxg.text: I was there yesterday. Have been there numerous times and loved it. Not sure what is happening but the service and quality has gone downhill. The outside seating was not available and misters were not on. We sat in the old church foyer and the floor was disgustingly covered in food and we were constantly swatting flys. So bad we asked to move and explained why. After we moved they sat a couple there who didn't last long and left. Another couple were sat there right away! Unbelievable.  There were 4 of us. Waiter seemed uninterested and stated he was in no hurry. One dish came out 10 minutes before the rest. Tacos were not hot but sorta warm. On a side note, when we were walking there across the parking lot a complete stranger stopped their car, rolled down the window and said it was terrible and don't waste our money! I just may have to stop bragging about this place. Totally let down.

DdQi0xs8P3OevKRZwb7biQ.text: The place has the look, it's a fun place to try do not think its the best for food. Its fun with the music and drinks are very good.

4PBXQuILXe6t53JLbpc-ig.text: This is our favorite place in all of Phoenix. The atmosphere is super cool and the food is amazing. Go for the street tacos and fer sher get the Cherry Steak and street corn. Beware cuz you'll suck down the margaritas so go for top shelf! Music on certain nights and it's always good.

bppjnpe3D03Lh-PEaqzxOw.text: Yum. Taco Guild is legit one of my favorite restaurants anywhere. Their Chipotle Cherry Steak tacos, street corn, queso con green chile, fresh tortilla chips, margaritas. I could go on and on about how delicious this spot is. It does tend to get crowded, but they seat you as soon as something becomes available. The staff is super friendly and the restaurant itself is a gorgeous study in gentrified architecture.  I would definitely recommend!

qw6uz1agUfNkMXkq0MzE1A.text: The location is awesome, the drinks are really tasty, and the food is alright. Everyone should give it a chance

Lg0k8IQgeyFPyX08BeEnrA.text: Great tacos the atmosphere is great! My favorite it the guacamole...it's to die for.  Also the chips are fresh. Would recommend this one.

6M9iZaLKgptCKXG4k0GVLQ.text: Everything about this place is tasty. Their happy hour margarita is great and all of their food is really good! Plenty of seating, great service and we had no problem parking. Such a great atmosphere in this old church. Can't wait to return.

45CKLDgXErQDJVS8uU3VNA.text: Great service and food is always so fresh and flavorful. Love the menu and more upscale tacos. Always fun and friendly and I will be back

YfKQOzh2tZTaXn-ELQgd4w.text: Wow.   Nice people, really good food, and such a cool building and interior.  This is my new reason to come back to Phoenix.  What a great place.  They cooked everything so well. I wish I had 3 stomachs.  Loved it so much I ordered my next meal and took it home.   I think this is only 5 star I've ever given.

8tZ35Cyt5msdfMyqg_oFoQ.text: I have been to this place more times than I can count.  I work very close and vendors love to take me to this place.  This place is just meh, I cant believe how many yelpers give this place 5 stars.  5 stars should be when a meal blows your balls off and this is not it.  The good about this place is that the chips and salsa are decent and always the best part of the meal.  I have tried almost every taco and they are pretty forgettable.  The two stars again means meh I have had better and that is the case here.  The only reason I keep coming back is the fact I am not paying for it.

sMMGYKFORbg4SMui6-2plg.text: Friendly staff! Guacamole was bland. Chile queso was like plastic :( house margarita was a little salty but still yummy! My seasonal veggie tacos were so good! Even though this didn't taste like authentic Mexican food, everything was good. Super cool atmosphere. Will be coming back! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lX4Q6RW24eKJSo4XmxhgRA.text: I had been craving taco guild for the past few weeks since I moved to AZ a few weeks ago. A place that I had loved the few times before gave me the late night dinner munchies.  When my husband and I arrived we were seated immediately. It was happy hour so we were a little surprised. Our waiter was amazing- very attentive and friendly.  Chips were good but the salsa was too hot- something I never complain about but whatever, I kept eating anyway.  I ordered the beef enchiladas. Wow, bland bland bland. The red sauce was unedible, in fact, I scrapped it off and was surprised to find that the beef was unflavorful. The red beans on the side were ok but questionable. The only good thing about the plate was the side of rice.  My husband had the tacos. He had the shrimp, coffee braised beef and the chicken tacos with the side of red beans. He didn't seem to complain about his plate as much as he did the beans. He did make a comment about the smell of the beans but I'll save you the graphic detail.  I did enjoy 2 of the happy hour margaritas but mostly because I wanted the taste out of my mouth. Can't say I'll be running back to the guild anytime soon.

jg6_8X7Wp4P26YV-ymd4gA.text: I was a little let down.  First, the place is pretty cool, even though it's in an old church (fellow jew here..).    Appetizer we ordered the Guac which was very good.  We also ordered the fundido which fell a little short.  The sausage didn't have much flavor to it, but the menonita cheese was perfectly melted.    Dinner:  One ordered the chicken enchilada which was good, not great.  Another ordered the steak burrito which was the clear winner of the night.  Cooked right, good mix of fillings, wrap was good, overall, best thing of the night.  Then I ordered tacos.  The al pastor pork, guild chicken, and lamb.  The lamb and pork was not edible, they were bad, like, i'll eat and finish tacos if they're just okay, I took one bite and left them, didn't want to touch or even give it a second bite.  The guild chicken one was absolutely delicious, but it unfortunately did not make up for the other two terrible tacos.  Would I go back?  Probably.  I'd just stay away from certain things like those two tacos, the fundido.

XY4YwvzAIXoHGjNuELf0dQ.text: Awesome food, service and atmosphere. Had the tacos, corn, deviled eggs, guacamole and queso and it was all amazing. Jack was our server and very friendly and quick to refill drinks.

9tFq34yL96AOtzfVy4ZcoQ.text: Off its mark. Walked into more of a loud bar serving food. overhead music being played was notably loud annoying and really not enjoyed by other guest. everyone just circled even closer to block out the annoyance. It was disturbing that the manager did not turn it down. this unconnected everything even staff delivery of food was absent to the serving of water etc. what even gets worst is our family who we brought only go out on Sundays so we thought this was going to be a great treat for them.

F7UjSM6LUbi2QEYI3febdQ.text: We went for Taco Tuesday. There is no Taco Tuesday here. The tacos were edible, and that's about the best I can say about them (they were pretty much tasteless). The Chips however were pretty Damn good.

Q_UkqOgBTCIl6Fk9TAcKXQ.text: Great happy hour specials!! The concept of turning the old church into a restaurant - awesome!!! The food never disappoints. Servers are attentive and courteous.

pdAq5WSRO9kryTmTLt7SEw.text: Amazing tacos , elote , and ceviche! You can get a flight of tequila for 10 dollars so can't really beat that. Staff was friendly and atmosphere was awesome, hopefully in the future there is a Taco Tuesday special we can come back for! *hint hint *

H1c0uZAukhInhg9sXiu3Gg.text: Tacos are always delicious. The only reason I cant give 5 stars if that there is often a long wait at lunch.  But if you have the time, highly recommend!!

7IzC28v7wCXfQYE9H4HHZA.text: Pretty unique tacos but the flavors just didn't work for me. We tried about six different tacos and the only one I liked was the carne asada. I really can't see what the hype is about. I also threw away a third of my burrito and this is coming from someone who rarely wastes food.

y3N71Sf7ieiPT6oC0LlrEg.text: Cute location, but your tacos suck and service suck. Had to have the busser find our server on more than one occasion

z72v5n_fNm-wltDDVXjIVw.text: This was the most fantastic meal I've had in sooooo long! From the ambiance of the amazing location and it's rich history to the out of this world Elote and spectacular uniquely created tacos! If you are in Phoenix I beyond highly recommend this place!

uYCibjjj1_UFbWq1DXVZZg.text: I really like Taco Guild - the ambiance, the historic building, the staff. However, I do not like the hectic parking situation and the food is good but not great for how pricey it all is. With how many great Mexican restaurants there are in town, this one falls lower on my list.

UkJv0Dj5eUXp8ZE0wYhclQ.text: My favorite taco place in the valley. Their mixed drinks are delicious and well thought out. Their tacos are extremely good and the corn is my FAVORITE side. Fun ambiance. Though, I waited over an hour because they sat my table to someone  else. They couldn't figure out how the tact system gave it away. Weird, but they made up with the food and drinks

nNDAl_bYEf18uUJ3uzo7hQ.text: Came here for taco Tuesday! The veggie enchilada was good and so was their margarita! I loved the church atmosphere, it felt very inviting! The only reason why I gave it a 4 Star is because of the structure of the church everything echos! There wasn't that many people in the restaurant when we came but because of the ceilings it was extremely loud and i could barely hear myself talk!

8N_tL8X5MDoOSzMiu6mADQ.text: What a clever idea, to have a church reborn into a taco restaurant.  Totally love the ambience, and the food is amazing.  Great variety of choices in tacos, plus the fresh salsas and homemade guacamole are wonderful.  Your guacamole can be tweaked with add-ins like bacon.

3k0Nz03m8rKDiGHtMevBFQ.text: I really wanted to like this place.  The atmosphere is great, the food..eeeeh.  I've been here several times, staff is hit or miss. Drinks decent, happy hour was just ok.

PWmQfm_JuDtWR4wm2KeUJQ.text: I gave Taco Guild a try for the first time today. From walking into the front doors to the end of my lunch, my experience here was stellar. Everyone was friendly and staff members even sat down to explain and answer any questions I may have had. The food is so fresh and is decently flavored. It is located inside of an old church. A cool place to check out.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xYTRxpKsk7lupdtBvVJDIg.text: It was awesome to go out to eat in a place that use to be a church. However, parking was difficult unless you wanted to do valet. Met a group of people for happy hour and prices were very reasonable and the taco's were decent. They filled me up but nothing I would need to go back for.  I would recommend for going with a group so people can order as much food as they want and it helps balance the desires of those that want to eat a lot with those that want a snack. They kept the chips and salsa coming and filling up our waters which is a plus for me.

2Y_gd14vcjAQBA2pNpiSTQ.text: So let me start by saying that i have eaten tacos and drank margaritas all over the valley from street tacos to 24 hour corner stops and grandiose restaurants alike and Taco Guild fell anything but short of what id hoped it to be. Its housed in an 1800's church with original structure intact if that tells you anything. When i entered its doors i expected to disappointed but when i caught glimpse of what was hiding inside i felt as if a symphony should have been playing as i gazed across the beautifully inlaid church "of tacos". I was greeted immediately (it was one of their slower times) and given the choice to sit wherever i liked(i choose the very back center of the building so i could take in the surroundings as i enjoyed my food). I want to say my server was ?Jessica?, but on to the food. It was happy hour so i ordered their house margarita which was far from well(a sauza base). I always say if you really want to test the taste of someone's food start simple. Upon receiving my margarita i was served a flight of salsa along with chips made in house. There were 4 salsas ranging from a Habenero to jalapeno and a simple but sweet house salsa all of which were made In house as well. Let me tell you for the next 15 minutes i let the flavors of these salsas roll over my tongue from sweet to sour, from pugnet to a tingling burn they touched every part of my palette. What a flight! I was not starving but wanted to soak some of the sauza up before i made my way home, so i ordered the pork taco. The taco was every bit as delicious as the menu description led it to be enticing. I spoke to Jason the manager and was compelled after my experience to complement him on the excellent job his staff and him were doing. I will definitely be coming back when i make my way back around.

dZn2UNDh55UzKUZuKONbhQ.text: I have return to spot a few times now. With each visit I am happy. The food is flavorful.  The staff are considerate, timely, and make you feel welcomed. The Sunday special is great, but the flourless chocolate is to die for. A great place to eat.  My father visiting from out of town loved the place so much we went twice during his visit.

QU7VHiYOGxYZo7umNjknjA.text: Amazing Tacos, and fully stuffed too. Their guacamole with serranos was great, and then there's the corn, wow super Delicious. The bar is just Beautiful and completely stocked specially with Tequila. Really a Great place to go for lunch and even better at night when they have live music (on saturdays)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their Bar is just Beautiful, and fully stocked. The Bartender was really friendly too.
Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their Corn is super Delicious, a must try

iMMHWQ90B48TldOfJbypIw.text: Great spot to hang with friends or take a date. The inside gorgeous. They took what I'm assuming was an old Spanish mission and turned it into a bar. The liquor rack is perfectly positioned at the pulpit. The ambience and vibe are perfect pitch. Taco selection is great too. They do Old World tacos which are the classics and New World tacos which encompass a modern flair. Come here soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9RtoIbHHNBdCWz04WCdBww.text: What a unique setting.  Stained glass windows, Chandeliers, candelabras.  Host and waitress were friendly.  Meal was served quickly (I visited at lunchtime and it was fairly busy).  Always love chips and salsa, burritos are quite large and tasty.  Check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmm chips and salsa!

uDEJIrH835GZxlNTo_9AfA.text: was all excited about going here and after eating it was ok guess if I didnt have to work more but the lunch was ok had better tocos in my day.so please go it is a experience you have to have

T3aBLMQPJI2FjK9bNH-fOw.text: Two stars for the atmosphere and service, which was great. However, the atmosphere didn't feel like I was at a taco place. If you're looking for original tacos then this place isn't for you-the tacos were nothing to brag about. They have specialty tacos and load them with so much different ingredients that you don't really know what you're even eating. The rice and beans were bland. Felt that it was overpriced for $5/6 taco prices and not worth the price for a meal out. Wouldn't go back.

-sERlqPHtQsofMvNWZ0YLg.text: So this was my 2nd time dining at the Taco Guild.  And I just absolutely love this place. I love the atmosphere, the decor, the employees and of course I love the food!!   No better way to start off with hot tortilla chips with the fresh guacamole, made to order!  (I dont even like onions, and I ate it, cuz it's so good) I've tried different tacos, but the one that stands out to me is the Pork Adovada Taco made with mango, jicama relish, cilantro and fresh advocado slices.  The marination used for the pork adovada is the best I've ever tasted!!  Let's just say.....This taco is very pleasing & tantalizing to my pallet!! The Guild Chicken tacos and Tropical Ono were also my favorite, and the Street Corn is                     A-Mazing, with their Chipotle mayo & cotija cheese!!  No other street corn like this!!  Now, I want to take the time to brag about one of the superivisor's named Jason,  He made our whole visit there even more special, by accommodating our needs in such a friendly manner. And having a table ready for me and my guests, checking in on us a couple of times to see if we needed anything. That is how managers/supervisors should be at every restaurant.  Even though they were crazy busy, Jason still stopped at our table.  Which is now the main reason I brag about the Taco Guild!!  Jason You Rock!!!   \\m//

PHltGNKdFTWpUYZX0jxlvw.text: The atmosphere is what makes this place. Set in an old methodist church, it is a great vibe. You'll even catch a Scripture taken totally out of context, "Be Perfect". But seriously, the service was outstanding. Ashley was our server and she helped us through the menu as this was our first time here. They even treated us to a dessert on the house.   The tacos were good, not great, but good. My wife and I had the lamb, cherry steak, braised beef, and the duck. Each of the tacos seemed to be a little dry though. My favorite was the lamb with the blue cheese. I'm not usually a fan of corn tortillas but they make them in house (I think) and they were pretty bombski.   All in all, I would definitely come back especially because of their service.

u9eB8i8rHZNuRC1sDWFq4Q.text: My first review on this place was not 5 stars but this time experience was for 10 stars.   It is True when people say service is as important as the food is.   Me and my boyfriend took his parents, grandparents and his brother for lunch. It was a first time for all of them   From the start everything was great.   We got really nice table and the best sever ever. Yes, his name is Eric.  Eric was exceptional. The best sever I came a cross in a long time.   Food was amazing, from appetizers to entrees, to drinks...etc.  Everybody was so happy with the choice. Grandparents enjoyed the ambiance and loved how the church was transformed and made into this nice restaurant.    Eric made sure we were taking care of at all times. No question we are going back, but calling ahead and making sure Eric is working if we have a bigger party again.   Thank you Eric! You are amazing!

54Px9KJeNl9pilgBf4touQ.text: Much better experience the second time around.  The duck taco was really good and was the pork adovada.  For sure get the street corn...to die for.  Sit at the bar, you'll get better service!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Guild - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street corn

7rAyQtyIhtMXOFj-XmN6_Q.text: Service was awesome and welcoming. I ordered to-go at the bar for the first time trying it out and the bartender was extremely helpful. Put my order in within the first 5 minutes and the tacos were AMAZING.

22cfYMct0mgUsDcmvU9U8w.text: it's usually a bad (food) omen when there's a LIVE MUSIC TONIGHT! sign outside a restaurant's front door. that usually means booze/drinks are the focus...not the food.  today we walked outta Taco Guild. only the second time we've done this in about four years of dining out in phoenix.  why?  hostess and staff seemed nice. we saddled up to TG because the hip church lady exterior had been calling our name for awhile - we've passed this spot a bunch of times.  anywho today we get there at about 11:20 a.m. on a saturday, right at the start of lunchtime. a lot of kids inside - grr, too much noise...so we ask to sit outside. and this is where TG fails.  the conditions were NOT up to restaurant standards. not clean, not professional...can you really expect people to eat on a patio covered in dirt, dust and garbage?  tables and chairs: both with thick layers of dirt/dust that would've taken our clothes straight to the cleaners. trash on the patio floor; and lots of tree sheddings on the cushy seats. none of this is a huge problem if the STAFF CLEANS IT UP. the last thing i want to do upon being seated at a restaurant is to spend the first few minutes soap and watering and then drying the tables and chairs. and they were ALL like this. don't offer to sit people on your patio when it's filthy.   we moved on. too many other options in the city. later, skaters....

57UL4dDFadz7e33Pz67Onw.text: Love the atmosphere and the food... Converted church (Bethel Methodist) has original Windows and more... Only complaint was the taco we ordered was supposed to have pineapple and bacon in it and didn't. Francisca was helpful and friendly

kODf-n4HgS4PqXFsQDArbQ.text: I have been on yelp looking at reviews of other restaurants for a while now and never felt overly compelled to leave a 5 star review, but eating at Taco Guild a few times this year changed that. My experience at Taco Guild is always amazing! I love the food and highly recommend the chipotle cherry steak tacos and the Mexican street corn. They are both off the charts! As other people have said in reviews, I love how the restaurant is built inside an old church. It gives the restaurant a different vibe than almost any other place to eat in Phoenix. The service is also top notch as well! Jason has always been very courteous and attentive to my needs and makes the whole night out a great experience. If you have time ask him for a tour of the building! I love going to a place that treats you like family and each visit to Taco Guild leaves me feeling extremely satisfied!

YK_WAht5lH5FQnuQwiTHgA.text: Five stars hands down I loved the music I loved the food and I really enjoyed the customer service. you guys rock! Awesome list of tequila I'd definitely be her more often.
